Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description:
Valencia Library has recently received a number of phone calls from Trent Trout with an obsessive focus on wanting to talk to program instructor DV, to set up a one-on-one session with her, and have the program instructor contact them directly. Because of the Issues with personal safety and escalating stalking behaviors specifically towards this program instructor in the past (PITS incidents 19542 and PITS incident 19522), the nature of the phone calls have caused distress and alarm and appear to indicate that the individual is seeking to continue the harassing and stalking behaviors towards program instructor DV.
Subsequent calls from Trent Trout will be referred to a supervisor for a verbal warning. If harassment behavior persists or escalates, incident will be assessed for appropriate follow-up, to include suspension.
The numbers: The patron phone calls to VAL in the past 6 weeks were more frequent than from any other person, reports from staff who spoke to him, KG and XR indicated that the questions that he brought up seemed excessively invasive, specifically requesting personal schedule information, and specific locations to find program instructor DV during the week.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description: At 12:04 Page MG answered a phone call from a regular patron whose name is unknown. Patron asked MG questions about what type of books the library had and considering the audience of the books we must be a family library. MG answered that we do have a higher population of children attending this library. Patron then reiterated that because this is then a family library that there was a "Drag Queen" walking around outside and he didn't think they were allowed to be near the building. MG completely shocked by the question asked patron to be put on hold. MG stated that she felt very uncomfortable talking to the patron and explained the situation to Manger VV. Manger VV answered the phone and patron then again asked if this was a "FAMILY library" VV explained this was a PUBLIC library and that everyone is welcome. Patron then said never mind and hung up.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: OSL III DM came and asked in-charge LTA Supervisor SG about a situation where two patrons in the quiet area, near the magazines, were speaking loudly. DM said that she heard the word "shooting" loudly and wasn't sure what context this word was used in, but was concerned. LTA Sup SG agreed to walk over and talk to them about their volume since she had not heard the content of their speech. LTA Sup SG walked over and told them to keep it down as it was our quiet area. Unknown patron quipped back, "If you take the e out of quiet does that spell quit?" LTA Sup SG reiterated again that they should keep it down as it was our quiet area and that we could hear you from the front desk and that it's disruptive. The unknown patron quipped back again, "Are you telepathic?" LTA Sup SG again asked them to keep it down and that it'd be great if they did and then walked away.

Location: Frank De La Cruz-El Pueblo Library
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description:
Patron Trent Trout called El Pueblo at 10:28 AM requesting information regarding LPI DV classes.  LA MD was suspicious because she recalled the patron from incident 0000019522 in 2019.  LA MD informed him that DV was not scheduled today. He quickly corrected himself and asked if MD could verify the schedule for the computer classes for El Pueblo and Valencia.  He then proceeded to recite the days and hours of the classes.  He then asked if this was when DV was here. Before MD could even respond, he corrected himself and said “to clarify the schedule of the computer classes are….”  
The patron was very persistent in trying to get LA MD to say that DV was in fact at Valencia at this
time. MD only responded by saying that those were the correct hours for the classes at Valencia.
He tried wording in it in different ways, but MD repeated that the classes were held on those dates
and times.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: A female customer came in to the library and went up the guard's station, where there is a rainbow sign that says "Be proud of who you are.  I am!"  She had seen the sign on her last visit, and commented on it, saying that if that sign was there, she should be able to put biblical scripture next to it.  When she came in today, she immediately pointed out the sign again and wagged her finger at it, saying it should be taken down.  Guard R told assistant manager LM about the incident.  LM approached the woman and explained that we have an inclusive environment at the library, and all are welcome.  LM showed her another rainbow sign that is posted in the library that says, "All are welcome here".  The woman began to recite scripture and then said, "You are discriminating against me.  Can I come to the library and read scripture to children?  Can I bring a poster of scripture and have it posted?"  LM explained that anything that is posted in the library has to be reviewed by staff first, and deemed appropriate for library use.  The woman left in a huff.  This is for documentation purposes, as it is the second time this has happened.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: Around 1:30pm, library patron Jesus Salinas left his pink backpack, containing money, his phone, and ID, unattended in the computer lab while he used the restroom. When he returned, the bag was gone and he reported it to guard J. J and LIC MB looked around the library and did not find the bag. Jesus left the library. At 2:05 pm, guard J found his ID and social security card left alone in the women's restroom but not the rest of his belongings.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: A patron asked library staff at the 1st floor information desk to call 911 for him. He simply stated that he was in distress and would like medical assistance. Staff assisted patron in making the call and patron has been given water, a snack, and guided toward seating while he waits for assistance.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description: Right before closing, multiple police vehicles came to our parking lot to speak to the group of people who appear to be living in their cars. The group consists of a woman named Veronica, her husband, their son, Lamborghini, and their two friends Tony and Fernando. These two sedans, one red and one white, are in our lot before employees arrive in the morning and after we leave for the evening. This has been the case for about a month.  Originally, they were in the lot closest to the Center, and were there off and on, however, the last couple of weeks they have been staying in the lot closest to the library in what appears to be a non-stop fashion.  Police told our security guard that an employee at the Quincie Douglas Recreational Center called them, stating these individuals should not be camping/living in the parking lot. This is being recorded for documentation purposes.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating
Description: Security guard RP recognized this customer and prevented him from coming inside the library. He accused her of being racist and raised his fists in a threatening stance like he was going to fight her. She refused to fight and he spat at her. He then left the property. His suspension is extended to a year from today.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: LA GL noticed patron enter bathroom around 3:05 (Patron was observed last week on 12/29/22 in restroom for most of the last hour before closing- LA GL detected a smell and LIB ID verified it as drugs). GL checked in on bathroom several times between 3:05 and 3:25 and noticed he was still in the stall, and notified LIB AD and LSM VL for guidance. GL and LA WB entered restroom about 3:35 to do a welfare check. Patron was gone but in the toilet of stall was a burned aluminum foil. Bathroom was locked and closed for rest of day. Tinfoil was not flushed.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description: A man had been in the Children's restroom for about 30 minutes. The sink kept turning on and off. Guard JT knocked on the door and asked him if he was okay as he had been in the bathroom for a while. He said he was using the bathroom. He walked out about 5 minutes later and JT let him know that he was using the Children/Family restroom and in the future he should use one of the other restrooms on all three floors. He said he understood and left. JT and LIC DSL checked the restroom and discovered lots of black, curly hair all over the floor, sink, and wall. The day porter was called to clean it up. DSL and JT thought he left, but later discovered the man went up to the 2nd floor and began cutting his hair in the second floor men's room. He left black, curly hair all over the sink and floor. DSL let the man know that cutting his hair was an inappropriate use of our restrooms and asked him to leave for the day. He complied.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.2 Internet use that is harmful to minors
Description: Approximately 11:15 am, LA BA informed LIC CM that the unknown patron at computer #8 was watching pornography on the computer, and that there were children in the area. LIC CM, who was helping a patron at the time,  informed VetSec security guard MG to please speak to the unknown patron about the content he was watching, and that if he complied with turning it off, that he would only receive a warning for today. SG MG reported to LIC CM that the unknown patron became upset, at first, stating that he watches this when he is at Main, but then complied when SG MG explained to him that watching pornographic material with children in the area was unacceptable and unlawful. Unknown patron signed out of his computer and left the library without incident.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: L1 KG let LIC DSL know that a regular customer, Gene, who gave his name as Gino, was passed out and may be intoxicated. DSL took a snack with her and asked Gino if he was all right. He struggled to wake up. DSL asked him if he was okay and he said he was fine, slurring his words. DSL noticed an open, nearly empty bottle of vodka sitting next to him, along with several Chick-Fil-A wrappers. DSL let him know that he could not have an open container of alcohol in the library and asked him to put it in his bag. She asked Gino if he had been drinking and he said yes, and that it was his business, not hers, and she should leave him alone. DSL said she was the librarian in charge and the safety and security of the library was her business. She asked Gino to please clean up his snack wrappers, as well as stand up, go outside, and get some fresh air. She told him he could not be drinking or intoxicated in the library. Gino put the bottle of alcohol in his jacket. He told DSL he wasn't going to leave and he was perfectly fine right where he was. DSL could smell alcohol on his breath when he spoke. He told her that "she didn't really care," that the "fresh air was right here," and she should just let him be. Guard S asked Gino to please gather his things and go outside on the plaza. Gino did so, but on his way out he yelled "Fuck!" and punched one of the book displays. Guard S calmly asked him to leave again and escorted him to the door. "Fuck this!" Gino yelled at DSL and S, "Fuck you!" DSL told him he would need to leave and he could not come back inside the library today. Guard S and Gino walked outside. Officer Fabian Valdez had just arrived and asked if he was needed. DSL told him about the situation and let him know that they did not need him at this time, but they may need him if Gino decided to re-enter the building. Gino began banging on the windows on the side of the building and guard S told him to stop. Gino left the property. He will be suspended for a month.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description: TFL was on the desk alone and was issuing a library card when suddenly she heard Rafael say very loudly "Wow, she didn't used to be so nice." TFL has not interacted directly with Rafael since addressing his staring behaviors on 12/2/22.  When she was done helping all waiting customers she approached Rafael to ask whether he was the person who made this comment. He said that he had. TFL stated that making insulting comments about library staff members could be considered harassment and could result in suspension if it continues to happen. For documentation.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
LIC LT received a call on the in-charge phone that there may be pee on the floor in front of the vending machine. LT came down and inspected the area. There was a strong odor and it was yellow in color. LT called the day porter for clean up.
Shortly after, the suspected patron came out of the restroom and started using the courtesy phone. Since there was no definitive proof, LT decided not to approach the patron.
However, a few minutes later the patron was seen and heard throwing and beating the courtesy phone's receiver. LIC LT told them to stop but they did not respond or acknowledge LT's presence. LIC LT and Guard M decided it was best to call 911 due to the person's erratic behavior and violent outbursts. The patron then threw the phone again and LT told them to stop and they needed to leave. It's unclear whether the patron heard LT's request but they left the building. LT cancelled the 911 call. 
Upon inspection, the phone's receiver is dented but it still works. 
While the person was on the phone, they could be heard giving their name as "Joseph Mitchell." It's unclear whether this is the person's name or not. The patron has gone by the name "Samora" in the past.
After reviewing the security footage, the patron can be seen lifting their skirt and peeing on the floor in front of the vending machine.
Patron will be suspended for 6 months.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms    2.7 Not wearing shoes or shirt
Description: A customer reported a woman in the restroom with only a bra on.  When L3 TFL and L1 KN entered she was still without a top. It also appeared she may have been using the restroom for an extended period for grooming as the sink area was covered with her belongings (there is only one sink for all users.) TFL asked that she do any changing of clothes in a stall and that she not spend more than a few minutes using the sink going forward, to ensure access for all using the restroom. Most of her replies were difficult to understand as her speech was a bit slurred, but she seemed to understand the direction given. She left the restroom soon after.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
At 2:35pm Guard J approached a man on the 1st floor who was talking to himself nonstop. She asked if he was ok and he became angry and started swearing at her and making threatening remarks. Guard J asked him to calm down and stop using profanity in the library, but he continued ranting and cursing. Guard J & LIC MB asked him to leave.
Shortly afterward, he came back inside, and J and MB lost track of him. Around 3:15pm, J reported to MB that he had been in the women's restroom, and tried to force himself into a stall that a teen volunteer was using. MB and J talked to him outside the women's restroom. He asked what floor he was on and was looking in confusion at the women's restroom sign. MB let him know that he would need to leave for the day and would be suspended because his behavior was threatening to other patrons. At this point he was mostly calm and mumbling to himself as he left without complaint.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
Unknown male came out of the bathroom and went to let VetSec guard VM know that he was leaving for the day. VetSec guard told him, "okay, have a nice day". Unknown male started to walk out of the library but then turned around and started yelling at VetSec guard VM. He shouted, "why do you have an attitude with me?" VetSec guard VM then said, "I don't have an attitude." He then said, "Yes you do you had one with me yesterday and again today." VetSec guard then said, "I am sorry if you think I have an attitude, I apologize." Unknown male then said, "I accept your apology but you need to work on that." Unknown male then went to walk out of the library again. He then stopped at the front double doors and shouted, "I bet you won't forget who I am now." L3 IR and VetSec guard VM then watched as he walked to his car and began making various hand gestures and yelling random things. 
This report is for documentation purposes only.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.4 Sleeping    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: urinating on floor
Description: A man was lying on the floor in the 3rd floor computer lab and would not wake up. LIC DSL, Officer WC, and guard JT woke the man up. He had significant trouble standing and when DSL asked him if he had been drinking he said yes. The man smelled like alcohol and was singing to himself. DSL told him he could not sleep on the library floor and asked him if he could stand up and sit in a chair. The man got up, swaying on his feet, and decided to head down the elevators. DSL heard a thud like he had fallen in the elevator. The man walked out of the library, peeing on the floor as he went. DSL let the guards and officer know that he would not be allowed back in for the rest of the day.  As this is the second violation, he will be suspended for a week.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description:
Diego was unhappy that the 101 Space desk was staffed in the morning and said he wanted to "punch [L1 BC] in the face because he wouldn't stop staring at him." Security guard JT told Diego that BC was keeping an eye on the 101 Space and not just him. 
At around the same time L1 CR got a complaint from a teenage girl about Diego. She identified him very specifically and said he had spent yesterday following her and her sister around the library and asking for their phone numbers and Instagram accounts. She said he would not leave them alone. When she said she was going to leave, he told her that he was going to follow her out of the library. Today the girl and her sister were on the 3rd floor doing homework because they were too scared to sit in the 101 Space with Diego present. 
LIC DSL talked with Diego about his behavior and he denied following young women around the library, saying that a friend was talking to some girls, not him. He repeated that he wanted to punch L1 BC in the face. DSL told him that those kinds of threats were unacceptable and that the library took them seriously. DSL asked him to leave. He will be suspended for a week.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description: L1 WW called LIC AW from 1st floor desk, in reference to a patron who was acting oddly and mumbling incoherently.  AW tried to discern what the patron needed, and decided on a welfare check/ crisis team visit.  Visiting TPD Officer WC called the Crisis Line and described the situation.  The patron was waiting for about ten minutes before they wandered off to Jacome Plaza.  The Crisis Team arrived at 2:50; AW showed them a picture and gave them a description of the patron, and they said they would search the nearby vicinity for the patron.  For documentation purposes.

Infractions: Children in the Library    Children in the Library: Other not listed: Telephone report of individual filming children
Description:
At approximately 2:30PM, Librarian in Charge L1 HS received a phone call from someone named Kai, who declined to give their last name, and was reluctant to leave their phone number. They wanted to report to the library that they had seen an incident while a school group was visiting us yesterday. They did not identify themselves with any other title, or share their relationship, if any, to the school. They did know the name of the school.
Here is what they said:
·They saw someone they described as a bald Hispanic person, taking photos of the children
·They told the school principle what they saw
·The school principle told them they would file a police report
 
L2 MB and HS were present in the library during the school visit.
·MB was present in the public area while the school group was here, and was not alerted to an incident
·A Special Duty Officer was on-duty, when this occurred, and was not alerted
·Our security guard was also on duty, and was not alerted.
·MB and HS checked the security camera, and located the individual they think Kai was describing; the footage does not allow us to tell with any certainty if this person took a picture of the children. It does not look like they did.
MB will follow up with the teacher, to see how the teacher thinks the visit went. This will give the teacher an opportunity to share if they are uncomfortable with how the visit went, and give MB an opportunity to share with the teacher that the library has security and safety as a priority, and the teacher can speak with staff, the guard, or special duty officer, if needed, during a visit.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: banging his hand repeatedly on the front desk, cursing
Description:
Mr. Pasalis (or Dr. Pasalis as he identified himself) came to the desk to checkout a reserved item for his wife.  Desk staff let him know that his wife's card was not linked to his, and asked if he happened to have his wife's card or card number.  Mr. Pasalis said he didn't, and he couldn't contact her because she was at the grocery store and didn't have a cell phone.  He asked desk staff to checkout his wife's reserve on his card, because the library had always been able to do this in the past.  Desk staff told him that unfortunately we couldn't do this due to our policy, and that reserved items had to be checked out on the account that held the reserve.  Mr. Pasalis grew agitated, said the policy was stupid, and emphasized that he had been married to his wife for so many years, and he had done this same thing many times in the past.  He said that something was wrong with the library's computer system, and that we should be able to check out the item on his card.  Mr. Pasalis started banging his hand on the front desk, and on various library books he wanted to check out. Desk staff came to the back to ask Librarian Amy Williams for support.  I came to the front desk, listened to his side of the story, during which he called the policy stupid, along with using a few curse words.  I explained to him that while I understood his perspective and view of the policy, that we don't make these policies at the branch level.  I offered to extend the hold, so that he could come pick it up next week.  I also asked him if it would be at all possible for him to swing by the library after picking up his wife at the grocery store, so we could get their cards linked and so this wouldn't be an issue in the future.  Mr. Pasalis said this was unacceptable, he was tired, and he wasn't going to stop by the library again. He said that he was not leaving without his wife's book.  Mr. Pasalis' voice was raised to the point that another library patron stopped by the desk and asked him to lower his voice because he was being disruptive.  After further language and discussion with a raised voice, Mr. Pasalis eventually left.  After which, several patrons at the desk told library staff that they were sorry this happened, and one patron called over the phone to voice her concern about the situation.  The patron on the phone said she was worried the library user was going to "come at" the desk staff.  
About 20 minutes later, Mr. Pasalis' wife called with library card number, and the item was checked out to her without further incident.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description: Patron Trent Trout called at 11:43am asking if he was on the wait list for computer classes taught by our LPI DV. He has called several times before, and on 1/11 he spoke with Managing Librarian IR who told him he is on the wait list and she gave him alternatives classes at other locations that may have openings for computer classes. Trent Trout continued to ask, "so I'm on the wait list for February, on Tuesday?" These frequent calls are concerning due to the history of this patron per incident 0000019522

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking
Description:
There's a gentleman who parks his white van in the parking lot consistently. We've noticed him shaving in the van, suggesting he might be experiencing homelessness. He comes into the library once in a while to get water and use the restroom or the wi-fi, but otherwise doesn't engage much with staff. On Saturday, 1/14/23 a customer called saying that the man approached her and her young son in the parking lot and began talking about UFOs and bigfoot. She cut him off at one point and said she had to get going. She reported to staff that he seemed angry when she cut the conversation short. On the phone, LA TW told the woman that she was welcome to call the police if she wanted to, but he wasn't really breaking any of the library's rules. To our knowledge he hasn't been soliciting money at all. Through staff discussions, Librarian III BL learned that a few weeks ago, the man struck up a conversation with Librarian I CL about anti-masking that was slightly confrontational. On 1/18/23, Librarian-in-Charge CL noticed there were two Sheriff vehicles in the parking lot and they were talking to the man. When the man went back to his van, CL introduced himself as a staff person to the officers and asked if they could tell him what was going on. They didn't have much to say. When the man came back out from his van he said to CL, "Are you the one who turned me in?" We're assuming another patron called the police. Library staff did not. At this point the man tried to show the police what he was looking at on the computer. He seemed to want them to know he wasn't looking at porn. 
This is for documentation. We will try to approach him the next time he comes into the library to gently have a conversation about the complaints we've received and ask him not to approach other customers in the parking lot.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: Bugs
Description: Patron CRP return nine books in book chute #5. Three books had two live small cockroaches and one dead small cockroach. One medium cockroach fell off and was squished when a different patron was returning materials in the same book chute.

A man on a small motorcycle travelling westbound at high speed collided with a minivan as it was pulling into the library parking lot. The man on the small motorcycle was lodged under the minivan and appeared to have suffered life threatening injuries. LIII TFL dialed 911 as soon as she became aware but Sheriffs were already arriving so the call was cancelled. The man on the motorcycle was removed from the scene by ambulance. Due to the serious and potentially life threatening nature of the event Sheriffs are not allowing traffic to enter/exit until evidence collection can be completed.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: A patron notified L1 SG that it smelled like someone was using drugs in the women's restroom. L2 AG went to confirm. The smell was there but seemed faint, and AG did not believe that anyone was actively smoking at that moment. Women's restroom will be closed for 1-2 hours. The all gender restroom is available instead.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking
Description: For documentation: A woman called from the following phone number but refused to give her name: 520-289-3806. She rambled about a variety of topics, including making a guess about a staff member's sexual orientation and accusing them of hitting on her during a program held several years ago. Staff politely ended the call as soon as possible.

Location: Frank De La Cruz-El Pueblo Library
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description:
At about 1:13pm, Patron Trent Trout walked into the library, and sat to use the computer. This is the patron from incident 000001522, though staff did not know what he looked like. He sat down at computer 17, and then asked Managing Librarian if she could help him with something. MS continued to help him with copying and pasting onto word, until MS needed to speak with facilities, in which LA MD took over. 
After some time, LA MD and LTA JA were trying to print the patrons documents, when the patron randomly started talking about our LPI DV, and said, "I use to be in her class, she is still here on Mondays right?" LA MD scanned his card, and confirmed that this patron is the same patron from 000001552, and the same one who has made about 20 calls between ELP and Val asking for LPI DV's schedule and the computers classes that she teaches.  LA MD responded back to him, "we don't know her schedule" and then notified ML MS by using our code word that we set up for safety. ML MS called LSM PAC to notify her that Trent Trout is currently at ELP and that he asked about LPI DV. LSM PAC instructed ML MS to speak with the patron in person about his behavior. 
ML MS went to the patron and asked if she could speak with him and took him toward the front doors of the library. MS said, "I just wanted to talk to you about some concerning behavior, about the multiple phone calls you have been doing. This behavior is the same type of behavior that you were suspended for back in 2019. This could lead to an order of harassment and then it could escalate." He responded "oh no I don't want that." ML MS said, "so I'm going to ask that you stop calling, you are on the list (wait list), and a staff member will call you back with more information." He replied back, "oh ok, I was calling because I gave them the wrong information and said September instead of February, what if I miss the call?" MS responded, "we will leave a message for you". He then replied, "what if I have a question about the message?", MS continued and said, "then you can call back and ask only about the class." He then thanked MS and went back to his computer.
 
After about 5 minuets, he asked to speak with ML MS again, when MS came out, the patron wanted to speak about the previous conversation and was agitated about it. He said, "I don't want any problems, how do you know about the phone calls, do you all talk to each other?" MS replied, "you're doing the same behavior that you did that merited a suspension, so the phone calls need to stop, and we will call you with more information about the class." He replied, "oh ok, thank you", shook ML MS's hand and then left the building.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property
Description: 2 teenage boys with skateboards were in a bathroom stall together on the 2nd floor with the door open. LA RW entered the restroom and asked what they were doing. They said, "Nothing," and left the library soon afterward. RW and LIC CS went to check the restroom and found fresh graffiti all over the stall walls.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: failure to clean up after dog~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description:
Staff noticed a copious amount of canine-derived biowaste on the north side of the building near the parking lot this morning in several different locations. LA DB reviewed security cam footage from the past few days and made the following observations: a woman who has a large white dog and frequently parks her car in our lot (we presume she is living in her car at present) can be seen parking her car in our lot at 10:48pm on 1/19/23. Shortly after this (10:50pm), she appears to have let her dog out of the car to wander around for over an hour while she remained inside the car. The dog can be seen roaming around in all the areas where we later found doggy doo-doo. The footage is fairly blurry because of the dog's distance from the camera but it can be seen stopping and squatting at various times (good examples at 11:14pm, 11:32pm, 11:53pm). The dog is not visible after 11:57pm when it appears to have returned to the owner's car. The car departs the lot at 1:22am.
Further review of security camera footage shows no other dogs or large animals in the area for the previous several days; since it rained as recently as the 16th, and the doo-doo was visibly "recent" and did not seem to have been affected by any rainfall, I ended my review there. Based on these observations I think it is reasonable to conclude that this particular dog is responsible for the large amount of biowaste. Will consult with Branch Manager LG for next steps.
Owner's car is a dark grey Nissan Altima with the license plate GSDGRL. This is the same person who accused someone of animal abuse in incident 21376.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: LI PC has reported persistent staring issues with Rafael over the past few weeks. Rafael has been warned about staring by staff multiple times in the past. Today LII KM and LIII TFL observed Rafael staring at LI PC as she walked around the teen area.  LIII TFL and LII KM were also being stared at by Rafael. Twice he was asked if he needed help and he stated "I will let you know if I need your help." He immediately began staring at LI PC after this exchange. LIII TFL and LII KM approached and explained that due to previous warnings, any future issues with staring would result in suspension from the library. Rafael stated that the issue was "intentional." We asked that he clarify. He stated that we were choosing to have this feeling. LII KM explained that it is not up to Rafael to determine how others feel and LIII TFL reminded him that he had been warned about the behavior previously. LIII TFL explained that this was the last time he would receive a warning and that he would be suspended the next time the behavior occurs. As the staff walked away he stated "it isn't sexual you know" and LIII TFL stated that no one had used that term. LII KM stated that harassment does not have to sexual to cause discomfort. A minute or so later he stated, from across the room, that "last time you claimed it was sexual." LIII TFL stated that no one had ever stated or implied that any of his behaviors were of a sexual nature and that if he wished to discuss it further he would need to come to the desk or ask to speak outside and that addressing staff from across the room is a disturbance to other customers.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: LA DB answered a phone call from a very upset woman who was not happy that we were hosting the Pima County Health Department for a mobile health clinic event -- in particular, she was not happy that vaccines would be offered, and began to reference random conspiracy nonsense and accuse the library of "selling drugs to children." I recommended that she direct her concerns to the Health Department since we were just hosting the event. She became increasingly agitated and continued rambling with bizarre comments like "we're all just doing our jobs! What do you think people were doing during WWII? They were just doing their jobs!" I indicated that I found this comment offensive as a Jewish person and would not be able to continue the discussion, to which she said she was also Jewish, and she did not appreciate me "bringing up race shit." I wished her a great rest of the day and ended the call. The phone number was (520) 490-1914 and caller ID only said "Cell Phone AZ."

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: A regular patron indicated to us that someone had been using drugs in the men's restroom, and pointed him out to L1 JH. Upon review of the camera footage, this customer had been in the men's room from 11:14am to 12:05pm. He left immediately after using the restroom so we were unable to ask him about the situation.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Customer asked to use the phone. Librarian KB directed him to the courtesy phone in lobby. Customer sat, made a call, and then became upset with person on other end. Customer shouted profanities and threw drink onto lobby floor. He got up and left and then came running back in for a few seconds before leaving the property for good.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.2 Strong odors    2.12 Belongings: Leaving unattended, may be removed without notice
Description: Staff/guards received complaints that Brandon's hygiene was poor again. Guard JT was able to speak with Brandon and give him a list of resources for showers and laundry. She let him know that he could be asked to leave the library if he did not address the issue. Brandon said he showered once a week but only had one pair of clothes. Brandon said he would do his best to take care of his hygiene and laundry. LIC DSL and JT checked for spare men's clothing but did not find any in the Main Library closet.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.4 Sleeping
Description: A patron came to the desk and reported to library associate TA that there was someone sleeping in the men's restroom. TA notified L1s JB and SG. SG knocked at the door and called into the restroom to ask if there was anyone inside. She was answered with, "Yeah I'll be out in a minute." SG and JB waited outside the restroom to monitor who came out. The patron who exited seemed to be under the influence of something, and was identified by JB as being the same person who was intoxicated and dancing in the parking lot last week. The patron left without incident.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: Excessive copying
Description: A customer has come into Quincie Douglas Library several times to make hundreds of copies at a time.  When he was leaving the library on Friday before closing, he asked to speak to the librarian in charge.  Assistant manager LM spoke to him--he said that when we ran out of ledger paper, and he asked for more, staff said there wasn't any more, and he always got more at other libraries, so why wouldn't we give him the paper?  LM explained that we had run out, and asked him how many copies he had made.  He said 400.  LM realized it was a customer who makes so many copies that he monopolizes the copier that he is using, sometimes even pulling a chair to sit in front of it.  He used the copier that customers can fax from, which held up people wanting to fax.  LM explained that the copier is a resource for all, and that when he makes so many copies it uses up large amounts of paper and toner.  On his next visit, we will ask him to only use the copier that is not also used for faxing, and also that he lets others take turns using the copier so that there is access for all who want to use it.  This is for documentation purposes only, as this has happened on several occasions.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Customer was behaving in an agitated manner at the desk when interacting with Librarian 1 KB.  Desk staff could not understand what the customer was attempting to communicate.  Customer went into the magazine/reading room area and through about 15 reference books onto an end table and shouting loudly enough to disrupt the entire library.  Customer turned to another customer in the area who appeared to be experiencing homelessness and told him to "get a job."  The man experiencing homelessness became agitated but did not respond.  The customer left the building.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Suspended patron John Samuel called Santa Rosa Library at 11:40am. He requested to speak with ML VV. Since she wasn't available, he requested to speak with LA ES. John knew he was suspended and wanted to know If his suspension was over and that he could come back to the library. He was informed that his suspension is effective until September 20st 2023 and he could come back to the library on September 21st 2023. His tone of voice changed being more agitated and frustrated. He also was informed that a copy of his suspension is in this library and he was more than welcome to come and pick it up. Then, he asked about what infractions were listed on that letter. LA ES was ready to inform the infractions but John yelled "Don't read them out loud for others can hear. Are you using the desk phone? are all the infractions from Santa Rosa Library or also from others libraries?". Since the answer was affirmative, he requested another phone number to call so he could know his infractions without other people being able to hear and since the SRO manager wasn't there. John was provided with the Infoline phone number and he hanged up.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description: At 11:52AM a regular patron entered the library and explained to LA SD and LA CR that on his way into the library, close to the junction of 10th Ave and 22nd St, he had found a handful of bullets and had picked them up out of concern, specifically citing the fact that there is a school close by. He handed staff the bullets, which were dented and scuffed; there were 17 in total. CR and SD thanked him and placed the bullets in a ziploc bag in the secure staff area. For documentation purposes only.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.4 Bullying per Pima County B.O.S. Policy D 23.1.    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: Calling Infoline while suspended
Description:
Suspended patron John called Infoline at 11:45 am. He told the Unique agent that he had called the Santa Rosa Library and been informed that he was suspended. He said the Santa Rosa staff had told him to call Infoline to find out why he was suspended. When the Unique agent let him know that she did not have any information on why he was suspended, he wanted to speak to the Main Library. The Unique Agent called the Main Library, where L1 KG gave her the rule violations listed on John's suspension letter.
The agent relayed these violations to John. John was upset and started repeating the same points about the guard he told to VV during incident 0000021871, continually interrupting her and not allowing her to talk. The agent eventually managed to transfer him to L2 CS at Main. CS repeated the list of rule violations to John and let him know that the only way to appeal his suspension would be to submit a written appeal. John stated that all of these were lies and continued to repeat his issues with the Santa Rosa guard. He also insisted that he wanted to come into the library and "speak to someone". After a long conversation, CS gave him the library director's phone number, but let him know that his suspension was still in effect and that he could not call or come in to the library except to get a copy of his suspension letter. John said that CS was probably going to call the director and tell her not to answer him. He then hung up.
Suspension is not being extended because John was specifically told by Santa Rosa staff to call Infoline and the Main Library. However, if he calls again, his suspension will be extended.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking
Description: Rafael came up to the desk while L1 PC was interacting with three teens and abruptly and aggressively asked her "can you define what you mean by staring." The experience was jarring for L1 PC.  Uncomfortable, she said "one sec" as LA LW went to get the manager. Rafael immediately left the building and was gone before staff could interact further. For documentation as his behavior was erratic and his focus on a specific employee is concerning. L1 PC has not been involved in either recent conversation about his prohibited behaviors.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.7.4 Bullying per Pima County B.O.S. Policy D 23.1.~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
At 5:39pm an unknown female patron went to the front desk and asked LTA JB for help printing from her phone. LTA JB proceeded to help her. At 5:45pm L1 VM went around telling people the library would be closing in 15 minutes. At 5:56pm the female patron came back to the desk and proceeded to ask LTA JB if she could help her print the documents. LTA JB told the patron she would have to send the documents again because the email address she sent them to was incorrect. The patron then started raising her voice at LTA JB saying, “You told me I would have enough time to print”. At that point, L1 VM jumped in and told the patron she still had a few more minutes and she could still print if she sent the documents quickly, otherwise she would have to come back tomorrow at 10am. The patron walked away to go sit at a table.
At 6pm, Sub Librarian XS made the announcement that it was 6pm and the library was closed. L1 VM went around telling people the library was closed. When L1 VM told the patron that the library was closed and that she could visit us again tomorrow the patron told L1 VM, “if you would just stop talking to me then I could send it but you keep talking to me.” The patron then said, “Why aren’t you helping me? There are still other people in here and you just keep telling me to leave.” LA ND then stepped in and continued to explain to the patron that we were closed for the night. L1 VM then walked away to tell the other patrons that the library was closed.
LA ND followed the patron as she started walking towards the exit doors and asked if she had asked anyone for help? The patron then stopped and started shouting and pointing at different staff members. She said, “I asked her for help. Her for help. Her for help. And none of them would help me.” L1 VM then approached the patron again and said, “We are more than willing to help you during opening hours. We will be open again tomorrow at 10am.” The patron then rudely asked L1 VM, “Why are you talking to me? Why are you yelling?” L1 VM then said I am not yelling I am telling you we are closed and you need to leave. The patron then said, “This is a library stop yelling.” L1 VM then again said the library is closed, we will be open tomorrow at 10am. The patron then told L1 VM, “Oh shut up you fat lady. Why don’t you go eat another donut.”

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: Library staff noticed that a trash bin that is left in the patio/garden area was dumped outside by the grassy area. ML VV checked the security cameras and you can see this patron taking the trash bin from garden area, to the grassy area, dump the bin and leave. about 30 minutes later Security footage sees the same woman return pick up the bin, put her belongings into the bin and take it with her. A young patron came to library staff to let them know that a woman at the bus stop had the trash bin that belonged to the library. Security footage matched description of woman. ML VV and Guard VY approached patron and asked for the bin back, Patron denied taking bin and that it belonged to her. Guard and ML told patron that we have Security Footage of patron taking the bin and dumping the contents on the floor. patron complied and gave the bin back to staff and was asked to not return for the day.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property

Description: A book was found in the bookdrop checked out to S.W. with signs of previous bug infestation (dead bugs and spotting.) Item deleted and items on customer's account placed on hold for the bedbug card. Other items that were found in the bookdrop with the book were also deleted.

Location: Frank De La Cruz-El Pueblo Library
Description:
Male patron, came into the library and went to deputy sheriffs BN and GH saying that he needed help. He said that people were trying to kidnap him and take him back to Obregon and kill him because they said he was a child molester. He said that he could hear the voices right now. Sheriff deputy BN asked if he had taken anything or any drugs. Patron said that he did not take any drugs, but he had been drinking and patron did smell strongly of alcohol. The deputies did notice that the male patron's pupils were pin points, indicating that he was under the influence of drugs. Deputy BN asked if he wanted him to call an ambulance for help and patron said no. The deputies and patron went outside because male patron wanted to show the deputies where the people were that were going to kidnap/kill him. While outside, patron agreed to be transported to Crisis Response Center.  
case number 230125147
 
for documentation purposes.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property    1.1.9 Trespassing    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: Breaking & entering~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.7 Not wearing shoes or shirt
Description:
At about 2am, an individual broke the front sliding glass door of the Main Library and entered the building. Cameras show him walking around the 1st floor and some of the 4th floor staff area, which he accessed via the staff elevator. He took an employee's water bottle and hand lotion and left a stick of deodorant on the employee's desk; the hand lotion was found, empty, in the 4th floor men's room later.
Police were onsite by 2:45am and arrested the individual without incident. VetSec security stood watch over the building until the glass vendor arrived in the morning to begin boarding up the broken door.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: Burning materials outside of entrance
Description: LIC KW found a burned canister of some kind outside the main entrance to the library.  The remains of the fire were on the concrete, inside of the horseshoe bench in front of the sliding glass doors. The area is not visible to cameras.  It was obvious that the burning took place in that location due to debris and ashes.  KW swept up the mess and this is just to document, as it was potentially destructive behavior.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: At 10:40, L2 DL recognized suspended patron Nelson on the 3rd floor and called LIC CS. While CS was busy dealing with an upset customer, Nelson went down to the 1st floor and spent some time on the computer. He then went down to the Our Space program for some food. When he came out, CS and Guard J reminded him that he was suspended from all libraries until October, and told him that if he kept coming back in his suspension would be extended. Nelson said, "I'm leaving. I'm leaving," and left.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.7 Not wearing shoes or shirt
Description:
Patron entered the library without shoes on, carrying a blanket. He tried to enter the women's bathroom, then went to the elevators. Guard J caught up with him and let him know he needed to have shoes on in the library. Patron immediately became agitated, shouting, "Fuck off!" several times at J and a nearby patron, scaring the other patron and his dog quite badly. He started waving his blanket around and walked away from J. When he saw Officer WC, who had heard the noise and gotten up to investigate, he immediately walked to the door and left the library.
Patron is not allowed back in the library today.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: A teen patron told LA DW that he thought he could smell marijuana in the teen space. DW called LIC CS, and the teen showed CS the place the smell was the strongest. The two of them found ash and the burnt end of a joint hidden in the origami butterflies on the windowsill. CS wiped down the area and disposed of the joint.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description: A customer went in the men's 1st floor restroom and came out to complain that a man was in there smoking drugs. Guard TL and L1 WW walked over and immediately smelled a distinct chemical smell, like burning marker, coming out of the restroom into the corridor. There was one man in the restroom in the closed stall. When he came out LIC DSL told him she had gotten a report he was smoking drugs in the restroom. He did not deny it and left quickly. DSL let him know he would be suspended for a year.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: 3rd floor men's restroom was closed for cleaning due to suspected drug use.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: LIC DSL had gotten reports of intermittent loud voices and cursing by a regular group of teens in the 101 Space. DSL went to talk with them about how others are using the 2nd floor to work quietly, look for jobs, etc., and to be conscious of that. Most of the teens said they understood but one wearing a black hoodie and blue gloves talked over DSL loudly and said "yes, sir!" when she had finished speaking with them. Later in the morning guard JT saw the teen with the black hoodie and blue gloves institgating rough horseplay with another teen. She let them know that kind of behavior could get them both asked to leave the library. They left the 101 Space and JT called DSL. While walking upstairs, DSL ran into the teens and saw the teen with the black hoodie and blue gloves attack his friend from behind and jump into a fighting stance. DSL let him know that he would need to leave for the day due to wrestling and horseplay in the library.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.1 Manipulating or bypassing library rules, such as computer use
Description: Caden, Cameron, Damien, and one other young teen patron were disruptive, using the N-word, and other forms of profanity.  They were asked by YA L1 JB, LA TA, and LTA DM to watch their language and told they would need to log off the computer if they did not.  When there was another patron complaint, the boys were logged off the computer.  Within about 5 minutes JB heard them use the n-word again and told them they could not stay due to their language.  The boys ignored her, but when JB mentioned getting guard CS, the boys said no one told them to leave and left in a huff, swearing at LTA DM on the way out

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: Cayden and Cameron White returned to COL and were reminded of their suspension by L1 JB.  They denied knowing about their suspensions.  JB offered them a copy of the letter.  They refused and left.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.4 Bullying per Pima County B.O.S. Policy D 23.1.
Description:
Patron Michael Abadia walked in the door and approached Lib III KS at Desk 1 and slide a DVD case to her. KS asked if he was returning it.  He said "No. It is just the case. I already returned the DVD.". KS tried to ask if he had talked to another staff member or dropped the DVD off in the book chute... He interrupted her to ask about a movie. When KS tried to let him know, she "would be happy to help with his request and still need more information about the DVD to make sure..." He cut her off and made a comment "I'm still talking - you know like Kamala Harris and all that...." He started talking about a movie he wanted again. He repeatedly referred to the movie by an incorrect title and KS tried to ask him questions to figure out what movie he wanted, he appeared frustrated, complaining that "we never have any of the classics", and KS found the movie on Hoopla which he did not want.
With moment to speak, KS asked about the DVD case - if he had talked to someone about the DVD or just returned it to the bookchute, so she knew how to make sure I got it matched up and removed from his account. He replied that he already talked to a staff member over the phone, referring to him as the "more melanated guy with the weird hair."  KS did not respond immediately, and he launched into asking about another movie he wanted to check out.
He similarly did not have the correct title and was frustrated by describing it to KS. At one point, he mockingly said "UMMMM, UMMM, UMMMM...Let's stop saying "UMMM" - we are getting no where". Later, he asked LTA EH what his name was. EH told him his name and the patron repeated his name, pronouncing it incorrectly with a phrase and tried to engage him in conversation. EH turned away, and later indicated to KS that he "felt like the patron was looking for an audience which he did not want to give him." 
The Mr. Abadia returned later asking for help on the catalog to look up movies that ARE physical DVDs he can reserve.  KS showed him at the catalog computer behind the desk. He mentioned he had just come from a 12 Hour shift as a nurse. He asked for KS's name, noticing her badge. He made a point to thank her by name and say goodbye by name when he left. (KS felt repeating her name was done in a way that was unsettling and not friendly.) This is for documentation purposes, due to repeated staff interactions with this customer leaving staff unsettled and on-guard. Librarian III KS will be calling this customer for missing disc issues in the future rather than LTA-Sup. DM.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description:
After the escalation of telephone calls to the branches (both to ELP and VAL) over the past several months--starting around Thanksgiving 2022, DV reported feeling unsafe. Trent has been previously informed of the consequences for continuing to behave in a way that violates the code of conduct, including suspension.
 
DV has changed her program hours and work hours as a result of the following circumstances with Trent Trout:
History of Violence: Evidence of earlier violent behavior from Trent- DV. indicated that through her interactions with Trent Trout at the library, he expressed issues in anger management and demonstrated signs of issues with anger management.
 
Threatening Behavior: Threats against family: Trent was previously suspended for making a direct threat to DV's husband, stated intention to hurt family in order to receive romantic reciprocation from DV.
 
Excessive behavior including repeated phone calls to the library requesting appointments with DV. and fixation on getting a phone call from DV., gift giving- in a previous computer class at the library, Trent brought excessive gifts, obsessions: Trent continues to demonstrate an obsession and fixation with DV. in a non-professional capacity.
 
Increase in Personal Stress: An unreciprocated romantic obsession that Trent has with DV. 
 
Staff DV has been granted an Injunction Against Harassment by the Tucson City Court from library customer Trent Allen Trout for her home and workplace, which is listed as Valencia Library. This includes a no contact order, no phone call, no email, no text, no social media contact, no phone contact to the Valencia or El Pueblo Libraries.
 
Due to the escalating behavior, and related violations of the code of conduct, Trent has been suspended from PCPL libraries.

Managing Librarian MS came up to Mr. Cancio and tried to get his attention, after about 5 attempts, he realized that MS was there. She said, "Hi sir, my name is MS, I'm the managing librarian here." Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description:
Regular patron Steve was waiting outside the library this morning. When Guard J walked by to enter the building, Steve yelled at J and told her she should be in jail. She told him to stop shouting at her whenever he sees her or she would call the police. In response, he called her a bitch. J entered the building and Steve remained outside, shouting at random passerby. LIC CS and L2 DL came down to review the situation. CS and DL debated calling the crisis line, but by then Steve had walked off towards Alameda and out of sight, so staff decided not to call yet.
Steve seems to be fixating more and more on Guard J in the last couple of months. He has accused her of harassing him multiple times, even when they have not interacted at all. If this behavior continues, he may need to be suspended.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.2 Guns, weapons, machetes, knives~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description:
LA DW called LIC CS about two groups of teens who were gearing up for a fight in the 101 Space. Group B, which consisted of 4 older teens, kept moving between the library's 2nd floor and Jacome Plaza. Group A (Ashley, Jordan, Manny, Mohammed, and another teen) was alternately using the computers in the teen area and pressing up against the windows, making gestures at Group B when they were outside. Both groups were verbally challenging one another.
CS and Guard J arrived while Group B was outside. They let Group A know that fighting would not be tolerated in the library, and that if Group A didn't stop antagonizing Group B, then they would all have to leave. Group A said that if the other teens said something rude, they would say something back. CS told them that if they had a problem with another teen, they needed to talk to a staff member, and reiterated that fighting would not be permitted.
Group B returned to the teen space. Guard J and CS repeated the same rules to them. The groups sat on opposite ends of the teen space and did not speak to one another. Guard J and CS stayed in the area to keep things civil.
At 12:04, Group B went to the restroom. While inside, they began a water fight. Regular patron Tony entered the restroom as this was happening and asked the teens not to splash him. One teen pulled a gun out of his hoodie and asked if Tony wanted to fight. Tony told the teen to leave him alone. The teens left the restroom and returned to the 101 Space, where the teen with the gun covertly flashed his weapon to the teens in Group A. All four members of Group B walked quickly out of the library. They began picking rocks out of the planters and throwing them at the 101 Space windows, where Group A was once again taunting them and making rude gestures.
CS told Group A to stop instigating a fight, which is when group A told her that group B had threatened them with a gun. CS and Guard J went downstairs and met Officer Corrales, who called for backup. Police pursued the teens and apprehended all 4 involved at the library, plus 4 more, in the parking lot across from City High.
Group A was not asked to leave the library today, as they did not have any adults who could come pick them up, and staff were concerned about sending them out into Downtown while another group of potentially armed teens were upset with them. However, they will be suspended for a month.
Group B will be suspended for 1 year. All suspension letters should be delivered by a police officer if at all possible. Staff should not interact with them and should call 911 if they enter the library.

Description:

She started screaming and crying, when two employees of the "HUB" next door to the library came to try to help the patron. Sherriff's Deputy GH when out to assist. Crisis Response Center was called, but they would not be able to come for about an hour and a half. Deputy GH offered to transport her, but she refused and then thought that he was a demon. The patron continued to scream and vomited a couple times. She seemed to be under the influence of drugs because after acting erratic, then she started to fall asleep, like under the influence of fentanyl. Deputy GH readied some Narcan if it were to be needed because the patron looked as if she was going to pass out. Patron ended up leaving the area. 
for documentation purposes.

The patron came to, without using the Narcan, and admitted to Deputy GH that she had a seizure because she just took Methadone to get off drugs. 
For documentation purposes
 
Paramedics Run Number 2313035

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
After closing at 5pm, a group of minors were lingering outside the library doors. L1 KN stepped out to remind the group to leave property since the library was now closed. A group of 4 tweens on bicycles moved to the corner of the parking lot near one of the entrance driveways (still on property). KN walked over to the group and again asked them to leave property, to which Chance responded "what will you do if I don't?". This is a common response from Chance when he is asked to leave property after closing. Before the conversation could continue, patron Jo Flowers pulled into the driveway. Chance was sitting on his bike in the driveway blocking her way. Chance did not move immediately, and Flowers began yelling at him through the van windows. Chance yelled back, but also began to move out of the roadway. Flowers then exited her vehicle and began yelling at Chance and the other tweens. Chance yelled back, both parties using a few obscenities. Since both Chance and Flowers have a history of loud reactions and escalating conversations, KN interfered and encouraged the tweens to leave. The tweens rode off. Flowers pulled to the front of the library, where she asked KN what "that boy's" name was and stated we (library staff) needed to speak to his parents. KN told her she could not give her that information, but if his parents did show up that we would speak to them.
Documenting due to frequent occurrences of this type of behavior from both Flowers and Chance.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal
Description:
Couple entered with two large pit bull dogs on a rather long leash. The dogs were pulling the woman rather than walking alongside her. As they stood at the front desk, the dogs were straining to reach customers walking by. Librarian JD reminded them that pets were not allowed, but service animals were. Customer said they were service dogs accompanying the male who was in a wheelchair. They got a guest pass and tried to log into a children's computer. JD explained that their pass should be used on the computers in the middle of the room. They walked over to the catalog computer in the area and started to sit down.  JD explained that they were catalog computers and motioned to the middle of the room. JD was called away and when she returned they were searching with Chrome on the catalog computer. JD again explained that the catalog computer was not for this kind of use. The brown pit bull jumped up, putting his paws on JD's chest and immediately was pulled down. JD warned them that the dog was not behaving as a service dog would and that he must be in control. The couple logged into a public computer and finished their work without incident.
On their way out about 2:00 pm, they walked by another customer with a dog and the three dogs began to bark and jump at each other. Customers nearby were yelling about the dogs. Librarians were called to the area, as the couple and pit bulls exited the building.
One male customer was continuing to be upset about the library's policy of letting dogs in and continued to talk loudly about it to others. He reported that a pit bull was grabbing at another man's pant leg. No one on staff saw this happen. 
The uproar continued another male customer who was very loud and vocal berated JD. He was asked to lower his voice. JD explained that the incident was over, the dogs were out of the building, management would be informed. After a few more sentences JD asked him to quiet is voice or he would be asked to leave. All was quiet and customers went back to work.

He let her know that what she said to him was not nice. He then said that she walked away, muttering to herself. No physical contact was made.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: At approximately 3:10pm on 2/13/23 Librarian I PC informed manager SH that there were kids arguing and possibly fighting outside of the library. SH walked outside and noticed that everyone had dispersed and only one or two youth were still outside of the library. SH approached Dean and asked them what happened. Dean informed SH that two other youth, Maddux and Andrew, were the other two involved in the argument and altercation. Dean told SH that the argument had started at the school next to the Abbett library and that multiple youth were yelling at and arguing with each other on their way to the library. Dean told SH that two of the youth from the other group had entered the library but came back outside and approached him as he and his friends approached the library. Dean thought they were going to attack him and after Andrew jumped toward him and possibly slapped him Dean reacted and hit Andrew. Andrew admitted that he did feint towards Dean as if he was going to hit Dean but never actually hit Dean. Dean mentioned his hand hurt so SH gave him an ice pack, but Dean refused any further first aid. After Dean hit Andrew both Andrew and Maddux went inside the library. SH spoke with each of the youth involved and asked them to leave for the day. According to the Revised Code of Conduct for Youth, all three youth will be suspended for 1 week unless they participate in a restorative conversation with each other. Dean mentioned his hand hurt so SH gave him an ice pack, but Dean refused any further first aid. All three youth left without further incident.
