Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Profanity
Description:
Patron J, a frequent visitor at our location, was sitting in his usual spot flipping through pages of a book. Around 1:20 p.m., Patron J begin to aggressively flip through the pages and start to ramble to himself.  The rambling became a bit loud. His rambling continued for about 2 minutes when LTA EH decided to approach Patron J and ask him if everything was okay. Patron J did not address LTA EH but in his rambling did clearly say, “It doesn’t matter cuz this is my last book anyway.” This is not an unusual way for patron J to signal to staff that he's getting ready to go, as he's had these types of interactions with most of the desk staff. Usually he is able to self-calm and bring the volume back down. LTA EH then decided to go back and continue shelving from the hold shelf cart.  
Minutes later, Patron J, while still rambling, finished flipping through the book and walked into the Men’s Restroom. While in the restroom, Patron J was rambling louder for about 3 to 5 minutes, it came across to LTA sup AK as shouting, and there was also some profanity. There were some loud banging noises coming from inside the Men’s Restroom alongside the ranting. LTA EH informed LTA Supervisor, AK, about the situation to ensure that others knew about it in case anyone decided to go towards the direction of the restrooms. 
A patron came out of the women's bathroom around 1:30 looking alarmed. She looked toward the desk and saw that staff was aware, and hurried out of the building. At about 1:35 p.m., Patron J came out of the Men’s Restroom, still rambling to himself and exited the library without incident. He did not appear to encounter anyone in the parking lot. Upon inspection there was nothing out of place or damaged in the men's restroom. 
This report is for documentation purposes only.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
Approx. 2:05pm, patron John Harman was evacuated from the library as part of incident 22207. He left his belongings behind. Afterwards, he called Infoline and spoke to LA TW about his belongings, making threatening statements such as declaring that staff 'had better not touch anything'.
He returned to the library at 10am 2/15, still behaving in an extremely hostile manner. LA WB asked Librarian III AD to speak with him. During his conversation with AD, he did not make any overt threats but acted in an aggressive manner, demanding to know who had moved his belongings and where some missing slips of paper had gone. AD informed him that library staff had evacuated with the patrons and that when we returned, his bag was at the front desk, neatly labeled. They assured Mr. Harman that they would try to see where his papers had gone, but that it had been out of staff control and that they could not promise that the papers would be located. Staff checked the obvious spots -- around the front desk, the computer Mr. Harman had been using, and the lost and found -- to no avail. Mr. Harman demanded to know if library staff had had advance warning of the threat, and was told that it was a surprise to us as well. Mr. Harman calmed down a little at this and expressed his opinion that us not being informed was 'bullshit' and that it had happened because 'the cops are lazy and they want to do these drills here because you're right next door', but reiterated that 'someone still needs to find my notes'. AD again assured him that they would try, but could not promise.
Mr. Harman then moved off into the rest of the library. Approx. 12:15pm, he returned to the front desk, asking for the manager's email address to copy them on an email he was planning to send about the situation. AD provided their business card and he left the desk without further incident.
Staff will review security camera footage, but it is likely that facilities staff moved the items when the building was being checked after the bomb scare and recycled the papers, assuming they were not important.
Documenting as Mr. Harman seems likely to escalate the issue.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: Suspicious package/suspected bomb
Description:
Approx. 2:05pm, LA WB let Librarian III AD know that Officer Parrish from the police substation next door needed us to evacuate the library. LIII AD had a brief conversation with Officer Parrish. He indicated that there was a suspicious package left in front of the substation/near the library gates and that based on the size and weight, the library needed to be evacuated as any potential explosion could affect the library as well. He directed staff to evacuate patrons from the side emergency exit and requested that we lock the front doors and keep patrons away from that area as that side of the building was closer to the package.
LIII AD proceeded to implement the emergency evacuation plans. LA WB and LTA Sup SG served as floor coordinators and other staff proceeded to the rally point. Once staff were safely gathered at the rally point, along with some patrons, Officer Parrish returned and directed staff to evacuate the parking lot, as well. Staff did so, eventually reconvening at a local Safeways as an offsite rally point. Eventually, after consulting with LSM VL and DD MA, it was determined that GLF would not reopen for the day. Staff were told they could go home or to another library to work.
Upon returning at 8am 2/15, LSM VL advised LIII AD that TPD had handled the situation and we could reopen as normal.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description:
At 3:07 two teenage boys approached the desk and informed LA SD and LIC VV that the men's bathroom "stank like someone was doing fentanyl in there." SD checked the bathroom and confirmed that the smell was consistent with drug use. The bathroom will be closed for the rest of the day.
Upon review of security footage, patron Chris enters the bathroom at 2:48pm and leaves at 3:08. No other patrons enter the bathroom around this time, and those that enter after Chris - the two teenage boys and child Sal - report smells consistent with drug use. Patron Chris brushes by SD as he leaves, but staff had not yet reviewed security footage to check. 
Chris has been in the library and used the bathroom at the same time as the last two drug-related incidents.
Patron will be suspended for one year.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed
Description: On Tuesday, 2/14/23 at approximately 4:00pm, one of our youth, Zay, had been asked to leave for the day for repeatedly throwing their lunchbag around inside of the library, at one point hitting another youth's laptop. As they were waiting to be picked up they began to throw rocks outside. One of the rocks thrown caused damage to a cactus on library property. LTA Sup. MV saw this take place from the front desk and both MV and manager SH spoke with Zay outside regarding their behavior and their continued poor judgment. Zay has been suspended from the library for 3 days and will be allowed to return on Monday, February 20th.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.4 Sleeping~Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: At 1:04 PM, guards reported to staff that a patron was drinking alcohol in the 3rd floor computer lab. LIC MB & guards found that a man was sleeping at the computer with a bottle of liquor on the computer desk. He was slipping in and out of consciousness and did not respond to requests to put away his alcohol or answer any questions. MB & guard J called for on-site Officer Corrales, who managed to rouse the man and get him to leave the computer lab, but he stopped to sit in a chair in the 3rd floor lobby and would not get up. His speech was slurred and he did not know where he was or what was going on. Officer Corrales called for an ambulance. A team from the fire department came and took his vitals at about 1:25. They recorded his name as Steve/Steven Perda, but he was difficult to understand. They removed more bottles of alcohol from his belongings, which MB & J disposed of in the outside dumpster. The fire department waited with him until EMTs arrived with a stretcher and took him out of the library at 1:50.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.8 Smoking, rolling, using tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes
Description: A patron reported to LA TA that another patron was vaping in a bathroom stall.  TA informed LIs JB and SG who inspected the bathroom.  The odor was strong before opening the door and overwhelming in the women's restroom.  JB and SG saw a single patron in the restroom doing their makeup.  JB confirmed that the smell was overpowering and informed the patron that the bathroom needed to be closed due to drug use.  The patron denied using in the restroom and JB explained that the procedure is to close the restroom due to the smell.  Patron stormed off, muttering.  JB and SG locked the restroom and placed an out of order sign on the door.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description: Patron name Dorian made the comments violating our policy about racist language. He was asked to come up to the front desk so that staff (Samuel Hennig and myself) could talk to him about how that is against the policy. We offered him some options as to how to resolve this behavior but of all the options he said he would just rather be suspended for two weeks.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description:
For documentation purposes. At about 4 PM LTAS KW observed three young men (18-21) helping a young woman (18-21) out the women's restroom on first floor. She repeatedly fell to the floor while trying to walk with them and could not respond to KWs questions. The three men with her stated she had had too much alcohol and quickly removed her from the building. They sat in front of the library for a few minutes before L1 MB, along with Guard A, approached them to offer water and check in on the situation. The young men once again insisted she was fine but her body language and the fading in and out of consciousness led staff and nearby members of the public to call 911 for a medical/wellness check. At 4:04 KW called 911 and for six minutes gave them details on the situation. Two of the men eventually helped the woman to her feet and with her arms around their shoulders they walked eastbound from Stone and Pennington. Staff observed her fall multiple times as they left line of sight. 
Guards J and A observed the four of them together as a group prior to her being in an inebriated state. 
At 4:47 an officer called saying they had searched up and down Pennington and could not find them.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.7.4 Bullying per Pima County B.O.S. Policy D 23.1.
Description:
At 5:23pm, Library Associate AM walked to copier #1 with two library users who had requested help with using the machine. A third library user, a slim woman in her 70s who is a regular library user, "WRU", who had been waiting to use the copier became upset and became verbally abusive Library Associate AM, using racist comments directed at AM, snide remarks, and using a loud fake condescending and patronizing Spanish accent including the phrase "no comprendo" when addressing AM. Bystanders were visibly shocked at the verbal abuse and tone. 
WRU then walked over to the copier to retrieve her documents, and made a point to slam the copy machine cover directly in front of staff AM.
WRU walked off and moved to the other copier where she got help with her copies and left for the day. 
WRU will be suspended for 6 months due to violation of code of conduct related to bullying, abusive harassment, and abusive insults based on race and national origin.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.2 Internet use that is harmful to minors
Description: On Wednesday, 2/15/23 at approximately 5:50pm staff reported to manager SH that a library page conducting closing duties had found pornography on the screen of the children's catalog computer in the children's area. At the time it was discovered there were very young children 5 years old or younger that were running around in the children's area near the picture books and were accompanied by their parents, but there wasn't anyone sitting at the computer. Earlier in the day there may have been youth in the area, however there was a children's program, Read to a Dog, that took place from 4:30pm to 5:30pm and none of the staff helping with this program remembered seeing anyone at the children's catalog computer. It is assumed that the incident took place sometime between 5:30-5:50pm but we were unable to determine who may have been responsible for the incident. At this time this incident is for documentation purposes only.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1 Any criminal offense    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description:
At approximately 12:59pm VetSec Guard TL observed 4 adults blocking the Emergency Exit door. The guard asked them to leave the area. LA MD was coming in from lunch and notice that the group was doing drugs, and notified branch manager MS of the situation.  MS went outside and VetSec Guard TL explained that he had taken care of the incident. The group was gathering up their things and heading out towards the Laos Transit Center. MS ask TL, "were they doing drugs?" and that is when MS noticed the foil on the floor and the dryer sheets. 
All 4 will be suspended for 1 year.  
Female #2 attempted to come in today, immediately upon opening the door she noticed our Deputies. Sheriff MS and NN stood up from where they were sitting to escort her out, but the woman was already leaving. No extension was given. 02/17/2023 mdiaz

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: Customer sitting in Cafe area was observed having very labored breathing, extremely heavy coughing, and appearing to be ready to vomit. Librarian, JD, asked if he needed assistance and he indicated that he did not need help. He was observed from the front desk area buying a soda from the machine and sitting down to drink it. His coughing became more loud and frequent, and he was grabbing at his chest while leaning over the garbage can as if he was vomiting. JD  called 911 at 2:30pm. TFD evaluated him and called for AMC ambulance, which arrived at 3:05pm and transported the customer to a hospital.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description: Teen volunteer W was approached by an adult male in the library (outside the Teen space) who attempted to speak to W and made them feel very uncomfortable. W described the man as wearing a back pack and beanie, likely Hispanic. W quickly left and came into the 101 space & appeared visibly upset, to get away from him, and relayed the event to LA MA.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Children in the Library
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling~Children in the Library    4.2 Leaving child unsupervised or ignoring disruptive behavior of child
Description:
A male and female patron were unable to control the behavior of there children while they were inside the library - including yelling, kicking computer cubicle walls, and hitting desks and keyboard. L1 MNC attempted to speak with the parents regarding the behavior and they informed him that they were leaving. The female patron was unable to direct one of children to leave the computer area and then told MNC to force the child from the computer. MNC told her that as the parent she would need to retrieve her child as that was not something that library staff could do.
The female patron then stated that she was abandoning the minor child there and proceeded to leave the branch. MNC requested the assistance of the PCSD deputies present and reported the situation. MNC and the deputies reiterated that retrieving the child was the responsibility of the parent and she could not simply leave the child behind at the library. 
The female patron responded with repeated insults and threats at MNC and demanded his name. When MNC went to retrieve the code of conduct and contact info for the branch manager/LSM, patron further directed their aggression towards the officers. The deputies escorted the patrons and their children off the property.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Regular patron Tony came up to the desk and let L1 WW know that someone was doing a drug deal and "smoking pills" in the 2nd floor men's restroom. WW called LIC CS, and they confirmed that there was no one in the restroom and the restroom smelled strongly of fentanyl. Checking the security cameras confirmed that as soon as Tony left the restroom, the customer who was accused of smoking left the library quickly in the company of two teen boys. There was no one else in the restroom during that period of time who could have caused the drug smell. The smoking customer will be suspended for 3 months.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Two regular patrons began arguing with each other in the lab. One of the patrons had been loudly talking to himself in an agitated manner and the other man had asked him to be quiet. The patron who had been talking to himself yelled at the other man. It escalated and the two began yelling insults at each other. One of the guards talked with the two men and asked them to quiet down and stop arguing. LIC DSL was called. She observed that that patron who had been talking to himself was still doing so in a loud voice. DSL spoke with him about the 3rd floor being the quiet floor and asked him if he thought he could work quietly. Most of his response was unintelligible and DSL had a hard time working out what he was saying. DSL suggested that he may want to use a computer on the 1st floor, or, if he thought he could do so quietly, move to the back row away from the other patron. The man said he was going to leave. He left amicably.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description:
Patron #1 came in and recognized patrons #2 & #3 from an incident at patron #1's workplace. Patron #1 briefly engaged patrons #2 & #3 before speaking with LTA AO and then PCSD Deputies Hill and Ramirez. The deputies spoke with both parties separately outside. Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description:
At 1:04 pm, LIC VS was speaking with a patron at the front desk, other staff were engaged with patrons in the computer lab. The patron VS was speaking to may have had a developmental or intellectual disability, and a speech impediment. She asked questions several times, in several different ways, and VS was using more focus than usual to understand the patron's questions, in order to answer them, and then check for understanding.
Another patron approached the far end of the desk at this time. He did not form a line or approach VS's work station, but instead hovered to the side, two desk stations away. At 1:05 pm, when the patron VS was helping asked another question, the patron who was waiting to the side, openly scoffed twice.
VS interrupted what she was doing to turn to the patron who had scoffed, and told him he would need to be respectful while he was waiting. The patron then said he was leaving, and that he wasn't receiving any help. 
On his way out, he raised his voice, and commented about the patron VS was helping, which caused that patron to then raise their voice, and the two of them exchanged words. 
At 1:12, the first patron came to report to VS that while she was outside getting her bike, the man was still in the parking lot. She reported that he called her a bitch, and that he made comments to her about how she should be careful out there, because it would be terrible if something were to happen to her while she was out on her bike, which, given the circumstances, the first patron took to be threatening. 
Since this is a first-time offence, and second event occurred outside the building with no witnesses, Patron will be suspended for one month, staff will plan to have a conversation : 3/21/23

Description: Librarian I CR called LIC BC t say that there was screaming coming from the women's rest room. Both CR and BC went to the rest room to speak with the woman who was very upset, but calmed down a little and left the library. She was speaking about demons and thought she was actively being followed though she was not. Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: At 5:16pm two young adult males entered the library and went straight into the men’s bathroom. At 5:25pm an adult male wearing a red hat walked in and then straight out of the bathroom. He then went and told VetSec guard VM that the men’s bathroom smelled funny. At 5:30pm VetSec guard VM asked LA TM if she could check the men’s bathroom with her. They did not see anyone in the bathroom but smelled a chemical smell. LA TM then informed L1 VM what was going on. L1 VM told them to lock the men’s bathroom and to not let anyone in there. As our guard tried to lock the men’s bathroom the two young adult males came running out of the bathroom. They asked VetSec guard VM, “What the hell are you doing?” as they proceeded to run out of the library. The two young adult males will be talked to about the incident if they come back into the library.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
Around 2:20pm, Moses Kidd was in the computer lab and began addressing a patron near him, calling him a f*ggot and asking him if he wanted to fight outside. When guard E approached to intervene, he yelled at her too, accused her of flirting with him, and left. -Per the report of the patron who was harassed to MB and Officer Corrales.
LIC MB was called but arrived to the third floor after he was gone; she was called to the first floor soon after because Moses was wanting to file an official complaint with VetSec due to what he perceived as E's flirtatious behavior (talking to him when needed, walking around as required by her job, and "flipping her hair"). Guard J and MB took his information to pass on his complaint to VetSec and MB offered accommodations such as a study room if he felt distracted by the security guards. Moses left the library appearing mollified. The patron who was harassed spoke to MB & Officer Corrales after he had left the library.
Moses will be suspended for 1 month for harassing other patrons & threatening violence.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description: Library page LB approached L1 KB to tell KB that a customer accused LB of following him around the library every time he comes in. Earlier in the day, said customer knocked into a book cart that was nearby. KB went to find L1 JD so KB would have backup for when she approached the customer. As KB was filling in JD about the situation, LTA Supervisor AP came in search of KB and told KB and JD that customer had pushed a cart from the hands of another page, BW, as he and page SL were shelving. BW and SL quickly left the area and came toward the service desk. Customer then followed DW and SL toward the exit. KB and JD approached the customer in the lobby and told him he'd need to leave for the day. He swore (a lot) and said that this is how the library treats black people and that he was being harassed. He aggressively stepped forward toward KB and JD and said he would film us. KB and JD stepped back farther into the library, and he continued to come toward them. He made an attempt to film with his camera. Guard JL was standing next to KB, telling her to step further back. After a minute or so of more swearing, he turned to leave, came back, and flipped the table in the lobby. JD and Guard JL went out the back door to make sure he left the process. LA RG called 911 during the altercation, but he left the property while she was on the phone. They said to call 911 if he returned.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description:
Incident began as a road rage incident off library property. Individual #1 began following Individual #2, driving aggressively and tailgating her. Individual #2 sees a PCSD vehicle in the library parking lot and comes onto the property followed closely by Individual #1. Individual #2 stops in a space near the library entrance and begins honking her horn to get someone’s attention. Individual #1 stops his vehicle in the lot behind Individual #2’s vehicle, exits, and begins yelling at Individual #2.
PCSD Officer Ramirez goes out to investigate and immediately responds to diffuse the situation. L1 MNC goes out shortly afterwards to monitor the incident. Officer R repeatedly directs Individual #1 to disengage, park, and wait in his vehicle. Individual #1 moves his vehicle to the end of the parking lot by the flagpole, exits, and begins to approach Individual #2 and Office R again. Officer R again directs him to remain inside his vehicle. Individual #1 gets back inside his vehicle, waits a couple of minutes, then circles around the parking lot, and rolls down his window to yell at Individual #2 and Officer R. Officer R then orders Individual #1 to leave the property and he drives off. Officer R remains outside for several more minutes getting a statement from Individual #2 who is visibly shaken by the incident. After receiving a case number and other information from Officer R, Individual #2 gets in her vehicle and departs.

She then noticed a piece of foil paper with black residue on it lying on the floor inside of the handicapped stall. The perpetrator has not been identified.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking
Description: NONE

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description:
Teen patron Michael was using the desk phone to call his mother about a ride home at closing when he reported to staff that tween patrons Chance and Tristan had been threatening him outside, saying they were going to take him behind the library and "kick his ass" as soon as the library closed. L1 KN, who had been outside reminding Chance, Tristan, and tween patron Niko that they needed to leave property now that the library was closed, returned and was told about the incident by Michael. LI KN went outside again and saw Chance, Tristan and Niko hovering at the edge of library property and occasionally looking back towards the direction of the library doors. L1 KN returned as Michael was on the phone with his mother trying to convince her to let him walk home. L1 KN encouraged him to go with his mother since she was already at the library and told him that it was always better to take a guaranteed safe ride home. He finally agreed, so L1 KN walked him to the door and made sure he got in the car with his mother.
Follow up: Chance and Tristan will be suspended for threatening another patron. Since Niko was not named as threatening Michael, he will not be suspended at this time but staff will have a conversation with him about his behavior choices and the consequences that may result from those choices.
Follow up: L3 TFL and L1 PC served Tristan with his 1 week suspension on 2/24.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property
Description: The guard reported graffiti reading "SUEDE" in the 3rd floor men's restroom. The day porter will attempt to clean it off with graffiti remover.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description:
A woman came to the desk and asked to use the phone to make calls. She was disappointed to learn that the courtesy phone would not make a long distance call. She said she had been a victim of identity theft and needed to make a long-distance call to get it sorted. She was upset when she was told she could not make a long-distance call from the courtesy phone. 
LA EP recommended she make a suggestion to allow the courtesy phone to make long-distance calls. LA EP called LIC DSL. 
DSL came and listened to the woman's complaint. The woman said she had been referred to the library by the City Manager's office, the police department, and her bank to the Main Library as a place she could make phone calls. She said none of them told her she could not call long distance. DSL said they probably weren't aware and that she would communicate with her supervisor that this was happening. 
The woman said she did not understand why she couldn't use the phone behind the desk. She said she had asked to use it before and had been given permission. DSL told her it was not a public phone and that it may have been a one-time thing, or it was before the courtesy phone was installed.
The woman said she had hired a lawyer to help her with identity theft and that it had been a long process to get it sorted. She said TPD wasn't helping her. DSL sympathized and said that sounded very difficult and frustrating. She asked if there were other places she could make long-distance calls, such as her lawyer's office or by purchasing a pre-paid phone. The woman said her lawyer lived in Phoenix and that she already had seven phones. 
DSL apologized and said she did not feel she could help her further. She told her she could make a suggestion in the box and escalate her complaint to Library Administration. DSL gave her the 5600 phone number. The woman became angrier and escalated her tone and volume and repeated herself several times. DSL said that she could not continue this conversation and that she had helped her as much as she could. The woman told DSL that she had not been helpful at all and that her tax dollars paid for the library, so she should be allowed to make long-distance calls. EP asked the woman to step aside so she could help other customers and the woman said that first she was going to finish her complaint. The woman finished writing down her complaint and left the building, giving staff the middle finger as she left.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description:
At 11:15 a.m. man in his 60s approached two young girls, about age 11-13, who were writing on the talk-back board in the hallway just outside the Children's room. He began to chat with them about what they were writing, and complimenting them, telling them that they were artists, and attempting to engage them in conversation.  The girls' mother came over a minute later, saw him talking to her girls, and ushered the girls away. 
The man then went upstairs near the Teen Space. LA RW asked if he needed any assistance as he was walking by and he said he was looking for an illustrator because he was a children's book author. He also mentioned that he used to be homeless and live outside the library about 10 years ago. He said that the person that had originally agreed to illustrate his book was a former patron that he recruited to do the work for him but had taken the money and walked out on the project. He said something to the effect of that if he ever saw that person again he was going to "shoot them." 
The man went back down to the Children's desk at about noon and told LTA MG he needed an illustrator for his children's book. He demanded that she find him an illustrator. His tone became quite hostile. LA TW came over and attempted to assist the man. The man demanded over and over that TW find him an illustrator. TW found a copy of the Children's Writers and Illustrators Market. The man was not satisfied with TW's assistance, swore, and left the Children's room. 
DSL and guard JT later confirmed that he had left the library.

Description: Approx. 10:05am, Librarian Substitute PM alerted in-charge Librarian MMM and Librarian III AD that an incident was in progress. Upon entering the main floor of the library, two men were yelling across the library at one another. One man, Tyrion Crowe (sp?), was accusing the other of having taken his phone charger. The other man was defending himself and loudly asking the other man to stay away from him. LI MMM asked him to lower his voice. At some point, when he wouldn't, Tyrion became enraged and began threatening him and the library, yelling things such as "Fuck you, fuck this library!" and asking the other man to "take it outside". He left angrily, but returned shortly thereafter, yelling his name and further threats of violence ("Remember my face, if I see you outside I'll fuck you up!") at the other man, who had been trying to work at the computer but got up, put his hands up and again asked Tyrion to stay away from him. During all of this, approx. 10:10am, LI MMM called 911. They responded at around 10:25am, after Tyrion had already left, and took a description of the incident and Tyrion's name. Staff let police know that Tyrion was not to re-enter the library for at least the rest of the day. After consulting the suspension guidelines, Tyrion will be suspended for one year.

When Patron #2 was leaving, Patron #1 quickly moved in to get alongside Patron #2. Once he had Patron #2's attention, Patron #1 then gave Patron #2 an intense and angry look before walking out of the library. Patron #2 sat down in the lobby to wait for his ride and left a few minutes later.

HS said, "Would you like to go outside and get some fresh air? I can't let you sleep in the library." HS asked patron to clean up the detritus from 6 snack packs. Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1 Any criminal offense    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Patron Mercedes M. Turner  was on the library bench sleeping. At 9:38am she wakes up and puts her blanket over her head and proceded to smoke fentanyl. She came into the library at 10:07am with a large blanket and pillow with her and she was crying and whimpering. She went to computer 21 and set her stuff down, then went to the front desk and asked for a guest pass for the computer. Managing Librarian MS was speaking to Deputy Sheriff GH about the recent incidents that had happened at ELP, when at 10:31 am patron got up from her computer, leaving her blanket and pillow at computer 21, and taking her pink purse with her. As she walked out, she said to Managing Librarian MS and Deputy Sherriff GH, "I'm gonna smoke". MS looked at Deputy GH and said "did she say she was going to go smoke?". MS assumed tobacco, and Deputy Sherriff GH went outside to let her know that smoking tobacco was not allowed on library property because we are a tobacco free zone. She was found by Deputy GH in the first alcove on the south side of the library smoking fentanyl in foil and with a straw. Deputy GH had patron Mercedes Turner come back into the library and empty her purse on the table, in which he found 2 fentanyl blue pills and drug paraphernalia. Patron was arrested for 3 felony counts and also because of an unrelated warrant. Managing Librarian also served her, her one year suspension letter for drug use on library property. Case number is #230301121

Librarian HS attempted to give suspension letter to patron at 11:54am, 3/1/2023, to follow up on Incident ID: 0000022225.
 
HS asked patron to have a conversation away from computer area. Patron said, "Did the guard tell on me?" 
He walked with HS toward the exit, but made gestures to Guard MS and called him a fat ass.

Patron said yes, he knew, but he had to check on a court date. "If I get arrested, it's on you, and I'll sue your ass." 
HS said, "We hope to see you back in the library in 3 weeks. If you want the letter, it has information about how to appeal the suspension."
The patron said, "I'm leaving and I'm never coming back here.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.1 Harassment: Filming or photographing without permission    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: filming in the branch, which made customers uncomfortable and leave the branch or the area where the incident occurred
Description: On Wednesday, 3/1/23 around 1 PM, two people entered the building and began filming, one male and one female. Staff were not aware of the female filming in the building, who immediately went downstairs to the nonfiction area while the male approached the desk filming. LTA Supervisor LAM approached the customer and informed them that they could not film customers conducting their business in the library, but they could film staff or the building itself. LAM told the customer she had some information she would provide to them about this policy. LAM then went to the back staff area and informed Branch Manager LAF about the situation. LAF informed staff in the back room that there was a first amendment audit that was likely occurring on the floor and to stay in the back if they did not want to be filmed. LAF then went out to greet the customer, who was standing in front of the circulation desk and next to the children's area. LAF notified the customer that they were not permitted to film customers conducting their private library business in the building, but that they could film staff. LAM had given the customer a copy of A.R.S 41-151.22 before LAF greeted the customer and they were reviewing it. The customer asked many questions regarding A.R.S 41-151.22 and the code of conduct, claiming at one point that the revised statute was fake. They also stated that the code of conduct and the revised statute did not trump their rights. LAF asked many times for the customer to stop filming other customers, which they would not. This included families and small children. Customers were visibly distressed, some leaving the building, and one parent with their children in the children's area gathered her children and took them to an area in the stacks where they could not be seen. The incident was very disruptive to business as well as it took place in front of the circulation desk. LAF offered the customer options and told them they could stop filming and leave or they could choose to continue filming and that they would be suspended from the library and trespassed from the premises. The customer continued to film and LAF asked the customer to leave, which they did not, still filming, and said that they would finish filming the rest of the location and then leave. LAF informed them that if that was the course they chose and they refused to leave after they'd been asked to, LAF would need to call TPD. They continued filming and began to head deeper into the branch and LAF proceeded to the staff work area to call TPD. LAM remained at the desk. LAM informed LAF that the customer left while LAF was still on hold and in communications with TPD. TPD was informed the customers left the branch. LAM also informed LAF that a second person (the female customer) left filming with the customer who interacted with staff. The male customer has been identified by a name they use on youtube and potentially other social media, which is Joey Surreal. The female customer has not been identified.

Owen could not identify the boy who had been talking to him from the teens in the library the day he reported this harassment.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Description:
At 10 AM on the morning of 3/2/23, the day after the first Amendment audit at Bear Canyon, staff member LTA CC answered a phone call asking for "the most senior person in charge at the branch". Branch Manager LAF answered the call and the person on the phone said their name was John. The person mentioned the filming on 3/1/23 and what occurred. They said the library is not within their rights to tell people they cannot film customers. They said that staff at Bear Canyon are interpreting the policy wrong. They personalized the issue to Bear Canyon staff multiple times. LAF told them this was a system-wide policy because they kept referencing our staff specifically and saying that staff at this location are interpreting the policy incorrectly. LAF thanked them for expressing their concerns and said that she would inform administration of the conversation. LAF also informed them that they could use the contact us feature on our website to express those concerns and that administration would see this. They continued on saying that they care about the library and that they were so glad we didn’t call the police because if the person filming had been arrested, that wouldn’t go well for the library and could have ended in civil litigation. In the film, the auditor asks staff member LTA Supervisor LAM if Branch Manager LAF was in the back calling the police and LAM answered, "I don't know". The customer continued on with the phone conversation and said they like the library and everything we do for the community and they “don’t want to see anything bad happen to us”. This was said two or three times in a pointed tone, which was vaguely threatening. They asked LAF who the policy came from and how that was being interpreted, and whether we have an attorney for the library or if it’s with the attorney for the county. LAF did not answer the question and directed them again to the website to express their concerns and assured them that she would share with administration what the customer said. They said good and said they were going to follow up on that. The phone call wrapped up here. 
Social media harassment on both the Bear Canyon branch facebook page and on the PCPL main facebook page with manipulated and extremely offensive imagery of staff began on 3/1/23 and has continued since the incident occurred on 3/1/23, but we do not know who is responsible or if the phone call and social media harassment are connected to the same individual.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1 Any criminal offense    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling~Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description:
Library page DL indicated to Managing Librarian DB that there was something off near the computer lab. When DB followed by LA CS approached the computer lab, Mick Carmichael was very closely hovering over another patron seated at a computer. Mick was shouting that the other patron had somehow broken his cell phone and messed up his computer. When DB asked for more clarification Mick started to swear at library staff and threatened the other customer that he would be waiting outside. He then turned and walked very quickly outside the building. He turned right and passed library page AJM seated on the bench in front of the window. AJM was on her break and was looking at her phone. DB watched Mick Carmichael forcefully push his arm down. DB quickly went outside to check on AJM and escort her inside. Mick Carmichael went to get the dog he had tied up outside and started walking across the plaza, only to turn around to swear at DB one more time. 
When AJM came inside she dialed 911 on her cell phone and described the situation to dispatch. Mick Carmichael had made a forceful grab for her phone. She protected herself and her body by turning away from him and during that motion her right hand thumb was injured. 
Librarian DB also called 911 to ensure that officers were on their way to take a statement. The dispatch confirmed that they were on their way. 
Approximately 10 minutes later Officer Horrigan arrived to take a statement from library page AJM and L2 DB. During the interview Office Horrigan determined that AJM's injuries warranted further investigation. EMTs were called and AJM was transported to urgent care for further treatment.

Description: A regular customer began talking on his cell phone in the computer lab, which is on the 3rd floor, a.k.a. the "quiet floor." One of the security guards asked him to take his call out into the stairwell and he ignored her. She asked him again and he ignored her again. Staff called LIC DSL. DSL introduced herself and reminded him that the 3rd floor was the quiet floor. The man said he was looking for an apartment and it was an important call. DSL let him know that it was the quiet floor and that he should use a computer on the 1st floor if he needed to use the phone and the computer at the same time. He apologized and said it wouldn't happen again. DSL told him that if he failed to comply with a staff or security request to modify his behavior he could be asked to leave the library. He apologized again, gruffly, and said it wouldn't happen again.

Description: At approximately 10:05 Guard JL alerted librarian JM that something was happening in the computer lab. JM walked over to find regular patron Steve Montes on the ground next to computer 25 and the patron at computer 25 claiming that Steve had attempted to choke him.  When asked about the claim of choking Steve claimed that the patron had pushed his chair into Steve causing Steve to lose his balance and as he flung his hands out to stop himself from falling his hands must have met the other patrons neck.  JM asked Steve if he required an ambulance or help getting up and he declined both offers.  The patron at computer 25 called Steve an idiot and JM informed him that name calling was inappropriate. The patron at computer 25 said he was not harmed and Steve managed to right himself and sat down at computer 26. JM left both men at their respective computers as the incident seemed to have calmed down.  Afterwards page DC informed JM that Steve had started the argument and that both men stood up and Steve was pushed by the other patron. Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.1 Harassment: Filming or photographing without permission~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
Customer Joel Christian Lopez (aka "Joeys Surreal Camera" on YouTube) came into the branch with a female companion, Tracey Tracy (aka "Girl with a Camera" on YouTube) with their phone cameras out. Believing that they were filming using their phones, LA MG notified Librarians KB and JD. KB and JD found Joey and the woman filming in the teen area. JD spoke to the woman, and KB spoke to the man. KB told Joey that he could film staff all he wanted but that it violated state law to film customers without consent. He told KB she didn't know what she was talking about and that he had been given this statute before but that it "didn't apply to me, it applies to you." He said it was a public building and no one should expect privacy. LIB JD engaged the woman in conversation, as the woman filmed books in the teen section. She told JD that she was at BCN and did not like the displays for children, specifically the Pride-related books. As KB and JD spoke with the two, they continued to walk toward the front entrance. KB asked Joey if they were going to leave because now they were not complying with a direct request and they were in violation of the Customer Code of Conduct. There was more talk about his rights and the fake law. JD then led the two out of the building, where they turned and filmed the hieroglyphics surrounding Wilmot's front entrance while JD gave them a history lesson about Wilmot.
Both returned about 15 minutes after leaving. The woman stayed in the lobby, while Joey came to the desk and asked to get a library card. JD said she would be perfectly happy to help if he put the camera down because there were customers around. He continued to film, scaring a young mother with kids away to hide in audiobook area. He ended up leaving without a card and taking the application with him.
3/13/23. INCIDENT FOLLOW UP: The day after the video was posted on YouTube (so March 7), WIL received at least six phone calls from viewers of the video who agreed with the "auditor" that the library violated his First Amendment rights. Most callers asked for L1 KB by first name or L1 JD by describing her hair. Most calls involved yelling, name calling, and swearing. Another call, on March 10, 2023, from a "Jay Pat O'Bannon, Civil Rights Investigator from Wisconsin," warned KB that we could expect protests and multiple people coming into WIL to film so that we call the police, the protesters get arrested, and the library gets sued (including KB personally).
3/16/23. INCIDENT FOLLOW UP: LTA Supervisor AP answered a phone call from a caller who complained the library is ignorant of the law.

When the dog headed back toward the restroom, the other customer left, and I thought the woman must have retrieved her dog. As staff were leaving and checking restrooms on the way out, we saw the dog in the open doorway of the family restroom, leash still not in the woman's hand. As I was about to talk to her, she quickly grabbed the leash, and headed out the door.

Location: Frank De La Cruz-El Pueblo Library
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.4 Sleeping
Description: Patron at computer 18 was sleeping with is head slump to the side. Managing Librarian MS went to him and knocked on the wall to wake him and said, "sir? sir? Are you ok?" He finally awoke and responded "yeah". MS said back to him, "You really can't sleep in the library, I just wanted to make sure you were ok." The patron could not seem to stay awake after a minute, (suspected to be under the influence of fentanyl) and he was asked to leave for the day.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.4 Sleeping
Description: At 2:15 guard JL called the branch asking for an in charge staff member to meet them outside. L1 JM and LA NG went outside to the far North end of the property, by St. Michael's school, where a man was asleep on the wall. JM asked the man if he was ok and he mumbled a response, seemingly under the influence of something, she then asked if he needed an ambulance and he indicated that he did not so JM let him know that he could not remain asleep on the wall and asked him if he thought he could rouse himself in the next 5 minutes. He waved a hand indicating that he understood so JM told him she would be back in five minutes to see if he was up and if he wasn't she would have to call an ambulance. Guard JL stayed where she could see him and the person did get up and move off property.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: Bed Bugs found in book
Description: Book was found on a cart to be shelved with a bed bug body in it on 03/06/2023. The book was immediately quarantined. The book was identified as having been returned by GB.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description:
At 11:55 am, a customer interrupted LII KM from helping a patron, telling her that she should probably call 911 for a customer who was sitting on a short yellow stool with his head on his hands on the table just inside the entrance. KM approached him and asked if he needed medical help and he refused. She decided to call anyway. When she went back to speak to him after she called, the customer who had alerted her, had begun to help him onto a regular chair.
After he was seated KM turned to go asses the public area and saw the man fall from the chair. The helping customer attempted to help him up but both KM and LA LW, who had just come over to assist, asked him not to move the fallen man. LI KN again called 911 to let them know that now he had fallen.
Northwest Fire medics arrived and began treating the customer. After administering some treatment, they took him to the nearest hospital.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others
Description: At 2:10 guard JL came to the back room to inform staff that there was a patron, Bob, who was upset that his study room was not ready for him at 2:00 on the dot. The people in the room before before him did vacate the room by 2:05 but that was not good enough and Bob cancelled his booking since he could "not get his full time". Librarian JM went out to the front desk and saw Bob in study room 2 talking to the man from Arizona @ work. Because things seemed to have calmed down JM went back to the staff area. At 2:55 guard JL came to the back again and informed Librarian JM that one of the AARP Tax Help volunteers told her that she felt threatened by Bob. JM went to the large meeting room to ask the volunteer what happened and she told JM that Bob had entered the room and said he wanted to join the class in progress. The volunteer told Bob that it was not a class and tried to explain the Tax Help to him but he seemed not to understand and wrote down his name and phone number, gave it to the volunteer and demanded that he be informed about the class via text. She also told JM that she smelled alcohol on Bobs breath. Bob then left the library. Due to his belligerent attitude the volunteer said she did feel threatened. JM asked her to inform the guard if Bob enters the room again. JM then talked to desk staff and the man form Arizona @ Work about Bob's behavior and they all commented that he rambled a lot and did not make much sense. This is for documentation purposes.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
At approximately 2:10pm Librarian DB answered the phone. The caller demanded to speak with the director. DB asked for clarification if the person meant the director of all Pima County Public Libraries or just the manager of the Salazar-Ajo Library. The caller proceeded to ask to speak to the director for the Ajo Library. DB identified herself as the managing librarian for the Ajo library. The caller started by announcing that there were lies being told about her (the caller) in the past and when she lived in Why before she didn't have any problems, but there were two staff members that were spreading lies about her and accusing her of murder and "being crazy". She asked the librarian for a personal meeting to introduce herself to the librarian so that the librarian could see that she was an ordained minister and wanted to show the librarian her degree in ministry. The librarian said that the patron is welcome to visit the library at any time. The patron immediately began to be very hostile and said "So you are refusing to meet with me? I'm going to file a complaint about you with the county!" The caller continued to say that five years ago there were two staff members that were spreading lies about her and that she was under the impression that they made things difficult for her in town. LTA KV was seated near DB during this phone call and was alarmed because she was able to overhear clearly what the patron was screaming at the librarian. When the librarian clarified that customers are able to use the library and are expected to adhere to a code of conduct the caller replied "What about staff? Do they have rules of behavior?" The librarian replied: "Yes absolutely". The caller continued to escalate and started to tell the librarian that she did not need to belittle the caller and that all she wanted was to do word processing. The librarian said that the computers are available to her whenever she was ready to come into the library. The caller kept ranting at the librarian that she didn't need to treat her like a child and that she was going to report her and started cursing at the librarian. The librarian stated that if the caller continued to be abusive, aggressive and threatening, that the librarian would need to end the call. When the caller repeatedly insulted the librarian, the librarian stated that the caller was welcome to call back, when they felt calmer, or could just come use the library when they were ready and ended the phone call.
 
When the librarian conferred with LA CS and described the call, CS identified the caller as MLP and shared that in the past this person had had difficulty interacting with staff in a respectful and neutral manner and would escalate during interactions with library staff after being asked to comply with library policies.
The patron since has returned to using the library and DB was able to identify the voice of the person.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal
Description:
Patron is a Nanini regular, uses the computer with a guest pass almost daily. Most of the time she brings in her dog, which has increasingly had behavior issues here and there. A couple weeks ago he was alone in the teen area, while she was on the computer. On Wednesday, 3/8 our Read to a Dog Therapy Dog Sophie was in the library and the patron's dog repeatedly barked at her. Patron looked at the desk and LA SB nodded that her dog needs to leave for the day. Librarian GT came out from the back room when she heard the barking. While patron was leaving she let her dog sniff our therapy dog, and her dog jumped, wanted to play, and continued to sniff and patron was just standing there. After about 15/20 seconds librarian GT said that the library is not a place to introduce dogs or have them play, and said the dog needs to go outside. Today, 3/10, patron came in with the dog and right after OSL III AB helped another patron in front of the desk, patron asked AB a question. Her dog jumped onto AB (above waist high), and patron lost control of the leash. After she regained it and took the dog off, AB came into the back to tell in charge librarians. Librarians GT and JNB went out to address the issue. GT said to the patron (who was at the computer) "Your dog needs to leave for the day." Patron asked GT "why?" GT said "Your dog cannot jump on a person, ever, in the library." Patron removed her dog from the library.
Patron came back and was on the computer without her dog. Librarian JNB and GT approached her, and JNB asked to touch base with her, then stated that we have noticed multiple behaviors unbecoming of a service dog and then asked if the dog was a service dog. Patron said "no, the dog is an emotional support dog." JNB then said "only service dogs are allowed into libraries so your dog will no longer be allowed to come back with you." Patron said okay and that was the end of the interaction.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.1 Harassment: Filming or photographing without permission    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
At 3:40pm, LTA Supervisor AK informed L1 KB and L1 SO about a first amendment audit in progress with the same individuals as at Bear Canyon, Golf Links, and Wilmot branches. The individuals, JCL and Unknown, in addition to a third individual, were filming patrons in the library again. L1 KB and L1 SO served JCL their suspension letter from Incident #22259 at the front desk and explained the policy again about not filming patrons in the library, which then JCL directed his camera at a patron. JCL refused the suspension letter. They were informed he was trespassed and asked to leave, which he refused to do. L1 KB called 9-911 and said the individual was trespassed. LA TM walked out with 2 of the 3 individuals. The individuals, JCL and Unknown #2, stayed outside in the front walkway and continued filming patrons. L1 KB served the female individual, Unknown, their suspension letter. She refused it as well and denied being with JCL and Unknown #2. She left approximately 5 minutes later and joined JCL and Unknown #2 outside and began filming as well. One officer, Officer R. Olsen, responded in approximately 15-20 minutes after the phone call was placed, and after the individuals were outside filming. Officer Olsen was provided a copy of the A.R.S 41-151.22 law, the images of the individuals, the previous incidents, and suspension letters from Bear Canyon. A second officer arrived about 10 minutes after the first officer. At approximately 4:45pm, the three individuals left after Officer Olsen talked to them about their trespassed statuses and current suspensions.
Officer Olsen had to leave, but came back after closing at approximately 5:30pm. He provided the names and dates of birth for all 3 individuals and explained that he put their names and report into TPD's system, so next time they visit a location their names should register with any officer who responds. Unknown above is Tracey Tracy. Unknown #2 above is Mark Kelly. A third name for Joel Christian Lopez was also identified by Officer Olsen as Jose Lopez Pena (on his Florida I.D.). 
3/15/23. INCIDENT FOLLOW UP: On Monday and Tuesday after Friday’s incident, SLIB received six phone calls from one or more people who expressed that staff violated First Amendment rights. The callers were unpleasant in tone and content [including the word f-ing (they used the word, not the euphemism)]. The only call to display a phone number on the caller ID occurred on Monday: 214-769-8676.3/16/23. INCIDENT FOLLOW UP: On Thursday, SLIB received ten phone calls from more people who expressed that staff violated First Amendment rights. The callers were unpleasant in tone and content. Only one caller, who called multiple times, had a number to display on Thursday: George Perez - (915) 694-3648.3/30/23. INCIDENT FOLLOW UP: On Monday and Thursday, 3/27/23 and 3/30/23, SLIB received internet, social media postings, and phone calls from more people who expressed that staff violated First Amendment rights in unpleasant and harassing tones and language. One new number could be identified on Monday 3/27: (716) 359-8252 - this number called 6 times. 
6/2/23. INCIDENT FOLLOW UP: On Friday, SLIB received a phone call from someone who claimed to have a lawsuit out against us due to having the three individuals trespassed. The caller was unpleasant and threatening in tone and content. This is a new number: (602) 245-2702, with called ID as Phoenix, AZ.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property    1.1.5 Indecent exposure, public indecency, lewd, other sexual offense~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description: Man seen on camera defecating right in front of our west side gate at 9:11pm on 3/12/23, then leaving to the south. Did not recognize the pooper but he will be suspended if he returns.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description:
At approx. 1:25pm page MG reported to LIC VV and LA SD that the women's bathroom smelled bad. SD checked the smell and verified that the scent was consistent with fentanyl use. The bathroom has been closed.
Upon review of security footage, unknown patron enters the bathroom at 1:19 and exits the bathroom at 1:22. Based on timing and strength of smell, we believe that this patron was the user. We will speak with her next time she visits the library.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Erratic behaving male entered the library shouting/talking loudly. He was rambling, agitated and mumbling incomprehensibly. He strode across to the water fountain and then found a computer. He signed in and grew louder and more agitated. LI MMM asked guard LH to request that patron lower his voice. After a few minutes of his continuing tirade, LI MMM asked him to leave for the day. He left agitated and rambling but gave no further problems.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description: Patron came in and got angry at desk staff for not immediately understanding his request for a computer. He was working on a public computer and took umbrage to a staff member helping another patron across from him, believing they were somehow accessing his records. He stood and started cursing at them, throwing a piece of paper in their direction. When guard RP let him know he had to leave, he started cursing at her, and as he was walking out the door, he said, "I'll fucking kill you" to RP and L1 KH who was also present. Due to the threat, he is suspended for one month.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.1 Sexual exploitation of minors    1.1.5 Indecent exposure, public indecency, lewd, other sexual offense    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
At about 4:20 a patron came in to the library saying there was a woman in the garden begging for help. LIC VV went outside to check on the situation and saw that patron Tara was harassing 4 teens as they were trying to leave to the point that one (while off property) decided to record for her and her friends safety. Tara welcomed the attention and continued to harass them. VV told them to walk away and directed Tara's attention to her. Tara then went on a rant as one of the gardens vine holders was pulled out of the planter and placed on the table by an unknown patron and Tara accused VV that this was a safety issue that will result in the murder of kids and how it will be VVs personal fault and will be placed in jail and fined for it. VV explained that looking at the condition of the vine holder was in we were going to throw it away but that was not enough of for Tara and continued to rant about the murder of children and how it is VVs responsibility. Tara then asked for a broom to "clean" the outside of the library and VV told her that we do not have one for her use. She then started to ramble about unknown things and VV tried to leave. Tara Stopped her and told her she wanted to show the magic she preforms on cleaning and disposing of the vine holder and she started to dance around the garden spouting nonsense about god and dancing. VV then tried again to leave but Tara yelled to stop and follow as she works her magic on the property. Tara then walks out the gate and comments about VVs body how dancing would make her look like Tara. Tara then lifts her shirt and exposes herself to VV. VV demands she put down her shirt and she complies. at this time a Headstart teacher walks out and ask VV if she needs assistance. VV attempts to tell the teacher to let someone in the library know she is outside for backup but Tara interrupts her. and this point VV is able to walk towards door where guard VY sees her struggling to pull away and tells Tara that the library is closed and locks her outside the gate. 
Tara did not seem to be in the right mindset and may be on drugs impairing her judgement. Tara will be suspended for 1 year

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1 Any criminal offense    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: 5:45 Customer reported drug use in the women's restroom. ML and Guard MG found unknown person in the restroom with a burning candle and the smell of pill smoking. She left when confronted about her behavior.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing    1.1.10 Remaining inside the library after closing, including emergency closures~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description: A patron left through the wooden doors on the restroom side of the building and lingered in this alcove after the library had closed for the day. He was later seen on the security camera footage running his hand around the perimeter of the water fountain, especially fumbling with the bottom part of the fountain base, as if trying to find something or hide something. He then wet a sock and ran it along the edge of the water fountain basin and wrapped it around the spigot. He was extremely slow to leave this part of the library. As staff were carrying out closing duties, he appeared in the stairwell and proceeded out the front door.

Infractions: Children in the Library    Children in the Library: Other not listed: Minor at the library after hours
Description: A female minor approached L1 VM as staff was locking up the library and let her know she had no where to go. L1 VM called 911. L1 VM, LA NM, LA DW and VetSec guard VM stayed with the minor and waited for an officer to respond to the call. While waiting for officers to arrive, L1 VM received multiple text messages from 911 that said there was a delay in response time due to other emergencies. Around 7:20pm L1 VM told LA DW to go home since she didn't know how much longer they would have to wait. L1 VM, LA NM, VetSec guard VM and the minor went inside the building via the staff entrance to continue to wait for officers to arrive. Around 7:40pm L1 VM received a call from a female officer named Hailey letting us know she was on the way. At 8pm two officers arrived and took the minor with them. L1 VM, LA NM and VetSec guard VM locked up the building and left the library.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: Guard JT and LA AH called LIC CR to say that a patron needed medical attention. AH then called 911. CR spoke to the patron who said that after asking for milk, her face and left arm went numb. AH had helped the patron to sit and patron had promptly forgotten who had helped her. While waiting for the paramedics, patron said she was starting to feel better. She refused being transported to the hospital and felt she had just overdone it.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: One of our pages noticed that they were missing some belongings from their car after they left work on 3/15/23, and upon review of security footage we indeed found a man checking car doors in our parking lot at 9:51am that morning and then getting into the page's car. He gets out about a minute later and then leaves the area. Did not recognize the man but he will be suspended if he returns.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: At 3pm there was loud yelling of profanities in the library that could be heard in the back room. L1s KB and JM went into the library to investigate and found that the person yelling had left the building. JM and KB went outside and followed the sound of yelling to determine who it was. They saw a regular female patron outside on the west side of the building still screaming profanities. Because she had left the building KB and JM opted to not confront her. When JM reentered the building she could still faintly hear profanities so she checked the small meeting room, where the children's snack program was being held, and could hear the yelling very clearly because the patron was directly outside of the meeting room door. JM asked KB to go outside with her to talk to the patron. As KB and JM exited the building through the staff door they saw the woman and her companion walking south off of property. For documentation purposes.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: Bed Bugs
Description: Patron SPC returned 4 books with bed bug damage, one of the books had a living bed bug in the book. All 4 books were deleted and are now quarantined for inspection. Remaining checked out items are reserved on bed bug card. Books were originally checked out from COL.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property
Description: Graffiti was found in the 3rd floor men's restroom, the disabled stall in the 2nd floor men's restroom, and the first floor men's restroom.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.12 Belongings: Leaving unattended, may be removed without notice
Description: LIC DSL got a call about an unattended bag on the 3rd floor by the windows in the computer lab. A man identified it as his. DSL asked him to bring it closer to him. He told her that she should bring it to him. DSL told him she was not going to do that and he needed to retrieve this items. He began to argue, loudly, and said no one else had ever asked him to keep his stuff with him. DSL told him that his things were too far away (they were about 40-50 feet away). He argued with DSL that if he brought his things closer it would be a fire hazard. DSL identified two places his things could go without being in the way. The man asked for the person in charge and DSL told him that she was in charge. He asked to see the policy about unattended items and DSL brought him the Code of Conduct and also let him know that he needed to comply with staff requests regarding behavior. The man brought his things next to him, apologized, and began to work on the computer.

Location: Frank De La Cruz-El Pueblo Library
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.4 Sleeping
Description: At 11:41 am, male patron in red shirt was sleeping at computer at ELP computer 18 with head over the keyboard and dozing off. Officer GH notified him that he needs to stay awake when using the computer and cannot sleep there. At 12:02pm, LA BV noticed patron dozing off again with face over the keyboard at the computer again. LA BV informed him that he cannot sleep at the computer. He complied and said next time he does this he will leave the library. At 12:14 pm, Officer WH saw the patron falling asleep face over the keyboard once again. He informed patron that he cannot do this and that he needs to leave. Patron gathered his belongings including a red backpack, cursing at staff and officers and storming off out of the library.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Melissa was using a computer when she began shouting emotionally at another known patron in the cafe area. Managing Librarian KW came out and talked to Melissa and walked her outside to calm down.  KW told Melissa she needed to leave for the day due to the level of disruption she created. She is known to staff and sometimes needs to take a break from the library and her cohorts to get better control over her emotions.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.7.4 Bullying per Pima County B.O.S.
