Policy D 23.1.    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: Threatening to fight other youth patrons, taking off belt and swinging
Description: Cayden and another boy were on the teen computers next to three of our regular teens.  Mgr KW was informed by desk staff that an altercation might be occurring outside.  When she went out the West doors she found Cayden and his friend taunting and threatening Abraham who had followed them outside after reportedly being bullied and threatened at the computers. Cayden's friend continued to threaten and harass Abraham despite the fact that KW, guard CS and Lib II AG were outside and trying to de-escalate them. After about 5 minutes of him threatening Abraham and disregarding KW's attempts to talk to them, including the friend taking off his belt in a threatening way and trying to reach Abraham, they walked away. As they walked away, KW tried to communicate again and the friend began filming her on his phone and saying he was going to call his mom while KW was still 20 or more feet away from him.  A police car happened to pull up and ask if everything was ok and the two crossed 22nd street at the light.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Concerning Note~Medical 911
Description: Around 11:00 a regular patron comes in to get some pantry items and milk for herself and her camp. After giving her the items she asks for a pen. Around 11:30 when she was leaving the library, she hands LA CR a note and asks to give it to LIC VV or Guard VY. LA CR went to give it to LIC VV and VV read the note that had saw that it was a web of names connected to "my camp". The note implies that this is a list of people that are hurting her due to a head injury with a note at the bottom saying that she thinks of suicide. LA CR called the crisis line and due to a lack of personal information, the crisis line was not able to help. The crisis line suggests calling the next time patron comes in.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.2 Disruptive use of personal devices
Description:
A patron complained that the man on computer #5 was talking loudly. He said that it sounded like the man was talking to a woman and he was being hostile and using bad language like the f-word. 
LIC DSL caught up with the man as he was leaving the lab. She recognized him as the same person she had spoken with the week prior about using a loud voice in the third floor computer lab. Last week, the man had been on a headset and appeared to be watching and talking to a Youtube video. Today it was unclear if he was talking to an actual person or the computer. 
DSL told him she'd gotten a complaint about his language and reminded him that the 3rd floor was the quiet floor. She (assuming he had been talking to a person) said phone calls while on the computer would need to be done on the 1st floor, or he could use the stairwell. He said he understood and that he was leaving the library.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Description:
A regular patron named Steve came up to the 1st floor front desk to voice a concern about Guard J to library staff DD MA and L2 KW. He began a long-winded diatribe against her, stating that she was stealing $1000 a week from him, that she was working with Kid Rock, and also mentioned that she had dealings with pedophilia. He was extremely upset and agitated during the course of his accusations and wanted library staff to report his concerns. Staff said that we would document his concern. He then left the library.
Steve has been a regular patron at the library and his behavior has usually been civil, but he has more recently been observed as staring aggressively at Guard J, and is now accusing of her falsehoods.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: Suspended customer entered the library and was recognized by staff and guard. He was reminded of his suspension and left the building peacefully.

Location: Frank De La Cruz-El Pueblo Library
Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description:
Patron Kirk S Meyer came into the branch wearing his pants well below his waist, below the butt. I felt that wearing them in this way was offensive to me and to our other patrons in the branch.  I was helping a patron at the desk, with a transaction in Spanish that I preferred not to turn over to someone else. I asked out Deputy GH if he would ask the patron to pick up his pants.  The patron was sitting at one of the sofa chairs.  Deputy GH did not say anything other than "library staff is asking if you could please lift up your pants."  Mr. Meyer angrily told Deputy GH that he would no longer be coming to this library, gathered his things and went to the self check unit to check out his own material.  On his way out, he told the Deputy that he was on Social Security, held a college degree, and did not do drugs.
 
For documentation only

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: bed bugs
Description: Circ manager KW immediately noticed that DVDs returned at the counter had bed bugs. He quarantined the items immediately and cleaned the area. LIC CR submitted a facilities request and called KM to schedule potential fumigation. An L2 or LSM will contact the patron about the issue.

Location: Frank De La Cruz-El Pueblo Library
Description:
Sheriff's Deputy GH was doing his rounds around the library when he saw a male patron passed out facedown with his neck on the bench and his body in a U shape (see photo) on the other side of the fence on the Southwest side of the library. Deputy GH turned the patron onto his back and then ran back into the library to grab some NARCAN and also quickly informed library staff. There was foil with burned marks and a straw that could be seen in his front right packet in plain view, which is indicative of fentanyl use from our experience.  Managing Librarian MS went out to assist him. Deputy GH gave him a dose of NARCAN and called for paramedics. He handed the used container to Managing librarian MS to keep track of used and non used ones. The patron's breathing was irregular, slow, and gasping for air with long period of time between breaths. Deputy GH gave the patron another dose of NARCAN about a minute later because patron was not responding to the first dose, and informed Managing Librarian MS that the patron was close to death. Deputy GH instructed Managing Librarian MS to flag down the paramedics and lead them through the gate. In that time, the patron came too, and he was responsive and talking to the fire department who had arrived first. Patron was transported to nearest medical facility
 
Case 230321165

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description: Guard J called LIC BC about a patron who was following Guard E and whom Guard E felt was creepy. By this time, the patron had left and could be seen on the plaza speaking with suspended patron from incident 22229, who was also being creepy towards Guard E. For documentation purposes.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.7.4 Bullying per Pima County B.O.S. Policy D 23.1.~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
Unknown teenage patron came up to the 3rd floor to ask for a guest pass. He was accompanied by regular teenage patrons Cameron and Cayden. He was told he could use the teen guest pass on the 1st or 3rd floors, but if he wanted to be on the 2nd floor 101 Space, he would need to get a library card. The group wandered around the computer lab then headed downstairs. LA TW noticed that he had signed onto a 101 Space computer with the guest pass, and we (L2 KLW) could see Cameron and Cayden also signed on. KLW called LA RW at the 101 Space desk and asked him to issue the teen a library card if he wanted to use that space. The teen became argumentative and stated he didn't want to get a library card.
KLW was informed that he had signed on again with the guest pass, was logged off by staff, and began arguing again with another staff member LTA Sup KW. KLW went to the 101 Space to speak with the teen about his options. He became argumentative and interrupted explanations about computer use in the 101 Space. He was informed that he was now disrespecting multiple staff members and that if he wanted to use the computer he was sitting at, he could get a library card. He refused.
Not five minutes later, KLW received another notification that he had signed on again. LIC BC was called and went to inform the teen that he needed to leave the library for the day. The teen, along with Cameron and Cayden, got up and began exiting the library. On the way out, the teen began yelling abusive things directed at Guard M, LIC BC, and a random patron who was working on an Express computer on the 1st floor. He continued cursing and yelling back at the library while on the plaza.
--
Upon looking into the incident tracker and possible suspensions, Cayden and what appear to be this teen had been suspended from Columbus library Friday, March 17th for one month. Cayden's suspension will remain intact and the other teen's will be extended one month from today, Tuesday, March 21st.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: L1 PC and L1 KN noticed a group of kids shouting in the parking lot. They were circling up with three ready to fight. L1 PC and L1 KN went out to assess the situation. Regular teen patrons Tristan and Chance were recognized trying to fight a third unknown teen. The unknown teen left quickly. L1 PC and L1 KN spoke with Chance and Tristan about what to do if someone is threatening to fight them, but the teens refused to listen and became verbally combative. They were then asked to leave library property for the day.

Location: Frank De La Cruz-El Pueblo Library
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1 Any criminal offense    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: AT 4:18, Patron Monica Conderre walked in and asked LA MD for a computer pass and walked over to computer 18.  She sat down and can be seen swaying in her chair and she never logged into the computer. At 4:35 patron still has not log into the computer and continued to sway and lean to her right side when she falls out of her chair and stays on the floor for about 3 seconds. LA MD goes up to the patron and askes if she was ok, and the patron responded, yes she is ok. After the fall, the patron finally logs on to the computer and then logs out at 4:41. She goes to the front desk and asks if she could use the restroom, and LA MD said yes we just need her ID. She then asked the patron if she was  sure she was ok? Managing Librarian MS came out, and noticed the patron had a full red face, and bruises on both sides of her upper cheek bones under her eyes. Managing Librarian said, Do you need help ma'am, do you want us to call an ambulance? Patron said "no, I'm just homeless, and I was sleeping and someone tried to steal my stuff and beat me up." LA MD opened the restroom for her, and Managing Librarian MS gathered some resources to give her with her ID, in case she needed help. She exits the restroom and MS hand her back her ID and resources and she leave the building. Managing Librarian MS checks the restroom for drug use and there was a chemical smell in the restroom, MS ran out gaging. LA MD also checked the restroom, and proceeded to gag and throw up as well from the drug smell. Patron will be suspended for drug use in the restroom.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: Staff identified a patron on the computers as the patron from 000022284. He initially denied that it was him, but when Security Guard RP and Librarian MK reviewed a security still, they confirmed that it was the same person and gave him his suspension letter, indicating that he could not return to any PCPL library until 4/14. He left quietly with the suspension letter, crumpling it up as he left. Because he had signed into the computer with his library card, we were able to obtain a name to attach to this and the prior incident.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description:
Patron had been crying and sobbing at the public PCs. A few staff members checked on him over the course of an hour but he always settled down. When his crying became loud again, L1 MK went to check on him and he started to ramble loudly to her, sobbing every so often. MK asked if we could call anyone for him and he gave us the name of his caseworker at CODAC. LA BM attempted to call her as MK sat with the patron.
He was re-routed to the Crisis Hotline, who would not speak with the patron without his desire to do, and they recommended to call 911, which BM did shortly before 2. 911 routed back to the Crisis Hotline and they said they would send someone out. LA BM finished speaking with the Crisis Hotline shortly after 2.
All this time, the patron was still rambling and crying, very loudly. He made accusations against various entities and asked for the FBI or a Pima County Sheriff. At times he asked where he was and if what he was experiencing was real. Sometimes he accused L1 MK of wanting to kill him and sometimes paid her lavish compliments. After a period of time in which MK was able to get him to walk outside and then settle in the study room, he asked to sit at the computer and listen to music around 2:30. He had calmed down somewhat so MK helped him get back on the computer and find the music he requested, and he was reasonably calm but still sometimes making faces of distress from that point. 
Adam from the Crisis hotline arrived about 3:00. He was concerned about how much alcohol the patron might have had to drink and called Tucson Fire EMTs, who arrived at 3:10 and checked him over.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.1 Manipulating or bypassing library rules, such as computer use
Description:
Ilan continuously books study rooms and many times is either extremely late or goes into rooms without reserving them. He is argumentative.  Today at 1:00, he went into a room without reserving and LA LW asked him to leave. He then reserved a room for 3:30 to 5:30 but didn't show up, so staff gave his spot to another library user. He then came in at 5:00 and didn't check in at the desk but just went into a study room. LIC KM talked to him about library study room rules and he argued with her about how the rules are stupid and that the library should be quiet anyway and he shouldn't need to get a room.  KM let him know that this was his official warning and if he is not compliant with library rules and staff requests going forward, that he would be suspended. He told her that he'd go to a different library. 
At 5:55 LTA AD went to lock the bathrooms and Ilan was sitting on the bench in the hallway just across from them. He stopped her to ask why it was such a big deal that he reserve a room, when in the past, he never had to. She reminded him that his booking was from 3:30 - 5:30 and when he didn't show up, we gave the room to someone else so essentially he didn't have the room anymore. He told her that as he was in the building at 3:30 we should have come to get him. She told him that these were unrealistic expectations of staff. He argued saying that she saw him so should have come to get him. The library closed and he left.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Librarian 2 DB noticed an odd sound coming from the restroom and went to investigate. Patron Jason Marquez came out of the hallway singing and humming to himself. The patron left and returned to the other side of the building. When DB and CS returned to the service desk LTA KV stated that she was noticing a strange smell. DB and CS went to investigate and a strong chemical smell was coming from the hallway and wafting into the children's area. DB closed the door to the hallway and called 911 to have someone from the sheriff's department come and investigate the odor. When officer Lozano arrived he went straight to the hallway and identified the odor as fentanyl. He asked who had used the area last and we identified the patron. This is the second time the patron had used the restroom just previously to this smell. Officer Lozano removed Jason Marquez from the library and issued a one year suspension.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description:
Regular patrons Michelle and Brendan were attending the Our Space program. Michelle asked if the cake being served had coconut, and L1 CR said she didn't think so, but she wasn't sure. Michelle took a slice of cake. After taking her first bite, she said that it tasted like coconut and had chunks of coconut in it. She went to the restroom and spit it out, then said she felt sick and short of breath. LA NG called the bakery and confirmed with them that there was no coconut in the cake, but Michelle still felt that she was having an allergic reaction. She left the library.
Brendan was upset and confrontational with staff. LIC CS was called and spoke with Brendan. He felt that Our Space staff were responsible for Michelle getting sick. He wanted staff to cancel the Our Space program and permanently stop serving food, as well as wanting to make a formal complaint about CR and get her food license revoked. CS gave him LSM EDL's phone number to make a complaint and talked with him about our food handling policy and where Our Space gets its food, after which he calmed down considerably.
Michelle reentered the library and went up to sit on the third floor. CS checked in with her to see if she was feeling better. She said she still felt sick and short of breath, but refused medical attention and did not want CS to call 911. She was visibly upset and embarrassed and said she just wanted to go home. Michelle and Brendan left the library at around 12:45pm.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.2 Disruptive use of personal devices    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: At approximately 12:50p, a customer came to the desk to complain that customer Steve Montes was talking on the phone so loudly that he was interfering with their ability to use computers.  Lib3 KK asked Mr. Montes to take his call outside or in the cafe area.  He refused repeated requests and continued on his call for approximately 30 more minutes causing more customer complaints.  When Mr. Montes finished his call, KK told him that he had to leave for the day.  He again refused and started another call.  KK explained to him (while he was on his new call) that his suspension would be extended because he was continuing to fail to comply with staff directions.  Mr. Montes demanded a letter which KK said she would give him when he got outside.  He continued to fail to comply and then Mr. Montes called 911 to report library staff making him leave the building.  Library staff also called 911.  Officer Deloria arrived, made Mr. Montes aware that he is suspended from all PCPL locations until 4/6/23 and - after a bit of back and forth - was able to escort Mr. Montes from the building at about 1:50pm.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.3 Food or beverage: unclean, disruptive, or damaging    3.4 Eating at computer    3.5 Failure to clean up after eating/drinking
Description: On 3/24/23 at 10:19 a.m. LIC DSL was informed that two young men who were drinking White Claws and eating at the 3rd floor computers yesterday had returned. DSL and guard JT went and spoke with them. DSL let them know that they could not drink alcohol in the library and they could not eat at the computers, and that it was expected that if they did eat in the library, they would clean up after themselves. She let them know if this happened again they would be asked to leave the library. The two young men said it was not them, and DSL said that both a guard and a staff person had positively identified them. One of the young men apologized and admitted to leaving some food mess. DSL gave them a copy of the Code of Conduct for reference.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description:
When HR went out to be on desk, she recognized that a customer who had been suspended from WIL was working at the computer. She and the security guard handed the customer a copy of his suspension letter and reminded him that he could not visit any libraries while suspended. At first he refused to accept the letter, saying it was unsigned, then he argued that he had only been suspended for one day. HR reiterated his suspension date and told him he needed to leave. He took about ten minutes to finish up on the computer and gather his belongings, and on his way out, asked a different staff person for the name of Himmel's manager.
This customer had been inside Himmel yesterday as well but staff didn't realize he was suspended at that time. While here, he asked staff for the name of the Wilmot manager.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description:
A man named Willie was sitting at a 3rd floor table and had the volume on his tablet turned way up. The beeps as he pressed the numbers on his device carried audibly throughout the floor.
LA TW said to him, "The 3rd floor is the quiet floor if you could please turn down the volume on your device." 
"You made me screw it up," Willie said, angrily. TW said, "I was just informing you that the third floor is the quiet area." 
TW turned around to walk back to the desk and Willie said, "Fuck you." TW went back to the 3rd floor desk and Willie said, "Yeah, you just stay there." He glared at TW. 
LIC DSL was called to talk with Willie. DSL attempted to explain the policy, and Willie said he would move to a different floor. DSL said that actually, he would need to leave, because he had said "Fuck you" to one of her colleagues, and that was not okay. Willie stood up angrily and said, "Did you hear it? Huh? Did you hear me say that?"
At this point Officer Corrales stepped in. He asked Willie to leave the building and walked with him outside to the plaza. Willie, who asked to make a complaint with the officer, talked to Officer Corrales for a while. Officer Corrales let Willie know that he had been asked to leave and the soonest he could return would be Monday.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.8 Smoking, rolling, using tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description:
Person seen setting up camp/sleeping at the front doors of Mission Library. 
This person has been asked to move off of the property and told not to camp in the front landscape multiple times. 
In this instance there are 4 people present. 
Man is seen lighting up something and woman is seen drinking from alcohol bottle.
The person who shows up in a car may be Crisis Help.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Lib1 KB found burned foil, a purse that appeared to have been dumped out, shoes and considerable garbage immediately outside the eastside Large Meeting Room exterior exit.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description: Customer who identified himself as "Jeffrey" was muttering, singing, crying and clearly drunk in the computer lab.  L1 KB approached him and he asked her to call a "detective" because his daughters had been molested.  KB offered to call 911 but he was adamantly against it.  L3 KK joined them and, based on the conversation, it was decided to call the Community Crisis Line at 4:52pm.  Customer became louder and more belligerent and was drinking alcohol.  KK approached him again asking him to quiet down and telling him the Crisis Team was on the way.  Jeffrey said that he wanted 911 instead.  KK called 9-911 at 5:19pm and was told that they would request an officer and the Crisis Team.  Customer's behavior further escalated.  He was loudly shouting "Fuck you!" multiple times.  KK and guard E approached and asked if he would move to the front lobby of the building.  Customer became further enraged and shouted, "You're evil bitches" and "I'm going to get you."  KK called 9-911 again at 5:29pm and explained that the customer was becoming increasingly threatening, she was concerned he would become violent and that there were children in the building.  911 operator could hear the shouting in the background and said that the call had now been marked a "priority."  Customer then stood up waving his hands over his head loudly shouting the racial "N" word in the presence of black customers and staff including children.  The customers in the study room wanted to confront the man.  KK stopped them and assured them that police were on their way.  The man then starting stomping towards customers and screaming "just shoot me" while holding his fingers up to his head.  KK decided to evacuate the building at 5:37pm and asked LTASup AP to call 911 to update them on the customer's behavior and the evacuation being in progress.  During the evacuation, another customer was calling 911.  KK brought the 2 unattended minors into the workspace for their safety.  The Crisis Team member arrived at 5:40pm and decided that it would not be safe for her to engage with Jeffrey without police assistance.  She called EMTs as well.  The man curled up on the floor after consuming another large container of alcohol.  Police arrived at 5:47p.  Staff went into the backroom.  Police removed him from the building at 5:51pm.  Police discovered that the customer had been released from a Saint Joseph's Hospital mental health program at about 2:30pm.  He was transported back to St. Joe's.  Police trespassed him from all PCPL locations for 1 year.

Regular on the plaza D was out in front of the library in a wheelchair. His pants were open and he was nonresponse when guard M tried to wake him. LIC CR called 911 and while waiting for paramedics, D roused enough to say he was in pain and needed to be moved to the shade.  He kept falling asleep while speaking to CR and M. Paramedics came and assessed. D refused transport. He told guard JT that he was experiencing sun poisoning. We asked him to come inside and gave him a bottle of water and a snack.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.5 Indecent exposure, public indecency, lewd, other sexual offense    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description: A female patron came to LA BD on 3rd floor and said that the person next to her at the computer lab had solicited sex from her. She asked that she not be involved and she was leaving. LIC CR spoke to the patron who is a regular. He denied that he had spoken to anyone that day. She asked him to leave for the day and told him he was welcome back tomorrow.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description:
Restroom closed at 12 pm due to suspected drug use leaving a strong chemical smell.
 
Staff IR and Vet Sec Officer VM confirmed a strong burnt chemical smell consistent with the use of chemical drugs. The last person in the restroom was identified as Elsa Patricia Madonia. Patron updated her library card information before requesting access to restroom which is kept locked.  When staff initially unlocked the door for the user, there was no smell of chemicals or other signs of recent drug use. After the user exited the restroom, Staff noticed burnt chemical smell coming from the restroom.  
Elsa left before staff could issue a suspension or explain code of conduct.
There was a TPD Officer on site that confirmed the chemical smell.

Location: Frank De La Cruz-El Pueblo Library
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1 Any criminal offense    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: At 2:28 pm Deputy GH and Deputy WH were at their post at the front door when a young woman walked up to the window closest to the book drop. She did not have a shirt on  and was just in her bra, jacket, pants, and footwear. As she stood,  She proceeded to take a sandwich bag out with two fentanyl blues pills, and have foil and lighter in hand. Deputy GH immediately got up and asked the young woman if she was ok, then asked her to hand over her drugs. The woman was in a drugged state and said ok and handed over the sandwich bag containing  the 2 pills. The women asked Deputy GH if she could keep her lighter and the deputy replied yes. She was asked to come inside so that we could explained to her that she would  be suspended from all PCPL libraries for a year due to drug use.  The woman stated in her drugged state,  that she had never been to a library before. She will be suspended for a year.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.1 Harassment: Filming or photographing without permission    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
A white female patron sitting at PC1 came to the desk shortly after an African American male patron came into the branch and went to the snack table. She told staff that she felt uncomfortable because the other patron was in the branch. L1 MNC came out to speak with the patron. She first began making claims about the other patron following her, but then devolved into saying that she was prejudiced and uncomfortable around "those people". MNC attempted to speak with her further about her comments but she stated that she was leaving and went to go retrieve her belongings. She then grabbed her phone and proceeded to go to other side of library and follow the other patron to photograph him. L1 MNC attempted to stop her from doing so, and told her that filming other patrons was not allowed. She said that she needed to do it for her safety. MNC repeated that this was not appropriate or allowed and asked her to leave the library for the day, which she did. The other patron did not interact with her at all during his library visit and was very understanding despite the circumstances.
Afterwards, staff mentioned that she had also made negative comments about "immigrants" while they were helping her fax prior to the incident.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal
Description: At 11:50 very loud barking could be heard out on the library floor. L2 AG responded, and saw a patron (Patti) trying to shush and pull a dog by its leash away to a different part of the library. The dog was very clearly reacting aggressively to the presence of another dog in the building. The other dog was non-reactive and was being led out of the library by another patron. AG followed Patti to a study room where she was set up and explained that the dog would need to leave for the day, due to the aggressive reactive behavior it displayed in the library. AG let the patron know that if there were services that library staff could provide in lieu of the dog, that we would be happy to do so. Patti left with the dog shortly after.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: At approximately 11:58 pm, Patron #1 got up from his computer, PC #12, and went to the printer, next to the service desk. At that time, Patron #2 approached computer #12. Seeing that it was already logged on, Patron #2 sat down at computer #12 and started to go through his backpack, and gets settled in. At about 12:00, Patron #1 returned to computer #12, and began to talk to Patron #2. They speak for about 2 minutes. Video shows that there was no altercation, and civil conversation between the two patrons, and that Patron #2 begins to gather his belongings. At 12:02 Patron #1 approached staff, LA CC and OSL JP at the service desk to tell them that someone else sat down at the computer that he was at, and that Patron #2 put Patron #1's flash drives in his backpack. At 12:03, OSL JP directs Patron #1 to LIC CM, who is at the job help table. Patron #1 tells LIC CM about Patron #2 and his missing flash drives. At this time, Patron #2 leaves the library, unbeknownst to LIC CM, walking right by her at the job help table (seen on video). LIC CM asks Patron #1 if Patron #2 is still in the library. Patron #1's response was, "I think he already left." Then Patron #1 leaves the library.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property~Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: graffiti
Description: Graffiti was found on the outer west side of the dumpster enclosure.

Location: Frank De La Cruz-El Pueblo Library
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1 Any criminal offense    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description:
Managing Librarian MS was cleaning the furniture when she heard a man speaking loudly outside towards the northwest side of the library. Managing Librarian MS and LA MD went out to investigate because the library's alcoves are notorious for fire/drug use/public urination/defecation ...etc. Upon turning the corner, Managing Librarian MS saw a male and female patron in the furthest alcove. The female patron saw MS and tapped the male patron on his shoulder. The Male patron did not look at MS but started walking and went through the gate with the female patron. Upon further investigation of the footage, the male patron is seen walking towards the furthest alcove on the northwest side with foil in his hand and burnt marks. It is not known if drugs were used or about to be used before Managing Librarian MS came. 
For Documentation purposes.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.4 Sleeping    2.12 Belongings: Leaving unattended, may be removed without notice    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Camping~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description:
Woman was again sleeping in front of the library.
VL LIII provided her with the Code of Conduct to her and warned that they will be suspended for a year if it occurs again. 
This person has been sleeping on the grounds and asked to move multiple times by L1 MC and VL when coming in to open. There have been others as well that sleep in front of the entrance to the library across from the book drop.
The person has explained it is the only safe place they can stay. 
We have let them know about the Crisis Response Team multiple times, they refuse help. 
We have let them know they can't camp on library property and they argue they are not camping, so we let them know they cannot sleep on library property.
They stay out of camera view in the front of the building. 
They often leave their blankets, jackets and other belongings behind in the sleeping spot or tuck away items in a bush on library property for later retrieval. 
Sheriff went out to place items in the dumpster, the person had already removed the items.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: Around 12:42 pm a disruptive and loud yelling was heard out on the library floor. L1 SG and Guard CS responded and found a patron screaming and calling names to another patron sitting in the cafe area with his dog. Guard CS engaged in a conversation with the patron who was yelling, asking him what happened. The patron kept screaming that the other patron stole his vipe in a very disruptive and loud manner. Guard CS offered to call the police, but it was declined by the patron stating that he wasn't a pussy. Guard CS and L1 SG asked patrons sitting in the cafe area if anyone saw something but, everyone declared that they didn't see anything. The patron kept yelling at the other patron, threatening him with hurting him if he didn't return the vipe, which led to the other patron's dog reacting, barking at the angry patron. But the owner held the dog by its leash. After reasoning with the patron, things seemed to be de-escalated and the patron lowered his voice. Guard CS was walking away from the cafe area when the patron threw what seemed to be trash and papers at the other patron sitting with his dog. The patron remained seated and not reacting to the other patron's aggressions, but his dog started barking again in reaction. L1 SG, intervened, stating that aggressive behavior and actions were not allowed on library grounds, and he needed to leave for the day. No further actions were taken.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: A customer reported her cell phone stolen from the landing between the 2nd and 3rd floors. She checked with the 1st floor desk but no one had turned it in. The customer wanted staff to review the camera footage to see who had taken her phone. LIC DSL explained that she would need to make a police report and the police would need to request access to the camera footage. The customer was upset that staff could not access the camera footage without a police report. She decided to go down to the nearest police station to make a report (staff and the special duty officer suggested she make the report online or by phone). After she left, DSL found the phone between the 1st and 2nd floor landings and put it in lost and found. DSL attempted to call the customer on her other phone but she did not pick up. DSL will try to call her again on Monday.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.12 Belongings: Leaving unattended, may be removed without notice    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Camping on library property
Description:
When staff arrived in the morning at the back gate, they heard a man yelling from inside a makeshift trash fort behind the dumpster. L1 MNC and L1 JC went to investigate when they arrived at 9 am. They found evidence of camping but there was no one present to claim the items. Staff disposed of the smaller trash piles and will put in a facilities request to remove the mattress. There are no cameras near the dumpster.
Follow-up: Staff later saw the two individuals from previous incidents going back to search for/retrieve items from behind the dumpster before returning to the park ramada.
10/26/23 Edited to attach 2nd individual to incident

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Description: At about 1:30pm suspended patron Tara (see incident 0000022286) entered the library for the first time since her suspension. LA SD took her aside and provided her with the suspension letter, which she refused. SD explained the terms and end date of her suspension to her, and Tara apologized for her behavior on the day of the incident and left the library without incident. Because she was not disruptive nor violated the Code of Conduct, her suspension will not be extended.

Location: Frank De La Cruz-El Pueblo Library
Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description:
Patron Daniel Lopez Jr. came into the library at 3:05pm. He was very jittery and dancing and said "I am providing my library card to use the restroom". Managing librarian MS scanned his library card, and went to do open the door for him. He followed Managing Librarian MS with weird movements like walking like a chicken and then entered the restroom. He was in the restroom for 5 minutes when he exited. On his way out the dorr he was cursing. When Managing librarian MS checked the restroom, there was a smell of cat urine and a piece of thick plastic (not a bag) in the toilet. Due to the smell and what was in the toilet, MS closed the restroom for the rest of the day. 
 
for documentation purposes.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description:
A patron reported to OSL3 M that there was someone smoking drugs in the women's restroom. M reported it to L2 AG, who went to confirm. Strong smell consistent with illegal drug use was present in and even outside the restroom. There was one patron in the 3rd stall. AG stated, "You cannot smoke in the library. You can't use drugs here." Patron came out of the stall holding a small black fabric bag (not a purse) and said that she was only using the restroom and not doing drugs. AG stated that another patron had reported that she was smoking drugs and that she would need to leave for the day. The restroom was locked for some air-out time in accordance with protocol.
Because the patron denied that she was using drugs and she was not actively smoking when AG entered, a suspension was not issued.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: There were three reported drug instances in the public restrooms.  2 in the men's room and one in the women's room.  The restrooms were aired out and re-opened after they cleared.  No obvious indications for who was responsible.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: urinating on furnishings and carpet    3.6 Using furniture improperly
Description: Mgr KW was alerted by regular patron that a man in the café was being annoying.  While addressing the issue with the patron she noted that his pants looked wet.  When the patron stood up to leave, she noticed that the chair was drenched and the carpet in front was wet.  Patron willingly left for the day without being asked.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
While LA LW was at the front desk, Jim Blackman approached him and asked “where is my lunch?” Since he didn’t understand his initial question, LW responded by asking if we (the staff) had put it in our staff refrigerator. Blackman replied that we had not and that he had left it near computer #4 and that it was no longer there.
LW checked the Lost & Found but it had not been turned in. He then walked over to computer #4 with Jim Blackman to look over to the area and see if they could find it. It was during this time that Jim Blackman asked two patrons who were using computers #3 and #4 if they had taken his lunch. They indicated they had not and had only been there for less than an hour.
It was at this point that Jim Blackman told the two patrons that they had been there for over an hour and that he had watched them while he was on his cell phone in the bathroom hallway. It should be noted that at time, Jim Blackman’s voice was loud and his tone was aggressive. He reached between the two patrons and grabbed some papers and a screwdriver – which apparently were his – and remarked that his lunch was “right here by my other stuff!”
LW informed Jim Blackman that he would look around to see if his lunch was anywhere else but he walked away and kept repeating that someone had stolen his lunch. LW turned to the two patrons that Jim Blackman had addressed and apologized for the interruption. As he was walking towards the front entrance door, Jim Blackman turned to LW and said that if he was going to apologize to them, that he should be apologizing him and not to the other patrons. LW informed him that he would not be doing that, at which point he replied quietly “you can kiss my ass” and then quickly walked out the door.
LW asked him “what did you say?” but he did not respond and kept walking out the door. Upon inspecting the footage from the security camera, Blackman did not bring in any type of food material or bag when he arrived.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: Maddox has been warned about this behavior before and Restorative Practice attempts have been made and he was warned that continued behavior would require longer suspension. Maddox interrupted staff while they were trying to deal with behavior issues with other teens. This kept staff from being able to deal with the disrupting behavior so that they could instead deal with Maddox.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.12 Belongings: Leaving unattended, may be removed without notice    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Camping on library property~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description: When staff arrived at 8am, there was another mattress dragged into the landscape in front of the library. Staff found evidence of camping including blankets, clothing, and beer bottles. Prior to our morning walkaround at 9am, the blankets and clothing were removed to the park by the individuals previously seen camping here over the last few weeks. The individuals in the park included the woman from incidents 0000022337 and 0000022338 who was seen on camera walking in and out of that area at different times during the night.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.10 Creating tripping hazards, blocking aisles, exits, entrances    2.11 Belongings: Bringing in or storing    2.12 Belongings: Leaving unattended, may be removed without notice    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.1 Manipulating or bypassing library rules, such as computer use    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description:
Page RH was opening the gates for the day and overheard Meeting Room User TB telling a parent there was no storytime.  Page RH said there would be a storytime.  TB said there wouldn't be a storytime, because they had the room booked.  Page RH said she would go get her manager.  Page RH told LA WB about the exchange, which is when Page WB went to talk to L3 AD.
L1 VG was in the meeting room after having set up storytime.  Frantic knocking on the door brought their attention to meeting room user TB.  L1 VG was told by TB the meeting had been booked by them from "way before" so there will be no storytime, because the room was TB's and they had even left their stuff.  TB made commentary about L1 VG taking down their tables and chairs, as they had left their set from the day before.  L1 VG tried to explain storytime was a weekly occurrence and a core program, and that they should together speak to L3 AD about the booking.  TB said okay, then walked past L1 VG and began dismantling the storytime setup.  L1 VG went to L3 AD and found LA WB.  
Page RH waited for L3 AD, LA WB, and L1 VG to return for confirmation, while TB restated position that they had the room booked, while taking down the storytime set up.  After L3 AD confirmed booking, Page RH assisted in setting up their tables again.
L3 AD allowed booking to continue as the patron was promised the use of the room, but required if group wants to use room again, they will be better informed of proper use of the meeting room at the public library.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: Librarian GT saw Jared enter the family restroom. I approached him after he exited and told him he is still suspended from all PCPL branches until August which means he can't use library bathrooms either. He took a copy of his suspension paperwork and said he understood and apologized. Suspension will not be extended at this time.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms    2.4 Sleeping
Description:
A patron entered the library at 10:00 and was very excited, shouting things like, "All right! The library's open! Let's motherfucking go, motherfuckers!" Guard J and LIC CS let him know that he could not use language like that in the library. He agreed and went up to the computer lab, where he tried to have a conversation with PS DR and called him "motherfucker" repeatedly.
Shortly thereafter, Guard J found the patron sleeping at the computers. She woke him up and let him know he needed to stay awake at the library. He agreed again and continued browsing.
At 11:20, LA TW called CS to let her know that the patron was singing loudly. CS and Guard M went to talk to the patron. As they approached, he put an large bottle of alcohol back in his backpack without the lid on and was clearly intoxicated. CS asked him to head out for the day. He eventually got up and headed down the stairs, but stopped in the 1st floor bathroom. When CS and the guards knocked to check on him, he had lain down on the floor to sleep, spilling alcohol all over the restroom floor. CS and the guards eventually got him to stand up and leave the library. Throughout this process he was very slow and had trouble understanding what he was being asked to do.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1 Any criminal offense    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: The security guard noticed the family bathroom smelled like fentanyl. We could not determine who was respondsible. We locked that room. We have other bathrooms available.  Just documenting it.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: 1st floor men's restroom was closed for a smell consistent with drug use.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description:
During a routine walk-around Library staff WZ noticed a strong pervasive chemical smell consistent with the aura caused by smoking meth surrounding a gray van with a black hardtop cargo carrier attached to the top. Manager IR walked through with WZ a second time and noticed that the windows on the vehicle were covered, except the front windows. IR noticed through the front passenger window that there was a human sitting in the driver's seat of the van, and even at the second walk-through the smell continued to emanate from the gray van. IR requested support from the TPD special duty officer scheduled on-site to ask the person in the van to remove the vehicle from the premises. TPD officer, suggested library staff stand back while he spoke to the driver, as he was not able to tell whether the person in the vehicle might be armed due to the low visibility through the vehicle windows.
The driver of the silver van left the premises per TPD special duty officer's request and did not return.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description: About 12:45 a customer approached Library Assistant MG at the desk. She asked him if he needed help. He stared at her without answering then asked her to take off her mask. She said she would not because she was pregnant. He started moving closer to the desk and said she would be great. He spoke to the "baby" and repeated she would be great. Asked MG if she was native, then said he was going to the restroom and then back to his book.  Before 1pm, Librarian JM was called to the desk where the customer and another man wearing a striped shirt were pushing each other in front of the desk in front of MG. They went out to the porch and the pushing stopped. A few minutes later Jehovah Witness ladies were approached and accused of being racist. The customer shouted the "N" word at them several times. The ladies came into the library because they were afraid of the customer. He moved over to the Spanish speaking Jehovah Witness couple and started conversing with them in a loud and aggressive manner.  Librarian, JD was called to the porch because he was continuing to use the "N" word and using profane language toward the Spanish speaking Jehovah Witness couple. A customer known as Milly was talking quietly to the customer inviting him to join her for coffee. He told JD that she was his mother. He swore at JD and accused her of being racist and started moving aggressively toward her after she encouraged him to go and get coffee. JD asked Library Associate RG to call 911 at 1:23pm. The man in the striped shirt he was pushing earlier came over and the two of them started pushing each other in front of the door. The door was closed by the guard so they could not enter. (A few customers exited through the staff door with staff escort.) Milly and the customer walked away from the property toward the hospital. The other man stayed on the bench in front of the library. He told JD that he was going with the customer to the hospital to get detoxed before stopping at the library.  Door was opened back up to the public after 5 minutes. RG reported to 911 that the customer had left the property. The police arrived at 1:40 after they were observed driving around the businesses that Milly and customer were seen walking toward. Police got details from the man in the striped shirt and another customer who said he was yelling and using the "N" word as she exited the restaurant across from the library earlier. Police left on foot to search inside the businesses across from the library. The police were asked to let the customer know that he was not allowed in the library for the rest of the day.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: Weaponizing furniture~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description: While on desk Mgr KW noticed disruptive noises coming from the cafe. When she looked over she saw a patron wielding a coffee table over his head in a threatening manner. She went to the cafe to find regulars Shawn and Devin interacting with the patron in a confrontational manner. The patron with the table accused Shawn of threatening him with his cane. Devin was yelling at the patron and escalating her language and demeaner.  KW separated the two factions and the patron put the table down but continued to react verbally to Devin's taunts and rants.  KW was able to get Shawn and Devin to leave for the day and the other patron returned to his seat and calmed down.  There was no guard on duty and only KW and a PT LTA on the floor so KW did not feel comfortable confronting the volatile patron alone.  He will be suspended when he returns to the branch and KW has more back up to assist with delivery of suspension papers.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description:
While walking outside to bring down the flags at the end of the day, Manager IR smelled a strong lingering smell of burnt chemicals and burnt plastic consistent with smoked chemical drugs. On the way back inside after retrieving the flags, IR conducted a restroom check and found that the smell was coming from the women's restroom.
A review of the security footage indicated that the last restroom check by Vet-Sec guard VM took place at 3:42 and since that time five different people had gone in and out of the women's restroom.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Security Guard MG saw a patron presenting female enter the building with a cart and torch lighter in hand so he asked the patron to leave her cart outside and that she can't have a torch in the building, in response, she shouted profanity and started calling MG names and that she would call TPD on him while pointing an umbrella at him. MG then asked her to leave and went to get In Charge person LF and gave a briefing of the interaction expressing his concern about her wanting to use the restroom while being in possession of a torch. The patron then came back inside with a backpack and pushed her way through MG saying she "needed to grab toilet paper from the restroom" even though he had already asked her to leave for the day because of possession of a having device that could harm someone or be used for possible drug paraphernalia in the Library. Librarian CM stood by to support LF. LF followed the woman into the restroom asking the woman to stop and said that she had already been asked to leave, the woman ignored, grabbed toilet paper, and left saying that she would call the cops. MG went outside to ensure the patron was leaving the property.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.10 Creating tripping hazards, blocking aisles, exits, entrances    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: I was called down to 1st floor to speak with a customer who was complaining about our sign saying that the public can not sit under the awning. After a conversation that lasted over 30 mins, I explained many times to Anthony that we were allowed to treat the awning as a walkway and ask people to not sit there. He was extremely argumentative and would not back down or agree to disagree, instead ramping up complaints and trying to use legalize.. I eventually told him that I said all that could be said and needed the conversation to end, but that he was going to be asked not to sit there and to move to the benches in the plaza. I got another call at 11:30 that Anthony was arguing with librarian MB on 1st about laws. He and i spoke again this time for about 15 mins. He wanted me to reprimand MB who did nothing wrong in calling me and I said such to him. I gave him a copy of the code of conduct and said if we had to speak again, he would be asked to leave. He wanted to complain to my supervisor about me and I gave him the various ways that he would be able to submit a complaint over email, in writing or over the phone to my supervisor.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description:
At approx. 1:45pm, patron V approached the service desk and told LA SD that their partner had found what he identified as fentanyl pills in the women's restroom. They gave SD four small pale blue pills, pictured below, and expressed concern over the possibility that a child could have found them. Restroom has been temporarily closed after SD did a walk-around. They found no additional pills and there was no chemical scent consistent with smoking fentanyl. We do not know who took or left these pills. 
After online investigation, it seems that the pills are oxycodone.

Infractions: Children in the Library    Children in the Library: Other not listed: Violation of BOS D32.12    4.2 Leaving child unsupervised or ignoring disruptive behavior of child
Description: At 6:15pm, L3 KK found that 14 year Alex Gonzalez had not been picked up.  He said that he had texted his mother, Ana Gonzalez and she was not responding to his texts.  Alex said that he wasn't sure if his mom was going to pick him up.  KK called Ms. Gonzalez from a cell phone and the branch phone and left a voicemail.  OSL3 JB also called Alex's sister's number.  The sister said that their mother was not responding to her calls and that we should "go ahead and call the police."  KK called 911 who called the mother.  The mother answered and then called staff's cell phone.  The mother said that Alex was almost 15, knew how to take the bus and was just "being defiant."   She told Alex to walk to Park Place and to take the bus from there.  Alex refused.  The mother told KK to just leave him at the library.  KK told her that library staff is not allowed to leave children unattended on property after closing and, as the parent, she was responsible for picking him up.   Ms. Gonzalez decided to have him walk across the street to a restaurant where she said she would pick him up after she ran her errands.  When KK called 911 back to cancel the call, they had already cancelled the call since they had spoken with the mother.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1 Any criminal offense    1.1.4 Vandalizing property
Description: When opening the gates this morning, Librarian MB noticed graffiti on three locations on the walls and front of the building.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description:
At 11:45AM OSL III JS got a call from a patron concerned about someone passed out in front of our sign at the entrance to Golf Links RD. OSL III JS informed LTA Supervisor SG of the phone call and both of them walked out to go check on the person passed out. They noticed the patron had a bottle of alcohol in his pocket and assumed he was severely intoxicated. JS asked if he was okay. They did not respond to attempts to awake him. Both JS and SG walked back to the building. JS went to inform the police and SG went to get Librarian I ID and inform her of the situation. ID wanted to see if she could get the man to respond before calling 911. Both ID and SG went out to check on them again. ID asked if he was okay and he nodded and responded to attempts to communicate with him. It was clear he was still heavily intoxicated. ID and SG went back into the building and ID called 911 around 11:55AM. The call disconnected and they called back again and spoke with Librarian III AD.
An Officer showed up around 12:55PM to let us know that they did a search of the perimeter and couldn't find him.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: The son of a staff member was asleep in the fourth floor lobby area between 1:45 and 2:30. At some point, his bag was stolen.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description: Regular patron who has lots of belongings and often speaks in both English and Spanish gibberish was very agitated and her volume was increasing with staff and security. Security eventually asked her to leave for the day.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property~Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: graffiti
Description: When doing the outside perimeter check, staff member RL and VetSec guard VM noticed graffiti on sidewalk on library grounds. Located on south side of building (between Bus Stop & South Garden Wall). Facilities Service Request was submitted. Online Police Report was also submitted.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description: Regular patron was singing at the computer on the 3rd floor, the quiet floor, and did not stop despite being asked to. She was not wearing shoes. LIC DSL was called. DSL reminded her that this was the quiet floor and asked her to use a computer on the 1st floor. "You think I'm psychotic, don't you?" The woman said. DSL repeated that she would need to go down to the 1st floor and use a computer there. DSL also asked her to put on her shoes. She complied with both requests and went to the first floor.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating
Description: Around 1:30pm, the Casa Baloo vending machine technician was refilling the vending machine on the 1st floor. He had his cart of supplies against the opposite wall in the hallway. While he was working, a library patron stuck his hand in the cart to steal a soda. The technician told him to get away from the cart, and the patron reacted violently with shouting and posturing, then punched the technician's face. They made their way towards the door, still arguing. LIC MB came over and told the attacker he needed to leave immediately. The technician was not injured and said he did not want to call 911. He was given the in charge phone number & the option to have library guards stand with him while he works in the future.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: A customer handed in a library card that they had found by one of the computers. When LA BM scanned the card, he discovered it belonged to suspended customer Todd H. Ferguson. BM determined that the image of Mr. Ferguson in PITS matched a customer who had been using the computer where the library card was found. BM informed L1 KH of the presence of the suspended customer. KH confirmed that the image matched the customer in the building. KH and L1 MK approached Mr. Ferguson, and KH explained about the lost library card. Mr. Ferguson confirmed his name, and identification for the return of his library card also confirmed he was the suspended customer. KH informed him that he was still under suspension and that his suspension from Woods applied to all PCPL libraries. KH provided Mr. Ferguson with a copy of his suspension letter. Since Mr. Ferguson seemed unaware that he was suspended from all libraries and left the building promptly without incident, his suspension is not being extended at this time.

Location: Frank De La Cruz-El Pueblo Library
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: At approximately 3:53pm, patron, Martin Alvarez came up to the desk and asked LA MD if he could use the restroom. LA MD asked for an ID or Library card as per our procedures. Martin Alvarez said that he did not have either and just wanted to use the restroom. He then turned and walked away from the desk, gathered his belongings, and left the library headed north around the library. He returned to the library in less than 5 minutes. LA MD reviewed our security footage showing that Martin Alvarez set his back pack down on the wall  of the building in front of the library. Martin can be seen taking out foil and doing drugs in front of the library.  LA MD asked Deputy Sheriff CE to back her up, and then asked to speak with the patron outside. LA MD spoke with the patron saying "we have security cameras all around the building and unfortunately you choose a spot directly in front of a camera, I'm going to have to suspend you for a year." He responded by saying "I know, I'm sorry I messed up, it was my mistake." Patron will be suspended for a year.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: At 12:20, a patron told Officer Corrales that someone was smoking blues in the 1st floor men's bathroom. Officer Corrales entered the restroom with Guard M and found a young man smoking pills. He arrested the smoking patron and escorted him out of the building. Patron was verbally informed by LIC CS and Guard J that he was suspended from all libraries for 1 year. Restroom was closed due to strong drug smell.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: 1st floor women's restroom is closed for the remainder of the day due to drug use.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal
Description:
A patron and his dog were in the men's restroom on the 3rd floor. At 5:40, regular patron Phil and his service dog Blue entered the restroom, and the two dogs immediately began barking. The two patrons also began shouting at each other. Phil left the restroom and went downstairs, where he told Guard J that the other patron had threatened to stab him.
At 5:45, the second patron came down the elevator. When he saw Phil in the lobby, he started shouting at him again, which agitated his dog and caused it to start barking. Phil went to a different area of the 1st floor while Guard J told the second patron to stop shouting. The second patron left the building and sat out on the plaza, staring at the entrance. Guard J escorted Phil and his dog out through the back staff door to avoid further fighting.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description:
At around 2:19 pm on 4/14/23, an unknown male patron approached LA DW at the main service desk to ask her why the bathrooms were locked and if she would open the men's public restroom. LA DW explained that the bathrooms were kept locked because there have been incidents of drug use in the bathrooms, which is a prohibited use of the public facilities. LA DW walked the patron over to the men's restroom and unlocked it for him. The patron entered the bathroom at 2:21 pm.
At 2:24 pm, when the patron exited the bathroom, special-duty officer JR noted that there was a new strong, chemical smell associated with drug use present in the bathroom. Special-duty officer JR called over VetSec guard VM, who confirmed the smell. Since the bathroom had been locked and free of the chemical smell before this patron entered, it became clear that this person was responsible for the evident drug use.
The individual left the building before a conversation or suspension letter could be shared. Patron will be suspended for 1 year (until 4/14/2024), and the suspension letter will be made available to them the next time they visit the branch, should they do so. The men's public restroom will remain locked for the remainder of the day.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
