Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description:
Library page AD notified in-charge LA DW that there was a person exhibiting suspicious behavior in the parking lot. As LA DW walked out to look, TPD officer JR indicated that he would handle it and walked over to the area.
TPD Officer JR reported that a woman exhibiting suspicious behavior by the enclosure on the north side of the library property. This area has been previously reported for repeated drug use activity and finding drug paraphernalia. The woman was crouched next to the wall and had several bags with her, along with a lighter that she had taken out. JR requested her to leave library property.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description: At 10:15 LIC JB was on the phone with LIII KW when LTA VN informed them that all three patrons from the week before were in the library.  JB went on the floor and put the other two patrons in a study room, then called Deputy Director MS for guidance because there was no guard present.  MS said to call 911 and get police backup to give the patron suspension paperwork.  JB called the police at 10:25 and went out on the floor.  KW and Deputy Director  MA arrived to help with the situation.  They went outside to wait for the police.  At 11:40 it was noted that the patron had left since 11:30.  KW and MA waited until 12:30 but the patron did not return, so the 911 call was canceled.  Guard JQ arrived at 11:30.  Patron returned at 2:40 and JB went to the cafe to get visual confirmation.  Patron asked "What the fuck are you looking at?  You look like a fucking retard."  JB stated she was there to see what magazines were missing.  Patron lunged two inches out of his seat and JB flinched.  Patron smirked and sat back down.  JB called 911 to request backup again.  Guard JQ stayed in visual contact with both JB and the patron. The other patrons from the week before showed up at 3:30 and JB called 911 again to inform them that the situation was more volatile now.  At 4:30 JB called 911 a third time to ask for assistance in closing the building, as a closing announcement may provoke the patron.  Dispatch said that they would get the police to the scene as soon as possible.  Patron left of his own accord at 4:45.  JB canceled the 911 call at 5:05.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description:
Just after she went on desk, Anthony Potter came up to L1 PC to tell her that he had an email account that got hacked probably from a library employee. She told him that as soon as customers log off the computer, all their information is erased. He then asked her about the cameras and possibly an employee, even though they have a background check, could hack into his account. She told him that our cameras can't pick up that much detail. He got more agitated so she asked him if he wanted to talk to a manager and he said that he did. 
LII KM went out and asked how she could help him. She recognized him from downtown, so knows a bit about his history. He went off about the library trying to steal his ID and insisted that we are allowing "the man" to hurt people who don't have money and who are homeless. She informed him that if anyone were to do that, they would lose their job and that just wouldn't happen. He went on about his rights and when she asked him if he wanted the phone number to call admin, he impatiently told her that he doesn't have a phone. She then asked him if he'd like to use a computer and he said if we helped him he would do that. She handed him a pass and invited him to log on. He went over to the computer and logged in and was quiet for a good amount of time. When she went out to check on things at the next hour, he spotted her and told her that the staff had abandoned him when he needed help. She told him that they didn't abandon him but that they had to go on lunch break and asked if she could do anything. He told her he wanted to file a grievance so she gave him a PC grievance form and he quietly filled it out. He gave it to LA LW when he was done to make a copy. KM took both copies to him and asked him if he wanted to take it up to MAI himself or if he'd prefer that she send it. He said that he'd like her to send it "internally." She offered to make him another copy if he also wanted to hand deliver it and he declined. He sat quietly at his computer until close then peacefully left.

Location: Frank De La Cruz-El Pueblo Library
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.4 Sleeping
Description: a Male patron came into the library at about 12:45 and sat at computer number 4. Managing librarian MS was asked by another patron for help, and noticed the male patron asleep at the computer. MS knocked on the table a couple times before she was able to wake the patron up. It was a little difficult to wake him. MS ask the patron if he was ok, and informed him that there is no sleeping at the computers. After about 3 minutes, Sargent HG informed Managing Librarian MS that the Patron was asleep again. MS went up to the patron again and knocked a few more times to wake the patron. MS noticed that the patrons eyes were blood shot, and he had a very hard time staying awake as if he was under the influence of Fentanyl. MS informed the patron that he can't sleep at the computer, and that she will have to ask him to leave for the day if he fell asleep again. In about 3 more minutes, the patron was asleep again, and MS asked him to leave for the day.

TPD Special Duty Officer JR found unattended plastic grocery bag in lobby. Bag contained miscellaneous harm reduction materials (unused/unopened syringes, test kits etc.).  Bag also contained business cards from “Cochise Harm Reduction Volunteer ID Card” / Sonora Prevention Works.
Staff member EO located extra Sharps Safety Kit. Staff member RL and DW put on puncture resistant gloves and moved items from plastic grocery bag to sharps containers. Containers put on cart and locked in Manager's Office.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Guard J called IC L1 WW to report a highly inebriated individual who was shouting and cursing at staff and patrons on the 2nd floor.  As Officer C was coming up to the 2nd floor to intervene, patron left on his own accord, shouting and cursing as he exited the building.  He will allowed back tomorrow.  UPDATE:  Patron reentered the library ~3:55 PM, cursing as before.  When he was told he needed to leave, he began cursing at Officer C as he left the building.  He is now suspended for 1 week.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description:
At 3:50 PM L2 KM entered the family restroom off the children's area and discovered a strong smell consistent with illegal drug use. KM locked the restroom and staff put an air purifier inside to cycle for a minimum of 1 hour.
In viewing the Meraki footage, a patron entered that restroom at 2:51 and exited eating an ice cream cone at 3:10.

Location: Frank De La Cruz-El Pueblo Library
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: Mercedes Turner walked into the library at 10:23am with two large bags. Managing Library MS thought she recognized her as a suspended patron from 0000022389, but her hair was shorter, and then thought that she could have been possibly wearing a wig during incident 0000022389. Mercedes went to the front desk to ask for a computer pass, and then sat at computer number 10. MS pulled up the first incident report to make sure this was the same patron from 0000022389. At 10:29, patron got up and went to the restroom door. Realizing it was locked she came up to the front desk and asked Managing Librarian MS to use the restroom. MS said, "I just need to see your ID or Library card." She responded with "I don't have none, can I just give you my phone?" MS replied no, but offered to have her fill out the library card application to use the restroom. Patron agreed, and started to fill out the form. Upon completing it, she handed the form to MS, when MS recognized the patron's name as indeed being from incident 0000022389. Managing librarian MS asked if  she could speak with her at the door.  MS then said to the patron, "so you're actually suspended from all PCPL libraries, and you're trespassing right now." She responded angrily, "why am I suspended? MS, responded back, "for drug use". Mercedes then said, "Are you sure it's not my twin sister?" MS responded back, "no" She replied then "how do you know it's me?" MS showed her, her library card application she just filled out and said, "you gave me your information". Mercedes replied back, "ok then!" Mercedes sat down on the computer again, and Managing Librarian MS gave her a few minuets to gather her belongings. After a few more minutes, it looked like the patron was going to continue being on the computer. MS went up to her and said, "ma'am, you need to leave." and She yelled back, "I am!" Deputy MS and Deputy JC told the patron that she needed to leave. The patron left without further incident.

Location: Frank De La Cruz-El Pueblo Library
Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description:
Patron came in and asked to use the restroom at 10:57 am and provided a library card and ID and Managing Librarian went to open for the door for him. After a few minutes, you could hear the patron retching and vomiting horribly from the front desk. At the patrons 5 minute mark, MS went and knocked on the door and asked the patron if he was ok. He replied, but MS didn't catch what he said. MS gave him a few more minutes, and after a little bit of time, nothing could be heard in the restroom, so MS knocked again to make sure the patron was ok. He replied "yeah" and came out after a few more minutes. Managing Librarian MS Asked the patron if he was ok and if needed us to call an ambulance. He declined, and said thank you, but then doubled over as he was walking out the door. MS asked again, "are you sure you're ok?" And he said "yeah, just something I ate." He continued to walk towards the Laos Center doubled over.  MS put the restroom out of order and put in a work order for a restroom cleaning. 
for documentation purposes.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.4 Sleeping    2.7 Not wearing shoes or shirt    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: L1 JD spoke to customer who was laying on the ground and sleeping.  JD asked him to get into a chair and to put his shoes on.  (The man has been repeatedly told not to sleep to on the ground and has been increasingly disruptive when instructed not to do so by staff.) The man became argumentative but seemed to comply.  A few minutes later, the man approached the service desk to speak to the manager.  The customer told L3 KK that was being harassed and that staff should address fentanyl use in the restrooms not him sleeping on the ground.  KK showed the man that the Code of Conduct regarding sleeping in the library and explained repeatedly that we simply were asking him to abide by staff's instructions. KK tried to insert an offer to call the Crisis Line but was talked over.  The customer began shouting and cursing causing other customers to offer to assist.  KK instructed him to leave for the day.  The customer said that he was being sent out to "die" and that we would all be "sprechen sie Deutsch" soon.  He also said staff was lucky not to be working in China. Customer said he would not leave.  KK explained that he was now trespassing and told him if we had to call 911, he would be suspended for an extended period.  After more shouting, the customer left.

Description: Item returned overnight had a living bed bug in it. Item quarantined and deleted. Patron IJs other items placed on hold for the Bed Bug Reserve card. Other items in book chute thoroughly inspected and sanitized, seem free of bug damage. Facilities request has been sent.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description:
At approx. 1:20pm regular patron checked out some materials with the reference desk and left the building. Very shortly afterward, he reentered the library and informed LA SD and LIC VV that his bicycle tires had been stolen. VV asked where he had left his bike, and patron indicated that he'd left the bicycle secured in the courtyard area, outside the garden wall. Patron was understandably agitated and frustrated. 
VV checked the cameras and saw at 12:55 a young, dark-haired man in a white long-sleeved shirt and darker khaki pants walk into the courtyard. The bike itself is out of view of the cameras, but the man walks into the courtyard, walks out of frame toward the bicycle, and less than two minutes later, walks back into frame carrying two bicycle wheels. VV and LA ES walked around the library area and approached the park, but because so much time had elapsed, they didn't find any bicycle parts or any witnesses. 
Patron declined to file a police report, stating that he didn't want to waste his time.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description: A teen was giving another teen a tattoo in the 101 Space. L2 KW spoke with them and told them this was not acceptable to do within a library, that they needed to stop, and not do it again here. It was explained to them that this was a potential biohazard issue. No blood was present, but they were still told to clean the table with disinfectant cleaning supplies. They then left the building.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property
Description: Guard MR and Librarian MMM observed and reported that a female patron (unknown), who had been in the branch less than twenty minutes, was sitting at the computer when she suddenly banged the keyboard on the counter. She immediately stood up, talking loudly to herself. As she walked past the customer service desk on her way out, kicked the lower part of the desk hard enough to leave a dent.

Man was lying on his side in front of the library, about 10 feet back from the outside book chute, upon opening at 10 am. Librarian KB and LTA CR talked to the man to see if he was all right and to get him into a sitting position. He mumbled something about taking a "meth pill" overnight. There were hospital discharge papers on the ground near him. The man was finally able to sit upright against a cement pillar. Librarian KB call 911. TFD arrived, took his vitals, said he was OK, and left him.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Guard JF repeatedly notified patron, David V, that he was being overly loud and exuberant while using the computer and after about the 3rd time she heard him call her a bitch as she walked away. Guard let staff know and librarian JH asked David to leave for the day. He argued and then made insulting comments about the guard to the guard--he even started to leave then doubled back to insult her intelligence. His initial one day suspension will now be extended to a month.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description:
At 1:45 pm Women's Restroom was locked due to suspected drug use.
VetSec Guard VM noticed that person using women's restroom was taking a long time/was in room for over 20 minutes. She and staff member IR, and another patron, smelled a strong lingering smell of burnt chemicals and burnt plastic consistent with smoked chemical drugs. 
Since the restroom had been locked and free of the chemical smell before this patron entered, it became clear that this person was responsible for the evident drug use.
IR spoke with person when she exited restroom. Person tried to mask smell with perfume. IR informed person of code of conduct and indicated person could pick up suspension letter tomorrow. The individual quickly left the building. Patron will be suspended for 1 year (until 4/24/2024), and the suspension letter will be made available to them the next time they visit the branch, should they do so. The women's public restroom will remain locked until smell subsides. 
There was no Special Duty Officer scheduled at the Branch today.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description:
LIC CR noticed guards JT and JF talking to two police officers near the stairs on the first floor of the library. They were discussing a teen patron for whom they were looking. They said it was related to an incident on the plaza. A person had taken a picture of a group of teens and then said that the group had threatened to shoot a group of fifth graders and their teacher. The police wanted to check the second floor to see if the teens were there but were afraid that if they were seen, the group could run or potentially threaten people in the space. Guard JT went to second and verified with the police that the two people they were looking for were in the space. 
At that point CR called LSM EDL for guidance on how to proceed since police were worried about other patrons on the 2nd floor. Before EDL arrived, the teens in question and a larger group came down the stairs. Without any further conversation, the police cuffed the two teens and walked them out. The other teens were asking what had happened. CR explained that it had nothing to do with the library and was related to an incident on the plaza about which library staff was unaware. 
About 20 minutes later, after 3 PM, officers reentered the building and asked at the front desk if there was a fifth-grade class on the premises. LTA Sup KW told them they were welcome to look around (there were no class visits at the time). The officers left after looking at the children's room.
The teens are not suspended and there are no warnings. This is to document a police interaction in the building.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description:
At 4:53 pm, Individual #1 enters the library and goes into the men's restroom followed by Individual #2. During the next few minutes, Individual #2 exits and enters the restroom in an agitated state. At 5:01 pm, Guard C hears shouting in the restroom. He enters and sees Individual #2 on the ground while Individual #1 is punching him repeatedly. Guard C separates the two and directs them to stop. L1 MNC, L1 BT, and LTA Sup FA go to investigate the commotion. Individual #2 quickly leaves the branch. Individual #1 gathers his belongings and leaves a minute later. Both proceed towards Kennedy Park.
Guard C and L1 MNC stay outside to ensure that both individuals leave the property and remain peaceful. Moments later, they see the individuals fighting again near the park ramada. L1 MNC calls 911. The two repeatedly disengage, separate a distance, and then one or the other rushes back to start fighting again. Eventually, the fighting escalates to throwing park trash cans and utilizing other weapons of opportunity. After 5:30 pm, two stopped fighting and went in different directions in the park. 
TPD responded to the call around 6 pm when branch staff were closing. They took a statement from the guard and gave staff a police report number before investigating the park. 
 
Follow-up: Both individuals returned together at 1 pm on 4/27/23, L1 MNC spoke with them about their behavior when they were last at the branch. They were informed of their 1 year suspensions and how it applies to all library branches (but not the park). They understood and left library property without incident.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed
Description:
at around 12:45, a customer who was at one of the 1st express computers, without shoes on. Guard J told her that she needed to have shoes on, the customer was very upset and she slapped her face. Information staff called in charge Librarian SYM, SYM grabbed another guard and asked her to leave. The Customer complied and left the building.
Guard J was given an ice pack she said she was fine.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.4 Sleeping
Description:
Around 3:46 pm, a patron asked LA NM for a guest pass for the computers. The patron logged in to computer 11 at 3:48 pm. Between 3:48 and 4:00 pm, the patron repeatedly nodded off and fell asleep at the computer. On three separate occasions, LA NM approached the patron, knocked softly on the desk adjacent to the patron, and asked if the patron was OK. The first two times, the patron nodded and said that they were fine, and LA NM returned to the front service desk.
Near 4:00 pm, the patron had fallen asleep again, and LA NM returned to knock on the desk and check in. This time, LA NM shared that the computer area is offered as a space to utilize the library's technology resources, and that the patron is welcome to use the computer if/when they are able to stay awake. LA NM let the patron know that the next (fourth) time they nodded off at the computer, they would be asked to log off and come back another day. At this point, the patron decided not to stay at the computer, and they logged off and left the library. 
Verbal warning issued. For documentation purposes.

Infractions: Children in the Library    Children in the Library: Other not listed: Violation of BOS D32.12    4.2 Leaving child unsupervised or ignoring disruptive behavior of child
Description: At approximately 6:02pm, teen patron Brian approached the front door after closing. LTA Supervisor AK spoke to Brian, who asked us to call the police due to an interaction with his guardian and "needing someone to talk to". Librarian KB called the Crisis Line first. They answered and advised us to call the police due to the long response time of their teams. AK went to sit with teen and discovered the guardian had left Brian there; while KB made the call. KB went out and informed AK and Brian of the next step options. AK went inside and called 911 after learning from Brian about an altercation with his guardian about computer use. Brian also gave AK his guardian's phone number. KB sat with Brian outside, and learned his name. While AK was on the phone with 911, the guardian returned. He got out of his vehicle, and he and Brian started calmly arguing about Brian's internet use. The guardian also stated that if Brian refused to get in the vehicle to leave, he would have to call the police. KB informed him that we were already in the process of calling them. The guardian mentioned that he left to let Brian cool off while he went to pick up milk and meant to come back after, and Brian had missed this and thought his guardian wasn't coming back. TPD called the guardian's cell phone and spoke with the guardian first, then spoke with Brian. We stepped away at this point to give them some room to talk with the officer. After they finished talking to the officer, Brian voluntarily chose to go into the guardian's vehicle. AK checked in with them, and Brian indicated that he was okay. The guardian thanked AK. The guardian and Brian left the parking lot at approximately 6:30pm. The officer called the branch to update us and give his name and title, and the Event Number. Sergeant Ortiz, East Side Division Supervisor. Event #CE231151390.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description:
At approximately 3:02 pm, Vet Sec security guard MG was told by a patron that there was an odor in the men's bathroom. SG MG went into the bathroom and confirmed that there was an odor. SC MG confronted the individual, Kevin, that he observed coming out of the men's bathroom just a moment before. MG states that Kevin admitted to using illegal substances in the bathroom, and was apologetic about. MG says that Kevin still had his lighter in his hand, and there was a black spot on his thumb. Kevin was informed by MG that he would have to leave for at least the rest of the day, and that if he returned before the day was over, that he would be suspended. Kevin was cooperative and compliant, but asked if he could use the courtesy telephone prior to leaving to confirm his bed reservation at a local shelter. MG did allow Kevin to use the phone. Kevin peacefully left the premises after his phone call. 
MG reported the incident to LIC CM, who then consulted with Branch Mgr VS about what the proper penalty would be. It was decided that he will be suspended for one year.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling~Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: Patron named Geoffrey Calabrese was intoxicated and yelling in the computer lab. L2 KW went to speak with him, he would not comply to come out from the aisle to speak after having been asked multiple times. Officer Calerdon assisted with removing the man from the computer lab, who also had an empty bottle of alcohol on the tabletop, was stumbling, and began yelling very audibly. He was escorted out the building by the officer, who then called for backup and medical assistance. Two police cars and a fire engine arrived to help assist the patron, who was then taken to get more medical care.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal
Description: A dog had reportedly lunged at two different patrons while in the library. L2 KW spoke with the handler and asked that he remove the dog from the building. Patron understood and he and his dog left without issue.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.5 Indecent exposure, public indecency, lewd, other sexual offense~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property~Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: A man was reported to be masturbating in the women's restroom on LL1. L2 KW went downstairs and spoke to a woman who had been trying to use the restroom and encountered him in the act. L2 KW, LTA KW, and Guard J propped open the door and told the man he needed to stop, he needed to leave the library, and that we were calling the police. L2 KW called 911 to report the incident, and then waited for the police to arrive with LTA KW, Guard J, and L2 CS. We made multiple attempts to get the man to leave the restroom, he was mostly unresponsive and just mumbled. Guard J mentioned that she had seen him drinking alcohol before the library opened. L2 CS made a call back to 911 to alert them that he might need medical assistance, but that he wasn't completely unresponsive. Police and medics arrived 50 minutes after the original call was placed.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.1 Harassment: Filming or photographing without permission    1.1.9 Trespassing    1.1.7.4 Bullying per Pima County B.O.S. Policy D 23.1.    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.2 Disruptive use of personal devices    2.10 Creating tripping hazards, blocking aisles, exits, entrances    2.12 Belongings: Leaving unattended, may be removed without notice    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description:
On Thursday, 4/20/23 at approximately 2:27pm Jackson, Eric, Porter, and Dorian entered the Large Community Room where Librarian I SG was conducting a movie program. Teens Eric and Porter interrupted the program and began shouting and protesting the suspension of one of their friends, Maddux, who had been suspended 2 weeks earlier for arguing with staff and repeatedly not complying with staff requests. At this time L1 SG asked the youth to stop interrupting the program, which they did not. Shortly after, around 2:28pm, the youth who had been attending the program left the program and did not return. At 2:28pm, Zay (Xavius) entered the Large Community Room and began filming Eric and Porter interrupting the program and arguing with L1 SG. L1 SG asked the teens to leave the room if they would not discontinue their behavior and they did not immediately comply. L1 SG told Zay that he was not allowed to film other patrons inside of the library, and Zay complied with SG’s request and stopped filming. Because snacks are only allowed in the meeting rooms during a program Dorian and Zay continued watching Eric and Porter while they ate their chips. At 2:32pm Dorian, Jackson, Eric, Porter and Zay left the Large Community Room. At 2:33pm Eric and Porter returned after letting in Maddux, the suspended youth, into the building from the side door. Eric, Porter, Maddux, Emily, Andrea, Jackson and Zay all entered the Large Community Meeting Room. Eric and Porter began harassing L1 SG again, and teens Jackson, Zay, Emily and Andrea stood in the doorway and watched Eric and Porter. Again L1 SG asked the youth to stop and to leave. No one complied with SG’s request until she became upset, shut everything down and because she felt endangered felt the need to leave quickly. As SG walked quickly towards the door, suddenly all of the involved youth, (Zay, Jackson, Eric, Emily, Porter, Maddux and Amelia) ran through the hallway to get away around 2:34pm. On his way out Porter stole a large box of chips and ran into the bathroom with them. At 2:35pm youths Eric, Andrew and Liam assisted Porter with his theft by keeping a lookout for staff in the area, which they admitted to later. Around 2:45pm, Branch Manager SH was interrupted while helping a patron, and was told that an incident had occurred and that he needed to speak with SG. L3 SH went into the back staff room and noticed that SG was visibly upset. After speaking with SG, SH discovered that Eric and Porter had interrupted SG’s movie program along with some other youth. SH went to look for Eric and Porter. Eric and Porter had changed clothes while they were inside the Men’s restroom and attempted to hide from SH in the children’s area. SH found them and asked to speak with them. While SH was speaking to Eric and Porter SG informed SH that someone had also stolen a large box of chips from the program. At this point Andrew asked to be a part of the conversation. SH spoke with Eric, Porter, Andrew and Liam, and Porter told SH that someone had put the chips in the Men’s Restroom but would not identify the person. After SH found and returned the chips from the Men’s Restroom, SH spoke with Eric, Porter, Liam and Andrew again. SH told them that they had one chance to tell the truth before he confirmed on the cameras who had stolen the chips. Porter admitted that he stole the chips but that he was told to do so by Maddux. SH informed the youths that they would be suspended, but that he would need to speak with SG to determine the severity of the incident. After SH spoke with SG he realized that the youth were upset about their friend, Maddux, being suspended and were trying to protest his suspension from weeks earlier. However, when SG asked them to stop, they refused to do so, and when she asked them to leave they again refused to do so. SG informed SH that the youth crowded around the door, refused to stop their behavior and had prevented SG from leaving the room. This caused SG to fear for her safety, which is when SG made the decision to try to leave the room as quickly as possible to get away from the youth. SH then learned from surveillance camera footage that Eric, Porter and the other youth had left after harassing SG but then chose to return with the suspended youth, Maddux, and a larger audience (Zay, Jackson, Emily, and Andrea. After the incident SG was not able to continue their shift and had to leave for the day. Upon further investigation the next day SH discovered that other youth had informed staff that some of the 8th graders were trying to get SG fired. In addition, the youth left behind a paper with derogatory threatening messages towards SG. The paper said “10 signs for Ciara to get fucked” and then had the names of six of the male youth who have been mentioned during the incident. There is additional illegible scrawling on the page, and it appears that with some of the youth’s names along with the word “fucked” there was an attempt to scribble out the words.
The following youth will be suspended:
Eric – Eric will be suspended for 1 month for his attempt to bully and threaten SG, and his refusal to follow staff direction, and because he was one of the main perpetrators of the harassment that took place that caused SG to fear for their safety and due to his poor behavior has permanently ended a program for the remainder of the school year that will have an effect on many of the youth who visit the library each day.
Porter- Porter will be suspended for 1 month for his attempt to bully and threaten SG, his refusal to follow staff direction, his attempt at theft of library programming supplies, and for being the second main perpetrator of the harassment that took place that caused SG to fear for their safety and due to his poor behavior has permanently ended a program for the remainder of the school year that will have an effect on many of the youth who visit the library each day.
Jackson – Jackson will be suspended for 1 week for his participation and support in the harassment of staff that took place, which may have included blocking the doorway which prevented SG from exiting the room which caused SG to fear for their safety.
Dorian – Dorian will be suspended for 1 week for his participation and support in the harassment of staff that took place.
Xavius (Zay) – Zay will be suspended for 1 week for filming patrons inside of the library, and their continued participation and support of the harassment of staff that took place, which may have included blocking the doorway which prevented SG from exiting the room which caused SG to fear for their safety.
Maddux – Maddux will have his current 1 month suspension extended for 1 week longer because of his trespassing, and his participation or support of harassment of staff that took place and for blocking SG from exiting the room which caused SG to fear for their safety.
Emily – Emily will be suspended for 1 week for choosing to be a bystander and blocking SG from exiting the room which caused SG to fear for their safety.
Andrea – Andrea will be suspended for 1 week for choosing to be a bystander and blocking SG from exiting the room which caused SG to fear for their safety.
Andrew – Andrew will be suspended for 1 week for choosing to assist Porter with his attempted theft of library programming supplies.
Liam – Liam will be suspended for 1 week for choosing to assist Porter with his attempted theft of library programming supplies.
 
Per recommendation of LRPY members, SH will also be meeting with the youth and their guardians to discuss the reasons for their suspensions, and the harm that has been caused by their poor decisions.

SD informs the woman that the library does not open until 10 am in about 2 hours. woman says okay but does not immediately leave garden and sits at the table. Vet Sec guard J. was accompanying our Day Porter S. while she cleaned the bathrooms on 3rd. After announcing herself at the Men's room door, J and S were confronted by a man upset that he was interrupted and he was directing anti-immigrant, white supremist slurs at S. in particular.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: Book damage
Description: At 1:40 Lib MMM called for back-up in addressing patron, James Riley's disruptive behavior at the public computers. Staff and the guard had previously approached him about slamming books and making lots of loud noises. I came out and approached Mr Riley, and checked in, asking how he was doing. Mr Riley, who was sitting a computer station surrounded by books he'd pulled from the shelf, deliberately opened a book and looked away. I asked again if he was okay and he he grunted and motioned for me to move away. I let him know that staff had already approached him about his excessive noise making and that he was welcome to stay but that he would just need to keep things quieter. At that point, he ripped a page out of the book and got up. I let him know that because of that I'd have to ask him to leave for the day. He made some unintelligible noises and proceeded to walk to the front door--at the front door he stopped and carefully tore out a small section of words from the page he ripped out and showed me the page with a hole in it and then took off. It was clear from Mr Riley's behavior that he isn't always in control of his actions and given the rising temperatures and lack of safe, comfortable spaces for many in our community, STU staff will welcome Mr Riley back tomorrow and do our best to help him have a positive time in the library while keeping the larger space comfortable and safe for others.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing    1.1.10 Remaining inside the library after closing, including emergency closures~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Refusal to exit after closing time, preventing staff from securing the building and surrounding premises.
Description:
At closing, LA-in-charge NM noticed that a patron (later identified as Daniel Antone) was still seated in the sofa area behind the job help computers and was not making any visible effort to wrap up and depart. LA NM approached the patron and let him know that the library was now closed, and that it was time for him to leave for the day. The patron briefly looked away from the video on his phone to acknowledge LA NM with eye contact and a nod before returning to his video. Daniel remained seated and did not make any motion to leave. LA NM repeated that the branch was closed, and that he needed to make his way out so staff could close the building. LA NM shared that she would give him a couple minutes to gather his things, and that she would return soon.
When LA NM returned, she let Daniel know that, at this point, by refusing to leave after closing time, he was trespassing. The patron remained seated and appeared to be ignoring LA NM. LA NM then stated that she would need to call 911 to have police escort the patron out of the building if they did not leave of their own accord. She then asked VetSec guard VM to reiterate this information to the patron. When Daniel did not respond to guard VM's request to leave, LA NM stepped away and called 911 (5:07pm).
L1 WW shared that he recognized this patron from previous interactions and that he was actively suspended (PITS incident 21593).
By 5:30 pm, Daniel had not left the building, though he stood up once to get water from the drinking fountain by the bathrooms. As he did this, LTA-S FC closed and locked the sliding glass doors that separate the bathroom hallway from the main body of the library building. Daniel stayed in the entryway, looking inside and walking back and forth for several minutes without leaving. Security camera footage captures somewhat erratic behavior at this time, including lying down briefly and waving at the door sensors and cameras. LA NM made a follow-up call to 911 to share the identity of the patron and that he was already under an active suspension from all library properties. 
After a few more minutes by the bathrooms, Daniel made his way outside the building and remained in the entry/parking lot area. Since Daniel was still on the grounds, staff and guard VM could not leave and close the Valencia BLVD gate, since their cars were still in the lot, and there had been a record of threatening behavior with this patron. Staff waited until Daniel walked off of the grounds near the bus stop before exiting the building and closing the gates. LA NM cancelled the 911 call at 5:56 pm, after the gate had been locked and the branch fully closed. 
The patron's suspension will be extended until 8/30/2023.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description: At 3:46 pm, a young couple came in to use the computers.  After a short time, it became apparent that both of them were cursing at each other and were arguing with one another.  Deputy WH walked over and asked them to pick up their things and leave for the day, since they were bothering other patrons especially a young teen who was seated right next to them.  They packed up everything they had brought in and made their way out of the library. Deputy WH informed LA MD that the couple were drunk and that once they started fighting he felt it was better to have them leave for the day. Deputy WH had observed their behavior earlier during his walk around the library grounds, he noticed that the couple would be talking loudly, acting silly and then arguing the next minute. Since they left without further incident this report is for documentation purposes only.

Description: Prior to opening, LTA Sup FA and L1 MNC noticed a patron pacing around, laying on the ground, and talking to himself incoherently. At 10am, he was able to get himself up and walked into the library to ask for a guest pass. He sat at the computer for a few minutes before moving to a chair near the magazines, removing his shoes, and sliding onto the ground face down. FA and MNC went to check on the patron and were able wake him after a couple minutes. When he woke up, he started to retch like he was about to vomit and MNC asked if he required medical assistance. He declined any assistance and got up from the ground. Since the patron was still under the influence, MNC let him know that he would need to leave for the day and the patron slowly exited the branch.

Description:
LA DB informed manager LG that a patron (name unknown) in the computer area was continuously talking rapidly and loudly, to himself and at others around him. DB had explained that the patron had already been asked to monitor his volume level. LG and Security guard LH, approached the patron and attempted to speak to him away from others, but he refused to engage, stating loudly that he would talk to staff later. At this, another male customer began arguing with him, telling him to listen to staff. The second customer was asked to let staff handle the situation.
LG suggested to the first customer that he could lock the computer so that they could address the issue, but he loudly refuse. The customer was warned that staff would need to reboot the computer and he would be asked to leave the building. This was repeated twice to him and he responded. Immediately after the station was rebooted, the customer went quickly to restroom and upon exiting informed the staff that he "tried, but couldn't make it to the toilet- have fun cleaning up".

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description: Staff could hear LA DS repeatedly asking a patron to not open the Bookbike cargo area--sounding more alarmed each time she told him not to open it. He proceeded to open the Bookbike cargo area and pull the case containing readers out. MR our guard, LA DB, and Lib JH came out to see how they could support DS. The man appeared agitated and was waving the plastic case full of readers. He appeared to be concerned that the case contained some sort of explosive device--he repeatedly lifted his shirtsleeve to show staff his military tattoo, perhaps for the purpose of showing that he had experience identifying explosives. He appeared to be having some delusions and escalating, so DB & JH stepped back to not overwhelm him while DS asked him again to put the case back in the Bookbike. The man's female partner then began yelling at him from several feet away to put it away, eventually he did respond and went and sat with her. Moments later she started yelling at him and JH and guard MR went over and asked them to keep their noise level down at which point he popped up and became agitated and approached Guard MR in a threatening stance. His behavior was very unpredictable and a little frightening. We asked him to leave for the day and let him know he was welcome back tomorrow. He mumbled some unintelligible things and his partner gathered their things and helped him out. They left without any further incident.

Description: A regular patron using a PC was reported by other patrons to have thrown up on the desk and keyboard of his computer.  He apparently tried to clean it up and remained at the station.  Mgr KW approached the patron to inquire as to his well being to which he did not respond immediately.  KW got him some cold water, marked the PC Faulty and asked if he needed her to call anyone. He was very red in his face and appeared to be heat impacted. When he finally responded he said he was just extremely tired.  She asked if he could move to the cafe area to rest and rehydrate while she cleaned up the PC area.  He complied.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Patron who comes in frequently and hangs out between the men's restroom and the cafe all day was in.  The last couple of times he has been in, we have found empty alcohol bottles in the restroom upon him leaving it.  Today when noticing him in the cafe, Mgr KW asked guard BB to just check the restroom for empty bottles.  He found an empty Popov 200ML bottle in the trash.  This patron has had previous episodes of falling due to apparent intoxication in the library resulting in self injury.  Mgr KW approached him to ask him to put his shoe back on and inquired if the bottle might be his.  He responded vehemently that it was not, that he does not drink and that he was offended.  KW apologized and stated that if it was not his, it was not a problem, but she would like to not find them in the restroom anymore.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description:
Incident is being added to tracker for documentation purposes due to escalating behavior issues with patron. Regular Mission patron Isabella is very demanding of staff time and assistance to the point of interrupting when staff are assisting other patrons. On multiple occasions, she has attempted to police other patrons’ volume and library usage. She often spreads out her personal belongings across several computer stations and/or furniture in laptop area and displays territorial/hostile behavior towards nearby patrons. She also remains in study rooms for an excessive amount of time after closing and argues with staff when reminded of library hours and patron expectations.
At around 4:15, LTA Sup FA was assisting patrons on PCs 9 & 10. FA noticed that patron Isabella had a large amount of belongings spread out across a couple computer stations and chairs in last row of public PCs, but was not utilizing any of the PCs. FA asked her to please not take up more than one computer station as it blocks other patrons’ access. Isabella then told FA to monitor people talking on the phone and children being loud and that the patrons can sit someplace else. FA responded that he was only asking her to share the space with other patrons who may wish to use it. Isabella kept trying to argue and FA returned to help the patrons on PCs 9 & 10. Isabella attempted to continue to argue with FA and made two the patrons whom he was helping uncomfortable. FA apologized to the other patrons to de-escalate the situation. At that point, Isabella got up to go the service desk to issue a complaint with Sub Lib CFD. She approached the desk staff questioning why certain library policies exist and stating how staff should be addressing people using their phones in the library instead of her behavior. CFD listened to her concerns and Isabella returned to her computer station.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal
Description: Patron, Melanie, spent some hours (roughly 11 a.m. through closing at 5 p.m.) in Sahuarita library, mostly in Study Room F, in the company of another regular patron, Catherine Ann. Both are currently experiencing housing insecurity and are living in their vehicles, Melanie in a van, Catherine Ann in her car. Melanie is disabled and uses a motorized chair. Melanie brought in her dog, who she referred to as a service animal. The dog barked threateningly at three separate staff members (Library Assistant JS, and Librarians EG and CL), whenever we went into the study room to speak to Melanie and Catherine Ann. This behavior is outside of the acceptable range of behavior expected of a trained service animal; this behavior could be frightening or startling to other patrons. Thankfully, the dog did not have the opportunity to bark at other patrons, as it was isolated in the study room while Melanie was in the library. However, as we do not want to risk the dog barking threateningly at patrons, Librarian CL at the end of the day informed Melanie that the dog would not be welcome in the library going forward. Melanie indicated that she understood and did not make any argument. Note: Library Assistant JS, a noted dog-lover, felt threatened by the dog's behavior.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.2 Disruptive use of personal devices
Description: At approximately 2:35 pm, a patron named Carina was in the children's area, speaking very loudly on her phone, during a video call to her young daughter in New York. LIC CM approached Carina to ask her to please take the call outside. Before LIC CM said anything, Carina became very defensive. "I am trying to read a book to my daughter!" CM explained to Carina that she could check out the book, and continue the story and the call outdoors. Carina responded in a very hostile manner, "No, I'm not going to do that." Carina left the children's area, continuing to read the book to her daughter. She told CM, "I have a room!" referring to study room B. CM then said, "Then please continue your call in the room." Carina turned to CM and said, still in a hostile manner, "That's where I'm going." Carina closed the door. Security guard MG asked CM what was going to happen to the patron. At that time, CM knocked on the door, and opened the door of study room B to inform the Carina that any future behavior of this manner could get her suspended. Carina became hostile once again, stating, "This is my daughter that I am talking to, and this is my time! This is very important to me! I want to speak to your manager when I am done here after my two hours!" CM told Carina that she would inform the manager. Branch manager VS was informed of the incident. OCS JP then informed VS that Carina was asking for her information. Patron was provided with VS's business card.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description: For documentation: A man was leaving the library at about 11:47 and Guard R told him to have a nice day. The man loudly and sarcastically gave Guard R a “Will do!” before leaving the building. Moments later patron poked his head through the front door and threw a dirty sock at/towards Guard R before leaving for good.

After a brief conversation, he spat aggressively on the paperwork and left. Extending suspension to a year from today's date.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description: Librarian I and Guard J both called the in-charge phone to let LIC BC know that there were teenagers continuing to be loud in the computer lab after being asked several times to be quiet. As LIC BC approached, one of the teens behavior was escalating and he was getting loud and threatening, first with another patron in his row, the with... everyone. As he was leaving the library, he loudly used all manner of racial slurs directed at most everyone he saw. He made also made a threatening gesture towards LA DL. This individual will be suspended for 6 months. The other members of the group are out for the day. These are also likely the individuals responsible for the broken bottle of alcohol in the second floor Men's room.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description: Patron was having a verbal altercation with David. Couple was asked to leave for the day, but patron returned to the library. When told she couldn't return until the next day by guard L the woman pushed past him and went to speak with a male patron. When LibI MMM informed her that she should leave, the patron barked, "I heard you!" and continued her business for another 10 minutes before leaving.

Male patron 20 yo was sitting on floor in men's restroom throwing up in the toilet.  Youth patron came out of restroom to report that the man was requesting someone call 911.
Mgr KW checked on man and offered water while she called 911. Emergency Services arrived within 5 minutes.  Patron was transported to hospital.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description: At 4:36 PM, a man and a woman enter the library. The man enters the family restroom with the woman waiting for him in the lobby. After a few minutes, the woman starts banging on the bathroom room and yelling at him to exit. L1 MNC responds to the situation and asks if they require assistance. The woman responds that they are together and they do not need help. A short time later, she knocks on the door again and yells at him to leave. The man emerges from the restroom at 4:50 PM, appearing dazed and moving slowly, possibly due to being inebriated. He exits the branch followed by the woman. They stop in front of the library entrance and begin arguing which then escalates into a physical fight. L1 MNC comes out and directs both of them to stop and leave library property. They both depart the property at 4:52 PM heading towards the intersection. No definitive evidence of drug or alcohol use was found in the restroom.

after staff investigated we noticed it was the same stall as the last incident involving a clogged toilet.

Description: Customer was observed using a library computer to view images of young girls in underwear and other "jailbait" material, and was taking pictures of these images with his flip phone. When staff member MS approached to discuss appropriate use of computers, the customer fled.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.7.4 Bullying per Pima County B.O.S. Policy D 23.1.~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
At around 11:30, two patrons got into a confrontation next to the elevators. An older man approached a younger Black woman and started insulting her, telling her that she was a "self-entitled bitch" and that "I'm an American, just because you're Black doesn't make you special." There was no prior interaction between the two patrons. Both patrons left the building, headed in opposite directions, before a staff member could intervene.
At approximately 12:00, the male patron came back into the library and sat on the third floor, talking loudly on his cell phone with his feet on the table. Guard J asked him to take his call in the stairwell and not put his feet on the table. He called Guard J a "he-she" and insulted her looks before returning to his phone call.
LIC CS spoke to the man and told him that he couldn't call people names inside the library. He told her that he had called the other patron a "self-entitled witch," not a bitch, and that free speech meant that was fine. CS asked him to leave for the day, as his behavior was violating the code of conduct and he refused to change it. She offered him a copy of the code, and he proceeded to read each clause out loud and talk about how he hadn't done those things because of free speech. CS told him several times that he needed to leave, and eventually let him know that if he did not she would have to call the police. He told her he was going to call the police on her instead. After several iterations of the same conversation, he asked for and was given CS's manager's number and left the library.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Guard DJ reported to L3 KK that there was a strong smell of chemicals in a public restroom near the entry consistent with drug use.  KK viewed security camera footage and identified the individual He was still on property.  KK spoke to him and he admitted to being in possession of drugs and said, "You catch me."  KK verbally advised him that he was suspended from all PCPL locations for 1 year.  Customer and his companion left property without incident.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Customer was in the public restroom for an extended period of time.  His companion from incident 0000022456 repeatedly knocked on the door to see if he was okay.  L3 KK also knocked on the door to check on customer's welfare.  When customer left the restroom, Guard DJ reported that there was a strong smell of chemicals indicative of drug use.  L3 KK stopped the customer and his companion as they were leaving property and made them aware that they were suspended for a year.  The customer appeared to be under the influence and made no comment.  He and his companion left property without incident.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description:
At 3:25 young Patrons Damien, Oliver and Vicente told L1 VV that there was a homeless man in purple bandana sharpening a knife in the bathroom. 
L1 VV and Security Guard VY approached the restroom opened the door with the ADA button to see if they could see anyone without arising suspicion. when they didn't guard announced herself and entered asking if they had a weapon. Regular patron Tyler Burfitt answered quietly no as he washed his hands, no knife was seen on him but he matched young boys description about a purple bandana. guard and L1 waited in hallway for him to leave in case knife was in a visible place when he walked past. Tyler returned to his usual station in the adult room and staff checked cameras incase a different person wearing a purple bandana walked in the restroom or if there is a glimpse of him sharpening his knife. 
cameras showed only Tyler entering the restroom while one child opens the door, sees the knife runs away, grabs a friend to keep guard as he uses the restroom before they tell staff. after further questioning only one child saw the knife and the others claim he put it way but was watching the stall of the first child who entered who saw him with the knife. 
as staff are afraid to approach someone with a potential weapon, staff are being extra vigilant with him in case they see any type of weapon on his person to inform him that weapons are not allowed in the library

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description:
Around 4:30 on Friday, 5/12, LA NM noticed a regular patron (George) speaking with a child/minor in the library. The child's parent and sibling were present in the library, but they were not in the same area at the time. When the child (a young girl) returned to her parent, LA NM kept an eye on the other patron (George) to see if he approached her again or continued his attention toward her.
Later, upon noticing that George sat down within eye line of the minor, LA NM left the front desk to present coloring pages to the girl and sit down with her at a table that was within eyesight of the child's parent but out of eyesight of George's seat.
Within a few minutes, George walked by, addressed the child sitting next to LA NM, and asked the girl if she wanted part of his open chocolate bar. LA NM emphatically said, "No, thank you," and gestured for Guard VM to come over while George walked away. LA NM asked Guard VM to keep an eye on George and to be present should he approach again and need to be asked to leave.
In the next few minutes, George walked back and sat back down at a table closer to LA NM and the girl. LA NM and the young patron continued to color until the child's parent had finished their work and was able to be fully present with the child. LA NM noticed that George continued to stare in the direction of her and the young patron. At this point, it was closing time, and everyone was packing up to leave.
George once again approached LA NM and the girl and tried to show them both a Bible verse, saying that it was "miraculous" that the girl appeared in the library when she did. LA NM asked him to pack up his things, as his continued gaze and interactions were not appropriate, and the branch was also closing. He packed up and left before follow-up could take place. The girl left with her sibling and parent and got into the car without further interaction with George. 
For branch documentation and additional monitoring. It's clear that a firmer follow-up is merited, though it got wrapped up in the flurry of closing activities at the time. While branch manager IR is out of office, staff will consult with their LSM to determine next steps.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: 3rd-floor men's restroom closed due to drug use.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: Suspended patron runs into the library to use the public phone or restroom multiple times a day and leaves quickly as soon as staff or guards begin to approach her. She has been reminded of when her suspension ends and warned that repeated trespasses will extend her suspension.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Repeatedly blowing a loud whistle within the library
Description: Patron became agitated, began throwing trash around in the study room, and then launched into a series of offensive comments toward Guard J. His behavior became increasingly hostile and he was told to leave. As he was escorted down the stairwells and out the front door, he was repeatedly blowing a loud whistle that could be heard throughout the building, while at the same time, continuing to loudly curse at the guards.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking
Description: For documentation: A woman called from the following phone number but did not give her name: 520-599-6627. She rambled to Page MF about her issues with PCPL's various knitting groups. She also identified a Himmel staff member by first name and referred to them as a "disgruntled employee" who "complained about the library during knitting group." Due to the unusual nature of the call, Page MF reported the call to Librarian I KH. Staff suspects this may be the same caller from Incident 0000022124. The caller in this incident (0000022462) fixated on the same staff member as in the previous incident (0000022124) and discussed similar topics with staff.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
Michael Bolents called Infoline asking the same question he has asked and had answered multiple times (What is the percentage of women vs. men who work at PCPL and at Infoline). He asked for the information to be mailed to him in writing with a person's name on it so that it would be "an official document". We have already answered this question from Michael multiple times (he needs to contact the Clerk of the Board and submit a Public Information Request; see incident 0000022051).
Michael was warned on 12/13/22 that continuing to ask the same question over and over after we had already answered it could be considered harassment and could result in suspension. After discussing with L3 MS, L2 CS mailed a letter to the requested address reiterating that fact along with an an official written warning and a copy of the Code of Conduct with relevant rules highlighted.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: At approximately 3:50 pm, a patron told Vet Sec Security Guard MG that someone was smoking something in the women's restroom. MG announced himself in the women's room, asking if anyone was smoking. MG reported to LIC CM that he did smell something and the patron in the first stall began flushing things down the toilet when he announced himself. MG blocked the door open and CM went in to speak to the patron. CM said, "Hello, there is no smoking in here." CM smelled a slight, sweet smell. The unknown patron came out of the stall, slightly disheveled, carrying many items, including a pink coat or robe, and a black stick. She washed her hands, very hurriedly, in the sink, and left the restroom without saying anything, or looking at anyone. She left the property without incident.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: On May 17th at approximately 11:00am LTA Supervisor FC was informed about a man that was outside and appeared distressed and injured.  Guard AF and FC went outside and approached the man, he said he had recently been released from the hospital and was very upset, on his left foot he had gauze wrapped around it that wasn’t properly fastened and was coming loose, he said he had surgery on it, he did not have any shoes on, his legs were red, swollen and they had open sores, he had bags with all his belongings and a walker from the hospital, he said that he had nowhere to go and he did not feel well, he mentioned he didn’t have any money because he had lost his wallet with his food card and money and that he had no family or anywhere to go.  He told FC “I just want to give up”, FC replied “no sir I will try to get you help”, he did not appear to be under the influence of drugs or alcohol.  FC asked him what it is he would like me to do, he then said he wanted to go to La Frontera, but he didn’t have a ride, he didn’t know what else to do.  FC told him I would see what resources I could find to help him out. FC and DW were both trying to contact several places and were finally able to contact the Crisis Response Center and they said they would send a team out to help him, they told us they  would call the paramedics to have him checked to see if he needed to go back to the hospital, the paramedics arrived and he refused to go because they were going to take him back to banner hospital and he said they are the ones that let him out in the condition he was in and that they didn’t take care of him there.  The EMT did not offer any advice they just left.  FC then called the Crisis Center back to let them know that he was still here at the library, at approximately 1:00pm The Crisis team showed up and took him.

Location: Frank De La Cruz-El Pueblo Library
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Right after the library had closed for the lunch hour a young man came up to the door trying to come in.  After being told by the sheriffs that we were closed until 1 pm for lunch, he turned around and sat down at the bench directly in front of the library.  The youth then pulled out his phone and engaged in a very dramatic call, one that had him crying and shouting very loudly.  Sheriffs went out and asked if everything was alright, to which the response was yes.  After a few minutes a young woman came and started yelling at the man.  Sheriffs intervened, again asking if everything was okay.  The young woman started cursing once again, saying that she just wanted to sit down, that it was hot as fuck and that he (the young man) just cries like a little bitch.  The young man, responded that he had been there first, he wasn't doing anything to anyone and that she should just leave.  However, he got up and left. He walked west, past the gate that separates the library property from the bus transit center.  The young woman then turned to the sheriffs asked them if they were "going to arrest her or leave her the fuck alone", she was hot, mad, and just wanted to sit there.  Both the sheriffs just walked a few paces back without saying anything to her.     After a few minutes, it seemed that she had calmed down.  The woman asked LA MD if she could "fucking use the restroom."  LA MD  explained that she could not cuss in the library but if she presented an ID or a library card, yes she could use the the restroom.  The cursing started up again, full force, "This is the way I fucking talk, I'm not even fucking being rude or fucking disrespectful."  MD responded, "I'm not speaking to you that way, please do not speak to me like that".  She once again started cussing at which time MD told her that she would have to come back when she didn't feel so "hot, and pissed off"  She stomped off yelling at one of our Sheriffs that he was a racist.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.2 Strong odors
Description:
Over the past couple of weeks, a family consisting of 2 adult males and 2 adult females started coming into the branch daily. During this time period, staff gave them many resources on places they could go get help because they are experiencing homelessness. As time progressed, the family’s personal hygiene started to decline and staff started to receive multiple complaints about the strong odor they carried.
On Wednesday May 17, 2023, L1 VM approached the family and LA NM stood as back up. L1 VM asked if she could talk to them. L1 VM handed one of the adult males a copy of the code of conduct and explained that their odor had become an issue and she had to ask them to leave until they could get the odor situation take care of. The male responded, “I know we stink but we have no where to go take showers”. L1 VM responded saying she understood the circumstances of their situation were difficult, but staff had given them plenty of resources on places they could go get help. L1 VM then handed them some more resources on places they could go for help. L1 VM then said you guys are not suspended from the library, you are just being asked to leave until you get the odor taken care of. The family then began to pack up their belongings. L1 VM then walked back to the front desk area.
As the family was leaving, they stopped a group of males and told them the library was kicking them out because they smelled. The adult male that L1 VM had spoken to then said, “I am going to sue the library”. The family then left the library without further incident.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description: Someone stuffed a phone charger and a t shirt down the toilet in the ADA bathroom. A plumber had to come out to fix it.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Description: At approximately 3:45 pm, LTA SY took a phone call from a patron that someone was seen in the bushes of the library. It wasn't known at the time what the person was doing. LA GP and Vet Sec Security MG went to investigate. A patron known as Christina was found putting dirt all over herself, then shook the dirt off of her. MG consulted with LIC CM about what to do if she came into the library. CM told MG to tell Christina that she would only be allowed 5 minutes in the bathroom, if she went in there. Christina then came into the library at approximately 3:50. She asked to get on a computer, to where she left the computer area all dirty. She then went into the bathroom at approximately 4:00. She was told by MG that she only had 5 minutes, and not to bathe in the bathroom. She was told to get out of the bathroom at 5 minutes, but did not comply. MG consulted with LIC CM, in which time, Christina came out of the bathroom, soaking wet. LIC CM went to speak to Christina. Christina turned around, pointed her finger at CM, and said "Shut the fuck up." Her tone was not loud, but hostile. She went to MG to ask a question, and MG escorted Christina out of the library and off the premises.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.5 Indecent exposure, public indecency, lewd, other sexual offense
Description: Guard J notified IC L1 WW that patron urinated in her chair while on a 1st floor express computer.  WW was able to find a pair of pants for her to change into, and the area was quickly cleaned and sanitized by the day porter.  The patron left the library and then returned, so staff will keep an eye on her for the rest of the day.  Our assumption at this time is that the incident was accidental, so this is just for documentation purposes unless it should happen again.
