At 9:56, two TPD vehicles pull up in front of the branch and MNC goes out to speak with them. Officers stated that they were looking for a woman involved in a fight in the park. MNC gave the officers D's description and the direction that she was going. No case number or other information was provided to staff. 
Added for documentation purposes.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Day porter Susana and guard Jasmine both suspected the same individual of using drugs in the 3rd floor Men's room. LIC BC spoke with the individual, reminding him that he could not use drugs in the restroom. He said that it already smelled like drugs when he went in. As we did not catch this person in the act, I am submitting this for documentation purposes. The male in question has been involved in other incidents at JDV.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Regular patron reported to Mgr KW that while he was in the restroom another regular patron was smoking drugs.  Mgr KW checked the men's room and found it to smell strongly of drug use. Patron drug user will be suspended for one year.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: Male customer in obvious emotional distress was loudly verbalizing an intent to self-harm. 911 was called to provide assistance. The customer left right before the responding officers arrived.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Children in the Library
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior~Children in the Library    Children in the Library: Other not listed: Adult Interaction
Description:
At 4:05 LA CR noticed young patron Isabella standing in the doorway of a study room that she had assigned to Veronica Williams. CR called Isabella over to ask what was going on and Isabella had stated that Veronica had asked her friend Nathalia to interpret for her on the phone since staff has told her they cannot make phone calls on her behalf over and over again. 
CR let LIC VV know of the situation and VV approached the door told Nathalia to go back with her friends and told Veronica she cannot have Minors interpret her legal business for her. Veronica argued that VV should then interpret for her. VV Told her again that staff cannot make phone calls for her and cannot help with anything involving her private information,  that she would need to contact her interpreter. As VV was leaving, Veronica yelled that she cannot contact her interpreter because her interpreter phone is dead and demanded help on her phone call again. VV reiterated the last conversation she had with veronica that for personal and legal matters like this she will need to either use her interpreter app or arrange for an interpreter to meet her at the library and added to not bother the children who are using the library.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: Bed bugs
Description: Around 3:45 patron DNW came up to the desk to return some items and left them on the counter. LA CR started to check the items and noticed that one book had small stains on the edge of the pages. ML VV was next to CR and confirmed that the stains were bed bugs. The patron was still in the library and ML VV approached the patron and made them aware of the condition of the book. The patron was very understanding of what that would mean for their account and are going to look into getting an exterminator. Their account has been put on hold.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
A woman was sitting outside near the pickup lockers, screaming and cursing. A mother approaching the library with her children was alarmed enough to move her children to be farther away from this woman. The screaming woman yelled at the mom saying, "I'm not a fucking weirdo. You don't have to avoid me." Lib II SW went out to talk with the woman. Before SW could speak, the woman started yelling, and said "I'm a fucking abused woman." SW tried to ask if we could help, and the woman continued to curse, and mumble as she walked away toward MVD. After SW went back inside, the woman came back and threw a drink at the building. LA SB and Lib II SW went out to talk to her, but she was past the MVD building. A few minutes later, SW saw her sitting near the staff entrance to the MVD.
About 5:40, the woman returned. SW tried to speak to her as she entered the library, but she said, "I'm not doing anything wrong," and sat down at a table near the phone charging station. SW approached her and explained that when people yell and curse at other customers, we usually ask them to leave for the day. She kept telling me she wasn't doing anything wrong, and she was waiting for a ride. I told her I wasn't asking her to leave. She left a few minutes before closing, without any further disturbance.

Male patron at computers asked computer monitor EZ to call 911 for medical distress. Circ mgr JF called 911 at 11:30am and stayed with patron until EMTs arrived at 11:40am.  Patron was transported to hospital.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others    2.8 Smoking, rolling, using tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Intentionally hitting a computer. ~Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed    3.2 Unplugging library equipment    3.6 Using furniture improperly
Description: As Vet Sec VY was doing her routine check of the library, she entered the Teen Area and noticed four teenagers - Martin Paul Perez, Malachi, Rudy, and Iseah - using the space. However, she quickly realized that they were not following the rules, engaging in rough play, and emitting a smell of "weed." As a result, vet Sec VY asked them to leave the area. Later, when she reported the incident to the staff, they reviewed the security footage and discovered that Martin Paul Perez had deliberately unplugged some computers in the teen area, angered his peers. In response, Rudy punched Computer Teen 04, causing it to fall to the ground, while Malachi hit Computer Teen 02 twice out of frustration. All the teenagers began to engage in horseplay and not respecting the library's property, creating an unsafe environment.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description: NONE

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property
Description: At 3 pm, three girls around age 11-12 came in to reserve a study room. When they came up to the service desk, one of them showed staff a photo on her phone of shattered glass in one of the panels of the large sliding glass door going from the Multi-purpose Room to the outdoor performance patio. Staff assumed they were walking by afterschool and saw it, so they didn't think to ask them additional questions at that time. Staff notified Branch Manager BL. We put cones and caution tape around the outside of the glass and locked the doors of the MPR Room. By the time BL was able to look at the cameras to find out what happened, we realized it was the same three girls, but they had by then left the building. We could see them throwing rocks out into the desert area, but one girl turned around and threw a rock at the window. It seemed to bounce and she threw another one, but this time it shattered the glass completely, though the glass remained in the frame and didn't fall. She looked really shocked and they gathered their backpacks. Two days later we realized she was in the library with other kids using a meeting room. BL asked to speak to her privately and we went in another room to discuss what happened. She was visibly upset and scared, but said she didn't know what to do at the time. We had a LRPY-style conversation and while I don't think she intentionally tried to damage library property, we talked about how anytime you throw a rock there's a possibility of harm. I suspended her for a month, but asked that she stop at the desk to ask for me when she comes back to the library so we can have another conversation. I will follow up with our LSM for additional guidance.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: LA BM recognized patron from a prior incident at Himmel (0000022313), and notified the branch manager and L1 MK. Since MK had established a rapport with him during the prior incident, she took a copy of the suspension letter from incident 0000022324 at Wilmot and went to speak with him as BM stood by. He was very cooperative and left quietly with a bottle of water. He seemed much more lucid than he had before.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: At approximately 4:35 PM, custodian D reported to LIC CM that a phone belonging to Vet Sec security guard MG had been taken by a patron. It was discovered a few minutes earlier when MG asked D to call his phone and they heard it ringing in the patron's pocket. Patron entered the bathroom. When the patron came out of the bathroom, LIC CM an ML asked the patron to return MG's phone. Patron said he had two phones and that he took his phones out of the charger device tower. ML asked the patron why was MG‘s phone was found in his pocket. The patron repeatedly denied that he took MG's phone.  Patron became angry. He said, "Your cameras are bullshit! I want to see where it shows me taking that phone!"  ML proceeded to tell the patron that he would not be able to return to the library for two weeks, but then the time was extended to three months.

Location: Frank De La Cruz-El Pueblo Library
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1 Any criminal offense    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description:
At 11:50am, Managing Librarian MS, informed a female patron, and male patron Marcus Uriarte, that the library was going to be closing for lunch in 10 minutes. At 11:55 am, Marcus left the library and heads towards the south side of the library. At 12:00 after the library is closed for lunch, a male patron comes up to the door and bangs urgently on the doors. Managing Librarian MS opened the door and says to the patron, "we're closed for lunch, we'll open back up at 1:00".  The patron said urgently, "are the sheriffs still here?" MS responded, "Yes, is everything ok?". The male patron responded back, "there are guys over there smoking drugs and doing a drug deal on that side of the library." Deputy GH immediately goes out, and finds male patron Carlos Garcia with a visibly pregnant female patron  Ethel Mariela Lopez Perez and Marcus Uriarte doing a drug transaction. Uriarte with Crystal Meth in had, and Garcia with money in hand. Deputy GH arrested all 3, cuffed Garcia and Uriarte and had them and Lopez come back in the library so that Managing librarian MS could issue suspension letters. Patron Ethel Mariela Lopez- Perez (who informed Deputy GH that she was 14 weeks pregnant) was found to have drug paraphernalia such as foil with burned marks, and also a used needle. Patron Carlos Garcia was found to have drug paraphernalia such as foil with white residue on it, a meth pipe, and long skinny piece of metal used to clear the meth pipe. Patron Marcus Uriarte was found to have drug paraphernalia such a straw to breathe in drug fumes, and a small bag of Crystal meth. All three were arrested and will be suspended from all PCPL for a year. 
Case number is 230525137

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: Harassment, Stalking, Bullying
Description: MS - starting a new incident report because I couldn't figure out how to trigger an all-library notification. This is notice of a suspension arising from the incident at HIM, where the customer was trying to get personal information about an employee whose name was on the previous warning letter. 3 month suspension for violating the warning letter and escalating to stalking.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.4 Bullying per Pima County B.O.S. Policy D 23.1.
Description:
Michael Bolents called to ask HR to research whether there is a professional agency that investigates library staff who unjustly threaten patrons. He believes that PCPL is guilty of sexism against men, and he states when he called Infoline to request information to support his claim, he was “yelled at” over the phone. He says he then received “a threatening letter claiming her could be forever banished from the library.” He believes that the “hateful standard” that was applied to him is not being applied to other customers and he wants the library to be investigated.
Later in the afternoon, he came into the library and was looking online to try to find information about Main Library staff member CS.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
At approximately 1:35, teen patron Tay went out the front door of the library and was immediately chased back in by a man in a black shirt. The man was shouting at her, threatening to "break her jaw" and "fuck her up" among other threats, while one of his friends egged him on and joined in. Tay was distraught and hid by the information desk. Guard J told the man to leave while LSM EDL called 911. L2 CS took Tay and one of Tay's friends to the back staff area to get away and help Tay calm down.
The man continued to shout threats, and then he and several other men walked off across the plaza. Guards J and R and LIC WW stood guard by the front door in case he returned. CS sat with Tay while she waited for her brother to come pick her up. When the police arrived, Tay spoke to the officer and to CS. She said that the man in the black shirt ("Mark") and his friends had been told that Tay had broken into the man's house, and that he had been threatening her and her brother on and off for a while. As she was talking, she kept receiving audio messages and calls from Mark on Instagram, all containing violent threats and promises that he was "waiting for her" at the Ronstadt Center.
After the officer took Tay's statement, her brother arrived and picked her up.

Infractions: Children in the Library    Children in the Library: Other not listed: Runaway child in distress
Description: IC L1 WW was alerted of an incident wherein a mother had tracked down her runaway daughter to the library and the daughter was in obvious distress and not wanting her mother with her.  The situation soon calmed to the degree that the daughter expressed to her mother that she was suicidal so the mother called 911.  They were led into the Tucson Room until police arrived and then they willingly left with police after about 1/2 hour had passed.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description: Patron "Robert" (the name he gave to PCSD officers) was sitting at last row of computers. He began to have more frequent loud outbursts in response to the videos he was watching on the PC. During the 4 o'clock hour, L1 MNC asked him to keep it down twice as it was disturbing nearby patrons but the patron was barely coherent/responsive each time. At 4:30pm, he began to thrash around violently, quickly rolled backwards in his chair, and started punching the air in front of him, alarming the other patrons at the computers and nearby families and children. L1 MNC requested the assistance of PCSD officers. They were able to calm him down and escort him from the library for the day.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description:
Regular patron Melissa Hermosillo has been eating seeds out of the seed library. Today, while LA ES was on the second floor helping a patron, she heard Melissa shout, "Beans!" over by the seed catalog and saw her walk away with bags seeds in her hand. Shortly thereafter, LA EP found six empty seed bags on the 2nd floor water fountain. Melissa can be seen on security cam footage opening the bags and swallowing all of the seeds with water. ES and LIC CS looked up the seeds in question and determined that they were non-toxic to humans.
CS brought the empty bags down to talk to Melissa. CS told her that she could not eat seeds from the cabinet, as some of them could make her very sick. Melissa replied, "Sick like how? Make me fat?" CS said no, there were seeds in there that could make her throw up or poison her if she ate too many. Melissa said, "Make me thin." She then turned away from CS and walked out of the library, refusing to acknowledge anything else CS said.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: On the morning of May 26th, JH noticed the hose that connects the library garden's drip system to the hose-bib was missing. Camera footage from the previous day, May 25th at 11:14am, revealed a man disconnecting the hose from the hose-bib and garden irrigation system, tucking it into his t-shirt and leaving the property with the hose.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: L2 KW heard loud, jumbled yelling near the 2nd floor restrooms and saw regular patron Melissa Hermosillo speaking to L2 CS. It was difficult to discern what exactly was being said, but CS stated that Melissa was speaking in Spanish, calling CS the devil and thinking that she was possessed. CS reported that she also saw bags of seeds in Melissa's possession, which is relevant because Melissa had  been seen eating the seeds raw in previous days, which can be harmful to physical health. Melissa was making her way down to 1st floor and left before a call to the crisis line could be made.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1 Any criminal offense    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: At 7:02 am, An unknown male patron walks up from the north side and goes to the east side of the library, just caddy corner from the  library front doors, behind the Senior Nutrition Center. He immediately goes to the corner and pulls out foil and can be seen smoking drugs. He later sits down and takes off his shirt and shoes and uses his shirt to pull over his head to smoke the fumes from Fentanyl. Managing Librarian MS walks to the library front doors at 7:47 am and she hears a noise that alerts her. She quickly opens the doors and enters the building. MS checked the footage and saw the drug using patron. The patron goes to the North side of the library and continues to smoke drugs in front of the communication door.  At 8:18 am the patron comes up to the front doors in a high state, and gags. He then head towards the south side of the library and heads to the Laos Center.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating
Description: Patron called to speak with L1 MMM about an incident that took place in the parking lot. After storytime, she and her toddler checked out books and went outside along with another patron and child. She stated that she was approached by a very aggressive woman. The patron had been fastening her child into the back seat when the woman stormed up to them. The patron quickly shut the car door to enclose her child. The woman started to shout out nonsensical phrases and gesticulating. The patron was able to distract her enough to get into the car, and the woman then went to approach the other patron, but the other patron and child were already in their car. The woman then went off shouting to herself and left the parking lot. The patron who called just wanted to alert the library staff to keep us aware of the situation.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: PCHD staff tabling in the lobby reported the smell of chemicals in the women's restroom.  Mgr KW went in to the restroom where one stall was being used and asked that the person not use drugs in the library. Woman in stall declared that it wasn't her, but the PCHD staff said that they were the only ones in the restroom.  KW waited while the woman finished changing clothes and cussing under her breath so that the restroom could be closed while it aired out.  The woman stated that she had never been to this library and she wouldn't be coming back as she asked for KW's name.  The guard CS stated that she had entered about 15 minutes prior to interaction and gone directly into the restroom.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: Young woman came up to desk stating that she had been abducted and raped. Lib 1 JB took patron to private area and called 911 and the Crisis line for support.  She stayed with the patron until she was assisted.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description: Guard J2 came up to the desk and reported that a patron had harassed her in the computer lab. She said he leaned forward and stared at her chest for an extended period of time; when she told him "My eyes are up here," he said, "Don't worry. I enjoyed it. I'm enjoying it." LIC CS and L3 MS went to talk to the patron, who said it was fine and asked if MS felt sexually harassed talking to him. When MS asked him to correct his behavior, the patron accused Guard J of lying and insulted her looks. He accused MS and CS of being "actors" and stated that they would "regret messing with him." He began gathering up his things and continued to promise that staff would "regret this" and that "I'll be back, but you won't," repeating MS's name several times. MS informed him that he would be suspended for 2 weeks for escalating his behavior. While CS and Guard J escorted him downstairs, the patron kept turning around and intentionally staring at CS's chest while repeating that he would be back, but CS, MS and Jen would be fired.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description: IC L1 WW was called to the 3rd floor on the report that there were two individuals in one of the men's room stalls.  As WW was approaching the restroom to check on the incident, a man and a woman quickly walked out of the men's restroom.  WW warned them that the woman needed to be in the women's restroom and if they were caught in a stall together again, they would be suspended from the library.  They apologized and immediately left the building.  Since no behaviors were actually observed, they were not given a suspension.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.8 Smoking, rolling, using tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes
Description:
VetSec Guard VM and staff member PD witnessed an individual smoking outside the front area of the library. After smoking he tossed his materials in the outside trash bin and then entered building. He then went to the computer lab. VetSec Guard VM told LTA FC about situation.  FC notified in charge LI, RL. RL and FC approached patron in lab. RL told him that he was seen smoking on library premises and that is not allowed. He was asked to leave for the day and not to smoke on premises again. He gathered his personal belongings and left the building without any incident. 
There was no Special Duty Officer scheduled at the Branch today.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.2 Guns, weapons, machetes, knives
Description:
Around 2:46pm a regular patron (George) informed VetSec guard VM that he found a weapon and that he had it with him. He then told the guard it was a gun and asked if he could give it into her. VetSec guard VM refused to take the weapon and asked the patron what type of gun it was. Patron (George) then told VetSec guard VM, “I don’t know, maybe a pellet gun.” VetSec guard VM then asked the patron to talk to the librarians about it. He then said, “I do not want to talk to them.” VetSec guard VM then again asked him what type of gun it was. The patron then shouted, “it’s a pistol, okay?!” VetSec guard then came and told L1 VM what was going on. VetSec guard VM emphasized that she thought the patron was angry. The patron’s behavior along with his indication of having a weapon alarmed L1 VM.
L1 VM called LSM EDL and LSM VL to get advice on how to proceed. LSM VL advised L1 VM to call 911.
At 3:03pm L1 VM called 911 and informed them that there was a patron potentially armed with a gun in the library. L1 VM also let 911 dispatch know that this patron had been involved in a few incidents before and that we were concerned there might be some mental health issues associated with his behavior. 911 dispatch told L1 VM they would be sending an officer soon.
At 3:38pm L1 VM received a call from 911 and asked if she could provide a more accurate description of the patron. L1 VM provided the description and let them know he was still in the library. At this point the patron (George) was on one of the computers near the study rooms. 911 dispatch again told L1 VM that an officer would be responding soon.
At 3:48 patron (George) got up from the computer to use the bathroom. The patron remained in the bathroom alone for 10 minutes before he proceeded to exit the library. When the patron walked out of the library, LTA GG locked the double doors to the building and L1 VM called and informed LSM EDL that Valencia was on lockdown. At the same time, 4 police cars pulled into the parking lot. As patron (George) was attempting to ride away on his bike, officers approached him, and they got into a heated exchange with the patron. At one point he called the officers, “assholes” which resulted in them putting him in handcuffs. The officers did recover a gun from his backpack.  
After talking to patron (George) for about 15 minutes, officers let him go. He rode away on his bike. L1 VM and LTA GG then went outside to talk to officers and ask if they felt it was safe to lift the lockdown. Officers said yes, everything was all good. L1 VM then informed patrons and LSM EDL that the lockdown was lifted at Valencia.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Female patron reported to desk staff TS that there was a strong chemical smell in the women's restroom.  Mgr KW went to investigate and found two stalls occupied. KW asked the women using the restroom to please stop using drugs if they were, and evacuate so that we could air out the restroom.  KW could not determine which if either woman was responsible for the chemical smell.  The restroom was locked for 1 hour.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Description: Male patron sitting in aisles between NF and Spanish section kept emitting random outbursts.  After multiple instances, Mgr KW approached him and asked if he needed anything.  He loudly stated that he needed "That man over there has been sitting there for 1400 hours, why don't you do something about him?"  KW stated that we didn't need to worry about other people, but could she help him with anything.  He said no, so KW asked him to please refrain from his outbursts which he agreed to.  A couple of minutes later he loudly used profanity and had additional outbursts.  KW and guard CS proceeded to ask him to leave for the day.  He continued ranting as he walked from the building.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Inappropriate language about a staff member
Description: Sometime during the 2pm desk hour a woman with her two daughters in tow asked to speak with the manager. Lib 1 informed her that the manager was at lunch and asked if she could help her. The woman proceeded to complain about a library page D. She claimed that this page had been "leaning aggressively near children" and also that he had been "staring at her daughters in an inappropriate manner and seemed like a [either perp or perv]. Librarian JM told the woman that as a computer monitor page D was keeping an eye on the computer lab as a whole ready to assist patrons who needed help. The woman insisted that D had been staring directly at her daughters and reiterated that he seemed like a perv (perp)? Not wanting to escalate the situation in front of the woman's daughters JM informed the woman that the manager would be told.  The woman will be given a warning letter if her behavior continues.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Earlier, we received a phone call from a frustrated individual at 520-376-9167. They were upset because our phone system only stated "Pima County Public Library" instead of the specific library they were trying to reach. The person felt we had deleted all information that would have helped identify the library. She aggressively asked why??? When LA ES attempted to assist, the person continued to be rude. The phone call was transferred to librarian VV to give them time to calm down. Unfortunately, when VV answered the call, she was unwilling to speak to the person and hung up due to not having an immediate answer to their question.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: A patron came up to Lib KV and asked if she could get her Aunt out of the Women's restroom.  KV asked why she needed to intervene.  The patron said that the aunt might be misbehaving in the restroom.  KV went in and asked if she was ok. The woman in the stall responded "leave me alone".  KV stated that there was a chemical smell in the restroom and the woman replied that she only smelled oranges which she was peeling in the stall, possibly to mask the chemical smell. KV informed the woman that she would need to leave, which she did.  The restroom was locked to air out for one hour.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: L2 KW received a call that a parent and child had observed someone smoking drugs within the restroom. KW asked her if anyone else was in there and she said no. KW and Ray confirmed illicit drug odor in women's restroom and cleared and locked the restroom for the rest of the day. Upon reviewing security camera footage, it was determined that that woman exiting had been in there smoking. She will be suspended for a year.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.12 Belongings: Leaving unattended, may be removed without notice    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating
Description:
Customer approached vet sec on the morning of 6/1, and told them that they were sick of racism from our staff and that they would be confronting the staff member who allegedly committed these acts. L3MS spoke with customer, and after the customer could produce no specifics, I asked him to not confront the staff member but to call on me instead. Customer described staff member RW, and MS went to get his end of the story to warn him to be vigilant. RW reports having no prior memory of this customer.
On Wednesday the 7th customer approached RW in the stacks and confronted him, accusing him of calling the police on black people in the plaza. RW de-escalated and apologized.
On the morning of the 8th MS approached the customer, and tried to determine if his desire for conflict was done, and he said it was. MS again requested that the customer reach out with complaints of racism.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms    2.7 Not wearing shoes or shirt    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description: At 2:42pm LA DB was alerted to a library customer using the men's restroom to bathe, preventing other people from using the facilities, including some children who had come for a program. Upon entering the restroom, DB encountered a man who had his shirt off and was using the sink to clean himself. He requested that I come in and close the door to talk, to which I responded that I was really just there to ask him to stop bathing at the sink and to explain our policies. He escalated the conversation by interrupting and raising his voice, and as I attempted to explain that we were just asking him to put his clothes back on and exit the restroom, he retreated into the stall and became increasingly aggressive, shouting statements that were nonsensical and highly offensive. I told him I would have to call 911 if he did not leave, but he remained and continued shouting, so I made the call. As I was talking with the dispatcher the man left the library while continuing to yell and disturb the children's program. He left the property at 2:46pm and the 911 call was canceled. He is at the very least out for the day, and we will consult with LG to determine the length of suspension to be imposed.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: Elder neglect
Description: L1 JM made L3 KK aware that there was a St. Joseph's Hospital patient in the lobby without shoes and speaking incoherently.  KK approached the customer and found that the customer's words were grabbled and that she appeared confused.  The 72 year old woman had no possessions except the the hospital scrubs and socks she was wearing.  KK was able to understand that St. Joseph staff had told her that she had to walk to the Cornerstone (?) building.  She wanted to know where the Cornerstone building was.  With the customer's permission, KK called the St. Joseph's ER phone number listed on the customer's paperwork and spoke to Evelyn.  Evelyn said that the customer was a patient who was not showing released.  KK asked if someone from the hospital could come and get the customer.  Evelyn said that she didn't think anyone was available. KK asked the customer if she thought she could walk back to the ER with KK and Guard DJ escorting her.  The customer said yes.  As they walked, KK realized that the customer was unsteady so KK and DJ held her arms to steady her until they were able to grab a wheelchair from the ER parking lot.  At one point, the customer thought that they were walking to St. Mary's Hospital and shared that she had had a seizure.  When the 3 arrived at the ER, Charge Nurse Stacy advised KK that the customer had been released and was "fine" to walk on her own.  KK pointed out the socks on the customer's feet, the fact the the customer was having difficulty communicating, and that the customer was confused.  KK said that when the hospital had left customers in this condition on library grounds in the past and one of the ensuing situations had been life threatening.  Stacy asked KK and DJ to step outside so that patients waiting for care in the lobby would not overhear the discussion.  Once outside, Stacy stated that a doctor had discharged the customer.  KK told her that the customer was confused, frail, and in no condition to be left without transportation.  Stacy said that the customer was homeless and that her insurance did not cover transportation.  KK said that she had spoken to the hospital patient advocate after previous situations and that the advocate said they could issue transportation vouchers.  Stacy said that she could not authorize a travel voucher.  She said that a House Charge (?) had to do that.  KK offered to speak to the House Charge.  Stacy declined the offer and said that she would "handle it."  L1 JD was concerned for the customer's safety and drove by the ER at about 5:15pm.  The customer was outside the ER in a wheelchair with a woman standing next to her apparently waiting for a ride.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description:
LA GL informed me of  a verbal altercation between two customers at the PC area. Upon approaching the area, I observed a female patron standing up and gathering her belongings at the PC. The woman was visibly upset. I asked her if she was ok. She told me that a male individual sitting on a PC next to hers disturbed her with his behavior. According to the woman, she was typing an important legal document on behalf of her daughter pertaining to" domestic violence and pedophilia", and other private things. The male next to her kept looking at her screen. She asked him to move away but he would not move nor look away. She turned the display slightly so that the angle of vision changed  but the guy moved closer and kept looking, and it caused her fear.
I expressed my sympathy to the woman and offered her to relocate to a different PC in the lab area but she said, "No, it's ok, I do not feel safe here" and asked to be escorted back to her car. LA GL honored her request. I apologized to the woman and invited her to come back later.
During my conversation with the woman, the guy on the PC next to her listened to our talk but pretended to ignore it, sitting straight and looking at his screen. 
After the woman left, another customer in the vicinity who witnessed the incident, reported to me that the woman was right in her complains, as this customer observed the guy's "stalking behavior" towards the woman, and despite the woman's pleas to move away and not to look at her screen, the guy invaded her personal space and stared at the woman's screen. 
The staff did not directly observed the incident, and report it here for documentation purposes. We continue to keep an eye on the male customer.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Guard DJ reported to L3 KK  a strong chemical smell coming from one of the lobby restrooms.  The smell permeated the entire lobby.  The restroom was closed.  The individual using the restroom exited the library immediately after his restroom use.  Staff was unable to talk to him.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description:
Branch Manager MS was walking to the lab to check on a work order for one of the windows. Seeing that it was done, she turned around and started walking towards the desk, walking  around  a group of computers that were close to the front desk, when a female patron made a scoffing noise. Thinking that she was needing help on the computer, Branch manager MS went close to the patron when she exclaimed, “I can’t get any privacy around here!”, MS stopped in sock, and then the patron exclaimed again, covering her computer, “Don’t look at my computer!” MS replied back, “Ma’am, I was not looking at your computer, you made a noise and I thought that you needed help.” Branch Manager MS started to walk away, and the patron mumbled something along the lines of “I didn't make a noise.” MS went to the staff area when she was informed by library page AM that this same patron was in the computer lab earlier that day and was accusing another regular male patron that he was following her. At 5:36 the same patron went up to LIB 1 DB, and began to tell her that people are fallowing her. The patron left afterwards.
 
for documentation purposes

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: Hiding Books and Leaving Inappropriate Signs
Description:
A patron called to report a sign she saw near our Pride Display that she felt was inappropriate. Once staff looked, they found handmade 8.5x11 signs written in marker and crayon that said "Happy memorial Month The only Pride i have is for my country And it's fallen" Staff later found found more of these signs at computer tables, on the book displays in tween and teen, and facedown in the chairs in the tween area. 
Staff also found several books with LGBTQ+ themes hidden or turned around on the displays. The hidden books has been an ongoing issue for over a year, so we are unsure if it is the same person.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: A man came in to the library to use the restroom.  He asked our Guard VM to unlock the bathroom for him.  The man was in the restroom for an extended period of time (about 28 minutes).  During this time our Guard VM heard the toilet flush several times.  Finally, Guard VM went in to tell him his time was up.  When she open the door she immediately smelled a strong burning smell coming from the restroom.  The man left the building, walked toward the Valencia Library sign on Valencia and stood there for several minutes swaying and making odd movements.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description: Customer was in the women's restroom washing their face, hands, arms, and between their legs, mumbling loudly and incoherently about not wanting to be touched. Guard RP and Manager HR entered the restroom and repeated multiple times that the customer could not bathe in the library and would need to leave. Eventually the customer complied, after making a mess all over the restroom floor. The customer went outside and shredded piles of paper on an outside bench, pacing back and forth with agitation, yelling profanities. Staff attempted to reach a community crisis line to seek assistance for the customer, but as it was after 5:00, couldn't reach anyone.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating
Description: At about 4:50 PM as the library was getting ready to close, teen patrons Chance and Tristan began threatening another patron. They wanted to go outside to fight. When L1 PC went outside to break it up, Chance and Tristan denied any wrong-doing. They will be suspended for one month.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.2 Guns, weapons, machetes, knives~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: At 9:40 am LIC JB went into the lobby to unlock the restroom doors.  A young adult patron was banging on the west-facing doors and demanding to be let in.  JB stated, "We open in 20 minutes." Patron responded that they needed to charge their phone.  JB repeated "We open in 20 minutes" and the patron banged on the door hard enough to rattle the glass shouting "Please!  I really got to charge my phone."  JB repeated "We open in 20 minutes" and walked away.  JB asked LSM KD to back her up and they returned to the lobby where the patron was using a pocket knife to try and pick the lock.  KD stated "We are not open.  You need to wait until we are open."  The patron left and we opened without incident.  Patron returned around 1:15 pm but staff chose not to confront him because there was no guard.

Description: An unknown man tried to use one of those litter-grabbing arm tools to try retrieving our quarantine box, which was behind our side gate at the time. He did not succeed and instead broke the plastic box with the tool, then left.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.4 Vandalizing property~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.3 Food or beverage: unclean, disruptive, or damaging    3.4 Eating at computer    3.5 Failure to clean up after eating/drinking
Description:
Approximately 4:15pm, Adre, Shia, Damien, and Vicente were warned by LA CR that if they were going to use the teen room, they needed to leave it clean and tidy. They agreed and entered the teen room. Adre flipped off the camera. All four children were eating at the computers and left a sticky mess.
About 4:20pm, suspended patron Malachi entered the teen room and began to write profanity on library tables, including right between Damien and Adre. Nobody in the room joined in, but nobody intervened or made any effort to clean up any of the mess.
As Malachi is suspended and has been reminded of this many times, for trespassing and damaging library property he will have his suspension extended by a month. Adre is currently doing LRPY for a previous infraction and will be suspended for the rest of the week for flipping off the camera and leaving a mess, which he has been repeatedly warned about. Shia, Damien, and Vicente will each be out for today for leaving a mess.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description: At approximately 3:20 pm, a patron informed LIC CM that the patron at computer #10 was verbalizing racial remarks toward the patron on computer #9, stating that he said, “Go back where you came from.” Patron #9 is of Middle Eastern heritage. CM spoke with Vet Sec security guard MG and TPD Officer J about patron #10. At that time, another patron approached them and said that he also heard patron #10’s remarks. MG and Ofc J observed patron #10, at CM’s request, while CM got a copy of the Code of Conduct brochure. CM also informed branch manager OC that there was an active incident. CM and OC, along with MG and Ofc. J approached patron #10 at the computer, informing him that they needed to speak to him. He was escorted to the front lobby of the library where he was told by CM and CO that two unrelated patrons heard and reported his remarks, and that racist and offensive remarks would not be tolerated in the library. CM then told him that he would be suspended for one month, and was explained what the suspension meant. He was also offered a copy of the Code of Conduct, but did not take it. He said that he understood, and left the premises without incident.

Description: Javier Rich entered and asked the staff at the desk when his suspension would end.  Staff gave him the date on his most recent suspension letter. He left without any incident. No extension to his suspension is being issued at this time.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: LTA SUP JH and Guard RP approached suspended patron Waymon Smith at public cpu number 8 to notify of him of his suspension from all pima county libraries through 6/15/2023. Jh showed Waymon the letter and he said aggressively that "y'all want to play" to which JH responded "not really". JH gave him a moment to collect his belongings from charge station and log out. On his way out Waymon asked what JH name was to which JH responded his name. WS then left without incident.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal
Description: A regular customer (A) has been coming in with his dog on a daily basis.  The dog is normally calm, but today another customer (B) came in with his dog, and when A passed B, A's dog barked at B's dog.  Guard RP spoke to the man and said that since his dog was barking, they would have to leave for the day.  The man complied, and walked out of the library.  Right outside the entrance of the library, the customer started yelling at the dog and handled it very roughly, forcing it to lie on its back and hold it down while the customer continued to yell and kick at it. This caused staff to feel very uncomfortable.  Lib 3 LM and guard RP went outside to talk to the man.  RP asked him to stop yelling at his dog.  The customer told guard RP to f*** off, and then left the library.  The customer will be suspended for one week.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: LAs NB, RG and L3 KK were in the work area and heard screaming and shouting coming from the outside as well as a revving engine.  The person shouting sounded enraged.  The three went outside to investigate and saw a three-wheeled motorcycle rapidly drive by.  KK spoke to a witness in the area who said that there had been a verbal altercation between the library delivery truck driver and the motorcycle rider.  Security footage showed the motorcycle driving dangerously in front of the delivery truck as it was negotiating a three point turn.  It also showed that the motorcycle blocked the delivery driver from driving away. KK spoke to the motorcycle driver at the service desk.  He admitted to driving dangerously close to the delivery truck driver and said that the driver yelled at him causing him to lose his temper.  The man admitted to being asked to leave QUI a half an hour before and wanted to know if he was suspended.  KK called L3 LM at QUI to ascertain if the customer was suspended.  Based on that conversation, KK told the customer that he had to leave for the day and that he should call Library Admin regarding his suspension length.  The customer said that he was experiencing homelessness and that being in the heat would put his dog's life as risk. KK referred him to a nearby cooling station.  The customer said that he had a disability preventing him from using it.  After considerable discussion, the customer left.

Description: (for documentation purposes) Patron observed broken glass in stall #4 of women's public restroom and reported to front desk. LTA-S S.G. and LA W.B. checked to see small amounts of broken glass mainly concentrated under the toilet paper dispenser, and fragments spread across floor. A faint unknown smell was detected, possibly alcohol. They swept back the glass and shut the stall door. LSM VL was called as the LIC was at lunch. Based on the possibility the smell was not chemical/drug in nature, it was decided to put an out of order sign on the stall open for use and entered a facilities request for removal of the glass.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description:
On the morning of 6/16/23, Joanne Flowers came up to the desk and told LIC KM that she needed a lot of help with copying and she's too tired to do it herself and our printer always "times out" on her. KM agreed to help, then informed her that she is not allowed to speak to staff the way that she did two days ago, while we were trying to close, and this was a verbal warning. She immediately told her that she has a head injury, we don't call out the closing announcement loud enough, and "I was about to shit my pants!", etc. KM told her that, while we would make an commitment to make a loud announcement, she would not be allowed to insult and be rude to staff.
During the course of the morning, as LTA GP was helping her, she observed her being extremely rude to a customer. KM again approached Ms. Flowers, this time in the adult area, to let her know that, not only is she not allowed to talk rudely to staff, that also goes for our patrons. She again reiterated that this was her warning and next time we would ask her to leave for an extended amount of time. Flowers said, "fine," put her things together then left for the day.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description:
Staff MN received a customer complaint about another customers taking too long in the men's restroom. DB and MN attempted to check on the customer and advise him that others were waiting to use the facilities, he began to shout, using profanity and demanding that staff "shut up" and leave him alone. I heard the shouting and went to see what was happening. DB briefly explained the status, and that he'd asked that the customer vacate the restroom in the next five minutes. DB and I stayed nearby to monitor the situation.
A few minutes later, the individual emerged from the restroom, shouting at staff and approaching the customers waiting in a challenging manner, pointing at one of them and yelling "if you have a problem, let's go outside". These threats by the individual were also directed at staff DB.  DB discouraged the other customer from engaging with him, while I tried to talk to the shouting customer. On seeing the situation escalating and the person becoming more and more threatening, staff JH placed a call to 911. It took a few minutes for the customers to realize that staff was on the phone with law enforcement, but when he did, he left quickly.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.4 Eating at computer    3.5 Failure to clean up after eating/drinking
Description:
Two teenage boys come in most days to use the computers. On numerous occasions we have asked them to lower their voices and not use curse words in the library. At the beginning of the 1:00 hour another computer user complained about the noise level of the two boys. Librarian JNB told him that she had not noticed them being too loud but would pay closer attention to them. After about 10 minutes they got louder again and JNB went over and asked them to please lower their voices. They complied.
About 30 minutes later Librarian JNB noticed they were eating out of a bag of chips that were coated in a red flavor. As she noticed this the boys mother walked over. JNB approached and said "You probably were not aware but we do not allow eating at the computers. You may take them to the table to eat just not at the computer." The older boy responded by saying I do this every other day and no one has ever said anything. When JNB responded with I am sorry but we need to protect our computer equipment and keep it sanitary for others the boy said, "That is why I pushed my chair back" His chair was pushed back 6 inches at most. At this point JNB said, "Other staff just haven't noticed before but it is in our customer code of conduct if you would like a copy I can get you one." Throughout this exchange Mom just stood there, starring at JNB and saying nothing. After a moment of silence in which the boys continued to eat out of the chip bag JNB said I am waiting for you to remove the food from the computers and if you don't comply I will ask you to leave for the day. Mom responded with "OMG" as she picked up the bag. At this point JNB walked away. Mom and older boy left shortly after that while the younger boy stayed. 
Librarian AB notified JNB that yesterday the boys left a mess of food at the computers. JNB mentioned that in charge people will just need to pay more attention to notice if they continue to eat over there.
Only a verbal warning has been issued at this time.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: A patron brought an animal crate with her to a supervised visit with her children.  LA NG asked her to please keep the animal in the crate and the mother agreed saying "Yes."  10 minutes later NG saw the mother and child holding a rabbit, feeding it lettuce, and the padding from its' crate was on the floor.  NG told her only service animals were allowed in the building and the mess would need to be cleaned up.  The mother responded, "Yes, mother".  The person supervising the visit apologized and promised she would not let them enter the building if the animal returned.  JB and the social worker agreed that she would not be permitted to stay at the library if any further infractions were committed or if she brought the animal again.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.5 Indecent exposure, public indecency, lewd, other sexual offense    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description: Customer alerted Guard, DJ, that a male customer was acting strangely in the library. He was walking and falling to the ground, getting up and walking a bit, then falling down again. Guard and Librarian, JD, found the customer in the children's non-fiction stacks. He was bent over from the waist with his pants down below his buttocks. He did have on underwear.  Librarian asked him what he was doing. He stood up and said he was just looking around. Librarian asked him to pull up his pants. Asking more questions, the librarian asked him to ask for help and to move away from the children's area to the computer area after he said he wanted to use a computer. As the librarian turned to walk away, the customer said in a somewhat under the breath voice while looking at the guard, "bitch ass". Librarian immediately instructed the man to go to the front of the library. He started walking asking why. Librarian told him in a firm voice that he could not talk to employees in that way. He continued to question why he was being asked to move to the door, but did comply.  In the lobby, he was told what he had said was not allowed in the library and directing it to a staff member was not acceptable. He argued that the guard was lying, but did leave when Librarian said she heard it too. Customer was told to leave and could not be in the library for the rest of the day.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Regular patron S came to the desk and said that Sylvia was bothering him.  LA NG could hear her shouting that he was weak and that he was an idiot.  Sylvia said several times "I will take care of him. Do you know what C4 is?  I'm not going to blow anything up, but do you know what it is?"  She looked at NG and said, "you are nice but you are a weak public servant."  Guard JQ was monitoring the situation from the entrance to the cafe.  LIC JB came out and stood behind NG.  NG informed Sylvia that she would have to leave for the day.  She said that she would never come back here again. Sylvia looked at JB and said I like you.  Are you going to escort me out? And JB said "Yes."  JQ and JB walked Sylvia to the door while she continued speaking about her work with the government and how she can make people like S disappear.  At the door, Sylvia turned to JB and said "You are weak.  They would never let you in the military."  JB answered, "That is correct." Sylvia nodded and walked out.  She sat by one of the front planters and JB explained she was still on the property.  Sylvia snapped that she was waiting for a ride.  JB left her because there were no other patrons for her to speak to and JQ watched to make sure she didn't harass anyone.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
At 11:30, Female Patron #1 was briefly approached by Female Patron #2 at the copier. Staff did not hear or witness the exchange, but Patron #1 began yelling, swearing and pointing at the other patron as she was leaving. L1 MNC spoke with Patron #1 about her behavior but she continued to shout threats at the other patron who had already left at this point. The patron then gathered her papers and exited the branch. 
Patron #1 got into her vehicle and then stopped in front of the library entrance to yell at the guard. L1 MNC and LTA Sup FA heard the shouting outside and went to investigate. L1 MNC stated that this was not acceptable behavior and told her to leave for the day.
The patron's mother called the branch later in the day demanding to know why the patron had been asked to leave and cited "anti-white racism" as the reason. Branch Manager TFL took the call and stated that she could not address the issue with her since the patron was an adult. TFL provided the mother with her contact info and invited the patron to call back if she wished to discuss the incident further.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description:
A group home of minors was in the library in the teen area. This group has come in previously, and we have never had a complaint as to their behavior. 
At around 1:30 p.m, once of the workers for the group home came up to me and told Librarian I MH there was an older man calling the teens assholes. MH took a copy of the code of conduct and followed the worker downstairs to the non-fiction and teen area to talk to the man. The man was sitting at the window laptop bar near the end of the 900's. This is the farthest seat one can sit at the laptop bar in relation to the teen area. MH told him she had been made aware of some language being used that was unacceptable in the library. The man told her that the teens were personally insulting him, whispering, and giggling. MH asked him what sort of behavior had happened that was insulting to him. He did not give her a specific answer. He packed up his bag and said he was leaving for the day since they were giggling and being disruptive. As he was walking away, MH told him the teens are allowed to giggle in the library.
Below is an account by the group home worker as to what happened before coming to the front desk for help:
"Two of our members [the teens at the group home] were sitting a the table, giggling and whispering when a man told them to shut up and called them assholes, when I told him, "excuse me sir can you please watch the language with my minors." He responded back with calling me a whore and saying they probably have heard worse things.
-Desert River
Alicia Bradley BHT"
The worker gave her verbal consent to include this written account of the event.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.1 Manipulating or bypassing library rules, such as computer use
Description: Tristen and Zen used computers for 4 hours with guest passes. They then logged in with their library cards. Staff had to talk to them at least twice today about their volume and food at the computers. Lib II SW told them they had to log off the computers because there is a four hour limit. They logged off the computers, left briefly, and then returned to the library.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description: A male customer who has been coming to QUI regularly came up to the information desk and asked L3 LM if she could take a picture of his car and send it to his phone for him because he said his camera wasn't working.  LM explained that she doesn't use her personal device to send photos to customers.  The man argued with her and asked why she couldn't do it, but eventually left the desk.  After LM was helping other customers, she saw that the man was now asking LA CS the same question. CS gave him a similar answer.  The man said he would then ask other customers in the library to take a picture of his car for him.  LM advised him not to do that, because they would most likely not want to for the same reasons.  The man began to argue aggressively, asking why LM and others wouldn't help him out, repeatedly asking, "Why is it not lawful?"  He wouldn't leave the desk, and customers were waiting for help, so LM went to get vet sec guard RP to help out.  LM and RP talked to him for a while when LM noticed that the man was filming them, holding his cell phone at his waist.  He told LM that she was acting entitled.  LM asked him to leave for the day, and said that if he didn't, she would call 911.  When the customer refused to leave, LM did call 911.  The man came up to the desk while she was on the phone, argued for a long time, and eventually left.  This customer has been problematic in the past, asking for specific staff members to help him out, and refusing help from others who are working at the desk.  He will be suspended for failure to comply with staff requests, disrupting library operations and harassing staff.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Description: Customer Lisa Ben Dror emailed library administration making false, sexist and hateful comments about 2 male staff members.  She accused staff of stalking, overreaching, staring, swipe walking, and threatening her as well as violently banging chairs against desks in order to scare her.  She reported that staff was "brazenly sitting with arms crossed explicitly glaring at me right behind my back."  She stated that the staff member looked "predatory" and called him a "perpetrator." She described herself as a "woman and citizen" and said staff's behavior was "illegal" and the situation was "domestic violence and workplace violence and harassment."  She stated that both male employees should be "moved out of Murphy Wilmot and kept away from women." She referred to the situation as a "psychotic, sociopath thing."  She stated that "female only or outside managers should be documenting this employee" and indicated that the complaint should be forwarded to HR.  She finally asked if she could film staff in the library "to document government employees behaviors."  A response was given from admin and code of conduct policy was highlighted for customer around their behavior.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: At about 3:55 L1 KN noticed a strong smell consistent with illegal drug use coming from the men's restroom. LTA supervisor JA and L2 KM confirmed, and the restroom was locked with an air purifier running inside. Video footage shows unknown patron entering the restroom at 3:39 and exiting at 3:49.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking
Description: Around 1:15 Page MG was helping a regular patron who only spoke Spanish. The patron then made some comments about Page MG that made her uncomfortable leading her to lock herself in the snack room and call Manager VV. VV walked out of the office and approached the snack table to see if she could find the patron MG was concerned about. the only patron at the snack table was a different Spanish speaker but not the one MG was avoiding. VV escorted MG to the back and told her to stay back there till the end of her shift at 2pm. After viewing the video footage we were able to confirm the patron that was harassing MG was a regular and will be given a 6 month suspension as this isn't his first infraction making inappropriate comments to staff and making them uncomfortable.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: At about 2:35pm, a regular patron came to the desk. He let LA SD know that there was "a mess" in the men's bathroom, saying that two of the three toilet stalls were clogged and that someone was in the bathroom "doing something they shouldn't." SD knocked on the door and poked their head into the men's restroom, where there was an overpowering burnt plastic smell. SD closed the men's bathroom and locked the women's to open upon request, so that SRO still has a working restroom. User is identified as another regular patron, name unknown. Upon review of security camera, he enters the bathroom at 1:05, then leaves at 1:45, then leaves at 2:10, then re-enters at 2:15 and exits at 2:40. Customer will be suspended for one year.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Patron came to desk and informed L1 JM that there was liquid, possibly urine on the floor of the North lobby restroom. JM checked the restroom and noted a strong chemical smell that indicated drug use. She could not determine if the liquid was urine but is was next to the toilet so a facilities request for cleanup was made and the restroom was put out of order.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating
Description: L1 AB observed Patron A (male) grabbing Patron B (female) roughly on the upper arms and seemingly demanding his phone. Patron B told Patron A that it was in his back pocket, then pulled away and left the library before L1 AB could intervene. Patron A followed Patron B outside briefly, then came back inside and went to the phone charging locker to try and retrieve his phone from locker 6, which indicated that it still had something in it. Minutes later, Patron A came to the desk and told L1 AB and LA SB that he couldn't get into the locker. LA SB reset the lockers and opened locker 6, which was empty. Patron A said Patron B took his phone and LA SB apologized. Patron B promptly left to try and catch up to Patron A, who had left the property by this point.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description: Regular customer came to the front desk to ask about the policy of people using the front porch. LTA Supervisor, AP, explained the policy. They reported to AP that two Jehovah Witness ladies on the porch were using negative language directed at transgender people. Librarian JD spoke to the ladies and explained that such language was not allowed on library property. They said they were privately talking about another experience, but did admit that they were talking about a related topic. They said they were not directing their private conversation to any customer. They were instructed to refrain from speaking in such a way in the future, even in private, while on county property. They were also reminded that their volume of personal discussions was being heard by customers. As librarian was speaking to them, the customer came to the front desk to say it was okay, but AP explained that it was already being addressed by the librarian and that any such discriminatory or hate comments would not be tolerated today or in the future. Customer appeared to be satisfied with explanation of how the policy was applied.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: At approximately 2:20 pm, TPD Officer AF reported to LIC CM that his water bottle was missing from his library station table. He stated that he was assisting in the Happy City program in the large meeting room, when he returned to his table and noticed the water bottle missing. CM reported the incident to Branch Manager CO. CO accessed the branch cameras and viewed two patrons on video, Patron #1 removing the water bottle from the table, and handing it to Patron #2. Patron #2 was seen placing the water bottle in his backpack. The time on the videos was 1:55 pm. Both patrons were then viewed on the video gathering their belongings and exiting the library. The patrons had left the premises before AF noticed his water bottle missing.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description: FOR DOCUMENTATION PURPOSES ONLY:  Staff member AM called to notify LTA Sup. LM that a male was seen video taping vehicles parked directly outside the library.  LM let Branch Manager MS know what was relayed through the phone conversation and both went to check on the reported activity.  The male was seen by the Sheriff's substation videotaping the outside of the patrol cars and leaning in to videotape through the windows.  Since all of this was videotaping was conducted off of library property, no further actions were taken.  LM & MS suspect this might be related to a First Amendment Audit.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property

L3 AG went to confirm that the door to the container was open but still locked, and the container itself had been put into the full/locked position even though it was completely empty. AG was able to reset the container to still be usable and relocked the container door. For tracking purposes.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description:
Staff DS observed a customer piling books and magazines on the lounging furniture in the teen area. The customer left the area briefly. This male customer has been suspected of taking library materials prior to this incident, so DS went to alert me of his presence.  When I arrived in the teen area, the individual was in the area and the materials were not found. While I was addressing another incident (#22566), the man left the building with two full backpacks that had been empty when he arrived. After the man left, another customer in the library also reported to DS that they had seen the man stuff his bags with library materials. 
Through the rest of the evening the security camera recording shows that the man can be seen lying across the North-side sidewalk in varying degrees of consciousness.
Staff called for medical assistance, per customer request. Officers responded and were followed up by paramedics soon after.
