Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description: Two people were camping outside of the employee entrance, at the electrical box by our dumpster, they attached a cardboard covering to the electrical box to use as shade and had all their belongings underneath.  LA NG let them know that this was a safety issue as well as against library policy but that they could come into the library at 10am and stay for the day for respite from the heat so long as they packed up and not camp there anymore.  They were compliant.  After several minutes, LA NG went back out with homeless shelter resources and L1 JB accompanied for backup, and LA NG provided the resources to them and let them know there is a free phone they can use in the library.  The two people asked for 20 more minutes to get their belongings together and packed up and we said that was fine.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: A patron brought in a box of zucchini to share, and some of the zucchini was rotten. Staff was helping patron separate and clean zucchini at the kitchen sink and tripped on secondary matt, falling into patron who also fell to the ground. Staff called 911 to assess the patron. Patron refused transfer for further medical evaluation.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Sub L TS stated that a patron reported a woman sitting on the floor of the women's bathroom and that there was a strong odor in the bathroom.  L1 JB and LA NG went to the bathroom - no one was sitting on the floor but there was one woman in a stall.  There was a strong chemical odor in the bathroom.  LA NG went to get a "restroom out of order sign" so that the bathroom could be locked.  The woman in the stall had come out and was standing in front of the bathroom mirror, taking @ 10min to fix her hair and makeup and use the sink to wet her hair, then put on a jacket and stumbled out of the bathroom, holding toilet paper to cover her face, and left the library.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property
Description: On Monday morning, staff discovered a large scorch mark on the purple bench outside our front door. The paint is ruined and there is ash on the ground beneath the bench. We don't have exterior cameras out front, so there is no way to know who damaged the bench or what they were burning.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: it was around 5:48 pm when LA TF and LTA ML heard a loud noise of something falling and hitting the floor. They went to investigate and found a patron laying on the floor, while the patron was still on the floor unable to move TF offered to call 911 but the patron declined the offer. LTA informed L1 SG of the situation and both went to the cafe area to assist the patron. The patron couldn't get up receiving assistance of other patrons and library staff to stand up and sit down in one of the chairs. The patron seemed confused and disoriented. L1 SG offered to call 911, but the patron refused assistance stating that they just needed to rest for a little while. Librarian SG checked on them again around closing time, and the patron couldn't get up. After 6:07 pm with the assistance of Guard CS and other patron helped the patron to stand up and walk towards the entrance door and agreed to call staff to call 911 for medical assistance. L1 SG called 911 around 6:10 pm and kept communication with the 911 operator and the patron who was sitting in the library's front entrance. Guard CS, LA TF and L1 SG remained outside of the building with the patron until paramedics arrived around 6:19 pm. After emergency medical assistance was on site library staff left the building around 6:30 pm.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description: At approximately 10:20am a young teen came to the desk and stated that another teen had punched him in the head.  LTA Supervisor JF and L1 SG went to the teen area to talk with the teens.  The teen who was punched said that Cheveyo had been sticking gum on the mouse and would not stop.  Cheveyo stated that it was his personal mouse (it was) and that he could do that.  Further, he stated it wasn't even his gum, it was gum from under the table.  Cheveyo then shut down and would not engage with anyone, and would not give us his side of what happened.  L1 SG meanwhile was talking to the younger teen calming him down. Because Cheveyo did hit someone, we let him know he needed to leave for the day, but was welcome to come back tomorrow

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: SO VM notified manager IR that a man exiting the restroom had left a chemical smell behind. IR checked the restroom and confirmed a strong burnt chemical small consistent with the smell of smoked chemical drugs like meth or fentanyl. The man had walked back into the library and IR approached him to let him know of the library code of conduct. IR could smell the chemical smell left on his clothes, and she let the man know that the consequence of breaking the rule about using drugs in the restroom is a one year suspension, and that he was now suspended, but he could return in one year. IR let him know that the suspension could be appealed by contacting library administration. The man had left behind a bag with some important belongings, so he walked around the library looking for the bag before leaving the library. About 20-30 minutes later, the man returned to ask about his belongings, which had been found in the interim. He left the property without additional incident.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.1 Harassment: Filming or photographing without permission    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description:
While on desk during the 2-3pm hour on Tuesday, 6/27, LTA TB noticed two teenage girls standing in front of Toshiba #2 while taking a picture. One of the teens appeared to be taking a picture of the printing instructions. A patron on computer #14 yelled at her to not take pictures of her. The teens were moving toward the entrance and told the patron on computer #14 that they weren’t taking pictures of her. Patrons on computers #11 and #12 then walked quickly and complained to the Sheriff’s in the lobby. TB talked to the patrons shortly thereafter and computer patron #11 said that the two teens had been bullying his girlfriend all day. The boyfriend said that the two teens shut off the light while his girlfriend was in the bathroom. TB told him it appeared as if the teen was taking pictures of the printing instructions, but that he would pass on this information to the librarian in charge. Once the two teens left the library, the situation de-escalated quickly and TB reported the situation to L1 MNC and LTA Sup FA.
The two teens had been cautioned by Branch Manager TFL during the week of 6/19 to not leave their belongings unattended in the Children's Area or lay down in front the shelves in a way that impedes staff and patron access to materials. 
They will be given a verbal warning and a reminder to be courteous to other library patrons when they return.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description:
Librarian I KB was standing near the service desk, at the front gate, when library customer Paige walked by her with a 40-oz Miller in a clear, glass bottle in her right hand. KB confirmed with LA NG that he, too, thought she was carrying a full bottle of beer. KB followed Paige into the reading area with a plastic bag for Paige to store the unopened bottle. When KB approached Paige, who was now seated in a chair in the reading area, Paige opened the bottle and took a swig. Before KB could even say a word, Paige looked KB in the eye and say, "Uh uh," which KB took to mean, Don't you dare tell me I can't drink in here. KB then told her she can't drink in the library. Paige responded that tobacco and tobacco products are prohibited but she could drink anywhere she wanted. KB offered to get her the Code of Conduct, but Paige said she didn't want it. She asked again why she couldn't drink her beer, and KB responded that it was a library and not a bar and that we don't have a liquor license, to which Paige said she knows the law. I asked her to close up the beer and put it in the bag. She refused to take the bag, put the screw top back on the bottle, and got up and left the building, all the while being mildly combative.
Paige returned a few minutes later, passing Branch Manager KK and KB on the desk on her way to the restroom. Paige stopped at the desk after exiting the restroom, asking KK for KB. KK identified herself as the manager, asked Paige her name and what the issue was. Paige said that KB was rude and that we needed to post the Code of Conduct because otherwise how would people know that they can't drink alcohol in the library. Paige also said something about Arizona and Christians and laws. After this exchange, Paige again left the library.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal
Description:
Patron has lately become a regular at Himmel and brings a large husky-type service dog. However, the dog exhibits behavior like putting its front paws on the counter, barking, and lunging at or trying to jump up on staff. 
Librarian MK has spoken to the patron before and let her know that the dog could not bark in the library, and the patron repeatedly said that they are "working on it." Today, she spoke to her about the other behavior and emphasized that on days the dog is behaving disruptively, it must leave the library, and we are happy to give the patron assistance inside the library if required. Again, the patron stated that they were "working on it," added that he was in training and he was "registered," and made some efforts to curb the dog's behavior, which she has not in the past. The dog is welcome if it can behave in an appropriate service-dog fashion. 
Afterward, Guard R told MK that he has seen the woman direct the dog to drink from the drinking fountain in the hallway, and he has informed her that she can't do that. Staff has also seen her invite patrons to pet the dog when they notice him. This is for documentation purposes.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description: 3 people were camping next to the electrical box, using cardboard that they attached to the electrical box for shade).  LA NG saw them as she was coming in from lunch and let them know that they couldn't stay there.   LA NG went into the employee's entrance to clock in and learned that LTA Supervisor JF had already notified the guard, who went out to ensure they were packing up.  LA NG went back out to gave them each left over breakfast snacks and a list of Cooling Stations as they were packing up the rest of their belongings, and the Guard and LA NG let them know they could also come into the library out of the heat - one of them had a shopping cart and was walking away and said "no, I don't want my stuff stolen" and left.  One of them stayed behind to help clean up their trash and then left.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description:
The police officer on duty GR went to use the men's restroom around 2:45 pm and started to smell a drug substance in the stall next to him. Officer GR had started telling the person that he needed to come out and shouldn't be doing drugs in the library. Patron denied smoking and the officer started to raise his voice to let the patron know he needed to leave. Security guard on duty MG went into the restroom when he heard yelling to investigate, immediately after entering, he could smell that there had been drug use and asked the officer what happened. MG went to get In-Charge person LF and let her know the men's restroom had a strong drug odor and that there was only one person in the restroom at the time the officer smelled it so the patron currently inside did need to be asked to leave. LF went with MG into the restroom and immediately stepped back out due to the odor and waited by the hallway entrance for the patron guard and officer to come out. LF asked MG if he got the patron's name, and he hadn't yet so we asked the patron what his name was and he complied. He let us know his name is Mike Lopez and at first, kept denying the drug use saying " I haven't done anything and I’m just trying to go home" Officer GR said, "No, we know it was you, you were the only one in there, were you smoking blues, I know what they smell like." Mike Lopez said no to smoking blues but then admitted he did smoke in the restroom. After LF let the patron know that because of the fact he had been using inside the library, he will be suspended for one year. After the patron left LF went to get more details from Officer GR and he let her know that the patron had clogged the toilet when trying to flush the drug paraphernalia. 
Edited 7/3/2023 to include Name/Description and Suspension end date on 6/28/2024.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description: Regular patron complained to the construction workers laying tile on the 1st floor that they were being too loud. The patron denied using racial language, but did say that the construction worker was a "dumb sh*t." MB informed him that wasn't okay to say either and said he was not allowed to harass staff or workers in the library. He was asked to leave for the day.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description: FOR REPORTING PURPOSES ONLY:  LTA Supervisor LM, heard a child crying by the indoor bookchute and saw a father consoling his daughter.  LM walked over to assess the situation and offer to help.  The father said that his daughter's fingers got caught in the bookchute door.  LM went to get a cup of ice water for the child to soak her fingers and filled out a Third party/Citizen Incident report.  The father did not want to give his address for the form and when asked how the accident happened, he reported that it was "user error" on behalf of his daughter.  Documentation was submitted to Risk Management and Library HR.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: it was around 2:02 pm that L1 SG perceived a subtle smell of burning plastic in the staff room. L1 SG and L1 JB went to the lobby to check if the smell was coming from one of the restrooms. one of the stalls in the women's restroom was being use and the smell of burning plastic and perfume was received in the room, L1 JB and L1 SG confirmed that the smell was coming from the stall in use. L1 SG asked the female patron using the restroom to please come out. When the patron came out of the stall the smell got stronger. L1 SG let the patron know that the use of drugs was a violation of the code of conduct and that they were suspended for a year. The patron left without resisting but stated that L1 SG didn't have any proof of them using drugs in the restroom. L1 SG let them know that they have the right to dispute the suspension if they feel that it was unfair. When L1 SG came back to lock the women's restroom and put an "out of order" sign. A stronger smell was coming out of the men's restroom. For this reason, L1 SG requested the assistance of LTA ML to verify of the men's restroom was impregned with the same burning plastic smell. LTA ML confirmed that the men's restroom was contaminated with the same smell and the men's restroom was locked. Nobody was seen using drugs in men's restroom. Further actions might be taken if other patrons can be identified with the assistance of camera's recordings.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description:
On Saturday, July 1st, at the Oro Valley Library, DM was scheduled to be at Desk 1 (the closest to the entrance/exit) from 2-3pm. Early in the 2pm hour, an OV Police officer asked DM if there was another policeman in the library. DM responded that DM did not know. The officer then went to go look around.
Shortly thereafter, DM saw 3 OVPD walking by the catalog desks headed towards the book shop. At this point, DM went to alert the "in charge" person who was RW. DM found her in the Children's section and let her know that there were 3 cops in the library. DM did not know the reason why but DM thought the person in-charge should know ASAP.
At 2:48pm a woman came out of the restroom screaming to call 911, that the "naked man" the police were looking for was in the ladies restroom. DM immediately called 911 because:

OVPD was just there, DM didn't know the reason why, but DM figured it may have been because they were looking for this man who was now hiding in the restroom. The cops had just left so DM figured they may still be in the parking lot (and the station is literally next to the library).
Because of the lady's adamancy and sense of urgency that there may have been a dangerous man in the restroom, and after all, at least 3 police were just in the library perhaps looking for him.

It took a few minutes for the police to arrive and in the meantime the woman told us about how this same man was seen by her earlier in the parking lot, and that he was naked from the waist down, and that she went immediately to her car and locked the door and drove away for her safety. She asserted that this was now the same man that she saw in the restroom.
The police showed up and found no one that fit the description of being a "naked man."
At this point there was a change in desk duties but was informed during the next hour that the same lady was at the desk still insisting on what she saw, adamant in her claims.
Based on my own conclusions, the lady may have been the one who called the police the first time, or was the cause of their presence at the library earlier in the 2 o'clock hour. However, the police never let us know what they were there for so we didn't know how big a danger there was, if any. We didn't even know they were looking for a "naked man" or any person.
When the woman alerted me to call 911 after leaving the restroom, this would have been her third (at least) sighting of the "naked man" or something she thought resembled that.
All evidence appears to show that there was no "naked man" and that the lady may have been confused. There was a man wearing two-toned shorts that were gray that could have been the cause of confusion. OVPD also alerted staff that this woman is known to them as someone who calls a lot. There were 6 OVPD that showed up.
Library staff should be on alert for any future claims by this woman, especially since they can unintentionally lead to accidental harm on an innocent suspect especially if police consider them a threat based on her claims.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: Regular patron D.O. from medical 911 call from Monday lost his footing and fell at 5pm as he was exiting the building for the evening.  When Guard JQ and ML KW helped him to his feet, there was a strong smell of alcohol and he was not able to walk due to self reported neuropathy. He uses a cane and has a very unsteady gate normally. Documented as this is the second time in one week that this has occurred requiring a 3rd party incident report to be filed.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: bug residue
Description: Librarian KB found an item in the book drop that had possible bed bug damage. She quarantined that and two other items that came in with it. LTA sup AK inspected items, and the indicated item does have possible bed bug damage, and one of the others appeared to have eggs. Items were discarded and holds were placed on the other items on patron GJ's account (4 items total placed on hold).

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: tied up 2 dogs outside in heat, left 2 cats in carrier outside in heat
Description:
Around 3:20, 72-year-old Nancy Shourd and 54-year-old Gary Weatherly came into the library asking for water and a place to charge their phone. Gary was in a wheelchair and wearing hospital scrubs. Librarian KB brought them to the couch in the café area, near an outlet. Gary said he was “thrown out” of St. Joseph’s Hospital and that they had nowhere to go. Nancy indicated that they had been in a hotel, but were tossed out, along with all their belongings. KB returned to the service desk to help with other customers. After about 10 minutes, VetSec guard TE approached KB, telling her that a customer said two dogs were tied up outside on the SE patio by the large meeting room door. KB went with TE to investigate. Two dogs were tied up to the bench, and there was a black, soft-sided carrier under the bench. The customer indicated that a cat was in the carrier. There was no water available to the animals. KB went back inside to the staff room and asked staff to retrieve the cat carrier and get water for the dogs. KB went back onto the library floor to find the owners. KB was stopped by Nancy and Gary, who again asked for water. KB brought them a couple of bottles, at which time Nancy asked if it was OK to bring in their pets because they were currently tied up outside. KB told them that library staff was aware that there were animals tied up and that they had been brought into the staff area to get them out of the sun and heat (the temperature at the time was over 105F). KB asked what they were planning to do when the library closed at 6pm, and Nancy said they didn’t know because shelters would not accept animals.
The next 3 hours were spent trying to find people who could take the animals temporarily and to find shelter for the couple. Nancy applied online with PACC to foster the animals while they got back on their feet; however, even if the couple were approved for this service, the process of placing the pets would take a few days. Nancy and Gary were not able to find shelter for themselves because of the late hour and the fact that the next day was the July 4th holiday. At closing, the couple left with one dog. The other dog was brought to PACC. The cats (there were 2 in the carrier) were placed temporarily with a staff member. (As an aside, PACC turned away the dog because she arrived too close to closing.)
The next day, July 4, around 3:15pm, concerned about the couple being in the heat without shelter, Librarian JD drove by the branch to see if they were still there. They were, and JD dropped off some water and food for them. Librarian KB drove by around 6 or 6:30pm and the couple was no longer at the library. KB spoke with a regular customer who uses the wi-fi after closing most nights, and he said that on the night of July 3 paramedics answered a call about the couple (he didn’t know if the couple or someone else called 911) and brought them back to St. Joseph’s Hospital. Wi-fi guy told KB that the couple had just been walked over to St. Joseph’s Hospital by paramedics again, about an hour before KB arrived to check on them.
At 8:00am, on Wednesday, July 5, paramedics did a welfare check of the couple, assisted Gary into his wheelchair, and left.  At 8:10am, Librarian I JM and Librarian III KK approached the couple, who were camped in front of Wilmot’s entrance. The couple shared that the man had suffered heatstroke at a bus stop on Monday after being evicted from a hotel and the bus driver had administered chest compressions while waiting for paramedics.  They said that St. Joseph’s Hospital had stabilized Gary and then “kicked them out” when their ride fell through. They said that their phone had died, which further complicated their efforts to get help, including needed medications.  KK offered to call the local crisis line, explaining that camping on library grounds was not allowed. They agreed. Staff called the Homeless Resource Line, the Community Wide Crisis Line, Karl Wagner with CWD, and Bethanie at the Sullivan Center but none of these entities was able to assist the couple. Multiple shelters were called, and all were full that night.
The couple spent the day in the library making many unsuccessful phone calls for help. At closing, L1 KB purchased clothing for them and gave them cab fare so that they could try to get to Salvation Army and hopefully be given shelter the next day.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: suspected theft
Description: While checking in items from the outdoor book chute after the July 4th holiday, Himmel staff noticed a number of books and DVDS (about 10-12 items) coming up with "in transit too long" messages. All items were in transit to Ajo Library from various other branches (WIL, ORO, etc.). Staff also found an interoffice envelope addressed to Ajo and a DVD case used to hold seed reserves that belongs to Ajo. All books and DVDs were placed in transit on June 19th or June 20th. Since Himmel does not have exterior cameras, we are unable to determine how these items ended up in the outdoor book chute.

Patron (named Sharrie) was in car.  After exiting her car, she fell and other patrons in the parking lot helped her back to her car to the driver’s seat (approximately 1:50).  Page C.I. reported the incident to LA J.R. and L1 K.N.  LA J.R. then went over to her car to talk to her as she sat in the front seat with the door opened. LA J.R. offered to call 911 and/or someone that could come meet her in the parking lot.    She said that she was feeling fine and then attempted to hand LA J.R. a bag of empty prescription bottles “for the dogs”, explaining that she had two pets that had died the previous week.  LA J.R. gave her information about Pima Animal Control.  She said that she would take the bottles over there.  About 5 minutes later LA J.R. saw her exiting her car, walking through the parking lot.  Two minutes later, Page C.I. reported to LA J.R. and L1 K.N. that she had fallen again, near the entrance to the library.  She was face-down, conscious and talking to those around her.  She had visible cuts on her face and hands and was bleeding.  At this time, Custodian E.O. called 911. L1 K.N. gave her a towel for her face and covered each foot with a towel because they were exposed to the sun. LA J.R. and Custodian E.O. then stayed with her.  Within 7-10 minutes, they arrived, rolled her over and placed her in a chair and attended to the wounds on her face.   They asked her several questions and took her vital signs.  There were 5 paramedics.  The chief’s name was Dustin Schaub.  Approximately, 2:15, an ambulance came, put her on a stretcher and took her to Northwest Hospital.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: At 4:05 pm library staff heard people shouting outside of the building. L1 SG and Guard CS went to check the front door where man and a woman were yelling at another man in a car. The person in the car left. The woman went inside the library and brought outside with her two children and told them to sit down and stay with them. The man and woman apologized for the disruption, they let L1 SG and Guard CS that they were okay, and that the person was harassing them, accusing them of taking keys without their permission. L1 SG and Guard CS went back inside the library. Around 4:12 pm LA TA let L1 SG know that the people outside were fighting. L1 SG went outside and noticed that Guard CS was outside trying to de-escalate the situation. A man driving a Navy Ford Explorer was parked in front of the library yelling to the people sitting outside of the library. Another woman in the passenger seat got out of the car and started yelling to the woman. L1 SG asked both women to lower their voices but was ignored. Since the two minors were present during the incident, L1 asked the minors to go inside the library to rest and eat some snacks. L KV took the kids inside. L1 SG called 911 at 4:16 to request law enforcement assistance and around 4:28 pm two police officers arrived. Police officers informed L1 SG that the incident was related to custody of the two minors for what personnel from the DCS arrived as well.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Guard RP approached me while I was at the service desk and informed me that a woman in the women's restroom was informed that her time (5 minutes) was up in the restroom.  The guard could hear the rustling of tinfoil and heard a small torch.  The guard smelled a little bit of smoke.  The woman left in a hurry after that.  She grabbed her bedroll that she had left at the entrance on the way out.  Staff suspects customer may have attempted to use drugs in the restroom.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: Lost of balance and signs of being under the influence of alcohol
Description: It was around 11:35 am that LP LF asked L1 SG for assistance with a patron sitting in the computer lab who requested his help to walk due to loss of balance. L1 SG recognized the patron as Daniel E., who fell in the library twice in the last ten days. When L1 SG assisted him, he showed signs of being under the influence of alcohol. The patron was taken to sit down at the cafe area where L1 SG had a conversation with him. The patron admitted that he had a drink in the morning after being released from the hospital and before coming to the library. He agreed that drinking before coming to the library is not appropriate. He must stay home if he drinks to prevent him from losing his balance and falling again. No further actions were taken at the moment.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.12 Belongings: Leaving unattended, may be removed without notice
Description: A patron came to the desk around 10:30am on 7/6 declaring that another patron had taken his laptop and threatening to call the police. When questioned about the situation, he said he had left a box of his belongings unattended outside the library, drove away to park his car, and when he returned, discovered that the laptop had been removed. Another patron inside the library had opened the laptop when he was asked to return it to the rightful owner. He complied without incident. The patron who had left the laptop unattended then complained to staff that there was sensitive information on the laptop. When staff realized the laptop had been returned, the patron was advised not to leave items unattended outside the library. The patron did not call the police since there was no theft.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using

She offered him a bottle of water on his way out.  He stated that his name was Elijah and he was the King.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description:
Around 4pm, Ken (Kenneth) came to the front desk and announced his name. "I'm Ken, Ken from Kansas! Who are you?" LA RG replied she was R, since her nametag was visible. Ken said, "Where are you from?" and RG replied, "From the library." Ken said, "You were born in the library?" RG said she was in order to avoid giving out any personal information. Ken said, "I'll let you get away with that for now." He asked where he could hang out for an hour and RG showed him the Reading Room, where the magazines and reading chairs are. He came back to the desk after 4:30pm and said to RG "How about you and I get together after work and I take you out to dinner?" RG replied that she was married and Ken said, "He doesn't have to know!" RG refused him again and Ken left the building. This is an ongoing interaction with this customer, where he repeatedly asks RG out or makes inappropriate comments. He has also made inappropriate comments towards some of the female pages in the past and been warned once by L3 KK that his language is inappropriate and he cannot talk to staff that way. 
EDIT TO ADD: L1 KB was on desk with LA RG during the 4:30ish interaction.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.2 Guns, weapons, machetes, knives
Description:
MS received a call on the in-charge phone; report of a fight escalating on the 3rd floor. when I arrived on the floor I witnessed known customer Eric menacing another individual with a chair that he was holding over his head. I tried to distract and disrupt the fight as I approached, yelling for them to stop and whistling loudly. As I got close, Eric put down the chair, and at this point I saw that he also had a folding box cutter in his hand, the blade was out. 
MS was able to escort Eric out of the building, where he paced and waited for about 15 minutes to see if the the folks he was fighting with would come outside.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.4 Sleeping    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Creating unsanitary conditions~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.6 Using furniture improperly
Description: L3 KK found Bradley laid out sleeping on the couch and asked him to sit up.  He complied and then a few minutes later came to the desk extremely irate that he was not allowed to lie down while sleeping since we let "drug addicts" sleep in the library.  KK explained that he was allowed to sleep sitting up but laying out on a sofa was not permitted.  Bradley became angrier since he had observed us allowing a person in medical crisis sleep on a sofa earlier in the week.  KK explained that that was an emergency situation. Bradley said that it was "unnatural" for people to sleep sitting up and that it bothered his neck to sleep sitting up.  KK said that we did not provide the level of services that local shelters provide. Bradley threatened to film all the people sleeping in the library.  KK made him aware that filming violated the Code of Conduct and State law.  Bradley ended up going back to the sofa and laying down again to sleep.  Given his agitated state and the fact that we were near closing, KK did not approach him.  Once he left, KK found sand and dirt on the sofa where Bradley's shoes had been.  KK spoke to Bradley on Monday, July 10 and he said that he understood and apologized for his behavior.

Description: Patron, Bacillo, spoke to the staff on first saying that he had put a portable charger in the charging station and when he came back it was gone. Patron was very upset. When LIC CR asked him to file a police report so that we could hand over video, he said that he would not be contacting the police. After a long interaction with the patron assuring him that using the same code on a different floor did not open the locked box, and verifying with him that he did not use a simple code, we checked the video. It became clear at that point that a thief had used social engineering to gain access to the locker. He is suspended for one year.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description:
Customer reported that she had sat on the sofa in the back of the children's area before breaking out with hives. She reported that she was highly allergic to many things, including certain chemicals in certain cleaning products.
Customer had hives on her upper legs and back and started feeling ill. She was coughing and vomiting and had trouble breathing and talking. Staff called 911. EMTs responded and transported the customer to the hospital. Her grandma had arrived and was able to follow them.
Staff wiped down the sofa with Lysol wipes and turned it around to face the wall, so that other customers wouldn't be able to use it until it can be thoroughly cleaned and disinfected. A sign was placed on the sofa to notify other customers that the sofa was unavailable.

When he responded he was ok, KW asked the other kids in the computer area and they reported that earlier in the day Snowden had made disrespectful comments about Christian's dad. Snowden had left the building and then returned a bit later. As Christian was leaving he came over and punched Snowden in the face before leaving the building.  These kids are all regular users of the library and Christian will be referred to Restorative conversation and consequences upon their return.  Snowden will also be talked to about his initial behavior.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: LIC CS was called to the 2nd floor due to reports of someone smoking fentanyl. Guard D reported that he had seen a man sitting at a table in the corner openly smoking pills. CS went to speak to the man with Guard J and L2 KW for backup; as they approached, the smell of fentanyl was incredibly strong. The man denied smoking pills and said that the smell was from the tin of ham he was eating. CS asked him to leave. He said the guard was lying and told CS to call the cops on him. CS said that she would if he refused to leave, but she would rather not do that. The man told CS to "suck a dick," gathered his things, and left, cursing the whole way out.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling~Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description:
Patron had been advised several times that we were closing shortly. At 5:55pm patron yelled "HEY HEY" loudly from the reading area, slamming his cane against the floor,  and informed LTASupervisor JF that he needed the paramedics called. While LTAsupervisor JF was on the phone with the 911 operator, patron became sullen and refused to answer any questions relayed from the 911 operator.  The operator requested to be allowed to talk to patron directly to see if he would answer directly, which he did.  While waiting for TFD to arrive patron loudly yelled "fuck you" at both guard CS and LTAsupervisor JF.  Patron was angry and appeared inebriated.
 Patron started shouting "fuck you", and "fuck you you motherfuckers" at the paramedics when they informed him that he could not take his knife in the back of the ambulance. At this point the paramedics told him he could calm down, or they would be calling the police in.  Patron calmed down somewhat and he was taken to the ambulance.  Paramedics found a paper bag with a bottle of alchohol he had hidden and threw it away.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property
Description: Staff noticed profane graffiti in magic marker on a tile on the low wall in our entrance walkway. Security camera footage shows that regular patron David Rivera was responsible. He will not be allowed to come in today; suspension length to be determined after consulting with Branch Manager LG. Graffiti was removed with melamine sponge.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: Today at roughly 1:45pm regular patron Tony Burgis was standing in front of the desk (where LA SD was located), grinding his jaw. After a few moments of trying to open a carry bag, he fell directly backward in a seizure. SD asked him if he was okay before calling 911, who directed them to lay Tony on his size and not give him anything to eat or drink. Tony was unable to comply with requests to lay on his side, and continued to lightly twitch. 911 arrived within 5 minutes, and greeted Tony by name. The EMTs informed us that Tony has a history of seizures, but that his vital signs were stable and he was able to answer their questions when prompted. They directed us to give Tony water and a blanket, and let him come back around of his own accord. Tony, now able to speak, thanked SD for their help.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior

Description: A dog (huskie) ran into the foyer area of the library from outside.  The female dog owner ran into the foyer and attempted to pull the dog back outside with her.  She was struggling to get the dog out and to control the dog.  The owner's companion ran up to the front door and another customer told him that the dog looked like it needed water and they should give it some.  The male owner of the dog started shouting so loudly that staff in the backroom ran out to see what was happening.  L3 KK and L1 JM found the male dog owner shouting obscenities at another customer.  JM handled the customer who had made the initial comment by telling him that staff were handling it.  KK was able to get the male dog owner to leave after several attempts instructing him to do so.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description:
At about 12:10pm, LTA Supervisor LM and Page JB went out the library's backdoor to empty the recycling bins.  LM saw an abandoned backpack and heard ticking coming from within.  There were two battery like terminals connected to a post in the ground and by wire to the building's gas meter.  LM told JB to go and get Librarians DB and MH.  LM looked around and did not see anyone around.  DB and MH came to support and assess the situation.  LM decided to disconnect the power supply and the positive charger from the  gas line.  The unit still continued to tick. MH told JB to take pictures and along with DB, went back into the building.  LM walked over to a local repair shop to ask if this unit was one of their tools that may have been stolen.  A repair person came with LM to look and said that it was not a tool they would use.  LM went into the building to call LSM EDL.  LM was directed to call 9-911, at the same time MH was sending an email with the pictures to EDL, Branch Manager MS and LSM SR. The call placed officer in route, but did not require any evacuation.  A call was placed to the branch by police instructing us to evacuate the building.  The building was evacuated of both staff and patrons. While in the process of evacuating, LM received a phone call from the police informing her that the police were on site and to meet them in the area where the backpack was found.  LM met an officer and the backpack was no longer there.  LM mentioned to the police officer that it may have been placed in the dumpsters.  Police officer thought that was a good idea and looked in the dumpsters.  The police officer requested to enter the building and LM asked MH to show him the pictures.  The officer was concerned and asked if the backpack had any ice in it.  LM and MH responded that none was observed.  The officer then took photos of the photos to better assess the situation.  At approximately, 1:00pm the building was cleared by police and safe entry was granted.  The building was reopened.
 
After LM reviewed the security footage, it seems it may have been some kind of worker.

LAF confirmed smell of fentanyl in the bathroom. LAF asked both customers to leave and told them they would be suspended for 1 year.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.8 Smoking, rolling, using tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.3 Food or beverage: unclean, disruptive, or damaging
Description: Upon arrival, Librarian MH noticed a man outside on the wall by the front doors smoking a cigarette.  MH let LTA Supervisor LM know of the situation and asked LM to speak to him about smoking on County property.  LM went outside to speak with the man, who was then laying down on the wall with an open salad container between his legs and smoking a cigarette.  Before LM approached or spoke to the man, he sat up and knocked his salad off the wall, spilling most of it on the ground.  LM said she was sorry that happened and then politely informed him that he could not smoke on County property.  The man grumbled and picked up his almost empty salad container.  He asked LM where a trash can was and LM informed him that we did not have one outside, only inside.  The man then threw the container and what was left of his food on another part of the wall.  He then left the property.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.4 Bullying per Pima County B.O.S. Policy D 23.1.
Description:
On Thursday 7/20/2023 LA CS handed me a letter that she had received from Librarian JG. The letter was signed by a customer and a scanned version is attached to this report. Mary Pieta had given the letter to the Librarian to give to CS. The letter makes disparaging remarks about LA CS and her facial expression. 
The patron had already spoken to LTA KV that morning to let her know too that she does not like LA CS and that she will not speak to her again because her perception of CS is that CS is unfriendly.
Having observed numerous interactions with this patron and having had my own, this patron reacts negatively to being redirected toward library business, or when staff does not engage in conversation about personal medical information, such as extremely detailed medical symptoms. The patron has attempted to share very detailed personal medical information numerous times with staff and when asked if library staff could help her find more information, she became aggressive toward staff.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: Tween patron CJ alerted LI PC that someone had taken his shoes and hidden them in the library. After questioning other teen and tween patrons it was revealed that tween patrons Niko and Jonathan were the ones who stole the shoes, hid them, and left the library. CJ was given some spare shoes to wear until Niko and Jonathan returned and were able to retrieve the shoes. LI KN then spoke to about their actions only to have them laugh in response. As this is not the first time that Niko and Jonathan have been spoken to about disruptive and bullying behavior, they have been suspended for one week.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: A customer reported to staff JH that another unknown customers was smoking in the restroom. Staff JH and DB went to check and both confirmed the report, noting a chemical odor in the room. The bathroom was locked and the customer will be suspended.

A patron was in the library, left and when they came back at 4:05 PM, expressed to the security guard MG that they were experiencing blurred vision. The patron then told MG that they have had blurred vision before but never to the extent that they were experiencing at that time. MG went to the front desk and asked LA BA to use the phone to call 911 because the patron said they could not see clearly and needed medical attention. LA BA went to the staff room to grab the In-Charge person and notify them of what was happening. In that time, patron was able to call 911 from their phone, In-Charge person LF went out to talk to MG and they both sat with the patron in the large meeting room. TFD responded and arrived at approximately 4:20 PM. Once examined, TFD saw no signs of needing emergency medical attention and said that the blurred vision was likely due to heat from being outside and that the patron needed to drink more water since they hadn't had enough. TFD left at approximately 4:25 PM, LF stayed with the patron and asked if they would like a bottle of water and to stay in the meeting room to rest. During that time, the patron was able to call a friend for a ride home since they still could not drive safely.  LF bought out two water bottles, the patron's friend arrived and they both left at 4:27 PM.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: At 10:40 LTA DM came into the back room and said that a patron had reported a patron using drugs in the men's restroom.  L1 JB confirmed that there was a strong chemical smell originating from the men's restroom.  Guard CS confirmed that the patron in question had the same strong chemical smell, but as there were multiple patrons in the restroom at the time, no conclusive determination could be made.  The restroom was closed for an hour so the smell could dissipate.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: Security Guard MR asked a customer if they were feeling well as they seemed to be pain. the customer indicated a need for medical attention for acute pain in their neck. 911 was called.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: The regular teens were at the computers when a woman walked about to the group and shouted in their faces "Shut the fuck up!" One of the teens jumped up and ran to the desk demanding to know "Does she work here? She just cussed at us!" Both the patron and teens were very upset. Circ Manager JF and L2 CR were on desk, the woman admitted that she had yelled at them and then said it was very difficult to concentrate. Staff told her that she needed to come to us to report noise issues and that screaming and cursing at the kids was completely inappropriate. The teens were also told to come to us, calmly, so that we could defend them and know they were in the right on the matter. CR later apologized to the teens and the patron apologized to JF for yelling. She was told that her behavior was inappropriate and could result in being asked to leave the library. She left shortly after.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: At 8:00am, LTA Supervisor LM arrived to work and proceeded to use the staff entry.  While rounding the corner of the building, LM saw a man curled up in the planter next to the door.  He was laying on the rocks and his shoulder and head were leaning against the building (rough blocks).  He had an umbrella, so LM was not able to see his face.  LM hurriedly entered the building and secured the door behind her.  The man did not move or say anything.  LM smelled a very strong chemical odor emanating from the man.  LM waited for other staff to arrive and waved them to use the front door.  LM described the situation to Branch Manger MS, who then decided to see if the man was still there and let him know about his misconduct.  MS, LM and LTA JC went outside, only to notice the man had left the premises.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description:
Male individual enters the restroom at 11:26. Around 25 minutes later, Guard G notices that he has been the restroom an excessive amount of time and checks on his status. He calls over L1 MNC to verify a potential drug smell in the restroom. MNC detects a faint identifiable smell and asks the individual if he is ok. Individual responds that he has a medical condition and MNC tells the guard to give him a few more minutes. And that he will call 911 for a welfare check if needed.
As the time passes, a definitive chemical smoke smell is noticed in the restroom and begins wafting into the hallway. MNC asks the individual to exit the restroom and tells him that he will be calling 911. Individual responds with swearing and threats. MNC places the call to 911 requesting assistance. The individual exits the restroom after an hour and 30 minutes and leaves library property . MNC contacts 911 dispatch back to cancel the call and locks the men's restroom due to the smell. The individual will be suspended for 1 year for drug use in the library.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.4 Sleeping    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: At about 11am, L1 JD approached Bradley and another customer asking them to not move furniture and to not use the table as a footstool. As JD was walking away Bradley said "they're giving me a lot of sh*t."  JD decided to not address his language since he had moved his feet off the table. At 3:30pm, Guard BJ found Bradley laying on the floor behind a couch despite repeatedly being told not to lay on the floor.  L3 KK and L1 JM approach Bradley and KK asked him to speak to her near the entrance.  Bradley said that he knew what that meant and he was going to leave.  In the process of packing up, Bradley got into a shouting match with another customer saying F* you a few times.  He then started shouting obscenities at staff and customers including small children as he was leaving. When he got to the drinking fountain, he shouted that staff would have to call TPD to make him leave.  KK called 911.  Bradley went outside in front of the library and began shouting at customers entering and exiting the library.  TPD arrived in about 5 minutes.  Bradley refused his suspension letter but complied with TPD directions to leave property.  Officer Scott made Bradley aware that he would be trespassed if he returned to property within a month.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed
Description: Woman approached staff at the desk and asked for names and schedules of all staff who were working at Mission library on 7/20/2023. L1 MC explained that such a request would need to go through Library administration. She asked if her lawyer would need to follow up. L1 MC repeated that her lawyer would need to contact library administration for such an inquiry. He provided her with library administrations contact number. She left without further incident. For documentation.

Customer approached L1 KB at opening saying that he was "this close" to killing himself because no one would let him use a phone and his phone was not working.  LTA CR showed him our public phone.  KB called 911 and was referred to the Crisis Line.  L3 KK spoke to the customer who gave a detailed description of how he had attempted to kill himself 15 minutes before coming into the library.  KB called 911 again to provide this update. KK was able to reach his mother, as the customer requested, and they spoke on the phone.  Once he was off the phone, he repeatedly told KK "I just want to kill myself" and that his life was "hopeless" since he was facing eviction and had been the victim of several violent crimes. KK told him that we were glad that he hadn't killed himself and assured him that help was on the way.  Crisis Line staff arrived about 45 minutes after being called.  Customer left with the Crisis Team at 11:10a.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed
Description: Suspended customer Michael Bolents sent manager HR a lengthy letter via certified mail in which he aired many grievances concerning his suspension and its effects on his life. This incident report is for documentation.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
Today, a patron was asked not to allow his dog to jump on another patron’s child. Rather than saying he understood and would comply, he told the library representative to go away and leave him alone.
He frequently brings his dog into the library.  In the past, the animal barked at another dog when the two owners were standing next to each other at the community food bank cart. On multiple occasions the dog jumped on the front desk. He stands on his hind legs and puts his paws on the desk. He is friendly. He is just trying to play, but it is not the behavior of a service animal. Today, the dog was observed pulling the owner and straining against his leash to run toward a child. He was not aggressive, he wanted to play, but when the owner walked the dog over to the child, the dog jumped on the boy.    
LA, CS, approached and explained to the patron that only service dogs were allowed in the library, and even a service dog is required to behave well. It was explained that his dog’s behavior was not appropriate for the library.
He responded by saying that was not posted anywhere. It was pointed out that there is a sign to that effect on each side of the front door. He then asked why it was being enforced now and it was explained to him that we just observed his dog jump on someone else’s child.
He replied that he couldn’t control his dog anymore that he already was, and the library personnel should just go away and leave him alone.
At that point, the LA got the branch manager who, along with the security officer, spoke to the gentleman outside the building. He falsely claimed the LA was rude to him and was picking on him. He also claimed the White House said dogs are allowed everywhere. The manager informed him he was welcome, but since his dog had jumped on a child, his dog was not allowed in the library.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.8 Smoking, rolling, using tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes
Description: A customer reported to the customer assistance desk that he didn't want his daughter to use one of the restrooms in the lobby because it smelled bad; when asked, he said it smelled like marijuana. Guard BJ reported to L1 KB that he knew who it was in the bathroom prior to the man who reported it and that he was now on a public PC. BJ also noted that the smoker was in the previous night at closing and had been smoking in the restroom then, too. That time, he left before he could be confronted. Branch manager KK approached the man on the PC and asked him to collect his belongings and come to the lobby to talk. He asked, under his breath, if he was being kicked out. KK replied, Let's go talk. He packed up his things and walked out without stopping, right past KK and BJ.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description: Around 10:05 am one of our regular patrons Melinda Turner came in and headed towards the water fountain. A little later Jamal, often with Melinda, came in and headed towards the water fountain as well. As seen on our security cameras, they exchanged some words by the water fountain and they head to the main desk. Jamal seems to leave the library while Melinda walks towards the computer lab. She's just by the door to the lab when he returns to the library and goes toward her. He pushes her and yanks the phone from her hand after she told him to stop. She comes to the desk as LA CR is dialing 911, Melinda tells CR that that is her phone and that it is all she has. Jamal leaves the library and Melinda follows. LA ES and VetSec Guard M goes after them and Jamal tells ES that that phone was in fact his. While they are outside, CR was connected with the operator but they were not able to dispatch anyone since Melinda went after him. Melinda briefly comes back inside to grab her belongings and left to continue to follow him. Jamal will be suspended for 2 weeks.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description: Regular patron Janis Nicole Moss 31030723, came in and began using public PC #26.  After about 20 minutes, desk staff saw a newspaper fly across the pc area and suddenly Ms. Moss began screaming at the top of her lungs, tossed her chair and possessions down the aisle. She continued screaming about noise and other things but was mostly unintelligible, while collecting her things and trying to leave.  Lib I SG and Guard CS approached her and asked her to please calm down. She would apologize between outbursts, and still elevate again immediately.  She gathered her things while continually screaming, shut down her computer and walked out the West doors like usual.  She comes almost everyday and we have never seen this type of behavior inside the library with her.  She sometimes has outbursts as she is leaving the building, but nothing disruptive like today.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others
Description: Staff heard yelling from the teen area--a man and woman were arguing loudly.  The man had accused the woman of stealing his phone cord, and she was saying that she didn't.  The man threw a chair at the woman and hit her hard on the leg--she yelled loudly at him.   L3 LM and guard RP went to talk to both of the customers.  The woman calmed down and explained everything to them, saying that the altercation had started out in the park area.   Meanwhile, the man (called "Tiny") wouldn't stop yelling, cussing and threatening the woman and the guard.  LM and RP asked him to leave the library, which he did, but he cussed and yelled at the woman and RP on the way out.  He will be suspended for one year.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: A patron (name unknown but she comes in semi-regularly) removed the plastic bird bath from our courtyard, which our birds are not happy with. We will ask her next time she comes in to either return it or accept a suspension.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Guard C noted a smell consistent with drug use in the women's restroom and adjoining area. L2 CR confirmed and locked the bathroom for two hours to clear out.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: At about 12:20 pm a female patron came up to another female and male patron who were sitting in front of the library near the main entrance. The first female patron started yelling and was filming the female patron who was sitting down and the male patron got up and left with the female who was yelling. At about 1:00pm an older female patron came into the library and showed a picture of the female patron  that was sitting with the male patron from the encounter earlier, and asked page AM, if we had seen this patron, and that she was in her 30's, and sexually assaulted her 17 year old son who is on the spectrum. Older female patron was referred to the front desk and Branch Manager MS and LTA SUP LAM spoke with the patron in our study room that we could not tell her if we had seen the women in the picture or not, but she was welcome to call the police and make a report on her own. The patron was also given a copy of the Code of Conduct. Later in the day, the first female who did the recording (daughter of the older female patron), and the female patron seen earlier sitting in front, were seen across the street from the library. TPD was later seen talking to the family. TPD later came into the library and asked Branch Manager MS if we wanted to trespass the female patron who was with the boy.  Branch Manager MS informed TPD that unless the Code of Conduct was broken, that merited a suspension, she could not trespass anyone. They were given a copy of the Code of Conduct as well for reference.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.4 Bullying per Pima County B.O.S. Policy D 23.1.    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.10 Creating tripping hazards, blocking aisles, exits, entrances    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Description:
Lib III KS noticed that there were people setting up a table outside in front of the book lockers and outdoor curbside table very close to the entrance and not in one the spaces she had designated for this location that would follow our petition passing policy. KS went to introduce herself, saying "Hi! I'm Kaitlyn the manager at the Oro Valley Library". He did not offer his name. KS let the individual know where he could set up. The gentleman in the tan shirt argued with her about where he could set up and said that she was being partisan. After repeating several times that this was a policy that EVERYONE is asked to follow regardless of their group, the tan shirt man said he was "handicapped" and was awaiting his partner to help move the table. KS said "okay, when your partner is here, this is where the table can go" and even showed him where the table could go walking to the exact spot and gesturing with arms wide to show where the table could be set up. 
When KS went out again, the man was attempting to put an American flag on a 6ft pole on the book lockers; it fell and he took it down as she arrived to give him the Petition Passing Policy "to help answer some of his questions he asked". Shortly after the tan shirt man started filming the other petitioner passer, a woman, and arguing with her. (She had arrived there first and had her table where requested). KS went to speak to both of them. She let them both know separately that they would need to leave for the day if they did not discontinue shouting. The woman shook KS's hand, apologized and said she was packing up to leave. The tan shirt man repeatedly filmed the other petition passer and continued to bicker with her; she did yell back at them. He also argued with KS that what she was telling him wasn't Arizona State Law; KS told him we have our own Code of Conduct that we enforce. He continued to say this did not supersede state law. One of the items he was referring to specifically is that she said "so that you are aware you can film in front of the library, but not INSIDE the library". He also asked her if she was going to tell him he couldn't have a gun next (he had a gun holstered on his hip); she told him "No. Patrons are permitted to carry firearms." 
Another woman arrived who appeared to be with the tan shirt man and she seemed to listen to KS and agree with discussing the petition passing policy but with the other man continuing to interrupt while KS tried to speak with the woman. (She also had a gun holstered on her hip, which is uncommon at this library location and noted here as the police asked for this information before they came.) However, she was not tabling with the tan shirt man and set up a separate table once the first petition passer vacated her "better spot" by the door. Her table was for a politician who later arrived and was on site at his table. (KS brought both groups the petition passing policy and code of conduct highlighted. The woman accepted it and was polite. The tan shirt man filmed her while she explained it. Another man jumped in and asked KS to take her mask off. KS said "no". The tan shirt man then said it was a political statement that she was making. KS finished going over the code of conduct letting the tan shirt man know that if he would be unable to follow the policy she would have to ask him to leave for the day. The highlighted portions she talked to him about are what are listed as infractions in this report.
The tan shirt man finally moved his table but blocked one of the book drops. KS went to speak to him again showing him how his table was blocking the book drop and asked him to move it from under the book drop. She also requested that he not stand in front of the doorways since he was not at his table but standing in front of the door. He continued to try to engage her about AZ State Law - KS said she would not discuss that with him and he needed to follow library policy or she would be trespassing him for the day. She asked if he could follow our policy and he did not say "yes" so she left and called 911 - it had been over 45 minutes of repeated interactions at this point where the man would not follow direction with much effort and argument. (She also asked the other group of the woman and politician to try to keep their line down the sidewalk as they were also blocking the doors and the side door.)
The 3 police officers in bullet proof vests arrived. (The majority of the group outside left, approximately 10 people in front of the doors, as the police vehicles pulled up.) KS told the police what was happening; yelling, blocking the doorway, not setting up where requested and arguing when asking to stop these behaviors. She showed the police the policy and code of conduct that she gave the man, highlighting another copy for the police. At the time the police were talking to KS a patron had just come in to report that she felt harassed and that the group in front of the doors were yelling about "incest" and other topics; she told the police this as well. (KS had offered the patron to exit through the staff door if she felt uncomfortable and she declined.) The police asked if the tan shirt man would follow the code of conduct and library policy, if he could stay. KS told them yes, however she had been asking for over 45 minutes and he only argued with her, so if he continued he would be "trespassed" for the day and need to be removed from the premises. The police took the policy and code of conduct and spoke to him. They came back to report he would comply, and he appeared to comply for most of the afternoon. 
Later a call came in from a woman that the man in the tan shirt had called her "a bum" while she returned her books and told him "no" she didn't want to talk to him. She asked "What did you say?" and his response was "well, if the shoe fits." 
As the groups were cleaning up, KS went to talk to the politician and thanked him for doing what he could to keep his group from blocking the door and apologized for any confusion as she was repeatedly interrupted when trying to communicate with his colleague about where to set up in front of the library. She said he was welcome back and better explained where he could set up. KS then went to speak to the man in the tan shirt about a concern a patron brought forward about him calling someone a bum. He said she was lying. The politician then came up and said the woman was rude. KS said she was sorry to hear that and asked that if they wanted to be in front of the library, they would need to not retaliate and could tell staff.  KS said to him that if he came back he needs to follow library policy and code of conduct or she would ask him to leave. The tan shirt man started arguing about state law. KS said she already spent over an hour talking him today and she would not discuss AZ State Law with him and walked away. He took down and carried his own table away. He yelled at her that she was a "narcissist and that was a narcissist's response." The politician shook his head and walked away.
