Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description: Customer Michael Hummons reportedly threatened school staff next door to the library with a metal pipe and syringe.  He then came into the library at 10:51am and went into the front entry restroom.  At 10:55a, LA NG ran into L3 KK's office saying that there were police in the lobby with weapons drawn.  (Security cameras seem to show them using a non-lethal grenade launcher weaponry.) When KK reached the lobby, she saw a man resisting arrest with a group of officers struggling to control him.  There were about 80-100 people in the building including a Babytime with 48 participants.  KK and Guard BJ immediately locked the front entry gates to prevent the man from entering the building.  Another officer closed the glass entry doors to prevent other customers from entering.  Police were able to get the man under control quickly and the gates were reopened.  Police reported that the man said that he had been using "medicine" via a syringe in the restroom.  KK asked TPD Officer Laughlin to suspend the customer from all PCPL locations for one year.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description: In charge staff LA DW was called out to the public restroom area by guard VM because of a drug use smell coming from the women’s restroom. The smell was the smell of strong burned chemical. Guard VM told LA DW that the lady in the restroom is called Regina. Regina’s friend sat in the hall, waiting to use the restroom next.  Regina was taking a long time in the restroom, so the guard knocked and asked if she was OK.  (Guard thought she detected a faint drug smell but wasn’t sure at that moment.)  Regina said she was not OK, that she’d had an accident related to bowel incontinence. Her friend, who was sitting in the hall offered to go to the service desk to get her a sanitary kit.  When the friend came back with the sanitary kit, the Guard let her in the bathroom to give it to Regina.  When the friend came out, she told the Guard that Regina was smoking drugs in the bathroom, and the friend left.   The Guard smelled the heavy chemical burning smell and called for person in charge.  LA DW entered the restroom.  There was a strong odor of burnt chemicals consistent with drug use, and a smell of a sweet, fruity perfume. LA DW explained to the woman in the handicapped stall that she could smell that drugs had been smoked and that the library suspends patrons who use drugs in the restroom.  LA DW explained to her that she would have to leave the library and that she would be suspended.  The woman cried and argued that it wasn’t her.  She said that it must have been someone else.  LA DW walked the lady to the front door and told her that we would have the suspension letter for her next time she came in and that there would be a way to contest it in the paperwork. She left the library crying. Women’s bathroom was put out of order until smell subsided.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Defecation on library property and outside of restroom
Description:
For documentation purposes. Male individual enters the library and sits at the Guardian Station near the children's area. L1 BT notifies male individual of appropriate seating area for adults; male individual is unresponsive and visibly inebriated. As L1 BT leaves for back-up, Sherriff WH intervenes and asks male individual if he is okay/needs medical attention. Male individual declines and willingly leaves the property. As he leaves both L1 BT and Sherriff WH notice the male individual has exposed flesh/wounds on the back of his arms.
The guardian chair has been removed/quarantined for clean-up. 
 
Update: Staff noticed moisture and the strong smells of beer, urine and vomit when exiting staff room for lunch. Upon camera footage review it appears the individual stood just outside the staff entrance with a 40 ounce beer swaying, retching and at some point urinating on himself. A work order has been submitted for cleanup of the staff exit walkway/driveway. Patron will be suspended for 30 days.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: Soiling furniture with urine and feces
Description:
Customer Dan was in the library all afternoon and into the evening. He sat in a chair near the back windows. At closing he was getting up from the chair and fell on the floor. The chair where he was sitting had yellow and brown liquid in it where he sat. His pants were soiled and wet. He asked staff repeatedly to help him get up. Librarian JD told him we could not help him get up because it was against the county policy for us to move customers who may be injured. Librarian KB called 911 at 6:05pm. While she was on the phone, Dan was able to get himself standing using his cane and the chair for support. KB cancelled the 911 call. Walking very slowing and very unsteadily while staff monitored him, Dan walked to the front of the library on his own. He fell at the reserve book area, hitting his head on the shelving unit leaving a dent in the aluminum part of the end cap. KB called 911 for assistance at 6:13pm. Dan pulled a bottle of Vodka from his waistband and took a drink. JD told him to stop drinking anything before the paramedics arrived. He drank more and dropped the bottle on the floor near him, telling JD to, "Throw the bottle out before the firemen come". She did not. The paramedics arrived and greeted him saying, "Been drinking again, Dan? You need to stop drinking." After checking him and some discussion they helped him get into a library chair and dragged it to the porch. They got him into a wheelchair that one fireman had brought from St. Joseph's hospital and walked him to the hospital. They left the premises at 6:34pm.
Dan has become drunk while at the library and soiled furniture in the past.

Description: A patron (name unknown but he uses the library fairly often) came into the library in a very agitated state, not appearing to be aware of their surroundings, and yelling loudly and continuously. Previously he has shown similar behavior but today he seemed much more emotionally volatile and was very disruptive. Since he was disturbing other patrons, LA DB and security guard MR directed him out of the building using verbal cues and body language gestures as it is very difficult to communicate with him. He left for about 20 minutes but then attempted to re-enter; LA DB met him at the entrance to try and direct him to not come back in since he was still yelling loudly. He responded with what seemed like threats and invitations to fight; LA DB declined and said he would have to call 911 if he did not leave. Patron left the property while continuing to shout, and pushed our PCHD "Self-test Pickup OPEN" A-frame sign over. He will not be allowed to come back in today at the very least; will consult with branch manager LG to determine length of suspension.

Description: At 11:15 am guard BJ informed L1 JM that a patron had reported that something smelled dead under the bushes on the South side of the parking lot. JM and BJ donned masks and gloves, grabbed a trash bag and the long-handled grabber and went to see if they could find the source of the smell. They found a plastic bag with a red unknown substance in it attached to what looked like IV tubing, indicating that it may have originated at St. Joseph's hospital. It was disposed of in the dumpster. For documentation purposes.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: At approx. 4:45pm L1 JM saw that suspended patron Phil was in the library at a computer. JM printed out his suspension letter and had guard BJ come with her to present the letter to Phil. When JM explained that his suspension was for all libraries and it wasn't over until 8/28/23 Phil apologized stating that he did not realize that his suspension applied to all Pima county libraries and he left peacefully. Because of this his suspension was not increased.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: Suspended customer Eric entered the building shortly after opening on Monday, 8/7. Eric was suspended for a year for threatening another customer(s) with a raised chair. He also had a boxcutter in his hand at the time. Guard J called L3 LAF to notify her that Eric had entered the building. LAF headed to first floor to guard J. When LAF arrived on the first floor, guard J was speaking with Eric, letting him know he could not enter because he was suspended, and offering his suspension letter to him. L3 MS also arrived on first floor behind LAF. Eric refused the letter and left the building without further incident. Guard J reported to LAF and MS after Eric left that Eric had said the library was kicking him out because it is racist.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description: Guard CS reported to Lib3 KW that a woman was sitting in the parking lot causing a disruption and that patrons were bringing her to his attention.  He had approached her and asked if he could help but she declined.  KW went out to find a woman flailing around with her belongings strewn all over a parking space, crying and stating that she needed a "Blue".  KW asked if she could call anyone or help the woman in anyway.  The woman declined, said "i'm not ready to quit" " I just need a blue".  KW went inside to call the Community Wide Crisis Line, where someone agreed to send out a team.  When KW went back outside the woman had jerkily put her things back in her bag and was trying to leave.  She stated that she was "going to blow someone to get the money to buy a blue".  As she was walking away from the library she almost walked right in front of a speeding truck on Columbus.  She continued very unsteadily West on 22nd ST.  KW came in and cancelled the crisis team and was told to report the woman to TPD for safety concerns which she did.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: A drug incident was reported to manager IR at 3:25pm. IR confirmed that  the burnt chemical smell consistent with the use of smoked chemical drugs could be smelled from the library lobby leading up to the restroom with the strongest odor emanating from the restroom. Review of the security footage and debriefing with staff on site and the security officer revealed that the unknown male who had been in the restroom when the smell began was wearing a gray shirt and gray cap. He had signed up for a computer 3:11pm, walked away from the computer and walked into the restroom within the first 3 minutes of being in the library ast3:12pm. He was in the restroom from 3:12pm to 3:23pm. At 3:22 pm security officer VM did a restroom check and smelled the chemical burnt smell. While she walked over to report the incident in-charge staff, the unknown male in the gray shirt walked out of the restroom and came back to the computer. He picked up the backpack he had left behind at the computer and was out of the library by 3:25pm He had a verbal interaction with SO VM and in-charge staff where he raised his voice and argued with them when they talked to him about the outcome of using smoked drugs in the restroom. He and his friend walked out of the library towards the south sidewalk and did not return. There was no TPD special duty officer on site on the day of this incident. (requested afternoon shift was unfilled). This is the second drug use incident in the Valencia Library restroom so far this month.

The man said that he could take them if he wanted and said "Fuck you." WW reported to LIC MB, who let the patron know while he was leaving that cursing at staff is not acceptable. The man grumbled that WW was "rude" for not allowing him to get paper towels. MB said that it isn't okay to reach behind the desk without permission either. He will be suspended for 1 week.

Patron was informed police would be called. L3 LF assisted with the incident, spoke with the patron, who then vacated the restroom. Patron will be suspended for one year.

Description: On 8/10/2023 at approximately 3:30pm Branch Manager SH noticed several teens getting loud and disorderly. As SH approached the teen area he noticed that there were two teen girls taking turns carrying each other. SH asked them to stop and because SH had talked to all of the teens earlier about their behavior, asked them to leave for the day. One of the teens immediately complied and left, but the other teen (who refused to give her name), started arguing with SH. SH asked for her name and the teen told SH she couldn't remember her name. SH told her she would be welcome back in the library once she remembered how to follow the code of conduct. The teen left without further incident.

Description: On 8/9/2023 at approximately 3:30pm Branch Manager SH was notified by another staff member that there were a group of teen girls harassing a teen boy. SH walked over and talked to the boy, Diego. Diego told SH that a girl was making rude comments about him and took pictures of him inside of the library. Diego told SH that the girl, Amayah, had already left the building but he was concerned that the girl still had pictures of him and would post them on her social media. SH informed Diego that patrons are not allowed to film or photograph other patrons inside of the library, and that he would speak with Amayah when she returned. SH also told the young man that he was welcome to tell his parents and the school about the incident, since Diego reported that this girl also harasses him at school. The young woman will be spoken with when she returns to the library.

Customer said he understood and complied with the request to leave.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.4 Bullying per Pima County B.O.S. Policy D 23.1.~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.1 Manipulating or bypassing library rules, such as computer use
Description:
Patron came up to the Reference desk and asked to use some of the books behind the desk. L2 CS got the books and requested the patron's name and phone number, which is the policy for these items. The patron immediately said, "No, I won't do that." CS stated that this was the policy for using books from behind the desk and explained that these books are often very expensive or very fragile, so we ask for this information just in case an item disappears. The patron began berating CS, saying that he had been allowed to use these books without giving his information before, that "the policy sucks," and that he wasn't going to give her his information just because other people were "bad actors." He accused CS of targeting him specifically and talked over her repeatedly. After several minutes of this, CS was too upset to continue the conversation and left him with the books. CS went into the back staff area and L1 KM replaced her on desk.
A couple minutes later, the patron came up to KM and LA RW at the desk and told them the same things at a lower volume. He told them both that CS was wrong and that he was being targeted. He also said that his blood sugar was low and he might have "gone a bit over the top," but the library couldn't just change its policies. RW and KM reiterated that this was and had always been the policy. The patron left, having the same conversation again with L1 MB at the 1st floor desk on his way out.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.4 Bullying per Pima County B.O.S. Policy D 23.1.~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description:
Customer started calling staff on both library and personal phone repeatedly after being asked to cease all contact. The customer proceeded to leave notes on staff's personal vehicle and wrote messages on the back windows of two staff members' cars while the library was closed for disaster recovery. 
 
Customer is suspended for 3 months from library.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description: LIC AW was notified there was a patron sleeping under a desk on 3rd floor who would not agree to get up when Guard J asked him.  AW asked the patron if they wanted paramedics to be called, to which patron replied yes, and also wanted a ride to the hospital.  While waiting for the medics, the El Rio Walk-in Clinic (on site from 1:00-3:00 on Mondays) tended to the patron. The medics walked patron (P) out the front door, but refused to take P away, even though P was in a dire health situation.  Patron came back into the library, and AW and guard JT took P to meet with the El Rio Team, who met with P and secured a ride to connect P with the needed resources.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: Regular patron Roxanne (last name possibly Jones) was turning the corner by the desk and tripped over the edge of a display stand, which she may not have seen as she was wearing dark sunglasses inside. She fell down hard. Library staff JH got librarian MK, and library staff MAS got an ice pack and provided a chair for Roxanne to sit in, although she elected to stay on the floor. MK spoke to Roxanne and determined that she'd hurt her wrist, and she was also complaining of having hit her forehead and her chin. Roxanne was concerned about possible concussion and a fracture in her wrist, as well as being very confused (she asked three or four times what had happened).  At Roxanne's request, MK dialed 911 at 2:11, and Tucson Fire responded at 2:16. They checked her out and transported her out of the library at 2:39, taking her to TMC to get her checked out further.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property

Description: When Lib III KW arrived to work at 8:30am she noticed a large group of 10 people and dogs on the front patio blocking access to the book chute.  When she approached them to ask them to move away from the path to the book chute she noticed a strong chemical smell associated with drug use.  She told them that they needed to leave the property and that drug use and smoking was not allowed.  She also explained that people needed to have access to the book chute as this was a public library. Some of them denied doing drugs, but when KW told them she could smell the drugs, they all nodded and concurred that drugs were being done.  KW gave them 5 minutes to pack up their belongings and move off of the property or she would suspend them all for a year.  They complied.

One of the foil pieces contained a blue pill that we believe is fentanyl. Staff disposed of the foil and pill. The areas where the items were found are not visible on our outside cameras.

Description: Evidence of bed bugs spotted on items returned in book chute. All items were immediately quarantined and bed bug procedures were followed. patron initials: KSM

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: A patron had left an I-phone unattended by our Teen PCs and then left the library over a period of 15 minutes.  When she returned and looked for her phone, she found her phone case in a garbage can in the Teen area.  She then reported this to staff at the front desk, who notified LTA Supervisor LM.  LM talked with the patron to gather details and then asked the patron if she had GPS tracking on her phone.  The patron said she did and logged into her own I-pad to gather the phone's location.  While the patron was gathering the information, LM checked all the restrooms and garbage cans in the building.  The patron let LM know that the GPS was showing the phone to be outside of the building.  The patron and LM walked the outside perimeter of the library and found 2 teen males sitting on the sidewalk at the far westside of the branch.  The patron approached them and asked if they had her phone because her I-pad was pinging with the location of her I-phone.  The teens told her that they did not have her phone.  The patron pressed them and told them just to return it and that they would not be in trouble.  LM reiterated that the patron was giving them a chance to return the phone without a hassle and if they did not, the police would be called.  The 2 teens looked at each other, waited a few minutes and then returned the phone to the patron.  LM told them that they needed to leave the library premises for the day.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating
Description:
Patron who uses a wheelchair reported to guard JT and LIC MB on the 1st floor that on his way out of the 3rd floor men's room, a woman near him said, "What are you staring at?" and slapped across his face. He told her, "Nothing, I'm blind" and confirmed to JT & MB that he is blind in one eye and has low vision in the other. 
Patron described a woman with a gray shirt, long dark hair, and medium-brown skin. There were no other witnesses and not enough detail to identify anyone in the building. L2 KW and MB reviewed camera footage and did not see anyone get near to him when he was on the 3rd floor landing. He was encouraged to report back to us if he sees this person again, and staff should follow up with him to try and get more information about when/where the incident occurred if possible.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description: One of the pages came to Lib JB to let her know that a patron had repeatedly asked the page to come over, then gotten within inches of her face and whispered "don't work too hard." The page had ignored it but the patron kept repeating the behavior, making the page feel more and more uncomfortable. JB felt that the behavior was enough to warrant asking the patron to leave for the day. With L2 CR as backup, she asked to speak to the patron privately and let him know that he needed to leave just for the day and that when he came back he needed to maintain a professional relationship with all staff. The patron agreed, verified he needed to leave for the day and then left the library.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Medical 911
Description: Guard BJ found unidentified customer passed out at a public computer.  L3 KK and L1 JD approached the customer and, after some effort, were able to wake up the customer.  KK asked if he had taken anything and whether he needed Narcan.  Customer said no and started to sign into the computer. KK smelled alcohol on the customer during the discussion.  Since the customer was fine when he entered the building at 10am, it is presumed that the alcohol was ingested in the library. A few moments later, the customer passed out again and, as KK and BJ approached him, he vomited profusely over himself, the computer keyboard and the floor.  KK called 911.  Paramedics transported the customer to St. Joseph's Hospital.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description:
Two young girls were using the catalog computer to access a website that displayed the text, talk with a stranger. LIB II CS noticed that the youth were using the Internet and stopped to talk with them about only using the computer to access the library catalog. While she was talking with them, a video of a hand stroking a penis popped up. LIB CS immediately turned off the video. The girls stated that they were unaware that it was a catalog only computer and seemed shocked to see inappropriate content. LIB CS asked them to not to use that computer for Internet access and discussed the dangers of using that website. They promised not to access the website again. The girls left without stating their names. LIB CS reported the incident to Manager SH.
It was later determined that it was the Omegl website.

No suspension was issued at this time.  For documentation purposes.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: On 8/17/23 at approximately 2:30pm Branch Manager SH was notified by staff that Mr. Littlepage (Robert Dwayne Littlepage) had made threatening remarks about the children inside of the library. When SH asked the staff member who had overheard Mr. Littlepage they reported that he made a comment to them of someday finding his own way to take care of the noise inside of the library each afternoon. This is not the first time that Mr. Littlepage has made threatening and concerning remarks regarding the noise with youth inside of the library, and because SH had spoken previously to Mr. Littlepage about using threatening language toward staff or library patrons, he will be suspended for 5 days. He will be allowed to return to the library on Tuesday, August 22nd.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description:
Library Associate NG was seated outside the library on his break, using his phone. At about 4:05PM a patron approached the library, who NG recognized as a regular patron who had been there earlier in the day. The patron remarked that NG, "seemed to be in a better mood", which NG interpreted as a reference to him taking a break, NG saying something along the lines of, "you know how it is." As the patron entered the front patio of the library, the patron remarked that he did, in fact, know how it was, because he had been in the military and his family was in the CIA and had many people arrested who stalked him. NG redirected the conversation and did not move from his seat. The patron entered the library.
At about 4:10PM the patron left the library from the same way he came, and struck up conversation again as he walked by, saying to NG that he, "knew who he (NG) really was" and that "he(patron) always got the last laugh". When NG did not engage in conversation, the patron stated that, "his(NG) overconfidence would be his downfall" and that he had been keeping an eye on NG since he kicked him out of the library (NG has never had any sort of interaction with this patron in the past). He said that he would have NG arrested next for being a "child molester," a claim he continued to mutter alongside other derogatory remarks, referring to NG as a, "f-ing pedophile" and a "smarmy c---sucker," believed to be a reference to LA NG's heritage. He accused NG of texting the police as they spoke and continued to rant and stare as he proceeded towards the bus stop. LA NG remained seated and put his phone away, ignoring the patron's ranting. NG returned inside immediately afterwards to inform manager KK and Librarian JD.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: Patron was on a visitation with her daughter and had a seizure. She fell out of her chair and was convulsing on the floor. L1 BC called 911. Paramedics arrived and checked the patron's vitals; she had stabilized and was sitting up. She asked to be taken to the hospital to be checked out. She was transported at around 5:15pm.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: Suspected bug damage.
Description: Patron RW returned two items into the indoor book chute. Staff member JH checked the items for condition and noticed the signs of bug damage, at this point JH began the procedure for suspected bug damage. All items belonging to the patron were located, the rest of the contents of the chute were checked and the chute was sanitized. Items already checked out on the patrons record have a hold for the Bug reserve card and the I type was changed to bugs. Also a message indicating the item is reserved for the Bug inspection. Quarantine the Item and inspect for bugs and bug damage along with branch/staff/date as per procedure. Items were deleted.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description:
At 11:15 woman entered the library and walked directly to a computer, sat down and started to cry quietly. staff noticed crying and saw that the woman had looked familiar to a pervious incident and did not know if she was suspended so LIC VV started to look through PITS as it was recent. As she was searching woman's crying became louder and louder and she started to scream and yell incoherently. This caused staff VV and CR to approach her to see what the issue was and she then yelled at both CR and VV to leave her alone while swearing profanities and threatening violence to both staff. Woman was told she would have to leave immediately as she replied "What do you think I'm doing?"  she then gathered her stuff and left.
VV then continued to look for woman's last pits report and saw that she has an active suspension from Main. suspension will be extended to one year from today

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Around 11:30 two individuals come into the library and ask for band-aids. LA CR hands the woman the band-aids and they proceed to the snack table. After some time they can be seen by the water fountain. Guard M goes to do her routine bathroom check and finds both individuals in the men's restroom doing drugs. Guard M escorts them out with no incident.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: A little after 1pm Lib III KW got a phone call from City of Tucson Police. The dispatcher said that they had received a call from someone who said there was suspicious activity going on outside of our building. The dispatcher told the man to report to staff but he replied that he would just take care of it himself.  KW got Guard CS and went to do a perimeter check of the building. When they reached the NW corner of the building they found a man squatting behind a bush with foil, straw and lighter out beginning to smoke illegal substances.  KW informed the man that what he was doing was not allowed and that he needed to leave the property immediately. Earlier in the day KW had asked the same man and his partner to move their things and themselves away from the East Emergency Exit which they were blocking.

Description: A patron became enraged and started attacking the computer they were sitting at while screaming inappropriate language. Staff immediately asked her to stop and to leave the library, which she did. We then realized it was the patron who had been asked to leave SRO earlier the same day; she had been quiet up to that point so we had not noticed that she was trespassing/suspended. Computer monitor is severely damaged. Patron's suspension is already maxed out to a year.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.10 Creating tripping hazards, blocking aisles, exits, entrances    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.4 Eating at computer
Description: Patron Catherine Young has been coming in for about the last two weeks and her behavior has slowly escalated. Today she had 11 DVDs and books on CD at the computer station, had pulled two chairs into the aisle to put her rolling bags on, and was cursing loudly. LIC CR asked her twice to stop cursing and modulate her volume. The third time she let her know she would need to leave for the day. Catherine escalated, yelling at other library patrons and cursing loudly, but she packed up her bags. When CR asked if there was someone she could call for her, Catherine yelled over her and continued to stand outside on the sidewalk cursing. There were three open drinks and a snack pack at the computer after she left. Because this behavior is consistent with the behavior staff have tried to work with her about over the last two weeks she has become a regular patron, her suspension will be for one week.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Regular patron Jered K. reported to Security Guard MG that patron Lamar O. was behaving aggressively towards him. Jered used the n-word when pointing out the individual to MG. Off-duty TPD Officer MA, guard MG, and Librarian In Charge HS made contact with patrons outside the front door of the library. Mr. O. reported that Mr. K was making threats with his eyes. Mr. O told Mr. K that he was going to find him and beat him up. HS asked the patrons to leave. Mr. O. left the property at that point. Mr. K. left the property later to avoid further contact between the patrons. Both patrons will be suspended for 3 months per Library Manager CO.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking
Description:
Nancy Shourd from Incident ID: 0000022603 called Murphy-Wilmot repeatedly after this initial incident, inquiring about her cats, which she turned over to a WIL staff member on July 3, 2023, after being found outside the library in a black carrier in 105+F heat without water (Two dogs were tied up outside with the cats, also without water; one of the dogs was surrendered to staff, too.). On Monday, August 21, LIB1 KB took her call and told her that the cats had been rehomed after 50 days out of her care. Nancy indicated that she had 90 days to get the cats back and that she was working on getting an apartment. KB told her that the cats---and the people who took them in---were not part of any formal fostering program and that she was not going to get the cats back because she was not and is not in any position to care for them because she is staying in a shelter. Nancy told KB that "you're going to regret this." Library Manager KK then took the phone and told Nancy that she was suspended for one month because of her threats to a staff member and then ended the call.
FOLLOW UP: At around 2:20pm on August 21, 2023, a volunteer (Pam) from Nancy's shelter came to Wilmot to find out about the cats. KB and KK explained to the volunteer the circumstances of the cats' surrender; the volunteer left with the understanding that the cats were rehomed, cared for, and safe.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking
Description: Joshua Garver called the Salazar-Ajo Library to find out more information about his suspension. Librarian II DB answered the phone and stated that he should be receiving his suspension letter in the mail. He inquired about the appeals process and DB referred him to library administration for further questions.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description: PT Librarian KM messaged in-charge L3 LAF that a customer, later identified as Horton Cyrus Weiss II, on the first floor seemed volatile. L3 VS was working the first floor desk with KM. When LAF arrived to desk, customer was interacting with VS. LAF stood close to VS and interacted with customer, who seemed to calm down. Horton had been asking KM and VS for information regarding the Pioneer Fire. KM mentioned to Horton that the person accused of setting the blaze was probably innocent. Horton had a very angry reaction to this and made comments that their father had been the prosecutor in that case and that the person accused was guilty. VS offered to email Horton articles to save time, which Horton accepted and said, "Can you do that right now?" and walked away. Horton went over to the courtesy phone to make a call. LAF stayed at the desk in case anything further occurred. Shortly after, some raised voices were heard by the courtesy phone and guard I approached the situation. LAF followed. Guard I was speaking with Horton and telling them he wanted to de-escalate the situation. A regular, Amina, had been purchasing snacks from the snack machine next to the courtesy phone when Horton became angry and began telling her not to eaves drop on his phone call. LAF asked what happened and Amina told her that she (Amina) and Horton had had some bad interactions over at Ronstadt, where Horton had insulted her appearance, calling her fat and offering her nutrition advice. Horton began to try to interrupt Amina and escalate further. LAF stopped Horton and asked if the two could exist peacefully together in our space or not. Amina said she could and went up to the 3rd floor. The situation was de-escalated and Horton made an additional phone call and left the building. LAF spoke separately with Amina on the 3rd floor to give her privacy, which was when Amina told LAF more about what happened at Ronstadt. LAF told her to ignore Horton if she sees him again and report directly to staff or a guard if he says anything offensive or inappropriate to her while she is here so we can support her. Documentation due to customer's volatility.

Description: Staff discovered evidence of camping and drug use by the library front door. Upon reviewing the cameras, staff saw 3 individuals camping against the front doors and smoking illegal drugs. They arrived around midnight and left before 3:30 am. All three will be suspended for one year for drug use.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: While straightening the café area before opening, Lib III KW looked out the window facing 22nd ST to find two individuals smoking drugs on library property outside the window.  She knocked on the window and told them that they could not do drugs on library property and that they needed to leave immediately.  They quickly complied.  There is no camera on that side of the building so no way to identify for a suspension.  They did not seem familiar as current library users. If they are recognized coming into the library they will be suspended for one year.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Children in the Library
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Children in the Library    4.3 Adult loitering in children's area
Description: During Childrens' Storytime, L1 AK and LTA DL witnessed adult male patron entering Childrens' room and asked him if he needed any help and that it was the Childrens' room.  Patron replied that he knew it was the Childrens' room and proceeded to walk toward the artwork near the storytime room.  Patron commented on a portrait with "TT" on the chest and asked L1 AK what it meant.  Then he walked closer to the desk and asked what the shake shake song was about that the L1 MB was singing about.  L1 AK replied that it was the Childrens' Room, and that the area was for children.  Patron then said to L1 AK "You look nervous.  Are you nervous?"  L1 AK then told patron that it was the Childrens' room and he needed to leave.  Patron replied, "Well that's not happening."  He walked over toward the picture book area.  LTA DL called the in charge phone.  When patron heard the call, he immediately left the Childrens' room and went to the express computers. This is the second time this type of interaction has occurred with this patron.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking
Description: Joshua Garver called the library. LTA KV answered the call and he asked her what is going on with his library suspension. KV answered that she does not know anything about it. Joshua asked to speak to Librarian II DB. DB was unavailable to take the call. Joshua asked KV again that he is not understanding what happened to his library privileges.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.2 Guns, weapons, machetes, knives~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Description: Staff messaged around 1:30 PM that a customer who had been spoken to earlier same day about being somewhat incapacitated and incoherent was "extremely sleepy". L3 MS responded and interacted with the customer and found them intoxicated on some kind of substance and again incoherent, barely being able to stay awake. MS asked the customer to leave and also offered medical assistance. The customer purchased snacks from the vending machine on the 1st floor on their way out as MS accompanied them and then left the building. Around 3:05 PM, in-charge staff were alerted that the customer had returned and was outside the front doors, throwing money near the doors and asking for food and yelling. L3 LAF responded, with L2 JM accompanying. The customer was not found throwing money, but was shirtless and shoeless and smoking next to the building and pacing. The customer's shirt and shoes were under the front awning and he had been sitting on them. LAF took guard I outside, greeted the customer, and asked them not to smoke within 20 feet of the building. LAF asked if he was okay and if there was someone they could call for help. The customer yelled, "they're already here". LAF went back inside the building and monitored the situation with guard I and spoke with staff at the desk. LAF informed staff that they should call crisis response. Staff at the desk called in-charge staff member MG to call crisis response. Once MG arrived, the customer's behavior had already escalated and they were pacing back and forth in front of the building and punching the building exterior and windows. LAF took guard I with her and went outside to address the customer's behavior. LAF told the customer she could offer two options, they could either sit down and peacefully await crisis response outside and library staff would call them (to which the customer began yelling again, "they're already here"), or they could leave the premises. She said she was sorry she didn't have any food to give them. At this point, the customer went over to their belongings and said they would "walk all over this damn city" and LAF and guard I both saw that the customer had a small machete and another tactical dagger of some kind next to their possessions. The customer put on their socks and shoes and picked up the machete in one hand and the other knife in the other. He approached, LAF took a few steps back and guard I stepped toward LAF. MG was present at this point, standing behind LAF. The customer backed away and left the premises, walking away from the library and tapping the blades together. LAF asked MG to call 911 to alert them to the situation. Within 15 minutes two officers arrived and were outside the library actively attempting to disarm the man. They were still attempting to disarm him some time later and walking him away from the library.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Around 3:15 pm Manager KW heard loud singing outside of her office window.  She went to the employee entrance to see what was going on.  There was a man standing with his back to the door and his belongings on the cement.  KW informed the man that this was the employee entrance and he couldn't smoke or hang out there.  He mumbled under his breath. KW repeated that he needed to move on as employees used this entrance and exit and he couldn't hang out there.  He responded affirmatively, so KW went back inside. A few minutes later KW heard an employee exiting the door and went to make sure the man had moved on.  When SG stepped outside the man was still there and smoking off of a piece of aluminum foil.  KW again told him to leave, which he did and then KW escorted SG to the parking lot for safety concerns. He will be suspended for a year for using drugs on property.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
Unknown_6430_08/22/2023 returned today to partake in the same activity as yesterday.  When Manager KW was informed of his presence on the back employee entrance dock, she went out to inform him that due to his drug use on property yesterday he was suspended from all libraries for one year.  He replied that he just wanted out of the sun to which KW replied that he would have been welcome inside the library had he not been caught on camera doing illegal drugs on property.  He didn't seem to be moving quickly so KW went to get the suspension letter and Guard CS to accompany her to the rear dock.  When they arrived, Unkown_6430 had a piece of foil out and was preparing to smoke a substance off of it again.  When KW offered him the suspension letter he called her a "Fucking Bitch" and began walking away.  KW and Guard CS remained for a few minutes to make sure he was gone and he returned to retrieve a piece of paraphernalia that he had dropped on the dock while leaving. He then walked away again.  Since it is only one day later and he was just informed of his suspension the one year suspension will remain as is.
 
Unknown_6430_08/22/2023

Description:
When returning from lunch, two children were waiting outside the library for the library to open from lunch. When LIC VV was walking inside they stopped her to inform her that a man had passed by gave them a cigarette, lit the cigarette and waited for them to smoke in front of him. both children had initially thought the cigarette were actually a candy cigarette before realizing it was real. children were left holding the cigarette trying to pretend to smoke until the man left towards the park where they then put it out and threw it away. 
Security footage could not get a clear view of man.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating
Description: At 3:27pm LI PC heard a teen swearing loudly by the front entrance. Upon investigation, unknown Teen I was on the ground being helped up by regular teen patron Drake while unknown Teen II was posturing with his fists up, trying to get them to fight. Teen II then quickly left property with his friend. Teen I and Drake told LI PC that Teen II had pushed Teen I from behind. Reviewing the security cameras corroborated Teen I and Drake's story. Due to the violent nature and aggressiveness of the actions, Teen II will be suspended for one month.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description: Patron KA came into the library at opening and asked to borrow the phone to call 911. He stated that he had been threatened by another person waiting outside of the library before opening. L1 KH and OSL III MB permitted him to use the desk phone to make the call. The other person came into the library briefly after opening, but did not interact with patron KA. TPD arrived at 10:30am to speak with patron KA and another library customer who was a witness to the incident outside. TPD's visit was strictly related to what happened in the park and did not involve interaction with library staff. For documentation purposes.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
Regular patron Joe was watching a movie on his phone the 2nd floor. 3 teens were hanging out at a table nearby. The teens yelled at Joe several times to turn his volume down. Joe told them to leave him alone and not come near him. When one of the teens threw his trash into the trash can next to Joe's table, Joe stood up and started yelling and telling the kids to "leave me the fuck alone"; the teens started swearing back, including calling Joe the n-word. Another patron attempted to jump in and defend the teens. All three groups were yelling and Joe and the teens were squaring up to fight each other when guards and library staff arrived.
L2 KW, L2 CS and Guard J separated the groups and brought the teens downstairs. The teens identified themselves as Alex Moreno, Jonathan Martinez, and Matthew. All three of them were asked to leave for the day. Alex, who is still suspended from a previous incident, was given his suspension letter and reminded that he could not return to any library until February.
L3 MS came down and spoke to Joe, who apologized for his behavior and left without arguing.
The two teens who are not suspended will be required to sit down with an in-charge staff member to discuss appropriate library behavior before they can resume their usual library activities.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description:
Victoria Olson came in again asking for snacks. when given her food she approached VV and handed her a note to give to head librarian. when VV told her she was the head Librarian, Victoria said no the short one insinuating she wanted ES help.
ES was out of the office, VV read the note and noticed a pattern to her pervious notes. 
Victoria has been referred to many times to call the crisis line when she is in need as library staff do not have the resources to help her the way she expects.
She will be given another brochure for the crisis line.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: Suspended customer, Unknown_6055_12/22/2022,  walked in and left when they saw that staff was about to approach her. Staff were unable to deliver the suspension letter attached to incident 0000022708.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: Two of the five hand-tiled benches donated to the library by the Sam Hughes Beautification project were stolen. These benches lined the walkway that leads to the library's entrance.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description: We have not seen an individual involved but in the Teen Area, on 8/23 and 8/25 we have had staff or teen patrons bring up graffitied Pride Bookmarks to the front desk. The graffiti was the phrase "You need God". This is obviously troubling language and while we do not know the individual or individuals that wrote this, the behavior should be monitored so we can make sure there is no escalation.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description: At approximately 4:30 PM on 8/26, adult female patron appeared in distress after I witnessed her having an exchange with regular patron Jayden Yao. I heard her say something to the effect of I heard what you said and that you should apologize. I did not hear if Jayden responded to this at all but he was respectful and listened to her as she spoke to him. Afterward, I took her aside and noticed that she was tearing up. I asked her what had occurred. She stated that her son had said hi to Jayden and Jayden responded by saying "Get away from me you bastard". She expressed concern about the whereabouts of her son and walked away to find him. I followed her to the entrance to ascertain if she would be willing to add more to the incident. I walked toward the meeting room and she motioned that she would be okay talking in there. She repeated the exchange Jayden had with son but added that she did not want me to follow up on incident as she was concerned with retaliation at son's school. She stated that she would follow up with Jayden's mother. I asked again if it was her intent to not proceed with complaint to which she replied yes for fear of retaliation. At closing, mother and father entered library. Father demanded disciplinary response. Mother now acquiesced. I informed them that I cannot confront Jayden outside of library and that I would follow up next week. Father demanded suspension. I informed them that that is an option I would consider. I reiterated that I will follow up next week. Upon leaving library for the day, I encountered mother and father talking to Jayden's mom in the courtyard. There was a back and forth in which requests were made for apologies and concerns expressed about retaliation. Jayden's mom appeared contrite and stated that her son had a "strong personality". Jayden's mom appeared open to negotiating an apology. Jayden appeared at that moment but only to ask if I could retrieve his Pre-Calculus book that he had left behind. Upon walking back to the courtyard I expressed to Jayden that I was disappointed that he had been responsible for a negative experience at the library. He listened but made no response. When I returned with book, I saw that he was talking with father of boy he had spoken down to. I am not aware of what was said. Upon follow up by Jayden's Mom with other boy's father if Jayden had apologized, father had said yes but still looked distressed. Because action is first offense by Jayden Yao, I intend to issue a written warning.

Infractions: Children in the Library    Children in the Library: Other not listed: Children and vulnerable adults policy: Children are not to remain at the Library after closing.    4.2 Leaving child unsupervised or ignoring disruptive behavior of child
Description: At 5pm closing, a 10 year old boy was left waiting out front. His mom had dropped him off at earlier to play the computer, and he had told her to pick him up at 6pm, thinking that was the time we closed on Fridays. He did not know her new phone number. L1 MM checked the Children and Vulnerable Adults Policy and called LSM AR to confirm that it would be ok to wait with the child. They confirmed it was ok. After 45 minutes, the boy asked L1 MM what happens if his mom doesn't come, and they confirmed that the police would then be called. He asked the L1 to go ahead and call the police at that point. 911 was called. An officer arrived shortly after 6pm, and the mom arrived very shortly thereafter.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
