Description: Patron (name unknown) became very upset when LA DB asked him to keep his shoes on inside the library; he was asked to leave after becoming verbally abusive and using profanity with a raised voice near children.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.8 Smoking, rolling, using tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes
Description: An unidentified customer was smoking what appeared to be marijuana next to the east Large Meeting Room door.  Guard BJ approached him making him aware that he could not smoke on property.  Customer left property.  Documenting this incident since this may be the same customer who was smoking in public restrooms a few weeks ago.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
Desk staff notified L2CR that two teens were fighting in the computer lab. Josh and Christian were seriously fighting and falling into the computer screens. Christian had a cut under his right left eye. CR stepped between the boys and told them they had to leave. She corralled Christian who was calming down and starting to walk away when Josh started yelling again, calling Christian names. Christian tried to turn around and reengage in the fight. Both boys were screaming names at each other. CR had to grab the back of Christian's shirt and again get between the boys. Christian continued to yell that he would fight Josh outside.
After Christian was gone Josh and CR spoke. He said that Christian had been talking smack about the game and when he lost to Josh, he told Josh he wanted to fight him outside and then began to punch him. CR told him that he would still have to leave for the day but to wait for a bit and we would make sure Christian had left the property. Josh assured us that he was going in a different direction. 
LaMonte came back in and CR spoke with him. He said that Josh had said things about Christian's dad, calling him "gay" and saying that he had touched Christian inappropriately. LaMonte said Christian's father has passed away and any talk about him is a trigger. He agreed that Christian then began hitting Josh.
I asked why they didn't come to the desk and he said that they don't like to "snitch." I told LaMonte to let Christian know that he could come back Monday to talk to KW and tell his side of the story, but that this is the second incident where he has assaulted another child and that this behavior from an adult would be an automatic year suspension. 
Later, LIC JB said that Christian was still on the front porch of the library. CR went to talk to him to explain that he had to leave the property for the day. He continued to play on his phone and ignored her. She asked him what outcome he wanted and if he wanted to be able to come back. He said he wasn't speaking to her and he would leave when he was ready. CR said she didn't want to have to call the police for a teenager, but he wasn't leaving a lot of choice. He replied that she should call them because she had "assaulted" him and he had video to prove it. JB stepped in and he asked her to watch the video that LaMonte had recorded. He then agreed to go across the street to wait for his friends. 
Recommending a one-month suspension for Christian and a one-week suspension for Josh with the opportunity for each to shorten it through a LRPY session.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft    1.1.4 Vandalizing property    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: Library staff noticed a picnic umbrella was missing from the enclosed picnic area on the south enclosure of the Valencia Library. Review of the Security footage showed 2 adults walking up to the enclosure on 8/26 at 11:16pm, a male figure wearing black and a female figure wearing white. The male is seen attempting various ways to enter the enclosure starting around 11:16pm. At 11:18pm he climbs the fence to jump into the enclosure, is seen on the security recording removing the umbrella from the picnic table structure and handing it to the woman through the fence. At this point he jumps over the fence again to get out of the enclosure and both he and the woman walk eastbound on the sidewalk south of the library. The woman is pictured on the security cameras carrying the large umbrella from the picnic area as they both walk away from the building around 11:20pm.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description:
About 1:30 librarian mg received a call from the guard for a possible emergency. On the first floor, two young men were shouting at each other, pointing fingers, and threatening each other. One of the men was Hodgie (sp?), and the other person was younger, possibly a teen. A young woman/teen was with him. Apparently, a few days previous, the teen had thrown a rock at Hogie and hit him in the face. When the teen came into the library, at first they were talking calmly, but soon that erupted into an argument. By the time mg arrived, the guard was getting them outside, attempting to de-escalate the situation, and the young woman was trying to separate the two fighters. They continued the argument outside, but eventually the teens walked away. After letting off a little steam to the guard and mg, Hogie returned to a computer. 
Mg later learned that Hodgie sometimes had a firearm in his backpack. She discussed this with LF and accompanied LF to talk to Hogie about library policy and safety. Hodgie said he already gave his weapon to a friend who left the library because he could see it wasn't safe to have it, and he had forgotten about the laws regarding firearms in government buildings. That is, minors cannot have them at all, and adults can carry firearms only if they are properly secured in a holster. Hodgie then returned to the computer. 
The teen was about 5'7", white, with thick, light brown hair. He has a stocky build.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property
Description:
At 2:08pm an adult female approached the front desk and asked LTA GG if she could have access to the camera footage because it appeared someone had keyed her car while she was in the library. LTA GG explained to the patron that she would need to file a police report and any footage found would be turned over to the police.
LTA GG informed L1 VM of the situation. Upon further investigation, L1 VM found camera footage of an adult male keying the female patron’s car.
Around 1:49pm a dark blue Chevy pickup truck pulled into the parking lot and parked next to the adult female patron’s car. She was in a black Chevy Impala, and she was parked in a handicap space right in front of the library entrance. At 1:50pm the male patron exited his truck and keyed the right side of her car.
The identity of the male patron that vandalized her car is unknown. L1 VM did, however, recognize him from having been inside the branch a week before. Due to the vandalism, he will be suspended and issued a suspension letter when he returns.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description: At opening library page HH found live bed bugs in several books that were retrieved from the large 1st floor outside book drop box. Page HH informed LTA DL and the books were moved into a large bin for quarantine. The book drop was cleared of all books by LII's CS and JM, and by LIII MS. Bed Bug procedure was followed.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
For 3 days in the span of a few weeks an unnamed adult male has come into the branch asking for a specific staff member in a bizarre way that has resulted in staff feeling distressed and harassed and led to a conversation with the adult male regarding the best way to get help on the computer, and reiterating with him that it is not necessary, and in this case, it is not appropriate to ask for a specific person again and again when other desk staff are available to help. Details are noted below.
On 9/18/2023, an unknown adult male--UAM (photo is attached) came into Valenica library and used a guest pass to sign onto computer #13. During his visit he experienced issues with the sound on his computer. LA NM attempted to troubleshoot the issue with the patron but was unable to get the sound working again. LA NM then came and got 2 of Valencia’s tech liaisons, L1 VM and LTA GG. L1 VM and LTA GG were also unable to get the sound working and advised him to move to the computer next to him. The patron then said he liked that computer and did not want to move. He then asked if they could get the staff member that was helping him previous because, “she knew what she was doing”. L1 VM then told him that she was working on other tasks, and they were able to help him now. He persisted and asked for them to go get the “short little brunette” because she fixed it for him before. It was understood that he was asking specifically for NM who had helped previously, but who had NOT been able to resolve the audio issue. On 9/18/23, UAM asked for help from “the short brunette” 3 separate times. LTA GG let UAM know that his best solution for the audio issues would be to log in to the computer next to him or continue his session without sound. He then moved to the next computer.
On Tuesday 8/29/23 around 3pm. Patron “UAM” was at the same computer (#13), and he came to the front desk and asked for help with his computer sound. At the time LTA KG and L1 VM were on desk together. LTA KG went over to help him. The patron explained that the sound was not working on his computer. He then repeatedly asked LTA KG to go get the “short brown-haired girl” with a “slim build” because she was able to help him last time. He also told LTA KG that she was about, “23 years old” and asked LTA KG if she knew who he was talking about. LTA KG did not know who he was asking about, and told him so, then advised him to move to another computer. When LTA KG told L1 VM about the odd conversation, L1 VM realized that he was referring to LA NM. Concerned for LA NM’s safety due to the bizarre nature of the interactions, L1 VM then informed L3 IR what was going on. L3 IR then took her desk hour the following hour so LA NM did not have to interact with him.
The concerning aspects of the repeated interactions with UAM were that 1) he used the same computer, which he knew had an audio issue, an issue for which he had been given a solution and 2) when he asked for help, he was not describing the issue he was having, or the work he was trying to get done, but rather he has focusing his words and phrases to describe the staffmember with an unsettling attention to details describing her physique. UAM was adamant to have staff look for her to provide one-on-one assistance, which indicated sexist undertones and an unfounded attachment; this along with the repetitive nature of his requests made staff feel harassed and distressed. 
The next day on Wednesday 8/30 around 1230pm the same patron at the same computer asked LTA GG, for help with the sound on his computer. LTA GG then went over to help him. In that conversation, he again started to describe a "short brown-haired girl" and asked LTA GG if he could get her to help him since she helped him last time. LTA GG suggested to have UAM move to the next computer if he was having sound issues again. LTA GG then let the librarian in charge, L1 VM, know what was going on. L1 VM then reached out to VAL’s LSM before talking to the patron.
L1 VM and LTA GG approached the patron, who was now at a computer inside the lab. L1 VM took him outside the lab so the conversation would not be heard by other patrons. L1 VM then introduced herself and told the patron she was in charge and understood he was having persistent issues with the sound on his computer. L1 VM then explained that any staff member at the branch could help him with his computer issues and made it clear he needed to stop asking for one specific staff member. The patron then explained that he was only asking for her because she fixed the issue last time. This was not an accurate statement. L1 VM reiterated that any staff member could help him and said he needed to stop asking for her. L1 VM also advised him to not use that specific computer anymore since it kept giving him issues.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Library staff FA alerted Librarian BT of male patron causing a disruption in the computer area of the library. Librarian BT observed unprovoked/incoherent verbal outbursts which included foul language. Librarian BT asked the patron if he were okay, patron nodded his head and continued to work silently on the computer. Library staff FA later alerted Librarian BT that the behavior continued to cause a disturbance. Librarian BT, library staff FA and VetSec Guard approached the patron. Male patron was asked to leave for the day, the patron reluctantly packed up and continued to use abusive/foul language towards staff. Librarian BT notified patron they would be suspended for a week due to their actions.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description: Martin came into chess club and was being disruptive because he did not know how to play.  When others offered to teach him he declined.  When another teen stood up, Martin pulled down his basketball shorts.  Librarian I JCB told him to leave for the day and that he was not to return to chess club unless he was going to play chess.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.4 Sleeping    2.8 Smoking, rolling, using tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
At noon on Thursday, 8/31/23 at noon in-charge library staff LII JM received a Teams message from library staff LA MA that the same (adult) woman from a strange interaction in Children's the day before was now on the 3rd floor of the library vaping in the open. MA informed her that she couldn't vape in the library but the woman did not seem to comprehended. The woman held her hand up and said "just stop" but made no eye contact or other acknowledgement of MA being there. JM observed the woman going down the elevator from 3rd floor to the 1st floor where she laid down to nap on a padded bench near the door with her eyes closed. Vet Security officer J and LII JM woke the woman up by verbally asking if she was okay, the woman did not respond at first. The woman would not give her name to staff and stated that she was sleeping and staff was bothering her. she began to cuss under her breath quietly at them. LII JM asked the woman if she could sit up and explained that she could not sleep in the library because we would not know if she was having a medical emergency. LII KW came over to help and the woman kept saying things like "fuck you" and "shut up." LII KW then offered the woman food or water and she just kept responding softly and cussing at staff while trying to go to sleep. The decision was made by library staff LII's KW and JM to call the mobile crisis phone number and when the woman heard us/saw us calling someone she got up and excited the building. JM informed the crisis response staff verbally that the woman was observed crossing Alameda and was walking on Stone Ave. A crisis worker responded to the in-charge phone a few minutes later to ask for a description of the woman. Two crisis response team members arrived at the Main library in about 30 minutes and they informed LII JM that they had made contact with the woman outside and she seemed a bit disoriented, and they were not able to get her name. She refused any help and the response team was not able to do anything further. Response team member B advised LII JM to make contact with them again if she comes back in or escalates her behavior.
 
The previous day, 8/30/23 this same woman had informed staff LA MA that she was 9 years old when MA told her she could not be in the children's area of the library unless she was accompanying a child. On the previous day she was carrying stuffed animals.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others~Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: mishandling books on shelves and stickers available to all patrons
Description: Young student, Lila, came into the library and grabbed stickers intended to provide awareness of Mental Health resources and scattered them. Staff weren't initially able to identify it was her because she had handed the stickers off to her peers and everyone was misusing them. Later she was found having tipped books over onto their sides down and entire row of shelves. She identified that she was the one doing this and helped staff to put the books back in order. Staff asked if there was some reason that Lila couldn't find a place to settle in the library and she shrugged. Lila then went and play-fought with peers so was asked to leave for the day.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description: LA JH notified LG that a customer had been in the women's restroom for over 30 minutes and had already been asked to vacate as soon as possible. JH had noted a strong bleach-like odor, which LG also noted when they approached a second time. LG and JH requested again that the customer vacate the restroom and their intent to speak to the customer. After several minutes the customer emerged and LG notified them that a suspension would be issued for drug use in the restroom and inappropriate use of the facilities. The customer left without the suspension letter.Staff noted that the changing table was extended and smelled of ammonia or really strong bleach, the hand sink and bathroom floor and table were still actively wet. The customer stated that they were simply cleaning the restroom and did not wait for the suspension letter.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
At 10:12 AM "Brandon Ching Fuu Djo" asked to use a study room and a remote for the TV. He was booked into Study Room B. At 10:27 loud yelling could be heard throughout the library, coming from Study Room B. L3 AG approached the study room to find Brandon standing up and shouting. AG knocked on and opened the door, then asked if he was ok. Brandon responded by shouting, "You interrupted me in my office, you bitch!" AG told Brandon that it was time to go. He grabbed his belongings and proceeded to exit the library, continuing to shout and call other staff and patrons "Bitch."
Brandon will not be suspended at this time because he left immediately, but staff will continue to monitor any future visits.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description:
Approx. 10:55am, a patron who had come in some time before to charge her phone in the library's freestanding charging station requested Librarian II AD's help retrieving her phone. She said her code did not work. AD tested it and found her code indeed did not work. The patron looked in the view window of the slot she had used (Slot 1) and determined that her phone was no longer in the machine -- instead someone else's device was there. She asked what she could do and if we had security cameras, so LII AD explained that in order to access footage, she would have to file a police report and law enforcement could request footage. She was visibly upset and wandered around the library for a few minutes, cursing quietly to herself.
A regular patron who had been working at a nearby table then came up to Library Technical Assistant EB and said she'd seen two people come up to the charging station and retrieve a phone in a teal case from Slot 1. The individuals came into the library after the original patron had already put her phone in the station. EB had seen the couple enter the building, but was busy with other tasks and did not see them at the charging station. One of them was wearing cargo shorts and a red hat and the other was wearing a grey tank top and shorts. EB looked around for the couple, but they had already left property.
The original woman had, with the assistance of another patron, turned on her phone's location finder and left the building in order to visit the phone's location. She returned a short time later with her phone.
For documentation purposes as staff did not observe the phone being removed from the charger and the phone was located off property.

Infractions: Children in the Library    Children in the Library: Other not listed: 9YO Child asked to call 911 because he was a runaway
Description: A young boy came in alone around opening time and asked for a pass for the computer. Lib III KW asked how old he was and he replied "9, and my mom knows I am here".  KW asked if he knew his mom's phone number if he needed her and he said yes.  He said he had been suspended from school. He went to the children's computers and began playing games.  Around 12:15pm Lib JB came to get IC Lib KW to say that the young boy wanted us to call 911.  She had taken him over to the pay phone to call since he didn't look to be in crisis.  He called and said they needed to come get him because he had run away.  The police showed up about 1/2 hour later and his grandmother came to retrieve him. Both he and the police stated that he does this frequently. This is for documentation only.

At 12:42 a young man who had been in the library since opening came to Guard CS in the lobby and said he needed us to call 911.  CS got LibIII KW and she called 911.  The man claimed that he was diabetic and had not had access to insulin for many days.  The EMTs arrived within 5 minutes and transported him.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.12 Belongings: Leaving unattended, may be removed without notice
Description: Patron asked LA G.P. and Librarian in Charge H.S. to call her phone, which she had misplaced. Patron requested assistance from Special Duty Officer R., who worked with Branch Manager C.O. to see if security cameras indicated phone theft. C.O. advised patron to use the iPhone Find My Phone feature on the internet. Patron was upset that the library staff would not do more to help her recover her phone. Another altercation between two patrons diverted attention for H.S. and Officer R. Patron left the property before completing a report.

Description: At 1:20 pm, patron Ian G. and unknown patron with tracheotomy tube had a verbal altercation outside the front doors of the library, then the man with the tracheotomy tube struck Ian G. on his raised left arm. They entered the foyer, shouting and gesturing at one another. Librarian IC H.S. approached the patrons and asked them to step apart. Off-duty officer ran to intervene. The patron with the tracheotomy said Ian G. attacked him as he entered the library, so he defended himself by throwing jars of peanut butter and jelly from the good give-away table at Ian G. Both patrons left the property, headed in different directions.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.5 Indecent exposure, public indecency, lewd, other sexual offense
Description: A young man reserved a study room at 4:30 under the name Jeremy. When branch manager KW walked by a few minutes later, he was inappropriately touching himself under the table while watching his phone. He was asked to leave for the day.

Description: Customer Nathaniel Foster is shown on camera throwing a large rock through Wilmot's front entry door at 10:23am.  In response to a call from TPD, L3 KK came into work.  TPD Officer Huston said Mr. Foster had been arrested.  KK stayed with Facilities RLB until the front entry could be secured.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Drug use in front of children~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description:
(VetSec Incident 316-23) Vet Sec Guard MM witnessed Tony burning off a spoon and had a syringe filled with black liquid. The Guard MM also smelled a strong drug smell in the area. Tony was crouched on the ground with Tim on the northside of the building in Tim's encampment.  As soon as Tim saw Guard approaching, he said something and Tony jumped up, emptied a silver can of liquid and ran across the street. This incident happened directly across the sidewalk path from the Child Parent Center of Head Start entrance (Early Childhood and Knowledge Center).
 
4:45pm: Tony Burgis came back to the library and was intercepted by VetSec Guard MM and informed of their suspension. LSM VL and VS Guard went out again to present the letter to Tony Burgis, since they stayed on the SRO patio, and they refused to take the letter. They denied the incident until they were told by LSM VL that the incident was on camera, was observed and smelt. They are aware they have a one year suspension from all libraries, but refused the suspension letter. They left the property.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.2 Guns, weapons, machetes, knives
Description:
Patron A approached the desk stating that we should call the police because Patron B had a knife and baton. Patron B approached behind him and said that Patron A followed him into the bathroom. The interaction was quickly escalating toward conflict between the two patrons so L1 AB told them that they needed to not argue with each other, that they need to come to staff with their issues. Patron A insisted again that we should call the police, but Patron B wasn't wielding any weapons at that moment. Patron A then quickly asked if "we" should call the police and L1 AB said that he was welcome to do what he felt he needed to, but L1 AB wanted to get both sides of the story first (as Patron B is a regular and hasn't displayed violent behavior in the past). Patron A then said he was dropping it and left out the front door as Patron B went back toward the bathrooms again. When Patron B came back to the computer area, L1 AB followed up with him to make sure he was okay. Patron B stated that Patron A "came at" him in the bathroom, but he was okay. He refused to make eye contact and didn't seem to want to further explain, so L1 AB left him at the computer.
 
After being filled in on the incident, L3 CB checked the camera in our hallway facing the bathroom for photos for the incident. In the footage, Patron A is seen filling jugs of water at the bottle filling station and Patron B stands at a distance. The patrons appear to be talking, then Patron B enters the bathroom. Patron A quickly follows him into the bathroom and appears to be reaching for something at his hip or in his pocket. Patron A then quickly leaves the bathroom to gather his bags and jugs of water, Patron B leaves the bathroom with a knife and a baton visible in his hands.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description: Last night our custodian found a knife on the floor in the adult section. Knife is small, with a fixed 3" blade. This is for documentation purposes.

Infractions: Children in the Library    Children in the Library: Other not listed: Parents retrieved their child who did not have their permission to be in the library
Description: At opening, three young boys around 9-10 years old came in to use the computers.  All three got library cards and staff asked if there was school today, to which they replied no.  They went to the children's computers and were quietly playing.  At 10:16 a woman and man arrived and went to confront one of the boys in the children's area.  The boy tried to run out of the library. LibIII KW was walking toward the front desk from the lobby area and asked the boy to slow down. The adults asked KW to stop the boy.  KW said that she couldn't do that and stepped out of the way.  As the boy got out of the entrance doors the man picked him up and carried him to the car and put him in the back seat and they drove away. KW immediately went over to the remaining boys and asked if they knew the adults. The two boys verified that the adults were the other boy's parents and that he had not had permission to come to the library. This is only for documentation because the father picked the boy up and carried him to the car which could be misconstrued if witnessed out of context.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: Patron became unresponsive while sitting in the computer lab on the first floor. L2 KW was called, who then called 911. Medical team arrived and she was escorted out of the building on a stretcher.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others
Description:
On 9/6/23 at approximately 3:40pm, Branch Manager SH was notified by library staff that a group of girls wanted to report that they were being harassed inside of the library. SH went and spoke with the group of tweens. The girls told SH that a boy, Austin, was flipping them off and loudly made the comment that "I don't like gay people" when they walked by. The girls reported that they felt targeted because at least one of the girls belongs to the LGBT+ community. SH and L1 SG then spoke privately with Austin. Library staff have had several conversations with Austin in the past few weeks regarding his behavior, and tendency to make inappropriate remarks. One of the library staff mentioned that Austin was the individual who had questioned them weeks earlier about the pride bookmarks and then made some disconcerting remarks regarding the LGBT+ community that had made library staff uncomfortable. 
SH informed Austin that because of Austin's previous behavior and the comments that could be derived as harassing speech towards the LGBT+ community Austin will be suspended for 1 week.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: LIC CR walked out the west entry and noticed a patron squatting against the side of the building covered in a blanket with the strong smell of burning drugs coming from underneath. She told him he to come out from under the blanket and immediately leave the property. After a moment he put a couple of items in his pocket and then stood up, saying it was a cigarette. (It clearly wasn't. There was no cigarette smoke nor the smell of tobacco, not to mention there would be no reason to smoke cigarettes under a blanket in 100+ degree heat). She believes the patron is named Christopher and he did create a library card about a month ago but hasn't used it to her knowledge. Patron is suspended for one year.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating
Description: 9/7/23 5:40PM, A group of regulars, teens mostly who use our library as a social base of operations, were circulating in and out of the building, congregating at the Sonora Sculpture. We have footage of one of these teens throwing up in-between planters, just prior to the fight. While a group sat on the sculpture benches, others play MMA fought; the sitters were passing a mmj vape pen provided by a newcomer: Teddy a young White youth. From witnesses I understand that Teddy started to direct disrespectful and sexist comments to Anisa, a regular in the main group. Anisa confronted him, asked him to leave, knocked his things off the bench to the ground and then knocked off his hat. Teddy got up and tried to strike out at Anisa, hitting her in the face. At which point, Joshua (one of the regulars) attacked Teddy from behind hitting him in the head, and George (a regular and a legal adult) unleashed brutally, hitting Teddy multiple times as Teddy covered and cowered. While Teddy was receiving a beating, Anisa approached and struck and kicked Teddy several times. The crowd cleared when our vet sec guard approached, leaving Teddy to clean up and tend to his wounds while we waited for his dad to pick him up.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: According to cameras, the patron came in and used the bathroom at 5:43. When the guard CS tried to lock the bathroom at 5:50 he heard that someone was still in there and let her know we needed to lock up. When we closed at 6, she was still in the bathroom. He told her again that we were closed and she needed to leave the building. No other patrons were in the restroom during this period and when she opened the door a strong smell consistent with drug use wafted out. Patron will be suspended for one year.

Description: LA KV alerted L1 MNC that patron Julio Acosta was behaving erratically by the laptop tables. He was hopping around, banging books on the table, and pacing while waving his arms. L1 MNC alerted PCSD officers to the behavior and they mentioned that the patron had been in and out of the restroom several times in the last hour prior to the behavior. A minute later, Julio came to the front desk to check out his items during which time he was unable to stay still. L1 MNC and LTA AO both noted a burned chemical smell on the patron. After taking his items, Julio quickly bounded out the door. L1 MNC and PCSD officers checked the restrooms and detected the same burned chemical smell inside. Patron will be suspended for 1 year for drug use in the library restroom.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.4 Sleeping    2.10 Creating tripping hazards, blocking aisles, exits, entrances    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
Library regular Sean sleeps directly under the outdoor book return chute. He has been spoken to about this several times but we're documenting going forward.
On Saturday morning, L1 MG was early and noticed Sean sleeping in his regular morning spot, directly under the book return. Two cars pulled up, looked at the situation, and drove off without being able to return materials. LIC CR went out and spoke to him, asking him to move to either side, he said he would, but when she checked 30 minutes later, she had to ask him to move again. At 3:30, CR saw Sean sleeping outside the west entrance and went to speak to him. She explained that he is asked to move because he is blocking access to the one spot we need clear even when the building is closed. She asked him to either sleep under the windows on the front patio or further towards the front door, where he is protected from view by a concrete horseshoe bench. When she asked if there was something specific about that spot, like shade or protection, that we could recreate for him at another spot, he said he didn't know why he picked it and there was nothing particular about it. He said he would try to sleep in a different location. 
When everyone came into work on Monday, 9/11, Sean was sprawled out asleep directly under the return book drop and Manager KW told him he would have to move.

Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: Exterior Book Drop Bin damaged, inoperable.
Description:
For documenting purposes:
LA CR discovered, on Monday morning at 8:30am, the exterior book drop bin had been severely damaged when she went to grab the weekend drops. 
The door is very difficult to lock/unlock. The pull out bin cannot be pulled out from the shell to retrieve the contents. There is a book stuck on the side we are unable to grab.
The bin looks like it was hit hard on the west side. There is an indentation that looks like a fender shape, so possibly a vehicle. Camera footage shows a landscaping truck pulling through the area, stopping, backing up and the readjusting to move forward again. 
We do not have a direct line of sight to the bin or area.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.2 Strong odors    2.12 Belongings: Leaving unattended, may be removed without notice
Description: Customer urinated all over himself, a computer chair and the carpeting under the computer station.  He then went to the restroom.  L3 KK covered the chair with a garbage bag so that no one would sit on it.  During that process, the customer returned with very wet pants, sat down on the garbage bag and asked KK for help using the internet.  KK explained to him that he would need to change into clean clothing before he could continue to use the library.  Customer was displeased that he had to leave but gathered his things and, after contaminating the front entry benches while waiting for a ride, left the library.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description:
Two tween patrons came into the library and sprayed another patron who was seated at the computer with a water bottle while coughing pretending it was a wet-cough. When librarian approached to tell that that was unacceptable behavior and that they would have to leave for the day the girls argued and continued to spray the water bottle in close proximity to the book shelves arguing that spraying other patrons with the water-bottle was no big deal.
Once the girls left they attempted on several occasions to come back into the library despite instruction to use the water-fountain and restroom despite being told that both restrooms and water-fountains were available out in the park.

IC L1 WW was informed that there was a patron on the 1st floor who had brought in by a DTP staff person and who seemed to be having medical distress.  DTP had already called TPD, who arrived shortly thereafter.  After a discussion with the patron, Officer Johnson called for medical assistance.  Medical help arrived within 10 minutes, spoke with patron and eventually took him out of the building on a stretcher.  For documentation purposes.

Infractions: Children in the Library    Children in the Library: Other not listed: CPS Searching for child
Description: Two representatives of CPS, Savannah Chandler and Daniel Klingenberg, came in looking for teen patron LB. L2 CR explained that we could not tell them if a particular patron was in the library but they could look around. They were able to locate the patron and used a study room to interview them for about 30 minutes. When done, the patron returned to the teen computers and the CPS staff finished paperwork for about another half hour before leaving. This is for documentation purposes only.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.8 Smoking, rolling, using tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes
Description: One of our regular patrons entered the library approximately 15 minutes prior to close (6pm). [Description: early-/mid-twenties, approximately 6ft tall, thin frame, mustache and close-cropped hair; mostly non-verbal with staff, usually wearing the same black hoodie with cursive script on the back]. He set his belongings down in the computer room, and then returned to the front desk to request a Guest Pass for the computer. He obtained a pass and returned to his PC to watch YouTube videos. My colleague Library Associate RS and I were setting up our book display for the 9-15 El Grito event at the El Rio Center in the other room, so did not become aware of the inappropriate conduct until another regular patron in the computer room (the only other patron in the branch at the time) yelled out that "someone was smoking in there". This occurred at about 5:52pm. I immediately hurried over to the computer room and saw that the patron had lit a cigar at his station. I informed him that smoking is prohibited in the library, and if he did not extinguish the cigar immediately he would have to leave. He complied right away. A few minutes later, I approached him again and informed him we were about to close and requested that he start gathering his belongings. He complied but left behind an extremely rotten banana. When we were first alerted to the situation, I tried to contact the El Rio security team via text to request that they come check on us just in case the situation escalated. However, we never received a response.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description: As staff arrived this morning at CAT, it was noticed due to paper debris nearby that there were four instances of human feces on the north side of the building. This is not a common experience, but it is the side of building several times in the past years we have had people try to camp out overnight due to it being sort of hidden / out of view of passersby. The owner of the plaza was contacted so it is hoped their landscaping/handy man will take care of it and so they know they wish to consider installing a motion light on that side of the building. They can also look at their many security cameras and perhaps know when this happened or who may have done. it. I am not contacting Pima Facilities at this time to give the owner a chance to consider actions.

JM put the patron in a study room where staff could keep an eye out for the staring patron. When JM returned to the building after lunch both patrons had left. Staff will talk to the staring patron about his behavior when he returns.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Staff DB informed in-charge staff LG that Mr. Rivera was shouting angrily from the men's restroom. When they both approached there was an obvious odor of feces near the restroom. LG attempted to ask Rivera to lower his voice, but he only became louder and more agitated. At one point, he opened the restroom door poked his head out to yell at staff and then slammed it shut again. LG called 911 to report the situation and ask for assistance. Rivera exited the restroom short after, still yelling. DB and LG directed him to exit the building through the building exit of the West side of the building to avoid alarming library customers further.  While leading him out, Rivera was shouting that we needed to fix the toilet. That he did not break it, he just got sick suddenly. The restroom was locked and facilities was informed about the biohazard.

Customer Derek (unknown last name). threatened and harassed one of our clerks while that clerk was trying to shelve books in the Adult Fiction area.  This is the third such incident in six months.  The first time he left before anyone could speak to him.  The second time, Asst. Manager MB spoke to him with guard MG standing by.  At that time he chose to leave the library rather than discuss the situation, and called MB "a racist bitch" as he left.  Today, Branch Manager C.O. along with Officer A.B. Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description: As staff were entering the library for the day, a regular patron was seated outside the staff door, by the bicycle rack. He was crying and wailing to himself about a missing bag. We have noticed him sleeping or waiting outside in this spot before, and we have also noticed his behavior inside the library getting increasingly erratic over the the past week. Given that, Librarians MK and KH decided to call the crisis line to have a welfare check performed. MK canceled the initial call because he left his spot around 9:15, but called again about 20 minutes later because he had circled around the front of the library and was wandering around, rambling to himself in a distressed fashion. Because he was moving around so much, the Crisis Line said they would get a non-emergency TPD officer to come check on him. When the library opened at 10, he bolted inside with a cry of distress and headed directly for our bathrooms. While in the bathrooms, he was talking to himself so loudly about being attacked by flies, alarming other patrons, that KH and LTA Supervisor JH decided to ask him to leave for the day. We left the crisis line call open.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description: Substitute guard J walkie-talkied me to come out to lobby.  When I got there he told me that a woman had just left the bathroom and she told him "somebody was using drugs in the bathroom."  There was no smell in the hall as there usually is when drugs are being burned/smoked in the public restrooms.   I did not smell anything until I actually opened the women's room door.  I smelled a very strong chemical, burning smell indicative of drug use.  We closed the women's restroom.  When following up with the guard he told me that a woman entered the bathroom about 11:25AM.  The guard went for a quick walk around inside and came back.  At 11:45 she was just leaving the restroom and leaving the library.  Guard let another woman into restroom at about 11:46.  Guard thought he might have smelled something in restroom, but at that point he wasn't sure.  When 2nd woman left bathroom at about 11:48 she told guard that someone was using drugs in restroom, and that is when he immediately called me. A conversation will be had with customers about drug use in the library.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description:
Around 12:45 pm Vet Sec Officer VM called the in-charge LI RL over walkie talkie to come to Restroom area regarding suspected drug use in Women's Restroom. LI RL confirmed that Women's Restroom had a strong burnt chemical smell consistent with the use of chemical drugs. Vet Sec Officer VM noticed smell as she was unlocking door for a customer. When LI RL got to restroom one customer was in a stall and another was exiting. When LI RL said "drugs can't be used in library", customer in stall said she just got there and it wasn't her. Other customer exited building before staff could talk to her. No suspension given since we could not confirm person.
Women's public restroom was locked and marked Out of Order until smell subsided.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description: Today when school got out early for Teacher Parent conferences a large group of student aged kids (10-14) came in at once.  Some were our familiar, daily kids and some were known from previous library use and others were not known to library staff. There were at least 0-15 kids.  They all gathered around two very regular kids, Lamont and Christian who were playing on the teen computers.  It became very boisterous and loud and staff reported that there might be a fight.  Lib III KW went to the teen room and told the kids to back up and slow down.  No fight was occurring. The reason the group had come in was because Christian and Juma (one of the group) had been in a fight at the bus stop two days prior over Christian turning Juma's computer off and being told to leave for the day.  They had fought and the other kids had filmed it and been showing it to all the kids.  Today was friends and (family?) of Juma coming to retaliate on Christian over the fight outside.  Nothing physical was happening in the library but there was an understood threat that Christian would be jumped when he left the library.  KW told the unfamiliar kids along with Juma and his inner circle of retaliators, that they needed to leave the library or she would call the police. They went outside the West entrance to wait for Christian near the bus stop.  Christian called his mom to ask for a ride and a few minutes later a whole group of kids and two adult women (not Christian's mom) came in to defend Christian. Since the group wanting to jump Christian was outside KW asked if this new group was here to see that Christian got home safely to which they replied yes.  The second group left out the South entrance while the other group was outside the West entrance. After Christian left, the group finished dispersing and the kids that had been in anyway involved were told that they needed to go home for the day.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Strong smell of chemical drug use in lobby traced to men's restroom.  No discernable culprit.  Restroom locked to air out.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: Cayden and Damian were in the 101 Space when L3 LAF arrived to relieve LA TW at desk. A distinct smell of marijuana was in the space. LAF tried to discern the origin, but was unable to. LAF asked TW about the smell and TW said the smell just started and that Cayden and Damian had just arrived when it did. Guard J was present in the space at the time and smelled marijuana also. Cayden and Damian had been sitting in front of the windows, watching people on the street and making fun of them, calling them expletive-filled names, specifically one person they referred to as a fat b*tch multiple times. They transitioned over to the computers. After a few minutes, their language became extremely inappropriate with nothing but expletives and slurs, mainly n*gga. LAF approached and told them to stop or they’d need to leave. They said okay and stopped. Some time later, they left 101 space. LAF said goodbye as they left and they said they’d be back. Guard J told LAF they were heading for the Ignite space. LAF said they needed to keep an eye on them. A few minutes later, guard J headed over to the Ignite space. She came back and reported to LAF that it smelled like marijuana over there. At this point, LAF began hearing Cayden and Damian loudly shout expletives and slurs from the Ignite space and the pair could be heard yelling loudly all the way from 101. LAF approached and said it smelled like marijuana and that she shouldn’t be able to hear them across the entirety of the second floor shouting expletives and slurs. She asked them to leave. Damian said they weren’t smoking weed and LAF said, okay if they weren’t smoking weed, but that they were still yelling across the entire second floor. Damian said it was “bullshit”, called LAF “booboo” or “boobear” and said she was “just having a bad day and to go home and take it out on some kids or something”. Damian began leaving and told a third person with them that they needed to leave, too. LAF said, “I didn’t ask him to leave”. Cayden accused LAF of telling him to “get his n*gro a*ss out of the library”. LAF did not say this. Guard J told Cayden to stop saying that and told them they were putting words in LAF’s mouth she didn’t say. Damian continued with insulting remarks toward LAF and using expletives all the way out of the building. Cayden followed Damian out slowly.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.4 Bullying per Pima County B.O.S. Policy D 23.1.    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Description: On 9/22/23 at approximately 3:20pm, Branch Manager SH was roaming the library in order to observe and address any conduct not following the Library's policies and Code of Conduct. At this time SH noticed a youth running through the library. He immediately followed the youth to address their misconduct. As SH was speaking with the youth who identified their self as Ichella, other youth approached SH and Ichella. One of the male youth who approached SH immediately addressed Ichella and asked why she hit his brother. SH addressed the youth and asked to speak to each of them to understand what was going on. SH first spoke with Ichella who said that the male youth who had followed them had been calling their friend and them names. SH asked Ichella if Ichella hit the boy who was claiming that Ichella had hit. Ichella said they pushed on the back of their head or their back because the boy was making fun of Ichella and their friends. SH went over the Code of Conduct with the youth and explained that if at any time there were issues that youth should let the library staff know rather than taking care of it themselves. Ichella said that their parent was waiting and asked to leave at 3:30pm. SH then spoke with the other youth and learned that according to them Ichella had walked up to the young boy, Santiago, and asked him if he called her friend "fat". Santiago said he replied that no he didn't know the girl and wouldn't call anyone names. Santiago then reported that he turned back around to his computer to play Roblox and was immediately punched in the back of his head, which caused his face to hit the computer screen. That is when Austin, and Santiago's brother, Adan, began to chase down Ichella. While speaking with Santiago and the other boys, Santiago's mother arrived. At this point Santiago was crying and saying his head hurt. SH gave Santiago an ice pack and began to take down everyone's information after realizing that Santiago may have been assaulted without provocation and in order to fill out an injury report. At this point Santiago's mother stated she would be calling the school. SH explained that he would be following up with the youth assailant, and gave Santiago's mother his information in case she had further questions. Santiago and his brother and mother left shortly after. At approximately 4:13pm Marana Police Department Officer, Barker #573 arrived with Santiago's mother. SH was alerted by staff that an officer was waiting to speak with him. Santiago's mother left immediately after arriving with the MPD officer. Officer Barker requested any information that SH could give about the assault and gave SH his information along with the report number. (DR# 2309-1174). After his initial investigation, Officer Barker informed SH that he believed an unprovoked assault did take place and that there was evidence of physical harm that took place due to significant swelling in the affected area where Santiago was punched. Officer Barker left at 4:26pm. Considering the unprovoked attack by Ichella that caused significant harm to Santiago, Ichella will be suspended for 1 year.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description:
From LA NG: This patron had come into the library earlier in the morning – C, a regular teen at the teen computers came to desk and told me a woman was bothering them and telling them to be quiet, so I went over to a woman sitting by herself in the children’s area on the couch.  I just went over and she immediately started talking to me about how she was having a bad day and was talking about how difficult things were and that she needed a quiet place to be.  She was calm but seemed to be a little emotional and when I explained this area was for children/teens and their grown-ups, that I could show her a quiet place that she can sit, she got up and walked away from me to the stacks.  I followed @ 8 feet behind and when she was in the stacks, I asked her if she needed anything, could we get her anything but as she didn’t respond to me at that point and ignored me, I said she could come to desk if she needed anything or if she needed us to show her where some quiet areas are.
Around 11:45 , the guard let LIC CR know that a patron in the cafe area was in crisis. The woman was doubled over in one of the lounge chairs crying so hard she couldn't speak and moaning to herself. CR sat on the end table next to the woman, trying to get a name or any information. After a minute, CR went to the staff room and asked someone to call 911 and ask for the mental health crisis team. CR returned to the woman, who was still nonresponsive. The woman began hitting herself in the head. CR asked her not to hit herself and the woman stopped after a few hits, but had been crying so hard she began to vomit and have an asthma attack. She was able to use her inhaler after about five minutes.
NG's description: 11:50am-ish, I called the Community-Wide Crisis Line 520-622-6000 and explained we had a patron who was having a mental health crisis and we needed someone immediately.  They advised me to call 911 if we needed immediate help.  I called 911 and was routed to police department, and when I asked that they send someone with mental health crisis exp, they asked if we had a name, asked for physical description, etc. I explained she was unresponsive to us and was in crisis and needed transport, but they would send someone to assess the situation.  LIC CR let me know we needed medical help at this point, I called back 911 and explained we needed medical assistance due to how severe her crisis is and that she was unresponsive, I handed the phone to LIC CR for further talk while I sat with the patron. 
LA NG had approached to say that she had called 911. CR asked her to call back and ask for an immediate transport. NG told CR that the operator was telling her that a crisis team was already en route. CR asked to speak to the operator. She told the operator that the patron was non-responsive, vomiting and having an asthma attack, and that she had said she wants to die. The 911 operator said that it was a job for the mental health crisis team and they were already on their way. Patron had still refused to give her name or any details to this point. The only things she kept repeating were "I want to die" and "why did this happen to me?"   
CR sat with the woman until 12:30 when two men from the crisis unit responded. At this point, the woman had calmed down and was curled up under a jacket resting. She was still unable to answer questions and her hands and feet were jerking and her eyelids were twitching. They tried to speak to the woman, who was still awake but unable to answer any questions. After asking her name a couple of times, the men said they had to step outside to speak to their supervisor. When they came back in they told CR that they couldn't do anything for the woman because she refused to respond. They suggested that she call 911 again and have the woman trespassed so the police could take her off the property. 
At 12:50 CR told the woman that the crisis team said they could not help but that she didn't want to have to charge the woman with trespassing in order to get her help. CR suggested sleeping for a little while and seeing how it went from there.  At 3:40 she was sleeping. CR asked her to wake up and checked in with her. She said her name was Tiana and that she would be able to comply with our instructions and would be able to leave at 5 PM.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description: Two men were having a lively conversation about how the country was being taken over by foreigners and several times during their conversation used colorful language to emphasize their points, which I could hear clearly from the service desk. I approached them and let them know conversation was welcome but to please refrain from cursing and talk that might make people uncomfortable, especially as loudly as they were. I returned back to the desk and heard the one man say, "she must be a Jew." I went back over to them and let them know that the library was a space for people of all ethnicities, identities, and religious beliefs and that their speech might be offensive to people who are nearby and was not acceptable in the library (as per CCC #1.1.8.4). They both complied. This is just for documentation purposes.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.12 Belongings: Leaving unattended, may be removed without notice
Description: Regular patron Nick got up from the computers shouting expletives as he walked out the West entrance, leaving his belongings behind.  If he comes back he will be asked to leave for the day.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description:
During the exterior walk-through in-charge staff RL and IR found evidence of drug use at the emergency exit to the garden on the southwest side, which included 3 lighters left behind on the floor and small pieces of foil with burnt marks consistent with their use for smoking chemical drugs. 
This is being reported as a drug use incident after-hours because evidence indicates that the drug use occurred on library grounds. Leaving behind drug paraphernalia causes a potential hazard to patrons who use the library during open hours. Unknown drug users will be issued a one-year suspension.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using    1.1.9 Trespassing~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description:
In the morning, staff found a bench dragged over to the bookdrop along with burned foil and other trash. Upon review of the camera, L1 MNC saw several individuals utilize the area for drinking and drug use since Sunday.
12:55pm Sept 24th - An older man drags the bench over to the bookdrop. He can be seen drinking alcohol on the bench. He leaves the property at 2:41pm. The man will be suspended for 30 days for drinking on library property.
9:26pm Sept 24th - A man and woman camp out on the bench for around 2 hours. During this time, both can be seen smoking drugs from foil. They leave the property at 11:44pm. Both will be suspended for 1 year for drug use.
3:22am Sept 25th - Two men sit on the bench. The man in the camo pants takes out drugs and foil and smokes for a few minutes. They both leave the property at 3:31 am. The man in the camo had been previously suspended for drug use. His suspension will be extended to a year from today's date.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
An individual came into the library at 11:10 am, asked for a snack pack, and sat down to use the computer. Over the next two hours, he made several loud outbursts using vulgar language and each time staff asked him to keep it down he would comply for a time. At around 1:30 pm, he started making comments about rape that alarmed nearby female patrons (including one with a  small child) and staff. It was unclear if this was directed at anyone or more random outbursts.
Desk staff informed L1 of the situation. Due to the nature of the comments he was making, L1 MNC asked the individual to leave for the day. The patron replied with "The video is almost over. Fuck you." And MNC gave him a moment to gather his belongings. As the patron was leaving, he made threatening remarks towards MNC. 
After reviewing the incident with Branch Manager TFL, the individual will be suspended for 3 months.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Patron was on the computer watching a video, and suddenly shouted out loudly, "Shut up, bitch!" Librarian MK was walking through the area and went over to check in with him. After looking at her once, he twisted his head away and stared in the other direction. OSLIII MS and the VetSec guard DT went over at that point, too. MS asked patron if he was okay, and patron repeatedly said he couldn't hear, and refused to remove his earbuds even when requested to do so. Finally MS said, "you can't curse in here or we'll have to ask you to leave." Patron got angry and said, "I'll just leave then," yanked his earbuds from the computer. He cursed again at MS and stormed out, hitting the front door with his shoulder on the way through.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.7.4 Bullying per Pima County B.O.S. Policy D 23.1.
Description: Male customer was talking extremely loudly in the quiet section and could be heard across the library.  L3 KK gave him a couple of minutes to see if he would quiet but he got louder.  KK and Guard BJ approached the man.  Staff had not said anything to the man when he started calling KK and BJ "rude" and said that he did not have to follow rules of society.  KK made him aware that this was a quiet area and told him that he could talk in the cafe area.  The man became louder and called JB a "dog" and kept saying he did not have to follow the rules.  KK asked him to leave.  The young woman sitting next to him was extremely unnerved because he had targeted her in his rant.  She left her personal belongings and walked quickly away from the area.  It took the man several minutes to leave.  As he was passing the (BIPOC) woman, he called her a "poodle" in apparent reference to her hair.  He then made several derogatory comments regarding a staff member's disability when they had him leave property.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
