Description: Graffiti in 2nd floor women's restroom. Photos attached.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description: On Monday, 9/25 staff were closing the building at 6 PM. L3 LAF was on third floor helping staff close. When she checked the elevators to ensure they were empty, elevator 3 would not come up. LAF heard a few loud bangs from inside the elevator that were alarming, followed by the sound of multiple people laughing. She knocked on the elevator and called out, but no one responded. The elevator still wouldn't come up. On 2nd, LAF tried the elevator again with no result. On the first floor, LAF found the elevator completely malfunctioning, with a milk and snack from the snack program jammed inside the bottom of the door, creating a tiny crack. LAF managed to get her fingers inside the door and pry it open. The ceiling of the elevator was warped. The elevator would not function at all. Upon review of camera footage from inside the elevator, a large group of teens is seen entering the elevator from the 2nd floor around 6 PM. Once inside the elevator, two of them jump up and down multiple times (Cameron and the teen girl with multi-colored braids). The elevator arrives at the 1st floor and most teens exit, with a different pair (one male teen with twists and another male teen with dreads) shoving trash into the door, and another teen (Damian), the last to leave, pressing all the buttons.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Patron Melissa refused to get off of the public computer even though it was reserved for another patron, according to the patron she continued to try and type in her card number even after the reservation screen for the other patron came up. According to the patron with the reservation, Melissa began yelling at him, and he yelled back. This continued until Vetsec guard J.T. intervened and told the two to separate from each other. Patron Melissa was asked to leave for the day.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: Customer Christopher was using the Tucson room. Staff recognized him as a suspended person from an incident at Murphy-Wilmot on 9/25/2023. L2 JM and L3 LAF approached Christopher with the suspension letter from WIL. JM gave it to him and explained he was suspended for 6 months. Christopher said he would just leave and then went on to say, "this is why people become terrorists, because they get treated like this". JM and LAF waited outside the study room while he packed up his belongings and Christopher continued talking. Christopher said he wasn't "here to make friends, but is here to win" and he said "I like winning. I'm here to win". He went on to say that, "some people feed sad when they see people dying on the news, but I feel happy". LAF stopped Christopher and said his comments and language were threatening and that she needed him to stop and leave the premises. Christopher said, "okay, I hope I never see you again". LAF said okay. Christopher began to exit the room and said, "Auf wiedersehen. I hope to never see you again". Christopher jumped down some sets of stairs as he left. Guard JP, and JM and LAF walked behind to ensure he left the premises. Customer's suspension has been increased from 6 months to 1 year due to threatening statements and language.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.4 Bullying per Pima County B.O.S. Policy D 23.1.    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Making unwanted physical contact with another patron and repeating this action after being explicitly told not to make physical contact.
Description:
At approximately 3:30pm LA CS and L2 DB overheard a patron interaction between two patrons. One patron said: "Hey, please don't touch me!" and the other patron, Mary Pieta replied by shouting obscenities at the other patron. Both CS and DB immediately went to the public computer area. L2 DB approached Mary Pieta, who continued to shout at the other patron and began shouting at L2 DB. DB stated that today didn't seem like a good library day and that Mary would need to leave for the afternoon. Mary immediately began yelling more and louder obscenities at the librarian. "Shove it lady! For months I've been putting up with your shit and your growling and snarling face and I'd like to see the code of conduct for librarians!" At this point the other patron packed up her belongings and left the library. DB asked Mary Pieta to please leave the library for the rest of the day and asked if she would like a copy of the code of customer conduct. Mary kept yelling at the librarian and began packing up her bags. She walked toward the exit and turned around to yell at librarian DB and made more disparaging remarks about the librarians facial expressions, snarling and growling. The librarian offered to walk her to the exit so as to help quiet down the library for the other patrons using it. At the exit Mary Pieta turned around and shouted at CS and growled and snarled lifting her hands and making them into claws. Librarian DB stepped toward the front door and asked Mary to please leave for the day. 
The patron who asked Mary reported that she asked Mary not to touch her asked her twice and Mary made physical contact with her and repeated the contact after being asked not to do so.
Following this incident 3 patrons approached the LA and Librarian to check that they were okay.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description: L1 KN came to the staff area to get L3 AG, because guard Albert reported that there was an argument happening in the adult area. AG and L1 PC arrived at the area to find regular patron Rafael sitting about 2 chairs away from another regular patron, whose name we don't know but who has had previous issues with Rafael in the past, although he is generally quiet. Patron 2 was standing and saying that he had problems with "that guy" and that he didn't want to be anywhere near him. AG asked what had happened today, and both confirmed that Patron 2 had been sitting in the adult area when Rafael sat down near him. Patron 2 was agitated and using swear words in a loud voice. AG asked him not to use that language, and he apologized. AG told both gentlemen that this was a public area and that anyone could be here as long as they followed the behavior guidelines. Patron 2 reiterated that he had problems with Rafael in the past and didn't want to be anywhere near him. AG suggested that Patron 2 move to a different spot in the library, and Patron 2 asked why he needed to move because he was here first. AG said it was his option to stay but that the language and the loud arguing needed to stop. Patron 2 repeated several times that he had never been a problem, then moved his belongings one chair further away from Rafael. Staff will continue to monitor the area.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: A chemical smell of drugs was detected in the lobby and was traced back to the men's restroom. As a result, the restroom was locked for one hour to dissipate the smell.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Nick was holding his hand up in a Nazi salute to something he was watching on the computer, then made a vocal outburst.  By the time LibIII KW went to talk to him his hand was down.  KW asked how he was doing and he answered that his schizophrenia was acting up and that he would try to control his behavior but couldn't always.  KW said he would have to leave for the day if he was not able to comply with proper library behavior. Nick as usual was polite and compliant when talked to.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.4 Sleeping
Description:
Clerk JC was told by a patron that there was a woman sleeping in front of the library. Librarians DB and BP went outside to speak with her. DB asked how she was and offered her a bottle of cold water (that was accepted).  DB offered to call someone for her, but was declined and the woman asked for a phone charger (none available). She complained of the heat and being tired but seemed coherent. DB offered and gave her the "Need Help?" booklet with resources for the homeless.
LM recognized the woman from her using a computer earlier in the day.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Guard BJ smelled drug use coming from a lobby restroom.  As he approached the restroom a woman rapidly left nearly knocking him over.  L3 KK confirmed that the restroom had a very strong chemical smell and burnt smell.  Woman will be suspended for one year if she returns.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: L1 KG informed IC L1 WW that a patron had something stolen from him when he was in one of the 3rd floor men's restroom stalls.  WW spoke with the patron and he said that the person had reached under the stall and taken one of his plastic grocery bags which had groceries in it.  Victim could not identify the thief as he was in the stall at the time.  WW told the patron that he would make a note of the incident and that he was always welcome to call the police if he wanted, which he refused to do.  For documentation purposes.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.4 Bullying per Pima County B.O.S. Policy D 23.1.    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
At approximately 2:15pm on 9/28/2023 suspended customer Mary Pieta entered the library and went directly to the computer area. Librarian DB asked LA CS to accompany her in delivering a copy of the suspension letter to the customer. One copy of the letter had been mailed already. The librarian greeted the customer and asked if she would accompany her to speak to her outside. Mary Pieta immediately became verbally hostile and told the librarian that she was there to write a letter of complaint. The librarian stated that Mary was currently suspended from all library privileges, which includes use of the computers. Mary Pieta demanded to know why she was suspended and that she had resolved the little disagreement with the other patron and that the other patron apologized for causing a problem. Mary Pieta continued shouting at the librarian that she was there to write a letter of complaint and that DB was only doing this because she was too stupid to differentiate between disparaging remarks about a printer and disparaging remarks about a person. The librarian stated again that Mary was now suspended and remaining in the library would constitute trespassing and if she continued to remain in the library that library staff would need to notify law enforcement. Mary Pieta continued yelling and shouting at the librarian calling her stupid and approaching the librarian with a pointed finger. When DB asked Mary Pieta to please stop approaching her, Mary Pieta said that the librarian was afraid of words. The librarian then asked the library associate to please contact law enforcement because Mary Pieta was refusing to pack up her belongings and kept mumbling that she just needed to print this one thing out. The librarian again stated that unfortunately she is now suspended and would need to leave the library. When CS called 911 to ask for support, Mary Pieta began collecting her belongings and approached the librarian again in a very threatening manner and the librarian again asked her to please not approach any closer. Mary Pieta repeated that the librarian was stupid and believed all of the lies about her that other staff had poisoned her mind. She continued to argue that library staff was lying about her and that she was going to write a letter of complaint to get rid of DB for good. She then turned around and departed the library. 
This patron's behavior continues to escalate and she verbally and physically threatens library staff. For this reason her initial 3 month suspension has been extended to 6 months.
4 Sheriff's deputies arrived after her departure and they were given the information that a library patron had been hostile and was now suspended from the library.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: On Thursday 09/28/23, a patron came to the desk and informed LA, G.L., that someone was smoking meth in the men’s bathroom. LA K.K., informed branch manager, A.L. and both proceeded to the bathroom.  As they walked outside a young man in his late 20’s walked nervously and very quickly out of the bathroom.  A.L. and K.K. proceeded into the bathroom and immediately smelled a strong noxious odor. When they went outside again the man was already gone.  The bathroom door was immediately locked to allow the odor to dissipate.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description:
Damian entered the library at around 11:20 and went up to the 2nd floor. Guard J called LIC CS to come deliver his suspension paperwork from incident 0000022828. CS asked Damian for a word away from his two friends. When CS showed Damian the suspension paperwork, he immediately insisted that he had not jumped in the elevator and told CS he wasn't leaving until she showed him on the cameras where he had jumped. CS let him know that the whole group was suspended, not just the ones who had jumped, and that the rest of the information was on his paperwork. Damian said he wasn't touching the paperwork and went to get his bag, calling CS and Guard J "wack-ass bitches." Damian's friend tried to take the suspension paperwork for him, but Damian took it, crumpled it up, and threw it onto the stairs.
As Damian went down the stairs, he told CS, "Don't fucking follow me. I'm going to go get a piece and pull it on you," and, "I'm going to find out what kind of car you drive." He said several other threatening things as well, including mentioning a gun and telling CS, "I'm gonna slap you, bitch." He also continued to insult CS and guard J by calling them names and telling them to "suck my dick, dickmuncher."
Damian is already suspended for a year.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.7.4 Bullying per Pima County B.O.S. Policy D 23.1.~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
On Thursday 9/28/23 at approximately 3:30pm Branch Manager SH was alerted by library staff that there were several youth yelling slurs and obscenities at each other in the library. SH went out and youth immediately approached SH to begin telling him what happened. There were four youth (Austin, Braley, Ian, and Noel) involved in the verbal altercation. SH and LTA Supervisor MV began to speak with each youth to find out what happened. SH and MV first spoke with Ian and Ian said that the girls approached Ian and Austin who were sitting at the Adult public computers and began making fun of Austin’s economic status which made Austin upset. Ian said that he then called the girls “dumb sluts” and told them to leave repeatedly. Ian then said that Braley called him a racial slur regarding his BIPOC background. Ian then reported that he told Braley she looked like “Harry Potter’s autistic cousin”. Austin repeated the same story. SH then spoke with Braley and Noel and they said that the boys were calling them Mexicans and other names. It was determined after speaking with Ian, Austin, Braley and Noel, along with other witnesses that the story given was mostly factual. SH told Ian, Austin, Braley and Noel that they would need to leave for the day and would be informed of the length of their suspension. Ian, Austin and Noel left without further issue, however Braley refused to leave immediately and sat at Austin’s computer and began typing messages on the computer he was sitting at. She was again approached by SH and MV and told to leave the library immediately. At that point she slowly got up and left the library.
Austin and Noel were asked to leave for the day and because they were not involved in the verbal altercation other than being present during the length of it, and complied with library staff’s request to leave the library will not receive further disciplinary action.
Ian will be suspended for 3 days because of his decision to engage in a verbal altercation using harmful words and derogatory language inside of the library. Ian’s mother later willingly spoke with SH and informed SH that she would be having a conversation with Ian regarding his behavior inside of the library.
Braley will be suspended for 1 week because of her harassing and bullying behavior toward Austin, the harmful racial slurs she used toward Ian, and because of her refusal to follow a library staff request.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description:
On Thursday 9/28/23 at approximately 4pm Branch Manager SH informed teens Maddie, Iliana, and Isabella that they would need to leave the library for the day because they were yelling in the teen area. SH had already spoken with the youth in this area earlier in the day and told them that if they continued to be loud they would be asked to leave for the day. The other youth complied and quieted down, but Maddie, Iliana, and Isabella continued to be purposely be the loudest youth in the teen area. After SH asked Maddie, Iliana and Isabella to leave for the day, they seemed to comply and began to leave through the front of the library. Isabella immediately left the library and did not return, however Maddie and Iliana either left or pretended to leave the library and then came back inside. Maddie and Iliana both ran over to the Emergency Exit in the Teen area and pushed open the Emergency Exit door which caused the alarm to sound. SH confirmed with staff the identities of the teens who ran out of the library immediately after the alarm began to go off, and youth in this area confirmed that Maddie and Iliana pushed the door open and then ran through the library and exited through the front of the library.
Maddie and Iliana will each be suspended for 1 week for their failure to follow library staff’s request to leave the building for the day, and for purposely triggering an emergency exit alarm and creating an event that could have led to a panicked situation for patrons in the library.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description: Customers reported someone being in the family/unisex restroom for a long time. Branch Manager BL located footage on the security cameras showing two individuals going in together and then exiting a half hour later. They didn't appear to be regulars and their age was uncertain - anywhere from 16 to 20. They could have been high schoolers so I'm not adding any photos. They both had large bulky backpacks and hats on, which hid their appearance. They left the building immediately after leaving the restroom, so staff never spoke with them at all. We checked the restroom for drug paraphernalia and found none, but noticed a condom wrapper in the garbage can. Their behavior in the hallway suggested this was a planned meet-up. If we see them again, we will give them a verbal warning that this behavior is not allowed in the library.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: LA G.L. informed branch manager A.L. that a regular patron informed staff that a man was "doing meth" in the men's restroom, and he believed it was the same man as the previous day. A.L. and G.L. went into the restroom to check and found the man still in the accessible stall. When he came out, A.L. spoke to him, saying that this was the second day an odor of drugs was reported while he was using the restroom. He denied the use. A.L. said it was clear that he was the person using, and told him this was his single verbal warning; if he is found using any drugs on library property again, he would be suspended. A.L. also informed him of what happens when drug use occurs in a public restroom, that the restroom must close which could lead to the closure of the library. A.L. asked if the man understood. He said he did understand. A.L. then offered him resources and asked if he needed any assistance. He responded that he did not need assistance. The man left the property.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1 Any criminal offense    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.5 Failure to clean up after eating/drinking    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description: Upon finding trash in the morning, LA DB checked security cam footage and observed two people entering property at 2:42am that morning and then smoking something out of a pipe that they handed back and forth. Did not recognize either but they will be issued a 1-year suspension if we encounter them.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.4 Sleeping
Description: L3 KK and MAI L1 WW approached a man who was curled up sleeping against the staff entry door.  KK saw the man had a St. Joseph's Hospital bracelet. He was not wearing a shirt and had adhesive tabs on his chest perhaps from an EEG. He was wrapped in a hospital blanket. KK asked the man if he was okay and if she needed to call paramedics.  He said he was okay.  KK asked if he needed a ride.  He said no.  KK explained that he was blocking an emergency exit and that we did not allow people to sleep on property.  KK again offered to call for help.  The man declined the offer of help and also declined to move.  KK said that she would need to call 911 if he was unable to get up.  When the man saw that KK had her phone out, the man got up and walked toward St. Michael's.  Guard JB found him sleeping on another area of the property and asked him to get up.  The man cursed at BJ but left property.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description: Rose took food from the ICS food donation box, and then brought it outside. She came back into the library (without the food), and displayed her middle finger to LTA VM and Page R. While checking out DVDs, Rose was speaking in Spanish, and may have been using profanity. Rose asked (in English) for the name of LTA Supervisor SL. As she was leaving, Rose flipped off SL too.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: A customer reported a strong chemicals smell, like burnt tires, present in the men's restroom. Staff JH went to investigate, assisted by Security Guard KS. They confirmed the odor and a second customer exiting the facilities, stated that they'd seen a person (Unknown) leave the stall, wearing blue shoes. The camera footage is in line with the information supplied. A suspension will be issued.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description:
During the exterior walk-through in-charge staff LC and IR found evidence of drug use at the south area outside the garden enclosure. which included small pieces of foil with burnt marks consistent with their use for smoking chemical drugs. 
This is being reported as a drug use incident after-hours because evidence indicates that the drug use occurred on library grounds. Leaving behind drug paraphernalia causes a potential hazard to patrons who use the library during open hours. Unknown drug users will be issued a one-year suspension.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1 Any criminal offense    1.1.3 Theft
Description: Teenage Patron stole from another patron while on the computer, the customer reported that her wallet was in her bag, but when she went to check her bag her wallet was on top of her things in her bag. The teenage patron can be seen crawling towards her bag and removing item from patrons bag, and the patron can be seen counting the money as they are leaving.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description:
At 4:49 pm an unnamed adult approached a juvenile patron in front garden area and asked to use his cell phone. Juvenile patron refused and unnamed adult became enraged and began verbally assaulting the juvenile patron, which we learned following the incident.
At 4:51 the juvenile patron entered the library for safety. Unnamed adult began to shake out his belongings including bedding and clothing over the garden benches and tables. Guard MM approached unnamed adult, and unnamed adult asked to use a library phone. Guard MM directed him to ask inside.
At 4:55 the unnamed adult entered the building and asked to make a call. L1 MG stated that he could use the phone for local calls. At this point, unnamed adult again became enraged and began to scream at staff saying things like "what kind of f*cking call do you think I need to make, n*****?" Staff and patrons, especially juvenile patrons, in the building became alarmed. Several patrons stated they were afraid to walk out of the building after unnamed adult had left. Guard MM monitored the area to ensure the unnamed adult had left the premises. Since it was closing time, all staff and guard walked out together to their cars.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.7 Not wearing shoes or shirt
Description: Staff alerted LG that a male customer had entered the library dressed in only an unbuttoned flannel shirt and white briefs. He was in the building for lees than a minute and had approached the desk immediately. He seemed to be mumbling to himself and staff MM asked if he needed help, he stated that he had been "kicked out". He left the building right away and MM went to inform LG. LG went out, accompanied by Security Guard LH, but the man was already walking South on Sixth Avenue.LG and LH walked over to inform STPD of the incident, emphasizing to them that the man was not confrontational but may be in need of assistance.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Biohazard
Description: Guard BJ told L3 KK that there was a woman vomiting in the lobby.  KK found a female St. Joseph's Hospital patient vomiting into a trash can in the lobby.  The woman was wearing pants and a hospital shirt that only covered her front, had large bandaging on her upper right arm in the area of her surgery, and had bandages where IVs had been.  There was also scrapes on many areas of her body.  She said that she had just had surgery and had woken up in the hospital confused and wondering what was going on.  She felt that she was vomiting as a reaction to the medication in the IV she had received.  When nursing staff did not explain what was going on, the woman became angry at St. Joseph's staff and threw something at them.  They allowed her to make one phone call for someone to pick her up and escorted her onto library property so that she could be picked up at the library.  KK explained that we could call 911 and have her transported to a different hospital.  As KK began to make the call, her ride arrived.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using    1.1 Any criminal offense    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: IV drug use~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description: At 2:50 pm LSM VL notices that outside of the office window, Tim is camped against library wall and is using a knife to cut up a drinking straw. VL asks LA ES to alert guard. Vet Sec MM approaches Tim and witnesses him with tourniquet around arm and blood streaming down arm. Other witnesses from nearby school had observed the behavior. Vet Sec MM came inside and was advised by LSM VL that a year suspension starts now. Vet Sec MM notified L1 MG of the incident, and security footage confirmed activity reported. L1 MG notified the police that IV drug use was occurring nearby a school. Police never arrived. Tim entered the building and Vet Sec MM and L1 MG approached Tim. L1 MG notified Tim that he was suspended for using drugs and that his suspension would last one year. After he left, Vet Sec MM followed to ensure he was leaving the premises. Tim then began to verbally assault Vet Sec MM.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: A customer reported a drug smell in the men's restroom to LA TA.  The odor was verified, and the bathroom was closed to allow it to dissipate.  We were not able to identify the person responsible for the drug use in the restroom.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: Shortly after opening, patron came up to the front desk requesting that we call an emergency vehicle. Clerk MS got Librarian MK who made sure that the patron needed 911 for medical, and placed the call at 10:05.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1 Any criminal offense
Description: A dead pigeon that had been shot by a dart was discovered by a patron outside the front doors. Another patron said she had seen the bird fly into the doors, presumably after it had been shot. Librarian DSL and LII SW ensured that the pigeon, who was dead and no longer suffering, was removed safely.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Very emotional and Crying after losing work on computer
Description:
For Documentation Purposes 
 
At 11:07 a women on Computer 12 screamed that it shut down and that she lost all her work and that she needed it back immediately. Staff informed her that once the computer logs off the memory is wiped clean and there would not be a way to recover her work if it was not saved elsewhere. Woman became hysterical that it should have given her a warning so VV decided to check MYPC and saw that computer 12 was still logged in. VV went to investigate the computer and saw that it said available and restarted the computer. VV explained that computers will shut off after one hour if not extended. Patron became agitated that she was not given the option to extend at any point during her session. VV stated that it is possible there was a glitch as this sometimes happens. Woman became paranoid that the glitch only affected her instead of the entire library. VV offered to right a report to IT to investigate the computer but assured that this was not an attempt to harm her but something that can happen to computers. 
Woman wanted to speak to manager about how unfair it was that she had to be personally attacked in this way. Manager was unavailable so In Charge staff CM came out to reiterate what VV had told her. Patron wanted business cards of the manager, CM and VV, a copy of  the tech report and mentioned she will be speaking to the director about this injustice. After giving all the information CM told patron there wasn't any thing more they could do. Patron then replied fine I will leave the premises. CM clarified that she was not being asked to leave, but that staff have exhausted everything they could do to help.  
Patron then left without further incident

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Patron carrying around injured dog
Description: Approximately 11:15 am, a patron, experiencing homelessness, entered the library with his dog. The patron has been carrying around the dog in his shopping cart. The patron laid the dog down just inside the inside double doors because he could not bring his cart into the library. L1 MM informed LIC CM of the incident. The dog was in obvious distress, with some sort of injury to the dog's belly, and did not move. As Security guard MG was informing the patron that he would have to take the dog out of the library, the injury was noted. TPD officer KR informed the patron that he was going to call Pima Animal Control Center (PACC) to assess the dog. The patron asked for assistance to put the dog back in the cart. The patron was using a T-shirt to lift up the dog. MG assisted. KR and MG stayed with the patron until PACC arrived. The patron was cooperative and compliant. PACC officer C arrived at 12:05 and spoke to the patron. PACC Officer C made arrangements with a nearby veterinarian for the dog to be seen. PACC Officer C put the dog in his truck and left the premises at 12:30. The patron followed by walking with his cart to the nearby vet clinic.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others
Description: Man came into library and appeared to be intoxicated on some kind of upper. His movements were jerky, he was sweaty and his speech was difficult to understand. He asked if staff could fill out job applications for him. He claimed to be illiterate and just out of rehab. As staff attempted to explain that we can assist, have a program for job seekers etc. he seemed to be unable to focus on what staff were saying. He went and sat in front of a catalog computer. LIII TFL was observing discreetly as he approached another customer to ask if she would complete his applications. LIII TFL approached, assisted the same woman with printing and then asked that he not approach others trying to use the library for their individual needs. He complied. A few minutes later he sat a table near the service desk. He again asked for staff help but it was difficult to understand and when responding he would interrupt or ask another unrelated question. He was sweating profusely and displaying even more jerky/erratic movements. At that point TFL asked if he was ok. Again his response was garbled. At this point TFL explained that it did not seem to be a good day and asked if he might return when he as in a better state, on another day. He left without incident. This morning, 10/5/2023, he returned and immediately and more noticeably began gesticulating wildly, sweating profusely and seemed extremely intoxicated on some kind of upper. Sheriffs were on site and L1 BT had them assist him in asking the man to leave. He left without incident.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
A patron [Mavis McCullogh, name identified through MyPC/Sierra] approached LTA JM at the front desk around 12:15 asking for assistance in opening up their word document from the previous session on Public Computer #16, saying that in the process of typing her document she couldn't extend the time and decided to save the document to the computer before her time expired. After JM informed her that county computers wipe their local memory and had no method of recovering the document for her, she cursed under her breath and headed back to the computer lab in anger. JM informed LIII HT of the interaction, concerned that the patron was upset. 
At 12:27pm a patron called the branch. When LA MS answered, patron said "May I speak with your manager?" MS responded, "May I ask who is calling?" Patron responded, "Like that matters! God damn. Fuck." and hung up. MS then informed HT that she had received a call from an angry patron who swore and then hung up.
At 12:30pm, a call came in which MS identified as the same phone number. LI KVN answered the call. KVN said, "Green Valley Library, this is Kelli, how can I help you?" Patron responded in harsh tone, "I want to speak to your manager." KVN said "Sure, can I ask what this is about?" Patron said "No, it's none of your fucking business. I need a manager." KVN said, "Okay, I am a manager and want to know how I can help you." Patron said, "Are you that bitch that sits over on the left side there? Because I'm not going to fucking talk to you. You were already horrible to me. I want the manager over everything. You're a fucking bitch." KVN said "Okay, you want the branch manager?" Patron did not respond. KVN said "Let me go see if she's available." Patron did not respond. After checking to see if HT was available to take the call and letting her know the caller was very angry and cussing, KVN returned to the phone and said "Okay, I'm going to transfer you now." Patron did not respond. 
HT answered the transferred call from KVN and identified herself by name and title. She let the patron know that she would gladly speak with her but would not continue the call if the patron used profanity as she had in the previous two calls with library staff. The patron denied doing so and with voice rising said, “it [the computer] wouldn’t let me extend my time and I lost an important, time-sensitive document!” Based on this comment, HT surmised that the caller is the same patron as the previous call with MS and the in-person interaction with JM. The patron then said, “If I used profanity before, I’m sorry,” but that when she asked for help, the staff person told her to “save her work,” but “would not get off her fat ass” to help her. HT decided to overlook that comment and tried to ascertain the order of events and who the patron had asked for assistance. HT expressed regret that this had happened and confirmed what JM had told the patron at the Service Desk that there is not a way to get her work back. HT attempted to explain that items saved to a public computer are only saved as long as that user is logged in, and that the library loans flash drives so patrons can save their work externally as they go. The patron then said, “Go to hell!” and hung up. HT called back the patron, again expressing regret and that she wanted to help to which the patron responded, “Leave me alone!” and hung up.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: At approximately 1:15, guard Albert finished his rounds and reported to L3 AG that there was a person who had been in the men's restroom for about 15 minutes, and that there was a very strange smell. AG confirmed a harsh chemical smell consistent with illegal drug use. AG then asked the patron if they were ok, and told them that there had been a report of smoking in the restroom. The patron didn't respond but sounded like they were packing up. AG waited with Albert for them to come out, and when they did AG let them know that they were suspended from using libraries for a year. AG recognized that the patron was Gregory Nelson, whose suspension had been extended on 9-20-23.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Patron approached the 1st floor free masks and tried to talk to L1 WW about it, who was busy helping another customer. LIC MB asked the patron to talk to her at the corner of the desk to bring him away from the other customer. Patron made several complaints about the library's services including offering masks when they are "not needed" and the move of the books to the 3rd floor. He also made references to drug addicts committing sex crimes including inappropriate language. Guard JT asked him to give staff more space as he was getting very close. He backed up excessively and called MB & JT "Bitches" and "authority hogs" and went out the front door yelling that he was going to leave and never come back. He will be suspended for 2 weeks.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description: During their morning walkaround, L1 MNC and LTS Sup FA witnessed a drug deal. A man with a backpack walks into the staff parking area. A minute later, a silver car pulls up and the exchange begins. The man hands the woman in the car some money and she gives him a small baggie of something. The car heads off in the direction of Ajo while the man continues towards Mission Rd. The two will be suspended if they return to the branch.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating
Description:
At 11:08, Guard J called LIC CS to report a potential fight. Patron 1 (an older man in a blue jumpsuit) said that Patron 2 (a younger man with a baseball cap and a script tattoo on his jaw) had pushed him. No staff members witnessed the actual altercation. CS spoke to both men separately.
Patron 1 said that Patron 2 had approached him outside and asked him for a lighter. Patron 1 said he didn't have one. Patron 2 then followed Patron 1 into the lobby, pushed him, and told Patron 1 "not to disrespect him."
Patron 2 said that he had not pushed Patron 1; he said that Patron 1 was "being disrespectful" and had stepped toward him threateningly. Patron 2 put up his arm to ward Patron 1 off and their arms brushed each other.
Patron 2 left the library immediately after this conversation. Patron 1 called his grandson on the free phone and then left on his bike.
On the library camera footage, Patron 1 comes in yelling and gesturing towards Patron 2. He steps towards Patron 2 and makes a show of getting in his face. Patron 2 then takes a swipe at Patron 1. Patron 1 jumps back and starts yelling at Guard J.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description:
At around 11:45 AM CM received a call from County IT Administrative Services Mgr II, AF, about the patron from yesterday. AF stated that the patron contacted her District Supervisor about yesterday's incident.
IT asked CM and VV for a copy of the lib tech report to send to patron as IT did not understand what the issue was. (Patron claimed that she was hacked and that is why the computer timed out without proper warning).
VV explained to IT that Library technology was aware of the situation and closed it as this is a known issue across library systems that the computer will time out and shut off and there was no need to address the issue further as there was no evidence of a "hack" as the patron claims. It is possible that the computer simply timed out of her session and she did not take the precautions to periodically save her work on an external drive.
IT still asked to have a copy of the report that was made. IT was directed to the Library Technology department for further discussion

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others
Description: The man from Incident 0000022865 returned for a second time today after being asked to leave for the day earlier this morning. This time he was more under the influence and less coherent than before. He became argumentative when PCSD officers told him that he had to leave. L1 MNC came out to address the situation and verbally notified him of his suspension. A few minutes later, officers were finally able to guide him out the door and off library property.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description: A library patron came to the desk to let staff know that there was a naked woman in the restroom. I went to check out the restroom and found a woman at the sink totally naked, washing her clothes. I made her aware of our policy prohibiting folks from using the restrooms for bathing/washing clothes and offered to get her some information about local resources where she could tend to her hygiene needs--she understood and got dressed and returned to desk to grab that information. This is for documentation purposes only.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description:
At 2:04 pm Page AM notified LA DW and OSL GG that she saw a customer doing a line of drugs in the Magazine Area. LA DW and OSL GG talked to customer about alleged drug use. Customer denied using drugs.  Review of the security footage confirmed the description given by Page AM. The customer was observed rolling up a dollar bill and leaning over the table and inhaling a white substance.
Customer left before we could deliver a suspension for drug use in the library.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description: Page AF was working as computer monitor, and got drawn into a time-consuming tech question involving printing from a phone. The customer was very animated and activated and was getting visibly frustrated with the situation, when the phone's battery died. The customer leapt up, said they needed a cigarette, and then smacked Page AF in the thigh. The shock of this was hugely upsetting to AF and she needed to end her public shift early. We plan on speaking to the customer about our conduct expectations, and being mindful not to touch staff.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: A patron left a trail of blood after leaving the restroom. LA DB noted a bleeding wound on their elbow and asked if they should call 911 for immediate medical assistance. The patron did not realize they had been bleeding and initially said yes to calling 911, but then asked that the call be cancelled and said they had their own phone if they changed their mind. They left to seek care at their assisted living facility. Women's restroom was closed due to a large amount of blood on the floor, and a facilities request was submitted by LA DS to have the library cleaned in areas that came into contact with blood.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property
Description:
Patron came in saying that her new car was vandalized at the library.
Off-duty cop KR filed a report for the patron. Patron wanted security footage but was told it could not be released without a warrant but we could give them a general time frame for the report purpose, and once a warrant is filed we could give the video footage.
After viewing security footage a different patron is seen hitting her car, taking the broken piece, and placing it in his vehicle at 1:48 PM.
There is no clear view of the patron who hit her car is visible but patron was driving a white jeep with a brown camper

As library staff were closing, a patron said that he needed help. He told LIC CS that he was feeling dizzy and hallucinating and that he needed us to call for help. CS called 911. The EMTs arrived at 6:15 and took the patron's vitals, then escorted him outside to wait for the Crisis Response Team.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others
Description:
This is a series of events for documentation. 
On 10/5, one of our regular patrons, Todd, asked to speak with me (LA W.B.) privately in the library. Todd informed me that one of our regulars attacked him (on 10/3) and, I believe he said pushed him into a wall near the GLF bathroom which is outside in a breezeway (Todd described and pointed out which computer this patron was currently using so I could identify him, a man with blond hair in a pony tail named Jeremy). Todd said he attempted to file a restraining order at the GLF police substation and informed me he could not get one unless a 2nd incident occurred. He wanted to library staff know as he said he had talked to some of the staff the day of the incident. He did not wish to speak to the LIC. I let LIC V.G. know of the interaction, who later relayed the information to LIB II A.D. 
On 10/6 around 9:30 LTA SUP B.M. was arriving to pick up Friend's boxes and a patron in a car (BM described Todd, who is usually waiting outside the library long before we open) alerted him that another patron was urinating near library property in full sight of the parking lot and asked B.M. to do something about it. B.M. alerted library staff to the issue. Lib associate G.L walked the perimeter and found patrons Jeremy sitting behind the building. It was mentioned that some staff had heard of something happening between these two patrons sometime between 10-11 AM on 10/3 (and mentioned to staff later), but it appears any police activity was dealt with either at the substation or by calling 911, and library staff did not appear to be actively aware of an issue). 
For further documentation, Todd continued to alert staff on 10/6 shortly after we opened that someone had been bathing in the men's restroom and making a mess of water on the floor. Staff seemed to sense he was indicating it was the same patron, blond man with a ponytail (Jeremy) 
10/11/23: Patron Todd told LA W.B. around 1:30 on desk that patron Jeremy was "washing his clothes" outside by the patio. I explained that was not something we could deal with, but that I would check in with a librarian (LIB V.G. was on desk and overheard). I checked and indeed it was the same patron from previous.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property
Description: Monday morning while attending to library cleaning, graffiti was noticed on a computer desk by L1 MG. After consulting with LA CR, and reviewing camera footage it was discovered that at 1:25 pm on Friday, Shia wrote on library computer desks using markers. If he comes in he will be notified that he will be suspended for one week.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description: L1 SG was told that someone was using the women's restroom sink to wash her clothes and body. L1 SG went to the restroom and found a woman picking up a backpack in a paddle of water. She admitted that was using the sink to wash herself and clothes. L1 SG let her know that restrooms are for specific use and not to shower or wash clothes, if she needs a place for that the library could give her a list of places to go. The lady apologized and assured that it won't happen again. No further actions were taken.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.2 Strong odors
Description: Eagle Alan/Allen Cook and his brother (name unknown) spend many days at various locations and are experiencing homelessness. In recent days the Cook brothers' odor has become increasingly impactful to others. The two entered the library and began to set up at the laptop bar in the back of the library. Their odor lingered throughout the entire library space and multiple individuals moved away. LIII TFL approached to offer a "Need Help" brochure and ask that they clean up before returning. Eagle Cook stated "but we just cleaned up yesterday." LIII TFL responded that she understood the difficulty but that the ability of others to use the library was being impacted. Mr. Cook then stated he was going to sue the library in a loud voice, stopped once more on his way out to state the same to the Sheriff's, and both proceeded to leave without further incident.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description: Customer "Millie" came up to the desk to say that the library-sponsored Tucson Corral of Westerners program, would not admit her into the program because of how she was dressed.  She was wearing a scarf over her face in place of a mask.  L3 KK immediately went into the room and made the group leader Bill Kalt aware.  He said that there had been a misunderstanding.  There were lunches that some of the group had paid for and she was not offered a lunch.  He said there was an extra lunch and offered to give her one and he welcomed her to come into the program.  Millie said that she was not comfortable with that and said she would not be attending.  WIL was short-staffed and KK was trying to cover the desk so she left the room as Bill was trying to convince her to stay.  Moments later, Millie and a woman from the program came up to the desk arguing in front of LSM VL.  The woman (who spoke English with a strong accent) accused Millie of saying "Go back to your own country."  KK looked at Millie and asked her if she said that.  Millie said "yes" because she was frustrated.  KK asked the woman who was escalating the situation to leave the desk so that she could handle the situation.  KK again asked Millie if she told the woman to "go back to her own country" and Millie again confirmed (in the presence of LSM VL) that she had done so because she was "frustrated."  KK told her that the comment was racist and asked her to leave.  Millie argued that she was the one who had been victimized by not being allowed into the program, that WIL staff had made past mistakes with her personal information and had intentionally violated her privacy, and that she actually told the woman to "get back" because she was too close to her.  Millie said that she was 83 years old and had health issues requiring her to keep people away from her.  KK reminded her that she had repeatedly admitted to telling the customer to go back to her own country.  Millie became increasingly argumentative and finally KK ended the conversation since it was no longer productive.  Guard BJ escorted Millie from the building.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: At 11:30 AM, LIC CR looked out the windows of the cafe to an unmonitored corner of the library known for issues with drug use. A man was sitting under a bush and proceeded to light up a pill on a piece of foil. She and guard CS went outside and told the man to get rid of the drug paraphernalia, leave the property and that he was suspended from all library properties for the next year. He got up and walked part way down the building and continued to stand next to it. CS let him know he had to leave the property entirely and would have to wait for the bus at the bus stop.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.4 Sleeping    2.10 Creating tripping hazards, blocking aisles, exits, entrances~Medical 911
Description:
Staff DB informed LG that a woman was asleep at the exterior of the emergency exit, on the East side of the building. Security Guard LH and LG went to see and a woman was lying directly in front of the exit, with her head to the door. It took a few tries to get a verbal response and I asked if she needed medical assistance. She answered "no". I then explained that she was blocking the emergency exit and that presented a safety hazard to herself and others. She repeated multiple times that she was getting up, but did not do so. Again we asked if she required medical and she said yes. She gave us the name Crystal and stated her age to be 30 years.
Once she realized we were dialing medical on the spot from my cellphone, she quickly gathered her things and left, requesting that the call be cancelled.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: LTA GP informed L3 AG that a patron from an incident on 9-26-23 had approached the desk and told her that if "that homosexual" went near him again he would "take matters" into his own hands. AG confirmed with LSM AR that this was grounds for suspension, then approached the patron in the adult area with the guard. AG introduced herself and asked if he had made the previous comments, which he confirmed. He immediately started saying to get out of his face "with that shit." AG let him know that he needed to leave for the day for threatening another patron. He first denied that he had threatened anyone, then said he was standing up for himself, and that if the other patron got near him again it was "going to pop off." AG tried to give him a copy of the Code of Conduct, but he said he didn't want "any of that shit." He began arguing, saying that he was being "thrown out for no fucking reason," posturing, using profanity, and making references to his past with "the Crips." He said that he wasn't afraid of us because he was "about that life." AG reiterated that he needed to leave. He said "Or what?" and AG said we would need to call the police if he did not leave. He said, "Call them." AG and the guard turned to go and call the police, and as they walked towards the desk the patron picked up his things and began walking to the exit. AG let him know that he would be suspended for one month and he stopped and repeated "Get out of my ear with that shit" a couple of times. He continued to use profanity as he exited the building.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: LA NG was showing a patron where he could plug in his laptop in the cafe and while there, noticed a male patron loudly telling a female patron that she needed to leave with him, and appeared she did not want to leave.  NG asked "is everything okay over here?" and he said he was leaving and started to gather his things, while rambling a bit loudly.  NG started to escort him to the side door but as he got to outreach table on the other side of the cafe partition, he put his things down and said he needed to ask one more question, and then proceeded to shout at the female patron for her to come here and that he needed cigarettes. NG said "c'mon, let's go, you need to leave, let's try again tomorrow" and as the female patron walked over and took out a pack of cigarettes, he went to grab for them, she gave him cigarettes and NG escorted him to the side door and he left.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal
Description: Two dogs got into a fight at the express computers: one light brown dog and one dark gray pit bull owned by a couple. Both owners were shouting at each other and trying to separate their dogs. The pit bull sank its teeth into the brown dog's leg and the owners had difficulty getting it to let go. The brown dog and owner left as soon as the dogs were disengaged. LIC MB asked the couple to remove the pit bull from the building as soon as the other dog & owner had left.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.2 Disruptive use of personal devices
Description:
While staffing Homework Help (3-4pm), Lib I KVN overheard an adult customer using profanity while seated in the Teen Area; the customer repeatedly made annoyed exclamations at her work on her laptop, such as "Are you kidding me?" "Come on" "Jesus Fucking Christ" and "Fucking really?" loudly enough that a teen browsing in Teen Fiction quickly left. KVN was unsure whether this behavior constituted a violation of the Code of Conduct so did not address it with the customer.
Periodically, over the course of two hours between 3:00pm and closing at 5:00pm, the customer used a hostile tone and made disparaging remarks about the staff and the library during interactions with five different staff members. For example, the customer told LTA JM that our staff/library had "poor communication skills" since the library hadn’t come up in her search results for public libraries in the area and no one had informed her that our wifi needed a password. JM told the customer the password while pointing to the sign on the wall behind him.
The customer returned a few minutes later to the service desk and told JM the wifi wasn't working and again denigrated our communication skills. JM explained that it might take a few moments for the popup window showing the computer use agreement to appear and that she would then be prompted to click "I agree." In a rude tone, the customer told JM that she's been around the country and never had to do this on other wifi networks. She used a similar tone when asking a page where she could find a nearby outlet to plug in her laptop. 
 
When doing her closing rounds, KVN approached the patron at approximately 4:56pm to give her a warning that the computer would automatically shut off at 5:00pm. The patron asked for help as she was having trouble printing. KVN went to the computer to assist at which time the patron told KVN that our system was so "convoluted" that she needed to print each page of her PDF document individually. KVN offered to help her print the whole document and the customer, in a harsh tone, exclaimed, "No," and went on to say that she had had to sit at four different computers before she could find one that worked so she thought it was still 4:00pm. [It turns out she had attempted to use an adult guest pass on both a teen and a children’s computer; her complaint, though harshly delivered, was accurate—we do not have signs on the teen and children’s computers explaining that logging in requires teen/child library cards/guest passes—this will be remedied.]
KVN apologized for her experience and reiterated that the computer would automatically shut off in two minutes; KVN then let the customer know that the SAH library was open until 6:00pm. The patron snidely asked if KVN would reimburse her gas mileage and went on to comment that the whole staff here is incompetent, this is the worst library she has visited, and that no one communicates. She then added that staff are all civil servants who don’t care and don’t deserve to be paid. KVN listened and tried to apologize again for the woman’s experience, at which point the customer accused KVN of being insincere and “sadistic” since KVN “had a smile on [her] face.” On her way out, the customer told staff at the front desk (JM and two pages) that the whole time she was explaining her issues to KVN, KVN was smiling in amusement at her problems, taking joy in her pain, saying to them, “That is sadistic.” The customer also said that she would be "filing a formal complaint" about KVN and her experience here.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description: Regular customer slipped a note to L2 CS while she was on the 3rd floor desk. The note asked if she had an "interracial baby" and stated "I can't remember if I've slept with you." CS shook her head at him and left the desk. The customer returned to a chair on the 3rd floor. After reviewing the note with Managers LF & MS, LIC MB asked the customer to leave for harassing staff. He agreed at first but then became argumentative, wanted to see the note, asked MB to read the note aloud (she did not), claimed that CS had committed a crime against him in the library and he was trying to gather evidence for the FBI. He asked for her name and MB's full name, which were not given. Manager MS stepped in and asked him to leave again. He gathered his things and left the building.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.12 Belongings: Leaving unattended, may be removed without notice    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others
Description: At 5:30pm LII IC JM was alerted to a patron situation on the 1st floor by LI BC who was working the desk there. VetSec guard R was speaking to a male patron by the 1st floor desk and patron Reyna Viridiana Yaneth was using the public phone on the 1st floor. LII IC JM asked VetSec guard R for information and he reported that the female patron Reyna had claimed that the male patron was stalking her. The male patron said that he had met her at a park earlier and that he was just trying to talk to her. When LII IC JM asked the female patron Reyna and her friend about the situation, she said that the accused patron had been following her. VetSec guard R and LII IC JM spoke with the man being accused of following her and asked him to please leave her alone and give her space as she doesn't want to be bothered. The male patron said he didn't have anywhere else to go and wanted to be on the computers. Reyna asked staff at the 1st floor desk how she could get a safe ride to her hotel. Reyna claimed that she could not trust  LII IC JM called TPD non-emergency phone number from the circulation desk to inquire about a safe ride for a patron. The patron Reyna called TPD from the public phone on 1st floor by the elevators and was on the phone for more than an hour talking to various people on the public phone to try to arrange a ride and to complain about someone following her.

I told her this wasn't appropriate and she could be suspended if this happened again. She told me she would call downtown and complain about me and LTA Supervisor SL (who she did not interact with today.)

Description: Patron AMF returned several books with live bed bugs. Bed bug procedures followed with submitted facilities request. Block has been placed on patron's account and books still checked out have been recalled for the bed bug card.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: A young man age 12 left the library and came back in a reported that his unlocked bike was stolen.  He was on the phone with his parents who seemed to prompt him to asked if we he asked if and if he could look at them.  Librarian I KN told him that yes, we have cameras, but that he (or his parents) would need to make a police report and then we can show the footage to the police.  Shortly after this interaction his parents came into the library (the mother's named is Desiree).  The parents were hostile when as they began talking to librarian I KN and said they had called the police.  They didn't understand why they couldn't look at the camera footage.  LTA supervisor JA got assistant manager DT, she came out and talked to the parents, she told them the same thing KN had explained (they needed a police report etc.).  The parents calmed down and went outside to wait for the Sheriff.  When the Shariff arrived about 4:10 the parents had left the premise.  DT let the sheriff know that they could have a copy of the incident on Monday when manage AG returns to the library.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.4 Bullying per Pima County B.O.S. Policy D 23.1.~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: Between 12-1 p.m. multiple staff attempted to help an elderly man to print an image he needed. his technology skills were limited and he appeared to have a hearing impairment. While LIII TFL attempted to help him, a man a few seats down seemed agitated and repeatedly glared as TFL attempted to try and help but did not engage or speak to her. LA KV took over so LIII TFL could go to lunch. A man a few computers down began gesticulating and sighing while KVs attention was on the original customer. The man stated "can you be quiet" LA KV turned toward the man who then stated "lower your voice" KV stated "I am trying to help someone." The man then said "shut up" to KV who stated "you cannot speak to me like that" the man then proceeded to make a "shhhh" sound four times in quick succession. LA KV asked if he would like some earbuds and the man stated "I don't need earbuds, I just need you to be quiet." At this point LA KV got L1 MC who approached the man and asked whether he was having issues with the computer. The man stated that his computer was fine and that he wanted the library to be quiet. L1 MC stated that libraries are no longer quiet places and that people may have conversations at normal volumes. MC stated that if the man had an issue with someone's volume that we need him to come to the desk and speak with staff. The man stated that he can tell people to be quiet in the library and MC stated that it was not appropriate tell others how to conduct themselves in the library and again stated that these concerns should be brought to staff. The man continued to argue the point and MC restated once more that we need him to bring his concerns to staff at the service desk. At that point the man disengaged from the conversation but remained in the library and stared at staff and others a few more times but otherwise used the library without incident.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal
Description:
A women came in carrying several bags one of which was a large carrier bag with a large orange and white cat inside. The bag was emitting a strong odor of cat urine from it, and the patron had informed staff that she  had just been evited from her home. Branch Manager MS, went to the patron and said, "hi ma'am, I couldn't help but notice that you have a cat here, and we can't have animals here unless it's a services animal." The patron said, "he is!, he is my emotional support animal". Branch Manager MS responded and said that "Emotional Support animals and Services animals are two different things, the animal must perform a service."  MS said that she is not kicking her out of the library, I understand all that you have been through, I'm going to make an exception and I just ask that if you can just keep the cat in the lobby, because people have allergies to cats. A staff member had experience and allergic reaction from the cat. The Patron rolled her eyes, but complied.
 
 
for documentation purposes.

Description: Patron reported a suspicious smell in the men's bathroom.  Guard CS confirmed the smell and LTA Supervisor JF closed the bathroom and posted a closed sign.  There is no way to verify which of 5 patrons is the source of the smell.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description:
At approximately 9:59 AM, an unknown female patron was waiting for the library doors to open. L3 LAF was in the lobby, waiting for open and supporting staff. She began cursing and yelling at guards through the glass as they were about to open the doors because she was angry the library wasn't open yet. She then began cursing and yelling at the other patrons waiting to enter the library, agitating them and making them upset. The other customers turned to the guard and said, "Can you get her out of here?". The woman then stormed off.
At 12:30, Guard J called LIC AK to report computer vandalism and disruptive behavior on the 1st floor. At approximately 12:20, an unknown female patron became agitated and told a teenage patron near the circulation desk, "You could die today." LA MG witnessed this.  Guard J said that the patron turned off some of the 1st floor lights and knocked a catalog computer and keyboard askew.  The patron also vandalized computer 7 in the Express area.  She took the computer off the stand, unplugged it, and the keyboard was found at another station. LAT NG later examined the computer and put it back together.  The patron was cursing, and she left the building on her own.  Customer has been suspended for 1 year.
