Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.2 Disruptive use of personal devices    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal
Description: Patron entered with his pit bull.  The dog barked at another dog in the building while the patron was talking to LA NG.  L1 JB came out and explained that the dog would need to leave.  The man explained that his phone was dead and he needed to call his wife.  JB and L2 CM agreed that as long as the dog had no further behaviors they could stay.  2 minutes later NG came to the back room and reported that the dog was hypervigilant around people and a patron had complained.  JB informed the patron that the dog must leave.  The man proclaimed that his dog was a service dog and they had every right to be there.  JB explained that the behavior was not allowed so the dog needed to leave.  The man tied the dog's leash to a full shopping cart on the front patio and went back inside.  CM explained that the dog could not stay on the front property.  Guard CS stayed with the dog to ensure that no children coming to storytime tried to pet or agitate it.  CM said he could have 10 minutes to call his wife and then he needed to leave.  The man completed the call within the allotted time frame but was shouting into the phone the whole time.  He left by himself and took both the dog and the shopping cart at the end of ten minutes.  Another patron approached JB and said "That guy was too close.  I was watching him and I was ready to punch him if he made a move." JB explained that while appreciated, that was not necessary or even helpful.  The man just winked and said, "I've got your back."

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description: At 11:30 staff reported that someone was fighting outside. L3 AG and L1 KN went outside through the staff door to find L2 DT already watching from the main library entrance. A group of patrons from the English Language class were gathered on the sidewalk, and the driver of a large white truck was shouting at one of them from behind the driver's seat. As staff tried to ascertain what had happened, the driver pointed to patron Octavio and said, "Don't let that guy take any girls home," before driving away. KN went and got LTA Supe JA for translation services with the group that remained. From what JA could gather, another student's dad arrived in the truck and started threatening him. Octavio did not mention what was said or why the altercation occurred. Upon reviewing the Meraki footage, it appears that the man in the truck pulled up, one of the students came over to the truck and got in, and the driver motioned to Octavio. Another man got out of the truck to watch the proceedings. The driver and Octavio have a short conversation before the driver begins advancing, and Octavio backs away down the sidewalk. Eventually the driver gets back into the truck. It doesn't appear as though any physical contact occurred between them.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal
Description:
Jennifer McIntyre (Caucasian, ~60 YO, blond hair, 5'2" holding black soft sided cat-carrier with cat inside it) came to the desk to claim a credit/debit card she had left the previous day. LIB LD restored her property and I recognized her from incident 0000022894.
I printed and gave her contact info and driving directions to Sister Jose's on Park & 22nd (a low barrier women's shelter that allows women in with a cat or dog). Twenty minutes later she came back in (not carrying bags) for items on the hold shelf. I checked out her items then saw her bags and cat in the front lobby.  I reminded her she cannot bring in any animal except a service dog or horse to any library. She was worried about leaving the cat in a hot car and I re-enforced that Sister Jose's was a cooling center and would allow her to come in with a pet.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal
Description: L1 JB was in the cafe area when a patron walking to the desk shouted "People stealing fucking phones."  The woman was at the desk with a dog beside her chewing on his rope leash.  LA NG went in the back to search lost and found for the missing phone.  While the woman waited the dog started barking.  The woman went back into the cafe shouting about how her son was kidnapped and no one follows the law.  NG came out and said we did not have the phone.  JB stated that the dog needed to leave.  The woman left with the dog and her husband while continuing to shout "people never follow the fucking law."  The two people and the dog were on the horseshoe bench further from the west-facing door.  Another patron sitting there came and complained to JB and guard CS that the dog was aggressive.  JB and CS went outside and CS explained that the bench where they were sitting was disputed whether it was city or county territory.  The woman continued to shout profanity and the dog continued to bark.  JB asked CS to remove the two.   He approached the woman and the dog jumped up on CS.  CS calmed the dog by scratching his ears and chin, then asked the woman to leave.  She continued shouting but gathered her things and went to the bus stop.  CS returned to JB and stated that in his professional opinion, the dog was a danger.  It was frisky rather than angry, but still out of control and willing to jump on people.

Security Guard LH and I went to check on a male customer who seemed to be sleeping in a slumped position. We were unable to wake the customer but noticed he was breathing. After repeated attempts, we called for medical assistance. The customer woke up when the responders physically shook his shoulder and refused any vitals check.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description: Patron who uses computers has been talking frequently at an elevated volume, using profanity and making references to distressing subjects in the computer area. She was asked twice by guard J to stop cursing before 1pm. At 3:30pm, other patrons complained about profanity and volume to DL at the 1st floor desk. Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: Bob (last name unknown) has been coming to MIS needing extensive computer help. Bob becomes easily frustrated and impatient with technology and expects staff members to complete tasks on his behalf rather than being walked through them. When he becomes impatient he tosses his phone at staff, expecting them to handle it. His reason for using library computers centers on online dating and his desire for a roommate who will agree to cook, clean and "provide companionship." Bob also becomes frustrated that his postings to do not receive immediate responses and staff are uncomfortable with having his frustration directed at them over something beyond their control and outside of our scope of service. The frequency and length of time needed to assist Bob with non-library related tech help has been a discussion at a recent in-charge meeting. Bob has been asked to consider coming to one-on-one help many times but he has not followed staff direction. On Friday Bob came to the service desk and while being helped by L1 BT stated (to she and LTA AO) that this would easier for him if she and LTA AO "had grandmas or aunts" that he could be introduced to. L1 BT did not acknowledge this comment and continued to attempt to help Bob. At a certain point Bob lost patience and tossed his phone toward her impatiently. L1 BT stated that she did not feel comfortable handling his phone. He asked to speak to the manager, who was at lunch. L1 BR came out to back up L1 BT and reasserted to the customer that we have limits on the help we can provide from the service desk and again asked that he consider coming to one-on-one help. Bob left frustrated, stating he would go to another library. For documentation.

It has to be a service animal and a cat is not protected under the ADA, it's either a dog or miniature horse. Patron Jennifer became argumentative. Branch Manager MS reiterated that the animal has to be a service animal and perform a service. 
 
for documentation purposes.

Description: Faustin came in after school and was caught with his pants falling down.  In charge staff JF assumed it was unintentional and told him to pull them up and make sure they did not fall again.  Later Faustin received a beef jerky stick saying "This is my weenie." About half an hour later the children reported to LA TA that Faustin forcing the beef jerky stick into the mouth of a girl in the children's area while his friend Justine stood by laughing.  She also reported that he was coming into the children's area to pull down his pants in front of her, though the boxers stayed up. The girl was shaking and upset.  When the boys were approached both Faustin and Justine protested that Faustin had done nothing. Faustin was holding a beef jerky stick with a single bite taken out of it, and he threw away the beef jerky stick on his way out.  They were escorted out by TA and JF, later joined by L1 JB when she heard the commotion.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: For documentation only: doing a daily pickup outside the building, LIC CR and L1 MG found approximately 25 to 30 pieces of burned foil and several cut straws in the northwest corner outside the cafe area and under a yucca next to the emergency exit on the east side of the building. There are also two additional incidents of human feces that were reported today, in addition to the one that facilities took care of earlier in the week. These are in the same areas as the recurrent drug use.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: At approximately 12:30 a patron in a green shirt approaches Page AM while shelving and tells her that he needs help opening a locker because he does not see his phone in the locker. Page AM goes to help the patron and is having trouble opening it but confirms there is no phone in the locker. Page AM goes to LA CR for help. LA CR goes to the lockers and notices that the locker box where the patron had his phone had a blue light, which means that it is an available locker. LA CR asks the patron if he had unlocked the locker before checking it again. LA CR explained that every time a phone is “retrieved” from the locker they must create a new pin if they want to leave it charging again. If not, the phone will remain in the locker but show as available. Unfortunately, the only people with security camera access were at lunch so LA CR asked if they wouldn't mind waiting a couple of minutes until someone came back to check the cameras. The patron was understanding and said he would come back later. LA ES came back, and she was able to look at the security footage. From the security footage, patron in the green shirt goes to use the charging station for the first time at 10:37am then goes to check it again at 10:54am but does not create a new pin. At 11:57am patron Margarita, who was using study room 106 goes over to study room 108 to talk to Michael, the patron she came in with. They then both go to the charging station and retrieve their devices. While there, Michael notices that there is a phone in locker #8. He can open the locker since it was showing available and creates a pin for the locker but leaves the phone in the locker. They both walk back to room 108, Michael stays in the room and Margarita goes back to the charging station, retrieves the phone using the pin that Michael created and takes the phone. They both leave the library at 12:00. They will both be suspended for a year. The patron in the green shirt returned later and asked if we were able to see who it was, L1 MG let him know that we were and that they are now suspended.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: At 1:30, Vet Sec MM approached a study room to let the four occupants know that they were being too loud and disrupting other patrons. When the study room door was opened, Vet Sec MM noticed a strong marijuana smell. Vet Sec MM alerted L1 MG to corroborate the smell. L1 MG approached the room and determined that there was a strong smell associated with marijuana. As L1 MG could not determine if the substance was used inside the library or before entering, L1 MG asked the group to leave for the day. As the group was leaving, one falsely accused Vet Sec MM of calling them "ugly bitches." The group proceeded to yell throughout the library on their way to the door phrases such as "old ass bitch," "pussy ass bitch," and "ugly ass bitch" directed to Vet Sec MM. Due to the escalating nature of their outburst, L1 MG notified the group that they would be suspended for six months. They responded by continuing their verbal assault saying "we don't want to come back here with you ugly ass bitches anyway," before exiting the building.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: patron tried to touch another patron under the stalls, reported to have feces on her hands~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: behavior required keeping other patrons out of the restroom until she left
Description:
Shortly after opening the library at 10:07am a woman approached the 1st floor circulation desk and reported that there were currently two women fighting in the 1st floor women's restroom. This information was reported to both LIC LII JM and LTA NG. LIC LII JM walked towards children's area to enlist the help of Vet Sec guard JT, and Vet Sec guard I was also present at the time and the 3 of them headed towards the bathroom. At this time a patron named Sienna exited the bathroom and Vet Sec guard Jen and LIC LII spoke with her about what was happening inside. The patron, Sienna stated that the woman currently in the restroom started a fight with her verbally and was trying to touch her legs under the stall. The patron also reported that the woman had feces on her hands which was seen by Sienna as she reached under the other women's stall. The patron Sienna was asked to stay away from the patron in the restroom and not to fight her. Patron Sienna went to stand over by the express computers but was not using the computers. Vet Sec guard J knocked on the door and opened it slightly - loudly asking if the woman was okay, or if she needed any help, and told her that it was reported that she was fighting with someone in there. J then entered the bathroom and the patron used abusive language with her from the closed stall. Vet Sec guards J and I and LIC L2 JM waited for the patron to exit the restroom so that they could speak with her. LIC L2 proceeded to speak again with the Patron Sienna over by the express computers and she stated again that she was ready to fight patron still in the restroom because of what she had said from the restroom stall, things that didn't make sense to patron Sienna like, "they're going to kill your children." LIC L2 told the woman that fighting is not allowed in the library and it would be a 1 year suspension, and that she should not engage the woman anymore. Patron Sienna said that she did not know the patron in the restroom from anywhere else. Sienna continued standing at the computers and watching for the patron to come out. The Patron left the restroom after a few more minutes at 10:18am and walked quickly out of the library sliding front doors as Vet Set Guard Jen made a "stop" hand gesture to Sienna at the computers telling Sienna not to engage the patron, and the patron left the building without incident. At this point L3 LF arrived after being alerted by LIC L2 JM of the situation and L3 LF along with L2 JM spoke with Sienna further about the incident. After making sure that Sienna was calmed down, L3 LF and L2 JM proceeded into the entrance to children's and spoke with the patron who originally had reported the verbal fighting. This patron stated that she did not know either woman in the verbal altercation and when she heard them fighting she immediately left the restroom to tell library staff at the front desk what was happening.
Addendum: Woman just returned to library (10/24/23 at 2:45 PM) and LIC BC verbally informed her that she is suspended for 1 year. She left with no problems.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description:
While pulling books on the 3rd floor, L2 CS heard regular patron Joe talking to himself. He was saying very concerning things, including, "What the fuck did you just say to me?" and "You fucking cunt" and "Yeah, beat the shit out of her." Upon closer inspection, it appeared that Joe was reacting to a movie he was watching on his phone.
CS related this to LIC JM, who went to ask Joe to please keep his voice down. Joe was immediately angry and responded that he hadn't talked to anyone. JM reiterated that this was the quiet floor, and that staff could hear him, so to please keep his voice down. Joe said, "Fine. Now leave me the fuck alone." As JM and CS walked away, he asked if he was chewing too loud, too, and then banged on his desk and shouted, "Fuck!" JM felt very threatened during this interaction, as Joe was speaking to and staring at her aggressively.
Joe spent the next 20 minutes pacing the 3rd floor and glaring threateningly at the desk staff. Eventually, he went to Guard J and began talking loudly and angrily to him. He told Jim that he had put 23 people in body bags, and he would put a 24th in the ground if they messed with him. CS requested help from L3 MS, as the situation felt very volatile and Joe tends to respond much better to male staff members.
MS spoke to Joe, who was immediately quiet and agreeable. Joe said that he had been having a bad day and agreed to leave. He packed up his belongings and left without argument.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Description: Margaret Gauna has been coming into QUI lately, and told Lib 3 LM that she would never go to WDS anymore because someone there is stealing her information while she is on the computer.  She got on to a computer here--because we know her, we extend her sessions so that they won't time out (she thinks that the sessions time out because someone knows her library card number and pin and they are intentionally logging her off).  She went to the bathroom, came back, and then came up to the desk to say that she had locked her computer, but someone went in, stole all her information and logged her out while she was gone.  She got very upset and demanded to know the names and numbers of LM's boss and the head of IT. LM gave her the name and number of LSM PAC, and also the number for Pima County IT.  This is the second time that she's accused staff and other customers of stealing her information.  This is for documentation purposes.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Children in the Library
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Running into other library patrons~Children in the Library    4.2 Leaving child unsupervised or ignoring disruptive behavior of child
Description: Upon returning from lunch, LA KV observed inappropriate behaviors from a family they have spoken to before. The caregiver was on the computer ignoring 4 children, one who happened to be a three year old. One child was on the opposite side of the library, while the child pictured in gray was laughing at the child in blue and the youngest child punching each other and wresting on the floor in front of the hold shelf. These are behaviors that we have seen before and have attempted to control. LA KV approached the guardian and told her "Excuse me ma'am, I'm sorry to interrupt, but the children cannot be punching each other and wrestling on floor" she replied with "okay" and waved her hand to dismiss. LA KV walked away without her actually saying anything to the children, and they began running around in circles around the computers in the middle of the library, actively running into another patron multiple times. The patron that they were running into was sitting on a computer. After running into the patron they ran towards the middle of the library and were climbing on chairs and furniture. LA KV approached her again and stated that the children could not be running around the library, and that it was becoming disruptive for other people around. The guardian proceeded to state  "they're not bothering anyone, I don't know what you want me to do. They're kids, you never have kids in here?" LA KV proceeded to reply with "The space is open to any patrons, but the behavior unfortunately is excessive and disruptive due to PCPL policy and we will have to ask you to leave if the behaviors continue." At that point the patron replies with "You can kick people out of the library for having kids?" LA KV replied with "no ma'am, we do not kick people out of the library for having kids, the behavior is disruptive and we have to make sure we follow county policy." At that moment LA KV returned to the service desk. The children were still partially climbing on furniture. The patron came up to the service desk annoyed and aggravated. She started asking LA KV why LA KV would approach her and stated "you can't say that they were wrestling and hitting each other, they weren't doing that" LA KV attempted to explain to the patron the behaviors that I had observed, but every time LA KV attempted to get a word in, the guardian would interrupt and state "You only target my kids, you've never told any other kids anything" and was denying any of the behaviors that were observed. She requested to speak to LIC JM, and when LA KV went to get him for her, she discovered that LIC JM was on a call and was unavailable. LIC JM stated he needed 5 minutes and would be right out. LA KV came back out to let the patron know that LIC JM would come speak to her in 5 minutes, but found her attempting to be argumentative with LTA SUP JH, while he was attempting to explain liability and policy to the patron. LA KV let her know that LIC JM would be available in 5 minutes time. She continued to be argumentative with both LA KV and LTA SUP JH. At that point LA KV stated "Ma'am I will need to ask you to please step outside and wait for the supervisor as the behavior is still disruptive." She became even more upset and stated she wouldn't be kicked out of the library and demanded the phone number for the manager. I gave her the public SWE number and let her know she could call and speak to LIC JM.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.4 Vandalizing property~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: Throwing and damaging books
Description:
At about 1:10pm, I got a call that there was yelling on the second-floor teen area. When I got there, one group of about 5-6 teens (Group B) had left the building, and another group of 3 teens (Group A) were sitting at a table in the teen area, looking through the window. L1MB was at the teen desk and told me that the two groups had been yelling at each other. I spoke to the teens in Group A, who said that "everything was cool," and that they were fine, that there was no problem. I went downstairs and spoke with Guard JT, who was watching Group A who were sitting together in the plaza. We watched them for a while, identifying Ashley and another teen I recognized possibly as Manny. There were two or three others with them. One Guard JT recognized as being too old for the teen room (18yrs+). L1MB texted that Group A was talking amongst themselves that they were looking for a way out. I approached them again and asked if they were worried about leaving. They said, no, that they were ok, but they seemed frightened and worried to me. 
About a minute later, Group B returned and sat and stood outside the teen area. One of Group A, the girl, sprang up and started yelling and Group B. Everything then escalated quickly, in a matter of seconds. Kids were screaming and posturing to each other, swearing and out of control. Someone then started throwing books, and they began throwing books at each other. There were uninvolved patrons nearby, and the teens were near the balcony edge, but as far as I could tell, no books fell to the first floor or hit any bystanders. Guard IB tried to calm things down, but they were furious and beyond listening. L1MB called 911 from the teen desk. I ran upstairs to get L3MS, and we ran down together. L2KW was also calling 911 from the 2nd floor desk. The groups then ran down the stairs, Group B first. Group A followed, shouting to each other that there should be a back door. In the confusion downstairs, both groups were yelling. Group B left through the main doors and started toward the NE side of the building. Group A then tried to get out the emergency exit by the public computers, although we were yelling for them not to. They met Group B outside the door. Group A came back inside and then fled from the main doors. 
Police came within about 10 minutes, including Officer Lopez. Several of us made statements.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: Around 3:00 p.m. two individuals entered the library with no shoes on in pajamas and after interacting with staff it seemed they may be vulnerable adults. They indicated they could not return home and seemed committed to this despite being unprepared for a night outside in cold temperatures. After getting them settled with snacks LIII TFL reached out to the crisis response team to enlist their help in securing safety for the two. Crisis response dispatched a team and advised that TFL call police to determine whether a missing person's report existed. TFL dialed 911 as there was no answer at the non-emergency TPD line. No missing person's report had been filed at that time. Two teams arrived to assess the individuals approximately 1 hour later (just after 5:00 p.m.) and both individuals left with the crisis response team at closing. For documentation as 911 was contacted.

Description: GLF page AM reported that there was a strong odor in the public men's restroom. At first it smelled like body spray, and the further into the restroom he walked, the stronger it smelled of fentanyl. He also saw the person in a stall drop a straw on the ground. Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.1 Harassment: Filming or photographing without permission    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description: A woman came up to LIII BL at the desk to complain that three boys in a glass study roomy were laughing at her child who was on a computer and taking photos of him. I said, oh no, that’s not okay - let me have a conversation and see what I can find out. She pointed to the study room and told me her husband was going in to yell at them for bullying their son. He was in the room briefly as I was walking over and then the two of them headed into a different direction, into the teen area with their daughter. When I went into the room I immediately told the kids that was not okay for the man to enter the room and I asked them what he said. They told me he accused them of laughing and taking photos of the son, but they told him (and me) that they were laughing at something else and held up their phones saying they didn’t take any photos. Okay, I said, and you know that taking photos of other people in the library is not allowed, right? Yes, they said, and we had a conversation about wanting everyone to feel safe and welcome in the library. I told them if he comes in again (or something like that happens), please let library staff know. I repeated that what the man did was not okay and that I would speak to him. I then went over the couple and told them what I found out. The main said he knew they would deny it so that's why he went in to speak to them directly. I politely pointed out that his behavior was inappropriate, explaining he shouldn’t be going into a room or telling kids what they can or cannot do. If something like this happens again, please come up to the desk to let library staff know and we will follow up. He argued a bit, but seemed to understand and they left quietly shortly after I had returned to the desk. The kids in the room remained in the study room. The next day one of their mothers (Amanda McNiel) called me to ask why we didn’t file a police report. I explained to her that we had a conversation with both parties, explaining the rules of the library and it didn’t escalate to the point where we thought a police call was appropriate. I explained that if the man had gone in to talk to the kids again or something else happened, we would have issued a suspension at that point and/or followed up with other actions. She became verbally abusive to me, yelling into the phone, demanding that I go file a police report. After some time letting her speak, I asked her to please not yell at me. I repeated what I had said, stating that with incidents like this we try to educate customers about what’s allowed in the library and if they continue inappropriate behavior, we follow up. She continued to yell and argue. Since she wouldn’t stop yelling, I told her I would have to end the call. This is for documentation.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: LTA JC let LTA Supervisor LM know that a patron was at the front desk and incoherently asking for assistance logging into something and for assistance to his car, as he was feeling light headed.  LTA Supervisor LM, approached the man with a chair and offered the person to take a seat.  LM spoke with the person about how they were feeling and if medical assistance was necessary.  After a brief rambling conversation from the person, the person stated that they wanted medical assistance and that they thought their blood pressure may be low and that their blood sugar may also be low.  LM asked a fellow staff member to offer the person a cookie, as he was already given a bottle of water.  LM left the person in the care of other staff and called 9-911 at 10:50am.  Tucson Fire Department arrived at 10:55am.  They medics interacted with the person and offered to take them to the hospital.  The person declined the offer to go to the hospital.  The person remains in the library and was notified that staff would be checking in throughout the day.  The person was thankful for the check-ins.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description:
FOR DOCUMENTATION PURPOSES ONLY:
At about 1:00pm a man came to the desk, identified himself as working with Adult Protective Services, and asked for the manager. Librarian 1 KB told him that the manager was not available. He (Chris) said that he wanted us to be aware of a situation. He was expecting to meet with a woman at the library who was the subject of a “third-person report” to Adult Protective Services and might be in danger in her home. Chris said that he expected the woman to arrive alone, but there was a chance that the man would be with her and that, according to the person who made the report, the domestic partner owned a gun. Chris said he was in contact with the police about the situation. L1 KB, L1 JD, and VetSec guard BJ decided that, for the meeting, putting Chris and the woman out of view in the small meeting room would be best (even though the meeting room has glass walls).
As Chris sat in the lobby waiting for the woman to arrive, L1 KB asked him for clarification about police involvement. Chris said that he had just spoken with the woman, who said she was arriving alone. Chris showed L1 KB a pendant around his neck and said that if the man does follow her to the library, he could simply press the panic button and police would be summoned. 
L1 KB told guard BJ to stay in the lobby with Chris to wait for the woman. As a precaution, L1 KB unlatched the lobby gate so that it could be quickly closed, told guard BJ to be on alert but “don’t be a hero,” and told LA RG, who was on desk, to make sure she had her phone and the key to lock the gate readily available. 
The woman arrived alone within about 20 minutes of Chris’s arrival. The two met in the small meeting room for more than an hour. They left together without incident.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description: Librarian DW was on desk when David came into the branch and started exhibiting strange behaviors. At one point he came up to the desk and grabbed a squash from the Market on the Move giveaway box--he took a bite and then threw it toward the printer station. L1 DW and guard KS both told David that throwing objects was unacceptable library behavior; David was unresponsive to their warnings. David proceeded to walk toward a library patron and loomed over them momentarily, causing L1 DW concern for the patron's safety. David quickly changed his focus and walked toward the exit where he stopped and grabbed a plant from atop the shelves where STU's reserves are kept. At that point, L1 DW went into the back staff area to ask for help. Librarian JH came out and after some talking with David was able to learn his name and learn that he was having some mental health crisis but his immediate concern was that he needed a shower. While David waited, JH and page NC made some calls to local agencies to find him someplace where he could shower. He declined any offers to help find him other resources. He was grateful for the information and left without any further incident--this report is for documentation purposes only.

Description:

Description: Chance and Tristan came into the library with a scooter. Chance was asking for a study room, but he didn't have anything to 'trade' for the remote so he went to ask his brother if he had anything-  Tristan rode the scooter up to the desk and Librarian II DT reminded him that he was not supposed to ride in the library.   They were unable to produce any collateral so they went to the teen computer area.  Tristan began making rude loud noises that could be heard throughout the library.  DB went over and asked him to stop making noises.  Chance was very disrespectful asking 'what noises' and denying it was him.  he was told he needed to stop making noises or he would have to leave.  He continues with the noises.  DB went back over and told Chance he needed to leave for the day.  Again he was disrespectful and refused to leave.  DB told him he had two minutes to leave or he would be suspended for the rest of the week. He did not leave and then his brother started asking why he had to leave, Tristan accused DB of being 'racist', which was ignored, continued to refuse to leave.  DB went to the back room to let manage AG know what was going on.  When they returned to the front Tristan had left reportedly yelling that we were racist on his way out.   Chance was at the desk asking why they had to leave.  Finally Chance left yelling f** the library on the way out.

Description: A man who appears to be experiencing a mental health crisis had been in the library most of the day and aside from some small verbalizations, had caused no code of conduct issues. Just after 2:00 p.m. he stopped at the desk and stated that his ride was coming soon. He then sat outside in our loading/book return area, where cars pull up to use the book drop, against a pole. LIII TFL approached and expressed concern for his safety and asked if he might move to the bench, where it was safer. He seemed to take no issue with this and moved. A few minutes later staff reported that the man had yelled at a customer entering the library. LIII TFL approached and said that she felt it was best if he move on for today. The man said that he could not. TFL pointed out that the park is close by and suggested he head toward there. He became angry and said that we should call the cops. TFL said that she really didn't want to do that and tried again to encourage him to walk over to the park. The man began to yell that we should call border patrol, that he was border patrol, that we are hitler and other comments while walking toward the park. He made the hitler salute a number of times but continued in the direction of the park. Staff moved out of view in hopes this would help in de-escalation. The man sat a park bench for a while and caused no further incident.

Description: At closing on Monday, 11/13, customer Takara Smith reported to guard Jen that she was afraid to leave the building because a man had harassed her inside the library. Staff (including L3 LAF) had interactions with Takara earlier in the day (beginning around 2 PM) because her pants were falling down and she seemed very slow moving and somewhat incoherent. Takara stated that she was near the women's restroom (unknown which floor) and the man was standing outside it and tried to grab her and touch her. She said he exposed himself to her and began masturbating. Guard Jen went outside the front doors with Takara at closing and LIC L3 LAF met them outside. Guard Jen was helping the customer contact people close to her, including her boyfriend and a family member. Takara described what had happened to LAF and LAF offered to call police to assist Takara. LAF called 911 and Takara spent some time filing a report with TPD on the phone about what had occurred. Dispatch offered multiple times to send an officer to the library to assist the customer. Takara said she wanted to go home and was filing the report in case the person hurt her. Dispatch offered to send an officer again and Takara said she could meet an officer at Ronstadt. Takara left around 6:20 PM and headed for Ronstadt. Infractions listed and unknown person description for this incident are related to the person Takara said was harassing her and attempting to assault her. L3 LAF and L3 MS reviewed video footage and the customer Takara references can be seen following her around the library, checking in on her while she is in a bathroom, and grabbing her bottom as she bends over outside of a bathroom. Customer who grabbed Takara is most identifiable, aside from physical characteristics, by a black ball cap that has a playboy bunny on it.

Description:
At 1:25 PM Guard J and LTAS KW noticed a group of four teens searching for someone in the library. Patrons Tayana Jones and Benny were leading the search. J and KW heard some mumblings from the group about beating up the person they were looking for, so KW tried unsuccessfully to engage with the group and ask what they were up to. KW followed the group downstairs and asked L3 LF who was at the first-floor desk to assist with engaging the teens. Tayana found the patron they were looking for in the first-floor women’s restroom. The patron came out willingly with Tayana and at Tayana’s request began to exit the library with the group. One of the boys in the group, Trey, turned out to be the patron’s boyfriend and warned the patron not to go outside because Tayana and Benny were going to beat her up. L3 LF asked the group “Are you searching the library with the intent of harming someone?” The group mostly ignored LF and proceeded outside, Tayana vaping while doing so. The patron stopped in the doorway without leaving and began asking the group who was now outside what the problem was. Tayana threw a series of threats at the patron and LTAS KW called 911 at 1:35 PM as they were openly threatening violence. The patron in the doorway yelled to the group of teens that the library would call the police on them, and this set Tayana off on another set of threats including how she would shoot L3 LF if she called the police. L3 LF was standing near the doorway encouraging the patron to disengage and come inside for her own safety. The woman stayed inside and repeatedly begged staff not the call the police as she was worried that she may have a warrant out for her arrest. LF told her police were on the way due to the actions of those outside and that while she didn’t have to stay, for her own safety we did not recommend she leave. LF offered to let her exit out of the back of the building which she declined. After a few minutes the group waiting in the plaza left, and the woman then settled in at a public computer.
 
 
Officers Wilson and Lee responded at 2:20 PM and took statements from L3 LF and LTAS KW. They were familiar with Tayana and intended to look for her to have a talk with her and inform her of her suspension. Tayana will be suspended for a year, and for his role in this incident and past behavior, Benny will be suspended for 6 months.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.1 Harassment: Filming or photographing without permission
Description: At about 2:40 security guard AB reported to LTA GP and LTA supe JA that there was an adult (about 19 yo) in the teen area. When they approached her she reported that there was a man stalking her, staring at her, and recording her with his phone through the bookshelves. She was offered a study room but chose to sit in the patio area, where she could be in the line of sight of desk staff. JA reported the incident to L3 AG immediately, and AG went to the patio to talk to the woman and clarify the details. AG let the patron know that we take this very seriously, and to please come get staff right away if she ever feels threatened or stalked by anyone in the library. The patron gave a physical description of the man, but he left the property while AG was talking to her. AG checked the parking lot but was unable to locate him. From security footage, it does appear that he may have been staring at the female patron while pacing around the adult section, and at one point he made a loop through the teen area where she was sitting. Due to the angles and limitations of our cameras, we were unable to confirm whether he was filming.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description: At 1pm LibIII Kw went to check on the lobby.  There was a faint smell of smoked fentanyl drug use so she proceeded to check both public restrooms.  The men's restroom was determined to be the source of the smell and one person was utilizing the stall.  Guard CS stated that the person still in the restroom had been in there for a significant amount of time and that no-one else had entered or exited recently.  The person was told that they needed to come out of the restroom and that they were suspended from all libraries for 1 year for drug use.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: At around 1:45 guard AB reported to L3 AG that a person who had previously been inside the library was on the sidewalk near the bus stop and appeared to be throwing rocks at cars. At that time the person was not on library property. At about 2:15 LTA AD reported that he was outside the front door shouting offensive words ("the 'R' word") and punching the air. AG went outside to talk to him but he had gone inside. AG went back inside, and the person exited the building again and then came back in. As he was returning, his first words were, "I'm sorry, I have Tourette's and I had a stroke," and he went to sit at a computer. Because he had apologized and seemed to have quieted, he was allowed to stay. A few minutes later, LTA GP reported that he said, "I don't want to be here anyway. I got all your faces memorized. You better watch out cause no one wants you guys anyway," before leaving of his own accord.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description:
Youth Carlos Miranda had been warned twice about touching others and wrestling in the children's area throughout the afternoon. Guard CS had also asked him not to ride his scooter in the building, which was ignored. At about 5:30, LIC KV was told that a little girl who is a regular in the library had been hit in the head and was crying. Her brother, Carlos had chased her through the library and purposefully hit her next to her eye. KV consoled the child and went outside to talk to Carlos and get his side of the story. He would not explain his behavior but only said "That's not what happened." KV explained that she needed to hear his side of the story and he said he didn't want to talk to her about it. She explained that he could be suspended for hitting someone. He said he didn't care. He will be asked to leave the library for the following day. 
Update: Carlos came in and was told he had to leave. He repeated, "I don't care. I'll just come back tomorrow." CR told him that was fine because he was allowed back tomorrow. CR asked the other siblings if they would potentially bring their parents in to discuss behavior in the library.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others
Description: LTA ST informed Librarian SM that a couple of patrons wished to complain about a petition passer who set up in front of the library.  SM learned the following from the couple:  As they were on their way to enter the library with their young children, they were approached by multiple petitioners.  The female petition passer closest to the entrance and nearest the book drops asked if the patrons were registered to vote and if they would sign a petition regarding women’s reproductive rights.  The patrons indicated they were registered to vote but declined to sign the petition.  Upon hearing this, the petitioner began to verbally attack them, in a raised voice, including using their minor daughter (who was present with her parents) as a rationale for why they should sign. The patrons became upset and reported the incident to the front desk staff.  SM came out, approached the petitioner and provided a copy of the petition passing guidelines (BOS D 32.11). SM explained that this interaction constituted a violation.  The petitioner was immediately apologetic, saying she was “having a bad day” and "I shouldn't have done that". The passer indicated she would no longer engage patrons in conversations in this manner.  Petitioner said she would leave "soon" but SM stated this was not necessary as long as the guidelines are being followed.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: At approximately 1:10pm, I began to hear phones that were producing sounds loud enough that it was bothering patrons in adjacent stations. I approached the area where I saw two separate men handling their phone. I asked if they would be able to turn down their phone. One man, later identified through card as Jamie Dove, made eye contact shortly thereafter and I repeated if he would be able to lower the volume of his phone. He said that he was doing something on the computer and to leave him the fuck alone. I informed him that we cannot have him speak that way in the library. He continued to say leave me the fuck alone. A woman next to him asked him to stop. He continued to say leave me the fuck alone. I informed him because he continued to speak that way he needed to leave for the day. He again said leave me the fuck alone. I informed him because he would not leave, he was now trespassing. A man at another station interceded with "you need to call the sheriff". Jamie said "call the police". Jamie then said "how I am supposed to leave if I am logged in smart guy". I informed him that we can log him off. At this point Jamie started shouting at a man at the reference desk "what the fuck do you want". This man said "you need to leave". Jamie went straight up to him and started to posture. The other man stood his ground. I stood the side in between them and said you guys do not need to fight. I asked the man that was not involved that I did not need his involvement. I reiterated to Jamie that he needed to leave for the day. Jamie started to leave but stopped a quarter of the way to tell me in Spanish that he is of Sonora and to get the fuck out. He returned to English and began sizing me up and asking me what I was going to do. He said that is "what I thought faggot" and continued to leave. I reiterated we needed him to leave for the day. On his way out the door, he knocked over books that were on friends of the library cart and said something I could not make out. At this moment, the other man that had gotten involved reappeared in front of entryway. Jamie reengaged with this main and asked what the fuck did he want. The man stated that "you need to not come back to the library". I again told this man that I did not need his involvement. Jamie was now posturing again in front of him in a confrontational stance. This man again was standing his ground. Jamie said that he would come back with what sounded like AR-15 for him. I again reiterated that Jamie needed to leave. I saw Jamie follow his female companion that was on the other side of the courtyard. As I came back into library, the man that was engaging with Jamie asked if I was going to call the police. Two male patrons nearby chimed in with agreement. I called the police because of the disorderly conduct accompanied by threat with weapon. Deputy Sheriff responded in person later that hour. He interpreted the event as a disturbance and understood taking the threat with weapon seriously. He took down as much information I could provide on Jamie. I informed him per our policy, he is suspended from all PCPL property for a year. He stated if Jamie comes back that we should contact the police.

Description:
At about 4:40 pm a minor reported to LTA supe JA that their bike had been stolen. L3 AG and JA gave the minor AG's business card and instructed them to report the theft to the police or sheriffs, and to have law enforcement contact AG to obtain security video of the theft.
Meraki footage shows the child riding up and parking their bike at the bike racks at 3:36 pm. They do not lock their bike, but use a lock that's already there to try to make it look like the bike is locked. At 4:01 pm an unknown man approaches from the southwest, carrying a yellow McDonalds wet floor cone. At 4:03 pm he enters the building, where he checks the reading glasses donation box, which is empty. At 4:04 he exits the building. Guard AB is on his patrol at that time and is standing outside the front doors. At 4:06 the man walks away to the west and around the side of the building, carrying the yellow McDonalds wet floor cone.
At 4:09 pm the man walks back around to the front of the building without the yellow McDonalds wet floor cone; at this point the guard has gone back inside. At 4:10 pm he takes the bike and rides off with it heading east.

Staff attempted to wake an individual found laying down just North of the staff exit. The man was entirely wrapped up in bedding and staff could not see if the man was alert at all. After several attempts, with no response from the individual, staff alerted 911. When emergency responders arrived the person woke up and walked away, refusing assistance.

Description: At the beginning of the day, Vet Sec guard JT and LIC L2 JM asked patron Catherine to make sure she checks out items that she puts in her bag. Catherine nodded an acknowledgement and went inside to use a computer. At 12:00PM LIC L1 MB and LTAS KW asked her to limit herself to 2 DVDs with her at the public computers as she's had a hard time since November this year returning complete sets to the library bookdrop before she leaves for the day. Then again at 2:30PM LIC LTAS KW asked her to put back 10 plus DVDs from the Children's area that she placed in her bag unless she was intending on checking them out, she said "no" that she wasn't intending to and left with them, not complying with staff's request again. Since November this year, at least a dozen DVDs she has used in the library have been returned incomplete. Many of the magazines she frequently reads are also missing. Today one magazine was found rolled up tightly and damaged on bottom of her unattended bag at the computer station. Four of the DVD sets found at her computer were missing DVDs. There were also two damaged library books found among her items today which were recovered when she was asked to leave. At 4:00PM JM asked Catherine to leave and told her that she would be suspended due to her continued behavior. Catherine gathered all of her items, while continuing to talk to herself or others around her and several curse words were heard by Vet Sec Guard JT and LIC L2 JM as she headed outside to the plaza.

The patron was in the library today, 12/1/2023. L1 MG recognized the patron from this incident as he was in the same striped sweatshirt. LSM VL inquired the patron if he was Gregory Nelson and he confirmed. He was informed by LSM VL that he would be suspended for one year. He continued to request library resources and was not exiting the building. Vet Sec MM escorted him to the door and he left. We were unable to give him a suspension letter.

We cannot verify that the previous user did this as people take DVDs home they never watch or try and do not report problems. Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description: On Tuesday, 12/5/23 on the 3rd floor during the 12pm-1pm hour, a regular patron approached LA MKA at the Infoline desk. Patron appeared to be in his 30s-40s, light skin black male with short hair, and of average height. He began speaking in a very disjointed manner, with his thoughts jumping from one thing to another in a way that was impossible to logically follow (which is how he has also spoken in prior interactions). He was softspoken but had an urgency of speech, as though he were trying to convey an important message and really wanted help. He went from topic to topic and discussed suicide, jumping off of a building, and firearms multiple times. He mentioned that “someone told him not to” at one point. LA MKA gave him the Pima County Mental Health Crisis Line number (520)622-6000 but he seemed to have difficulty understanding how he could use his phone or the library’s courtesy phone to call that number. LA BD was also at the reference desk at this time and messaged the in-charge supervisor at the time, L1 MB, after observing this interaction. Shortly after the patron left the 3rd floor area and headed downstairs.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.2 Disruptive use of personal devices
Description:
A woman who was a doing petition passing in front of the library came in and told us that a man was filming her. Since this happened outside the library, librarian AW politely talked to him that person wasn't feeling comfortable of his behavior. but man said he had the right. Woman called police and a policeman arrived in 15 minutes.
Policeman talked to the man who was doing filming outside. he left without any incident. This is for document purpose.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description:
On 12/5/23 at 1:57pm library patron Adrian exited the men's restroom and reported to the security guard that someone had used drugs in there. Security Guard VM checked the men's restroom and it had a strong odor of drug use. Video footage indicates that no patron besides Adrian has used the men's restroom for a half an hour before he entered. Security Guard VM reported that the odor was not present until after Adrian used the restroom. VM opens the restroom for each patron who needs to use it and is thus checking them frequently or in the vicinity of the restroom regularly. Between the last patron to use the men's restroom and Adrian using it, she was in the area of the restroom doors three different times to allow someone into the women's restroom. At those times VM didn't report noticing any strong odors associated with drug use. Based on this information, video footage, and past interactions with Adrian where substance use was in question, staff concluded that Adrian used the drugs causing the odor (despite also having reported their use).
When approached by LII JM and asked about the incident the patron denied using drugs in the library restroom and expressed being upset about being falsely accused and our policy that led to his suspension. He appeared under the influence of drugs to LII JM. After speaking with LII JM, LIII IR, and LSM ED-L (over the phone) about the incident, suspension, and how to appeal to library administration, Adrian left the library. 
Adrian has been a regular at the Valencia Library in recent months with large backpack and his small dog. He usually spends most of the computer lab. He is generally mild-mannered and polite with staff and other patrons. On one occasion he was asked to leave for the day because he smelled heavily of alcohol and was behaving as if under the influence. He was very upset about being suspended and may return to the library to plead his case or to ask more questions about the appeal process.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: encampment behind dumpster enclosure
Description:
A man has been living on the grounds behind the library dumpster enclosure between Esmond Station Regional Park and Esmond Station Library (in COT limits). After library hours he uses the north facing patio for electrical access to charge and use phones while drinking bottles of beer. The plastic bags and bottlecaps are left behind. The materials and littered trash behind the dumpster enclosure have increased in the last couple of weeks. There does not appear to be a mattress, however there are blankets, a banner being used as a tarp, many plastic bags, and empty bottles. The man was coming into the library daily for several hours, but his use has decreased since establishing the area behind the dumpster. Library Administration instructed to report the encampment via the COT survey, and that was done on 11/22/23 (R231122_1141_23104). There was no response, so it was recommended by PC Facilities to call the COT phone number (520-791-2540), and that was done on 12/5/23. They do have record of the report but said it takes a couple of days for the process to get going and typically takes weeks as they follow a specified tier process. It was explained that when someone eventually does come out, if they speak with the person, and all is peaceful, they will leave them as they are and offer optional resources. Library staff was instructed to call 911 if activity becomes criminal. Library Admin is following up further with PC security liaison and facilities. For future reference, the link to the blank survey, the suggested phone number, and a description of the tier process can be found here: https://www.tucsonaz.gov/Government/Office-of-the-City-Manager/Homeless-Encampment-Protocol-Reporting-Tool
Update 12/7/23: at 8:45am AF from Sullivan-Jackson arrived at SLIB in the morning, BO (PC Maintenance Mgr) came at the same time. AF was able to speak to the man living on the grounds, and he told AF that he got housing and would be gone by tomorrow. AF said he would be back to SLIB on the morning of 12/8 to check. BO said that he would also return the next morning to install more detailed No Trespassing signage (there is currently one sign). At 1pm a PC truck was parked in the area and the driver was taking photos of the encampment. At 2pm staff noticed the encampment was cleared.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property

Description: A patron who was using Study Room A stopped by the front desk on her way out to tell me, Librarian-in-charge CL, and co-worker JM, that she and the student she was tutoring were done with the room, and she also wanted to report that there was "inappropriate words" written on the wall behind one of the sound baffling panels. JM and I went to investigate and found the "N"-word written on the wall in black dry-erase marker.  As numerous patrons have used that room, and we do not know when the word was written, we do not know who wrote it.  But we wanted this vandalism documented.  I cleaned the word off the wall before we closed.

After about 30 seconds, SC attempted to bypass the line moved herself ahead of the family that AO was helping and asked if AO could just check out her book. At this point I excused myself from the patron who I was helping at the copy machine. I went towards the desk and told SC that I would help her over at the other service desk. We are documenting this as the patron has a history of being rude to staff as well as being inconsiderate towards other patrons being helped. While the woman did reenter to yell some more, she left after a few minutes. It is unclear whether the chemical smell was an illegal substance. No further action is being taken at this time. For documentation.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: At approximately 3:40 pm, L1 CM was at the service desk when a young man, SM, fell over against a chair, falling to the floor, next to the study rooms. An unknown patron approached SM, asking him if he was OK. CM also went to see what was going on with the patron. Ofc WB and Security guard MG also came to see what happened. SM said that he had been watching a video, which "grossed him out." He said he got up to leave, felt dizzy, and fell over.  CM noted that he was very pale and sweating. CM asked MG to fill a water bottle for SM. CM also asked SM to remove his jacket and hoodie to be able to cool down. He also stated that he had not eaten since this morning. WB took SM's information, and called 911/EMS. Engine 8 and Paramedic 48 responded at approximately 3:55 pm. EMS Checked him out, and he said he felt better, so he refused treatment and transport. EMS left the premises, and SM remained in the library, stating that he did feel much better.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: The multiple interactions between this library customer and library staff and other library customers on Monday, December 18 began at approximately 9:55 am, when Librarian D.B. was letting Page E.S. into the library via the library staff entrance, when the man just outside the staff entrance started asking both D.B. and E.S. many questions about library services before the library opened.   D.B. told the man that the library opened at 10 am, and that library staff could help him when the library opened.  D.B. and E.S. then quickly closed the library staff entrance door.The man entered the library at approximately 10 am when the library opened.  He was given computer guest passes to use public computers and was using computer number 12 on and off in the computer lab from about 10 am to 4 pm that day, except for some periods when he left the library.At approximately 11 am, L.T.A. Supervisor L.M. and D.B. received complaint one of four, from four separate library customers to various library staff, on four separate occasions throughout the day about the man being too loud and using swear words in the computer lab.  L.M. and D.B. observed the man talking loudly and swearing while using a computer in the computer lab.  L.M. asked him to be quieter and not to swear.At approximately 2 pm, L.M. and D.B. received another complaint from a library customer to library staff about the man in the computer lab being too loud and swearing.  D.B. went with L.M. and  L.M. again asked him to be quieter and not to swear.At approximately 4 pm, when D.B. was at the public service desk, D.B. was able to hear the man in the computer lab being loud and swearing.  D.B. heard the man say “f*ck,” which D.B. was able to hear from the public service desk.  Librarian M.H. and D.B. accompanied L.M. to the computer lab. L.M. told the man that he was being too loud and was swearing.  L.M. asked the man to leave for the day.  The man left the library, and did not return inside the library that day.This portion is for documentation purposes:This is the same man who has been asking for money from multiple library staff during approximately the last week or two when library staff are either on their breaks or lunches, and also before and after their work shifts when library staff are on foot in the parking lot outside the library, or by knocking on the library staffs’ car windows when library staff are in their cars in the parking lot outside the library.Library Page H.T. told Librarian D.B. that the man repeatedly knocked on H.T.’s car window and asked for money when H.T. was outside the library on several breaks in their car in the parking lot immediately outside the library on Monday, December 18 between 1 pm and 5 pm.BCN Library staff have been advised to exercise caution when inside or outside the library, and to be aware of their surroundings, and whenever possible when going to their cars or when leaving the library, to go with at least one other staff person, and to report any inappropriate behavior that they experience, or observe inside and outside the library as soon as possible.

Description: Unknown customer from previous incident at MAI on 10/17 (linked in their record) came into the library and was informed by guard Jen that they were suspended. The customer became agitated and requested video and audio footage from guard Jen of their behavior. Staff on 1st floor and guard Jen notified IC L3 LAF that the customer was on 1st, what her demands were, and that they were angry. LAF approached the customer and introduced herself. The customer was speaking very loudly in a raised voice, which inevitably became yelling. They said guard Jen had humiliated them in front of other people in the library by telling them they were suspended loudly and publicly. The customer said they understood they were suspended, but wanted the suspension paper. LAF told them she'd be happy to get it. They said they just wanted to use the bathroom before they left, then began yelling loudly, cursing, and complaining about guard Jen, the library, and the computer they took apart in the previous incident "because it has f*cking magnets in it". LAF told the customer to wait outside and she would bring them the suspension paper as they requested. The customer said okay, told LAF where they would wait, exited, and was yelling loudly and using profanity on the way out. LAF retrieved the suspension letter and went to go outside with a different guard so as not to escalate the customer further. The customer had already begun walking and left, continuing to yell as they walked, and was at Pennington and Stone, leaving their suspension letter behind.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
A patron on the last row of public computers came out to LIC CR and asked her to throw out two men for fighting. When she approached, the two men were sitting and ignoring each other. One is a regular patron with no history of issues and the other was a gentleman who is known at the branch for racist comments and over the past week, unplugging his headset while the computer volume is set high and it's always something with the "n-word." 
CR asked the gentlemen if everything was okay and if everyone could behave. They appeared compliant. She walked away and a few minutes later noticed that the problem patron was now yelling at the patron who had originally brought the complaint. She was telling the man to leave her alone and that he was acting in an offensive and racist manner. CR asked the gentleman to leave for the day. He said "just because I said I don't like n-words? Well, I don't. I don't like any of the lazy brown people." CR said, "okay, you really have to go now." As he was getting up from the computer he told the woman, "you think I need to be redeemed? Here's my redemption. I'll come back here with a 45." He continued to yell profanities on the way out.
CR let him know he was suspended for a year. He will need to be served his suspension paperwork. 
CR checked in with the two affected patrons who both said they were okay and glad the whole thing was over. 
Can't find the previous cases, but this customer has in the past, yelled at L1 SG "Do you speak English?" as she was trying to help him, in English. He also told CR "I'm finding that the meth really enhances my personality."

Description: Around 4:20pm, in-charge staff LC noticed a woman sitting on the chairs near the entrance to the large meeting room. When LC asked if she'd like to participate in the programming (teen time), the woman mentioned that she'd been drinking since leaving jail two days ago and needed to sit down. LC let the woman know she could sit down to catch her bearings and had water and restrooms available if she needed. About 4:28p, LC and programming staff CC and KG heard a can open, and when LC arrived to the woman's location, had confirmed it was a beer can. At said point, the woman was asked to leave the library's premise by in-charge staff LC. Woman's name is unknown.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
At approximately 11:15am two men sitting in the Teen area started engaging in an argument. One man had been sitting in the area all morning with no apparent issues, when the other man came in and sat near him; it's unclear if anything was said but this seemed to trigger the one man and audibly aggressive words were said and threats were made. The argument quickly escalated and I walked over and reminded them that this was not acceptable behavior in the library and if persisted I'd have to ask them to leave. Since I didn't know what the issue was I asked the man who came in later if he'd mind relocating to another area of the library. He ended up leaving but appeared to be waiting outside for the other man. Meanwhile, guard M had had previous interactions (all positive) with the man sitting in the Teen area so she felt comfortable asking him what had happened. The man said the guy has been following him and harassing him. Guard M told him if he had any issues with anyone in the library he needed to come to staff rather than start a fight. Meanwhile, I went and spoke to the man outside who said he had no idea who the man was, he just went to sit down and nodded "hello" to him and the man went off on him and threatened him. He apologized for his reaction. I said he was welcome back in but asked if he would find an area to sit that was far away from the other man and he was okay with that. I also asked him to let staff know if the man approached him rather than addressing things himself and he agreed. As of writing this (2:20pm) things have remained peaceful. Both men were given a verbal warning. 
This is for documentation purposes.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
A woman came to the desk from outside and said that there was a man harassing a petition passer and the people trying to sign her petition, including her. Librarian III KS went outside and witnessed a man arguing with a petition passer and holding a picture of a baby near her face. He was standing extremely close to the woman.  KS approached and interrupted, letting the man (Dale Winders) know that we had received a complaint about the behavior outside from a library user that they felt harassed. He mentioned that it was his right to express his opinion and KS agreed and said he could do so if he was not yelling or getting in people's faces. He said he would stay quiet then but continued to stand very close to the petition passer, and she started to move her things to get away from him.
A minute later Dale walked in front of the doors, KS who was talking to LA DM who was at the book lockers about what he witnessed, approached Dale again. She asked if he was planning to stay, he said "yes", so KS told him that he is welcome to stay and share his opinions; however, we had a policy and guidelines to follow, and she pointed out the two petition passing locations and asked him to stay at the one that was not occupied. (There are Petition Passing and Information Sharing guidelines out front in two locations.) She also mentioned that we ask people to check in at the desk and at that point Librarian II SYM brought both Petitioners the BOS policy.
Dale started reading the policy and then went and stood next to the other petition passer again. KS gave it a minute and he continued to stand near her, so she approached again and let him know that he needed to stay over at the unoccupied petition passing location or he would need to leave for the day. He said he would not. KS told him if he would not follow our polices that she would have to suspend him. He said, "go ahead - you can't make me leave!". KS told him that if he continued to stay that he would be considered "trespassing" and she would need to call the police and he said, "go ahead!"
KS called the police. They talked to KS, DM, and the man. The man left. KS provided OVPD with his suspension letter, code of conduct, and policy. A senior police officer showed up and was arguing about our policies with the other junior officers stating that it is a "first-amendment right and this was a public space"; KS told him that it is a 1st amendment right; however, it is still not okay to harass people while exercising that right and that the library can enforce our code of conduct/BOS policy. DM told them what he witnessed, which was the man yelling "baby killers" at people trying to sign the petition, and petition passer and trying to insert the photo he was holding in front of the clipboard while people were trying to sign. He was standing directly behind the petition passer who was around 4' 10" while he was about 6' tall and reaching around her. The three women that DM noticed him harassing where asking him to stop and to leave them alone and he kept repeating "This is public property".

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: Suspended customer Gregory Nelson entered Himmel and asked staff at the desk if he was allowed in the library. LTA MKB recognized him as a suspended customer and informed him that he was still suspended. Mr. Nelson asked if he could use the restroom. Customer was redirected to the park restrooms due to suspension status and history of restroom misuse at Himmel and at other library locations. Suspension is not being extended at this time, since customer left the library after being informed he was still under suspension.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating
Description: At the 11 o'clock hour a woman came in to the library very agitated. OSLIII JP had assisted her with various tasks from receiving a guest pass, helping her with the printer, getting her change and much more. However the woman did not appreciate any of JP Efforts and complained to desk staff about how people at the library are unhelpful and left angrily. As she was leaving the delivery truck was pulling in and would proceeded to block her in as she was parked in the staff lo.
