DV then continued with his regular duties dropping off the delivery and waiting for a staff member to give him the purple bag so he could be on his way. while he was waiting staff could hear very loud banging on the staff door as well as continuous rings from the doorbell as well as some yelling. Staff were able to determine that there was a woman yelling that she was blocked in and demanded the delivery driver move his truck so that she may leave. DV then approached L2 VV and asked her to speak with the woman because he did not feel safe leaving. VV recognized the woman from earlier and explained that the area she was parked was for staff and that the delivery driver was in the middle of his duties and will move his truck when he was done and should take no longer than 10 more minutes. The woman was still very frustrated and continued yelling about how terrible this library was. VV reiterated that the driver was in the middle of his duties and to give him 10 minutes. As she was yelling DV walked out and pulled his truck forward so the woman could pull out and leave and then pulled it back to load his truck. The woman left quickly and without further incident

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: At 3:45 KW was doing rounds and smelled the chemical smell of drugs being smoked.  The source was the men's room.  Guard CS went in to confirm that only one person was in the restroom.  When he came out KW informed the man that he would be suspended for 1 year.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
The regular group of teen patrons had been in and out all day and two of the groups had been antagonizing each other because patron Jonah Toler felt that Hermon Hailemariam had stolen his phone. Hermon kept approaching Jonah when Jonah asked him to stay away. Christian Hudson was taking Jonah's "side" in this argument. Later in the day the kids had left. At about 4 PM, staff notified L2 CR that the kids were fighting in the lobby. Guard CS had separated the combatants but there were about 10 teens in a group in the lobby. CR asked everyone to leave for the day and it would be sorted. On watching the footage it was Christian and Hermon that were fighting, with Jonah and Benny trying to break it up with the guard and many others looking on.
Because this is Christian's 3rd fight in the library he will be suspended for three months and offered a LRPY session.
Hermon will be suspended for a month and offered LRPY in place of suspension.
Staff will discuss with the other teens to get an adult and not add to the problem when a fight occurs in the library.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: For documentation:At 11:45 AM LIC CS was called to the first floor to talk with patron Enrique who was requesting hundreds of pages of court documents from staff and would not take no for an answer. When CS arrived he decided he did not want to speak with CS. At 12:00 PM LTAS KW took over as the in charge person right as Enrique approached the desk again asking for free prints. He had board of supervisor policy 32.8 "Fees Schedule Policy", which pertains to waiving fees for books, and was pointing to different sections in it and arguing that he knows the policy allows us to print for free for him since the library near him does it for him regularly. LTAS KW spent 30 minutes talking with the patron about the price of printing, and the cases in which we make exceptions. As the conversation went in circles he made comments like "Does your boss know you don't follow policy? What's their number?" and "I really don't want to get anyone in trouble, I just can't go all the way to my library today." KW made it very clear that we would not give him hundreds of pages, and told him we would be happy to help him with anything else library related but KW and other staff can not continue to discus the price of printing. KW offered him the publicly available administration/LSM contact list which he declined saying he already has it. He then stood ten feet away from the desk and made a show of calling administration. KW left the information desk to consult with another in charge person about how to proceed, since the behavior seemed like intentional bullying. For another 20 minutes he approached L1 KG and and LTA NG attempting to restart the conversation, and upon being shut down he would pivot the conversation to who their bosses are and how to get ahold of them. A little before 1:00 PM he left the building and lingered near the entrance. L1 KG left the building on lunch shortly after him and as soon as KG left he began walking in the same direction as KG. KG went into a business and the patron lingered around outside the business for 15 minutes before leaving.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.4 Bullying per Pima County B.O.S. Policy D 23.1.
Description: On Dec 29, some time between 1p-2p, customer identifying himself as "Taylor Birkey" approached L1 JD at the service desk calmly asking how he could make a comment.  JD offered him an online form or a piece of paper that she could give to the manager.  After writing his comment, Mr. Birkey quickly left.  JD was busy and didn't have a chance to read the comment until several hours later.  The comment stated, "Yall should be ashamed of yourselves for turning a public library into a shelter for the mentally retarded.  I have listened to a guy laugh uncontrollably & another sing in falsetto for an hour straight.  There is no respect in here B(?).  I am writing this to you before I leave so I dont go to jail for beating the shit out of the miscreants(?).  Taylor Birkey 520-551-3277" L3 KK called Mr. Birkey at 10am on Jan 2 and made him aware that his threatening language violated our Code of Conduct.  She informed him that he was suspended from all PCPL locations for 6 months.  Mr. Birkey laughed and replied, "You guys are riduculous."  He went on to say, "You bunch of liberal fucks. Fuck you."  L3 KK ended the call.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: A library customer fell down in the parking lot outside the library, and not on library property.  Library staff did not witness the library customer falling in the parking lot.  The library customer came into the library and requested that we call 911.  Librarian I D.B. immediately called 911, and the library customer was quickly transported by ambulance to the hospital.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.3 Food or beverage: unclean, disruptive, or damaging
Description: L3 MS was called by guards to address a disruptive customer, who had been warned twice today about disruptive shouting. I approached and asked for the customer, DMR to please check the volume of his outbursts and to mind the community around him. DMR escalated and began yelling incoherently at in charge staff and guard. When MS asked him to leave he refused, but slowly started gathering up his personal belongings and then would refuse afresh. I let the customer know that his refusal left us no choice but to call the police, at which point he lunged at our Vet-sec guard, and they in turn called dispatch and had them call the police. We managed to get a yelling and resisting DMR to the door to the parking garage, and we instigated a lock-out, closing and barring the doors behind the customer. Lock out lasted for less than 5 mins. Police came and escorted DMR off library property

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: Sharps in library material
Description:
For documentation purposes.
 
LTA EB found fresh, unused razor in one of the audio books on shelf while doing inventory. Fresh, unused razor was placed in between CD sets. Razor was removed and tossed in proper sharps container.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: Bed Bugs
Description: On the morning of Saturday 12/30 a book that was in the book drop over night was discovered in the morning with a bed bug by LA DW. The book was quarantined along with the other books in the chute. The books were documented. The patron PPR's remaining checked out books were put on hold with the Bug Reserve card to be reviewed. Staff were reminded of PCPL bed bug procedures. Facilities was notified and pest management visited the branch the following Wednesday 1/3/24 to check for bugs and replace bed bug traps. No additional bugs were found on site by staff or pest management. PPR has had issues with bugs and the condition of their returns in the past. The situation will continue to be monitored by LTA Supervisor FC. Another item from patron PPR was discovered with a bed bug on 1/10/24.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description:
Library user JA Gomez approached LP TR when she was shelving in the large type nonfiction section. Talking through the shelving he asked “Do you work here?” and “Can you help with the computer?” LP TR reported that the way he approached her caused TR to feel uneasy. Review of the security footage shows JA Gomez standing in the stacks one row away from where TR was shelving and standing on his toes to talk above a row of books towards TR, security footage also shows that during his visit in the library JA Gomez was drinking from a flask or hand-size liquor bottle that he kept in his pocket. LP TR reported that JA Gomez’ speech was slurred and he was slow to react in the conversation during their brief interactions. 
After TR looked at the issue with the computer and indicated that it was not an issue that she could fix, JA Gomez proceeded to ask TR for the “horror section”, AM JM was in the vicinity and observed that TR was feeling uneasy in the conversation and offered to show JA Gomez some options for horror books. Again, JA Gomez responded sluggishly to the transition in conversation and instead of continuing the request with JM, he sat in the computer chair that he had been standing behind and said “No, I’m alright”
TR reported that the way JA Gomez approached her caused her to feel uneasy and unsafe and per Library Page training for interactions that cause concern for safety, harassment, or alarm, she moved away from the public area and worked in the back room for the rest of the hour.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1 Any criminal offense    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description:
A woman (Mom) reported to the front desk that her teenage daughter had been grabbed while she was in the stacks and was physically held without her consent by an unknown man, later determined to be library patron Jose Alfredo Gomez. Mom indicated that her teen daughter had contacted her to let her know she was in distress by this man and needed to be picked up. When mom arrived, teen daughter walked away from the man and ran out the door.
Review of the security footage confirms Mom's report, and further shows the unknown man was sitting at the computers prior to approaching the teen. He can be seen taking what appears to be a small liquor bottle or flask from his pocket and drinking it periodically while at the computer. The man was logged in to the computer under the name Jose Alfredo Gomez.
Staff reports from earlier in the day indicated that Jose Alfredo Gomez had approached one of the library pages and was making uncomfortable remarks while standing alone in the stacks with her. AM JM indicated that when he walked up to the man who was "requesting a book recommendation" from the young female library page, JM let the page know that he would take over and told Jose Alfredo Gomez (JAG) that he would be happy to talk over book recommendations with him. At this point JAG walked away from JM saying "no, I'm okay." This suggested that JAG's request for a "book recommendation" was disingenuous and instead reflects a pattern of harassing behavior towards young women in the library.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description: Sean #2, regular patron, approached a patron who did not know him and said "you're trans." And then verbally attacked the man with phrases that didn't make sense, talking about his dad. He was walking toward the door and seemed to be leaving. LA NG and LIC JB were monitoring the situation. When it seemed that Sean was slowing down and wanted to keep escalating, even as he was leaving, JB told him he needed to go ahead and leave for the day. NG told him, it's okay, we'll see you on Tuesday. Sean said, "See you later chink bitch." He will be suspended for three months.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: Regular teen Freddy was on the computer.  When another teen asked for someone to fight him in the game, Freddy responded "you're trash, you're garbage, you deserve to be bullied."  L1 JCB told him he needed to leave for the day and he responded "Miss I did not swear."  JCB said he needed to leave regardless.  He proceeded to ignore JCB, so Guard CS was called.  JCB indicated the correct patron and CS responded "You Freddy? Let's go."  Freddy followed the guard out.  He was only asked to leave for the remainder of the day.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: Suspended patron Christian Hudson came in with his sister and Jonah Taylor.  L1 JCB informed him that he had been suspended.  Christian tore up the letter and threw it, asking why he was suspended.   The other kids told him it was for the fight with Hermon and he started loudly shouting that the incident was not a fight, trying to garner support from the other kids.  JCB called Guard CS over to help escort Christian out.  His sister Briyanna was on the couch asked what we were trying to do to her brother.  She started yelling about "his black ass needed to get beat up" in reference to Hermon.  She continued to shout profane language about "I'm here because y'all can't do y'all's job."  JCB asked her to please lower her voice and Briyanna called JCB a bitch and said she would "take her" referring to a fight.  JCB stated that she was suspended for a week and the woman responded "I don't even go here, I'm just here for my brother." While walking past the front desk he cupped his hands around his mouth and shouted "fuck this library!"  When the group reached the lobby they left and then returned a moment later.  CS stopped them from coming in any further than the lobby. CS negotiated with Christian and asked him to leave but he refused.  JCB explained she would need to call 911 if they did not leave.  An adult patron grabbed the front of Christian's shirt.  The sister ran up and screamed "what are you doing to my brother?  Get your hands off him!"  She then grabbed the adult patron. JCB and CS asked him to unhand Christian and for Briyanna to let go.  He let go and walked out the west-facing doors. CS maneuvered Christian out the doors.  The group hung out in the parking lot where one of the kids (no one would say who did this part) stood in the way of oncoming traffic in the parking lot playing "chicken".  When told to stop, the kids started throwing pebbles at the west-facing doors.  When the bus came, they all ran to catch it.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description: Young gentleman in his late 20's was sitting at a table sobbing uncontrollably and talking on the phone.  Staff asked him if police needed to be called and he said yes.  STU police officer came and determined that there was nothing that could be done but the police officer was willing to give him a ride.  Police officer gave the young gentleman a ride to Sahuaro Shuttle.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.5 Indecent exposure, public indecency, lewd, other sexual offense    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: L SG was coming back from lunch around 1:59 pm when found two individuals drinking alcohol, smoking marijuana, and inappropriately touching each other outside of the library property, next the electrical junction box. L SG let them know that those activities are not allowed within Pima County property for what they complied and left.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: A patron notified us that there was someone smoking in the women's bathroom. Guard DT asked L1 MK to check. There was a woman inside the bathroom, not actively smoking, but the air had a chemical smell, and she had foil in her hand. I said, "You're not allowed to smoke in here," and she left the bathroom, whereupon DT informed her that she had to leave the library. She did so quietly.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: Bugs
Description: Patron AAH returned several DVD's today that triggered the bed bug reserve card. They had returned bug items back in November. Today, 3 of the DVD's had damage, with one of the DVD's have 3 dead German cockroaches and 1 live German cockroach. Their account has been suspended and they will be contacted. Items with damage have been discarded.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: Suspended patron Eric came into the library and went straight into the second floor restroom. Guard J called LTAS in charge KW to serve suspension paperwork. J and KW waited for patron outside of the restroom for 20 minutes before entering the restroom. Patron was in his boxers bathing in in the restroom. KW informed him that can not bathe in the restrooms and that he is suspended until July 2024 for previous incidents. Patron expressed his annoyance but left without further incident so the suspension will not be extended at this time.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: Christian who is suspended, came to the library to check in with his friends that are not suspended.  He did not try to come inside, but hung out outside the door and tried to get different friends to come out and hang with him.  I told him he needed to stay off the library property, which he did not comply with.  One of the boys in the group told KW to look at the camera because Christian had been engaging in aggressive behaviors.  The camera shows that both Christian and Justine Severe were hitting a boy with small sticks.  They also threw water at the entrance door.  Christian's suspension will be extended by two weeks and Justine will be suspended for two weeks.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description: A woman who had been suspended for multiple previous incidents and camping on library property was again found sleeping in front of the library. Her belongings were spread out on the landscaping and there was a burned can of known materials on our wooden bench near her. She had a lit candle behind a bush which also posed a fire hazard. L1 MNC came out with LTA Sup FA to speak with her about not camping or lighting fires on library property. She accepted the suspension letter and gathered her belongings.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.2 Strong odors    2.12 Belongings: Leaving unattended, may be removed without notice
Description: As George Salvos approached the desk, L3 KK and OSL3 YM smelled urine and saw that Mr. Salvos was soaking wet on the front and back of his pants.  L3 KK made Mr. Salvos aware of the issue and explained that he would need to leave and change into clean clothes before he could return to the library.  The computer chair that Mr. Salvos had sat in was covered with a bag and the computer was marked out of service until cleaning staff can address the biohazard.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
Patron Cyrus had been using the computer for a couple of hours playing Roblox when, evidently, the computer accidentally shut down. He came charging up to the desk and screamed at L2 CR that "this is bullshit, I've only been on here an hour!" She asked him to bring the volume down a level.
He said "No! Your computer shut off in the middle of my game!" She said, "this is still a library. Please bring it down."
He stomped back to the computer and said "fine, I'm just going to break this thing." She told him that he would have to leave for the day and they would see him tomorrow. He said "no you won't. What's your name? I'm going to report you."
She gave her name and he said, "you're that bitch that gave me a hard time last time." As he left she let him know he was suspended for a week. He said he wouldn't be coming back.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others    2.8 Smoking, rolling, using tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description: After noticing graffiti etched into the sidewalk, we consulted security camera footage and found that a man had been behaving very erratically on library grounds the night of 1/11/24. Between 8:58pm and 10:37pm, he engages in a number of strange and potentially dangerous behaviors, including throwing lots of rocks, etching the aforementioned graffiti into the sidewalk (9:23-9:32pm), and draping a blanket on a tree and attempting to light it on fire (10:10pm). Did not recognize the person but will issue a suspension if he is seen on property again.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.4 Sleeping
Description: Patron notified front desk staff TF and IC LHN it appeared someone was sleeping at PC 13 at ~ 11:50 am. LHN went to inspect and saw patron Blake was indeed sleeping and snoring at PC 13. LHN tried to get attention by saying excuse me but he was unresponsive so LHN knocked on desktop to get attention and wake Blake up. LHN let him know the library can not be used for sleep but that he could get a drink of water and walk around to wake up a little more. Blake apologized and said that he did not mean to fall asleep and did not need water, they were fine. HS came to switch for desk and LHN passed along information that he had been given first warning, second warning was issued by HS, patron moved seats and then fell asleep again a few minutes later. Staff monitored the situation gave third warning. Blake fell asleep again in lounge chair, HS let LHN know and Blake was asked to leave by security Guard MG. LHN and MG walked Blake outside of the library letting him know he can return again tomorrow but that he cannot sleep in the library. Blake cooperated and left but mumbled cursing under breathe as he walked out at ~12:47PM.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Guard BJ made L3 KK aware a customer had been in the lobby restroom for a significant period of time, that it smell strongly of chemicals and that the customer was not leaving the restroom.  L3 KK knocked on the door and made the customer aware that we could smell drugs in use.  The customer opened the door, denied using and said to search her stuff.  The restroom smelled very strongly of chemicals consistent with drug use.  KK asked customer to leave and told her that she was suspended from all PCPL locations for a year.  KK went to get keys to lock the restroom while BJ waited for the customer to exit the restroom.  As the customer was leaving, she told BJ that she was not doing drugs but that she was going to go into the parking lot and use them.  Customer placed a joint or cigarette in her mouth and left the building. BJ monitored the parking lot but the customer had left.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.7.4 Bullying per Pima County B.O.S. Policy D 23.1.~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
Regular patron John Thomas has a history of yelling and berating the pages who are on computer monitoring if anyone is loud in the computer lounge. Page supervisor JB has spoken to him at least twice that he needs to bring his complaint to the front desk, that he needs to be appropriate with all staff, and also discussed that the library is not a quiet area. 
Today a patron who was hard of hearing was taking a phone call in the computer commons. Mr. Thomas approached the page and told her "you need to do your job. Why don't you tell him he has to leave this area for his phone call?" She went to find the supervisor and upon her return he again approached and told her she was not doing her job and that if she couldn't do it she should probably just go work at McDonalds. He was loud enough that another patron asked him to stop yelling at the page. 
Because of prior warnings, L2 CR approached Mr. Thomas at his computer and asked to speak to him. He took his earbuds out but otherwise refused to move from the computer. She let him know that because this was a repeated issue he needed to leave for the day. He said, "no, I'm not leaving." She told him that if he didn't comply with her request she would have to call the police. He said, "can I tell you my side?" She listened to his side of the story. He said he did approach the page but did not yell. She told him he would still need to leave for the day. 
He demanded her name, her supervisor's name and how to file a complaint against her "authoritarian and inappropriate" behavior. She gave him the information he requested. On the way out he said "you should try the Mediterranean diet. It might get rid of some of your bloat, including in your brain." He then turned around and about an inch from her face said "boo" and he poked her in the shoulder, saying "now I've assaulted you; why don't you call the cops now?" Librarian Substitute KR stepped in at that point and said "I just want you to know that I'm here and I'm witnessing this." Finally, the patron turned and left after insulting both her and the guard.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Before opening the library this morning Librarian I KN noticed a piece a burnt foil and broken pens that looked consistent with drug usage directly in front of the library's front doors.  She reported her finding do Librarian II DT who went out and cleaned up the debris using the grabber and sharps resistant gloves.  Upon looking at the camera footage it appears that the incident happened on Monday 1/15 from between 3:14pm and 4:22pm.  An unknown man came up to the doors and when he realized the library was closed he sat against the front doors he was  there for about and hour.  The burnt foil was not there before his arrival, but can be seen after he leaves.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description:
At 11:51 am Women's Restroom was locked due to suspected drug use.
At 11:46 am LTA EO started to open Women’s Restroom Door and noticed a strong lingering smell of burnt chemicals and burnt plastic consistent with smoked chemical drugs. Person was exiting restroom, as EO was unlocking door. EO went to the front desk and informed LI RL about the situation. RL went to restroom with EO to investigate smell. L3 IR also went to restroom and confirmed suspected drug use.
Video footage confirmed that person had initially been let into restroom by RL at 11:36 am. RL did not notice any chemical smell at that time. Since the restroom had been locked and free of the chemical smell before this person entered, it became clear that this person was responsible for the evident drug use. Person had exited building before a suspension could be given.
The women's public restroom will remain locked until the smell subsides. 
There was no Vet-Sec Guard or Special Duty Officer on duty at the Branch during the incident.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: LTA NG heard Christian explaining to someone online that he was kicked out of COL and has to come to MAI to play games on the computer. Christian had made another library card under the name Zach Verdogo and has been using it at Main. IC LTAS KFW reminded Christian of his suspension and gave him the suspension paperwork. He insisted he wasn't the same person but left without incident. Christian left with another patron who I believe is Justine Sever from incident 0000023080 but could not be verified.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.2 Guns, weapons, machetes, knives
Description:
For documentation purposes only.
At 5:00pm, closing, three juvenile patrons were exiting the library when they asked L1 MG and LA CR if they could wait inside the library for their ride because there was "a man with a gun outside." L1 MG and LA CR allowed the patrons to remain inside while Vet Sec RG went outside to investigate. Vet Sec RG returned and notified staff that there was a man with a large rifle over his shoulder walking west on the north side of the library. Vet Sec RG indicated that he ensured that the unknown man left the area. L1 MG instructed the juvenile patrons to wait inside for their ride and leave together.
Upon viewing the security footage, the unknown man can be seen walking from the area of the K-8 school and then on the north side of the library near the child development center.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: LTA NG called IC L1 WW that suspended patron Christian, from incident #0000023080, was in the Teen Room.  WW presented Christian/Zach/Nick with his paperwork while the young woman with him argued and berated staff.  As they were leaving the building, the young woman then called WW a "Punk ass N-word" while they were exiting.  Female patron is now suspended for a month.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.2 Disruptive use of personal devices
Description:
A regular homeless customer came to the desk yesterday and asked if she could leave her large cart with belongings outside the library, near the door and where the guard could watch it.  Manager LM said she could leave it there for a little bit, but it was at her own risk and the guard would not be able to watch it for her.
The cart was in the same place for a long time yesterday, and today it was still there when the library opened.  LM went with guard RP to talk to the woman, who was in the library with her male friend.  LM asked if she could please move her cart as it had been in the same place for a long time and was near to the entrance of the library.  The woman and her male friend agreed to move it.  About 30 minutes later, the male friend went to the guard and said (about LM), "If I see that bitch again, I'll punch her in the fucking face".  He continued to go on threatening LM and saying he wanted to beat her up.
RP and LTA supervisor KP talked to the couple, asking the man to leave for the day.  He will be suspended for one year for threatening staff.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: At 2:35pm Manager KW smelled a burnt chemical smell while stocking a display.  The source of the smell was the men's restroom. It was locked.  The camera shows a man entering the restroom at 2:23pm and leaving at 2:28pm.  Unable to verify user with certainty.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property
Description: At 12:50pm, a man entered the men's restroom and remained inside for over 30 min. When L1 BR checked the restroom afterwards, he discovered new graffiti all over the stall wall. A knife was also found in the restroom and disposed of by staff.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description: LTA KW reported to L1 KH that someone had been in the handicap stall of the women's restroom for over an hour. LTA KW could see a syringe cap and a drop of blood on the floor of the stall. KH went to the women's restroom, and asked the occupant of the stall if they were ok, letting them know that someone reported seeing blood. The occupant said that they did not need medical attention and would be right out. The person quickly left the restroom and the library. KH inspected the stall, confirming that there were drops of blood on the floor, as well as trash strewn around the stall. The syringe cap was no longer visible. Stall was placed out of order for biohazard cleaning.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: At 3 PM L1 KN let L3 know that a male patron sitting in the adult area had been drinking a Twisted Tea alcoholic beverage. When she approached him about it he apologized, said he wasn't thinking, and took it outside. KN specifically told him, "No alcohol in the library." He was allowed to remain in the building at that point. At 3:50ish a teen came out of the teen area to say that the same person had another Twisted Tea and was drinking from it. The patron denied that the second can was his and said he took it from someone else but would not say who. AG told him that he had it in his hand, he needed to leave immediately, and he would be suspended. He apologized several times and asked for a second chance. AG told him he'd had a second chance already and he needed to go. He again pled to be allowed back in, said that his friends were inside, said that he would work for us to be allowed back. AG told him again that he needed to leave. He left, and about a minute later came back and asked to retrieve his phone. AG went with him to get his phone from the teen area. He didn't immediately find it and started demanding of the teens, "Where the fuck is it? Which one of you motherfuckers took my phone?" AG told him that language was not appropriate in the library, and he said, "I really don't fucking care right now." The teens in the area denied having anything to do with his phone, and soon one of them pointed out that it was sitting near a computer. He took his phone and again left. At about 4:10 library staff called for AG in the back again to say that he was back outside and was smoking in front of the building. AG got guard AB and they walked outside. As they walked other teens were coming inside giving directions to where he was, and two of them said that he was trying to fight with them. At that point he was at the far west front of the building. When he saw staff coming his way he began to run. Teens in the area denied knowing him. A few minutes later, one of the teens asked to speak to the manager. She told her side of the story, that this person had attempted to fight her sister when her sister was entering the library. She further stated that she had taken an audio-recording on her phone of Blake admitting to sneaking the Twisted Teas into the library for him, in exchange for 2 Monster energy drinks. She allowed AG to listen to the recording, and AG went to get another staff person (L1 PC) as a second witness to the recording. The patron drinking the alcohol will be suspended for one year, and Blake will be suspended for two weeks.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: A patron came in and left his bicycle near the front door. It appears he did some sort of lock to keep the back wheel from turning but did not use our bike rack or lock it to anything immobile. Another patron came up about 15 minutes later and walked off with the bike. That patron will be suspended for a year.

71 year old customer Robert Brown fell twice near the entrance of the library.  His leg is very swollen from a car accident he was in last week.  He asked us to call for an ambulance.  Manager LM called 911.  They picked him up in 3 minutes.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: L3 MS was notified of a disruptive customer who was swearing loudly and hitting himself, as they entered the first floor men's room. As he exited MS approached him for a wellness check, and it was immediately obvious that this customer was intoxicated on alcohol and in a state of manic upset. MS let the customer know that he needed to leave and was suspended for the day. Customer continued to swear loudly as he gathered his things and as he left the building. Staff notes that this customer is a regular, and not usually this way, so we'll try again tomorrow.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft    1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
Senad has had difficulty following the Library code of conduct for a couple days now and was asked to leave the library entirely today. A longer suspension will be considered if this behavior continues.
On Thursday, 1/18, Senad was asked to leave the gaming program in the meeting room. From L1 AM : 
Senad was warned three times by me to keep his voice down (his friends too) watch his language and not slam his mouse when at the public computers during the 12 o’clock hour 1/18. I asked him his name and he said it was Jeremiah. I then told him and his friends that they could use the computers in the room when it opened. During the 2 o clock hour when I was there moderating he was warned not to cuss, slam his mouse and yell (Matias had warned him the previous hour). He smirked and said oh she keeps calling me Jeremiah and it’s not my name. Marisella told me his correct name. I gave him a final warning and told him he would have to leave the room if he couldn’t control himself. He then slammed the mouse down and I told him he had to leave the room since he wasn’t following the rules. He tried to come back in, I told him he wasn’t allowed to come back and he said but I just need to tell my friend something quick and still took a moment longer to tell his friend. He then went to the public computer area and was sulking the next hour when I came on desk.  
Today, 1/19, Senad came into the library with a friend(Taha) and asked for a guest pass. As he was talking he was hitting his "friend" in the legs with a stick. I told him to give me the stick because hitting people with sticks was not allowed in the library. He handed it over. I told Senad he had to use one of the computers near the teen area and not the ones by the art wall because he had already started to yell at the other kids he would be playing a game with. Later, as I walked past the computers, I reminded Marzella and Taha that there was no eating allowed at the computers and to put away their food. Senad jumped up from his computer and snatched the pizza out of Taha's hand. Taha did not immediately say anything about this, so I told Senad not to eat the pizza at the computer. But then he sat at his computer and started eating the pizza. I told Senad again that there was no eating at the computers, so he shoved the last of it in his mouth and stuffed the box under his bottom. Then Taha said, "he also stole that pizza from me." I verified with Taha that he was not joking, and he was in fact upset. I stood next to Senad and listed the things he had done today that were against the rules. I told him I was feeling generous but he was on his absolute last warning and if I had to come over again he was out for the day. I returned to the desk, but Taha came to the desk a few minutes later to say that Senad was cussing. I went back to the computers and told Senad that he was done for the day. He left without complaint, but once I was off desk, he returned three separate times. L1 HT informed him over and over that he was suspended for the day. She told him she would get the manager and he did not try to return again that hour. 
I looked up his library card and found a phone number for his father. I called and listed Senad's infractions to his father. His father indicated that he understood (though I am not certain as English is not his first language) and said he would come by to pick up Senad. He did not come into the library though.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Upon entering the building Librarian II T notice two men sitting in front of the library.  She wanted to know how long they had been there so she looked at the camera footage.  As she looked back she notice two different people enter the library property at about 5:30.  They sat on the block bench in front of the library.  AS she watched the video DB witnessed the couple lighting what something.  They were using a coat to try to block their doings, but you can see the bright flame and what appears to be smoking.  The couple left about 6:35.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.1 Harassment: Filming or photographing without permission
Description:
Patron at computer 21 came up to the desk to report that another patron (computer 23) is sitting at the computer in the computer lab and that the patron is in their underwear and is watching inappropriate material and the customer is groping themselves. The staff reaches out to the in-charge the so the in-charge person and manager goes out to the floor to investigate. Both, CC and I approach the customer making the complaint. The customer J, starts to tell us that a gentleman is in the lab with his underwear on, watching inappropriate material, and groping himself. Both CC and I look into the computer lab and notice that the customer that she is talking about. I then address her with the facts of the situation, I tell her that the undergarments that she is referring to are biker shorts, the patron is watching a dance competition and from where we are standing, we don't see the patron groping himself. I then tell her that there is nothing that we can do because he is not violating any policies. She's now upset and she asks if she can move to another computer. I reply that she can move to another computer. CC and I remove ourselves from the situation, because the patron J has now moved to another computer. 
I guess the patron feel that we did not handle the situation to her liking so she approaches the off-duty officer L and she insist that he needs to do something. The officer does a roam in the area and then makes the security aware of the situation. The Guard M, comes to alert me about the incident and we have a conversation about her concerns. He goes back on the floor and finds that she is recording the patron and guard M ask her to leave, on the way out she films the guard as well.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description: At ~12:33PM Patron on Public Computer 17 experienced extended session issues. Patron tried to extend the session and hit ok but the computer rebooted anyway. Patron came up to the front desk upset and explained that the computer had done that before, and someone was trying to compromise her information and demanded to speak to a manager. LHN let the patron know that she could help her with her computer issue and that in the future, she can ask 10 minutes before her session ends at the desk to have the time extended and since this had been a reoccurring issue then she could go on the library website to report it. During that time officer on duty NL had been going around helping to push in chairs and doing regular routine to ensure everything was in order, the patron saw this and yelled at him "Do not touch my things, get away!" This caused the patron to feel unsafe and that the officer had interfered with her personal space and privacy by messing with her USB. LHN tried reassuring her that officer NL was doing his normal walk around and helping to keep the library tidy by pushing in chairs. The patron said that she couldn’t see him fully, but he was lingering and not just pushing in the chairs even if that's what LHN thought. Patron stated that all she could see was that he was by the computer and had kept watching her and he was messing with her things. Officer said, “He was not touching her things but moving the chair because it was tilted upright.” and moved away from her belongings. LHN and the patron then walked over to computer 17 with a guest pass instead of the library card since the patron felt someone was messing with her by signing her out early from the computer with her card. As LHN and the patron were passing by the patron asked for the officer’s supervisor stating, “That should be a sergeant.” to which the officer said, “That is correct.” and stated the order he wrote down his name and the sergeant’s name and the patron said, “I’m not stupid, don’t mock me.” The officer tried to reassure that’s not what he was doing and LHN stated “That's not his intentions.” The officer then walked away from the area and sat at his normal post. LHN continued helping the patron to the library website so the patron could write a report on the tech issue and interaction with officer. At ~12:48PM LHN let the patron know that she would document the tech issue to IT as well as in our tracker to ensure it was logged since the computer issue had happened multiple times now. After submitting the issue, the patron continued working on their other documents.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description: At around 4:30pm on Monday, 1/22/24, LIB1 KVN and LTASup ME were staffing the service desk when the patron walked out of the computer lab and began yelling and hitting himself in the face. The yelling was mostly incoherent, but he did say “computer” a few times. He paced in the front entrance of the library a few times, but avoided staff when they started to approach. Due to previous behavior from this patron, KVN went to find LIB2 LF for backup before engaging with the patron, in case talking to him caused escalation. When KVN and LF approached, the patron began to pack up his items and avoided eye contact with staff before KVN and LF could ask if he needed assistance. KVN and LF stood off to the side to give him room and observe him in case help was needed. Several other patrons made comments and complaints about his behavior, to which KVN and LF noted that it was being handled by staff. After the patron collected his items, he avoided staff until he neared the front of the library, where he started to yell incoherently and hit his face again. He paced in the front hallway two more times, but when he noticed KVN approaching, he exited the library. Staff believe he may have become upset due to the PC session ending, and will be proactive in giving him instructions on how he can extend his PC time the next time he visits and requests a guest pass.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms    2.8 Smoking, rolling, using tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes
Description: A customer reported a strong odor of marijuana coming from the men's restroom. Security Guard LH and staff DB went to check. Camera footage could not help identify a single individual responsible due to the heavy use of the restroom around that time.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.2 Strong odors    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description: Around 11:30a, VECSEC guard informed staff that feces were smothered in the Men's Bathroom stall.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description: John Tripp approached a Page with questions, but the Page repeatedly told him to ask for help at the service desk. John continued and seemed to be motioning for the Page to enter the Business Development Room with him. This made the Page uncomfortable and again, he made it clear that he couldn't help him and pointed to the service desk. The manager was not in the office that day and wasn't aware of the incident, so didn't get a chance to have a conversation about it. This is for documentation.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: Threats to call security/police~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Two female patrons in their 20s approached L1 MD on desk and reported that patron Desirae was continuously and loudly tapping her acrylic nails on the table in the computer lab, which was disturbing them as they were attempting to complete job applications. They said patron "Bunker" had expressed frustration at the tapping as well. L1 MD approached Desirae to request that she stop tapping as we had received complaints. Desirae immediately reported in response that the two friends had been talking loudly and disrupted her while she was taking a test. Both parties began speaking over each other and L1 MD in raised voices, both accusing the other party of being more disruptive. This quickly developed into the two parties yelling at each other- during this verbal altercation in English and Spanish both parties referred to each other as "bitch" and "perra fea". LA RS joined L1 MD for back-up upon hearing the yelling. L1 MD attempted to separate the parties by suggesting moving one side into the main room of the library on a PCPL laptop, but this caused the conflict to escalate as the parties both had strong opinions as to who would have to move. Patron "Bunker" offered to call or fetch security at this time, but L1 MD declined since the altercation was verbal. One of the friends also began threatening Desirae with calling the police. L1 MD attempted again to get one of the parties to move, but unsuccessfully, so LA RS instructed all three to leave the branch. During the parties' departure, which L1 MD ensured was through opposite sides of the library, the parties continued the verbal conflict and there were apparently threats of physical violence once they got outside. A physical fight seemed potentially imminent. Outdoors, the parties continued yelling at each other from inside their car on Riverview (the two friends) and the sidewalk in front of the main entrance (Desirae), and Desirae spit in the car's direction.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
Security LH reported to LG that a male customer had been in the restroom an excessive amount of time and had been asked to vacate the one stall in the men's restroom. The customer is seen, on camera, entering the restroom at 2:11pm and not exiting until at 3:14pm. Library staff had similar issues last week with the same customer, and at one time time, this coincided with a faint chemical odor coming from the restrooms.
LG and SG LH approached the customer, once all this had been confirmed and explained the pattern staff had noticed. At that time, we noted that the customer had been sitting on the floor in the public area and his eyes were notably bloodshot. I explained that due to the pattern in this behavior he was being asked to leave the branch. He refused to leave and asked for proof of any wrong-doing. After explaining that I would need to call for support from law enforcement if he refused to leave, he left, stating that he would return tomorrow "to discuss the matter". A three week suspension will be issued.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.2 Strong odors    2.8 Smoking, rolling, using tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description: For documentation: Custodian reported ~3:15pm that Study Room 1 smelled like cigarette smoke; page ZS confirmed a strong odor and noted it smelled like bologna. 🤷‍♂️

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: Suspended customer entered the library this morning and I approached him to remind him of the suspension. He refused to leave and 911 was called to request assistance.Officers arrived and presented the suspension letter. After some discussion, the man, who stated to the officer that his name was Matthew, left with the letter.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Claiming that staff is mocking and insulting her
Description: Regular patron Margaret Gauna asked manager LM for help on the computer.  She was filling in a legal document and needed help with it.  As LM was looking over the document and trying to help, Ms. Gauna started to say that LM was mocking her and insulting her.  She said that the libraries have the computers set up in a way that is meant to frustrate and insult customers.  She asked for LM's contact information, and for the library director's phone number.  LM provided her with both.  This is for documentation purposes.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description: John Tripp was using Study Room C, which a distance away from Study Room B. He came out of his room, crossed the hallway, and entered Study Room B, which was being used by a woman. He closed the door behind him, which caused the woman to feel unsafe and threatened. He said something about using English, though she is an English speaker and was quietly working. This didn't make sense and she stood up and told him he shouldn't be coming into her room. He left abruptly out the front door while the desk person got LIC BL. I spoke with the woman to learn what happened and said we would speak to him about his behavior if he came back in. She felt unsafe and wanted someone to walk her to her vehicle, which I did. John was out there near his vehicle drinking a bottle of water. He didn't approach us or say anything. I came back and noticed the front door wasn't working correctly and tried to fix it, when he approached. He came in to get more water and I asked if he was the man that went into Study Room B. He said yes, but that he thought she was someone else. If that happened again I asked him to speak to staff at the desk for assistance rather than entering another room. He said okay and walked away, back to Study Room C. I got a Code of Conduct, highlighted a portion, and asked another In-Charge person to watch me approach his room for a more formal verbal warning. I explained that we want everyone to feel safe in the library, showed him the Code of Conduct, and calmly explained that if he exhibited that kind of threatening behavior again, we would need to ask him to leave the library. He didn't get defensive or argumentative at all. He said he understood.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: Patron reported to IC L1 WW that he had his bicycle pump stolen from the front bike rack sometime between 10AM-12PM.  He was asking to view the camera footage, so WW told him he would need to present a police report.  WW let him use the Circ Desk phone to call police to file his report.  Police told him they would be by at some point (as of 12:45PM) to assist.  For documentation purposes.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Loudly and repeatedly cursing at a public computer
Description: 3 teen boys were on computers 1, 2, and 3 and cursing loudly and continuously. At least two of these boys have been repeatedly warned about their language in the past two weeks. LPI CH was seated at a table directly next to these computers helping a patron and told the boys that they should not be using that kind of language in the library. The boys ignored CH and one of them stated loudly "I will fucking kill you". At this point CH used her cell phone to call the back room to request the assistance of guard BJ. Librarian 1 JM went to look for BJ and found him in the lobby interacting with one of the 3 boys. He reported to JM that the boy in the red shirt who made the threat refused to stop and talk to him and left the library. He did talk to one of the boys friends and told him to let the boy know he was suspended form the library and would have to return and talk to the LIC to find out how long his suspension was for. The third boy who was at the desk asking about Roblox not working on any computer left before anybody could discuss this incident with him. The boy who made the threat will be suspended.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: Tween patrons Niko and Jonathan were asked by LI PC to watch their language and volume multiple times. After ignoring staff directions, they were asked to get off of the computers if they couldn't behave appropriately. The two refused to do so resulting in staff turning off their computers. As they left for the day of their own accord, Jonathan was overheard saying "I'm going to blow up the library" causing another patron to become alarmed. Due to having to repeatedly speak with both Niko and Jonathan about these same issues, and repeated attempts at LRPY for both, the two of them will be suspended for three months.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.2 Guns, weapons, machetes, knives
Description:
Regular patron Enrique came into the library and told Guard K that a group of teens had run behind him and tazed him while he was standing outside on the plaza. Guard K asked L1 WW if he could call the police, but Enrique said he would do it. He called 911 from the free phone. Police arrived shortly thereafter and spoke with Enrique out on the plaza. CS was unable to find the incident on the cameras.
One of the officers asked LIC CS for access to camera footage from the front door. CS explained that he would need to speak to a manager and called L3 LF; however, the officer then said he didn't need it and left.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
L1 WW and LA RW received complaints that regular patron Aim was being too loud and using profanity on the computers. LIC CS went to speak to Aim and asked him to keep it down; during this conversation, Aim used the n-word and said something incoherent about black people causing the night. CS told Aim that he absolutely could not use that language in the library, and if he did so again he would be asked to leave. He apologized, went outside to walk around, and came back in. Shortly thereafter, another patron came up to complain again. This time, as CS approached, she could hear Aim saying the n-word repeatedly and pointing at two black teenagers sitting nearby. CS told him he needed to leave. As he gathered his belongings, he asked if she was the author of "The Little Prince." When CS said no, he called her a "fucking liar." He then proceeded to run out the front door, shouting the n-word repeatedly.
This behavior is vary out of character for aim, who is usually very polite and quiet, but his mental health seems to have been deteriorating over the last couple of months.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others
Description: A patron reported to the front desk the women's room smelled like someone was smoking/using drugs.  PIC JF went to check and the restroom was hazy and reeked of fentanyl.  The restroom was locked.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: This person was threatening others with her dog
Description: At 4pm L3 MS received a call from the in charge phone about a conflict on the first floor. When I entered the floor I saw a group of teens with a small dog antagonizing a single woman with a wheeled cart and her large dog. From camera footage I see that the woman with the push cart and large dog came out of the woman's bathroom and they immediately encountered the teens with their dog. The woman with the cart tried to control her reactive dog but it started acting aggressively and was barely in her control. The teens yelled at her to control her dog and the verbal fighting escalated to the point that the woman with the larger dog was encouraging the dog to attack and it was pulling on her leash. I broke up the conflict and sent the teens upstairs and I escorted the woman with the aggressive dog out of the building.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: 1.1.8.4 Using Profane, offensive or abusive language that would cause a reasonable person to fear for his or her personal safety or feel distressed~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
A male patron was walking towards the garbage can to throw away some trash when a female patron was turning and made a mistake and bumped into him. The male patron became belligerent and started yelling about the female patron bumping into him. VV told the customer to keep it down and he replied to her with, "she bumped into me" and VV said that their is not reason to yell. As he was passing the circulation desk he then called the patron a "bitch" and was yelling that she clearly assaulted me. The patron then went into the public restroom for 15 minutes, he then came out and CO asked the patron can we talk", and the patron blew her off and said "I'm fucking leaving, I'm not coming back you cu**t, and CO told the patron that he will not be able to come back and then he said, "I'm never coming back".
Manager was unable to talk to the patron about what he did wrong, so a suspension letter would be waiting if he returns.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.5 Indecent exposure, public indecency, lewd, other sexual offense    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.7.4 Bullying per Pima County B.O.S. Policy D 23.1.    1.1.4 Vandalizing property    1.1.3 Theft    1.1.1 Sexual exploitation of minors    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description: According to the Meraki footage, patrons Melinda and Jamal (involved in previous incident 0000022652 ) enter to use a study room around 2:30 and stay until about 4. While in the study room, Jamal began loudly shouting at Melinda and physically assaulting her. She is seen leaving first and then around 4:15 Jamal exits the library. Guard MM was outside when he continued to physically and sexually assault her right outside the patio wall. He was pushing and kicking her and at one point exposed himself to her. Guard MM and L1 MG called 911 to report the incident. While on the phone with the dispatcher, he stepped away and was about to leave with her belongings. She went after him demanding that he leave her belongings and after a few minutes of verbally fighting, he dumped all of her belongings on the sidewalk and started to walk away. Guard MM followed him, as instructed by the dispatcher because he was trying to get on a bus to leave. He missed the bus and walked back to where Guard MM and Melinda were. They kept their  distance but before he could get any closer, the police arrived and detained him. He was charged with indecent exposure since there were children around when he exposed himself. He will also be suspended for a year for physical violence that started in the library, making it unsafe for others and making staff fear for their safety.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: Customer was outside of the library next to the book drop. Their friend called 911 for emergency services because the person lit a cigarette, fell to the ground, and became unconscious. Emergency services responded, both fire and TPD. They alerted guard Jen, who alerted PIC L3 LAF. Emergency responders struggled to revive the customer. The customer who called 911 on their friend's behalf disclosed to LAF that their friend had overdosed on fentanyl. Emergency responders administered Narcan and the customer's life was saved. The person was transported from the library to medical services.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description:
Regular patron Melissa was agitated upon entering the library. Throughout the morning she had confrontational interactions with staff around guest passes and ear buds. At 12PM Melissa warned PIC LTAS KFW to not go near her unattended belongings, and then flipped off another staff member on her way to the computer lab. Guard J was in the computer lab working with another patron and Melissa demanded Guard J leave the lab. Patron was asked to leave for the day. 
Update: Malissa returned and got on a computer around 4:30pm. PIC L1 AW noticed Melissa on the computer and asked to speak with her near the front of the library. Patron was confused as to why she was being asked to leave but packed her things began to exit. As she was leaving she said "Fuck you" to L1 AW, who told her to take care.

Location: Frank De La Cruz-El Pueblo Library
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Adjacent to the library's north exterior wall, Vet-Sec guard J.P. caught two individuals holding drug paraphernalia, which emitted a smell consistent with fentanyl.  When he approached them, they ran away.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property
Description: Staff found red marker graffiti all over the unisex restroom in the lobby. The cameras showed two teen boys came into the library - one went into the restroom, the other paced and giggled in the hallway. They immediately left the library. When they returned two days later, Lib III BL asked to speak to them in a private study room. I told them what we found in the restroom and asked if they knew anything about what happened. They denied any involvement. I explained that this was considered vandalism of library property and described the consequences - closing the restroom to the public, extra work for staff and custodians, and stained tiles. I said there were two boys who looked a lot like the two of you near the restroom right before this happened. They again denied any involvement. I explained that users of the library are expected to follow some simple rules, like not damaging property, and if this happened again in the future we might have to ask you to leave the library, or even suspend you from using the library for longer. They said they understood. This was a verbal warning.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
As the patron left the library, they loudly said "I hope your mother is fucking disappointed in you" to seemingly nobody in particular. Afterward, another patron came up with a child and said that the patron who left had been cussing and she had asked them to keep it down as there were children around. The patron proceeded to cuss again and when the guardian approached again, the patron said "I'll just leave". The patron with a child stated that she had felt unsafe, but couldn't leave because she had the child with her (I assume she was a tutor or something similar instead of the parent). L1 AB apologized and asked her to please come to staff with situations like this so we can handle it and that we would talk to the patron if she came back.
Staff hadn't heard any cussing, as it happened at the back of the library, but we will be more alert to outbursts if this patron returns.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.1 Manipulating or bypassing library rules, such as computer use
Description: Patron A. Goya presented her child's card at the service desk to check out a Culture Pass. LA BM noticed that there was already a Culture Pass checked out on patron Goya's own card, which was linked to the child's card. LA BM informed patron that only one pass per household could be checked out at a time. Patron stated that they thought the rule was one pass per card and left the library unhappy. Immediately after leaving, patron called Himmel and demanded to speak to the manager. Patron hung up while waiting for staff to get the librarian in charge. Patron immediately called back and spoke to LTA MB, who re-explained that only one Culture Pass per household could be checked out at a time and that there was already a Culture Pass checked out on a linked account in the household. Customer talked over LTA MB, and would not accept LTA MB's explanation of the rules. The customer also stated "you don't know how to do your job" and "the other library lets me do it." LTA MB had to end the call due to the customers unwillingness to cooperate. Customer then proceeded to visit another branch and check out a Culture Pass on the child's card. Documenting as this appears to be a repeated pattern of behavior (aggressively talking over staff and accusing staff of incompetence) for this customer when interacting with Himmel staff about library rules.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description: This is for informational purposes only.At approximately 1:15 pm, it was reported to Librarian I D.B. that there was a bat in the public area of the library.  D.B. worked with Librarian B.P. who called the Facilities phone number and let it ring many times, but there was no answer.  Instead, B.P. immediately called LSM E.D.L. to report that that there was a bat in the public area.  E.D.L. called B.P. back shortly thereafter and told B.P. that LSM S.R. had submitted an emergency facilities service request.  At 2:40 pm, the bat removal person told staff that the bat had been found, and had been removed from the building.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
A woman approached the information desk just after 2pm and indicated she needed help. She told MD that there was a man outside yelling that people were murderers. MD went outside to find an older man yelling at the top of his lungs at two people who appeared to be petition passers that they were "Murderers! How would you feel if you you were ripped from your mother's womb! You're all murderers!" MD approached the man and clapped to get his attention. She had to yell to be heard over his yelling because he did not stop his tirade. She informed him that his behavior was not appropriate and he needed to leave. He replied, still yelling, that this was public property and he was allowed to protest. MD informed him that his behavior was against library rules. The man then strode into the library and MD followed him, telling him that he was not allowed in the library and he needed to leave. He turned around and got in MD's face and yelled "You're a murderer!" and stormed out of the library to continue yelling at the the petition passers that they were murderers and demons. MD told him that he had been asked to leave and he had not left so he was now trespassing and he should leave. That seemed to register with him because he strode off.
The petition passers and the woman working at the next door Mathnaesium had called the sheriff's department, and two deputies arrived a little after 2:30 to take MD's statement. The report number is 240201174. The Deputy was Urias, and his badge number is 8868.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description:
LA ES received a call from our custodian on 02/01/24 in the evening asking if they knew what had happened in the restroom, LA ES was not aware of any incident. The custodian mentions that there was fecal matter smeared all around the small stall in the men's restroom and had to stay until 10 pm to clean it up. From the security footage we can see a patron with a light blue jacket enters the men's restroom at 4:42 pm. Around 4:55 pm LA CR goes to check the restrooms.
