She locks the women's restroom first and then goes to close the men's restroom. The patron with a light blue jacket was still in the restroom and LA CR let them know that they had to exit the restrooms since the library was about to close. A bit later L1 MG knocks on the restroom again to remind them that the library was closing soon. As the patron exits LA CR was in the hallway waiting to lock the restrooms. LA CR confirms that no one else was in the restroom but notices that there was a fecal odor in the restroom but assumed it was from the patron that just used the restroom. 
L1 MG and Vet Sec MM delivered his suspension letter on 2/6/2024 and he left amicably.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal
Description: Customer entered library with her huskie puppy on a leash and began talking to the guard. Puppy urinated on the mat inside the front door of the library. Customer got paper towels from an unknown source and started cleaning up the mat. Librarian JD became aware of this as she was beginning closing procedures by walking through the library. Guard was holding the customer's dog and watching her wipe up the mat. Guard was instructed that the owner had to be in control of her animal. Customer was asked not to continue cleaning and to take the dog outside. JD left to put make a sign for cleaning staff to know of the need for extra cleaning. JD assumed that the customer had left the library. A few minutes later the customer was found outside in the backyard with the dog running freely. Customer was told that service dogs were welcome, but this puppy was not following service dog behaviors. Customer left the library.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description: At 12:15 a teen patron notified L1 KN and LA JR at the front desk that there was someone bathing in the men's restroom sink. KN asked LTAS JA to assist. As JA went to open the door to the men's restroom a patron KN recognized as suspended patron Gregory Nelson was coming out. KN stated to patron GN "You're not supposed to be in here, you're still suspended. You can't be in any libraries." GN responded "You don't know who I am." KN responded "Yes I do, you're Nelson", to which GN did not respond. GN then left the building without any further warnings. KN observed GN to make sure he left property while JA confirmed there was no one else bathing in the men's restroom. Some standing water on the floor by the sink was mopped up and a wet floor sign was placed. Guard A approached KN while she was watching GN leave property, and after KN informed guard A about GN's suspended status guard A informed KN that he had observed GN sitting on a stool in the front lobby (outside of desk staff's view) charging his phone. GN's suspension will not be extended since he left peacefully.

Description: Previously there were two individuals staying outside of the library window on the west side of the building. Vet Sec MM has spoken with them and told them they are not allowed to stay in that area. This morning, LA CR saw a campsite in the same area and alerted L1 MG. They had planned to wait for Vet Sec MM arrival before speaking with the individuals. Before Vet Sec MM arrived, LA CR smelled an odor consistent with drug use in the children's area of the library. L1 MG confirmed the smell and witnessed the individuals smoking. They packed up and left the area before they could be spoken to. They did leave evidence of drug use on library property. They will be suspended for one year.

Description: Youth patron reported to LIBIII KW that the men's room smelled like smoke.  When investigated it was confirmed to smell like drugs had been smoked.  The restroom was locked to air out.  The patrons using the restroom at that time were not complicit. Not able to identify user.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: Brothers Anthony and Andrew were in the library all day and as the day progressed their inappropriate behaviors increased. They were engaging in wrestling, head locks, climbing under each others chairs and general loud noise and rough play.  They were asked to leave for the day but continued to play roughly on the patio while waiting for their ride.  They were spoken to again and as they were leaving they threw a downed branch at the library door and Anthony shoved Andrew into the road.  They were told that they were suspended for one week.
Patron complained of severe nausea and asked LTA DL to call 911.  Paramedics arrived at 3:54pm.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: At around 3:50, a patron approached Guard J to say that the patron on computer 9 was being loud and pounding on the computer cubicle walls. Guard J told the loud patron to please keep it down. About half an hour later, the first patron approached Guard D and said that the loud patron was at it again. LIC CS went to speak to the loud patron and observed that he had pulled the entire end cap off of the computer cubicle and thrown it onto the floor. He was also visibly intoxicated. CS told him that it seemed like this wasn't a library day, and he needed to head out. He asked if he could use the restroom on the way out, and CS said yes. On his way out, the patron told CS "Hey, fuck you," and kicked the front door accessibility button several times.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description:
Since May 2023, staff suspected that Andrew Kern was stealing graphic novels. In June, Librarian III KS talked to him about the library and how to check out books. He did get a library card the next time he came in the library. He only checked a few books out a couple times and would immediately put them in the exterior book drop after leaving.
From June - November 2023, staff would witness some odd behavior. He always walks into the library facing away from staff and take the longest route around the edge of the room quickly. Usually with a ballcap and/or hoodie up. Staff saw him one night in late November with stacks of Graphic Novels, going to back and forth to his backpack that he left in the nonfiction section behind a bench. He did not check anything out and then the stack of graphic novels could not be found.  The next day he came in and Librarian III KS asked him to come to the desk where it was quiet. KS said “Hey, Andy - Staff saw you with a large stack of Graphic Novels but didn’t see you check them out last night.” He immediately jumped in and claimed he put them back. KS told him to please put them on the cart by the front desk for our statistics and so we can make sure they are counted and put back in the correct place. KS let him know that what staff had witnessed him doing could make people suspicious that he was stealing, and we wouldn't want people thinking that if it wasn't the case. He did not come back for several months until 2/7.
On 2/7 staff said he didn't have his backpack this time, but they believe that he tucked something under his puffy jacket. He wanted to check out something for his mom, but they weren't linked so he called her and she came inside from the car to check out her own items. 
On 2/8 around 4:10pm, Librarian III KS saw him come in and asked if LA LG could help her watch him, so it was less obvious. LG watched him go from Adult to Teen Graphic novels and he took pictures of the ISBNs of the books. KS also witnessed him seemingly taking photos of the books at one point while walking by. He went back and forth a couple times and eventually LG saw him put four “Teen” graphic novels under his oversized jacket - he sat on the floor with the books on the ground next to him and slid them up his side under his jacket. KS saw him walk by with graphic novels under his jacket. He went very quickly to the restroom with his left arm glued to his side and his phone in his left hand. KS followed him the entire way after seeing the books in his jacket, and he did not stop anywhere else in the library. (While in the restroom, KS and LG discussed what they saw and when LG told KS she saw him put “4 Graphic Novels under his jacket”, which was consistent with what KS noticed under his armpit in his jacket.)
Andrew came out of the restroom and the books were no longer under the armpits of his jacket and he was no longer holding his arm to his side.  LG checked everywhere in the restroom, even the garbage, and the books were not there. He waited for staff to change at 5pm and left with his mother; he called her after going to the restroom and she came in to get her book from the hold shelf and then rather than leaving they loitered in the Friends Shoppe and hallway from 4:35-4:45. At 4:45 she went and talked to the AARP tax people at one point until they left at 5:03pm. 
While we cannot be certain, staff believe he put the books in the lining of his large jacket at the back based on the way it looked after he came out of the restroom. 
 
When they left at 5:03PM, KS followed outside and asked “Hey, Andy! Was there anything you need to check out?” The mother had walked away. He said “no”. KS let him know that we saw him go into the bathroom with several books under his coat. He opened his coat showing KS the front of his shirt saying they weren’t under there. KS said, what happened to the books then? He said he put them back on the shelf, and KS said “Oh, that’s odd because we didn’t see you do that.” SYM was watching a few feet away told him that he needed to return what he didn’t want at the desk next time if took them off the shelf, and KS let him know that if he is stealing books that the suspension is one year from all library locations – holding up a suspension letter KS had prepared for him. He said “okay. I didn’t steal” and left.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Two men came into the library in the 1:o'clock hour.  One was in a wheel chair and has one leg, the other was standing and walking a little wobbly.  They asked for computer passes and logged on to the back row of public pcs.  A couple of times they were asked not to laugh so loud or sing out loud.  LIBIII KW let them know that if they couldn't keep their noise levels and language in check they would need to leave for the day.  The one not in the wheelchair assured her he would comply. Minutes later he was using inappropriate language and singing out loud again.  ( I'm gonna fuck you up, I'm gonna kill you )  KW told them that they needed to leave for the day. (This all took place during the guard's lunch hour).  The walking one refused so KW said she would call the police if they didn't leave.  They took a while but finally the walking one got up and started walking out of the building while KW helped guide the wheelchair man out to the lobby.  KW helped him leave through the West facing doors. A few minutes later a patron reported that there was a man in the restroom who was wobbly and making a mess (turned out to be the walking member of the duo).  KW told the man he needed to leave immediately which he did. The restroom stall was left with liquid and paper clumps all over the toilet and floor. Next, a patron came in and reported that there was a one legged man laying on the sidewalk outside the West facing entrance.  KW went out to check on him and woke him up, and asked if he needed help, which he declined, but his wheelchair was missing.  KW walked over to the bus stop where she found his friend with his wheelchair, she asked if either wanted her to call 911 and asked the one with the wheelchair to please go get his friend who needed the wheelchair.  They are currently unable or unwilling to get up and get the guy back into his wheelchair.   Both are currently laying outside on the sidewalk in the horseshoe bench.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Presently suspended customer David Michael Rivera trespassed and entered the library around 11 AM. Guard Jen called L3 LIC LAF to alert her that he was in the building. When LAF got to the first floor, David Michael Rivera was shouting very loudly and aggressively at guard Jen. He could be heard throughout the first and second floors. Guard Jen handed LAF David's suspension paper. LAF attempted to speak to the customer and tell him he was suspended, but he continued shouting loudly and lunged toward her. LAF had already kept some distance, but took additional steps back and told the customer to "please leave the building". David continued shouting and even got a little louder as he was making his way out of the building, pausing to continue yelling at the doors, to which LAF responded, "Leave" a few times and he did. David can be difficult to understand at times, but he did say something about being shot or shooting someone. The customer's suspension has been updated to one year. A library card number is attached to David's person info, but the card does not appear active.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: As L3 KK was sitting in her office, she heard loud screaming and shouting coming from the computer lab. Desk staff thought that the screaming woman may have been angry that we were out of snacks. As Guard BJ and KK and L1 KB approached the woman creating the disturbance, customers were moving away from the woman and some were exiting the building.  The woman was slamming her possessions and screaming in a complete rage. It was hard to understand what she was saying but staff heard the words "fuck" and "staff."  L1 JD called 911.  Other customers in the area also appeared to be calling 911.  One male customer approached the desk to say he "didn't feel safe here" and asking if we had security. KK and BJ positioned themselves so that the computer desk was between them and the woman.  KK instructed the woman to leave.  The woman initially did not comply.  KK told the woman that the police were on their way and she needed to leave.  The woman got up and slammed her chair violently against the computer desk.  As she left building, she yelled at desk staff to stop looking at her.  The woman exited the building heading towards St. Michael's School.  L1 JD called St. Michael's to make them aware of a potential threat.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Men's room smelled of drug use.  Locked and placed out of order.  During guard's lunch hour.  No definitive user noted.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: Man came up to front desk to say that his phone, which he was charging under the desk at the pc station he was using, had been stolen.  LIC KW followed him over to the desk where a charging cable was hanging under the desk near where his legs had been.  He immediately accused the two young men on the other side of the privacy panel.  They both denied it and offered him their names and contact information.  KW asked the man to refrain from accusing others, and the woman beside him let him call his phone with her cell phone.  The phone went straight to voice mail.  KW told the man that he could file a police report.  He was very distraught and on his way out he dropped his big gulp of mountain dew all over the lobby.

Location: Frank De La Cruz-El Pueblo Library

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description:
SO CS reported a wellness check for a male library user, "Jake" who CS estimated "had been in the restroom for about 45 minutes". When CS did the wellness check in the restroom, Jake indicated that he did not need assistance and he remained in the restroom for an additional 4-5 minutes. When he exited the restroom, there was a smell of burned chemicals which is consistent with the smell of smoking burnt chemical drugs. As this smell was not present during the wellness check, and there was no other person in the restroom, Managing Librarian IR walked over to Jake who was still on the library premises to chat about the incident. IR let Jake know that due to the serious nature of the behavior, he would be suspended from the library. Jake indicated that he understood and said "I will keep that in mind".
Jake then left the library premises without additional incident.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description:
Tony came in and asked to use the charging station, I informed Tony that he was still suspended from all libraries. He argued that he does not use drugs and he visits the other library with no issues.
I let him know he is still suspended, that he was observed doing drugs and if he wanted to he could appeal the suspension.
He was given a copy of his suspension letter.
He stated his last name was not Burgis. I only know him as "Tony", but I know this is the same person I suspended after the drug use incident in September. VetSec guard was the observer of the violation. 
LSM VL 2/14/24 UPDATE: This may be a case of mistaken identity. Some SRO staff and the guard MM, familiar with Tony Burgis, do not believe this is the same Tony.
STU, where the other Tony frequents,  was notified of the possible mistake and we all will be sure that the patron is welcomed into the library.  Unfortunately the staff and guard familiar with the "bad" Tony were not present during the interaction I had and I believed it to be the "bad" Tony.  Due to the last incident by the school, where "bad Tony" was violent and caused a trail of blood from himself or someone else all along the school sidewalk to the park, I was being overly cautious.

Description: Individual enters the library at 11:15 and goes into the family restroom. They remain in the restroom for around 30 minutes. During this time, multiple flushes can be heard and the sink is kept running the entire time. Suspecting drug use, Guard J gets L1 MNC and they inform the individual that the restroom is not for bathing. The individual appeared in be under the influence and needed to be asked multiple times to exit. They will be suspended for the day.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others
Description:
At 11:15 AM, a male patron entered the library and went straight to the charging station. He then walked up to the customer service desk, asking for a micro USB charging cable because the ones in the charging station were incompatible with his old device. Unfortunately, we didn't have any micro USB chargers available at the time. So, he decided to charge another device in the charging station. While waiting for his device to charge, the patron appeared anxious, frequently walking around the library and sitting in different places. Vet-Sec MM noticed his behavior and kept an eye on him. 
At 1:50 PM, a female patron came to the desk and reported leaving the library because she felt uncomfortable around the male patron. She said that he seemed to be following her. We reviewed the camera footage and saw that the male patron had displayed questionable behavior around the library. Vet-Sec MMs closely watched him, and he, the patron, left around 2:22 PM. We want to document this incident for future reference.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
Over the past two weeks, two groups of tweens from Sahuarita Middle school have had repeated negative interactions. At various times, members of staff have advised the two groups to keep apart. On 2/15/24 at 3:45pm, regular tween patron Alice came to L1 EG and said that another tween had called her friend, Braedon (in our game room), “the n-word.” Upon speaking with the group of tweens standing outside the game room, EG determined that the word had been used by a newer tween patron, Cayden. EG asked Cayden to please call his parents, as he would have to leave for the day due to his use of abusive language. She then addressed the remainder of the group, reminding them that their negative behavior was escalating, and in the future they could face consequences up to and including suspension if they continued on this path.
EG went to speak with the second group of tweens to explain the consequences and potential suspension of the continued escalation. While speaking with this group, EG discovered that Cayden had tried to enter the game room, and Braeden had blocked the door. Cayden then used the n-word and slapped Braeden. In response, Braeden had kicked Cayden and “taken a swing” at him. Realizing that the interactions had turned physical, EG went to speak with L3 BL, who determined they should sit down with both boys. BL highlighted relevant sections of the code of conduct. She then asked each of them what had happened. Each told their side of the story, and it was discovered that there had been a miscommunication about who was allowed in the room. Each had responded in anger toward the other. BL explained that the library is supposed to be a safe space for everyone, and using abusive language and engaging in violent acts runs contrary to our goals. She further explained that this sort of behavior can lead to suspensions. Both boys admitted to their part in the altercation. Each sincerely apologized to the other. They both agreed to take more control over their responses, and to seek staff when they feel disrespected or unsafe. As both boys understood the consequences, it was decided that this would serve as a verbal warning and they would not be suspended at this time. Staff will continue to monitor their behavior. Both boys expressed they would like to continue to use the library, and admitted that a suspension was not their desired outcome.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
Henry Lancaster III submitted an Ask A Librarian request for some scientific research on 2/11/24. L1 KG responded with the requested information on 2/12/24. Henry responded with some commentary on the research and ended his email with, "I want to thank whoever it was that sent me this message for their assistance. And if you're a granny over 50......................... Buy a dress #Gilfsforlust"
L2 CS responded to the email letting Henry know that this was an inappropriate way to speak to library staff, and that we require all library patrons to follow our Code of Conduct even over email. Henry emailed back, "If I endowed the sophistication of my language with panegyric editing, would that be appropriate to the reception of your ears..................... Baby?"
Because of the repeated harassing messages, Henry will have his library and Infoline privileges suspended.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: At about 4:45 PM Guard AB came in to the back room to report that suspended patron Gregory Nelson had entered the building and gone into the men's restroom. L3 AG and LTA supervisor MB went with AB to the restroom and told Mr. Nelson that he was suspended from all Pima County Libraries and he needed to leave. Mr. Nelson was in the stall and kept asking for "a minute." Staff repeatedly asked Mr. Nelson to finish up and leave over the next 30 minutes. At times he was unresponsive and staff asked if he was awake, and should they call the paramedics. After that, he would respond. Mr. Nelson finally left at 5:15 pm. It did not appear that he had used illegal drugs while in the restroom.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description:
LTA KW informed L1 KH that a customer was behaving strangely in the Women's Restroom. L1 KH checked the restroom and found a woman in front of the sink, who did not seem steady on her feet and was waving her hands through the air. The woman was the only customer in the restroom. She began repeatedly washing her hands when KH entered. KH smelled a strong odor of burnt chemicals, but did not observe any drug paraphernalia in the restroom. Another customer entered the restroom at this time. KH asked the woman at the sink to allow the other customer access to the sink. The woman left the restroom weaving and slurring her words as she said, "Have a nice day." KH placed the restroom out of order and locked it for 2 hours to air out, as the odor was strong enough to give KH a headache.
After talking to LTA KW again, KH learned that KW had witnessed the woman smoking from a metal pipe while standing in front of the sink. After speaking with Guard DT, KH learned that the woman had been witnessed with foil in hand during a previous incident (0000023077) in which there was a strong burnt chemical odor in the restroom. The woman will be suspended for one year due to repeated instances of drug use in the restroom.

Description: Custodian EMO was doing her mid-day cleaning when she noticed a strong smell in the men's restroom.  She came to the staff workroom and alerted LII DB and L1 PC of the odor.  They went to the men's restroom and confirmed the smell and locked the door.  Upon looking at the camera LII DB noticed the man come into the library at 1:47pm, got straight to the restroom and leave the restroom at 2:05pm and immediately leave the library.  The man was not recognized by staff, but will be suspended if he is seen again.
