Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: Guard JQ was doing rounds when he observed a gentleman drinking beer, sitting next to the west-facing doors drinking out of a beer can.  JQ told him he needed to move.  He attempted to get up but did not succeed and sat back on the ground.  JQ got L1 JCB and asked her to come to assess the situation. JCB asked the man to leave and gave him two minutes to do so.  When she returned he was still there, and JCB asked the man if he'd like her to call paramedics to help him move.  The man nodded.  JCB called the paramedics and they arrived and asked the man if he was okay.  He nodded.  They asked if he needed any help and he shook his head.  The paramedics said JCB would have to call the police.  JCB again reiterated that he only needed to move to the bench on city property.  The man attempted to stand and was too unsteady to do so.  The paramedics helped him stand and move to city property, therefore he was no longer in violation of library policy.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description: On hearing a loud clattering, sound coming from the restroom area, Guard KS and I went to see what was happening. A male customer who was in the stall at that moment immediately yelled out, "i'm ok". We both noticed that the floor was wet and there was soapy water all over the sink area. I stated that we had heard a loud clattering sound, similar to glass being dropped on the floor and asked him if there were glass shards on the floor. He just kept saying "it's ok, i'm ok". Five minutes later he exited the restroom and staff went in to check the area. There was so much water on the floor that it needed mopping and a caution sign. No glass was detected. I asked the man to leave for the day and to avoid repeating his actions when he returned. I explained that the amount of water left behind presented a hazard for other customers.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description:
A male patron wearing black was sitting on the computer when a female patron placed her phone on the phone charging station behind him. The charging station cubby was not closed all the way. 
After looking for a book the female patron reported that her phone had been stolen out of the cubby. Review of the security footage showed the male patron at the computer clearly looking around to make sure the female patron was out of view and walk over to the open cubby. He then took the phone out of the open cubby and placed the phone in his sweatshirt pocket and walked quickly across the library and out the front door.
Female patron was distraught and reacted strongly. Staff called 911 to report the theft as well as the emerging disorderly conduct triggered by the theft.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.2 Guns, weapons, machetes, knives
Description:
Fawn Pape came into the library agitated and asked for water. She asked for a place to charge her phone. Librarian IR brought a water bottle and showed her how to use the charging tower. Fawn insisted that the charging tower cubby be left unlocked while the phone charged. Fawn continued pacing and commented that she was feeling overheated. She also requested a book about astrology. Lib. IR walked her over to find the book and when they both got back to the phone tower, the phone was gone. IR indicated that she could call 911 and submit a theft report. 
Fawn became more agitated and began screaming at IR and insisting that the police be called. Fawn was pacing more erratically around the library, yelling and cussing. At the entrance she paced around the security officer and in her rush hit him with her body. She apologized, but continued pacing.
This particular part of the incident continued in this manner for about 10 minutes inside and outside of the library.
By the time TPD arrived, Fawn had calmed down and had been using the computer. Just before TPD entered the building to receive the incident report, staff at the front desk reported that Fawn took out a taser from her backpack and was discharging it several times. Staff reported feeling intimidated and they noticed that Fawn was laughing in seeming delight at causing her service dog to act fearful with the zapping of the taser nearby. Fawn Pape put the taser away and brough out a baton showing off the weapon to her friend before putting it away before the officers walked up to them.
TPD took the theft report and left. No additional incident occurred after Fawn left the premises.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
Approx. 1:30pm, LTA Sup SG informed Librarian II AD (currently in charge) that regular patron Jeremy was laughing loudly enough to disrupt everyone around him and several patrons were visibly uncomfortable. LII AD went and spoke with him. They said "excuse me" several times, until Jeremy looked at them, and then they informed him that there had been several complaints about the noise level, and asked him to keep it down. He never verbally acknowledged AD, but he remained quiet throughout the interaction. LII AD then came away and updated LTA DM and LTA Sup SG about the situation.
Approx. 1:55pm, a patron approached LII AD to complain that Jeremy's volume was again high, and he was making statements that were making her uncomfortable. She specified that he had been talking about "sex changes" and making statements like "you can't arrest those kinds of Mexicans and Blacks" and "if I wanted to fuck your niece...". She said that a couple of families had left the area because of him. At 2pm, LII AD informed LIII AL of the ongoing situation, and accompanied AL to again speak with Jeremy. AL asked Jeremy to leave for the day and explained the complaints and the inappropriate statements and language. Jeremy complied with the request to leave, but made several more bizarre and alarming statements, including describing AL as "German", claiming she was "pushing drugs" and "should go see someone about that", misogynistic statements about "women and men", and making several references to being part of the mafia (seemingly because AL had mentioned families), and discussing "children with AK-47s" at length. Jeremy also either could not or would not answer the question of whether he was aware he'd been making statements aloud, even when AL asked several times.
Jeremy's conspiratorial/misogynistic/racist statements have consistently been a problem in recent weeks that have required staff intervention.
UPDATE: Some of the incidents involving Jeremy over the past several weeks are as follows:
12/1/23: Patron complaint of Jeremy cursing loudly on the computer.
12/15/23: Patron complaint of Jeremy cursing loudly in the computer lab. Patron specifically noted that Jeremy's behavior was a recurring issue.
1/4/24: Jeremy was overheard by staff cursing loudly in the computer lab. LA WB asked Jeremy to lower his volume. Jeremy glared at WB and denied wrongdoing.
1/29/24: Jeremy was overheard by staff having "a loud, acrimonious conversation on his headset". Librarian SM asked him to lower his volume. He became defensive and rude but took a walk and returned calmer.
2/5/24: LTA MB requested assistance from Librarian II AD to have a conversation with Jeremy about his volume. MB informed Jeremy that he needed to lower his volume while in a quiet space like the computer lab. Jeremy responded with several conspiratorial statements, and kept returning to the theme that "as women", LII AD and LTA MB were at risk of violence. It was not directly threatening, but it was bizarre and unsettling. LTA MB repeatedly asked if Jeremy understood that he needed to lower his volume, and he eventually agreed.
2/8/24: While in the computer lab, LTA MB overheard Jeremy say loudly "Yeah and she'll go home and take 10 Black guys up the ass". LTA MB was unable to address this behavior because they were assisting two other patrons, but alerted LTA Sup SG to it later.
2/26/24: Jeremy entered the library and immediately greeted Librarian SM by saying "I forgive you!" with a wide grin, apropos of nothing. SM replied "Great! I wasn't aware I needed any." She found it a bizarre thing to say.
In addition to these specific moments, most days, Jeremy requires a staff reminder about his volume level.
UPDATE 2/28: After consulting with LSM VL, it was decided to suspend Jeremy for a year. Approx. 11am, upon Jeremy's arrival, LII AD called the non-emergency line for assistance in suspending Jeremy and escorting him from the property. Officer J Davis (Badge #47230) arrived at approx. 1:25. He gave Jeremy the suspension letter. Jeremy asked if the suspension was from all libraries and the officer replied "Yes, all libraries in Pima County." Officer Davis also explained that Jeremy could appeal the suspension in writing. Jeremy ranted about "protection by exclusion" and "protection from a gangbang" and other such statements. Officer Davis allowed Jeremy to retrieve his belongings and then escorted Jeremy off the property.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: around 3:10pm a female patron came up to the information desk and reported that the women's restroom smelled of urine.  Lib III KW went to investigate and found a single woman at the sink and a strong smell of burnt chemical drug use.  KW informed the woman that she would be suspended from all libraries for one year for using drugs in the restroom and locked the bathroom to air it out.  The woman replied "How did you know it was me?"

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description:
During the 3 o'clock hour Phoebe Robinson was in the library and wanted to speak with the Writer in Residence, but did not have an appointment, nor did she want to book one for next week. Writer in Residence LM was actively in an appointment with another patron, so desk staff took Phoebe's name and number and let her know they would try to have LM call her back.
Less than an hour later, at 4:00, Phoebe called the library and complained that LM had not called her back yet. L2 DT took the call and reported that Phoebe was very upset and continuously talked over her while she tried to help her. DT took Phoebe's name and number again. When LM had a break in appointments L3 AG told her about the situation and asked if she knew this patron by name; she did not. LM expressed discomfort with calling her back using her personal phone. She also didn't want to set the expectation that she would be returning calls using the library phones as that isn't within the purview of this program.
Shortly after 4, AG called Phoebe and introduced herself, apologized, and let her know that the writer wouldn't be calling her back as that is not part of the program. AG then asked if she had been in the workshop on Saturday, as Laura had promised to email some documents to some of those patrons but several of the emails bounced back. This patron confirmed that she had been there on Saturday, and then proceeded to complain about the way the program is being run, saying that this was turning into a "horror show" and that she didn't want AG to do anything for her because she would "handle this in her own way."
LM is very uncomfortable about the idea of spending any one-on-one time with this patron due to the behavior. She feels that "handling things in her own way" may constitute some sort of veiled threat.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.5 Indecent exposure, public indecency, lewd, other sexual offense    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking
Description:
Guard J saw a man talking to a teen-aged girl. He gave her a hug, and then it appeared as though he tried to kiss her. She leaned backwards, and then moved rapidly away from him. She then left the building before Guard J had a chance to speak with her. Guard J then called the in-charge phone and I came down to the second floor, where the man had moved to. He was in the bathroom. He came out of the bathroom and I asked him if he remembered the girl, if he knew her, or if he had anything to say about the encounter. He may not have understood me and that although he spoke English, there may be a language barrier between us. He insisted on showing us his passport, although we assured him that we didn't want or need to see it. He was from Senegal, but I did not get his name. 
He was in his 30s, dark skinned, thin, with a knit cap, wearing beads and a pack around his waist. 
We don't have the details on exactly what happened, but this is for documentation purposes.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: A regular patron asked Guard CS if he could help her out to the bus stop as she wasn't feeling well.  He said he would walk with her, but halfway to the bus she needed to sit down and requested he call 911.  Librarian 1 SG called and they arrived about 10 minutes later.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.2 Guns, weapons, machetes, knives~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description: After L1 MG was notified that there was a juvenile patron with a BB gun, she reviewed the security footage. Cedric, Adam, and Milo were seen on the security footage playing with the BB gun, bringing it into different spaces at the library, and pointing it around. After discussing the matter with library admin, they will be suspended for one week.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: During Guard CS 's lunch break LIBIII KW went to the lobby on her rounds and found the men's room reeking of burnt chemical drug smell. The restroom was cleared and locked to disperse the odor.  The person in the restroom did not smell of the drug nor look like he was under the influence. No definitive source could be identified.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.2 Guns, weapons, machetes, knives
Description: Around 3:50pm, L1 MG was having a conversation with a juvenile patron when he indicated that Lucio had taken out a BB gun in the teen room and pointed it at him. L1 MG immediately went into the teen room to verify, and did not see the BB gun but other patrons stated he had had a BB gun. Lucio insisted that he had not pointed the BB gun at the patron. L1 MG spoke to Lucio about the severity of his actions and made him aware of the danger concerning the use of BB guns. L1 MG referred to library guidelines to determine the next steps. On 3/1, upon viewing the camera footage and verifying the claims, Lucio will be suspended for one month in accordance with "Suspending Library Privileges - Guidelines for Restorative Practices for Youth" section 1.1.7 for pointing a BB gun at another patron.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: LIBIII KW was working desk when a waft of burnt chemical drug smell came by.  She went to investigate and since the men's room was locked for a previous drug use, it was found that the smell emanate from the women's room.  A mother and young daughter were the only people in the restroom and were not the source of the smell.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: The front doors were opened at 9am for patron access to the large meeting room for Story School.  At 9:00:24 a woman in an Adidas black hoodie walked into the women's restroom leaving around 9:16.  At 10:13 am LIBIII KW went to check on opening in the lobby and found the strong smell of chemical smoke aka drug use.  There was one woman in the restroom who denied responsibility.  Unable to confirm which woman was the drug user.  The restroom was locked for 1 hour to air out.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description:
LIB1 KVN has helped patron Keddy, TL 4-5 times now since starting at GVY. On 3 separate occasions, Keddy has claimed he is unable to find a specific non-fiction book that indicates it's on the shelf. The book always has a graphic title and is related to physical intimacy (twice it was the same book). With all 3 requests, KVN went to the section and found the specific book in the exact shelf area it should be (no mis-shelves). Keddy always has a stack of books with similar content from the exact same section. Regardless, it is common to overlook/miss something so KVN was never concerned by this pattern of requests. NOTE: This description of previous interactions is included to demonstrate a potential pattern of targeted behavior, as requesting shelf-checks from staff members is not otherwise concerning. 
On Friday 3/1, after asking KVN to find a book in the physical intimacy section which Keddy claimed he could not find (that was in the correct spot), Keddy grabbed a book about kama sutra sex positions from his pile to check-out and said “it’s so great you have this book. I didn’t think you would carry something like this.” KVN was slightly uncomfortable by him highlighting that book, but said “Yes, we have all sorts of books at the library” and continued to check him out and add a book he wanted on hold to his account. He then opened the kama sutra book with it facing KVN on the desk and started pointing at some of the sex positions in the book and made generic comments about how great it was that the library had this content. KVN did not say anything in response and finished with his transactions. He left as soon as KVN gave him the due-date slip.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: LTA EO was sitting at the snack table when a little girl went up to the AMS table.  EO asked the girl if she wanted a snack.  She said yes and came to get the snack.  She then proceeded to pick out the items she wanted at the AMS Table and then ask EO if she could have a plastic bag.  EO got up and went behind the table to give her a bag.  The girl then loaded all her stuff into the bag and left the library.  A few minutes later she came back and asked EO for a wallet.  EO didn’t see the wallet and didn’t notice if or where she may have left it.  EO then asked LA CC to go in the back to check the Lost and Found. CC didn’t find any wallet.  The mother of the girl who came in was very upset because the wallet (turquoise color with Flamingos) contained her credit cards and money from her paycheck. CC went in the back check again and asked staff if they saw it.  The mother then asked if we had cameras and wanted to know if we could check them, feeling that maybe one of the patrons picked it up and took it.   Unfortunately, none of the staff have access.  She went around the library looking for the wallet but was unable to locate it.  She said she was going to call the police and report the thief.  She left her information with CC. LI RL took contact information and left message with LSM ED about situation.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: Customer requested staff call medical 911 to assist. Customer reported dizziness, was unable to stand without wobbling. Fire EMS responded and transported the customer.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: L1 AK called LIC L3 LAF stating there was a very loud verbal altercation in the men's restroom on the 2nd floor. LAF arrived to find guard Dominick standing outside the bathroom door, which was closed, with one man shouting extremely loudly at another person in the bathroom about a phone. The tone of this individual was aggressive and angry. LAF instructed the guard to open the door and LAF loudly stated that was enough and they needed to leave. One man exited the restroom and the shouting stopped. The customer who had exited the restroom told LAF that he hadn't done anything and the person in the bathroom had just begun to scream at him out of nowhere and that he was waiting at the library to pick up his child. LAF asked this customer to move out of the way and toward the 2nd floor desk and a different staff member, which he did, so that the customer who had been shouting would have space to leave and not again verbally assault the other customer. LAF spoke to the customer in the bathroom who had been yelling, who was beginning to calm down, and told him he needed to leave immediately. He was packing up his belongings and did not argue further and said he would leave. The customer who had been shouted at had made their way down to the first floor at this point. LAF asked the guard to ensure the yelling customer vacated the premises and went to check in with the customer who had been shouted at. He again stated he had not been involved in anything and that the other man had suddenly lost his cool and began accusing him of things he hadn't done related to a phone. He said he was about to leave. LAF informed him the other customer was leaving and asked him to remain seated at the computers until the shouting man left and had gotten out of the area so that there would not be further conflict between the two. The customer thanked LAF for the heads up and said he would wait to leave.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property
Description: On 3/5/24 @ 8:15am, Branch Manager SH noticed that there were several lights near the staff entrance that were missing their covers, and all of the lightbulbs inside of these boxes had been broken and strewn on the ground. This report is for documentation purposes.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description: At 1:13 PM Guard D and Day Porter S alerted a patron in restroom that they needed to clean it. 10 minutes later the patron was still in the restroom and Guard D once again requested he wrap things up. Patron started yelling at Guard D things such as "These fucking Mexicans are always trying to rush us". Patron left the library on his own.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.2 Strong odors~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.6 Using furniture improperly
Description:
Regular patron JR comes in nearly every day to use a study room. His use of patchouli has escalated and a couple of patrons using the study room after him have mentioned that they couldn't stay in the room and it has begun to affect the whole desk area. L3 CR asked to be notified the next time he came in so she could talk to him. Today, she was informed he came in and a few minutes later, another staff member let her know that he was sitting with both his feet up on the table. 
She approached the room and asked to speak to him, first asking him to please not put his feet on the table. She then told him that the patchouli was affecting customers using the room after him. Some people are sensitive to scent and could he please back off a bit. She didn't find it offensive, but for the comfort of other patrons, we would appreciate it. He said, "was it my girlfriend complaining? I bet it was." She told him that she didn't know who it was but a couple of patrons had mentioned that they were uncomfortable.
He asked why he couldn't put his feet on the table. She said it was inappropriate for the library. He said "So, let's talk about appropriate. Do you think it's appropriate to wear that nose ring when you work here? Is it appropriate to have your shirt unbuttoned like that?" She said, "This isn't a discussion about me. I just came to let you know." 
When she came in the door had been open so she asked, "Would you like the door open or closed?" He said, "Well, since I stink I guess you better leave it open." 
No other action was taken. This is for documentation purposes.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: There was a complaint about regular patron Cyrus being too loud on computers.  LA NG went over to him and the patron immediately started shouting "She's harassing me.  This is bullshit.  Fuck this!" and stormed out.  On the way out LTA DM heard him say "I'm going to steal their fucking books."  If this behavior repeats he will be suspended for a week.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: A customer reported to Librarian JNB that when he tried to leave the library, he found that his front tire had been stolen. He entered the library when we opened, so it happened sometime between 10:00 and 2:00. Customer walked over to the Sheriff's office to report the theft.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description: For documentation purposes. A bag with a white powdered substance was found by VetSec MM in the patio area.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft    1.1.4 Vandalizing property
Description: When Facilities Electricians arrived at Columbus Library this morning they told Lib III KW that the cables that hook into the cars for the EV Chargers were both cut off and missing.  Upon camera review a dark SUV pulls up to the visible station at 11:52:03.  At five minutes before it pulls up you can see the cable.  At five minutes after it leaves there is no longer a cable hanging.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description: Suspended customer entered the foyer restroom at 12:43pm without staff observing them.  L3 KK and L1 JM noticed that there was a line building for the restroom at about 12:55pm and KK knocked on the door to make sure the person was okay.  L3 KK got a response and walked away without saying anything.  At 1pm, L3 KK knocked again and asked if the person needed assistance.  The customer opened the door and shouted some vulgarities.  KK recognized her as a previously trespassed customer.  No guard is assigned to WIL so staff had to continue handling the situation.  L1 JD then knocked on the door at about 1:05p telling the customer there was a line of people waiting to use the restroom.  (Our other restroom is awaiting repair.) Customer opened the door again and shouted more vulgarities.  At 1:20pm, KK called 911 to have customer removed from the premises for trespassing.  At 1:24pm, the customer exited the restroom and started using the public phone in the lobby.  We had another incident happening in the computer lab that JD was handling, so KK reminded the customer that she was suspended from the library and asked her to leave.  KK told her that TPD was on their way.  Customer said she wouldn't leave until KK told her why she was suspended.  KK reminded her that she had used drugs in the restroom and that drug paraphernalia had fallen out of her backpack at the time of that incident.  The woman threw her backpack at KK telling her to look inside for drugs.  Customer immediately charged at KK.  KK backed away.  LTAs YM and MG thought the customer was going to attack KK.  KK went behind the service desk and the woman went back to the phone.  KK called 911 again.  While KK was on the phone with the dispatcher, the customer left the building.  The dispatcher encouraged KK to not cancel the call based on the customer's behavior.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: Death threats against staff~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
At 3:05pm, the individual from incident 0000023176 enters the family restroom. He remains in the restroom for almost 20 minutes during which time Guard J and LTA Sup FA hear multiple flushes with the water in the sink constantly running. They get L1 MNC due to suspected drug use. MNC asks the individual finish and exit the restroom. The individual refuses to exit and quickly escalates to swearing, racial slurs, and death threats. Guard J was in the process of calling 911 when the individual finally exited the restroom and building, continuing to shout threats the entire time. Due to the extremely violent nature of the individual's language, they will be suspended for one year.
A few minutes later, the individual re-entered the building to ask why they were being suspended. L1 BT attempted to explain the cause of his suspension and the process for appealing. The individual responded with another tirade of swearing and death threats. Afterwards, a couple patrons came to the desk to let staff know they were concerned by the individual's threats. This included the mother of 3 children who was scared for their safety and wanted to be sure that the individual was gone from the library premises.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft~Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: Theft of electric vehicle charging cables
Description: At 3:30pm L1 JM noticed that the charging cables at both electric vehicle charging stations had been cut and removed. This theft occurred sometime between Friday March 1st and Wednesday March 6th. Due to our lack of guard and no camera in this location we are uncertain of an exact date and time of this theft. The police were here for an earlier incident and Library Manager KK reported this theft to the responding police officer.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating
Description:
From 4pm-4:30pm LTA sup MB and LTA GP had to repeatedly remind a group of teens and tweens in the teen area to keep their volume down. During an internal patrol LTA sup MB observed a teen sitting on the back of a couch and reminded them to sit correctly. The group's volume continued to build over the hour, both in voice level and horse-play behavior, despite repeated reminders and warnings from staff.
From the desk LTA sup MB observed tween patron Michael chasing tween patron Rachel along the glass wall in the teen area, catching up to her out of view of staff. Rachel immediately ran over to LTA sup MB and LTA GP at the front desk and reported that Michael had whipped her with his phone charging cord on her arm and leg, pointing to a visible red mark on her arm. LTA GP retrieved in charge LI KN from the staff area. LI KN spoke with Rachel who described the incident again, as well as openly admitting that she and Michael had been rough-housing and that she had been goading him into hitting her. KN let Rachael know that Michael would be asked to leave for the day for hitting her with the cord, but also advised her to consider her actions and words and how they can affect herself and others in the future.
LI KN went to the teen area and asked Michael to gather his belongs and come speak with her outside the teen area. As Rachel entered the teen area behind LI KN, she gave Michael the middle finger. Michael (and others) complained about the action, which KN told Rachel she would address with her after speaking with Michael. Michael slowly gathered his belongings, stalling by asking a friend if he would watch his portable stereo and looking for his phone cord. During this time LI KN explained the events to L2 DT and asked her to address Rachel's actions and ask her to leave for the day for giving the middle finger behind LI KN's back. Michael finally exited the teen area. LI KN started to speak to Michael outside the teen area, but he requested that they speak in one of the study rooms for privacy so "the entire library wasn't staring at me". LI KN agreed and stepped into the study room. LI KN explained that because he had hit someone and left a mark he was being asked to leave for the day, but because there had been some back-and-forth between him and Rachel leading up to the incident he was not going to be suspended for any longer. Michael continually talked over KN as she tried to explain, saying Rachel "had got kids suspended at school" and accusing staff of not listening to him. LI asked Michael to give her a chance to explain but he continued to speak over her, so she asked him to leave and that the two of them would try to have the conversation another day. Michael insisted he was listening, but when LI KN tried again to explain he began to speak over her again, this time arguing that "in a court of law" Rachel would be "convicted". LI KN stated that this isn't a court of law so they wouldn't be discussing that. Since he still refused to listen and stop speaking over LI KN she told him he needed to leave for the day and that they'd try again tomorrow. During this time L2 DT spoke with Rachel and asked her to leave. Rachel and her friends, after calling for a ride, left the library. Michael left in another direction. LI KN and L3 AG observed all parties to make sure they left property.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft    1.1.4 Vandalizing property    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: Theft of electric vehicle charging cables
Description: When L1 KH was leaving for the day, she noticed that the charging cables had been cut from the electric vehicle chargers in the shared park/library parking lot directly behind Himmel. KH recalls seeing vehicles plugged into the chargers when returning from lunch at 2pm. Theft is suspected to have occurred between 2pm and 6pm on 3/6/24. Himmel does not have camera coverage of the parking lot.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Disrupting library staff workflow, large area left in significant disarray~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Description:
Patron (name unknown) asked desk staff if they had any hygiene supplies, specifically a comb and razor to shave, which they did not. His speech was fast and he did not stand still for long. Around 1pm guard A entered the men's restroom prior to the beginning of his shift and observed the patron shaving at the bathroom sink. Guard A informed L2 DT about the incident, who then went to speak with the patron. She informed him he could not bathe in the library, to which he replied he was not bathing. L2 DT replied he could not shave either, that he couldn't use the library bathrooms for personal hygiene reasons.
Later in the day page KC observed the same patron leaving the adult non-fiction area. Entering the area immediately after him, they observed multiple shelves in disarray. Shelves throughout the entire adult non-fiction section and the Literacy Reads collection had books pulled out and stacked and rows leaned over and left disorganized. Page KC was taken away from closing duties for the better part of an hour trying to put the section to rights. Page KC also observed the same patron in the children's non-fiction section pulling out books and making stacks. Page KC informed LI KN of the incident. The patron did not leave until the 6pm closing announcement, at which time staff observed the children's non-fiction section was left in a similar state with stacks of books left on multiple shelves and rows leaned over. Multiple staff were required to put the areas back together in the morning of 3/7/24. Patron will be given a 1 month suspension.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: While picking up trash around the building, Lib III KW went to NW corner of building, facing 22nd Street and Columbus, to clean-up a large pile of garbage that she had seen through the cafe windows.  When KW approached the area to pick up the trash, she was startled by a man sitting in the bushes actively preparing drugs to smoke.  She told him to leave and proceeded to pick up over 20 burnt foil patches, 3 plastic drug type baggies, food, half empty cans of beer and clothing. This after having picked up over 30 burnt foil patches and multiple half empty cans of beer in the same location on Monday.  This is the area that a fence is proposed to go to address these issues soon.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description:
Approx. 2:50pm, LTA ST was assisting Mr Cione in retrieving his hold. After she found his item, he hugged her without permission, causing ST to feel severely uncomfortable. After the hug, Mr Cione said, "Oh, I'm sorry, I just hug people!". ST was so distressed by Mr Cione's behavior that she ended her shift early.
Mr Cione left before staff could speak with him about his behavior. When he returns, he will be warned that touching others without their permission is unacceptable in the library and could result in being asked to leave the library.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property~Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: Breaking coin tower screen by punching it
Description:
At 4:00, LTA Sup KW noticed that the coin tower by the Express Computers had a shattered screen. Review of the camera footage shows a patron attempting to print out a document, growing frustrated at the touch screen, and punching it. The patron and his companion then argued with each other and left the building.
Patron will be suspended for two weeks, as the punch does not appear to be an intentional attempt to damage the screen, just to get it to work.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Children in the Library
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.1 Harassment: Filming or photographing without permission    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Children in the Library    4.2 Leaving child unsupervised or ignoring disruptive behavior of child
Description:
A woman was in the library on a supervised visit with her children. She had difficulty preventing them for running around the library, screaming and swinging around a large toy on a rope. The children were in the children's area of the library and their screaming could be heard all the way in the staff back room. After being given multiple chances to redirect or correct the children's behavior, L1 MNC spoke with the patron about ensuring the safety of the children and others while inside the library. The patron responded by called calling MNC "stupid", "idiot" and "retarded". He told her that was not an appropriate way to address library staff and that he was trying to suggest other activities that might redirect the children's energy. She continued her insults and MNC asked her to leave for the day. 
The patron pulled out her cell phone and began filming MNC and other people in the library. He informed the patron that filming was against the code of conduct and asked her to stop. The patron did not stop filming and became more aggressive. MNC stated that she was now in violation of our code of conduct and TPD would called if she did not leave. 
While MNC was in the back trying to call 911. The patron went over to the desk began trying to film him placing the call. She then started filming L1 BR and LTA TB and was threatening to post the video on social media. L1 BT attempted to intervene and de-escalate and also pointed out that the children's problematic behavior was continuing while she was filming staff. The social worker present for the supervised visit finally convinced the woman to leave for the day. She then left while yelling and swearing at her children.
 
During previous visits, LTA Sup. FA and Branch Manager TFL had also spoken to this patron about engaging her children in less disruptive behavior while at the library.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
LTA MG and LTA DL heard the patron at Express Computer 1 start shouting, asking, "Who the fuck logged me off?" The patron came to the desk and yelled at MG, who explained that his computer may have automatically logged him off and gave him a new guest pass. He accused MG of logging him off. The patron took the guest pass and asked MG, "Is this thing going to work?" MG said yes. The patron went back to his desk and apparently was unable to get the guest pass to work. He returned to the desk and started yelling at MG again. At this point, Guards J and A interceded and told the patron not to speak to staff that way. The patron got his belongings and left the library. On the way out, he glared at MG and said, "You'd better watch out, motherfucker." Then he said "Fuck you" to the guards and stole a bag of chips off the guard table.
This is the first time this patron has reacted this violently, but he consistently claims that guest passes don't work and gets angry at desk staff about it.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property
Description:
Lieutenant Quaintance from PCSD notified PCPL staff of property damage done to a stuccoed brick wall between the library and sheriff parking lot. His report read: 
There is significant damage to the wall.  One of the top blocks was knocked into the sheriff parking area, and the other is loose on the top of the wall.  There is also an electrical line that was partially crushed as well.  The wall was moved by approximately an inch at the top.  The strike was near a joint line in the fence which accounts for the movement.  
This is for documentation purposes.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description:
At 5:25 a staff member from the Santa Rosa Recreation Center called LA ES to report that the emergency exit door on the north side of the building had been broken. LA ES called library admin to report this issue. Upon viewing the security footage, the unknown patron from incident report 0000023143 can be seen throwing rocks first through an east side door and then through the north side door and a window on the east side of the building, breaking the glass of each. He is already suspended from Pima County Libraries.
On 03/21/24 the patron came in around 3:45, for our safety the staff did not engage with the patron given the gravity of his actions. LA CR called 911 around 3:50 and let them know that the patron was trespassing. Before LA CR ended the call, the patron made his way out of the library. There was no follow up from the police. 
03/22/24- Ruben came back into the library around 4:10 LA CR and L1 MG reminded the patron about his suspension and left right away. 
3/25/24- Ruben came into the library around 10:23, and VetSec MM informed him that he was suspended and unable to enter any Pima County Library property. VetSec MM and LSM VL ensured he left the area. He came back around 11:53 and poked his head into the door to ask if his sister Cassandra had left the library. Library staff told him that he was suspended and could not enter library property. Library staff is unaware of any associates and have not seen him with any other patrons.
3/26/24- At 10:07 Ruben was approaching library property when VetSec MM identified him as a suspended patron and reminded him that he is not allowed in the library. Ruben then pulled out two shards of green glass. He then began to walk on the north side of the library near the Head Start facility. VetSec MM returned to the library to make staff aware of the events. As LA CR called 911, VetSec MM witnessed Ruben attempt to enter the nearby school Drachman Montessori. The library was instructed by police to go into lockdown and the Head Start facility and Drachman were instructed to do the same. Police responded at 10:22. They spoke with Ruben. Due to not having video or direct witnesses from the window vandalism incident, the police released Ruben. Reference Police Report #P2403260113 [New incident created based on ongoing severity of infractions. L2HS 3/29/24]

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.4 Sleeping    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: Guard JB reported to L3 KK that he had woken a customer up 3 times and that he was again asleep.  When KK walked over to the customer with JB, the customer was snoring and drooling excessively.  KK was unable to wake him.  JB tapped on his chair and awoke him.  KK explained that, since he was sleeping again, we would need him to need for the day.  KK asked him if we could help him find any resources.  The customer declined.  KK and JB left the area.  The customer kept falling asleep while packing up his things.  JB approached him and asked him if he was okay, the customer said that he was.  After about 10 minutes, the customer started walked out and then came back in again.  He said that he didn't understand why KK had asked him to when he was allowed to sleep at other libraries.  Then he said he had been "talking to his medium" and called KK a "bitch" for interrupting him.  KK and JB did not respond.  The customer left.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Guard JD found a crack pipe on the bench near the front entry and disposed of it.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Right before 1pm Lib III KW was coming out on desk when the back up bell rang.  KW went out to find a ruckus occurring in the Teen-Children's area.  She found a woman who appeared to be with four young children, yelling at the regular youth and using profanity.  The youth enmasse were responding in a defensive and loud manner.  KW told the youth to please stop yelling and she would be back to talk to them.  Meanwhile guard CS came and helped guide the woman and her children out of the library as she continued to be loud and engage with the regular youth.  Outside KW was told by the woman that one of the regular youth is her nephew and she felt that another youth had been harassing him so she was just defending her nephew.  KW explained that if she had a problem with another patron she needed to tell library staff and they would take care of it.  KW also explained that her behavior and language was disrupting other's use of the library and she needed to leave.  The woman said that she had anger management issues and couldn't help herself going off on the kids. When KW asked the remaining youth, including her nephew, about the incident, they said that nobody was harassing anyone, and that she misinterpreted an interaction between friends, and escalated without provocation. KW reiterated that the youth needed to come get a staff person if any patron ever threatened them or yelled at them.
Customer complained of chest pains and requested staff call for medical 911 to assist. Customer was transported.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Library guard AB came to the desk to inform L3 AG that on his rounds he detected a burnt chemical smell in the men's restroom, although there was currently no one using it. AG confirmed the smell to be likely drug use and closed the restroom to allow time for the air to clear.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: When LA NG came back from her lunch hour she informed LibIII KW that someone was squatting behind the electric box on the SE corner of the building. NG stated that it looked like he was rolling something and possibly getting ready to use drugs. NG had told the person that they couldn't stay there and to please move on.  KW went out and reiterated that there was no drug use allowed and that they needed to move on. The person got up and walked away after packing some things in his backpack.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: While Lib III KW was addressing a person loitering behind the electrical box she looked North down the East side of the building and saw two people sitting behind the bushes.  She walked over to talk to them and found regular patron David and one of his regular friends sitting in a much used drug using location.  KW asked them to please get up and move along. David nodded yes. Ten minutes later while KW was doing rounds, she found both of them still sitting in the same place behind the bushes. When she walked up she saw David's associate lighting foil and sucking smoke through a straw.  KW told them to get going and that it was a mandatory 1 year suspension from all libraries.

Shortly after 3pm a 19 year old women approached the front desk at GLF and informed LA GL that she was not feeling well. GL found a chair for her to sit in while she rested her head on the counter. At her request, LA GL used her smartphone to call her mother so she could be picked up. Ten minutes later the mother arrived and determined that the paramedics should be called. Five minutes later the paramedics arrived and tended to the young woman. Five minutes later they helped her to her mother's car so she could be driven home. LA GL then sanitized the chair and counter.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description:
Over the last few months, patron John Tripp has made repeated comments to L1 EG which have made her uncomfortable. He will seek her out in lieu of other staff, he often tells her “You’re my favorite,” and he has looked at her in a way that makes her feel objectified. His behavior, though uncomfortable, did not rise to the level of harassment until 3/12/24 at about 5:15PM, when John walked up to EG on the desk and said, “you drive a stick shift?” EG answered in the affirmative and he said, “I knew that about you.” As manual transmissions are rare, and EG doesn’t advertise the fact that she drives one, EG felt that John not only knew which vehicle was hers but had also looked in her windows to confirm that she did, in fact, drive a stick shift. EG felt threatened by the idea that John knew her vehicle and personal details and told LIII BL about the interaction. BL determined that John’s behavior was threatening, and this interaction could be seen as harassment.
After talking with staff at GVY and due to a pattern of incidents after a verbal warning, we decided to suspend him for one week. LIII BL asked to speak to him away from other customers and brought up the conversation about the car, telling him that this made the employee feel watched and unsettled. I referenced the other incidents, letting him know he was increasingly making staff and patrons uncomfortable. Since I'd already given him a verbal warning, we were suspending him for one week and that included all libraries, including those in Tucson and Green Valley. I told him he could return on 3/20/24 and showed him the portion about appeals. He asked me why he's suspended from the libraries in Tucson if he made someone in SAH uncomfortable. I told him this type of behavior isn't acceptable at any location and suspensions are enforced at all locations. I could hear him mumbling under his breath about where he might find a computer to use. He seemed to understand my words, but not the emotional impact of his behavior. We've heard this might be due to a brain injury, but wanted to make it clear that this behavior needs to stop if we wants to continue using the library. He took the suspension letter and left without incident.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: A gentleman came into the library asking where the closest hospital was. Our guard MG and special duty officer asked the man if he needed medical assistance and if they would like him to call paramedics for him. The man said he had chest pain, and the officer observed that he looked like he may have been hurt on his head as well. The officer called for paramedics, and the man went outside and threw up in the landscaping while waiting for them to arrive. A fire truck arrived 4 minutes later and met the man just outside of our property and assessed him. They then called for an ambulance to transfer the man.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating
Description: At 3:30pm LIC L1 AK was called to 2nd floor desk by LA MA, because two large groups (Group 1: older teens, Group 2: adult woman and young adult/teens) were arguing because someone in Group 1 had stolen her nephew's phone outside the library.  When AK arrived, an adult woman was yelling in a threatening manner and pointing at a male teen in a black shirt.  LA MA was calmly asking both groups to speak more calmly and/or take their conversation outside.  Guard Jen, Guard April, and Guard Kyoshi were all present nearby as well.  Guard Jen was telling the woman that she was not allowed to threaten others in the library and that everyone needed to speak more calmly.  AK addressed both groups and told them they needed to end the conversation or leave the building.  The woman and her group angrily left the floor and then the building. Group 1 watched from the 2nd floor balcony, and as Group 2 left the woman yelled up at them in a threatening way.  AK asked the remaining group to tidy up their area and settle down, or they would need to leave the library.  They apologized, cleaned up, and left the building shortly after.  AK spoke with Guard Jen and LA MA after everyone left, and Guard Jen said that a young adult male in Group 2 with long dreadlocks in a ponytail and facial hair was going through the male teen from Group 1's bag earlier looking for the phone without his permission.  The teen grabbed his bag back and said the phone was on 29th street and not in the library.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: A customer reported to Librarian GT that he saw foil in the toilet of the handicapped stall of the men's restroom and other evidence of drug use. This customer also said he flushed the foil down the toilet. Manager CB checked the restroom and did not find evidence of drug use. There was a slight smell of something, but it was not an obvious drug smell.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: A female patron came to the service desk, reporting that her green bag had been stolen. After checking the security cameras, we observed that at 10:36 a.m., a male patron stole her bag as he was leaving the library.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: A regular QUI customer was heard loudly accusing kids in the computer lab of stealing his phone charger.  He then came to the information desk and said that his charger was stolen.  On the way out of the building, he started yelling and screaming at guard RP, saying, "You f___________ n_________"  He stood at the door yelling aggressively and wouldn't leave for several minutes.  He will be suspended for one week.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: Delete - item was reported stolen but later found in library

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Patron concerningly under the influence
Description: At about 2:45pm, a patron entered the library and approached the service desk staffed by LA RS and L1 MD. The patron was concerningly under the influence and was nodding out in place and listing side to side. His speech was extremely slow and slurred. He requested a computer pass and headphones which he received from library staff. He then attempted to make his way over to the computer room, and appeared to be having difficulty moving and navigating. His movements and demeanor were reminiscent of being under the influence of opioids. Once at a computer, the patron proceeded to cycle through short periods of being nodded out/slumping over/appearing to be unconscious, and periods of frantic energy scratching/clapping/rubbing his head and face. L1 MD and LA RS each approached to check on the patron, and offered to call for medical attention as we were extremely concerned for his safety. He declined each time assistance was offered. At this time, El Rio Neighborhood Center manager PP entered the library (unrelated to the incident), and upon being briefed on the situation by library staff stated that per City of Tucson regulations, this level of intoxication would warrant removal from the premises but he defers to PCPL/County procedure. L1 MD called 911 but emergency personnel stated that unless the patron consented to medical attention, they legally could not send help. LA RS called the In-Charge number at the Main Library and was advised to contact the Crisis Line. L1 MD called the Crisis Line and they confirmed that this behavior sounded like the patron was under the influence of opioids. A response team was dispatched with an unknown ETA. In the meantime, the patron continued cycling through the "nodded out" and hectic movements. LA RS and L1 MD kept an eye on the patron, occasionally approaching to check on him. Patron shared his name with LA RS- might be Connor or something that sounds similar. Patron left El Rio on his own accord at approximately 3:30pm. L1 MD called Crisis Line back to report this development and notified Neighborhood Center manager PP that the individual would now be elsewhere on the Center campus.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: person smoking something next to the electrical box near employee entrance
Description: LA NG was coming back from lunch and observed a person hanging around the electrical box by the employee entrance who had a blue sweatshirt wrapped around them w/several layers of clothes underneath, a ball cap on their head, dark hair and had some items in a plastic bag on top of and around the electrical box, and it looked like they were kicking the dirt/gravel around the box.  LA NG informed them that they could not be hanging out there due to safety issues but could come inside the library and they said they would leave.  LTA VN came back from lunch a few minutes later and confirmed that the person was still there and appeared to be burying something next to the electrical box.  LA NG went back out and the person was now smoking something (unsure what it was, it long and gray-ish) and still attempting to bury something into the gravel (which turns out to be a burned end of a stick).  LA NG called guard JQ to come be back up, and reiterated to the person that they could not be there nor smoking on the library property and the person shouted "Fine!!! I heard you!!!" and walked off towards the street. No further action taken since they walked off property.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property
Description: As per security camera, at 11:38am on Sunday, March 17th a male with neon green shoes dark pants and a dark jacket, short dark hair, came up the sidewalk from the intersection of Columbus and 22nd street spray painting neon green paint on the sidewalk and up onto library property.  He proceeded to paint the concrete and wall outside the West facing entrance, the horseshoe bench and plants.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: Trying to steal the newspaper
Description: For documentation purposes: Nanini Library Page saw a patron put part of the NY Times newspaper in his bag. The Wall Street Journal has also been missing multiple times at Nanini recently. Librarian GT went over to the patron while he was reading the New York Times. GT asked how he was doing, then he replied with "I'm reading the cover of the NY Times." GT said "Great, do you happen to have the Wall Street Journal?" he said he did not. GT reminded him that newspapers have to be read inside the library. He said okay! The page then saw him toss part of the NY Times back on the shelf - she filed it back.

KH disposed of the foil and locked the women's restroom to air out. Unable to determine a person responsible for the drug use.

Description: LA GL discovered graffiti in the GLF Men's Room in one of the stalls. The graffiti is orange colored and written along the handrail and the toilet paper dispenser. Believe to have been applied in the 2-3pm hour.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: Patron has been banned from PCPL. He arrived at STU and was using community computers in a peaceable manner. A veteran staffer identified that he had been banned for bad behavior told him he should not be in the library. He ran into the bathroom and held the door and was loudly shouting abuse and cursing. At this point, several staff members including management approached the bathroom. The writer was ordered to call 911 and get help in controlling the patron. The patron returned to the reading room where he was surrounded by staff, whom he abused verbally while carrying a "Chuckit" dog toy in a potentially threatening manner (This is a ~2 footlong hard plastic stick for throwing tennis balls). With police on the way, the patron slowly exited the library.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: Bedbug situation?
Description:
Approx. 6:15pm on 3/19, Page AM called the after-hours line to let staff know that he had been bitten by a bug in the library shortly before closing. Upon arrival at his next destination, he shook his sleeve and saw what he believed to be a bed bug fall out and scurry away. He was unable to capture the specimen to confirm the species.
The next morning, when staff arrived at 8am, we listened to AM's message and checked the materials he had been working with the night before for possible bed bug activity. We did not find any, so none have been set aside for quarantine. We submitted a facilities service request -- FAC10745.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: At 11:50AM on the 1st floor, a patron alerted Vet Sec Guard JT that they weren't feeling well and were having sharp pains in their side. Patron stated that they wanted to call an ambulance. Vet Sec Guard JT proceeded to call medical 911 notified the LII IC JM to the situation on the Vet Sec flip phone. Vet Sec Guard KB then waited outside for the ambulance/medical 911 fire truck to arrive, and LII IC JM joined Vet Sec Guard JT on 1st floor to get more information from the patron about how they were feeling and wait with the patron until help arrived. At 12:05PM a firetruck arrived at the east entrance of the library and proceeded to check on the patron. At 12:15PM an ambulance arrived, spoke to the patron and it was agreed that the ambulance would take her to a hospital for further assessment.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description:
Manager VS was notified by staff at the GLF and WIL libraries, that they had observed misuse of a library account, by patron .p26859166. This patron is under the age of 18. Over a period of two years, more than 80 items were removed from the library and not returned. The patron's account was used to place books on hold. The books would arrive, and go missing from the hold shelf without being checked out. Staff at WIL and GLF checked the status of the items in the account's hold history, and discovered that the items were never returned. Staff at GLF and WIL took measures to try and contact the patron, including calling, emailing, and placing holds behind the desk so the patron would need to speak to staff to pick them up. Items on hold behind the desk were never claimed, and no contact was ever made with this patron.
The account will be suspended for 6 months, until 9/20/24.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal
Description: L1 MG called IC L1 WW to inform him that a patron on the third floor had a dog who had possibly bitten another library user.  The library user who had possibly been bitten left before WW reached the third floor.  While the dog's owner had been informed that the animal would have to leave for the day, MG went to look for the patron who had possibly been bitten but he could not be located.  WW remained with the dog owner while she slowly gathered her belongings and got on the elevator.  After a bit of a delay, she exited while mumbling something about the "building burning down" under her breath.  Images will be searched to see if it can be determined if the dog did actually bite someone.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property
Description: At 12:51am on Friday March 22nd a man is seen on camera walking up to the front planter and attacking the plants with a stick. He continues to stab at the plants and soil for about 3-4 minutes, pours his drink on the planter and walks away.  He completely destroyed all plant life in the planter and left the debris all over the front entrance.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.4 Sleeping
Description:
Customer was  asleep, sitting in the chair by the public telephone. The restroom door was slammed so hard it hit the common wall and knocked the telephone receiver off the cradle. The loud noise of this and the door slamming into the wall woke the customer up and he slid out of the chair. He landed flat on his back. He reported no injury and was able to stand and leave the library on his own.
 
Third Party/Citizen incident report filled out by librarian JD.
