Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: One of our patrons vomited and another asked loudly for someone to call 911 for her. That patron stayed with her while we called 9-911 using the corded desk phone, and we brought her water that she asked for while we waited for the EMTs. Another patron had called 911 as well, and stayed on the line with them after being informed that we had called 911. The patron who vomited had requested that we call her father and gave us his phone number, which LIII KS followed through with. A fire truck and an ambulance arrived on scene shortly after we called, and after assessing the patron, she was transferred to the ambulance.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
Every Saturday since February 17, an older man comes and holds a banner with pictures of a naked, bloody, dead baby with an umbilical cord wrapped around its neck. The poster states this a "2nd trimester (22 week) aborted GirL". Every Saturday there are many complaints, and people often make remarks or yell something at the man while walking by. 
This Saturday, March 23. Staff came to get Lib III KS who was doing paging slips around 2:15pm as they said that the man with the poster and a woman were yelling for more than 5 minutes. KS went out and the woman had already left. KS talked to the man and let him know that she was here because there was a complaint about the yelling and shouting out front. She asked him to "please refrain from yelling or shouting while he was in front of the library." He replied, "oh, you are going to make me leave but not the person who was yelling at me?". KS said, "I would also talk to the person who was yelling at you but they weren't here by the time I got out here. People are not to yell or shout at you either." He then said "What about that lady over there? That baby killer!" and gestured at the other petition passing table. KS said "Are you saying that woman is yelling out here, because I will go speak to her, or are you bringing up an unrelated topic to what we are talking about right now?" The man then said "No, she wasn't yelling." KS said "Okay. Well, please let us know if people are yelling so we can address it. Thank you!" and walked back inside.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.10 Creating tripping hazards, blocking aisles, exits, entrances    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
A woman joined the man with a poster at the petition passing location in front of the library about halfway through the afternoon. While Librarian III KS witnessed the woman walking up to people trying to talk to them and hand them business cards while they were trying to get in and out of the library. The library page in the check-in area also told KS that the woman was doing this as you can see the front door through the window.
KS went and talked to the woman after she finished up her conversation with a patron (we were near the fire line in the middle of the walkway into the library). KS said "Hi, I'm here because we've noticed you walking up to people and stopping them in front of the library. You're welcome to be here; however, we need to ask you to stay in the petition passing area over there and not approach people trying to enter and exit the library." She said "I'm not doing that! People were talking to me and I was just going to talk to them." KS said "you can wait for people to approach you for a conversation. Right now, we're standing in this area talking which is not close to the petition passing spot" KS then walked back over to the petition passing area with the woman while saying this and used the bollard to indicate the area she needed to be in, KS said "please stay within this area behind this (touching the bollard) and not block the sidewalk or doors". KS then went back inside. 
Later that same hour, the woman went and was standing in the parking lot - main driving area with red bricks in front of the library and KS watched her follow a man to his car while trying to talk to him. KS then went back out and talk to the woman who was back standing in the the roadway. KS said "Hi again. I'm here again because we need you to not stand in the parking lot or parking places." She said "I"m not doing that, I'm staying here." - still in road but near the parking partitions with rocks. KS said "ma'am, I watched you follow a man in a red shirt to his car while he was walking away from you. You were in the middle of the parking lot and in the parking places, and right now you are standing in the road." The woman said it was her 1st amendment right to be here. KS said, "Yes. and you get to talk to a lot of people standing by the library in the petition passing spot, but the parking lot or road is not safe and you could get hit by a car." The woman said she would stay off to the side - KS looked at her feet. The woman then stepped up into the rock area, and asked if she could stand here. KS said as long as she is not in the road or parking places or following people to their cars. 
For the rest of the day the woman when back between the petition passing spot and the spot in the rocks by people's cars.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Description:
Biohazard material was found in the family restroom before opening, including fecal matter, blood droplets, and other stains. Restroom is locked and out-of-order signs are posted on the door. Facilities request was submitted for biohazard cleanup.
Update 3/25/2024 4:32pm - Bathroom has been cleaned and is reopen to the public.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description:
Two petition passing women were sitting out front. A woman yelled for help behind them on the sidewalk. She collapsed going to her hands then knees. They helped her sit down on the sidewalk and she asked them to call 911. She said she couldn't breathe, and this had never happened to her before. They called 911 and stayed with her. The paramedics arrived after a few minutes. They assessed the woman and gave her oxygen. She did not end up going with them. She called her office and family from her phone. 
One of women who was petition passing walked the woman back to her office to make sure she got back safely. Library staff did not know until a petition passer came to tell us once the firetruck and ambulance had arrived that a woman had collapsed, and they called 911 for her. Librarian III KS asked the remaining petition passer what happened as the paramedics were leaving and so was the woman with the other petition passer. KS also asked if the woman had tripped/fell or injured herself and the woman said "no" and described what happened (above).

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal
Description: Woman came into the library with a seemingly well-behaved dog, who was wearing Service Animal gear. While the woman was looking at books the dog pooped on the floor. Staff member LA NG saw it and while the woman was trying to clean it herself, staff went over with paper towels and a spray bottle for the smell. The woman's dog was not asked to leave, but stayed for a couple more minutes then left. Patron did not alert staff. When Librarian GT came back from lunch she reported it as a Bio Hazard Facilities Request. Cleaning crew came out close to 5pm and took care of it.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Children in the Library
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others~Children in the Library
Description: Andrew was rapping loudly for an extended period while on teen computers and creating a disturbance for all others using the library. At a point the lyrics became very explicit. When LIII TFL was done helping another customer she approached and asked that Andrew refrain from using such explicit language, Andrew stated he was rapping. TFL stated that the language needed to stop, whether in song or spoken form. As she returned to the desk Andrew continued, becoming louder, and the other teens created more disturbance laughing at him. At this point TFL approached and let Andrew know that today didn't seem to be working out and that he could return tomorrow. TFL returned to the desk and Andrew remained in the teen area. After a couple of minutes TFL let Andrew know that he needed to leave. He continued to respond verbally but did not leave. TFL let Andrew know that at this point he had violated the code of conduct in multiple ways and would be taking a break from the library for the remainder of the week. Andrew still did not leave the library at this point. TFL stated that at this point he had been asked to leave multiple times and needed to do so. TFL stood behind Andrew as he exited, yelling repeatedly "don't follow me miss" but heading for the exit. Andrew and group exited, continuing to create a disturbance as they left.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: Page BW reported to L3 KK that two men were loudly reading the Bible in the cafe section.  KK could hear the men from the computer lab.  As KK approached, one of the men made a comment about women's "tits."  KK asked if they had just said "tits."  The younger of the two smirked and said that they hadn't said tits but rather he was talking about women's nipples.  KK made the men aware that the conversation was not appropriate and that their volume was too loud.  The men said that KK couldn't stop them from reading the Bible.  KK made them aware that the Code of Conduct prohibited offensive language and that their volume was disruptive.  KK asked them to move into the study room.  The men ignored KK and continued talking loudly.  KK asked the men to leave for the day.  They did not comply and continued to be loud.  KK asked Guard JD to go over and ask the men to leave.  JD was able to get the younger man to leave but the other said, "You'll have to call the police to get me to leave."  KK called 911.  At closing, the man was the last person in the library. KK made the man aware that the library was closed.  The man initially was laughing and saying "What? What?" as if he could not hear.  He has done this to staff in the past in an effort to make them shout.  KK pointed to the door. The man said he was like Ernest Hemingway and asked KK many questions about Ernest Hemingway.  KK did not engage in the conversation and again repeated that he needed to leave.  The man made some insulting remarks to KK but finally left.  Staff cancelled the 911 call.

Description:
3/26/24- At 10:07 Ruben was approaching library property when VetSec MM identified him as a suspended patron and reminded him that he is not allowed in the library. Ruben then pulled out two shards of green glass. He then began to walk on the north side of the library near the Head Start facility. VetSec MM returned to the library to make staff aware of the events. As LA CR called 911, VetSec MM witnessed Ruben attempt to enter the nearby school Drachman Montessori. The library was instructed by police to go into lockdown and the Head Start facility and Drachman were instructed to do the same. Police responded at 10:22. They spoke with Ruben. Due to not having video or direct witnesses from the window vandalism incident, the police released Ruben. [L1MG]
Ruben often exposes himself to guard MM, SRO Staff, patrons, and community members. [L2HS]
Reference Police Report #P2403260113
Reference PITS#0000023236

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: At 4:16 library page CS reported to VetSec MM, L1 MG, and L2 HS that she had found drug paraphernalia consistent with opioid use near standard computer 9. Upon reviewing security footage, an unknown patron entered the library at 3:28 and approached the area. He sat in the chair at the computer until exiting the library at 3:52. Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: writing on computer screen/computer station walls
Description: At 11:40 am LII IC JM responded to a phone call from Vet Sec guard JT who said there was an issue on the 1st floor. LII IC JM and Vet Sec guard JT met and walked over to public computer #18 and saw writing in blue marker on the computer screen and on the right side of the partition wall between computer stations. Vet Sec guard JT retrieved Clorox Wipes and succeeded in getting the marker removed from that computer station. LII IC JM reported to the 1st floor circulation desk what was discovered to LTA NG and LA MG. Vet Sec guard JT then saw patron Melissa Hermosillo sitting at the computer station to the left of computer #18 and observed blue marker writing of that computer screen #16 as well. Vet Sec guard JT saw that the patron had a blue marker. The only other item observed to be marked up with the blue marker was a plastic covered "Town and Country" magazine that underneath the plastic cover the word "Exam" was written. All other items in the computer station occupied by patron Melissa Hermosillo belonged to her. Vet Sec guard JT and LII IC JM approached Melissa at the computer station #16 told her that she cannot write on our computers or furniture and asked her to leave. Melissa said that she didn't understand why she could not write on the computers. She grabbed her belongings, took the marker with her and left the building without further incident. She left a small book that does not belong to the library and a plastic bag that had blue writing in marker on it at the computer station #16. Patron will be suspended for 2 weeks.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.5 Indecent exposure, public indecency, lewd, other sexual offense    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description: At approximately 10:30AM LA KV and Library Tech DR notified LTAS IC KFW that a suspended patron was urinating outside of the children's room emergency exit. Their silhouette was clearly visible through the frosted glass. LTAS IC KFW went outside to talk to the patron. Upon arriving the patron was still standing over the puddle of urine, KFW asked patron if someone had been peeing out here to which the patron replied "You can't prove it was me." and quickly walked away. KFW went back inside to grab their suspension paper work from the day before, patron stood in the doorway yelling into the library that she knows not to come inside but encouraging staff to come outside in a threatening manor. Before KFW could return with the suspension paperwork guard J warned her that if she didn't leave we would have to call the police. At this point patron left Jacome Plaza. After discussion with the Vulnerable Pops librarian we decided patron will be suspended for 3 months.

At 12:45 pm, a semi-regular patron inspected the bags, peered into the front door, and wrapped the bags in a large piece of fabric and left the property. SRO staff do not know the patron's name. Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: public nuisances dangerous to the public health per ARS 36-601~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description:
Around 3:20pm Library staff FC notified in-charge staff IR that Library User David Rivera had laid out trash and food on the floor in the library computer area and was disrupting the use of the space by other customers. IR walked over to the affected area and let David Rivera know that the items would need to be picked up off the floor, she brought two unused plastic bags for him in case he needed extra storage for his items. David Rivera stated "Yes, I know I'm packing up and I'm leaving already" and waved IR off. His speech was slurred and his gait was unstable.
After almost 10 minutes, at 3:30pm IR and FC approached David Rivera again. FC had compiled additional information for social services that David Rivera might be able to access for housing, and mental health and offered these to him, which he did not take. David Rivera continued moving things around on the floor in front of computer 30, but appeared to be having issues with mobility and balance and was not making progress consolidating his materials into the bags. At this time FC pointed out to IR that a paper soup cup in the area with is trash and belongings was of dark muddy complexion and appeared to be the main source of the strong scent of adult human bowel waste that permeated the area. There was also a second soup cup with dark liquid set next to the cup with the bowel waste. IR offered to finish throwing out the trash so that David Rivera could step outside, but he indicated "no, that's not trash, these are my things" and continued to move his small items around on the floor without making progress at consolidation.
TPD special duty officer JP walked over at 3:36 to provide backup support and stood by as David Rivera finished packing his items. IR and TPD SDO walked with David Rivera as he exited the library at 3:38pm and IR let David Rivera know that he was suspended, but could come back in a few months if he needed to check how much longer his suspension was for.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.1 Manipulating or bypassing library rules, such as computer use    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description:
At approximately 10:10AM LTA Supervisor SS was made aware that a group of people were setting up at the entrance of the library. LTA Supervisor SS addressed the group letting them know the library only has one designated Petition Passing Location (which was already occupied.) LTA Supervisor SS let the group know that they could relocate to another area or come earlier the next day to claim the designated Petition Passing location. The group refused to move/relocate. LTA Supervisor SS told the group they could contact Library Administration, their response was “Library administration could call us.”
LTA Supervisor SS and LI RW then made in charge L1 BT aware of the situation. LI BT approached the group reiterating and citing the BOS Policy D 32.11. L1 BT also gave the group contact information for Library Administration. The group continued to argue and ask questions, LI BT repeatedly told them to contact library administrators for questions/concerns. LI BT firmly let the group know they were trespassing and 911 would need to be called to have them removed from the premises. The group told LI BT that they too were calling 911.
LI BT called 911 stating that a group was trespassing and would need to be removed from the library premises. Sherriff K Gomez arrived shortly around 10:30AM. LI BT and LI RW spoke with Sherriff K Gomez about the situation. LI BT and LI RW provided the sheriff with information regarding the designated Petition Passing Location as well as the BOS Policy D32.11.
Sherriff K Gomez spoke with group informing them that they needed to leave or relocate to another spot. The group continued to refuse to leave and cited their first amendment rights. Sherriff K Gomez contacted the Sherriff Supervisor and ultimately allowed the group to stay.  
Sherriff K Gomez debriefed LI BT stating that they tried their best to remove the group but because they are in a public space they would be allowed to stay as it is their first amendment right. Sherriff K Gomez recommend LI BT contact OV Legal at 520.229.4760. A case number was created for the situation: V24031252.
 
Update: LII SMY followed up with the group at 12PM. LII SMY let the group know that from now on they would need to use the designated petition passing location. A man from the group named Craig agreed to the new change.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description: Regular patron Sylvia was in the cafe with her dog when a patron reported that the dog had snapped at him. The dog will no longer be allowed in the library due to behaviors that are not aligned with proper service dog behavior. The dog is very small and we have had difficulties with it growling at staff and other dogs before. The patron said that it tried to bite him but did not cause harm.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description:
Approx. 10am, LA WB alerted in-charge Librarian II AD to the fact that two petition passers on opposite sides of the same issue had taken up residence in the plaza. He wanted in-charge staff to be aware since this situation has caused friction in the past.
Approx. 10:20am, a woman from the pro-life table came up to LA KK to ask about boundaries. She complained that people from the pro-choice table were approaching patrons and blocking them from approaching her pro-life table. LII AD came out and spoke with both groups, asking them to stay in the general area of their tables. Both groups agreed.
Approx. 10:30am, the same woman from the pro-life table returned to the library, complaining that the folks at the pro-choice table were still exiting their designated area and coming too far into her space. She further stated that one of the men from the pro-choice table had approached her table and "gotten in her face and yelled at her". LII AD printed both the petition passing policy and the code of conduct (a copy for each group). AD handed the woman her copy of the documents and discussed the contents with her, and let her know that AD would be observing so that they could address any specific behaviors. LII AD and LA WB went outside and observed both tables from the breezeway. After a few minutes, the same woman approached, again complaining that earlier that morning, the man from the pro-choice table had yelled at her. AD let her know that the man would be told to interact respectfully.
LII AD and LA WB then went over to the pro-choice table, handing them the petition passing policy and code of conduct. AD then clarified for both groups that the area between the prickly pear fruit statue and the beanpod statue must be kept clear for patrons to walk, including the entire breezeway into the library. AD further instructed both groups that they must stay in the vicinity of their tables, because tables must be attended at all times, per the petition passing policy. AD explained that patrons needed to be free to walk unimpeded and that the library wanted both groups to have an equal chance to share their information peacefully. Again both groups agreed.
For documentation purposes only. There seems to be friction between the two groups and we expect both groups to be back, especially in the run-up to the election (the pro-choice table are already regular petition passers at GLF).

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description: At 3:40pm the fire alarm went off at QUI.  At the time there were high winds blowing dust.  LM talked to the fire department--they sent out their truck immediately.  They came to QUI and turned off the fire alarm.  There is no indication that there was a fire.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property

They managed to bend the metal plate covering the latch. The other patio door looks like it may have been pried a little too, but that one is visible via the cameras, and the other is not. Both doors still function.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.4 Bullying per Pima County B.O.S. Policy D 23.1.    1.1.9 Trespassing    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.1 Manipulating or bypassing library rules, such as computer use~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Green - Low Impact
Description:
During the last hour of the day, a large group of teens was being disruptive and loud on the 1st floor, shouting profanity and playing browser games on the catalog computers. L1 MB asked them to stop and let them know that the teen area on 2nd floor was available and might be more comfortable; the teens laughed at MB and ignored her. The teens then began to harass Guard A. They shot several rubber bands at her and called her an "ugly midget" and a "tiny ugly man." When Guard A grew visibly upset at this, they laughed and started running around saying she was going to attack them.
LIC CS and Guard J came down and spoke to the teens, who denied any wrongdoing. CS asked all of them to leave. The teens were argumentative and continued to play games on the catalog computers. One teen pulled up pictures of young children on his computer and shouted sexual innuendos about them. As CS was speaking to one of the teens on the computers, the other teens snuck by her and ran up the stairs. They came back down a minute later of their own volition.
At this point, CS and Guard J managed to herd the teens outside, where they stood for several minutes shouting abuse at Guard A (who was still inside), accusing Guard J of calling them the n-word, and telling CS that they would be back tomorrow. They split up and began running in and out of the various automatic doors, shaking their hips suggestively at Guard A before running back out again. When CS pulled out her phone to call the police, they ran off across the plaza while still laughing. Two teens split off to shove rocks and garbage into the book drop on their way out.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
Greg from Friday was back and set up in an area that is not designated for petition passing. Librarian III KS went to speak to him and started by saying "Hi! I'm Kaitlyn..." He said "hello". KS said "Perhaps you do not know, this is no longer a petition passing location." He said "Oh, you must have not been here on Friday. I do know and the cops came. The cops told me that I could be here so I decided to come back." He brought up that it was the first amendment that said there must be  two locations for petition passing, KS asked him if he could let her know where she could find that information, and he said he didn't know. KS, "Sir, I don't believe it is a law that we are required to provide two petition passing locations in case it comes up in the future". KS told him that she was asking him to relocate for the day and if he did not, he would be considered trespassing. He said "okay". 
Librarian II SYM also spoke with him later as he told her on Friday that he agreed to use the designated petition passing location in the future. He told her that he changed his mind because the "cops" said he could be there and the "cops" told him that the library could not enforce the policy of where people are set up.
Librarian III KS brought him the policy later and let him know that she did speak with the Town of Oro Valley, and having designated spaces was enforceable and she would be meeting with OVPD so she wanted to give him the opportunity to relocate to the designated area or another area not right in front of the library, sidewalks, or parking lot. He said he would think about it. She let him know that she was asking him to leave for the day for failing to comply with a staff member's request and it would be recorded.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Green - Low Impact
Description:
LII IC JM received a call from Vet Sec Guard JT that several teens who were involved in harassing behavior towards Vet Sec Guard A at the library the previous afternoon were outside the building. Vet Sec Guard JT told the teens as they walked in the library that we had a surprise for them. The teens proceeded up the stairs to the 2nd floor and gathered in the doorway outside of the 2nd floor men’s room. Several went inside the restroom and 2 of the youth from the incident were met by LII IC JM and informed that several of them are suspended from the library for 3 months following as a result of that harassment. Vet Sec Guard D came up the stairs and entered the 2nd floor restroom to tell the group they needed to come outside to talk to library staff. Vet Sec Guard D noticed that the teens were vaping inside of the restroom. All of the boys came outside to the 2nd floor landing and began asking why they needed to leave, and why they were suspended. The boys, a few currently suspended, and some not suspended began arguing with both Vet Sec Guard D and LII IC JM about the suspensions. Vet Sec Guard D informed the boys that they had photos of them from the previous day’s incident and the boys began asking to see the photos. They were informed by LII IC JM that they could pick up their suspension paperwork at the guard station on the 1st floor, but that they were not going to be shown the photos captured from library cameras. Vet Sec Guard D stayed on the second floor and LII IC JM escorted the boys downstairs to the guard station. Vet Sec Guard JT gave three of the boys their suspension letters. The boys again argued about wanting to see the photos from the previous days incident and they began using abusive language towards Vet Sec Guard A, and also Vet Sec Guard D who was up on the 2nd floor balcony. Several of the boys were taunting Vet Sec Guard D by calling him a “nigger” and trying to get him to come down to the first floor to fight. Vet Sec Guard A and her son E were on the 1st floor and the boys also began taunting E and calling him a “nigger” trying to get him to come outside with them to fight. Vet Sec Guard JT manages to get the boys to leave the building, but they walked back towards the door a few minutes later to argue with her again.
Vet Sec Guard JT calls the police to report that two 3 of the youth were just served their paperwork, and were not exiting the library as they had been asked to do by staff and guards, and that they were trying to start fights with the two of the Vet Sec Guards and another teen, E. Vet Sec Guard JT asked the police to come as soon as they could and kept the call open by text with TPD. When the teens saw that Vet Sec Guard J was going forward with calling the police they ran outside to the plaza. LII IC JM proceeds upstairs to speak with Vet Sec Guard D and LII CS. A few minutes later Vet Sec Guard D and LII IC JM come down to the first floor to check the perimeter of the building and confirm that the youth had moved on. The three guards gathered with LII IC JM and LIII MS on the first floor waiting for Tucson Police to arrive.
About 10 minutes later Vet Sec Guard D walked across the plaza to retrieve the flag as part of his duties and was confronted by 4 of the youth. Vet Sec Guard JT, looking out from the library doors alerted Vet Sec Guard D that youth were approaching him. Vet Sec Guard JT is then joined by LIII MS and they both walked out to the plaza on the flagpole to speak with the group and prevent a fight. Vet Sec Guard JT and LIII MS tell the group to “back off”, leave Guard D alone, and leave the premises. The youth began balling up their fists, and they began jumping towards him as if trying to initiate a fight with Guard D. LII CS called the police from the 2nd floor balcony to update them about the confrontation on the plaza. The group of teens then ran away from the plaza as officers arrived at to talk to Vet Sec Guards and library staff members. Vet Sec Guard D and Guard JT were able to properly fold the flag in front of the library. LIII MS, and LII IC JM head back inside to help close the library by 6pm
The police took a report from Vet Sec Guard A, gave her a report # and told her that if the group comes into the library again, we should call the cops and give the report #. Vet Sec Guard J closed out her call with the police at 6pm.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating
Description:
Delivery Driver GE reported that he had been maced by two unknown women in the parking lot. He reported that the two women were following another lady, yelling and threatening her, as he was preparing to exit his truck. He yelled out at them to leave her alone, and one of the two women pulled out mace and sprayed him directly in the face. The two women then began running North on Sixth Ave. GE immediately contacted his supervisor and reported the incident to staff on-site.
The third woman initially being harassed had already walked quickly away as GE distracted the assailants.

Description: At 12:24PM, LTA Sup SG and LTA YM witnessed a customer watch her leashed service dog have runny poop onto our carpet by the holdshelf. The customer, after seeing her dog do this, continued to walk to our computer lab to use a computer. LTA YM got L3 KK. L3 KK approached the woman to let her know that we witnessed her dog do this and that service animals need to abide by our library policies. The woman said “I’m leaving” and slowly gathered her things and left the library with her dog. L1 JM contacted facilities to come clean up the mess and L3KK put up cones near the spot. We’ve had issues with this patron in the past when they have left their dog unattended while the customer went shopping. This is for documentation purposes only.

Restroom was locked and janitor was informed. This is for documentation purposes since this is the second incident of this type.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.10 Creating tripping hazards, blocking aisles, exits, entrances    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: Minor Patron Anthony was asked to leave for the day due to failing to comply with library staff about disruptive behavior.  On their way out through the west door, Anthony shouted something that Guard CS and LTA DM couldn't understand and threw a cup of applesauce against the cement floor outside of the west entrance, and before leaving library's property picked up the cup of applesauce and threw it at the door splatting the applesauce left in the cup against the glass.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
Around 9:03 an information sharer/petition passer checked in at the desk with Librarian I BT, she told BT that she was not going to set up in the petition passing spot since yesterday her group did and another group arrived and were not in the petition passing location. BT let her know that we let the other group know the policy and the did not follow it. The woman told us since we can't enforce it, that she was going to do what she wanted. She said she "wanted to know the rules and she was a rule follower" during this conversation, and that she was aware that the library "was in talks with the police" regarding petition passing locations. She asked for BT's name and left.
Around 9:15 Librarian III KS noticed a group setup in the wrong spot, and thinking it was perhaps different people that did not talk to us, went outside. When KS got there, she realized it was the same woman who spoke to BT at the desk. KS said "Oh, I was coming out to let you know that we had gone down to one petition passing location since it changed recently." The woman who was sitting next to another lady said she knew but yesterday we did not enforce that with another group. LIB KS said that "we did speak to the other group yesterday and they moved more than once at our request; it sounds like they continued to come back in front of the library after we had already talked to them..." The woman said they did and if we can't enforce our policy that she doesn't have to follow it. KS let her know that we can politely tell people our policy and, no, library staff cannot physically remove anyone from the premises, so it was up to them if they were going to be respectful and follow our policy, and the library staff could continue to provide direction in following the policy.
The other lady with the woman said it was too hot in the other location, so she wanted to stay. KS said, "I've let you know our policy and we appreciate your cooperation and respect. Have a good day." The woman that has been at the library several times and talked to KS repeatedly then asked for KS's name, which she gave her as well as her title. KS then went inside. The group is still there as of 11am.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description: Guard K alerted LIC MB to someone bathing in the 1st floor men's restroom. K asked multiple times for him to leave the restroom, and it took about 10 minutes for him to comply. K also reported water all over the floor, requiring the bathroom to be locked for cleaning, and reported that the man had stripped down to his underwear in the sink area. When he came out, MB told him that he could not use the restroom for bathing, and that he needed to have clothes on when outside the stall. The patron may have had difficulty understanding English, but apologized. He was asked to leave for the day.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Staff reported that Herman punched Justin and this was followed by a loud verbal exchange that included "nigga" and "bitch" multiple times. LIII TFL approached and spoke with both parties about appropriate library behavior. Since both are regulars, she asked whether they felt this was ok behavior in the library. Both acknowledged that it was not. LIII TFL asked them both to leave for the day and explained that violence is never tolerated in the library. Justin was concerned Herman would hurt him after leaving so TFL accompanied him outside. Other kids began to join Justin and he left in a group of three. It appeared they may all take the same bus, so TFL asked the guard to keep an eye and alert her if any the re-engaged or any further physical fighting erupted.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Racial Accusations
Description:
Around 1:05 a patron approached the front desk and asked DS for help with printing documents since LTA Sup GG was standing next to her and offered to assist. While coming around the front desk GG was then approached by another patron African American about 6ft wearing tan pants, black shirt, black and green bucket hat. As he approached GG, he then said, “Hey I heard you the other day, you said you hate black people.” GG replied, “I never said that” then he continued to accuse GG of saying that while taking his seat on the chair next to the charging station. GG then proceeded to help the first patron with the copy machine. When GG was done, He asked L.A. DS if she recognized him, and she said no. DS told GG to let L1 DW know of the situation. When Branch Manager LG returned from lunch, GG let her know of the situation and she replied that this patron has accused staff and security in the past of racial slurs. She also said, “if we leave him alone, he’ll be fine, but it would happen again in couple of weeks.” This occurred about 2 hours prior to incident 0000023312
 
https://pimapits.quipugroup.net/index.php?qfdo=Incident%20Report&qfsubdo=Retrieve%20Report&incidentId=23312

Description:
LIC MB was alerted to suspended teen Unknown_6776_04/02/2024 from incident 0000023299 coming towards the library from the plaza. He was accompanied by (number) other teens, who were not (?) involved in previous incidents. MB and Guard S moved to the doorway to stop the suspended customer from entering the building. One older teen entered, turned around to check if the others were following him, then went back outside. A fight broke out quickly between 2 older teens in the group of 3 and the group of younger teens just outside the doors. The person who came inside landed several blows on the face of a younger teen. needed:

police response time & case number
photos
suspension letters
more details on who did what punching if possible
was the kid who got punched real bad Unknown_6785_04/03/2024 from Tuesday?

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description: Mr. Drake called while LTA A.O. was on phones.  He immediately stated that A.O. would probably need to escalate this to someone higher up.  A.O. said ok, but what was the call in reference to so that he would know who to escalate it up to.  Mr. Drake responded by saying that he had been trying to reach someone but the phone kept going to voice mail. and that only "Filipinos, Asians and Hispanic women" ever got jobs anymore and whoever he needed to talk to was probably one of them.  A.O. quickly realized that Mr. Drake was becoming animated, put him on hold and got Mgr. KW.  K.W. asked Mr. Drake how she could help him, and he asked if she was the head of the library to which she said she was of this library, and how could she be of help. He mentioned that he had tried to call multiple times but couldn't get through and that Infoline was unable to understand his needs. He said that only  "women of Filipino Asian and Hispanic heritage" got jobs anymore and nobody would answer his call. KW said "please don't talk to me that way, and how can I help you with a library question?" He kept saying racist, derogatory statements all including "Filipino, Hispanic and Asian women" and the ability to get jobs over other people.  Every time he started talking about that, KW would say that he needed to stop speaking to her in that manner so that she could help him. He  finally let her know he was calling about an ILL which she confirmed for him and he finally he finally mentioned a previous PCPL employee from the 4th floor who had nothing to do with ILLS, and one who does, as people who I should direct to call him and hung up.  A few minutes later he called back to say that he had been destroyed by a Filipino/Hispanic/Asian woman who broke his heart, cost him millions of dollars and ruined his life and that was why he had talked the way he had in the previous conversation. KW responded that she was sorry for his unhappiness but that he could not talk that way to library staff. It turned out that he had only placed the ILL the day before the call and we were never really sure what his phone call was in reference to.  This is for documentation purposes only as he had interacted with a COL employee to place the ILL, been very racist in his conversation with both A.O. and K.W. and had also interacted with Infoline.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating
Description:
At 2:45.55PM, a group of 3 (Stafford students) middle school aged youth can be seen on camera 2 approaching the library from the south, followed by three larger teenage youth, about 30' behind. The first group approaches the library entrance at which point UNK#6793(previously suspended, grey T-shirt) hangs just outside the awning aware that he has been suspended. The other two youth UNK#6794 (brown hoodie that reads "hell yeah") and UNK#6795 (dressed in black, with black and red shark backpack) rush into the library and up to the 101 space to rally UNK#6796 (fluffy edgar cut, dressed in black, red and white backpack) for reinforcements, announcing in the 101 Space that there was going to be a fight. Meanwhile UNK#6793 talks with the three teens just outside of the planters. At 2:48.16 UNK#6796 and UNK#6794 exit the library, crossing paths with the three older teens. UNK#6797 (Tall, grey hoodie, black backpack worn in front) enters completely and turns near the express computer wall to face the door. UNK#6798 and Ethan enter shortly after and meet up with UNK#6797. Guard S and In-Charge MB's attention is drawn to the entrance, with the middle-school youth walking off. UNK#6796 turns and heads back toward the entrance and the older teen in grey UNK#6797 steps out and they exchange blows.
UNK#6798 turns and tosses his backpack to Ethan who catches it and steps back. UNK#6798 steps into the melee. All SIX youth take some part in the fight.
 
LIC MB was alerted to suspended teen Unknown_6776_04/02/2024 from incident 0000023299 coming towards the library from the plaza. He was accompanied by (number) other teens, who were not (?) involved in previous incidents. MB and Guard S moved to the doorway to stop the suspended customer from entering the building. One older teen entered, turned around to check if the others were following him, then went back outside. A fight broke out quickly between 2 older teens in the group of 3 and the group of younger teens just outside the doors. The person who came inside landed several blows on the face of a younger teen. Guard JT called 911 while MB and Guard S attempted to initiate lockout procedures. The fight broke up shortly and everyone involved scattered.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating
Description: African American male began yelling "Stop fucking looking at me like that" at our page AT who was sitting behind our customer service desk.  DS immediately jumped up and put herself in between the male and AT, and told the man to stop yelling at her and he needed to leave. The male again said "I will not stop and she needs to fucking stop looking at me like that", and spit at her.  The suspect left the library and headed east.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: Threat to damage library property
Description: Around 10:30 patron known to staff as Tammy approached LI KN and LTA sup JA at the information desk. She told staff that she wanted to make a complaint about a poster on our bulletin board in the hallway, that the poster was "child pornography". LI KN asked Tammy to show her which poster she was referring to, and when they went into the hallway Tammy pointed to the THMS Q Space Club 3rd Annual Drag Show poster. She again reiterated that it was "inappropriate" and "child pornography". LI KN let her know that she would pass her complaint on to the manager who was out that day, but that anything posted on the bulletin board goes through an approval process and if it was approved it would likely not be removed from the board. Tammy then asked who had approved the poster, to which LI KN replied that she was not sure. Tammy asked if LI KN could get her the name of who approved the poster because she "intends to sue them for child endangerment", a statement she made a few times during the conversation. Tammy also stated that the poster was "inappropriate for children" and that had she come into the library with her children when they were under the age of 11 she "would have ripped the poster down herself". LI KN said she would pass along her complaint. Tammy made no further complaints to staff that day, however LTA sup MB did have to ask her to stop standing on the chairs in the study rooms later that afternoon.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
Sean #2 just returned to the library after a 3-month suspension. He had been using the library for roughly 2 weeks without incident.
At around 2:35pm (while guard was on break) desk staff entered the back room and requested the in-charge person, stating two men were about to fight. LIB 2 KVN went into the library where Sean #2 was yelling profanities at a male computer user (Phillip) and 2 female computer users. Sean had moved toward the lobby area of the library when KVN approached and asked him to leave. Sean #2 acknowledged the request by saying "okay ma'am" and continued to encourage Phil to step outside to "fight him" while calling the female patrons the n-word and other slurs. KVN stepped in front of him to block his line of sight and told him to leave immediately. Sean #2 used his arms to push past KVN without touching her and continued to move closer to the other patrons, escalating his voice and threats. He repeatedly told Phil to fight him outside, while telling the female patrons to "shut up." KVN continued to move in front of him and body-block him from getting to the patrons inside the library, and finally had to raise her voice and say "Outside now." At that point Sean #2 complied and walked outside.
Once Sean #2 left the building (while continuing to yell and say abusive slurs and profanities) KVN asked other staff to grab LIB 3 KW while talking to the other patrons. Phil and 2 female patrons stated that Sean #2 had been at the computers when he started to escalate and make threats toward the female patrons, accusing them of spying on his computer or interfering with his use of the library. Phil stepped in and told him to calm down, which escalated Sean #2 into the fight with all 3 patrons. KVN asked if all 3 patrons were okay staying in the building while the situation was managed, and they agreed.
Sean #2 was sitting on the edge of the library parking lot, so KVN and KW consulted on what to do. KW went outside to help a patron and Sean #2 left the property, appearing to want to avoid confrontation with KW.
Roughly 10min later, staff entered the back room saying other patrons were reporting 2 males fighting in the parking lot. KW went outside with KVN as back-up, and found Sean #2 and Phil ending a verbal altercation in the Golden Corral parking lot after chasing each other, with Sean #2 attempting to re-enter library property. KVN stayed with Phil and directed him to walk with her back inside. Phil claimed he had stepped outside for a smoke break and to "make sure it was safe for his wife and service dogs to leave" when Sean #2 attempted to attack him. Phil ran from him and reported that Sean #2 never made physical contact with him. 
While KVN walked Phil inside, KW instructed Sean #2 to leave the library property and informed him that he is suspended for 1 year for fighting and abusive language. KW had attempted to call 9-1-1, but the connection outside failed. Sean #2 continued to follow KVN and Phil until they turned west on 22nd street to return to the library. 
Sean #2 walked east down 22nd street while yelling aggressive insults at the male patron, including racial slurs, but complied with staff request.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Customer came to the customer assistance desk to report the smell of drugs in the lobby. He believed the smell was coming from the south unisex restroom. Guard JD knocked on restroom door and told the person to hurry up. Customer came out shortly thereafter, saying wasn't in there very long. Guard JD said there was an odor but couldn't say for sure it was drugs. Restroom was locked for the rest of the day as a precaution.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: On Monday, April 8th, 2024, three kids approached the front desk and one of them asked Library Associate DB if he could file a complaint about his friend taking his money from his wallet. It was a confusing conversation with DB trying to get to the bottom of what happened. The kids kept arguing while talking to DB and then concluded that everything was okay, and they didn’t want to file a complaint anymore. In-charge LTA Supervisor RM had heard this interaction with the three kids at the front desk while passing through. It was a busy time of day, so they forgot about the weird conversation until Page MZ brought a wallet she found in the teen section to the front desk. MZ and DB looked for an ID in the wallet and discovered it belonged to a minor. DB had just put the wallet in the locked box when the mother of the wallet's owner called the library. DB answered and the caller said that her son had lost his wallet and she wanted to know if we had found it in the library. DB told the mother we had found a wallet and asked her what her son’s name was. The caller said the correct name of the wallet's owner, so DB told her she could pick it up with a photo ID at the front desk. The mother asked if his dad could pick it up and gave us the dad’s name. The dad came in with his ID and picked up the wallet. RM verified the dad's ID had the right name and then asked him to sign our lost and found log that he received the item. After the dad left with the wallet, the same kids showed up at the desk and the kid who wanted to file a complaint said that his friend Emiliano took the money from the guy’s wallet. Emiliano told RM he had taken the money because he found the wallet. RM was confused because the conversation with them earlier was that Emiliano stole the money from his friend. RM asked the friend if that wallet was his and he said no. RM did not know how to handle the situation from there and told the kids that it was wrong to take the money from a wallet and that the next time you find a lost wallet do not take anything out of it and turn it in at the front desk. On April 9th, RM relayed the situation that occurred the day before to Branch Manager BL. BL noticed Emiliano had reserved a study room when he arrived in the afternoon. BL asked if she could speak to him. He said, Is this about the wallet? BL said, "Yes, can you tell me what happened yesterday?" He admitted quickly that he took $15 from a wallet he found on the table in the newspaper room, leaving the wallet there. BL discussed other choices he could have made at that moment. He offered to give the money back, stating that he didn’t spend it because he “knew you were going to ask for it back.” BL replied that if he gave back the money that would lessen the amount of time of suspension and showed him the Code of Conduct, explaining more about suspensions/behaviors/consequences. He said he comes to the library to meet with a tutor on Mondays and Tuesdays. After discussing the situation with other in-charge staff, BL decided to use this incident as an LRPY opportunity, gave him a verbal warning (explaining suspensions might be the outcome of additional behavior problems), and asked him to write an apology letter using a template in the LRPY folder. He was amenable to this approach and said he’d turn it in next week. BL was able to get ahold of the mother of the child with the lost wallet and she said that she would come in to retrieve the money from the lost and found.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.1 Harassment: Filming or photographing without permission
Description: A first amendment auditor was observed filming inside the lobby while families were entering the space for Storytime. He had a bandana covering his face. Children’s Librarian EG discussed the parameters of filming within the library, letting him know that he wasn’t allowed to film other customers and asked him to be careful of that since there were people moving around the space. She also alerted Branch Manager BL. I came out and asked if I could help him with anything and he said, “So, this is a public space. I know I can film staff. Can I film you then?” while holding up his phone towards me. I said well, not right now because there might be customers coming in the front door behind me and you can’t film customers for privacy reasons. He began arguing about public spaces, saying no one had privacy in a public space. I tried to explain customers still have privacy rights and I gave him a copy of the code of conduct, pointing out the portion about filming, but he didn’t want copies of the statute. He said he was just filming information about the library then moved his phone across all of our flyers and handouts. I said okay, that’s fine and walked away, back over to the desk. He then followed me while holding his camera facing me and said, “Can you tell me about library services?” I asked which ones and he said all of them. I shared basic information check-outs, computers, digital options, and noticed he was getting bored and looking around. I took the opportunity to walk into the staff area and continued to watch him on the cameras. He left the desk area and wandered around the building for over an hour filming every possible paper, sign, and flyer, but seemed to be avoiding people. I was then scheduled on the desk and he came up to ask for my business card, which I gave him. He continued filming in the lobby. At one point a customer came in the door. She seemed to try to avoid him, but it looked like he might have caught her on camera as she made her way through the second set of doors. He then made eye contact with me through the glass, staring, almost defiantly as if wanting me to go confront him. The customer had since started talking with another desk person about getting a card. As I was deciding what to do, other customers came up to the desk needing help. At some point he wandered out of the building. Later in the afternoon, the same gentleman called the branch. Staff transferred the call to Branch Manager BL. I introduced myself and said, how can I help you with your question? He replied that I couldn't since I had been the person he spoke with earlier. Then he hung up. This is for documentation.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: Damaging computer screen
Description:
IC LII JM was notified via Teams that there was damage to public computer #26 on the 1st floor of the library. LTAS KW and LA KV verified that the computer screen had been damaged. L1 BC verified that the damage likely occurred sometime after 2:49pm. Staff at the first-floor desk did not report hearing anything unusual. We are not able to associate a patron with the damage at this time. 
This is for documentation purposes.

Description: Possible bed bug droppings in exterior blue bin book chute Patron identified as CLW and is a STU patron. Book was deleted from system and set aside for inspection.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Red - High Impact (Please click Notifications > Email aliases > Copy Trauma Informed Care Team if your location would like to request group EAP support)
Description: A man using his laptop in front of a public computer began to make comments about another customer who was using the phone at a reasonable volume to page SM as she was performing computer monitoring duties. His comments included "can you do something about her" "can you do something, you are just sitting." Page SM went to get in charge librarian and went back to CM duties. LII KV and LI JB observed and the individual was using a normal voice and the librarians did not deem it inappropriate. After they departed the man became agitated again, began gesturing and implying he was shooting himself with this hand. He then turned to page SM again and said "can you shut her up, if you don't I will." LII KV approached and the man demanded to know whether libraries are supposed to be quiet and asked what an appropriate decibel level would be. As she attempted to respond he spoke over her. She asked what solutions we could offer, attempted to offer a study space or alternatives but the man dismissed her by putting his headphones on and waving her away. LII KV consulted with LIII TFL, who went out to the floor to observe. As LIII TFL observed, a man asked her for computer help and as she helped, the irate man began whistling. When LIII TFL was done helping she approached and attempted to ask the man to stop whistling but he began talking over her immediately and would not allow LIII TFL to communicate. At that point she retrieved a copy of the code of conduct and asked the guard to accompany her to ask the man to speak outside of the computer area. As soon as TFL approached he began yelling and insulting her including calling her an "incompetent disgusting cow" multiple times, commenting on her appearance and saying things that indicate he watches staff activities from the parking lot. TFL stated that he was being asked to leave and would be suspended from all libraries. Guard CS remained nearby as he was shouting and TFL went to dial 911 because he had at that point become belligerent. He remained at the computer arguing with the guard for a few minutes, intermittently screaming about his opinions on the qualities of government workers, got up very violently and while leaving heard someone from the cafe area yell something about him. The man turned to head toward the voice and shoved Guard CS in his attempt to re-enter. He then left the building, entered his vehicle, circled the parking lot and aimed his vehicle at Guard CS as he exited. Guard CS was able to move safely behind the bollards outside the entrance. TPD Officer Nichols followed up by phone at 4:39 p.m. and were provided an image and video as evidence.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: Librarian JD arrived at the branch at 7:45am and noticed an older man sitting on the sidewalk at the corner of library property near the library sign along Wilmot. He was wearing purple paper scrubs  with a clear bag on clothes near him. Immediately Library KB also entered the library asking if JD knew anything about the man who was rocking back and forth as if trying to stand. The next employee to enter reported that he was on his hands and knees. KB called 911 to report that he was standing, but appeared to be very unsteady. Staff feared that he would fall into traffic on Wilmot or into the road used to access the St. Joseph's hospital emergency room. Firemen arrived within 3 minutes and walked him to the hospital.

When Librarian I KB arrived at the branch at 8:00am, she noticed a man in paper hospital scrubs sitting on the sidewalk at the corner of Wilmot Road and the entrance/access road to the library and St. Joseph's Hospital emergency room. He had a bag of belongings next to him. To KB it looked as if he was trying to get himself up without much success. KB was concerned that if he did get up, he would fall and stumble into traffic. He appeared elderly and frail. KB went into the branch and called 911. A firetruck arrived quickly and walked the man back to St. Joseph's Hospital, which entailed a paramedic on each side of the man to hold him up as he walked.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description: LTA supe MB reported that regular patron Oscar had entered the library around 10:35 and was swearing quietly, but it wasn't directed at anyone. Staff made the decision to monitor Oscar from a distance rather than escalating a situation that might resolve itself. Oscar entered the adult area and then went to use the restroom shortly after before exiting the building. A short time later another patron reported that there was a man laying down in the landscaping rocks in front of the building. MB got L3 AG and the two of them went outside to find Oscar laying on his side in the rocks near the solar parking cover. AG asked him if he was ok and if he wanted us to call anyone. He said he was ok. AG then said that we were worried about his safety, and asked him if he could please stand up. AG offered that he sit on a bench in front of the building instead. Oscar said something but it was quiet and difficult to hear over the outdoor noise. AG told him that she couldn't hear him and asked him to repeat himself, which he did not immediately do. He started to stand up, so AG let him know that we just couldn't have him laying down like that for safety reasons. Once he was standing he said something that might have been "I'll cut you down," but again he spoke quietly and we don't know for sure if that's what he said. He then walked away and left library property. Documenting because this patron has a history of saying things that could be considered threatening.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description:
On 4/12 patron John Tripp reserved study room A and asked for a laptop. LTA AD set up a laptop for him, and while she did so he asked her questions about whether she was single and if she had kids. She responded that she did not have kids and he began staring at her, then stood up and physically moved to within a few inches of her, causing her to back up to maintain distance. He then said that he needed to log off the public computer and went to do that while AD remained in the room to finish setting up the laptop. When he returned he said, "I'm really interested in knowing what the life of a librarian is like. Tell me about your daily life. I've always wanted to know." AD did not respond to his question and reported to L3 AG that his conversation and physically crowding her made her feel very uncomfortable.
Today, 4/13, AG and AD were on the desk when John Tripp again came into the library and approached AD to ask her for "the same thing as yesterday." While AD was setting up the laptop AG came and stood at the door to the study room so the patron would see the extra staff presence nearby. After a couple of minutes he needed to get something from him vehicle, and as he passed AD on his way out of the study room he patted her arm and squeezed her shoulder.
At 11:50 He left the study room and introduced himself to LTA GP who was now at the desk. He wanted to shake GP's hand and she reported that he help the handshake for too long. He asked for help with something and came around the side of the desk to stand next to GP, who directed him to go back to the front of the desk to receive help. He then asked GP, " What time do you get off?" GP asked him to repeat himself and he rephrased it and asked what time the library closes. When she told him he said, "I might see you later, then."

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using

Description: A woman asked Page EZ whether there were opportunities for Christians to volunteer at the library. EZ brought the customer to the desk. LIII TFL asked questions to clarify the customer's query and proceeded to demonstrate how she could search for volunteering opportunities of this type. When TFL attempted to clarify whether she was seeking such opportunity at the library the woman did not give a clear answer. As TFL was demonstrating the woman began making comments of a religious nature to TFL, who asked her to refrain from doing so as it was making her uncomfortable. The woman then began to say "repent" and other comments directed at TFL as an individual. TFL repeatedly asked that she refrain and she became more insistent. This went on for some time and TFL then stated that the woman was making her uncomfortable, was not respecting her wishes and that it would be best if she left for the day. The woman continued to direct her religious pronouncements at TFL anytime she spoke and continued to respond with "repent" when TFL requested she head on for the day. This went on for about 5 minutes until she disengaged and left the building.

I can say anything that I want." CM told the patron about the library code of conduct in regard to profanity. The patron then told CM that she couldn't stop him from saying whatever he wanted. MG approached the offending patron, informed him about the code of conduct, and that he would would need to leave for the day. The patron left the premises without incident.

SH saw a youth in a blue shirt and black shorts running across the outside concrete extension of the roof and quickly climbed down a pipe to the ground. Description:
At approximately 5:05 PM, guard Jen called LIC L3 LAF and let her know that a group of teens recently involved in multiple violent and/or threatening altercations at Main had returned to the library and were approaching the building from across the plaza. Teens involved in the following incidents, along with three or four other teens not recognized, were present in the group (around 9-10 teens total). Those the guards could identify are linked in people:
0000023316, 0000023314, 0000023310, 0000023301, 0000023299
The teens stood on the plaza as a group and began shouting obscenities toward guard Jen and telling her to come outside. A teen volunteer who is also another guard's son, was present and fearful for his own safety. The teens outside knew this teen and began screaming, "Bring him out so we can beat his ass". LAF directed guard Jen to call 911 and provided her with a police report number and officer information from previous incident. As Jen made the call, one of the teens approached the doors and entrance and then turned around and the group began coming closer. LAF immediately instituted a lockout of the primary front doors where the teens were centralized. The group moved back toward the wall further toward the center of the plaza and sat there as a group. Jen was on hold for a long period of time with 911 and LAF directed LTA Sup KW to call 911 instead to try to get through. KW was able to get through right away and the police report info, etc was transferred to him to give to dispatch. Dispatch officer delayed the entire process of getting a police presence on site by roughly 25 minutes and kept multiple staff members on the phone, including KW, LAF, and guard Jen, despite the officer being asked for an immediate presence. During this time period, a few of the teens separated from the group and began following an older man down the street in front of the library toward Pennington and were screaming at him very loudly and trailing his heals as though to jump him. Dispatch was informed that the situation was escalating. At this point, more of the group left and followed those who were harassing the individual on the street, eventually with the entire group leaving. After several minutes of the group not returning, LAF asked that the doors be unlocked, and the teen volunteer felt safe enough to leave the library. It was around this time that TPD arrived and took a police report.
