Description: Larry Baker walked into the library and began speaking to Vet Sec Guard D saying very unusual and disturbing things. The man had an orange bottle of Listerine in his hand and drank from the bottle at least once. Larry said that he “didn’t want to live” and that he was going to kill himself or harm others and insisted that he was not homeless. LA MA called 911 from the circulation desk phone and was eventually connected to NAMI crisis. LA MA was told that several people from crisis were on the way but that there was no estimated time of arrival. LII IC JM asked Larry if "he was okay", or if there was an issue we could help him with, needed assistance or if we could call anyone for him. It became immediately apparent that Larry was in crisis and Vet Sec Guard JT joined the group interacting with Larry and he asked if there was somewhere he could sit down. JM pointed out a bench by the front doors, but Larry instead sat down behind the guard station at a table in between the two doors. Larry explained that he had come from La Frontera (behavioral health) that morning and that he was upset with an employee there and wanted to kill them. LII IC JM told the patron that she was "sorry that this had happened to him" and suggested that we call the crisis line so that he could explain more about his situation to them and get some help. The patron stated that if we make him go outside, he would "murder the first person" he saw. The two Vet Sec guards continued trying to keep the patron calm and listening to him talk and Vet Sec guard JT retrieved a bottle of water for the patron. LII IC JM called Mental Health TPD from the IC phone and the dispatcher offered to stay on the phone and to connect her with TPD which took a few minutes. JM confirmed the description of the patron to TPD and the dispatcher stated that police would come as soon as they were available, but that they were having a busy afternoon, and they could not give an estimated time of arrival and said to call back if anything escalated. An employee from Sonora Behavioral Health who happened to be meeting with JM then joined the group interacting with Larry. Larry became more animated as the employee from Sonora Behavioral Health tried to talk with him, throwing his hands up in the air as he spoke loudly repeating the same things reported above. At this point the Vet Sec Guards stepped back and began guiding patrons to go around the 30-minute computer area to continue into the library. The group continued to talk to Larry until he got up from the chair and went outside the sliding glass doors on his own. The employee from Sonora behavioral health walked with him outside to continue talking and Vet Sec guards D and JT stood inside the sliding glass doorway to observe and help guide patrons to the other door that leads down to the parking garage in order to keep the area as clear as possible. The patron came back inside the building on his own and sat down in the chair again and began to threaten to "come back to the library with a molotov cocktail." The outreach worker from Sonora Behavioral Health called La Frontera from his cell phone and put them on speaker phone so that the patron could talk to them about the issue he was having and try to resolve it and he was able to get some information from Larry such as his name and birthdate. The patron stated that no one was going to come because they didn’t care. Larry began hitting his head against the wall and hitting the wall behind him with his fists. He stated again that he wanted to die. LIII M approached Larry and asked that he stop hitting the wall with his fists. Larry got up from the chair and walked outside on his own again and leaned against the pillar outside by the planters and then began to bang his head on the pillar. LI IC AW called back TPD and informed them that Larry was attempting to injure himself by banging his head against the concrete pillar. The NAMI crisis mobile team called the IC phone and told LI IC AW that they were having issues finding parking in the library parking garage and they were asked to move their car. They said they would be there as soon as they were parked. A TPD vehicle responded first and drove onto the plaza at around 12:30pm. At this point Larry had laid down on the ground outside like he was pretending to be asleep. An officer came over to talk to the patron and he was joined by two other officers on bikes. Larry continued talking to the officers using the same language about harming himself or others. The employee from Sonora Behavioral Health helped to inform officers of the detailed he had gathered from Larry and La Frontera. The officers asked that Larry put his hands behind his back and helped him off the ground. An officer said that they were going to get him "some help" and they put him into the back of the police vehicle. At this point two employees arrived from the crisis mobile unit and  joined the officers and the Sonora Behavioral Health employee outside the police vehicle. The patron was taken by the TPD vehicle and NAMI crisis left.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: From the service desk, L1 KH could hear a customer's phone ringing repeatedly. KH went to investigate, and noticed the phone's owner asleep at one of the tables at the back of the library near the serials. The phone began ringing again, but the customer did not wake up. KH asked Guard DT to provide backup while she attempted to wake the customer up verbally and by knocking on the table in front of him. The customer did not respond. Guard DT tried tapping the customer's chair and gently shaking his shoulder. The customer still did not respond. KH returned to the desk to call 911 for the unresponsive customer. While KH was on the phone with 911, the customer woke up and declined medical assistance. KH canceled the 911 call. The customer left the library shortly after.

Description: On 4/16/24 @ approximately 4:30pm it was reported to Branch Manager SH that a youth had vomited in the children's area and was still vomiting in the family restroom. SH checked on the youth, and the youth said their sibling had called their parent to pick them up. The parent asked to speak with SH and informed them over the phone that the child's father would be picking them up and the child was likely feeling the effects of being outside all day for a field trip. The parent refused emergency medical services and said the father would be able to determine the severity of the child's illness. Shortly afterward the youth said they were being picked up and both youth left the library around 4:45pm. A service request was placed to have the restroom and the other affected areas cleaned. This report is for information purposes only.

Description: Around 12:35 patron T. Kimbrough was standing at the self check out with his puppy on a leash writing on a piece of paper.  He had obviously been trying to train the puppy on his way in.  The puppy was behaving and everything was ok.  At 12:36 another patron came in with a large German Shepherd on leash and walked over to the hold shelf and proceeded to check out at the self-check out station right next to Mr. Kimbrough.  The German Shepherd was behaving perfectly, when the puppy barked.  KW and KV were on desk and looked up.  The puppy barked two more times, so KW got up to let Mr. Kimbrough know that the puppy needed to behave like a service animal in the library.  Before she could get a sentence out, Mr. Kimbrough yelled "I know" "He's just a puppy" " it's this big mutts fault" "We were here first, he's just a puppy and he's being trained".  He spoke aggressively toward the patron with the German Shepherd in that he blamed him for bringing in a dog that made his puppy misbehave. He got all tangled in the puppy's leash and almost tripped, so he kicked the leash making the puppy fly off of the ground.  He elevated to a very high level, very quickly and shouted expletives all the way out of the building.  Due to the extreme reaction and heated behavior he will be suspended for 1 week. He later called the branch still upset but was not able to talk to manager KW as she was out on lunch.  He did not ask to be called back.

Description:
An 11 year old child and his 13-year old girl cousin walked up to the front entrance where the Security officer and Special Duty TPD officer were stationed and reported that two young boys had hit him while he and his cousin were using the computers in the lab. The 11 year-old boy was bleeding from his face. The TPD officer had seen two boys run out the door, he walked outside in their direction to follow-up on the report. Library staff stayed with the 11 year old boy in the computer lab while the parents were called.
The TPD officer spoke to the boy in the library and filed a report for the assault. The girl cousin called the boy’s parents to come pick them up. When the parents came to pick up the boy, the TPD officer spoke to them before the boy went home.
The two boys who were participants in the assault are regular library visitors, but their names are unknown.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Security (LH) asked me to confirm if there was a smoky smell in the men's restroom. I approached the restroom and could smell a faint but definite smoky smell in the hallway directly outside. LH and I entered the restroom and found a patron was locked in the stall but there was no smoke emanating from the stall. LH and I waited in the hall and confronted the patron who vigorously denied any illegal activity. LH had me return to the stall to observe if there was any smoke there, but there was no smoke and other than an empty water bottle on the floor, nothing was amiss and there was definitely no longer a smoky odor in the restroom. LH told me we should not incriminate the patron since there was no actionable evidence of drug use. The odor I had detected earlier had entirely dissipated. The patron in question was a bronze-complected man of medium height and medium build with black hair wearing a beige t-shirt who was not unkempt and was well-shaven, in other words he did not look like he slept on the street. However he had a very large cloth bag, like one used for transporting laundry. He seemed composed and didn't seem to be intoxicated.

Description: At 1:45 a patron called the branch asking for services that could help with word. Sub LPV answered and said our computers had Word and the year of the software. Patron then continued to ask questions about help formatting a document and LPV offered tech help to answer questions along those lines. Patron then became agitated that she did not understand what she was asking for. Patron was then transferred to L2 VV. VV Asked what she needed help with, and the patron explained that the library had a program to help her write a legal document. VV clarified that we didn't have a program specifically for legal documents at the public library and asked if she meant to contact the Law Library. Patron became more agitated that she wanted to go to the public library because she knew they had the program she was looking for since she used it before. VV explained that the computers had Word and there were staff available to help with basic formatting but there was no one on staff that could help with Legal documents. Upset at this response Patron demanded to escalate this to the director to find someone who could help her. VV offered to give her the number but warned that other public libraries are not likely to have anyone on staff who specializes in legal documents and to try going to the law library for help on those matters. even more upset at this Patron demanded information on VVs superior so that she may complain about VVs responses and her attempt to pass her off to a different facility. information was given and the patron hung up.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.7.4 Bullying per Pima County B.O.S. Policy D 23.1.
Description:
Sisters Ariana, Sierra, and Mia reported to staff LA NG and L2 KVN on Thursday, 4/25/24 @ 5pm that, on Tuesday, 4/23/24 Joshua, Fnane, and Senad made rude comments and bullied them. It started with Joshua, Fnane, and Senad calling them "furries" and mocking them. After KW told them to cut the conversation and stop talking over the PC rows on Tuesday, Ariana Sierra, and Mia reported that the 3 boys told 8-year-old Mia that 14-year-old Mark (an unrelated boy not in the library at the time) "wanted to put his penis inside her vagina" and then called Sierra and Mia "Black African Monkeys." The girls reported that they did not tell staff at the time because they were worried "staff would not do anything." After the library closed, as they were crossing the street at 22nd street, the 3 boys threw an applesauce at Mia and got it all over her skirt. 
These 3 boys have a history of racial slurs and harassment directed at the girls. Their intention appears to be playful, but the impact is affecting the girls safety in the library, and they have been leaving early in order to avoid walking home at the same time as the boys. The girls reported to their parents who may come to the library to speak with staff.
After getting the report on 4/25/24, KVN instructed the girls to always tell staff when these situations occur, and stated that while there may not be consequences for the events on Tuesday, there will be strict consequences moving forward for discussion of sexually inappropriate topics, racial slurs, bullying, or comments that make them feel unsafe/uncomfortable. The girls reporting that they understand and felt supported.
On 4/26, KVN and NG met with Joshua privately. KVN asked for his version of events on Tuesday, explained that while his intention is playful, it is still hurting the girls' feelings, and that the impact on others matters. I informed him that if there are any more discussion of sexual topics in the library, including about body parts, or any more racial comments or slurs in the library, he will be suspended for 2 weeks. This conversation served as his final warning and he is aware of these 2 rules and the consequence. KW and KVN followed LRPY guidelines in determined duration of consequence.
Fnane and Sinad will have the same conversation with KVN and back-up staff member next week (4/29-5/4)

Infractions: Medical 911~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description: At 8am, L3 KK and LA NG approached a man laying in a fetal position in front of the library.  Man was wearing St. Joseph's Hospital arm bands and said he needed a ride to "Cornerstone" because he was too weak to walk.  Man was groggy and unable to get off the ground when asked to sit on a bench.  KK called Saint Joseph's Hospital Chief Operating Officer Megan Powe who sent security staff to assess the situation.  Security staff arrived within about 5 minutes and then departed leaving the man on the ground.  KK spoke to the man again and he said a car would be coming.  At 8:33a, KK called Ms. Powe again.  She said that a ride was being arranged and she gave KK the Head of Security Pedro Valdez' number to work with him directly.  At 9a, KK was out of the building so LA RG called Mr. Valdez' number and left a voicemail to check on the status of the ride.  At 9:30a, KK called 911 since no ride had arrived.  KK and L1 JD went out to check on the man and he had managed to sit up.  He was asking for water and said that he had been released from St. Joseph's that morning.  He stated that he had tried to walk to Cornerstone (near Speedway and Kolb) but was too weak and had only made it as far as the library. Pedro Valdez arrived at about 9:40a minutes and within a couple of minutes a ride arrived.  The 911 call was cancelled.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description: LIC KLW was messaged that someone on the phone had an ADA complaint. The staff member taking the call needed assistance locating administration’s contact information. KLW went upstairs to assist, said they were familiar with the patron (Brendan) in name and their previous concerns, helped them locate the website, and suggested they give out the general 5600 number. The patron continued to repeat their concerns to staff for another several minutes and then they eventually ended the call. After a few minutes, the same patron called back and said they weren’t able to get through using the 5600 number. KLW took the call this time and let Brendan know that we had the plate that they had previously used to cover a tablet in the Tortolita large meeting room during Our Space and assured him that we could return it to him tomorrow. He then asked where Our Space would take place and KLW let him know that it would be in the Tortolita room. He then started to become agitated and informed KLW that the room was in violation of ADA compliance, and it was giving him vision issues and headaches, and that it was also negatively affecting his partner’s health. He asked if previous branch manager MS was no longer working here, and KLW stated that he was not. KLW informed him of the names of the current branch managers. Brendan continued to become more agitated and began asking if he needed to bring this issue to the Board of Supervisors. KLW informed him that he could contact administration regarding the issue and that she would be ending the call. He repeated himself and that he wanted to bring this up to the BOS. At this point, KLW stated that she would be ending the phone call and hung up.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: L1 KB and L3 KK found a pile of personal items strewn in front of the exterior bookchute at 8am on 4/25.  Security camera footage showed a masked man rifling through a bag at 12:55am and throwing much of its contents to the ground.  L3 KK found a car registration among the items and called the WIL customer listed.  The customer reported that someone had broken into her car across the street.  Customer retrieved her items and reported that some of items of value were missing.

Description: COL staff arrived at 8am and noticed the main sign facing 22nd street had new graffiti. After walking the building, 1 additional Bike Lock sign and the concrete bench (by West Door) has graffiti). 1 sign appears to be missing or damaged.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: For documentation: Patron A was sitting next to the elevators, wanting to be the first one up them when the 2nd and 3rd floors open. Patron B did not know that the upper floors were closed and attempted to use the elevators. Patron A purposely positioned himself between the elevators and patron B and would not let B touch the call button. Patron B began yelling at patron A to let him past, patron A responded by talking about the FBI and NBA, upsetting B even further. Guard J and LTAS IC KFW arrived and separated the two arguing patrons. Staff encouraged the patrons to come and get staff the moment something like this happens and both parties acknowledged that they will in the future.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Description: Brendon and Michelle arrived to the Main Library around 11 AM. L3s LAF and LD were waiting for them in the lobby with the plate mentioned in incident 0000023353, as well as a memo from the health department regarding magnets in the library. LAF gave Brendon back his plate and the memo, which stated that we should provide a space 6 inches away from electronics. LAF explained that staff had a table reserved just for them in Tortolita for Our Space, that more than met this requirement. Brendon said that he has visual issues that are also a problem in Tortolita due to the electronics. He debated and questioned the credentials of the county's director of the health department in the memo that was given to him. Brendan continued on saying that he had spoken with Adelita and that she agreed with him and that she told him she was going to make sure the library had to comply with his request to either remove the electronic control panel in Tortolita or have a metal box manufactured and placed over it. LAF told Brendon that we would not be making any accommodations beyond the reserved table today. LD mentioned that we are following administration's recommendations. Brendon began to argue and wanted a final word on this. LAF called LSM ED-L and filled him in on present circumstance. ED-L confirmed no further accommodations would be made. LAF relayed this to Brendon and LAF and LD gave him ED-L's card to contact him. Brendon began to demand ED-L come downstairs to speak with him. LAF confirmed with ED-L that he was busy in a meeting and unavailable and relayed this to Brendon as well. Brendon continued to press the issue and said that PCPL should get prepared to be sued and told LAF that she would be fired. Brendon accused staff of not caring and not wanting to be partners. LAF reminded Brandon that we do care and that we are trying to help them. LAF told that there was no further need for discussion on the matter, that we would not be making those additional accommodations, and that his statement was disrespectful. She told Brendon that if there was further disruption they would need to leave. Guard J also had walked up at this point and told Brendon he was being rude. Brendon said he was struggling because he was having to stand up and talk with LAF and LD. Both LAF and LD at once told him he could sit anywhere he liked and they could talk with him that way instead if he preferred it. Brendon said he would sit down and wanted LAF and LD to discuss the matter. LAF reiterated the decision would not change. Brendon sat on a bench with Michelle, who had been sitting for the entirety of the interaction. LAF and LD monitored the situation for around 10 minutes, until Brendon and Michelle headed to the 3rd floor. LAF and LD made their way to 3rd and LAF called LIC L2 CS to fill her in. Our Space staff had already been made aware of the plan to speak with Brendon prior to the program and were also prepared to hold the boundary of the reserved table only. Brendon went into Tortolita, stood in front of the electronic control panel while Michelle retrieved snacks, and then came over to the 3rd floor desk to talk further about the issue, while Michelle went downstairs. CS and L2 JM were also there at this point and became part of the conversation. Brendon simply repeated more of the same and said they would not be able to return to Main unless the panel was removed or a metal box was placed over it. As Brendon continued, LAF interrupted and said that there was no more they needed to discuss and that she and LD needed to converse on the matter and that she knew Brendon was busy also. Brendon asked for water, because Our Space had run out, so LAF asked him to meet her on the first floor and she would bring them bottles of water. When LAF met them with the water, Michelle asked if El Rio nurses were available today and she told Michelle yes. Brendon said Michelle would like to stay to see them and asked if that was okay. LAF said that would be totally fine as long as we had no further disruption whatsoever. Brendon agreed and said they did not want that either.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description:
At 12:05 guard AB alerted about a strong odor in the men's restroom.  LTA Sup. JA and in-charge LTA Sup. MB check the restroom and note a patron in the stall but could not determine if drugs are being used. 
At 12:30 MB and JA go into restroom to check on patron again and let him know that in order to keep the bathroom open and safe for everyone else in the building, he will need to finish up soon, within the next 5 minutes. 
At 12:35 MB and L1 KN go back into restroom to remind patron they need to leave. Patron then puts his head above stall and makes eye contact with MB. At this point, MB visually confirms this to be suspended patron Gregory Nelson. MB and KN then alerted patron they are trespassing and need to leave library property, or they will have to call police. 
Gregory starts gathering belongings and staff exit bathroom. KN and MB waited outside bathroom hall to redirect any patrons who might need to use the men's restroom. Gregory comes out of the restroom and holds a finger as to signal to give him more time, then went back into the restroom and shut the door. Afterwards, staff could hear the water faucet being turned on repeatedly. KN then gets cordless phone to begin calling authorities at approx. 1:05. 
While KN was on the phone with the Sheriff's Department, Gregory exited the restroom and argued with staff about his suspension and other things, at one point claiming that KN does not work for the library. 
Gregory exited the building followed by staff, but remained on library property while KN finished the call with police. She provided the dispatcher with a physical description of Gregory. She was informed the officers were on the way, so she ended the call. 
MB noticed Gregory holding what appeared to be items used for taking illegal substances and a lighter and says "And sir, we cannot have that thing in your left hand at our libraries". 
Gregory begins to exit library property around 1:15, heading towards the crosswalk. KN calls 911 to cancel the call. Just as Gregory stepped onto the sidewalk off library property, authorities arrive and see Gregory on the corner of library property. The two deputies speak with Gregory for a few minutes, then placed him in handcuffs and sat him in the back of their vehicle. The deputies left with Gregory around 1:25.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Last week, LTA YM and Guard JD observed a man shouting obscenities as he left the library.  There did not seem to be any provocation for his behavior.  Today, the customer entered the library signed into a computer and then began circling the library.  After a few minutes, he sat down and started using the computer.  SubL CB observed him suddenly yell "Fuck you" and other vulgarities and appear to try to remove his pants.  There was no apparent provocation.  A customer reported that the man began jumping up and down.  Guard JD and L3 KK approached the man.  KK mentioned that it looked like he was having a bad day and asked him to leave for the day.  The customer did not respond.  Guard JD said, "She's talking to you."  KK repeated herself.  After a few minutes, the customer left without further incident.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Children in the Library
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Children in the Library    Children in the Library: Other not listed: Refusing to Comply with Guardian Request
Description:
Lib 2 KVN was told multiple library patrons and a mother were requesting assistance in removing a minor from the library. Lib 1 SG reported that Senad Gebrezgabher entered the library upset and instructed her not to "shut off his PC if his mother asked." Senad was on the PC and his mother, who spoke very little English, was requesting that he leave the library with her. Senad was refusing her request.
KVN sat with Senad and asked what was going on. He told her his mother was lying and that his father was supposed to pick him up. KVN asked the mother if Senad's father was coming and she understood and said "No." KVN was unable to explain to the mother that they could not ask Senad to leave (the mother was in a rush to get to work). The parental concern was the Senad would not have a way home after the library closed, due to the mother being at work and the father not coming. KVN expressed to Senad that he needed a way to get home when the library closed at 5pm and he said he would take the city bus. KVN asked him to tell his mother directly (in their language so she understood) and when he did it caused further argument. Senad was getting more vocal in his argument with his mother and refusal to leave, and multiple student patrons and parents were getting involved and instructing Senad to leave with his mother.
In order to avoid escalation, KVN told Senad he needed to have a conversation with his mother outside the library because he was causing a disturbance. KVN told Senad that she would not force him to leave with his mother, so if after the conversation he decided to come back inside that would be fine. But he needed to take the conversation outside the library. Senad argued a few times until KVN told him he could either take the conversation outside or he would be asked to leave for the day anyway.
After Senad shutdown his PC and started to leave with his mother, he shouted "This is fucking bullshit." He then shouted a few more obscenities. 
Because of his language and arguing with staff, KVN informed Senad that he was not allowed back in the library on 4/27.
At 11:35 the guard informed KVN that Senad had tried to re-enter 3 times, was still on library property, was being physically aggressive with his mother, and was bringing other students from the library outside to help argue his case. KVN went outside to remind Senad where the property line is (that he cannot be in the parking lot) and told him that she cannot make him go with his mom but he needs to leave library property for the day. KVN told the guard if Senad tries to come inside a 4th time then he will receive a 1 week suspension because he has been given multiple warnings.
This PITS report serves to document to staff that the next time this situation occurs, the translation service is needed to explain to the Gebrezgabher guardians that library staff cannot help remove minors from the library.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.4 Sleeping
Description:
On Friday, 4.26.24 between 10am - 11am a woman with dyed red hair and a man with spiky black hair came to the service desk in the morning and aggressively asked LA NG to call 9-1-1 for them. NG tried to ask questions for more information, but the man kept not answering and telling her to call 9-1-1. L1 SG stepped in and learned the incident occurred off library property, prior to the library opening, and was a verbal (supposedly non-physical) altercation that needed reporting. SG directed them to the phone in the café area where the patrons called 9-1-1. 
On Friday, 4.26.24 between 11am - 12pm KVN was asked by LTASup JF to wake up patrons slumped over at the computer. They were the patrons who had made the phone call and were completely slumped over their chairs in unnatural positions at the PCs. KVN tried to verbally rouse the patrons by saying "good morning" and "are you okay?" to which the patrons did not respond. KVN then tapped the back of their chairs and tapped on their keyboard to create vibration. The patrons finally woke up so KVN let them know if they are not using the PC they can move to the café area to sit. The patrons laughed and displayed physical signs of drug/alcohol use (slurred speech, irrational mood, stumbling, unclear eyes) but left the library shortly after KVN woke them up.
On Saturday, 4.27.24 at 2:30pm a patron approached KVN at the desk and reported 2 patrons "drunk." KVN looked over to see the patrons slumped over in their chairs and the PCs in the front row. KVN went to approach them, and tried to verbally rouse them which did not work. Because they had objects on the floor obstructing access to their seats at the PC, KVN tapped the back of their chairs to wake them up. KVN delivered the same message as the day previously, and the patrons displayed the same signs of drug/alcohol intoxication.
However, as KVN walked away the male patron informed her as she reached the desk that she should not "touch him" or "they would have problems." KVN nodded and chose not to respond. The male patron reiterated that he would "throw hands" if she "touched him" again. KVN did not touch him physically, but touched the chair.
KVN did not respond so as to not escalate the patrons because this happened when there was no guard for backup while the patrons were under the influence. Based on the previous day, KVN assumed they would leave the library. The patrons left the library immediately afterward. 
This serves to document a pattern of behavior with these patrons and threats against staff.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress

Description: At 2:28 pm LII DB looked up from the desk to see Mary Pieta standing outside the library entrance lifting one foot after the other in a way resembling someone who is taking aim to kick something. DB alerted LA CS that a second pair of eyes was needed to observe the situation. Both library employees watched as Mary Pieta extended her right arm with only her middle finger raised at them. Mary Pieta then turned around to leave, but quickly retracted, opened the door and leaned into the library building shouting: "I hope you enjoy your time in hell for the lies you are spreading!" She then turned around and walked away from the library.

Description:
Computer user (Person1) reported to front desk staff that his black and white notebook had been stolen from the public computer area when he got up to use the restroom. 
Review of the security footage shows that a man (Person2) who was sitting on the couch behind the computer user walked up to the computer work space when the computer user walked away, and looked through the belongings that were left at the computer desk. Person2 picked up some items from the computer desk and walked back to the couch area. At the couch area, he picked up his luggage and placed Person1's items in his pack. At this point Person2, who was originally at the couches grabbed all his items and made his way to the front door. The original computer user-Person1 came back to computer #24 and did not notice his items were missing until Person2 had left the building.
