Description: L1 JD discovered unattended bags near the staff entrance at 8am.  L3 KK looked at the bags and thought they had blood on them so she looked at security camera footage.  At 2:52am, male 1 pushed male 2 in a wheelchair up to the staff entrance area. A minute later, what appeared to be a women followed them.  As she approached the men, male 1 began punching the female repeatedly in the face and kicking her.  The female responded with kicks and punches.  The three left property at 2:58am.  KK called 911 at 9:18am.  TPD arrived at 9:40a.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Red - High Impact (Please click Notifications > Email aliases > Copy Trauma Informed Care Team if your location would like to request group EAP support)
Description: At 10am LII IC JM was notified by LTAS EB that one of our patrons had been talking to himself very loudly, he had been asked to quiet down multiple times and had been walking back and forth, knocking on the staff door and then going back to the bench outside of the Men's restroom on the 1st floor and sitting down again, continuing to talk to himself out loud at too high of a volume. The library staff are familiar with this patron and had noticed his behavior getting worse over the last few weeks. Staff only knew a possible name, Milton, and that he may have lived in Maryland at some point. LII IC JM decided to call Crisis and she was told they would be there shortly. Two Crisis workers showed up at 10:40am to talk to the patron who was still sitting on the bench talking to himself loudly. The patron refused service from Crisis and said "stop, stop" Crisis informed LII IC JM and LII PP that because he refused service, they couldn't help him, but that they would check in with their supervisor to see what options, if any we may have. LIII LF came down to help with the situation, and offered the patron a snack bag, LA RW got a few cold milks to offer the patron to get him to calm down, and LIII LF offered him two choices, the milk and lowering his volume, or leaving for the day. The patron started talking loudly about the CIA, saying things that didn't make any sense and continued to be agitated and loud. LII LF decided that it was time for the patron to leave and asked him to leave for the day and that he could try to come back again tomorrow. The patron kept saying the same things and would not leave. LIII LF told him multiple times that he needed to leave for the day and he ignored her. LII IC JM called 911 and told them that we had a patron trespassing on the library property and that we had called crisis and he refused help so we needed police to respond to remove him from the library. Police said that they were going to send someone out as soon as they could and that police were responding to another incident at the moment, she was not given an estimated time of arrival. LII LF called 911 again to inform them that the patron was getting more agitated and escalating. The two crisis workers came back to tell library staff that because we didn't have more information from him, like treatment history, name and birthdate they could not take him to treatment against his will. Crisis encouraged staff to tell the police officers when they get to the library that the patron needs to be taken for mental health care. The patron began getting up from the bench and coming to the circulation desk, talking loudly to himself about the CIA and he leaned over the desk toward LTA NG, getting close to her, and then banged his fists on the desk, at which point LIII LF told him to back away from the desk. LII LF called 911 again to let them know that the patron was escalating and that he was impacting the library operations on the 1st floor and becoming potentially dangerous to both staff and patrons. TPD informed her that the incident was being elevated to a level two. One TPD officer arrived on bike an hour after being called initially, got the information from LII LF and went to speak to the patron and ask him to leave. The patron left after a few minutes, being walked to the door by the officer and he stood outside the door asking the officer where he was supposed to go, "the airport." The patron left the library and the TPD officer talked to staff. The patron will be suspended for one year.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.10 Creating tripping hazards, blocking aisles, exits, entrances~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Green - Low Impact
Description: Just before opening the 2nd floor to the public, LIC LII JM was alerted by staff that there was a patron sitting on the floor on the 2nd floor landing outside the bathrooms with all of his stuff surrounding him and reading from a bible out loud. Staff LTA NG said that he had been cussing at people when they looked at him and seemed angry. LIC LII JM went up the stairs to talk with the man and asked the patron if she could speak to him, but he ignored her while continuing to read the bible out loud and telling her not to interrupt him. When he finally put the bible down to talk, LIC LII JM asked him if he was angry about something and he said "yes, I'm angry" and immediately began to accuse her and others of violating his rights and saying he could read the bible if he wanted. Vet Sec Guard D came up the stairs to open the 2nd floor along with LTA NG and asked the man to move his things so that we could open the door. Other Patrons began streaming up the stairs to enter the second floor and LIC LII JM approached the patron again and said "sir, if you cannot calm down you will be asked to leave." The Man gathered his items and went down the stairs to the first floor finally sitting by himself at a chair in front of the 30-minute computers. LIC LII JM followed him down the stairs and kept an eye on him while calling the Crisis line for another patron on the first floor who was in crisis. Two employees from crisis entered the library a few minutes later and the man with the bible left the library on his own without further incident.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal
Description: A woman with a boxer puppy was at the computers and staff overheard the puppy growl at something undetermined. At 12:49 LII KVN notified staff that anything further would result in asking that the dog be removed. The owner of the dog approached the desk with the dog on a leash and began playing with it and picking it up like a baby while waiting. When LIII TFL was available she mentioned that pets are not permitted in the library. The woman stated "I know, he's a service animal" TFL responded that the animal was a puppy and the woman said "he is in training" TFL then stated that the way she and the dog were interacting were not within our expectations of service animals and that the puppy would need to be taken outside. The woman said "don't talk to me like that" and walked away. The woman then yelled "fucking bitch" and TFL said it was time she left for today. The woman said "I am leaving" and began to gather her things. TFL returned to the desk and was helping another customer when the woman walked up and tossed the contents of her bottle all over TFL and the customer service desk area. She then ran out of the building and headed west on a city bus. Guard CS called 911. An officer arrived about 4:00 p.m. to take a report. The woman is suspended for one year.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: a Male patron was sitting near the adult fiction area around 1:30pm. You can see there was a pair of Airpods charging in the corner next to him. He got up and went to the restroom, while Manager MS was shelving close by. The patron emerges from the restroom, and stops at the friend's cart and starts patting his pockets as if he was looking for something. MS asked him, "are you missing something?" Pointing to the airpods that were sitting plugged in on a shelf where he was previously sitting. He says yeah, and packs up the airpods in his pockets and leaves. About 5 min later, another patron comes up to the desk and asks if anyone had turned in some airpods, they were in that back corner. The Patron pointed to where the Airpods were previously sitting. Manager explained that she thinks that they were stolen and suggested him to do a police report, and apologized for the situation. She also let him know that he could securely charge his items in our charging station.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: LIC AW was alerted that two patrons were arguing about a laptop near the front desk. Patron 1 was upset saying Patron EA stole the PCPL Chrome book out of his unattended bag, and now the hotspot is missing. Patron 1 was accusing EA of stealing the hotspot also. Patron EA confessed to seeing the unattended bag and was curious what was inside, took the computer bag out of Patron 1's personal bag and went to the restroom. EA was seen and caught by patron 1, before he put the computer bag down at a desk to leave it behind.  Patron EA said he saw the hotspot but did not take it.  Patron EA confessed to attempted theft. He understands he will not be able to use any library or services for 6 months.  LTA Sup KFW came to support the situation with Patron 1, and made sure he will have access to another PCPL hotspot since this one is now missing.

Location: Frank De La Cruz-El Pueblo Library
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: At about 4:00 p.m. patron Joseph Gleason (21152042370753) approached the front desk asking to offer a replacement book for two titles that had been billed on his account. L1 SG began to explain that replacements needed to be of a similar topic, when the patron interrupted to say that he had been told differently at another branch. He showed the book he was offering as a replacement and L1 SG explained that it could not be accepted due to condition (the spine was broken, etc). The patron became a bit agitated and said again that they had been told differently at another branch, he had  not been aware of the replacement rules, the library wasn't accepting a book he thought was valuable, that L1 SG was creating barriers to him rectifying his account, etc. Eventually LA MD asked that the patron leave because he was speaking inappropriately to staff and leaning forward against the front desk. The patron became more agitated and said he would contact library administration (he did not ask for contact information), and asked for LA MD's name, which she gave. LA MD again asked him to leave and mentioned she would call the police if he did not. The patron left the branch at about 4:10 pm and said that he would be back.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed
Description:
At 9:58am (2 minutes before opening), LIB 2 KVN was walking into the Large Meeting Room when the male patron starting banging on the glass door with his cane and demanding the door open. KVN looked at her watch to check the time and responded through the door "We will open in 2 minutes at 10am, sir" to which the patron shouted "yeah, I'm sure you're really prompt, bitch." The insult was said quieter but still audible. KVN put her stuff in the Large Meeting Room and grabbed Lib 1 SG for backup, explained the situation, and told her because there was not a guard and the patron was continuing to bang on the door with his cane and display aggressive behavior they needed to prepare for escalation as they issued a verbal warning. 
As KVN and SG walked up to open the doors, a female patron outside who was interacting with the male patron banging on the door moved away from him quickly and said "Stay away from me." KVN opened the door and told him "You cannot bang on our door with your cane." The patron responded with a mock salute and said "Yes ma'am. Won't happen again." KVN said "If you continue to break library rules you will be asked to leave for the day." The patron appeared to try to "control himself" by trying to speak and stopping himself several times and grumbling under his breath, said "stop making things worse" and then said "Can I please just come in and do what I need to do?" KVN let him in.
As the rest of the patrons entered, the female patron who had moved away told KVN "He threatened me with his cane too" and kept walking into the library. 
While the patron was inside the library, KVN was at the desk monitoring the situation with PC Guest Passes and his behavior with other patrons and staff. At one point the patron at the copier stared at KVN and audibly laughed in a hysterical, mocking way, which KVN ignored. The Patron left shortly after this.
Both SG and LA NG reported having regular issues with behavior from this patron, included harassment of staff, racism, proselytizing, and ranting.
When LIB 3 TFL re-entered from break, she consulted with the female patron and learned more about what occurred prior to the building opening. When she arrived, the patron made a comment under her breath about the library "running late" (the library opened on time according to library clocks) to which the male patron began ranting about government workers being lazy. He then started to talk about how "God loves her" and bring religion into it, to which she politely tried to redirect the conversation. When he did not stop, she asked him to stop talking to her. He then started pointing his cane at her and repeated told her that regardless of her beliefs "God loves her" and other comments along those lines. That is when she got up to move away and said "Stay away from me," which KVN witnessed and overheard walking up to open the doors. Another, unrelated female patron reportedly stepped in before the doors finally opened and told the patron "She asked you to leave her alone." 
Due to the female patron report and his behavior toward staff today, this patron is suspended for 1 month. He will be served if he uses the library within the next 4 weeks. 
UPDATE 5/4: LIB 2 KVN noticed patron already in library and served patron suspension notice. KVN explained that because of the incident on 5/1 and a different patron's report, the patron had been suspended for 1 month and he could return on June 1st. Patron reported having congestive heart failure and argued with staff member about leaving the library. After looking at suspension notice, patron stated that "rules are meant to be broken." Patron continued to indicate he was cleaning up his items, but was laughing mockingly at KVN and attempting to engage in casual conversation with the guard. Patron pointed to his veterans vest with a PTSD patch and told KVN to "read it." KVN nodded and said that if he continues to not comply with her request and attempt to engage in conversation with others, she will have to call the police to remove him from the building as he is trespassing. The patron laughed again, mentioned "white women" and talked about KVN "standing there like a school teacher" while she waited for him to clear his items. 
After clearing his items, the patron started walking away and said "white women ain't shit," and then pulled guard JQ in close to which JQ reported afterward that the patron said more derogatory comments regarding "white women." As the patron walked out, KVN informed him that because of his comments his suspension would no longer be for just one month, and that if he wanted to know how long it had been extended, he could call back at a later time. The patron stopped multiple times to make casual conversation about the bookbike, told JQ to have a good day, and on the way out the door told an older, white female patron that "white women ain't shit" as she walked into the building. 
After the patron had left the property, NG reported to KVN that during their interaction at the printer this morning, the patron had unprompted said "Did you know there are no white people in the Bible?" 
Due to his behavior, comments regarding "rules are meant to be broken," comments regarding "white people," and the disruption caused to staff and the library environment, this patron has been given a 6 month suspension starting today, 5/4.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description: LA Marisol was walking behind the staff front desk to the staff area in the back when a young man began telling her "Can I some frijoles too".  LA Deanna verbally told him that was not appropriate and to please stop.  He said it a couple of times and went to cafe area to grab his belongings.  He said "He thought she worked here and wanted some frijoles too".  LA Deanna told him to leave for the day and he came back to desk saying "I'm homeless and have no money".  LA Deanna told him once again to leave for the day and he left the library.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description:
Earlier in the day staff reported that Oscar seemed to be having a hard time, pacing through the library, making wide swinging gestures with his arms, and he took our copy of the New York Times Book Review out of the building. It is unclear whether he knew that the Book Review was to be kept here, and staff elected not to escalate the situation in the moment.
At about 2:15 guard AB reported to L3 AG that Oscar had returned and had thrown a couple of pennies at him as he was passing by, as well as mumbling something that AB couldn't understand. L3 AG found Oscar smoking at the property line and told him that it sounded like he was having a hard day, and that he wouldn't be allowed back into the library today because he had thrown something at the guard. AG said he could try again tomorrow. Oscar nodded but did not say anything.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Red - High Impact (Please click Notifications > Email aliases > Copy Trauma Informed Care Team if your location would like to request group EAP support)
Description:
A verbal altercation broke out between 2 male patrons in the café area (unknown cause). LIB 3 TFL and LIB 1 SG went over to the area with the phone and heard an unknown male patron telling patron Ivo Ortiz that he was going to "kill him" and to "take it outside." Lib KV grabbed LIB 2 KVN from the Large Meeting Room, who could already hear the raised voices. As KVN approached, TFL was telling the unknown male patron that the behavior was unacceptable and he needed to leave. Ivo Ortiz remained seated and stared at the unknown patron while he paced, shouted, and made threats against his life. The unknown patron lifted a small potted tree to hit Ivo. TFL told the patron the police had been called and he needed to exit the building. He put the potted tree down. 
The male patron started to gather his items to leave, but continued to yell threats, move toward Ivo, displayed posturing, and escalation despite library requests to leave. Guard CS was on lunch break. Ivo Ortiz got up to follow the male patron into the main library area. Ivo Ortiz made another (unheard) comment at the unknown patron, to which the patron grabbed a book a lifted it to start throwing it at Ivo. Lib 1 MC yelled "Don't do that!" in a very firm manner, which drew the patron's attention away from Ivo. The patron became aggressive toward MC and displayed posturing while making general threats about "killing" to everyone in the library.
KVN was on the phone with 9-1-1 requesting police. The male patron finally left the building but said he was going to stay outside, threatening to wait for Ivo to "kill him" and implied others as well. 
9-1-1 dispatch did not have an ETA on officer response and due to patron threats and escalation, COL locked down the building, filtering patrons who entered and exited. 
Ivo Ortiz continued to be unable to calm down in the library. Despite wanting to keep him inside for his safety and the safety of others, TFL was forced to ask him to leave the building as well.
9-1-1 authorized the lockdown to be lifted - they did not instruct staff to lockdown, staff made the call due to the intensity of the threats and the language used. Staff checked cameras to verify it appeared both patrons involved in the incident had left the direct area. 
A U.S. Marshall uninvolved in the TPD report showed up just as the lockdown lifted and provided emotional support and safety to staff. Staff have incident number but are awaiting TPD response.
TPD officer responded at 4:07pm. KVN provided copy of this PITS report with updated name (for Ivo) and pictures of the patrons. Officer is aware they are trespassed for 1 year. He will drive around to see if he sees the patrons. Otherwise officer understands staff will call 9-1-1 to serve suspension letters if they return due to staff safety.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description: For two days in a row, staff have found clothing discarded in the ADA restroom. Today the restroom also contained a strong chemical odor indicative of drug use. We could not determine who left the items or used the drugs.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.2 Guns, weapons, machetes, knives~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description:
At around 3:45, patron Annie Antone reported that her phone had been stolen from the charging locker on the 3rd floor. She said that her daughters had witnessed the theft and she wanted staff to check the cameras. She and her daughters walked around the library while LIC CS attempted to find evidence of the theft on the cameras. They appear to have left and re-entered the library several times, making it difficult to check back in with them.
At 4:30, a young man reported to Guard D and LTA Sup KW that he had been pushed and threatened on the stairs. He stated that the woman who attacked him said that he had stolen her phone, and when he said that he had not, she told him, "Well, a little Black boy stole my phone," and threatened him with a knife.
On the camera footage, Annie and her daughters can be seen on camera waiting outside the 2nd floor men's restroom. When the young man exits the restroom, Annie shoves him into the wall, then pushes him backward several times with her hand on his chest until he is cornered in the alcove by the water fountain while her daughters gesture for her stop. While the knife is not clearly visible, she can be seen gesturing with something and then folding it in half and putting it into her pocket.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: At closing, a patron asked Guard J to call 911 for him and get an ambulance. Guard J did so while LIC CS and L3 LD talked with the patron and asked him questions. He said that he was short of breath, that his ribs were broken, and that he had diabetes. After a few minutes, he indicated that he really needed to use the restroom. LD unlocked the men's restroom for him. When he came back out, he appeared much calmer and chatted happily with CS until the paramedics arrived. He was transported to the hospital at his request at about 6:25.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.1 Manipulating or bypassing library rules, such as computer use
Description:
During incident 0000023383, L2 JM noticed that the patron requesting aid (Michael Stowe) had several books in his clear plastic bag. The patron has 64 books checked out and openly admits that they have all been stolen or destroyed. He has been told multiple times that he cannot check out any more items. He has recently been attempting to remove books from the library without checking them out, but has been stopped by staff. LTA Sup KW checked the barcode visible on one of the items and found that it had not been checked out (item 31152115494819). LIC CS elected not to confront Michael about the books in his bag this time because of the medical emergency occurring.
Due to the repeated nature of Michael's attempts to remove materials from the library without checking them out, and due to the sheer volume of materials involved, he will be suspended for 3 months.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.1 Manipulating or bypassing library rules, such as computer use
Description:
Patron .p20172369 Elijah Mendibles recently started coming to Main library after Missions closure. He places items on hold, picks them up without checking them out, and then cancels the holds online. MAI staff had never seen his name before, but he had 10 items missing on the hold shelf in two days, so we started keeping his items behind the desk. On Monday 4/29 LTAS KFW had a conversation with Elijah when he came in to get his reserves. Elijah assured KFW that he checks all of his items out and didn’t have any of the 10 that were missing. KFW talked with patron about ways to accurately check out materials before giving patron the items that were stored behind the desk. Watching from afar to make sure the check out process went smoothly KFW observed Elijah pretend to check out the items by scanning the same book 5 times, and then quickly head for the door. KFW caught up with him and told him the items didn’t check out. He was slightly argumentative, but went back to the self-check and checked the books out with KFWs assistance.This interaction led us to investigate his account further where we noticed 50 items on his cancelled holds list in the last two months alone. We went down the list of 50 cancelled items and each one we checked with a barcode was missing. We double checked our shelves to verify they were missing. LTAS KFW put a note in his record at this point to keep holds behind the desk while KFW consults with L3 VS, and LSM KDL on how to proceed. During this time he had multiple items come in, and he came to get them at the information desk. He was upset when LA KV checked the items out to his account, saying he really wanted to use the self checks. Elijah switched his pickup location to the outdoor lockers and had some books placed in the lockers on 5/2 and checked out to them on the morning of Friday 5/3. He called Infoline to complain, saying that he hadn’t checked out the items from the lockers yet. KFW explained how the lockers worked but also used the call as a chance to talk about what staff have noticed going on in his account, and how it appears to be stealing. 
On 5/6 LTA NG observed patron grab items off the graphic novel display and walk out without checking them out.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Green - Low Impact
Description: On 5/6/24 at approximately 4:47pm Branch Manager, Sam Hennig, was informed by our guard that two gentleman had just had a heated conversation before one of them left the library. The guard informed SH that Mr. Littlepage had addressed a youth earlier in the afternoon, and told him and his friends if they couldn't be quiet they needed to move to another computer that wasn't so close to him. That youth had called his father, and the father came in to speak with Mr. Littlepage. According to the guard, the man told Mr. Littlepage not to talk to his kid, and if he heard that Mr. Littlepage was talking to his son anymore, Mr. Littlepage would have to talk with him instead next time. It was made clear to the guard that the father was very upset, but he remained civil during the interaction. The guard said that there wasn't time to grab library staff, and according to the video, the gentleman arrived at 4:45pm and left by 4:46pm. Because staff have had several conversations with Mr. Littlepage about his issue with telling other patrons, specifically youth, what to do inside of the library and his failure to comply with the request, Mr. Littlepage will be suspended for 3 days. He will be informed of his suspension by SH when he returns to the library. His suspension will end and he may return to the library on 5/10/11.

LTAS IC EB and Vet Sec Guard JT called Medical 911 for a patron who was lying down on the bench closest to the men's restroom on the 1st floor. Patron was almost unresponsive when staff tried to wake him up. When he woke, he was very hard to understand and the decision was made to call 911 to request an EMT's come to access the patron's well-being. The Tucson Fire Department responded in less than 10 minutes and requested an ambulance to take the patron to a medical facility to be checked out. The ambulance arrive outside the library at 10:30am and the patron was able to walk out to the ambulance on his own.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: LIII found 2 individuals smoking a substance off of foils behind the electrical box just outside the library staff entrance. She let them know this was not permitted and that they needed to leave property. They did so without incident.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property~Children in the Library
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.4 Bullying per Pima County B.O.S. Policy D 23.1.~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property~Children in the Library
Description: On Monday, May 6th, Brendon Delucco came to the Main Library and spoke with LIC L2 KW and L3 LD. He again returned to the issue of magnets inside the library and he was encouraged to contact LSM EDL. The conversation was cut short due to an emergency in another area of the building. Staff at the desk accidentally gave Brendon L3 LAF's phone number, as it was retrieved from out-of-date information on the website or intranet. Brendon had previously been given EDL's business card during a previous visit, which had EDL's correct phone number. LAF was out of office on 5/6 and returned to work on 5/7 to find several missed calls from a phone number listed as unknown on her phone. On Wednesday, 5/8, the same unknown call appeared, which was Brendon, who called back while LAF was in a meeting and left a voicemail, which LAF retrieved and listened to on Thursday, 5/9. In his voicemail, Brendon makes multiple threats to the library to contact City of Tucson and enforce an eviction of PCPL from the Main Library building due to ADA non-compliance, questions the credibility of the memo given to him from Dr. Theresa Cullen, demands that the Our Space program be moved to LL1 instead of the Tortolita room, makes insults toward Main Library staff, and more. He also states that he went to another location that had magnets, but did not detail which, and says that 2 staff at that location took care of his concerns immediately.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Inappropriate interactions with staff and youth patrons
Description: Mr. Drake attends our weekly chess program.  He has at times asked inappropriate questions regarding personal contact information of staff and presenters.  It was also reported that while playing chess with a youth attendee he may have made disparaging or sarcastic comments that left the youth not feeling uplifted and supported.  Today LibIII TFL and LibIII KW had a conversation with Mr. Drake informing him of our expectations for his behavior if he wishes to continue attending the chess program.  We asked that he only play with youth who seek him out to play, keep his conversation positive, encouraging and refrain from asking personal contact information for presenters/contractors or staff.  He was receptive and agreed to the requests.  This is for documentation purposes. No other steps were required at this time.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: I was approached by two separate library patrons about the conspicuous smell of smoke in the stall in our men's room. I walked in and asked "What's going on in here" There was a patron still locked into the stall and a heavy odor of smoke. I summoned security guard GH and we waited while the patron came out of the men's room. He was an older middle-aged Caucasian male, in Levi's jeans, a white T-shirt with a Tucson logo in the back wearing grey New Balance sneakers. He was accompanied by a shaggy brownish orange dog of about 50 lbs or larger, with a length of chain for a leash. He had a rollie bag and was familiar to staff at STU. He denied he had been smoking drugs, but the restroom was still filled with acrid smoke and nobody else was present when clients had complained to me about the smoke smell.We informed him he was banned from our library for drug activity. He promises to file a formal complaint and I did not discourage that. But he peacefully removed himself from the building while I escorted him out with our security person.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
Joshua F received verbal warning from LIB 2 KVN on 4/30/24 with the clear communication that "he will be suspended for 2 weeks if he uses racial slurs or sexually inappropriate comments in the library again." On 5/8 at 5:30pm staff reported in the COL Teams chat "Fenam and Josh were having an issue. Fenam was saying Joshua was touching himself inappropriately and getting in his face and Josh as saying that Fenam was messing with him and turned off his computer. Both of them denied the behaviors. I offered them to go to computers away from each other if they were feeling uncomfortable and both of them refused to move. Since they both refused to move computers I told them if either had any problems, both would have to leave for the day since I could not confirm the behaviors and both were refusing the help of moving." Then, at 10:00am on 5/9 staff reported into the COL Teams chat "The N word was shouted from the teen/child area and a general warning was given for the group that inappropriate language is not acceptable. The N word was shouted about 4 different times as we were trying to pinpoint who it was. It sound like it could be Joshua or Sinowden. Sila went over and asked them both to leave and Joshua took responsibility for using the inapproriate language left for the day."
Joshua F has allegations of sexually inappropriate conduct on 5/8 which would have been dismissed with the verbal warning he received from staff on 5/8 (due to the inability to prove the allegations), had he not followed up with admitted use of the N-word. Though he was asked to leave for the day on 5/8, KVN is issuing his 2 week suspension as a result of his behavior and the clear verbal warning he received in Incident ID: 0000023364.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating
Description:
This is for documentation in case behavior escalates.
On 5/1/24 guard AB reported to L3 AG that there were two adult males sitting in the (busy and occupied by teens) teen area. LTA GP said that she had spoken to them earlier in the hour and that one of them was charging a medical device because "none of the other outlets work," so GP had asked how much time he needed for his device (15 mins), and had agreed to let them stay in that area for that amount of time.
Because it had been well over 15 minutes since that conversation had taken place, AG went to talk to them. AG introduced herself and said she was aware of the special permission they'd gotten to continue charging the device, and asked how much longer they would need because, as they could see, the area was busy with young teens. He said he needed 10 more minutes, and AG reiterated that next time library staff would be happy to show them where the outlets were in the adult area because this area is reserved strictly for teens. He agreed and they left 10-15 mins later.
On 5/7/24 L3 AG needed to check on the status of some outdoor signage both on the front of the building and in the parking lot. A vehicle was parked near one of the signs and the two men from 5/1 were standing outside of it talking. As she approached, AG said to them, "Hi, I'm just checking on some signs. No worries, you're both good," then afterward returned to the building. Minutes later the men came into the building and the one who had been charging the medical device complained to on-desk staff that someone had come out to look at a sign but that really they had discriminated against him and that he hadn't done anything wrong. Staff responded that it sounded like the sign was unrelated to him, and he responded that he was sure that it was in fact related to him. He was very agitated and on the verge of yelling, so staff went to get L3 AG. AG went to talk to him and explained that, just as she had told him, she had needed to look at a couple of signs out there because she was in the midst of ordering new signs, and reiterated that she had told him he hadn't done anything wrong. He agreed that she had said those things but that he did not believe her. He went on to say that he had at one time "fallen asleep for 5 minutes" at another branch and been trespassed for 30 days and that he didn't think that was fair. We then said that he owns four acres of land nearby and so his taxes fund the libraries, that he believes that all laws should apply to everyone equally and that if you're a thief, but he didn't finish that thought and instead went in a different direction and said that his son was a cop and had left Tucson because the cops here all engage in profiling, and more. AG allowed him to vent for a little while, and he quickly seemed to calm down.
He then asked where he could plug in his medical device because "The last time I was here apparently I sat in the wrong area and they harassed me about it," perhaps not remembering that AG was the one who had that conversation with him. AG showed him the different places in the library where he could sit and plug his device in.
On 5/9 at about 10:30 AM a regular patron who has not previously posed any behavior problems came to the desk to say that a man had "gotten into his face" unprovoked and tried to start a fight with him. He was visibly rattled and his hands were shaking while making this report. L3 AG approached the alleged aggressor along with L1 PC as backup and saw it was the same man from 5/1 and 5/7, who was now sitting across a table from where the first patron's belongings were, charging his medical device. AG said that the other patron reported that he had tried to start something. He asked if we wanted to hear his side of the story and AG said yes. He reported that he had checked the far end of the table but there were no outlets on that side [there is in fact an outlet there but he hadn't seen it], so he had sat down across from the other patron, who had then told him that there was an outlet at the far end of the table. This caused him to take offense and start a verbal disagreement with the other patron. The other patron denied this version of events and maintained that he had not been the first to speak, and the two began arguing. AG told them that if they wanted to remain in the library they both needed to stop arguing with each other. The first patron said he would not sit near the other guy and began to pack up his things. PC offered him a study room, which he accepted, while the other patron reiterated his version of events to AG. AG told him that in the future if there's a problem with another person he was to come and get library staff rather than engage with that person, or he would be asked to leave. He agreed, and left the library before the hour was over.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.8 Smoking, rolling, using tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Relationships with unrelated minors
Description:
Patron Nate has a history of slightly inappropriate conduct and preventative conversations with staff at COL. After an incident on 4/11, Nate offered to Guard CS and Lib 3 TFL to bring "his guys" to "jump" the patron involved in the incident to prevent the behavior. Nate was told that while staff appreciated the protective sentiment, that would result in him getting in trouble and being removed from the library. Lib 3 KW has had conversations with Nate regarding hanging out on the Teen PCs with the teens, as Nate is over 18-years-old. Nate has "shown documents" to Guard CS to "prove" that he is currently 19-years-old. Recently, there has been conversations between staff and regular youth that Nate has involved regular library minor patrons in a car-jacking (unknown whether true). 
On 5/9, Guard CS saw Nate swapping vapes with a 13-year-old minor outside the front doors. Guard CS addressed Nate, hold him he cannot do that on library property, that exchanging vapes with a minor especially could result in the police getting involved, and that Nate has been talked to about hanging out with minors in the library. Nate told CS that he "hangs out with these kids after the library closes" all the time and that Nate "can't tell him what to do" off library property. Nate brought up the legalities of spending time along with unrelated minors, and CS ended the conversation.
TFL and Lib 2 KVN asked Nate to have a private meeting in the Small Meeting Room. TFL reiterated that Nate also needed to make decisions to protect himself, that spending time alone with minors, and that exchanging vapes, could open up a host of legal troubles for Nate. TFL explained that library staff were not accusing Nate of any wrongdoing, but that library staff needed to help protect minors inside the library and staff need Nate to spend time with adults while inside the library. Nate stated that he is "part of the same age group" as the minors, stating that 13 and 19 are roughly the same age. Staff explained that while they may have a lot in common and they may have relatability, Nate is an adult and has to make adult choices. Staff also guided Nate toward the idea that being a good role model for the youth he spends time with is something to consider, and asked him if he was making the best choices by smoking with youth and engaging in (as he stated) "the lifestyle on the streets" with them. Nate appeared open to understanding needing to protect the youth from certain realities, explaining that he carries a gun "on the streets" but does not bring it to the library, and that he does not want to get the cops involved in anything as he "has an active warrant." Nate shook hands with TFL that he will no longer engage with minors inside the library without their guardians present, and that he understands that any sort of vape/smoking on library property with minors is not allowed. 
At 4:30pm, TFL noticed Nate on library property with 2 minors and another adult patron. Guard CS stood outside to send the message that Nate's behavior was being monitored as he was violating his agreement from his private conversation earlier in the day.
At around 5:00pm, Nate had another private conversation with Guard CS where Nate approached and said "they approached me" and asked what he is supposed to do if the youth won't leave him alone. Guard CS CS gave him good advice on how to verbally tell youth to disengage with him on library property. CS also reiterated the same points we made in our private conversation and told him directly that if he continued his behavior there would likely be further consequences.
At 5:12, after getting the flags, LTA DM reported to KVN that he still saw the patron, on library property, engaging with the main minor in question.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description:
Ingrid told LA NG that a male customer had come up behind her and placed a piece of scrap paper and a pencil down on the desk near her.  Ingrid said she didn’t know him and didn’t understand why he was standing behind her.  NG pointed out that the scratch paper basket was there and perhaps he was just returning extras.  Ingrid was adamant that that could not be the case. Ingrid told NG that she had asked the man why he had done that and that he “had no good answer for her.” NG informed her that we would keep an eye on the situation, but that as no harm had been done there wasn’t much else we could do.  Ingrid spent several more minutes going back over the same things she had already told NG, getting increasingly more agitated, and a couple of times raising her voice while visibly shaking to say that it all just makes her so mad.  She then sat back down to use the computer.
About a half hour later, Ingrid again came to the desk to ask NG to look at a picture on Ingrid’s computer of her air conditioning unit. Ingrid alleged that someone had sprayed something into her air conditioner, and it makes her feel sick.  She said she was feeling the same way in the library now, so she suspects that the male customer who had come up behind her had sprayed something on her back to make her sick.  Throughout both conversations Ingrid said she knew she sounded crazy but that she can assure NG that she is “very very sane”.  As she was whispering about this, the customer she had been talking about stood up and looked her way.  Ingrid said to him loudly “Are you smirking at me?”.  He came over and very politely said “No, I’m not.  I just wanted to say that I’m sorry if I made you feel uncomfortable, I didn’t mean to”, and walked away.  Ingrid used the computer for a few minutes longer and then left the building.
For years, Ingrid has shared her concerns with multiple NAN staff regarding computer security and people following her. When we suggest that she contact the sheriff’s department, she says they are “useless.”

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description: Patron asked LTA MS if he could reserve the “little room with the computers in the meeting room" for him and his friend (referring to our server room, which was open because County IT was working in the room). MS told the patron that the server room was not a space that was available to customers, and that the meeting room was not available because IT was working in the room. The patron then asked LTAS DB about using the meeting room or the study room. DB consulted with L1 KH. Since County IT was working in the server room, KH was not comfortable with members of the public also being in the meeting room. DB informed the patron that the study room was reserved, and that the meeting room was unavailable. Patron complained to Guard DT about not being able to use the meeting room. KH then observed patron approach and stand over a younger female customer who was working at a table at the back of the library. KH could not hear what was said, but the female patron moved to share another table that was occupied by a different customer. KH approached the patron wanting a room and offered to help him find a nearby library location with study room space. Patron said, “We’re good now.” KH said that it had looked as though he had asked another person to move from their table. KH requested that he not ask other people to move in the future and to ask staff for assistance in locating table space. The patron said he understood. KH left the patron and his friend to play their game. LTA MS later reported that the patron held up his phone and appeared to photograph LTA MS on his way out of the library. LTA MS was unsettled by this action. Documenting due to patron’s aggressive behavior and repeated unwillingness to accept the limitations of the library space.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description: Child/tween brothers Salem and Rashad approached LI KN at the information desk and reported that another tween patron, Jayden, had called Rashad a "faggot", told another child patron he was autistic (implying that the term was used as an insult), and was "farting". Salem also reported that Jayden had made some comments about Salem's father and that he (Salem) would not tolerate that. LI KN reminded Salem that he needs to report such behavior to library staff and not handle it himself. Jayden has been informed in the past that such language will not be tolerated at the library, so after consulting with LI PC it was decided to suspend Jayden. LI KN informed Jayden about his suspension. Jayden said it was "his bad" and that many other kids in the library were involved in exchanging name calling. LI KN encouraged him to think about the difference between harmless trash talk while gaming and using personal attributes and offensive language to attack others. He accepted his suspension with no argument.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description: Ms. Jimenez called back after talking with LA NG about a book she wanted by the weekend. She had placed a copy on hold and was concerned it would not arrive at HIM by then. NG explained that she was placing it on our holdshelf for the woman, who could pick up within 3 days. NG left work for the day soon after. Ms. Jimenez called back and asked to speak with NG. LIII TFL explained that she had gone for the day but that TFL was happy to jump in and help. The woman immediately began yelling and stating that "Robert" had been there, that the book was on its way to Himmel and that library staff could do nothing right. TFL asked her to refrain from yelling, explained that she would do her best to help but that abusive speech was not allowed. TFL found the book, on the holdshelf for the woman. When she returned to the call she asked for the card number to open for account verification. Ms. Jimenez yelled "he's coming to get the book" and hung up. It appears "Robert," on his first visit, had come to desk staff, apparently unaware of the context of the phone call, and promptly returned to tell her that we did not have the book but had sent it to Himmel. If she calls again Ms. Jimenez will be given a verbal warning.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: Using an incendiary object on library property~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description: LTA Sup AP observed customer using a blow torch in front of the library.  L3 KK and AP approached the man who admitted to using the device.  Customer stated that he was using it to stay warm and that it was a "camping blow torch."  The customer was sitting in the shade and it was 73 degrees.  KK did not observe any drug paraphernalia nor did she notice any obvious signs of impairment.  KK made the man aware that the use of blow torches or any objects that cause fire was not permitted anywhere on library grounds due to safety issues.  She further instructed him not to bring the torch into the library.  Customer said that he would comply.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: While cleaning up around the outside of the building I discovered a significant number of burnt foil, burnt straws, and hypodermic needle caps indicative of drug use on the north side of the building--particularly between the electrical box and the parking spaces. Human feces was also discovered. This is just for documentation purposes.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Use and preservation of library materials and property~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.5 Indecent exposure, public indecency, lewd, other sexual offense~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.2 Unplugging library equipment    3.6 Using furniture improperly    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Green - Low Impact
Description:
This is for documentation purposes only: The computer classroom is now closed to the public without a staff member present as of 5/10/2024. 
We believe there is one individual who is using the room inappropriately. Several of the chairs and under the desks had stains. Our LPI has caught him watching pornography, but no children were present, and he would close his browser immediately once he realized someone was watching. The LPI did not see him touching himself. Additionally, there is a long history of the computer behind wherever this patron was sitting having the power or the internet unplugged. The janitor also informed KS that someone was spitting chewing tobacco on the floor at one of the computers that patron regularly sat at - no one caught him chewing tobacco. 
February 20, 2024, staff noticed 5 chairs in the computer classroom had white stains near the edge. These were cleaned. Around February 21, KS informed the individual that we thought there was "inappropriate behavior in the computer classroom and since he was there so often, we would appreciate if he would let us know if there was anything inappropriate happening in there". He asked what happened and KS told him that several of the computer chairs had to be cleaned because someone was doing something they should not at the library. The patron responded with "I haven't seen anything and I don't know who would do something like that...I'll let you know if I see anything."
March 26, 2024, staff noticed 2 chairs in the computer classroom had the same stains. We had these cleaned. For the next week, staff regularly checked on the computer classroom during their "Roaming hour" and even sat in the back of the room for 5-10 minutes several times a day but did not catch him doing anything in appropriate. 
May 9, 2024, one staff member used a black light and there were stains under three of the desks - two of these desks were where that patron usually sits. Earlier that week, one of the computers that we had a sign to "stop unplugging the computer" was unplugged again after this patron used the computer in front of it. Per LSM AR, we will close the computer classroom and only use it for computer classes, one-on-ones, or if we run out of computers in the main area of the library.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: Patron came in at 10:40 to turn in a Laptop that he had found to LA BA. When investigating further we had found that this was one of the laptops that was reported stolen. Item check-in and sent to Main.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
Patron Reginald Johnson was upset by an infant crying in the public area. He left his computer and began ranting about how the baby "needs a whoopin" to stop crying. Guard CS stepped in to redirect the patron's rant and starting walking him towards the lobby. Hearing the loud ranting, L1 MNC came out to check on the situation. As the patron was already heading out of the library, MNC decided to only monitor the situation and not engage and escalate the situation. On his way out, Reginald paused near the cafe area to rant about how "the homeless are evil and thieves". At that point, another patron passed by and Reginald began quickly following him outside and yelling about how the other patron is a drug addict who "can't wait to get his dope fix". L1 MNC and Guard CS followed behind anticipating a fight to begin outside. The other patron ignored Reginald and rode off on his bike. Reginald disengaged and went to car.
Reginald is a patron who only visits the library once or twice per month and these rants are a frequent occurrence. When he returns, he will be given a verbal warning about respecting other library patrons. If he does not accept the warning and escalates, a suspension will be issued.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description:
when coming back from lunch LA CC mentioned to L2VV that The guard was trying to empty the bathroom due to a strong order. VV checked and confirmed it was a Drug smell and locked the bathrooms for cleaning
when checking the camera many patrons were coming in and out of the bathroom but one was seen with something in his mouth and rushed outside shortly before the incident was reported

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: L3 KK recognized customer Reginald Johnson from today's COL incident while she was assisting him on a computer.  She opted to wait until he was leaving the library before talking to him about his behavior at COL.  However, he kept monopolizing the time of the page A and so she asked to speak to him.  Reginald immediately became loud and defensive and said that he was leaving.  When KK again attempted to talk to him, he went into a study room and closed the door in her face.  While ranting in the study room and gathering his things, he asked what it was about but immediately talked over KK as she said it was in regards to his behavior today at COL.  Reginald left the study room and yelled that he was never coming back.  He then looked at a man sitting in a walker who had not provoked him in any way and said, "You're probably never going to walk again."  Reginald left the building. He will be suspended for 2 months for this disruptive and harassing behaviors.

He hid under the computer desks while MG and L1 JB looked for him to remind him of his suspension. When he was found and caught, he claimed that he thought his suspension was only for 2 days. He was again told that he is suspended for 2 weeks.
Due to his actions today, if he returns again prior to the end of his suspension, another week will be added to the suspension.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.5 Indecent exposure, public indecency, lewd, other sexual offense~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others
Description: LIC LII JM was called by Vet Sec Guard JT who reported that a patron had told the guard on 2nd floor that they were touched inappropriately below the waist by another patron while using the 2nd floor men's room. LIC LII JM met Vet Sec Guard JT on the first floor and both went to talk to the patron who made the report. The younger man reported that he was in the men's restroom and out of nowhere the older man walked past him, looking him directly in the eyes and touched him below the waist and then exited the bathroom. The younger man said that the older man was wearing a blue plaid shirt, had short hair and glasses, a backpack and was African-American. Vet Sec Guard L who was the guard on the second floor when the incident occurred got a brief report from the young man. Vet Sec Guard L reported that the man he saw exiting the restroom was tall, 5'9 or 5'10, had a black backpack and that he had come out of the restroom and said that the men's room was out of toilet paper and then immediately headed towards the elevators. After reporting about the toilet paper, the older man went down the stairs to the first floor and exited the building quickly. This patron will be suspended for one year.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: A male library user was suspended due to drug use in the public restroom. After an investigation of a reported powerful smell from a female library user, we were able to pinpoint the male library user who used the public restroom to use drugs. The manager did address the male library user and his drug use in the restroom for which he did not admit to, but he did not fight either. He accepted that he will not be able to use the library and other libraries due to drug use in the restroom. He did not want to wait for his suspension letter.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Patron had, periodically throughout the morning, had outbursts where he shouted obscenities and then seemed to regain control of himself, or grabbed and forcefully swung the patio door open and shut a few times without slamming it. He also seemed to be coughing and sneezing on other patrons in what seemed to be a targeted manner, sometimes he would do this from about 6 ft away from the person, and another time as he was passing by the person. Staff were keeping an eye on the patron and the situation, and when it had occurred two or three times staff believed that it was intentional. At about 1:30 L1 PC let L3 AG know that it had occurred again, and AG approached the patron near the computer lab and introduced herself. She let him know that because of these behaviors, which were disruptive and targeted, he would need to leave for the day but could try for a better day tomorrow. Patron wanted to argue about whether the behavior had occurred, and AG reiterated the request to leave for the day a couple of times. Patron did gather his belongings and exit the library, stopping first in the entryway to make kicking motions back into the library building.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.9 Trespassing    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: attempting to steal library property
Description: Several incidents with this patron occurred throughout the afternoon. LTAS KW was moving a whiteboard on the 2nd floor and the patron moved it slightly out of the walkway and told him to "Get the fuck out my way, homeboy". LIC LI MG was called to address two older teens fighting in the Ignite Space and she told the group of teens, including this patron to stop cursing because everyone in the library can hear it, even down on the 1st floor due to the balcony and where they are sitting. She and the guard asked them to stop fighting or even pretending to fight in the ignite space. LII IC JM and Vet Sec Guard L went over to the space about an hour later to talk to the patron and another older teen who is one of our regular patrons about horseplay in the ignite space. The patron said that it was "bullshit", and he didn't believe there was a rule about pretending to fight another teen in the library and LII IC JM assured him that this is a code of conduct violation and retrieved a printout from the 2nd floor desk underlining all of the code of conduct violations currently happening and offering the piece of paper to the teens. The teens refused the code of conduct printout and the patron still continued to argue about being able to fight in the space and so LIC LII JM told the patron to leave for the rest of the day, and try to come back again another day. The patron and a group of his friends left the library, one of them stating that it is better to leave for the day than to argue and get kicked out for longer. About 20 minutes later the patron came back in with another friend and ignored LIC LII JM when she said he was suspended for the day and needed to leave. The patron sat down at a 2nd floor table in the stacks and started texting. LIC LII JM and Vet Sec Guard D went over to the patron at the table and told him again he would need to leave and that he will be suspended for a week. The patron still sat at the table denying that he had done anything wrong or that he could be asked to leave. When Vet Sec Guard D informed the patron that the next step was the police, the patron said that he couldn't have the police show up because he is on probation. He got up from the table, went over to the 101 space to talk to his friend first, and then walked down the stairs and out the door. After hearing about the other issues staff had with this patron between 3-4pm the decision has been made to suspend this patron for 90 days.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
At around 3:30pm Lib 2 KVN (on desk) and Guard CS noticed regular youth Adriana G leave the teen area to sit in the café area. After roughly 10min, Charlie D joined her. KVN watched from the desk as Adriana exchanged cash with Charlie and then pocketed a small bag. KVN waited to see if they were potentially exchanging money for the vending machine and the pocketed item was unrelated. Adriana and Charlie immediately split up and Charlie went back to the teen area on the PCs and Adriana left the building through the West doors. 
KVN went to speak with Guard CS and Adriana re-entered the building less than 5min later. KVN asked both Charlie and Adriana to step outside with her. She told them that she saw them exchanging money and acting suspiciously and that they can't do that in the library. KVN did not accuse them of doing anything illegal, and did not even mention drugs, or nicotine. Charlie became defensive and began asking "who gave who money?" and stated "I just asked for her snapchat" (when Charlie and Adriana have spent time together in the library before and would not need to leave the supervised Teen area to exchange snapchats) and used KVN's name in an aggressive tone repeatedly. 
As a result, KVN told Charlie that because of his response to her conversation, which consisted simply of a verbal warning, he needed to leave for the day. KVN clarified to Adriana that what they did is not appropriate on library property. Adriana nodded that she understood.
Guard CS agreed that both parties were overly defensive while proclaiming innocence even though KVN was simply clarifying that their actions in the café area were not acceptable behavior. 
This serves to document this behavior for both parties and that they have received a verbal warning.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.6 Using furniture improperly
Description:
At 2:50pm on 5/15, the unknown patron is seen on camera digging through the trash, entering the building through the West doors, walking through the entire lobby and out the front entrance, looking out the front entrance, and then returning to the lobby where he picks up a green chair and walks out the West door with it. This was during the hour Guard CS is on lunch. Secondary patron Kenneth (reported on 5/15 in separate incident involving drugs) is seen interacting with the unknown patron and holding the door for the patron. Kenneth booked a study room from 3pm - 5pm on 5/15 as well. 
At around 3:45pm, the unknown patron returns with the chair, and has a brief interaction with Guard CS. CS notifies Lib 2 KVN and both stand in the library monitoring his behavior. The unknown patron spoke incoherently and behaved erratically (under the influence). While CS and KVN monitored the situation, the patron continuously searched desks for free items (masks, pencils, papers, bags) and collected them, ducked behind shelves in an obvious manner and looked in CS's and KVN's direction, and browsed through books in the Teen area. KVN monitored while the patron (an adult) was in the Teen section, and then let desk staff know about the patron. Guard CS continued to monitor for more signs of theft.
At close to 4:45pm, KVN approached the patron in the adult section at the request of staff to ensure the patron did not need help. KVN did not address the erratic behavior or incident with the chair. The patron sounded more coherent, and was looking at sci-fi books. After the interaction, the patron quickly checked out multiple items and left for the day. The patron lit a cigarette as he walked out the West door.
This PITS serves to document that the patron does have a library card (staff were unable to obtain the information) and a history of (temporary?) theft. The patron is also associated with patrons who are using illegal substances on library property.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.2 Disruptive use of personal devices
Description: As I was using the copy machine in the public area near the computers a man on one of the computers was engaged in a very loud, personal phone conversation. From my vantage point at the printer I watched a patron look up from their computer towards the man as if bothered by the man's excessively loud voice and then look to me. I then walked over to the man on the phone and before I even had the opportunity to say anything he waved me off and told me to go away. I remained and said I was coming over to ask him to keep his conversation quieter or to offer him a study room to use, he proceeded to ask me my name and said that he's seen me ignoring homeless patrons at the branch and nit-picking people's behaviors and called me a "Karen." I went to the desk to write my name down for him and he proceeded to call me a Karen and said he bets I voted for Biden. Our guard G came over to support me and he said, "I can't even take her seriously with that mask on, tell her to not come over here." As this was going on he was packing up his belongings and logging out of his computer session in order to leave so I did not engage him further. He left continuing to mumble about me being a Karen and stuff about guard G's mask.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: Customer Richard Miller was waiting outside the library for the doors to open arguing with other customers waiting. Guard Jen called LIC L3 LAF to inform her of the situation and that Jen had spoken with Richard and asked him to stop arguing with others. Richard complied. He was also lying on the ground and showing people a wound on his leg, including guard Karen. Richard entered the building at opening without issue. LAF was assisting front desk staff with opening when staff member LTA NG reported to her that two customers were arguing. Richard was again arguing with another customer. LAF spoke with Richard, he stopped arguing, went to the restroom, and LAF remained on 1st floor to monitor the situation. LA RW, also staffing the desk, reported to LAF that Richard had requested a phone number for a bank in Grant Park. Richard came out of the bathroom and LAF gave him the number and a reusable water bottle. Richard was defensive and as LAF was trying to help him, Richard used dismissive language toward her, and after requesting instructions on how to use the courtesy phone, told her to "stand down" and to "stop talking" as she was giving him the instructions he had requested. After using the phone, Richard informed LAF he needed a ride to the bank and that getting to the bus was too difficult for him because of the wounds on his feet and leg. LAF offered Crisis and Richard accepted. LAF called and Crisis said they could not support with this request. LAF offered to call TPD non-emergency and EMS, if he wanted care for his wounds. Richard refused both. Richard made more calls, asked LAF for help again, and finally asked her to call TPD non-emergency, who also said they could not help with a ride. Richard again told LAF to stop talking as she was trying to assist him and get information so she could help. LAF told Richard he was being rude to her and that if he was going to be disruptive and rude to staff, he'd need to leave. LAF said she could try Sun Van, as Richard said he was registered with them. Richard said he would sit down and wait. LAF provided the info Richard gave her and Sun Van said he was not in their system. LAF asked for an exception and they refused. LAF wrote down phone numbers for Sun Van and gave them to Richard and explained that this had been her last option to help. Richard became angry and started telling LAF it was her fault they weren't coming and said she "didn't fucking listen" to him. LAF said she had worked hard to help him, that was enough, and he needed to leave. Richard called LAF a "fucking whore" and a bitch, along with other expletives as he exited the building. Guard Jen present for the entirety of the interaction.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Green - Low Impact
Description:
Patron Victoria Acedo called and LIB I RW picked up the phone. After 4 minutes of trying to speak to the patron, RW went to get LIB III KS. RW told KS that the person was yelling at her because her daughter had a collection agency fee and was swearing. The patron started the call by asking "What the hell is going on that you would send my daughter to collections?!" RW was able to get the daughter's card number to look at the account but was unable to get more information and the patron kept yelling over her. 
LIB III KS took the call and the patron started by using a clipped tone - "Do I have to repeat everything I just said or did she tell you what is going on?!" KS explained she knew some of what was going on and tried to explain that the library does not credit report and the collection agency is just to help contact people when the library has not received a response, and we could send her information to another department to waive it. The patron yelled over KS most of the time, so it was hard to tell if she heard anything. She asked for KS's manager at one point and then talked over her when she tried to tell her and give her a phone number. At one point, she yelled, "This is bullshit!"
