KS told her that she would not speak to her while she was yelling and cursing and said I'm hanging up. KS hung up the call and the patron called back immediately. KS told the patron before she could say anything that she wanted to help her; however, she could not speak to staff like that and to please stop cursing. The woman yelled "it was one swear word, you need to relax!" KS told her that she was hanging up again until she was calmer - the patron was still yelling at this point and KS hung up again. 
The patron called back repeatedly and the phones were busy. Finally Sub Librarian CB took the call and she said the woman mostly yelled without swearing, and asked how CB would feel if she got back from Mexico and found out that her child had been sent to collections. She would not allow CB to explain or offer to send it to another department to waive the fees and she finally hung up on CB. 
KS referred her to LIB III VS to consider waiving the collection agency fee. VS was able to call her a few hours later and resolve the issue.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: Harassment: Crowding library staff~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description:
Managing Librarian DB observed patron Lyra Perry's general agitated pacing upon the patron's arrival at the library at approximately 9:05am. At one point the patron was walking quickly behind librarian DB, who was approaching her office in the front of the library and when the librarian turned around to glance over her shoulder the patron diverted her path to go into another part of the building. Library staff began restocking the food pantry cabinet at approximately 11:15am and observed the patron pacing, staring and mumbling to herself. While LA CS and Page AY were working together, the patron kept her distance, but paced and kept staring at library staff that was working. When LA CS left the area to obtain more supplies, Lyra Perry approached the food pantry and entered the enclosed space that had been set up for page AY to finish the restocking. DB observed the patron moving quickly toward the pantry and heard the card and cabinet door being moved, she approached the food pantry cabinet to observe the situation, as staff had mentioned their discomfort at being watched and stared at by this patron for the bulk of the morning. When she approached the patron was standing mere inches from the page AY and was talking to her. DB asked the patron to please refrain from crowding staff in such close quarters. The patron said that they were just asking a question and the librarian said that that was fine to do, but that staff needed more space to complete this task and that the pantry would be available as soon as staff was finished. DB remained in the area while AY finished stocking the cabinet. Following that interaction, the librarian approached Lyra Perry with a printed copy of the customer code of conduct to share with the patron. She offered the code of conduct and indicated the behaviors that were problematic, crowding, staring and stalking library staff. The librarian emphasized that while all customers are welcome in the library, not all behaviors are welcome in the library. The patron immediately defended her actions and stated that she knew her library manners and that the librarian was a hindrance to library services. The patron requested the Librarian's full name and LSM's full name. The librarian provided the requested information to the patron. 
Page AY's statement:
"While I was stocking the food pantry, a woman come over and slightly moved the cart with her body to get into the small space I was in. I had the cart right behind me so I could just turn around to place the items from the cart to the pantry. Once she got into the small space I had to stay turned looking towards the cart because there was no room to turn without touching her. Also right away she started saying something about national geographic while also doing sign language. Then DB came over quickly and asked her not to crowd employees."

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Customer handed Guard JD a hypodermic needle wrapped in a tissue.  Customer said that he'd found the needle in the bushes next to the southeast parking lot entrance.  JD disposed of the needle in a sharps container.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description:
A couple parked in the library parking lot saw that a dog was left inside a vehicle. The gentlemen came into the library to report the issue. the library manager CO went outside with the gentleman and saw that there was a dog in the vehicle with both windows down (passenger & driver side). Because it was not hot and the windows were down for air, the manager told the couple that the dog was not in any danger and that it was okay. The manager returned inside. about 10 minutes passed and the manager hears some yelling outside and that's when she noticed that the two parties were arguing, the owner of the vehicle with the dog and the couple. The manager returns inside to retrieve the police officer D. On the way to talk to both parties, the officer receives a call from 911. The manager and the officer both goes outside to talk to the parties. Unfortunately, the vehicle with the dog left. So the manager and the officer were able to speak with couple. The conversation to the couple was that, it is best not to approach those you do not know and that you should report the situation not involve yourself in the situation because it can lead to a more problematic/dangerous situation.
 
Backstory... The owner of the vehicle was having a conversation outside the library with 2 people who were handing out literature. And the gentleman was not in the library longer than an hour of which 15-20 minutes was in a conversation outside of the front door of the library.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.2 Strong odors    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: Librarian MG let L1 SG that a patron in a wheelchair using computer number 8 had his pants down to the hip level. SG approached the patron and recognized him as Alan Killmer. SG asked Alan to please pull up his pants, he responded that needed help, SG offered him to use the family restroom. He refused and used the regular men's restroom. A few minutes later, SG, Guard CS, and LII KVN were in the lobby when noticed that Alan was coming out of the restroom with his pants up but wet in the bottom and an overwhelming urine odor. SG approached Alan again to let him know that he couldn't stay in the library until he was able to get cleaned up and change his wet pants, he responded he didn't have a place to go to change his clothes and to leave him alone. Alan refused to leave and kept entering the computer lab. SG asked one more time to please, leave for the day and offered him help gathering his belongings, he responded, "fuck you." The patron finished picking up his things and left for the day.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1 Any criminal offense    1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: At 9:58 AM LTAS IC KFW was notified that Patron A, Mark C, was singing loudly in the computer lab. Patron B in the next row over yelled at the first patron about his volume level, according to Patron B, Patron A then threatened him and called him racial and homophobic slurs. Patron B then came and got in Patron As face and told him if he didn't shut up then Patron B would punch him, at which point Guard L and J arrived and separated the two parties. The interaction between Patron A and B happened very close to Patron C, Jeremy D, who became very agitated and started threatening Patron B and a number of other patrons in the computer lab. KFW arrived at this point, 9:59 AM, as Patron B sat down but Patron A and C continued to take turns yelling threats, slurs, and racially charged insults at patron B and another African American patron near by. KFW told A and C to stop their behavior and exit the library immediately. Patron C sat down and ignored staff. Patron A continued to yell at Patron B for about a minute, before putting his headphones on, sitting down, and singing to himself while staring at KFW. At this point KFW instructed Guard J to call 911 since both patrons were refusing to leave. After a few more requests to leave Patron C finally starting packing his belongings while yelling more racially charged insults like "This is why affirmative action doesn't work". KFW thought Patron A was going to leave when he jumped up quickly and exited his row in the computer lab. Instead A went quickly down the row Patron B was in with his right fist raised. When Patron B and the other African American patron jumped up together ready to defend themselves Patron A paused just long enough for Guard D to get between the groups. Patron C left on his own at this point while Guards D, J, L, and KFW herded a still yelling Patron A out of the library. TPD arrived right as Patron A went out the front door. They talked to Patron A for a few minutes before A walked down Stone Ave and they departed. Both Patrons A and C were told they will be given a years suspension.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description:
Entering as an incident as PITS follow-up is not working:
Patron came in and got upset that the guards asked him to pull down his mask so they could verify that it was actually him. LIC CS spoke to him and let him know that he was suspended. He asked to see a picture; CS showed him the printed-out picture of him from the security cameras. He said that "didn't prove anything," asked for CS's name and position, and left with the suspension paperwork.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description:
A young man who had been in the library since opening reported to Guard J that his bike had been stolen from the bike rack outside. He stated that the bike had been secured with a bike lock and asked to see the camera footage. LIC CS and L3 LAF came down and spoke to the man, who asked them to show him the camera footage so he could "find the person and beat the shit out of them." CS and LAF politely declined and explained our policy around camera footage. The young man submitted a police report on his phone while LAF spoke with the TPD non-emergency line, who told her that the officers would reach out for the footage. The man made several other vague threats (including, "Whoever stole my bike better hope the police find him before I do.") but eventually calmed down and sat in a study room.
Unfortunately, our cameras do not cover the bike racks, so we were unable to see who took the bike. However, the bank across the street confirmed to the customer that their cameras do face that area, so they may be of more help to the customer.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
During the Our Space program, semi-regular patron Tara was harassing regular patron Joshua about using the microwave and telling him repeatedly that "Jesus loves him." The two separated briefly, but then attempted to leave the room at the same time. Joshua accused Tara of following him and told her, "I'm going to kick you in the vagina like a football." The two shouted at each other as they went to opposite stairwells.
LIC CS went down the stairs after Tara to speak to her and try to keep her from leaving the library at the same time as Joshua. Tara agreed to wait on the stairs until Joshua had left, though she decline the offer to be let out through the side staff exit. However, as she stood in the stairwell with CS, Tara continued to swear and call Joshua "crazy." When the security guard leaned around the door frame to check on the noise, she shouted at him to "stop staring at me, motherfucker!" and accused him of stalking her. She then stormed out of the library.
Meanwhile, L3 LAF spoke to Joshua, who said that Tara had been yelling at him in Our Space. Joshua stated that Tara was aggressive with him and yelled at him after cutting in line. He stepped back to let her cut in front of him and she immediately started yelling at him again. This was corroborated by accounts from staff in the Our Space program. LAF let Joshua know that what he yelled was not appropriate and asked him to leave for the day. He did so without argument.
Tara then came back into the library and said that another man had threatened her out on the plaza and she wasn't going to leave because it wasn't safe. CS offered to take her out the side exit again, and she agreed; however, as soon as she had gathered her bags back up, she went right back out the front door and up Stone while shouting obscenities at the cars.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description:
LA NG was showing a patron who requested where she could charge her phone the cafe area where we have plugs/outlets and USB charging areas in/next to the furniture.  The cafe area was very full, all available outlets and chargers appeared in use except for an outlet next to one of the small round tables where another patron was sitting, leaning against the median wall.  As his device was charged into the top, but the bottom plug was available, and an empty chair on the other side of the table was unoccupied, LA NG was going to ask if he minded if she used the other plug. He had his eyes closed and LA NG attempted to wake him up by saying "excuse me" and rapping loudly on the table, with no response, then clapping her hands loudly right in front of him with no response.  A woman who wears a blue head scarf who has been seen in the cafe before as a semi-regular walked over, said "I'm an EMT" and proceeded to grab and shake his shoulder.  The sleeping patron woke up and LA NG told him that she wanted to make sure he was okay since we don't always know if someone could be passed out or need medical attention and asked if he was okay.  He nodded.  LA NG went to the woman who was sitting at another table in the cafe and said that while we appreciate her intentions, that only staff can wake up patrons for their safety and to please not intervene in the future.  She didn't say anything in response to LA NG but another cafe patron said "rock on" to her and gave her a high five and she laughed.  
This is just for documentation to show we let her know that only library staff should make attempts to wake up other patrons in case she tries to involve herself again.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description: LA TW called IC L1 WW to inform him there was a gentleman who had a cat in a carrier on 3rd floor who was heading downstairs.  WW confronted patron with cat and a woman he was with on 2nd floor.  When WW told patrons they could not have the cat in the building, the woman began arguing and calling WW names ("bitch", etc..etc..) and said they'd be calling their lawyer.  WW then told the woman she was being suspended because of her behavior and refusal to leave.  L3 LF came upon the interaction as WW was escorting them out the door, and WW and LF were then joined by Guards J and D on 1st floor as they angrily left.  Office Shelton joined staff as the two patrons (and the cat) left the building.  The male patron will not be suspended, as the entirety of the negative behavior came from the female patron.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: L1 JCB approached four boys sitting in the teen area gaming while parents and toddlers were browsing the picture books.  JCB congratulated them on completing the school year and asked if they had plans for the summer and Juma said "yeah, I'm gonna beat my meat!"  JCB explained that his comment was inappropriate for this context and should not be said in public or they would not be allowed to remain in the library.  A minute later, LII KVN came out in the youth area and caught the boys using profanity and throwing things.  She told them to leave for the day.  As they were in the lobby Juma repeated his earlier statement at a loud volume and then said it again as he stepped from the front porch to the parking lot.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
After receiving multiple strikes and warnings regarding behavior in the library, a group of 4 youth patrons including Anthony Salas and Justine Suvere were asked to leave for the day. Both Justine and Anthony know the policy about returning to library property after being asked to leave. However, within 3 minutes after leaving through the front doors Anthony and Justine walked back into the library through the West door. LIB 2 KVN, Lib 1 JB, and Guard CS were still standing there discussing the incident. 
KVN notified both of them that they have been issued an extended suspension due to trespassing. Anthony and Justine claimed that they left something with a person in the library, but knew they should have checked in with a staff member or guard before re-entering. KVN is issuing both Anthony and Justine a 3 day suspension as both youth have a history of returning to the library after being asked to leave for the day and pushing the boundaries of the rules.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description: At approximately 1:50 a library patron known to use the restroom for bathing came into the library and headed straight for the restroom. At 1:55, I asked guard GH to accompany me to the restroom to see if the patron was bathing. As we walked in, the woman was at the sink with foil and a burnt straw in her mouth. She had not started smoking the substance but was about to. I let her know that drugs were not allowed in the library and asked her to leave immediately. She complied and I walked her out of the building. As we walked out I informed her that she would be suspended from all PCPL libraries for one year. She mumbled some obscenities but continued to exit the property.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others    2.10 Creating tripping hazards, blocking aisles, exits, entrances
Description: 5 minutes before opening, a group of young men were playing with a basketball and another small ball in front of the library.  They were throwing the balls in such a way that made people walk around them to get near the entrance, and the balls occasionally hit the glass doors and wall of the library.  Guard RP opened the doors and asked them to stop.  They did stop, but said inappropriate things to the guard.  LTA supervisor KP went out to talk to them and asked them not to speak disrespectfully to the guard.  KP got L3 LM--LM went outside with RP to talk to the group before opening.  LM said they could come in the library if they behaved respectfully toward the guard.  One of the young men talked back a lot, and said he is the head of Arcadia Landscaping and would report RP to his boss.  He decided not to enter the library.  Two men from the group did enter the library and behaved respectfully. This is for documentation purposes.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description:
A patron reported to LTA VG that he saw a male patron consuming alcohol. L2 KVN went to investigate and found Ivo Ortiz (from incident 0000023379) hiding behind a newspaper with a can of alcohol sitting next to the chair. KVN asked the patron "What are you drinking?" and the patron stated "that's not mine." KVN asked "So you're okay if I take it and dump it out?" and the patron said "Sure." KVN recognized the patron as Ivo Ortiz, who has a current suspension and was served his letter. KVN asked L1 MC to verify that it was Ivo and that MC did serve him his suspension. After MC verified it was him, KVN asked Guard DT to back her up and returned to Ivo and told him that he is serving a current suspension and that he was already notified of his suspension so he is trespassing. KVN asked Ivo to gather his items and leave. Ivo immediately left. 
KVN did not mention his extended suspension, but as a result of consuming alcohol in the library and trespassing, KVN is issuing a new, 1-year suspension starting today 5/25/24 for Ivo.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description:
L1 JB and L2 KVN received a report from a staff member on 5/25 regarding a patron who had been displaying a pattern of behaviors that was causing her discomfort and anxiety. Upon further investigation, KVN found out from the staff member the patron David Durazo had been displaying following behaviors, watching her, and engaging in uncomfortable conversations with her. The patron behavior has been going on for 5+ months, with the staff member making infrequent reports about having to leave CM duties when she feels uncomfortable. The staff member reported in the beginning, David would attempt to ask more questions about her personal life, but over time she has stopped engaging and this has resulted in shortened conversations - but he still tries to engage in small talk daily. These interactions of David following her to various areas of the library, stationing himself in the areas where she is working, and having brief interactions with her occur every day that she works. 
On Thursday, 5/23 David Durazo was seen by KVN interacting briefly with the reporting staff member in an unusual location (the children's area), but KVN was unaware of the situation at the time. However, this interaction was the most recent occurrence where other staff were witness to the behavior. Several other staff have reported noticing David Durazo's behavior around certain staff.
On Friday, 5/25 David Durazo made it a point to approach this staff member to ask permission to charge his phone in a spot where he is frequently seen charging his phone (so is aware he can charge his phone in this spot) and then circled back several minutes later to ask how the staff member was doing. The staff member kept the conversation short but reported to KVN after it occurred. 
COL staff report David is a regular who is at the library almost every day.
During the investigation, KVN also learned that this staff member may not be the only one experiencing the same interactions with David. David Durazo has had a history with another staff member in the building, including inappropriate interactions that occurred outside the library.
KVN will follow up with Guard CS next week to determine if he has more information about David Durazo. After determining if there is further information, KVN will follow-up with JB and issue a verbal warning to David Durazo regarding limiting interactions with staff to library-related functions only. David Durazo's behavior will continue to be monitored to ensure staff are safe in the library.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description:
L1 MC reported to L2 KVN that Reginald Johnson, a currently suspended patron who was issued a 2-month suspension for behavior at COL and WIL in PITS 0000023403 and 0000023404, was sitting at the PCs. KVN verified that Reginald had not been served his suspension notice, but MC had already printed his suspension letter. MC recognized him when Reginald came to the desk asking why his library card was not working, displaying agitated behaviors, and demanded a guest pass. That is when MC made the connection regarding the patron and printed the suspension letter. 
KVN approached Reginald at the PC with Guard DT nearby and asked Reginald if they could speak somewhere more privately. Reginald said no, and asked to "just finish this task." KVN then informed him that he is suspended as a result of his behavior at COL and WIL. KVN asked if he wanted his suspension letter but Reginald did not respond. Reginald got up off the computer and started ranting about "pedophile priests" and mentioned "taking them down." KVN followed at a significant distance to ensure Reginald left the building, with Guard DT following KVN. Reginald turned around in the lobby and told KVN "Could you not follow me" in a demanding tone. KVN told him that he needs to leave the building and she has to ensure he leaves. Reginald asked for his suspension letter, which KVN handed to him. Reginald then began to argue that the address on the letter was incorrect, to which KVN responded "It does not matter, you need to leave." 
Reginald then began to take out his wallet and continue to argue that the address on his suspension letter was incorrect. KVN repeated that it did not matter and he needed to leave. Reginald asked if he was being trespassed and KVN responded "yes." Reginald then told KVN he was going to sue the library and County and COL would be "shut down in 3 days." He continued to turn around and make threats as he walked through the doors. KVN and Guard DT monitored as he left the building. 
The suspension letter given to Reginald did not include the official date of return. As a result of Reginald's threats with staff giving him a suspension letter, and his consistent pattern of hostility with patrons and staff, KVN is extending Reginald's suspension to a 6-month suspension starting 5/25/25. He may need to be issued an additional suspension letter in the future.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: indecent sexual exposure
Description: Quincie Douglas library Carlos Agulia witnessed a patron, by the name of Angel Green, masturbating a few feet away from the staff entrance door this morning on site around 8:30 a.m., when he arrived. Library staff noted from his eyewitness account that he had his pants down, lying down on his right side with his left arm jerking in a quick back and forth motion, away from the public towards the wall. TPD was called and informed of the patron's indecent sexual behavior/ exposure (i.e. masturbating) from another library staff member, Brie Chillious. Indecent exposure was reported 10 minutes later, after patron was seen walking towards the Quincie Douglas Recreation Center. The Executive Director, Jerry Neely, was contacted and informed of the patron and his recent activity. TPD arrived, apprehended and arrested patron near the recreation center. Sometime later a TPD officer, Officer Flores (badge number 106191), contacted Quincie Douglas library staff about the incident and informed staff to report the incident as patron was "trespassing," which allowed arresting officers to take him away. Patron was arrested and removed from the premises, thereafter.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed    3.1 Manipulating or bypassing library rules, such as computer use
Description: For documentation: Patron BC has pattern of returning material very stained, beat up, and often with liquid damage. BC has been given tote bags and zip lock bags in an attempt to help mitigate damage to library materials. Items matching this patrons pattern of damage have often been returned not checked out to any account, often in missing status or check shelf still. On 5/28 3 missing items were returned with this pattern of damage. LTAS KFW asked BC if he had returned the items, BC admitted he did. KFW showed him the damage on all three items, BC claimed that they were damaged when he took them out. KFW has spoke with BC before about reporting damaged items to a staff member before taking them as that is a frequent excuse he uses. KFW has also spoken with BC about checking out all items that he takes with him out of the building. Since 2 of the items met deselection guidelines KFW chose only to bill for one of the three items.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.2 Strong odors    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Approaching library customers for help with self care needs.
Description: Mr. Killmer has a history of issues with incontinence and extreme odor. Mr. Killmer is wheelchair bound and regularly struggles to manage his own needs around hygiene and defecation. On this day his odor was notable prior to entry. LIII KW spoke with him about connecting with resources and has connected with resource navigator KW in an effort to help Mr. Killmer secure help. After Mr. Killmer went to change his pants, guard CS reported that multiple customer's exited and reported that Mr. Killmer had asked them to help him to put on pants. Mr. Killmer's odor was notable for the remainer of his visit. It is unclear whether he has followed up with the resource navigator. For documentation.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
A couple who had been arguing in the library loudly at the computers area were previously relocated to a study room as a civil compromise to allow them to remain in the library while not disturbing patrons. At one point a manager (LG) passed the study room and the couple were prone on the floor, she asked them to remain seated in the chairs provided.When I returned from lunch (~12:45 pm), LG briefed me about this situation and asked that I remain vigilant if this couple continued to misbehave.
At about 2 pm, as Page ZS was leaving through our delivery entrance and reported that this couple were fighting again and doing so very loudly.DW was at the front desk when the male came out yelling and swearing about the woman while moving his wheelchair. The statement he made: "That bitch is crazy! She won't stop hitting me!" He mentioned that she had struck him. He was followed by the female with her walker screaming at him loudly. This yelling caught the attention of every person inside the library. The man and woman began fighting, screaming loudly in full view of everyone as security guard GH moved toward them accompanied by all library staff on hand."Dial 911" LA (DS) said. I did so while the couple quickly moved out of our front door and into the entry courtyard. I remained on the line and got a recorded message at 911- the crowd who had followed this couple outside began trickling back into the library and I hung up the phone as I was neither able to see what was going on nor was I speaking to a live person.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.2 Internet use that is harmful to minors    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description: Sub Librarian CE informed LIB CS that the guard had reported to her that customer known as Dylan (last name unknown), who wears a beanie, had exhibited threatening behavior that was cause for concern. The guard had walked around where he was on a computer viewing porn because children were present in the area. The customer changed his screen and then turned towards the guard and moved his metal straw back in forth agitatedly. The guard looked around thinking that he was motioning to someone behind him but didn't see anyone. The guard pointed to himself and the customer nodded yes. LIB CS walked out to observe and noticed that the customer had logged off the computer and started pacing in the stacks and out the door and back. At one point, he walked by LIB CS and she greeted him. He didn't respond and walked on by. He stopped at the pole near the computers for a minute or two and then walked out the door. Staff and the guard have noticed that his behavior has been erratic. One day he waved and smiled at the guard and waved and smirked at staff. His erratic behavior is cause for concern for staff and guard safety. A wellness check may be needed.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description: At approximately 2:54pm LA TW and LTA NG were approached by a minor (16 years old, female) at the 2nd floor desk who asked them for assistance. She reported that another patron (male, in his 50s, white hair with crooked teeth and a brown complexion) had approached her and made inappropriate sexual remarks, asking for her information and making comments about taking her out "when he got paid," having breakfast in bed, and asking her to meet him back here on Monday. The patron wrote his name and phone number on a card and gave it to her. The minor then got up and approached staff at the desk, who took her to the back staff-only area where LII KW spoke to her while she called her parents. LIC PP and LII KW then circled the floors and checked security footage but could not identify anyone that fit the description still in the building. Officer A. Aguilar was on site and attempted to call the phone number the man provided, but the number was not registered. He spoke with the minor and she declined to file a police report. The information that was written on the card was: Mario Castillo, 520-535-9910.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: On Wednesday, 5/29 at approximately 5:00 pm, library page A.M. reported a strong odor of fentanyl in the men’s restroom. LTA Sup S.G. investigated the odor to confirm the origin and locked the restroom for the remainder of the day.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.5 Indecent exposure, public indecency, lewd, other sexual offense~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Creating biohazards~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Red - High Impact (Please click Notifications > Email aliases > Copy Trauma Informed Care Team if your location would like to request group EAP support)
Description:
L2 KVN was monitoring regular patron Alan Killmer to ensure he left the library on time. Alan is in a wheelchair and regularly takes 10-15 minutes to pack up and leave at library closing, so staff monitor him and start the process earlier than close. After his PC signed off, KVN was assisting LTA DM with another patron when she noticed both of Alan's hands in his pants. As KVN approached, she could see Alan's exposed genitalia inside his pants - both through his stretched button fly and because his pants were being held open. Alan was peeing into a bottle at the PC. KVN asked "Do you need help packing up" which caused Alan to jump and disengage. He shook his head no but put the bottle of urine on the desk. He eventually packed the bottle with his items indicating that that any of the bottles he may be carrying may contain urine. 
Since Alan takes a while to clean up, KVN waited until he started to starting leaving the library right at 6pm. She had Guard CS back her up and told him "What you were doing at the PC is unacceptable." Alan did not respond and left the building. KVN did not address it further on 5/29. 
After addressing the situation, Page BP pointed out there was a wet spot under the PC he was using. KVN recognized it was urine that had missed the bottle (including from her surprising him in the act) and gave the floor and desk area an extra cleaning prior to leaving the building.

Infractions: Children in the Library    Children in the Library: Other not listed: Runaway
Description:
In the 2PM hour, a police officer arrived at the Murphy-Wilmot branch and approached LTA Sup AP at the desk asking if a teenager was there. LTA Sup AP told him he was welcomed to look around the library. The police officer informed desk staff that the teen had called from the Wilmot courtesy phone to turn himself in and was a runaway from a domestic violence situation. While the police officer looked around the building, the teenager came to the front desk and asked for assistance in turning himself in to the officer in the building. The officer and teen met up and resolved the issue outside in a peaceful manner.
This is for documentation purposes only.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description:
On 5/29 at approximately 5:30pm, LIII AL had a conversation with a teen patron who was passed out in the corner of the library. He had been drinking. LIII AL informed him that he was not allowed to drink in the library or to bring alcohol into the library.
On 5/30 at approximately 4:15pm, LA WB informed in-charge LII AD that he had observed the same patron with multiple bottles of alcohol in his backpack and an open smaller water bottle filled with a liquid that appeared to be the same color. LII AD and WB walked over to speak to the patron, who immediately covered his backpack protectively. AD informed him that because of the alcohol present in his bag and the open container, today wasn't a good day to be in the library. The patron denied having been drinking and claimed the bottles in his bag were empties from the weekend. AD informed him that he would still need to leave as he had already been warned about the presence of alcohol in the library. AD told him that he was welcome back tomorrow but that he would need to be completely free of alcohol, including getting rid of any empties in his bag. Patron left peacefully.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.4 Sleeping~Medical 911
Description: Customer was deeply asleep at the computer, with his face planted on the keyboard. Library staff and guard could not wake him. HR called 911. They responded within 5 minutes and were able to rouse the customer, who declined further assistance. A few minutes after the paramedics left, the customer fell asleep at the computer again. Guard DT woke him up and told him he needed to leave for the day.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description: Page HP informed her supervisor JCB that regular patron Robert Wenger approached her as she went out on Computer Monitor station.  He stated "Hello Darling. You have a beautiful smile.  I took a picture of you the other day.  Did you notice me?"

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description:
Security Officer on site reported a chemical smell coming from the restroom to in-charge staff LA DW. DW confirmed with manager IR that the smell was consistent with the burnt chemical smell caused by smoking illicit drugs in an enclosed area. IR confirmed with the security officer that only one person was in the restroom when he noticed the smell. The S.O. indicated that the man had been in the restroom for about 20 minutes and was flushing the toilet repeatedly but had not come out. IR confirmed that the smell was a burnt chemical smell and not the smell of human waste or biomatter. IR knocked on the men's restroom door and let the man in the restroom know that she needed to talk to him outside. 
IR talked to the man and let him know that he would be issued a one-year suspension due to drug use in the restroom. When asked if he would like to wait a few minutes for a suspension letter he could refer to for the suspension end date, the man said no and left the library property without further incident.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1 Any criminal offense
Description:
Man came in around noon and sat down at computer 22.  When LA DW returned to the desk at 2, same man was using computer 17.  He got up to leave at around 5 after 2, and LA DW put on gloves to wipe down both computers and chairs he had used and pick up a few pieces of trash on the floor around these computers.  One of the pieces of trash turned out to be a used drug foil.  It was handed over to TPD officer on duty.  When looking at camera it was determined that the foil fell out of same man's pocket.
 Patron entered library 6-26-2024 and was served his suspension letter. DW let him know that he was seen on the camera with the used foil falling out of his pocket.  In charge staff DW and LC found out that Peter is on sobriety journey.  He expressed that he will go downtown to talk to someone at Main Library to discuss his suspension.   DW and LC instructed VETSEC guard to stand at front desk in case further assistance was needed. Peter left the library calmly understanding the circumstances.

Infraction Categories: Medical 911~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Red - High Impact (Please click Notifications > Email aliases > Copy Trauma Informed Care Team if your location would like to request group EAP support)
Description:
A concerned patron reported someone slumped over next to the front door to L2 KVN at the desk. KVN went to investigate and found the patron on the ground, curled up in a fetal position, unresponsive but breathing. KVN called 911 and instructed L1 MC to grab narcan. Other patrons reported seeing the patron coming out of the bathroom in a daze and slumping against the wall before falling on the ground. 
While on the phone, the 911 operator requested KVN to administer the narcan. KVN administered 2 doses waiting for paramedics to arrive. The patron continued to breathe heavily and unevenly and remained unresponsive. 
When paramedics arrived, they made the patron sit upright, checked his vitals, and asked him questions. Patron denied drug use and refused transport to the hospital or further medical care.
KVN and MC provided the patron with a water bottle for water and a breakfast snack, as he had reported not eating. The paramedics left and the patron left the property.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms~Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description:
Individual from Incident 0000023453 returned to the library and entered the restroom. A short while later Guard JQ heard him yelling in the stall. The guard and L1 MNC entered the restroom and the man began yelling about being in pain and wanting medical assistance. L2 KVN came to the restroom to monitor the individual's well being while MNC called 911. The man crawled out of the stall and began writhing on the floor and moaning. There was still drug paraphernalia and fentanyl pills in the stall and the man was verbally admitting to having smoked more fentanyl moments earlier. MNC called 911 again to update the first responders that this was the same individual to whom KVN had administered Narcan and that he had just taken more drugs.
While in the restroom, KVN had to verbally prevent the patron from using more fentanyl. 
Paramedics from TFD arrived within 10 minutes and assessed the individual. He kept reaching for the fentanyl while the paramedics were trying to assist him. They requested an ambulance to transport the individual and when it arrived, they transported the individual to the hospital.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal
Description: Patron #1 was walking through the library with her dog to the computer room, when her dog met patron #2 with a dog and the bigger dog from patron #1, lunged at patron #2's two dogs. Both patrons were asked to leave because of the lunging and the barking.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description: Drug use in women's restroom. Unknown female user. Guard received a report from a mom that there was a bad chemical smell from the in women's restroom. VAL in-charge staff were called and they determined that this smell was consistent with the smoking of chemical drugs in the restroom. Due to the restroom door being unlocked and high traffic from a children's program it was not possible to determine additional details of identity of the drug user in the women's restroom.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: L1 KB saw suspended customer using the public phone.  She was wearing the same clothing as she did during her last incident. L3 KK chose not to approach the customer given their history of violent behavior.  KK call 9-911.  About 5 minutes, later the suspended customer left the property.  KK called and cancelled the 911 call.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing~Medical 911
Description: At 12:00pm, Guard JD and L3 KK found a recently released Saint Joseph's Hospital patient laying on a sidewalk on the west side of the property.  The man was wearing hospital socks (no shoes), a paper hospital gown for a shirt, and jeans.  He was extremely groggy so KK called 911.  While waiting for paramedics, the man got up and starting staggering along Wilmot Road.  He collapsed about 20 feet later under a tree along Wilmot Road. After about 10 minutes, paramedics arrived and, after shaking the man a bit, managed to rouse him.  The man refused medical treatment.  Paramedics advised staff to call TPD.  The man then made his way into the library's entry restroom.  KK called 911 for a TPD response. KK suggested the Community Crisis might be a good fit for the situation.  By this time, the man had been in the restroom for about 15-20 minutes so KK, JD and L1 KB began knocking on the door.  When there was repeatedly no response, JD unlocked the door and found the man laying on the ground in front of the door.  JD instructed to man to come out of the restroom and KK confirmed that the man did not have a cell phone and therefore would not be able to use the 211 Transportation Services.  Ricky, the police liaison with the Community Crisis Line, called and KK asked that he send his staff.  Community Crisis Staff arrived at about 1:15pm and, during their assessment, determined that the man was medically vulnerable and "barely breathing."  By this time, the man was laying on the concrete outside in front of the pickup locker area.  Crisis staff managed to rouse him and noted that the man may be struggling to stay awake because of the heat. The Community Crisis staff were finally able to wake the man and convinced him to go to a shelter.   However, the man started talking about guns or knives which seemed to be associated with suicidal thoughts.  The Crisis staff thought it would be unsafe for them to transport the individual and called to have him trespassed from the library and driven to detox.  TPD arrived at about 1:45p and transported the man to the Community Bridges facility.  TPD Officer told the man that he could not return to library property.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: A regular patron came in disgruntled, shirtless with a bloody nose wanting to get water. Patron was rummaging through his belongs looking for a cup to fill water with when Guard approached him letting him know he needed a shirt to enter a library. this angered the patron as he was assuming he was not being allowed inside and yelled to leave him alone that he just wanted to water and he'd leave. guard and L2 VV watched the situation allowing him to get water to cool down as he the heat was most likely agitating him but wanted to remind him to put his shirt on if he'd like to be in the library, but patron was intimidated by their presence and then got more upset dinking a sip of his water throwing the rest on the ground and throwing the cup on the floor. Patron left yelling that he was being harassed.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: On June 3, 2024, a frequent patron (unknown name) sat at computer 23 with his laptop, and once he left the mouse to the computer was gone. Via the camera, the patron can be seen sitting down at the computer with both keyboard and mouse intact. A little after sitting down the patron is seen going behind the desktop computer number 23. At around 12:35, the patron is seen taking the  mouse, as he was cleaning up the area to leave.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description: Suspended patron Reginald Johnson called the Main Library and spoke to L1 SG. He demanded to speak to the manager about his suspension letter. L2 CS was just starting on the desk, so she stepped in to explain the procedure for appealing a suspension. Mr. Johnson was rude and aggressive over the phone and would not let CS speak at all. He insisted that he could not be the person involved in the incident, since there was no way library staff could have known his name. He accused CS and other library staff of racially profiling him and wanted to know the full description of the person involved. He also said that he would sue the library several times because CS and the rest of the library were clearly targeting him. CS tried several times to interject and let him know the process for appealing his suspension, but he continued to shout over her, seeming to get more angry as the call continued. Eventually, CS told him that if he continued to shout at her, she would end the call. Mr. Johnson immediately apologized and listened as CS told him how to appeal and gave him the Library Director's phone number. When she finished, Mr. Johnson sarcastically said, "You know what? You have a nice day," and hung up.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description:
L2, MC was speaking to the guard regarding a separate mater and recognized the smell consistent with Fentanyl.  L1 LC confirmed the smell and went with MC to check the public restrooms.
No drug paraphernalia was found.  The odor was very strong in the women's restrooms.  Both restrooms were locked and the air scrubber was placed in the women's restrooms.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description:
Patron approached the front desk asking for her phone that was left in the charging station over the weekend. Library Page Z.S. helped her check the charging station. Patron couldn't recall which locker her phone was in. Z.S. then asked LTA Sup G.G. and they proceeded to check lost and found. G.G. stated to the patron that items left in phone tower are not the library's responsibility, and patron became agitated and started raising her voice. Then LA M.N. heard the commotion and recalled removing a phone on Friday and placing it in lost and found. M.N. proceeded to assist patron and explained that she first needed to verify that the phone belonged to her. Patron was initially cooperative, but she became disruptive after verification was confirmed and the phone was handed to her. Patron started raising her voice to M.N., saying M.N. was accusing her of being a thief and a liar by asking her to verify that it was her phone. M.N. tried to explain it's protocol and staff have to do this for all lost and found items. Patron then asked for the library director's number and the name of M.N. to make a complaint against her. G.G. asked her to calm down and lower her voice and she complied, G.G. gave her the info she requested and continued to explain library procedures of lost and found items. Patron then left the building without further incident.
For documentation only.

Location: Frank De La Cruz-El Pueblo Library
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: After being inside the library for approximately 1.5 hours without incident, unknown patron exited the library at 12:59 p.m. heading to the north side of the building. Guard JP patrolled this area at 1:03 p.m. and found the patron with aluminum foil and a lighter. Guard JP asked patron to leave. She called for a second patron, who retrieved a bag from one of the computers and then they both left through the north gate without further incident.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: At about 2:18pm, ICMG responded to a Teams report that there were two patrons arguing on the first floor. She was told by Guard J that two men were arguing and she heard them threaten each other. One of the men (with a walker) left the building immediately, and the other, later identified as Joseph P. Gleason, walked to the second floor. MG and Guard J went to the second floor and confronted Mr. Gleason, telling him that witnesses heard him arguing and threatening the other man. Gleason became indignant and denied threatening anyone and told us that the other man had threatened him with a knife earlier that day on the bus. Finally, Gleason said he would leave after he checked out a book out. MG and Officer J followed him downstairs. Gleason continued to deny and argue and complain. He complained that the libraries have become shelters and let all "the bad guys" in. Once downstairs he continued to be unpleasant and argumentative, while denying that he threatened anyone. Eventually he gathered his belongings, checked his book out, and left.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Personal behavior
Description: After helping Wassim Khawan print a document from his phone during the 1pm-2pm desk hour, LA RG went outside around 2:30pm on the way to fetch something from her car and encountered WK in the parking lot. He was carrying a sealed boba tea and straw and said "I was hoping to encounter you inside, but you were so helpful and kind earlier I wanted to get you something." He then attached a post-it note to the drink and handed it to LA RG. LA RG said, "That's so sweet, thank you so much!" and then went back inside of going to her car. The post-it note said "Thank you! You are very beautiful and kind <3 I would like to take you out for a coffee. Wassim" with his phone number attached. LA RG did not drink the drink and reported the note to LIBIII KK later that day, who called WK at 4:45pm and informed him that asking library staff out was sexual harrassment and asked him to keep his interactions to library business in the future. WK apologized profusely and then called back again at 4:50pm to apologize more. He has stated that he will behave appropriately from now on.
LA MA reported to LII IC PP that a patron was having trouble breathing. When offered assistance the patron requested 911. TFD arrived and treated the patron, who then left the property.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description: At 12:15 library patron Gabriel can be seen on security footage approaching a petition gatherer/tabler outside near the library bike rack. On the footage, Gabriel leans over the person at the table, grabs the other person's phone out of his hand, and puts it down on the table in front of him. The two seem to exchange words, and Gabriel enters the library. He then goes to a study room he had been using, collects his things, and exits a couple minutes later. The person at the table made a call to law enforcement about the incident, but did not enter the library or alert library staff as to what had happened.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property
Description: at approximately 3:20pm Guard DR approached L3 LD to let her know that a patron sitting on one of the 2nd floor tables by the nonfiction are had witnessed a group of 6 teenagers vandalized 2 adjacent tables. L3 LD corroborated the information with the witness. The group of teenagers had already exited the building. L3 was reviewing camera footage to identify individuals, when she received a called from guard JP that the group had returned to the library at approximately 3:40pm. L3 and guard DR waited for the group on the 2nd floor and indicated that they had violated the library code of conduct by destroying library property and that they will be suspended for 1 month. the group exited the building immediately escorted by L3 LD and Guard DR.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: A patron "Steve" approached the front desk and asked to call 911 on his behalf. He reported feeling nauseated, light-headed, and in need to be taken to the hospital. L2 ID called 911 and reported that per patron, he was a veteran with medical problems, diabetic, and with high blood pressure. The paramedics arrived within 10 minutes. As "Steve" was homeless and disabled, there was a problem with his wheelchair. The ambulance could not take it with the patient. The paramedics tried to solve the problem calling the police but failed to sort it out. After some discussion with the library staff and L2 AD, it was decided to accommodate "Steve" with holding his wheelchair temporarily at the breezeway area outside of the library. "Steve" agreed to sign a note saying that PCPL won't be held liable for any loss/damage of his electric wheelchair. At 5:30 pm the patron was taken to the hospital.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: called 911 for assistance with a man who reported having current thoughts of suicide and thoughts of hurting others. 911 call for medical assistance dispatched crisis line.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Alcohol intoxication
Description: Older African American male came into the library to charge his phone and read materials. But he was already intoxicated. He started talking loud and crowd was over hearing his loud conversation while using the "Nigga" word. The manager went over with guard and asked him to keep it down and asked if he needed a study room. He was very incoherent so the patron said he would leave and I seconded his choice and he left.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description: Around 3:50pm LI KG let IC LII KW know a patron was being disruptive and approaching teenagers on the 2nd floor. KW observed patron Maria as she was escalating and asking incoherent questions, pacing around the area and wearing only one shoe. KW asked her to put her shoe on, lower her voice and not approach teenagers. The patron became argumentative and agitated. IC switched to LII PP who met staff and Guards J & S at the desk. The patron was yelling loudly around the charging station saying she could not access her phone, pacing, tossing bits of paper over the railing of the balcony, and threatening Guard J by getting very close to her, as well as refusing to leave or lower her voice when asked by staff. IC PP called 911 while LIIIs LF and LD approached the patron and retrieved her phone. The patron calmed but continued to refuse to leave the building. LIII LF reiterated that she needed to leave the building and could return to speak about the incident and suspension the following day. The patron left the building but remained in the plaza until police arrived, then left the property.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description: As LIII TFL gave the group at teen computers a 2nd warning for language and volume Juma asked if she had been to a "DD" party. Based on a search of the internet, this question was not an appropriate thing to ask a staff member. LIII TFL let Juma know that his question had been inappropriate to ask anyone, staff or others, and he was asked to leave for the day. He was informed he is welcome back tomorrow.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: At about 12:30pm, a man leaving the 2nd floor men's bathroom told Guard D that someone was smoking fentanyl by the urinals. Guard D went into the bathroom to a heavy drug smell and saw a man put drugs and paraphernalia into his pocket. When confronted, he told Guard D that it wasn't him. Guard D left the bathroom and spoke to me. Together we waited for the man to leave the bathroom and I told him he had to leave for the day. After some denials and complaints, he agreed to leave. I asked if he had stuff, and he said he did downstairs. He went downstairs in the elevator and I went down the stairs and met him. He gathered his stuff together and left the building.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal
Description:
At around 1:30PM, desk staff observed a young woman and her husky dog in the lobby by the restrooms. Another patron with their dog came into the lobby to use the restroom, at which point the husky dog snapped and barked at the other dog. The woman brought her dog around the corner to the water fountains to separate the dogs. She tried to give her dog water and spilled it on the floor. LTA Sup AP approached the woman and she stated that the dog was young and was her emotional support animal. AP informed her that only service animals were allow in the building and offered to help the woman with whatever services she needs. The woman asked for a cup so that she can give her dog water. AP filled up a cup of water for her at which point L3 KK arrived to speak to the woman. L3 KK discovered the woman was in distress and her 2 year old husky named Conrad was her emotional support animal. L3 KK told the woman that she can try to come back again tomorrow but if the dog is disruptive again that we would have to ask him to leave again. KK also offered to call for assistance which the customer declined. KK spoke to customer until she appeared calm. KK helped the customer carry her items out to her car. Customer said she was going to drive to her parents house. KK walked away as the customer appeared ready to leave.
In the 2PM hour, a different customer spoke with the woman and learned that the woman had found the dog earlier that day abandoned in a park. The second customer convinced the woman to surrender the dog to them and the second customer also called the crisis team for her. The second customer was prepared with a collar, leash, and vest for the dog. The crisis team showed up and spoke to the woman and they all left. 
For documentation purposes.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Description: LA NG was walking back to desk after helping a patron in the computer area.  She saw a man with dreadlocked hair walking away from the desk area with 3 milks that staff give with the breakfast packs in his hand and noticed a couple of the milks kept on the cart behind the desk were out of alignment, so he has been behind the desk when no employees were present.  LA NG said "excuse me, sir" to him as he was walking away and he said "fuck you" as he rounded the corner to the lobby.  No further action was taking as he was leaving.  This is for documentation purposes.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.10 Creating tripping hazards, blocking aisles, exits, entrances
Description: Placing an overloaded shopping cart in the library's external breezeway, near an emergency exit. This patron has been repeatedly warned not to obstruct passage with his cart. Security guard GH and me (L1 DW) asked the patron to remove his cart, GH mentioned that she had warned him repeatedly about this problem. The patron in question calmly left the library and moved his cart. A verbal warning was issued.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: Loose Aggressive Dog~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal
Description:
Around 12:30pm L1 JB reported a loose and aggressive dog in the parking lot. Guard CS and JB went outside and discovered Rufus, a regular dog who is usually attended by his teen human Zay Lopez, alone in the parking lot. Rufus was hiding under a car, and when CS and JB tried to coax him out, Rufus was barking aggressively, raising his hackles, snarling, and lunging at CS and JB. 
L2 KVN took over and went outside. While CS attempted to offer Rufus water and befriend Rufus, KVN called PACC dispatch to report a loose and aggressive dog. Rufus continued to act aggressively toward CS, and when CS stood up to move away from Rufus, Rufus lunged forward and acted as though he wanted to bite CS's leg. Rufus did not respond positively to any attempts to help him or bring him to safety inside, and neither CS nor KVN could get close without a potential bite risk. 
Rufus eventually moved to the edge of library property and waited under a tree, but continued to bark aggressively at CS, KVN, and other cars driving by. He then ran across Columbus street to a car dealership. PACC said there would be no ETA for assistance. 
Once off property, KVN went inside and got assistance from JB and LTA DM to find Zay's library account and call him. While on the phone, Zay said "that crazy dog man!" and reported he had been looking for him everywhere. Zay said "it's too hot to be doing this, man" in reference to picking up his dog. KVN reported that Rufus was at the dealership across Columbus street and that PACC had been called if they couldn't find him. Zay indicated he was on his way.
Fortunately, Zay and Rufus did reunite and Rufus is safe and re-entered the library around 1pm. Unfortunately, while Rufus is normally behaved inside the library, the behavior he showed while scared was concerning to staff and patrons. Additionally, Zay has been seen repeatedly leaving Rufus unattended in the library the last week and leaves multiple bowls of water for Rufus all over the library (including near PCs). For this reason, Rufus will be asked not to return to the library.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.4 Sleeping    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: at approximately 1:45 pm on site off duty officer Aguilar performed a wellness check on patron sleeping on the landing area between the1st and 2nd floor. patron (steve#2), became aggressive towards the officer, calling him racist and other slurs. Officer asked patron to composed himself. Patron escalated the situation by continue to insult the officer and increase the volume of his voice, officer asked patron to leave for the day and escorted him out of the building along with IC L3 LD and Guard S.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal
Description: Patron and her Chihuahua mix dog were seated on the floor next to the upholstered chairs. A teen volunteer was walking quickly through the area, and the dog growled and lunged at the volunteer. L1 KH approached the patron and informed her that the dog was not displaying appropriate service animal behavior. KH stated that she (the patron) was welcome to stay, but the dog would need to leave for the day. Patron explained that the dog will lunge at anything fast-moving. KH informed her that such behavior was not allowable in the library for safety reasons. The woman and the dog left the library. Patron was heard praising the dog for "still knowing how to attack" on the way out the door.

Minutes before closing, EMTs arrived to provide care for a library patron who had gone outside already. The patron called 911 for themselves and staff were unaware they were in need of assistance until help actually arrived. Patron was transported to the hospital.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property
Description: Staff reviewed camera footage, after finding human feces hidden behind a pillar structure near the entrance on the West side of the building. An unknown individual is seen defecting at the spot at 7:41 pm.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1 Any criminal offense    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Patron A launched a series of insults at Patrons B and C. B and C insulted Patron A right back. Guards J D and S approached the interaction and Patrons B and C apologized and attempted to disengage completely from the interaction. Patron A continued to yell insults and threats at B and C. Patron A will be suspended for one month, Patron B and C were asked to get staff immediately if any problems occurred.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description:
A woman who recently started coming to the library regularly to use the computers was on computer 18 and another patron in a nearby computer (man on computer 14) told her she was being too loud and it was bothering him. The woman on computer 18 reacted with threatening words to him and abusive language including "I'm going to shoot you". 
In-charge librarian RL let her know that threatening others and using abusive language was not allowed in the library and that she would have to leave for the day. During this interaction, the woman on computer 18 continued to become agitated and escalated her abusive language, now directed at RL. After additional requests to leave for the day were met with further verbal abuse, RL notified branch manager IR that she had done everything she could and IR took over the interaction with the woman. IR let her know that due to the threatening behavior and verbal abuse, she was being requested to leave for the day, but IR could bring over a bag if she needed help collecting her belongings and a water bottle. The woman did not comply with staff request to leave but started additional abusive language with the new staff. After 10 minutes of back-and-forth with the woman on computer 18 and refusal to leave her spot, IR requested assistance from on-site TPD officer to provide support in escorting the woman out. After additional abusive language to the TPD officer, the woman left and did not return for the rest of the day.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
Approx. 3:50pm, a regular patron approached in-charge Librarian II AD at the front desk and said "The guy on #6 is talking to himself about planning a shooting." The patron he indicated (Patron A) has been a regular at GLF over the past few weeks and staff remind him near daily to keep his voice down and/or relocate out of the computer lab (which is a designated quiet area). He has also been talked to on several occasions about the content of his conversations, including reminders not to use profanity or talk about subjects that could alarm other library users.
LII AD approached Patron A in the computer lab and reminded him that we had had these conversations several times and asked him to relocate to another computer, outside of the lab. LII AD also warned Patron A not to talk about anything that could make other library users feel alarmed or harassed. He nodded and turned back to his screen, so LII AD left to allow him time and space to comply with the request.
About 20 minutes later, at 4:10pm, LA KK alerted LII AD that there had been another complaint about Patron A, including that he was still talking about "shooting people". The patron who reported this left in distress after telling staff. LII AD and LI MM went out onto the floor, and discovered that Patron A had not moved from the lab and was still audibly muttering to himself. As soon as he saw LII AD and LI MM, he quickly closed his browser and yanked his headphones out of the computer, hurrying quickly away as LII AD said "It's not a good day for you to be in the library, you can try again tomorrow."

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
Approx. 4:35pm, in-charge LII AD received a call from phone number 520-548-8415. The patron asked if we could let her know if the library card she had was active or not, so LII AD requested that she read the number on the back. When entered, the number returned "barcode not found", so LII AD asked the patron to read the number again to verify it. She immediately became hostile, yelling "What's going on here? I read you the number!" LII AD explained that it had said "barcode not found" and that they wanted to re-enter the number to be sure that it really was inactive before telling the patron that it was inactive. She continued yelling "No, it's because you went too fast and didn't do it right! Slow down and do it right this time!"
At this point, LII AD informed her that she could not speak to staff that way and that they would be ending the call. She hung up before LII AD could terminate the call.
A search of the phone # revealed an attached account for Marisa Soto.
