Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description:
At around 4pm Page HP reported to L2 KVN that an unknown patron at PC #18 stole a ruler from a regular patron sitting at PC #16 when she was not looking. The unknown patron also popped up his PC camera and turned his screen to face the regular patron, and then turned his PC to face HP while she was the computer monitor. 
KVN decided to wait and monitor the situation to see if the unknown patron had potentially borrowed the ruler with the regular patron's permission. KVN noticed the unknown patron repeatedly looking at the regular patron (staring at her every 10 seconds) and seeming to engage with her. The unknown patron did engage with other patrons in the café area briefly before returning to his behavior in the PC area.
Around 5:00pm HP found the ruler left unattended in the cafe area and turned it in to KVN. KVN held onto it to see if the regular patron asked about it at the desk.
At 5:15pm the unknown patron left. Before he left, he dug through the trashcan in the lobby and pulled out a backpack.
Around 5:30pm the regular patron asked the desk if a ruler had been found. KVN went to talk to her and told her it had been found in the café area and there were reports that potentially another patron took it. KVN asked if she loaned out the ruler. The regular patron became distressed and reported discomfort at the actions of the unknown patron at PC #18. She reported he took his PC label off and put it next to her without saying a word, and she believes he took her ruler while distracting her with that. She reported his repeated stares and looking over made her uncomfortable, and that she had not been talking to him and did not know why he was doing that.
Another regular patron had been sitting with her (they had previously not interacted) and reported that he sat with her because of the unknown patrons odd behavior. 
KVN will follow-up if the unknown patron returns.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using    1.1.10 Remaining inside the library after closing, including emergency closures~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description:
A woman was in restroom at 5:50 when Guard CS went to lock it. At 6pm, she still would not exit despite several prompts from guard and staff.  During this time, she tried to flush something multiple times. She finally exited around 6:10pm. As she was leaving, the guard saw a straw in her hand and L1 MNC checked the bathroom. He recognized a chemical smell consistent with drug use partially obfuscated with perfume or body spray. Upon review of the cameras, she had spent over 40 minutes in the restroom.
She will be suspended for one year for using drugs in the restroom and not complying with staff directions to leave the library after closing.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft    1.1.4 Vandalizing property~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description:
On Friday morning, a regular patron informed staff that the memorial fig tree had been pulled out of the planters out front. Upon reviewing the camera footage, a young person walked up to the planter, pulled out that specific tree, and jogged off while looking around for pursuit.
The planter (including the memorial fig tree) was planted in honor of Fred Fisher, a long-time volunteer at Main Library with watering the planters, helping the seed library and selecting books for Books on Wheels. Staff worked with the community to plant and remember him, and this planter and tree are important to the library.

Infractions: Children in the Library    4.3 Adult loitering in children's area
Description:
Intern KC was assisting L MG in Babytime when he and other patrons noticed an adult female patron pressed against the meeting room windows, watching the story time. MG instructed KC to tell staff in the back. 
L1 JB approached the patron and asked if she had family/a child in the storytime. The patron said no. JB asked if she needed help with anything. The patron said no.
JB left to report to L2 KVN and ask what to do. 
KVN approached the patron and verified that she did not have family inside the storytime. The patron confirmed. KVN began to explain that there had been some patron concerns when the patron threw her hands up and left the library.
The patron gave 1-word answers to both JB and KVN in both interactions. She was abnormally close to the meeting room glass, and staring into the storytime. She was carrying a free parenting guide typically distributed by the library. If there had been more potential for further conversation, KVN would have tried to connect further and find out the purpose behind her watching storytime. However, in light of patron discomfort, it was necessary to discuss her being inside the children's area and staring at the storytime in an abnormal way without a minor at the library with her.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.5 Soliciting handouts, donations, contributions~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Red - High Impact (Please click Notifications > Email aliases > Copy Trauma Informed Care Team if your location would like to request group EAP support)
Description:
Nate frequently shares details about his personal life with L2 KVN after the discussion on 5/9. KVN attempts to keep the conversations short, but tries to show compassion and support in the information he shares. In 2 conversations, Nate asked for money from KVN, to which she said "Sorry, I don't have any." He pressed further both times and KVN would just say "Sorry Nate, I don't carry cash" to try and end the conversation. 
There have been recent incidents between a female patron and Nate, where the female patron has reported Nate for rape and calls 911 from a personal cell when he enters the library with her present. There has been no police response and staff have remained aware but uninvolved. The female patron leaves when Nate arrives at the library, but there are some incidents of arguing. 
Yesterday, Nate asked Guard CS for money for the vending machine and CS warned him that he cannot ask people for money. Nate was not accepting of that feedback. Nate also reported to CS being able to acquire new guns (he told KVN a few weeks ago he lost his gun in a recent shoot out at Reid Park). Nate's reporting on having/carrying guns repeatedly to multiple staff is seen as threatening. 
Today, while on desk Nate shared more details about his life with KVN. He discussed ODing, mixing drugs that exploded, and showed KVN a new (red) vape he acquired. KVN reminded Nate that he cannot smoke it in the library. Nate told her "he's not stupid," to which KVN said she knew, and was just reminding him. Nate then told KVN that he vapes on the 2nd floor of MAI all the time, but would step outside to smoke a cigarette. He requested a snack (there was one snack leftover for adults which KVN provided).
Nate then asked KVN to buy him something from the vending machines. KVN used the same excuse as previous conversations and simply said "I'm sorry Nate, I don't have money." Nate pushed further and asked "You don't have a card?" and which KVN just said "I'm sorry, I can't."
Nate then said "You done messed up Kelli." He shook his head and started walking away and repeated louder "You messed up Kelli."
KVN did not respond.
Roughly 20min later when Nate was leaving the library and KVN was engaged with other patrons at desk, Nate yelled across the library "Goodbye Kelli!" 
Guard CS did report that Nate entered the library today, showed him the red vape, and reported that he was going to use it to "get fucked up." When CS told him he can't use illicit substances in the library, Nate retracted to say it was nicotine. CS also reported Nate frequently asks other patrons for money. 
Nate is being issued a 1-year suspension for carrying and displaying a vape in the library that he stated contains more than nicotine, soliciting money from staff and patrons after receiving a verbal warning, and using threatening language toward a staff member when being denied money.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description:
Regular patron Keith became enraged at another patron for no obvious reason. Keith screamed at the other man for several minutes, accusing him of being a snitch and threatening to assault him. He threw a chair at one point but did not strike anyone. He left the building while still yelling, then continued to yell at himself/nobody on the NE corner of the block for several minutes. Keith then attempted to re-enter the library to confront the man again and was redirected away from the building by staff. He eventually calmed down and apologized for his behavior before leaving towards the church across the street.
Staff called 911 immediately when Keith began loudly confronting the other patron, but eventually canceled the call when he left library property; they showed up anyway at 3:05pm and staff gave them a description of Keith and the direction he had left in.

Infractions: Children in the Library    4.2 Leaving child unsupervised or ignoring disruptive behavior of child
Description:
13-year-old Angelina Ibarra was asked by L1 SG 15min before close how she planned on getting home. Angelina reported having a guardian picking her up, and claimed the guardian was on her way. SG warned Angelina that if her ride had not picked her up by around 5:10pm, staff would be required to sit and wait with her, and at 5:15pm would be required to call the police because it is not a safe area for her to be left alone. SG suggested she make arrangements with her guardian to be picked up at the Burger King across the street, as then she would have more public eyes on her.
At 5:10pm, as staff were leaving COL after close, SG reported to L2 KVN that Angelina was still sitting by herself in the front of the building. An unknown adult male was loitering nearby.
KVN approached Angelina and asked about the status of her ride. Angelina stated that she hadn't heard back from her foster mom, but that she was sure she was on the way. 
Once it was clear staff were staying with her, the unknown adult male left on his bike. 
KVN and Guard CS stayed with Angelina. KVN asked a few more questions from Angelina, and received inconsistent and (at times) incoherent information. Angelina reported being in foster care "since last month" and "since the end of last year." She reported being with her current foster mother "for 4 months" and "since [she] was 4." Angelina stated both that this "happens all the time" and that this had "never happened before." Angelina reported her foster mother has having "3 other children" she was picking-up, and changed her answer when KVN inquired (to build rapport and ease her anxiety) how many of the other kids were her siblings. Angelina also said she was living in a shelter while they waited for housing. 
KVN told Angelina she was going to wait until 5:20pm to call the non-emergency line, hoping to give her guardian more time. KVN asked if Angelina would be comfortable giving KVN her guardian's phone number so KVN could attempt to call her, as Angelina said she had not heard back from her guardian at all. Angelina said she could only message/call her through Facebook messenger and did not have her number.
At 5:20pm Angelina still reported not having heard from her guardian and how close she was. KVN called the non-emergency line and, while on the phone, Angelina immediately started saying she did have her guardians phone number and she had been texting her and she had heard back. 311 indicated they were dispatching an officer with an undetermined ETA.
At closer to 5:30pm, Angelina's guardian arrived. KVN approached the vehicle and Angelina's foster mom got out of the car and stared KVN down with crossed arms. KVN explained the library's policy regarding unattended children, and that for Angelina's safety staff stayed with her after close. KVN explained that she was required to call the non-emergency line for an officer to be dispatched, but that now that she was being picked-up KVN would be canceling the call. KVN also explained that it would be safer to Angelina to make alternative pick-up arrangements if she cannot be picked-up by the library closing time, such as meeting at the Burger King across the street. 
Angelina's guardian rolled her eyes and said "Just one more fucking thing I have to deal with." She then drove away.
KVN called 311 to cancel officer dispatch. 
This PITS is to serve as documentation that this conversation took place, that Angelina was incoherent and inconsistent, and that the guardian was not open to the information. Angelina Ibarra has a mother listed in her Sierra record - undetermined if the guardian identified by Angelina as her "foster mother" is the one in her Sierra record or not. 
UPDATE Saturday, 6/15: Angelina came to the desk with her 4-year-old sister and asked KVN for a guest pass for the PCs. She also asked for a study room. Throughout the day, Angelina and her little sister asked for KVN for help with books, coloring pages, SLP materials, and a 30min extension on the study room. Angelina was much more coherent and open with KVN, and made sure to check-out with KVN at the desk at 4:30, saying they were getting picked up, and asked for a weekend pack. Her little sister got a free SLP book. This showed a positive shift after the previous day's incident.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description:
Due to past instances of disruptive personal behavior, use of language that causes other patrons to feel alarmed or harassed, and escalating instances, it was decided that the Community Wide Crisis Line should be called upon patron return. At 10:00am, patron entered the library and L SM called the Crisis Line for assistance. No timeline was given for a team arrival.
Crisis team of two arrived at 11:15am and attempted to engage with the patron. He wouldn't engage or talk to either individual. The crisis team spoke to LI MM and L SM and told them that if police need to be contacted at a later point, to let the police know we had already contacted the Crisis Line and that they were unable to engage the patron.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property
Description:
Large graffiti found on north facing external wall of COL, facing 22nd street. Undetermined time-frame or patron involvement. 
Reported to online TPD and facilities.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal
Description:
Two medium tall huskie dogs were sitting under the computer table while two adults were using the computer. Both dogs were leashed, but it is not known if the owners were holding the leashes. Another customer was walking a small terrier dog on a long leash in the area of the computer table. One of the huskies came out from under the table and appeared to grab the small dog. There was growling and yelping. The owner of the huskie grabbed the dog and the two dogs were separated. Librarian JD arrived just as the dogs were separated. Page JF witnessed the incident. The huskie owners were asked to leave. They gathered their things while holding the dogs with short leashes and left the library immediately after retrieving their cell phone from the phone charger.
The owner of the small dog, Sylvia, returned to her seat near the north windows of the library. The dog was shaking, but was reported to be fine after being checked by the owner and by another customer who was sitting in the chair next to her. Despite the hairy coat and the vest the dog was wearing, there were no apparent marks or blood seen.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.1 Manipulating or bypassing library rules, such as computer use
Description:
Mary, a patron booked in Study Room #2, approached the service desk close to 1pm and asked if her items would be safe in the study room while she used the restroom. Sub TS informed Mary that her 2 hours in the Study Room was up at 12:45pm and another patron was booked at 1pm, and Mary agreed to move her items. Mary asked if she could extend her time/use another study room, and TS let her know there is a 2 hour max in the study room per day (KVN was present for the conversation). 
At 1:30pm, Page HP received a call from Mary asking to book a study room for today. HP did not think she was the same person from the previous booking and gave her Study Room #2 again from 3pm - 5pm. Mary did not convey she had already used a study room that day.
At around 2:45pm, TS communicated to L2 KVN that Mary had re-entered the study room and had an additional booking. TS reminded her that she had already reached her 2-hour limit and Mary said "I called and they told me it was okay."
Mary was in Study Room #2 prior to her 3pm booking (at around 2:45pm), without asking for entry from desk staff.
On previous Fridays and Saturdays, KVN has had to ask Mary to leave a study room past her booking time or when she did not have a reservation at all. Mary has set up in the study rooms without permission at least twice before.
Due to the history with Mary, KVN printed the COL website that outlines the 2-hour max daily limit, and asked Mary to leave the study room. KVN reminded Mary that TS had already explained that she reached her 2 hour limit for the day. At first Mary said "that's not how it is at other libraries," to which KVN explained they may have other policies because they have more or less study rooms available or it's a less busy day. Mary then said "I didn't see that on your website" so KVN showed her the printed website information. 
KVN invited Mary to continue to use the rest of the library to work. Mary finally complied with the request.
At 3:15pm, LTA AO let KVN know there was a patron on the phone asking to speak with the manager. 
When KVN answered the call, the male patron on the phone Jacob Weill did not identify the situation directly but immediately started saying that the tech team needs to "update the website" and discussed how confusing it is that the link under the Eckstrom-Columbus Library page labeled "study rooms" goes to a list for all meeting/study rooms in PCPL, and that patrons have to click on the "Meeting Rooms" tab to find out the 2-hour study room limit policy. The male patron reported this as being "not intuitive" and said that if [we] updated the website, [we] could avoid situations where staff make "patrons feel embarrassed" and like they were "intentionally skirting the rules" when they "simply did not know the policy" and staff were creating an "unwelcoming environment" by not having "verbal information" or "signs."
Jacob Weill then stated that signs need to be put up "in the library entrance, at the service desk, and on the study room doors" explaining the 2-hour limit policy to ensure that situations do not occur where "adults could feel like they are unknowingly violating the policies when they are just trying to do homework."
KVN listened to Jacob, told him she would talk to the tech team to see if the adjustment could be made on the website, and that she made note of the request for signs regarding the policy. KVN spoke very little during the phone call and did not directly discuss the incident. The phone call ended with issue apparently resolved. 
KVN will discuss with management whether library technology needs to update branch page regarding study room policies. 
Documentation in PITS to demonstrate that this conversation occurred with Mary, that she had been verbally told about the 2-hour max prior to calling COL back and requesting a study room again, and that a person associated with Mary immediately called to complain about the situation.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: Physically Abusing an Animal~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description:
Several times throughout the day, L2 KVN could hear a dog yelp once in the café area. She did not have time to investigate.
At 4:13pm, KVN heard a dog yelp loudly and saw a man carrying a puppy out the West doors, walking quickly. After he had exited, KVN and staff could hear an animal yelping repeatedly. KVN was assisting a patron and unable to get up, but the unknown patron returned with the puppy less than 2 minutes later.
Upon checking the cameras at 4:13:19 outside the West door, KVN can see the male patron throw the puppy onto the ground and kick the puppy repeatedly. 
The male patron immediately packed his bag and left. 
KVN is issuing a 6 month suspension for abusing an animal on library property.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: A White male in his late 20's early 30's, 6 foot tall, light brown hair, with light facial hair, red shirt and jeans.  This individual walked into the Nanini Library just before noon and started shouting "The Flesh Eaters are here, The Flesh Eaters are here. We are at the Los Reales. The Flesh Eaters are here!"  He then preceded to walk out of the Library and into the desert beside the branch.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: For documentation purposes: Lib KV found residue of suspicious-looking, unidentified white powder on the public chair table near the Spanish area shelves at around 5:20 pm.  L1 SG also noticed powder on the floor earlier in the day, around 3 pm, but had not seen any on the table at that time. The areas were cleaned.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1 Any criminal offense    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Page DC reported that a customer was intentionally coughing and sneezing on other customers.  L3 KK and L1 KB and Guard JD approached the customer.  KK asked him to leave.  The customer was initially resistant but then starting walking to the door shouting about "American spies."  When customer exited the building, LTA MG observed him spitting at the Jehovah Witness who in no way provoked him.  He then started screaming at people along the west side of the building.  KK called 911.  While on the phone, the customer left property.  KK made TPD aware that he left the property and was headed north on Wilmot Road.  KK suggested to TPD that they not cancel the call.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: A man wearing a blue beanie hat and black shirt walked into the Nanini Library and approached a male patron proclaiming loudly "You are the Korean president, I know your the Korean president".  The other patron in question calmly told the man I don't know you and walked to the public computers.  Staff began to closely observe the disruptive individual.  After walking around for a few minutes and behind Staff member MJ, he approached another patron (female) at the public computer and slammed his hand down hard on the table beside her saying very loudly "Looks like you have a real gourmet salad, Do you have a bible, I need a bible".  At this point staff member SB asked the man to move away from the female patron so he could help him find a bible and discuss his actions.  Staff member SB requested in charge Librarian SW to talk with the disruptive patron.  He was asked not to bother other patrons and yell in the library, he was shown a bible that he used for a few minutes, he gave the bible to staff member MJ thanked staff for letting him be in the library and left the building without further incident.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description: Regular patron (Anthony?) came in and went to the computers.  After a short time he walked up to the desk to ask for a snack.  He loudly said Fuck this. Lib III KW asked him to not use that language in the library.  He said "Oh yeah. I'm sorry" as he walked back to the computers he continued to speak to nobody in particular but continued using profanity at a loud volume.  KW walked over and asked if he was alright, and noticed that he had a full bottle of alcohol in his inside jacket pocket.  KW told him that he needed to leave because he wasn't able to act properly in the library and wasn't allowed to bring alcohol in.  He was agreeable the whole time but also took a long time and continued to rant and cuss as KW waited with him to walk out. He finally gathered his things and left, although he never quit cussing and talking loud the whole way out. This occurred on the Guard's lunch hour.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description:
At about 3pm, JM reported to the person in-charge that a man on the first floor was exhibiting behavior that made other patrons and staff uncomfortable and feeling threatened. He would stand and stare, with hostile body language. He did this for between 1 and 2 hours around the computers. He then moved to the open part of the lobby and was staring at workers at the front desk. His glare was angry enough that people looked away. He then muttered something and RW asked if he could help him with something. The man then swore at him. He then walked out of the library and stood in the plaza, staring at the library. 
IC MG called the crisis line, who said they couldn't help. 
After about 15 minutes, the man walked away and was seen crossing Stone Avenue and then out of sight.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description: Around 5:30pm staff came to inform LibIII KW that there was a biohazard in the lobby. KW went to lobby to find tracks of fecal matter trailing from the West entrance to the women's restroom.  When KW entered the women's restroom she found more fecal matter on the floor leading to the large ADA stall.  A woman was in the stall and sounded distressed.  KW asked if she was ok, and she responded that she was.  KW asked if she needed anything and she declined. KW went to write a facilities report and luckily there was a custodial staff onsite addressing another facilities issue and offered to clean up.  As we waited for the woman to finish so that the restroom could be cleaned, KW went in again to find the woman washing her clothes in the toilet and wiping up the floor in the stall with a towel.  KW went and found some clean clothing to offer to the woman and a plastic bag to carry the toilet wet clothing.  The woman was very grateful and finally left the room to allow cleaning. KW will speak to the woman when she sees her next to tell her that she understood the impossibility of the situation, but to please ask for staff assistance when she is in need rather than washing clothing in the toilet.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: A customer called saying they left their bag in the library, and asked staff to see if it was there. Staff did not find the bag. The customer called again, saying that there were two laptops in the bag, and asked staff to check again. The customer called again the next day on 6/19, and now say they think the bag and laptops were stolen, and they think they know who took them. Librarian II SW asked if they had reported the theft to law enforcement. The customer said they wanted to check with us first and see if we could look at the security cameras. SW told her we do not have cameras in the area, and even if we did, we could only release images to law enforcement. SW encouraged the customer to report the theft to law enforcement.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1 Any criminal offense    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using    1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Red - High Impact (Please click Notifications > Email aliases > Copy Trauma Informed Care Team if your location would like to request group EAP support)
Description: As Lib III KW and Guard CS were leaving the building they noticed that a man was sitting behind the bushes on the East side of the building.  Earlier in the day KW had asked him to leave that area when she was doing a facilities round.  CS and KW walked over and noticed that the man was surrounded by burnt pieces of foil and had drug paraphernalia on his lap.  KW asked the man to move along and not to do drugs on library property.  The man responded "Fuck you bitch" " Leave me alone". CS told the man to get up or he would be trespassed.  The man responded "I'll fuck you up" and lunged threateningly towards CS.  CS stood his ground and told the man to leave.  The man decided to pull out a pipe and begin smoking drugs. At that point, due to the volatility of the situation, KW informed the man that he was suspended from all libraries for a year and told CS that we would leave and pursue follow up in the morning.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description: LTA EH told L3 MM that a patron asked to speak with the mgr. In an agitated manner and tone the patron told the mgr that she and 3 other family members were sick with covid and claimed that staff made a bad face at her when she asked for covid test kits. She accused staff of lying to her regarding being out of test kits, and she said that she knew we had more elsewhere. MM told the patron that she was sorry that she wasn't feeling well, but that she had, in fact, taken the last test kit at the branch. MM offered to call GLF to confirm that they had more kits. She agreed, but again began to get worked up and accusatory about how awful staff had been, how she didn't believe that there weren't anymore kits, and staff should get them for her now. MM asked her to sit on a bench near the door, told her that she needed to stop accusing staff of having done anything wrong to her because none of them had, and said that if she could remain calm at the bench, the call could be made to GLF. She sat on the bench. She agreed. GLF had test kits. She left.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description:
During mid-day cleaning, our custodian found two small empty vodka bottles in the trash in both the men's and the ladies' rooms, and turned them over to security guard AB, who turned them in to L3 AG. 
Reporting for tracking purposes.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1 Any criminal offense    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.8 Smoking, rolling, using tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes~Medical 911
Description:
Bernie Roach and Tanner Montalvo were smoking/vaping marijuana near the front entrance to the library when Bernie began to have a bad reaction. Witnesses and Tanner both called 911, and Pima County Sheriffs soon responded. L1 KN monitored the scene, and EMTs and Fire dept arrived shortly after and began to provide treatment to Bernie. L3 AG became aware of the incident as the PSM meeting was ending, and went outside to speak to Sheriff Deputy Hanover, who was on scene, as well as witnesses. Bernie was loaded onto a gurney and then onto the ambulance. AG recognized Tanner from the day before, when she had to tell him and another man that they could not smoke on County Property at about 5:55 PM. 
AG informed Deputy Hanover that both would be trespassed for a year due to drug use, and Deputy went to inform both men. Deputy Hanover provided AG with his card, case #, and the two names, and Bernie was transported to the hospital.
On reviewing security footage while trying to get a good image capture, AG found that Tanner Montalvo and the unknown man she had spoken to the day before had been smoking illegal drugs out of foil in front of the library about 10 minutes before she spoke to them the day before.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: Around 10:20 am Patron A came in and was waiting to be helped. LI KM was helping patron B when all of a sudden patron A came up to patron B and began yelling and threating him. Patron A was threatening to break his neck and was claiming that patron B was trying to kill him. From the security cameras we can see that patron B had not engaged with patron A at all. LA CR told patron A that he had to leave for the day and that we would not be helping him with his library card. He began to argue with the staff and Guard MM saying that he was not going to leave until the cops came. Patron A then was threatening staff and said he had a gun. As LA CR was connecting with the dispatcher patron A left the building. Guard MM went after him to confirm he left the area and told Guard MM that he was going to come back with his friends. LA CR ended the call with the dispatch and around 30 minutes later patron A comes back to the property. LA CR alerts the dispatch that he returned and library goes on lockdown. The Santa Rosa Recreational Center and the HeadStart also went into lockdown in that time. Both agencies had altercations with patron A.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description:
At around 1:50pm a patron reported to Guard CS and L3 TFL that another patron was smoking fentanyl outside the library.
Guard CS and TFL investigated and smelled fentanyl but did not find anything.
Upon looking at the cameras for another incident, L2 KVN discovered the patron rolling foil and smoking under his shirt outside the West doors.
He will be suspended for 1 year.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.8 Smoking, rolling, using tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes
Description:
While helping another patron on the printer, L2 KVN noticed a patron in the café area vaping. 
KVN asked Guard CS to be nearby and approached the patron. KVN explained that vaping inside is against library policy, and ask him to leave for the day. She explained he would be welcome to return the following day.
The patron said he "didn't know" and asked if he could please stay. 
However, vaping has not been allowed inside enclosed spaces in AZ for quite some time, so KVN re-emphasized that he could return the following day.
Patron was polite and compliant. 
This is to document the patron has now received a warning regarding the policy.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.2 Unplugging library equipment
Description:
A patron unplugged 3 PCs to plug in his phone charger. This affected a patron in the middle of an application at the job help computer.
L2 KVN went to investigate. KVN explained to the patron that it is against policy to unplug library technology.
The patron was slightly incoherent, and argued that he had to because "his phones were dying." The patron had 2 different phones (a smart phone and a flip phone) and unplugged multiple PCs to charge them. He said the USB port on his PC wasn't working to charge his flip phone and he needed to plug it in so his flip phone "would never die again" and he would "never have to return to the library."
KVN explained that if he needed help finding a plug for his devices, staff at the desk could help him find a wall outlet or book a study room for him.
The patron argued that the outlets under the desk are "basically the same." 
KVN explained that there is additional technology and electrical wiring involved in the PC plugs, and that the library has an entire IT department dedicated to that section of the library which is why unplugging those devices is prohibited.
The patron asked what "IT" meant, to which KVN re-explained the acronym. The patron then began to discuss technology, chemistry, how computers are made, and how he could "never figure out how to put the PC inside the box." 
KVN re-iterated that he was more than welcome to plug in his devices into the USB port on the PC or an open wall charger in the café area, but if he needed additional help finding a charging spot, he needed to ask desk staff for help and not unplug any library devices. The patron finally indicated he understood and would not do it again.
The patron on the job help PC will return tomorrow to finish his application. KVN had previously helped him with his application and assured him most of his work would be saved because he created an account. 
This PITS is for documentation only.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: At 8:56 pm on Thursday night, a man reached through the gate and opened it with the push bar.  He proceeded to steal the cart holding the stainless steel garden hose, trash gripper and other gardening paraphernalia.  The locked gate is not secure and will need to be addressed.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft    1.1.4 Vandalizing property    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description:
At 11:10pm, visible through COL Camera #8, an unknown male patron approached the staff gate and yanked on it a few times. He then broke the lock on the trash bin area and went inside. He went through both dumpsters until 11:16pm. The trash bin lock has been missing.
He then went to the front of the building and pulled plants out of the planters. He removed and walked away with a plant.
Unknown patron receiving a 1 year suspension for trespassing, theft (of trash can lock and plants), and vandalism.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: Former GLF page M made L3 KK aware that suspended customer Jeremy Anderson was using a public PC.  KK, L1 JM and Guard JD approached the customer.  He was wearing the same clothing as he was on the day he was suspended from GLF. KK made the customer aware that he was suspended and asked him to leave.  Mr. Anderson said, "It's not me."  KK asked if he was willing to show ID but Mr. Anderson ignored her.  Given that there was a storytime about to start with dozens of children, KK did not want to do anything further that might provoke Mr. Anderson.  KK called 911 and explained that there were dozens of children in the building and she was concerned that Mr. Anderson may become volatile if we took any further action to remove him.  TPD arrived in about 5 minutes. TPD Officer asked if KK wanted Mr. Anderson removed from property or arrested.  KK asked to have him arrested.  KK also extended customer's suspension by one month and gave the officer a suspension letter to give to the customer.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Red - High Impact (Please click Notifications > Email aliases > Copy Trauma Informed Care Team if your location would like to request group EAP support)
Description:
At 12pm, L2 KVN was approached unexpectedly by a petition passer while sitting in her vehicle with the car door open. The passer approached from behind and startled her. KVN instructed the petition passer to check in at the service desk (COL policy) and instructed the petition passer not to approach patrons in the parking lot for safety reasons. The petition passer asked where he could request signatures from patrons, to which KVN directed him to the shaded area in front of the library, so the petition passer complied with both requests.
At around 12:10pm, the petition passer from KVN's incident and the petition passer from this PITS were seen talking in front of the library. 
At around 1:15pm the petition passer from this PITS was approaching patrons aggressively in the parking library lot. COL staff had already received multiple complaints and concerns about aggressive petition passers in the parking lot. L1 MNC approached him to let him know about the branch's rules for petition passing and expectations as outlined in the Board of Supervisors policy and our Code of Conduct. He stated that the Code of Conduct and Board Policy do not supersede his rights under the law. He then started arguing about AZ Revised Statutes and the 1st Amendment in a very hostile and confrontational way. MNC and Guard CS asked if he was willing to abide by our code of conduct in order to continue his activities and he stated that he was not. MNC let him know that he was being asked to leave the property due to his refusal. The petition passer said that he would not leave and kept trying to argue the law. L1 MNC disengaged as the conversation was not productive. Staff called 911 for support as the passer was being hostile with staff, refusing to leave and continued to approach patrons directly in front of the library doors. L1 MNC and L2 KVN both went to the door and served the petition passer his suspension paperwork.  LI JCB observed the interaction from the lobby and informed LIII KW of the situation.
He demanded MNC's last name multiple times as staff tried to disengage and walked away. MNC did not provide his last name. The petition passer then continued approaching patrons while waving the suspension letter and shouting that the library was denying him his rights.
L1 MNC felt concerned for his safety when leaving the branch at 2:30pm as the petition passer was still circling the parking lot. Branch manager KW walked with him to make sure that the passer did not continue his aggressive behavior toward him. MNC quickly made his way towards his car when the passer approached a family exiting their vehicle on the other side of the parking lot.
A police officer arrived at 2:45pm and asked to speak to the person who made the call.  KW and LI JCB informed him that MNC had left for the day.  The officer interviewed JCB and KW about the incidents and asked the patron to leave.  He continued to argue that this was against his rights.  The officer informed him that he could appeal the action, but he had to comply with the request prior to starting the appeals process.  The patron left and the officer gave JCB a copy of the Victim Notification report,

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling~Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: Guard JD expressed concerned for a customer in the foyer who was unable to stay awake and seemed to be getting worse over the last hour.  L3 KK found the man sitting slumped on the entry bench.  KK attempted to wake him but only got slurred responses. KK asked him if he needed Narcan or a ride to a shelter.  He held his head in his hands and did not reply.  KK made customer aware that she was going to call 911 to check on him but did not get a response.  Paramedics arrived in about 5 minutes.  Paramedics were able to wake him up and the customer immediately began shouting at them and appeared under the influence.  Paramedics said they could not treat him because he was refusing treatment and said they had called TPD because of his behavior.  The customer continued to shout for a few minutes and then left. KK call 911 to cancel the call.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description:
As he was signing out of his volunteer shift for the day, Teen Volunteer E (a minor) let Librarian I VG and in-charge Librarian II AD know that an older woman had approached him and fellow Teen Volunteer K (also a minor) and complimented their hair and eyes, including touching their hair. He said that it had made both of them uncomfortable. He gave a description of the patron and told VG and AD that she was out of the building, but her stuff was still on a table near the volunteers.
When the patron returned, LII AD approached and asked the patron about the interaction. She confirmed that she had complimented them in this manner and said the teens were "very nice". LII AD let her know that she was not to touch anyone without their permission on library property. The patron apologized and said she hadn't meant to hurt anyone's feelings.
If the behavior recurs, patron will be suspended.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: Guards contacted LIC MB about a patron sitting on the floor outside men's restroom on 1st floor. MB talked to him and he reported feeling feverish and gastrointestinal distress. MB called 911 for medical. Paramedics arrived within 15 minutes and transported patron.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description: Patron came up to the desk to ask LTA NG a question. He made comments about her appearance and said "you would look better if you were in bed with me." After that interaction he made similar comments to a female patron who also approached the desk for help. NG contacted LIC MB. Patron spent 15+ minutes in the restroom before he could be apprehended, so MB and manager LD asked on-site Officer Quijada to assist. Officer went into the restroom and told the patron to leave, and he complied promptly, returning reference materials that should not have left the 3rd floor to MB on his way out.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: bug damage
Description: Book put into the quarantine box on 6/19. LTA Sup SG inspected the item on 6/21 and found a small reddish-brown bug crawling around in the pages and potential blood on the edges of the pages. Patron was identified as MR a patron we have had another incident with.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: A teenage male stole another teenage males phone.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Tying animal outside and leaving unattended
Description:
On Friday, 6/21 Zay Lopez asked L3 KW if Rufus was banned from the library (following PITS Incident 0000023481). KW confirmed he was.
At around 10:30am, Zay approached L1 JB and asked if Rufus could please be unbanned from the library. JB looked at L2 KVN at the desk while trying to answer the question. KVN re-iterated to Zay that Rufus tried to bite the security guard so he is not welcome back inside the library. Zay said that Rufus was "just scared," and KVN said she understood Rufus was scared, but only service dogs who behave like service dogs are allowed inside the library, so Rufus cannot return.
Zay asked if he could leave Rufus outside, to which KVN directly told him "not unattended."
At 10:40pm, while checking on another situation, KVN saw Rufus tied outside to COL pipes directly in the sun. 
KVN told Zay that she had told him he could not leave Rufus unattended and that Rufus is banned from the property. KVN told Zay if this happens again he will be suspended, as he directly violated her instructions. 
Zay left but returned to the library within 5 minutes. Rufus was no longer on property. Zay then left roughly 10min later.
According to Pima County 6.04.110, it is illegal to put animals (other than horses) on tie-outs. If Zay returns to the library he will be given information about Pima County laws, as he might lose custody of Rufus if he ties him up somewhere nearby and someone calls animal control

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal
Description:
Mya and Keysasi Ester came to the library carrying a nylon backpack and holding it closed with their fist. Keysasi approached L2 KVN at the desk and said "Guess what miss?" They opened the bag to show KVN 2 young bunnies inside. 
KVN told them they were cute and asked why they were carrying them in a bag. The bunnies were white and black (domestic). Mya and Keysasi said they were their pet bunnies and they could not keep them at home unsupervised, as the bunnies did not have an enclosure and would "eat the walls."
KVN told them that the library does not allow any animals other than service dogs. Mya and Keysasi said they were "just going to be in the children's area" and KVN said that the bunnies could easily get out of their bags and run around the library, and that the dogs inside might chase them and hurt them. 
KVN told Mya and Keysasi that the bunnies could not stay inside the library, and asked what they were going to do. Mya suggested taking them to her friends house. 
KVN told Mya and Keysasi that bunnies can overheat and die very easily, and that the bunnies did not have good ventilation inside the bag they were using. She said she knew they didn't want to hurt the bunnies but they are very delicate. KVN asked if they had anyone they could call. They both said no, they were going to walk home with the bunnies. 
Mya and Keysasi said they were walking home with the bunnies. They came back inside to try to call for a guardian, but no one answered, so they said they were taking them home. 
PITS to document this conversation took place.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: A bathroom patron was in the bathroom for over 20 minutes, the manager told her we would giver her 2 more minutes. Two minutes passed. the manager entered the bathroom asking the patron to come out and she started cursing as she was talking. "Bitch I can take as long as I want", I'm using the fucking Bathroom Bitch". I told her that she would not be able to use the bathroom if she continues to act vulgar. She replied " Bitch you can't tell what I can do". So I told her, she won't be welcomed back to the library". Suspended her.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: Drug paraphernalia used as book mark.
Description: On Monday 6/24/2024 at approximately 2:53pm patron p25216673, dropped off a book in the book chute. LTA JP was inspecting library materials before check in and found that the book had foil with burnt markings and odor used as a bookmark. Item was placed in a ziploc bag and discarded.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description:
A patron approached L1 MNC at desk and indicated that he needed to show him something in front of the library. MNC obliged the patron and motioned for Guard CS to follow. Once outside, the patron showed MNC that he had parked his ATV on the library porch. He also ranted about it being unstealable, his importance in the neighborhood, and other unrelated things. Since the ATV was not obstructing the book drop or the door and the patron also said that he was waiting for someone to pick it up within the hour, MNC let him know that while this was not normally allowed, he would make an exception as long as it was only for an hour but that staff could not watch the ATV for him. The patron indicated that this would be acceptable and MNC returned to the desk.
A couple minutes later, the patron threw $100 in 20's at Guard CS and ran off. CS could not stop him to return the money. He brought the money to the staff in the backroom and let Branch Manager KW and L1 JB what had occurred. When L1 MNC went to check if the patron was still nearby, both he and the ATV were gone. The money was placed in the lost and found locker so it can be returned if and when the patron comes back.
Incident added for documentation purposes only.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: Customer Lewis Mitchell was petition passing in front of the library in the designated area.  L3 KK, L1 KB and Guard JD approached the customer.  KK handed Mr. Mitchell a copy of his suspension letter and explained that he is suspended for a year from all libraries and would need to leave library property.  KK encouraged Mr. Mitchell to contact Library Admin if he had any questions about his suspension.  Mr. Mitchell stated that he had lots of questions and then left the property.

Location: Frank De La Cruz-El Pueblo Library
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.4 Sleeping~Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: A library patron entered the facility, seated himself at a computer terminal, and appeared to fall asleep. Despite numerous attempts to rouse him, he remained unresponsive. Consequently, the library manager contacted emergency services. The first responders addressed the situation, and eventually, the individual, albeit groggy, departed the library independently.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description: Man was sitting at PC #1 and #2 with his adult daughter.  He loudly attempted to have a conversation with desk staff from the PC's. LibIII KW went over and asked him to please speak in a lower volume to which he agreed. A few minutes later Page KL came up to the desk to ask KW if she could go in the back as this man was making her feel uncomfortable by telling her she was beautiful and then telling her she was "Hot".  KL went into the back room and KW went over to the man again and said " Sir, I need you to not talk to staff in inappropriate ways.  Please don't comment on their appearance or say anything non-professional to them. They are at work and need to be treated as professionals."  He said "ok". In the next hour page BP told Lib I JCB that the same man wasn't doing anything specifically wrong but the way he looked at her was making her uncomfortable, so JCB told BP to stay in the back room and JCB went out on the floor as Computer Monitor.  When LibIII TFL heard about the third report, she went out to tell him to leave, but he was already gone.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: At approx. 12:45 p.m. an individual called to ask that staff pass along a message to his daughter if she was in the building. LI JB walked the floor and did not observe the young lady in the building. At about 2:15 p.m. a man who staff believe to be the caller came to the desk and asked LA NG if his daughter had been in the library today and presented a photo. NG explained that the man was welcome to look around the building for his daughter but that we were unable to give additional information about her use of the library. He asked to speak with someone higher up. LIII TFL and LI JB were present and JB confirmed that we cannot disclose this kind of information to the individual. TFL remained nearby as support. The man became angry and used expletives as he loudly exited the building. The man remained in the parking lot and seemed to be making a call. A few minutes later a woman (who was parked in a handicap space and had a handicap placard) came to the desk stating that an individual was yelling at her, accusing her of inappropriately using the handicap space. She asked if the guard could walk her to her car. The guard was on lunch and so TFL and LI MC walked her to the car. The man continued his loud phone call but did not reenter the library. Due to no guard, TFL and MC did not approach to ask the man to leave property. The man will be suspended for 30 days.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.12 Belongings: Leaving unattended, may be removed without notice    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Extended use of courtesy phone
Description:
Chris had been using the library's courtesy phone for over 45 minutes, after another patron asked to use the phone Librarian JNB asked for Chris to end his phone call so that another patron could use it. As she walked away she could hear him tell the person on the phone "I have to fucking get off because I got in trouble with the librarian." He continued to talk, swearing another handful of times very loudly. JNB had walked to the front desk where she could still hear him. A teen volunteer then approached JNB to inform her that another patron has gone up to the teen saying that they were concerned about the man on the phone because he smelled of alcohol and was acting intoxicated. After 5 more minutes of waiting for him to end the call JNB approached him again, she asked him to please end the call and explained to him that the hallway does funnel sound into the library and they could hear him using profanities. She handed him a code of conduct and let him know that she was just warning him about his behavior. 
A few minutes later Chris approached JNB and introduced himself, apologized for his language and said he did not realize he was being so loud. JNB emphasized that we are happy to have him in the library as long as he can follow the code of conduct and try to keep his phone calls to the 5 minute limit so that others can also use the phone. He was agreeable throughout this conversation. 
At around 5pm Librarian AB reported that they believed Chris had left the building after getting a library card but that all of his stuff was still left in the library. This is  something we will need to make sure he knows he cannot leave his belongings unattended.
At 5:15pm Librarian JNB was walking a teen and her parent to a program down the hallway where the phone is and Chris was once again on the phone swearing loud enough that the program door needed to be closed. JNB approached Chris again and gave him another warning about his language.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.12 Belongings: Leaving unattended, may be removed without notice
Description: I was working at the desk (DW) and noticed an unattended takeout fountain soda and straw hat on the table in the center of our library. I asked out loud if these belongings were those of any patrons present. There was no response. I picked up the drink to throw it out and noticed it was still cold and assumed that the person owning it had walked out absentmindedly- a common occurrence at our branch. I put the hat in our lost and found and removed the drink. After throwing out the drink in our lunchroom, I sat back down at the desk and a seemingly disoriented patron asked where her stuff had gone pointing to where the hat had been. This patron had been present and close by when I had asked about ownership of the items in question. She seemed disoriented but left the library without further incident. This was in the last half hour of operation at our branch. The following morning our security guard, GH informed me that she suspected that the hat owner had been smoking drugs in our ladies' room, which explained her disorientation and confusion. She reported there was a chemical smelling smoke detectable in the hall outside the ladies' room and that nobody else had been in there when the person involved had left.

Description: A young lady on the job search computers was not job searching but was search up information not related to job search. She came up to the desk because  she said she was unable to print. VV told her that she would not be able to print all of these document, but she insisted that these documents were part of DES. VV alerted CO and Co talked to the customer letting them know they we would not be able to print all of those items but we would be able to print 20 items free of charge as they were unrelated to job search. VV released the prints but the young lady went and released the print job anyway while we were cleaning up the branch. CO noticed their was a continuous print sound of ongoing print, during that time VV started deleting the print jobs. The patron had over $50 worth of printing waiting to be released, she was able to retrieve $25. She is no longer able to be put on Job search computers at Woods.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description: At 2:10pm, cooling station staff and custodian M let L1 MNC know that a patron had been in the men's restroom since at least 1:40pm. MNC went inside to check and found the patron partially unclothed and in the process of bathing with all of his items spread out on the sink. MNC let him know that this was not an appropriate use of the public restroom and gave the man some time to pack up his belongings. When MNC returned to check on the patron again, he had begun shaving. After a second prompt, the patron gathered his items and exited.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.12 Belongings: Leaving unattended, may be removed without notice
Description:
At closing, branch staff noticed a number of items left behind near the cafe area after the building had been cleared. L1 MNC looked around in front of the door and porch to see if there was anyone they may belong to, but there was no one there. When staff had finished closing procedures and were clocking out, they heard someone pounding on the front door. MNC went to investigate and saw a man who had been in the library earlier. The man yelled at MNC to open the door because his socks and other belongings were still in the building. MNC let him know (through the locked gate and door) that the library was closed and that we could not let him back inside the building. MNC said he could come back tomorrow to retrieve his items. The man did not accept that answer and kept knocking and yelling as MNC walked away. 
When staff exited through the rear entrance, the man saw them and started approaching. Guard CS engaged with him so staff could safely get to their vehicles. The man continued to argue with CS for several more minutes before leaving.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Children in the Library~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others~Children in the Library~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Red - High Impact (Please click Notifications > Email aliases > Copy Trauma Informed Care Team if your location would like to request group EAP support)
Description: Brendon complained at the 3rd floor desk to LIC L2 CS and LA RW that his table in Our Space was not in the right place. Our Space staff LA KV reported this to L3 LAF in her office to let her know that Brendon was berating CS at the desk on this issue. LAF told KV to move the table. LA KV came to get LAF again a few minutes later because Brendon then complained about a craft table that was stationed under the televisions near the control panel Brendon has concern with. LAF went to the 3rd floor desk to assist CS. CS was in the process of providing Brendon with LSM EDL’s phone number by writing it down. LAF spoke with Brendon and asked what his concern was. Brendon indicated that he thought CS was escalating the situation by providing him EDL’s phone number and that he asked a simple question, if the table was for crafts for the public or for a presenter to make crafts. Brendon said that if it is a table with crafts for the presenter that would be fine. LAF said CS had done everything right and was correct in supplying him with EDL’s phone number. LAF asked Brendon if the real issue was that he was concerned about the craft table’s proximity to the control panel and Michelle potentially wanting to participate in the craft. Brendon said yes. LAF said she would find out if it was crafts for the public to use generally or if it was a craft table for the presenter. After inquiring with LA KV, LAF found it was a craft table for a presenter. LAF told Our Space staff if Michelle wanted to participate, they could give her craft supplies at their table. LAF returned to Brendon and told him this. Brendon did not yell, but did raise his voice, and said that was unacceptable and that it is discrimination. LAF said she was offering a way for Michelle to participate. Brendon said, “Get EDL now. Call him now. Tell him he has a court date”. LAF told Brendon EDL is a busy person and that he was likely unavailable. Brendon said, “Get EDL”. LAF told Brendon she could no longer have this conversation with him and he would need to call EDL. LAF returned to her office and called EDL to inform him of the situation. LSM VL was passing and was stationed at 3rd floor desk at this point. LAF requested from EDL to tell Brendon he could not discuss the issue with other staff either and would need to contact EDL for further communication on the matter. EDL confirmed and said to inform Brendon that if he continued, he would need to leave. LAF returned to Brendon with CS. Brendon said he needed EDL’s phone number yet again. LAF said okay and told him again she could not discuss the issue further with him and he could not discuss it with other staff either, that he would need to contact EDL to discuss it. She said if he did engage other staff in conversation on this issue, that he would be asked to leave. Brendon said, “Did you just threaten me? I can talk to anyone I want”. LAF said she had not threatened him and said yes, he could talk with any staff he liked, but not on that particular matter. Brendon again said that it was a threat and that it was a federal crime. Brendon told LAF not to speak to him. LAF and CS provided EDL’s phone number. Brendon called EDL while he was in LAF’s office shortly after. EDL reiterated the same information LAF had. Brendon again said it was a threat and disconnected the call.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.8 Smoking, rolling, using tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes    2.12 Belongings: Leaving unattended, may be removed without notice
Description:
Page RB saw Chris smoking marijuana out of a can in front of the library. Librarian II SW told Chris he cannot smoke marijuana on library property. Chris says it was tobacco, but he smelled strongly of marijuana. SW told Chris that smoking tobacco is also not allowed on County property. SW told him if he needs to smoke, he has to completely leave the property. About 1/2 hour later, LTA Supervisor SL saw Chris walking away from the library with just one bag, and earlier he had multiple bags with him. He left the other bags unattended in the library. In charge staff will need to tell Chris that he cannot leave items unattended in the library.
Update: Chris returned about 5:15. SW told him he needs to keep all of his things with him, but especially when he leaves the building. SW told him that in addition to the possibility of theft, his stuff occupied a space for 4.5 hours, and if it had busy, SW would have moved his things outside. He said it wouldn't happen again.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.4 Vandalizing property~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.6 Using furniture improperly~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Red - High Impact (Please click Notifications > Email aliases > Copy Trauma Informed Care Team if your location would like to request group EAP support)
Description:
At approximately 4:20, LA RW heard dogs barking and shouting from the 4th floor seating area. He saw 4 people come down the stairs, including a dog, and then 3 people went back up. 
LIC CS and Guard S went up to the 4th floor seating area to check in. There was one person (Angelina Corrales) sitting in a chair on her phone, looking somewhat upset. CS said, “We heard an argument up here. Is everything okay?” Angelina responded, “It’s fine. Leave me alone.” CS said, “All right. Are you sure you’re okay? Is there anything we can do to help?” 
At this point, Angelina stood up, threw her phone down, and started screaming at CS and Guard S. Guard J also arrived on the elevator, and Angelina screamed at her, too. She kept repeating, “Leave me the fuck alone!” Both CS and J attempted to verbally deescalate, but Angelina kept approaching them in a threatening manner, hitting her own chest and reaching out as if to grab them (though she did not make physical contact). CS backed off and dialed 911. Angelina punched and kicked the walls multiple times, then picked up a side table and threw it off the balcony onto the stairs below. L3s LAF and LD heard the commotion from the staff work area and went to the bottom of the stairs, hearing the screaming patron and seeing a call for help in teams from LA RW at 3rd desk. They were unaware CS was above. They instructed LA RW to call 911. They also retrieved onsite TPD Officer Bonnano and messaged administration that there was an emergency in the building. 
Officer Bonnano came up the stairs and attempted to speak with Angelina. During the next 10 minutes, Angelina continued to scream, “Get the fuck away from me,” as well as multiple threats towards herself and others. She said multiple times that if the police came, she would force them to shoot and kill her, both before Officer Bonnano arrived and directly to him. She told CS several iterations of, “I’ll fuck you up like I fucked up my mom. You’d better watch it outside, because when I see you…” and then punched the wall and a nearby chair repeatedly. She also kept saying that she would “give them what they want,” accused CS and the guards of filming her, and said that she “was fine until this white bitch [CS] showed up and called the cops.” LSM EDL arrived on 3rd. LAF and LD began clearing people off the 3rd floor. LSM KDL secured the interior of the door to 4th floor administrative offices. 
Angelina continued to scream while officer Bonnano radioed for backup. Shortly thereafter, several officers arrived on the elevator and took Angelina into custody. CS left the scene, as her presence seemed to be agitating Angelina and the stairs were no longer under threat. LAF and LD took over at this point.

Description: While returning from lunch, LA VN saw a man and woman camping in the bushes and suspected drug use. L1 MNC and L1 JB went outside and found the couple in a state of partial undress on a blanket hidden in the bushes. Their speech and movements indicated a state of intoxication. MNC let them know that the library's bushes were not an appropriate place to camp and spread out their belongings. He added that if they needed to cool down, they could come inside the branch or sit in the shaded area near the entrance. They declined and left a few minutes later after packing up their possessions. As L2 KVN left for lunch, she saw the couple leaving and recognized the couple from incident 0000023367.

By 3:30, their behavior had become very disruptive to other patrons and they had made a mess in the area with food and wrappers at PCs and on the floor. Most of the group were being more or less compliant, but Freddy attempted to make the others disregard staff directions and remain in the branch. He then began to wave food in MNC's face and swear at him. For this, he will be suspended for 1 week.
