Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Description:
At Approximately noon Sub LPV witnessed Ms. Flowers Verbally harassing our day porter. calling her stupid for not knowing and understanding English when "people on Mt. Everest even speak English"
As this was the top of the hour, Desk coverage was being rotated and Sub LVP reported this to the 3 in charge staff on desk as they were beginning the rotation. by the time LPV could report the incident Ms. Flowers was gone presumably to the restroom. in charge staff waited in the lobby for Ms. flowers to exit, but was missed as staff were not able to identify the perpetrator until after she left. 
Ms. Flowers has a long history with harassing staff at various branches. seeing as this incident was racially charged, the next time Ms. Flowers is witnessed to harass staff or patrons she will be suspended

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
At 3 PM page EC came into the library as a patron. As they entered, they were stopped by one of the petition passers outside the library and asked to sign. As a patron, they agreed as they resonated with the petition. EC then asked the petition passer how their day was and she said it was " good except I'm competing with this crackhead" implying to a petition passer with a red hat. the woman in the red hat overheard this, got very angry with the original petition passer, and yelled at her. EC then rushed inside to tell the guard and library staff. As EC was telling staff Guard MG de-escalated the fight and the woman in the red hat stormed off and the original agitator stayed on the premises. L3 CO came out and told the petition passer that due to her aggressive behavior, she (as well as the other petition passer) could no longer collect signatures on library property, but were welcome as guests. The women then left the premises. 
Staff were able to confirm that this woman has been very aggressive towards staff on several occasions.
because actions were taken outside the library CO confirmed she may retain her library privileges for the time being but will not be able to pass petitions, especially seeing as Woods will be an early voting site this July.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking
Description:
Petitioner 1 in red hat approached the desk to check in with staff following COL policy. 10 min later, Petitioner 2 in pink shirt asked to speak with in-charge person. 
L2 KVN spoke with her privately. KVN listened with Petitioner 2 stated that Petitioner 1 and her had worked together at a previous library, and they were working for the same petition under different companies. Petitioner 2 claimed that Petitioner 1 had become aggressive and used profane language toward her at the previous library (indicating an East library location), and that Petitioner 2 ended up calling the police about it. She claimed Petitioner 1 had been slamming her clipboard and threatening her. Petitioner 2 claimed that Petitioner 1 is a "druggie" and uses her petitioning money for that. Petitioner 2 stated she had asked Guard CS to call 911 for her when Petitioner 1 arrived, but Guard CS had not seen any aggressive behavior and told her she was welcome to call 911 herself or talk to staff, but he was not going to call on her behalf. Petitioner 2 also claimed that she had been "banned" from the previously noted East library due to their altercation, and that (unfairly) Petitioner 1 had not been banned. Petitioner 2 repeatedly implied KVN should ask Petitioner 1 to leave. 
After listening to her concerns, KVN asked her to wait inside the library so she could check PITS. KVN did not see any recent PITS or suspensions involving these petitioners.
KVN met with both petitioners outside and had a conversation with both petitioners about PCPL Code of Conduct. She explained to both of them that if there was any aggressiveness, threatening language, profanity, or the creation of a hostile environment for patrons, that both petitioners would be suspended from all Pima County libraries. Petitioner 1 was quiet but said "this again? She won't leave me alone." 
After reiterating that the warning was for both petitioners, Petitioner 2 asked if she could still call the police on Petitioner 1 if she escalated. KVN told her that she has the right as a citizen to do whatever she needed to do, but warned both of them to work in separate areas in front of COL. KVN explained, again, that they needed to simply avoid and not engage with one another or they would both receive consequences.  Both petitioners seemed to understand PCPL Code of Conduct and that library staff were not going to be monitoring their history of conflict outside of issuing appropriate consequences for behavior from both parties. 
After 30min, KVN checked back in with Guard CS. Petitioner 2 had a 30min phone call in the parking lot. Petitioner 1 ended up leaving the property. Situation resolved. PITS for documentation.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Red - High Impact (Please click Notifications > Email aliases > Copy Trauma Informed Care Team if your location would like to request group EAP support)    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description:
Unknown patron entered the library at 11:58 AM, bypassed LTA AD and said as he passed her, "I don't want to talk to you, you talk to niggers," before getting a guest pass from LTA supervisor JA who did not hear the comment. AD informed JA of what the patron had said, and JA went to get L3 AG. AG confirmed which patron it was and which computer he was on. AG approached the patron, introduced herself, and asked if the two of them could have a word outside. The patron was immediately defensive, and said, "What did I do now? It seems like every time I come in this place you guys are targeting me!" AG responded, "One of my staff members said--" but was cut off by the patron, whose voice was getting louder to the point of yelling. He interrupted to say, "She's making it up! I didn't do anything, she's making it up!" At that point another patron signaled to AG that she needed help and said, "When you're done with this situation." When the patron AG was speaking to saw the other patron who needed help, he began yelling, "That's why I don't want to even be in this fucking library! Because there are niggers here! Leave me alone!" AG then asked him to leave, which he yelled over. He repeated his offensive statements as he stood up, then picked up the computer keyboard and threw it back down on the table. AG reiterated that he needed to leave. He began to collect his things, while continuing to yell with offensive language including the words "fucking" and "niggers," then he left the building.
AG went to the patron who needed help and apologized that she had to hear any part of that. 
At the time of the incident there were many patrons nearby overhearing everything, including the post-storytime crowd of children and caregivers.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Red - High Impact (Please click Notifications > Email aliases > Copy Trauma Informed Care Team if your location would like to request group EAP support)
Description:
L2 KVN was on desk and heard a somewhat quiet argument from the lobby. KVN waited a few moments while finishing up with patrons on the desk, assuming Guard CS was in the lobby and would get staff attention if needed. A female patron quickly approached the desk saying 2 other patrons were fighting and asked staff to call 911.
KVN entered the lobby to see Guard CS was not in the lobby (instead walking the building) and 2 female patrons were engaged in a fight. One female patron had the other cornered against the drinking fountains and was holding her in a choke-hold. KVN approached and loudly asked "Is everything okay here?" The patron pinned kept struggling and telling the other female to get off her but told staff she was okay. 
The other female released her, but when she started to walk away she grabbed her from behind and started holding her aggressively. KVN got closer to them and instructed them to stop. The instigating female glared at KVN unbreakingly for several moments and then released the female patron again. 
The female patron once again tried to walk away. Multiple patrons started to fill the lobby to assist with the fight. The aggressor kept insulting the female patron and the female patron kept saying "she's like this all the time." KVN directed her attention to the female patron and asked if she needed to get "somewhere safe." She kept responding "no." 
The aggressive female finally said "Fine, I'll never call you again you dumb n*gger bitch" and shoved the female patron hard. She then stormed out the West door. 
KVN again asked the female patron if she needed to stay in the building, if she needed to go somewhere safe, or if she needed them to call someone. The female patron thanked them for their help but said no. Several other patrons offered to walk her outside if she needed additional safety or support. 
Both patrons left the property immediately after the fight.
The aggressor will be issued a 1 year suspension for all libraries. KVN did not call 911 because the fight de-escalated and the victim requested she not call 911.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description: At 2:29pm LTA NG was standing near the balcony on the 2nd floor when a patron began staring at her menacingly and muttering threats ("yeah you, we're gonna fight" etc) Guard J witnessed the interaction from the 1st floor. NG walked away and the patron followed her, raising her voice and threats saying "You can meet me outside, we're going to fight." NG said "you can leave for the day" and the patron did not comply; after several more threats of fighting NG again asked her to leave and the patron exited the library.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: Customer has repeatedly been told not to leave her dog unattended in the library and, at one point, her dog got into a fight with another dog.  Today, customer left her dog under a computer station while she sat at a table out of sight of the dog.  LSM VL and L3 KK approached the customer and reminded her that she has been repeatedly told to keep her dog with her at all times.  The customer smelled strongly of alcohol.   KK asked the customer to leave for the day for repeatedly failing to comply.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: failing to keep control of a dangerous animal~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description:
The incident occurred when a patron was sitting on the bench on the 1st floor closest to the children's area entrance. The patron was eating and sitting on the bench and his dog was laying on the ground. Patron did not have hold of the leash and Vet Sec Guard JT attempted to walk around the dog as far away as was possible. Dog jumped up without provocation and started to lunch at Vet Sec Guard JT and she backed up quickly and put her hands in front of her face, backing into the guard closet. Before the dog had reached her at the door, the patron took hold of the dog's leash and stopped it. Vet Sec Guard JT asked the patron to leave with the dog immediately and the patron walked out with the dog without further incident.
Vet Sec Guard JT reported to LII IC JM that the dog had been in for most of the day and she had warned the patron about keeping control of the dog at all times earlier in the day when she noticed the man sleeping, laying down on the bench and he didn't have a hand on the dog's leash. The patron was warned that the dog cannot jump up, bark, or act aggressively and the man said he understood. It was reported later that Vet Sec Guard F was up on the 2nd floor that day and the dog had growled at him as he walked by. Once again, the dog was unprovoked but exhibited aggressive behavior towards staff.
Main Branch managers LIII LF and LIII LD talked to the man outside the library within the hour and told him he could not bring the dog in again, but that if there is a service that the dog performs that we can help him with, he was told to please reach out to staff and we can help. The man agreed and there was no further incident.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: A patron that was recognized as using the library earlier in the day collapsed outside the gate on Yavapai St. CC and JP heard the fall and JP came into the building to get the manager. The manager talked with the off-duty officer D and the officer went out to incident, he was able to call the emergency crew who were a able to come out and assist the gentleman.

Infraction Categories: Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Green - Low Impact
Description: For documentation purposes. Mr. Bulikowski came in and asked for LTA MM. LTAS CR told him that MM no longer worked here. Mr. Bulikowski asked where Michael went. CR told him he wasn't sure. Mr. Bulikowski began explaining to CR about what he thinks is a "glitch" in our system which he had spent months trying to get LTA MM to explain to his satisfaction. Mr. Bulikowski habitually returns items that are overdue and billed. He noticed that when an item is billed, it disappears from the public catalog and he claims that sometimes the items never show back up in the catalog. The only instance that he could provide of this at the moment was the billed item he had just returned moments before, which had not reappeared in the public catalog. CR tried to explain to him that the removal from the public catalog was an automated process and the books would reappear when the system updated. Mr. Bulikowski insisted that was not the case, but again was only able to provide the one example. CR attempted to explain that things could disappear from the catalog for many different reasons, but Mr. Bulikowski insisted that there was a problem. At this point L1, MD who was on the desk with CR, noticed that CR's speech was increasing in speed and intensity. Mr. Bulikowski was interrupting CR's explanations with his own comments. MD interjected that if Mr. Bulikowski would return his items before they were billed, they would not disappear from the catalog. Mr. Bulikowski said "yeah, well, that's not the point," and continued with his insistence that the items he checked out were disappearing from our system. MD then asked him why he needed to know these details about how the catalog works. He replied that he was concerned that we were losing items. MD reiterated her question, asking why he personally needed to know these details because they appeared to be causing him stress. He said that he had been coming to the library for a very long time and he cared about how the library operated and he did not want us to be losing items. MD asked again why he personally needed to know these details. He said he had already explained. MD said she still did not understand. At that point, MD went to help a child call his father on the phone. Mr. Bulikowski began speaking to CR again MD attempted to help the child. The child was very soft spoken and MD told Mr. Buikowski that she could not hear the child because of the volume of his voice. At that point Mr. Bulilkowski walked wy from the desk and CR was finally able to clock out and go home. Mr. Bulikowski did not return to the desk that evening.

Description:
Patron reported to LA TW at 1:40 that his green backpack had gone missing while he rested in the chair on the landing between 1st and 2nd floors. He searched inside & outside the library and did not find it. LIC MB recommended that he speak to the officer on site and offered use of library computers to make a police report.  Incident ID: 0000023567
 L3 LD looked at the camaras and footage shows a teenager grabbing the bag and heading out of the library at 1:34pm. Patron will be suspended for 3 months for theft.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft    1.1.4 Vandalizing property
Description: On Monday July 8 at approximately 6:53 am, an individual came to the back entrance of the Main Library carrying a large bag, leaves it by the trash cans, makes an attempt to leave the premises, but comes back and informs Delivery Manager BM and Facilities Staff R that "he was blackmailed to return the items". The bag was opened by staff downstairs then brought to administration. The bag labeled Health Department had several items from first floor circulation desk and city of Tucson garage. Administration called the police to come to the library to investigate. Case #P2407080054 Upon further investigation by Deputy Director JT, the individual is seen coming from the Garage through the stairs on Monday 8th at 2:01am. Then the individual makes entry into the library by the side door (Garage elevator) at 3:17am, collects items from the circulation desk and exits the library at 4:52 am. Individual will be suspended from the library for 1 year.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: Customer approached the desk at approximately 10:30am. When asked if she needed assistance by Librarian BL, customer said they specifically wished to speak with LA NG, who was helping another patron with a replacement card. After waiting, patron approached LA NG. She asked if he was familiar with the Knights Templar, to which NG replied that he was. Patron stated that she knew that NG was a descendant of the Knights Templar, and that she wished to identify herself to him as the “Dame of France,” to which NG replied, “Joan of Arc?”. The patron stated that she did not wish to confirm or deny whether she was Joan, simply repeating that she wished for him to know that she was the Dame of France. She repeated that she knew NG was descended from the Knights Templar and that he was disobeying his master, “Theophicus (?)”. NG asked for her pardon and the customer returned to her seat. NG immediately brought this to the attention of L3 KK.  KK and Guard JD spoke to customer and made her aware that her comments had made NG uncomfortable.  KK asked customer to keep conversations with library staff limited to library business.  Customer stated she was a government agent and that she was leaving.  As soon as KK got back to her desk, customer came back in and asked to speak to the manager.  KK came out and customer advised her that customer is a KGB agent and a Green Beret.  Customer began to read from a manifesto that she had written in a notebook.  Customer  talked about an impending raid to protect children.  She further stated that she was watching KK and "her people" because "your people don't like my people."  Customer said that was because customer knew KK is Irish.  KK offered to call Community Crisis for the customer.  Customer became louder to the point that other customers were stopping and listening with concern.  KK then asked customer to leave for the day.  Customer stated that she was taking note and that KK was "losing her government clearance."  Customer then left.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: Customer lost balance and fell very hard backwards.  L3 KK called 911.  Paramedics assessed the customer's condition and helped him off the floor.  Customer declined further medical assistance.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms    2.7 Not wearing shoes or shirt    2.10 Creating tripping hazards, blocking aisles, exits, entrances
Description: A woman came to the desk to report that she had slipped and fallen upon entering the women's restroom. She stated that when she entered a woman was naked and that a large puddle of water was on the floor. She asked LIII TFL to call 911. TFL spoke briefly with her to determine whether she needed 911 for medical assistance. The woman stated she was shaken up but was going to sit a minute first. TFL got LI SG and they entered the restroom to find a woman who appeared to have been bathing very recently (she had a dress on) and the floor covered in lots of water. Her belongings were strewn around the restroom. TFL attempted to explain but the woman was very volatile and made many threatening and insulting comments as soon as staff engaged her. Staff remained at the bathroom entrance to ensure no one else entered and the woman exited. She was asked to leave library property for the day and left while continuing to make insulting statements. When TFL returned to the floor she could no longer locate the woman who had slipped and fallen.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: 1st floor circulation staff was alerted by Vet Sec Guard S that a patron had an open can of beer in his pocket at the computer station #24 and he had spilled beer on the floor underneath his chair. LII IC JM and Vet Sec guard S approached the patron who was sitting at the computer, informed him that he could not drink alcohol in the library and asked him to leave for the day. The man complied with no further incident.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: Staff member TF watched Mariam take stacks of Summer Learning books over to our main floor computers. Because the manager had already gave Mariam a number of opportunities to take extra summer learning books, the manager told Mariam should could not have any more because we stall have patrons who are still signing up for Summer Learning. Mariam Left the library taking the stack of books, which constitute as stealing. I notified the staff that when she returns I will have to suspend her for stealing the books. Mariam came back (7/10) into the library and I pulled her aside into a meeting room and had a conversation with Mariam. Mariam told me that she dropped off the books to Columbus. I told Mariam that she was not suppose to leave the branch and take the books to Columbus because each branch has a budget set aside for their Summer Learning Materials.  I told Mariam that I will confirm with Columbus..I was able to confirm with Columbus that Mariam has not been there in over a year. Mariam returned back to the library around 1:20 with all the books in hand. I told her that I would not suspend her because she did return the books. But throughout the whole time Mariam was never truthful.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.2 Strong odors
Description: Mr. Walker has been asked to leave on one previous occasion due to extreme odor. Today upon entry to the library a urine smell became pervasive throughout the space soon after his entry. Staff LIII TFL and L1 JB approached him to speak privately and asked that he address the issue prior to returning. He left without much incident and stated he would do laundry prior to returning. For documentation as his odor is a frequent issue.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking
Description: Guard J called the in-charge phone to report that regular patron Dorothy had come out of the restroom and was yelling at our day porter. She will be suspended for one week.

Infraction Categories: Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description:
Staff discovered, in the box for cooling center surveys from the Health Dept, that patrons had filled out two heat surveys and two computer class surveys that had intolerant remarks written on them. 
One of the computer class surveys had written in response to what would motivate you to attend a class, "Having them NOT be available in ANY other language except English (because that is the language spoken in the U.S.)" The other computer class survey had written in response to what language would you like classes in, "Only English." These surveys were turned in while our first English language class of the summer quarter was taking place, and seem very charged and pointed.
One of the cooling center surveys, in response to the question about gender identity, had the word 'identity' scratched out, and written below that, "There is ONLY 2 gender options at birth! F.Y.I." The other cooling center survey, in response to the same question, had all options except for 'man' and 'woman' scratched out, and had written in, "Only 2 genders male + female."
Judging from the handwriting, and comparing that with a comment card also filled out the same day, Christina filled out two surveys (one of each), and another unknown patron filled out the other two.
Staff are disturbed by the intolerant comments, which places a burden on them while they are trying to do their jobs. This is for documentation purposes.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description: During early open hours, LTA NG reported that there was shouting coming from the 1st floor men's restroom. LIC CS, Guard J, and Guard L went to see what the problem was. A very intoxicated man was upset because he believed that the guards had been trying to lock him in the restroom. CS and Guard J deescalated the situation and encouraged the man to drink some water. As he did so, NG recognized the man as a suspended patron from a previous incident. CS and Guard J delivered the man's suspension paperwork, and although he did not appear to understand what was happening, he did leave the library peacefully.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
A male patron entered the library around 10:30 and loudly attempted to interrupt a staff interaction with another patron to get a guest pass. When asked to wait, he went over to another staff member and repeated the behavior. After he received the pass, he began pacing between the PC, the front desk and the cafe area, swearing profusely. He left the branch before staff could address the situation. He briefly returned moments later and attempted to walk behind the desk to ask for a snack while L1 MNC was helping 2 youth patrons and their parent. MNC asked the patron the step back and gave him a snack and water bottle to expedite his departure.
At around 11:15, the patron returned again and approached Librarian 1 JCB at the desk and asked for a computer pass to look up when Primavera opens.  JCB responded that we could just look that up for him.  She printed the address and hours of operation as well as the phone number for Primavera Foundation. Guard CS came over to observe the interaction.  Patron vented about his life and being "on hard times" and JCB listened and indicated sympathy.  Patron left happy but returned less than five minutes later asking for an application for a replacement CBID card.  JCB came up with two applications and some instructions, and the patron insisted these were not what he was looking for.  She clicked on another link and he said forget it.  He stormed off and started venting to CS.  At this time JCB had an unrelated interaction with a volunteer that made her laugh.  The patron assumed the laughter was directed at him and yelled that JCB was a "bitch" and was disrespectful before leaving the branch.  CS advised that JCB not interact with him again because the aggression was targeted at her.
Based on his hostile behavior, he will be asked to leave for the day if he attempts to return.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: Patron approached the info desk to ask for papers and during the conversation with L1 AB, they swayed and appeared faint. The patron then fell forward, hitting their head on the edge of the desk. L1 AB immediately called 911 and asked OSLIII DA to get L2 SW. L1 AB talked to patron, who was conscious to answer the operator's questions. Patron requested that L1 AB tell them what happened because they didn't remember falling. A fire truck arrived within 7 minutes to assess the patron, who was taken to the hospital via ambulance.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: Misuse of library newspapers
Description: Customer requested copy of newspaper that is kept behind the desk at Himmel from LTA MKB. Customer told LTA MKB that "just because the library is a cooling station it doesn't mean people should be sleeping", indicating a regular customer (who is experiencing homelessness) who was seated in a nearby chair and happened to have nodded off. The customer stated that the regular was "taking up a seat that was for library patrons." LTA MKB told the customer that staff was aware of the sleeping and that the regular was also a library patron. The customer left the desk and walked over to the sleeping regular. He tapped the regular on the knee with the library newspaper, and said "wake up!" LTA MKB was in the middle of another transaction, but called out to the customer from the desk that his actions were inappropriate. The customer walked off and sat down without acknowledging LTA MKB. LTA MKB made L1 KH aware of the situation. L1 KH checked on the regular, who indicated that he was unharmed. The regular thought the person might have been someone that the regular knew who was trying to greet him. As a result, KH did not speak to the customer with the newspaper. KH was informed later of the customer's statements to LTA MKB, which lead KH to believe that the customer did not actually know the regular. Staff will speak to the customer about appropriate use of the library and library materials the next time he returns.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description:
For documentation:
Throughout recent weeks a regular patron has been expressing concerns to multiple staff members about things such as drug and sex trafficking going on at the library, Pima County staff listening into his conversations, and the urinal in the men's restroom attempting to give blow jobs. Today he approached LTAS IC KFW during our our space program and said if staff don't stop talking about him he would handle it himself. When asked what he meant by that he said he would approach staff to give them one last warning before having staff arrested by "Federal Prosecutors". KFW tried and failed to reassure the patron that staff wasn't talking about him or monitoring his electronic devices. He made threats of legal action against everyone working at the library.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: At around 1:30pm, two regular patrons were yelling and hitting each other in the computer lab area on the 1st floor.  A female patron left Computer 11 to smoke a cigarette outside, and while she was gone a male patron took her spot.  When she came back and told him to move, he refused.  She yelled at him, and he hit her.  The female patron then began hitting the man.  They yelled at each other and hit each other until another female patron jumped in between them to separate them.  LIC AK and Guard J arrived just after this, while the two patrons were still yelling at each other.  LIC AK told both patrons they needed to leave the library immediately.  Guard J walked the male patron out of the library. The female patron argued and refused to leave after multiple requests by LIC AK and did not leave until Officer Quijada told her she would be arrested for trespassing.  Both patrons are suspended for 1 year.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.2 Guns, weapons, machetes, knives    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Description:
At approximately 3:45 while at the desk, a ruckus was heard in the internal hallway near the men's room. Librarian DW was summoned by our security guard, GW. She also requested help from LTA Supervisor GG to translate Spanish.The person of interest (Patron A) was yelling at two other men who had been in the restroom at that time. The Patron A accused the other two men (Patrons B and C) of interfering with him while he was in the restroom stall. Patron A accused Patron C of being a pervert, swore and fulminated against them and started exiting the library. He also challenged them to meet him outside, after a few minutes of heated discussion, Patrons A and B exited the restroom into the lobby area while Patron A continued with profanity and threatening demeanor towards Patron B. While Patron C remained in the restroom. GG told him his language and behavior were contrary to library policy and he had to leave for the day. He exited the library without further incident.
GG de-briefed one of the Spanish speakers who had been in the bathroom. According to this source, Patron A had been in the stall an excessive amount of time and those waiting to use the stall checked to see if a person was even occupying the stall.
Patron B then left the building, upon exiting Patron A was waiting outside. Patron B returned inside the library and alerted staff that Patron A had brandished a weapon and threatened him. Then LA DS called 911 at 4pm. Building then went on lockdown and waited for the police to arrive, which they did at 4:09.
During police investigation, they were able to apprehend Patron A and confirmed his identity with witnesses. Police took statements from Patrons B and C. Police advised us that the area was secured and the branch re-opened at 4:25

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Green - Low Impact
Description: IC L1 WW was notified by LA JS that there was a patron at an Express computer with a boa constrictor around his neck.  WW approached the patron and told him the the snake could not be in the building because it was not a service animal.  Patron got defensive and attempted to argue that the snake was indeed a service animal but did remove the snake and himself from the building as he continued to argue on his way out the door.  For documentation purposes.

Infractions: Children in the Library    4.2 Leaving child unsupervised or ignoring disruptive behavior of child
Description: At approximately 4:57 pm, just before closing, L1 CM was informed that 2 children were waiting for their parents to pick them up. The children were Sitey Ali, 11 years old, and her younger sister Zanabo Ali, 8 years old. Security guard MG stayed with the children at the Yavapai gate until the branch was closed and gate was locked. LIC CM and L1 CM stayed with the children. Sitey Ali said that her parents said that they were going to to go grocery shopping, drop off the groceries, then come back for them. Sitey said her parents told her "a couple of hours." LIC CM noted that that it was about 4:30 when he saw the mother leaving. From 5:11 pm-6:14 pm, L1 CM called the parents repeatedly, 31 times total, plus 2 text messages, with no response. Law enforcement/911 was called, per protocol at 5:19 pm, although no officer responded. Branch manager CO was contacted at 6:00 pm, and said she would come over to the branch. At 6:14 pm, the mother finally answered the phone and was told that she needed to pick up her children. The parents showed up and were given the protocol for unsupervised children by L1 CM, who also wrote the branch hours on the brochure. The father stated that he wasn't aware of the hours, and asked if he was in trouble when he was told that 911 had been called. L1 CM pointed out their blatant disregard to answer the phone after 32 phone calls and 2 text messages. They received a 3 month suspension, which was reduced to 1 month. The 3 month suspension was reinstated after further consideration by CM and CO.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description:
LTA AD observed a woman (Iris) speaking loudly and in what she perceived to be an aggressive manner to some young children on the children's PCs. The children are known to staff and are not known to be connected with Iris. LTA AD informed L1 KN. KN asked Iris if the children she was speaking to were under her care, which she said they were not. She said her two grandchildren were playing on the computers and came to her to complain about things the other kids were saying, and since staff "weren't doing anything about it" that she spoke to them instead. KN told Iris that she needs to come to staff with any concerns about other patron's behavior and that staff will address any behavior that we feel is outside the range of behavior expectations. KN also explicitly told Iris that she does not need to speak to or correct the behavior of any children that are not under her care. Iris told KN she "heard you the first time" and that she is "old school" when it comes to correcting children.
A few minutes later the mother of one of the children Iris had spoke to approached LTA AD at the front desk and informed her that Iris had given the middle finger to her and her younger child. LTA AD informed KN, who informed L3 AG. The mother told KN that she was chasing the younger child around the shelves in the children's area and Iris gave them the middle finger as she walked by. AG spoke to Iris, who was already outside with her grandchildren, and told her that her behavior was inappropriate and that she would need to leave. Iris stated that she was leaving anyways and that she was "never coming back here".
Multiple staff members have spoke to Iris in recent weeks about library expectations and had informed her that she needed to speak to library staff instead of correcting the behavior of other children in the library.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: At 1:15pm Guard JQ brought a glass pipe with drug residue to LIBIII KW. He stated that an older man from the cafe area had found it and given it to him. It was disposed of in the outdoor garbage receptacle.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description: LA NG was on desk and heard loud voices coming from café area and went to investigate.  She went to get Guard CS and when they went to the café, they found two male patrons engaged in a verbal altercation.  Male Patron #1 was standing and was loudly talking to male Patron #2, who was sitting in a chair next to a female who was with him.   Patron #2 was alleging that Patron #1 was staring at him and his female companion.  She said very loudly, "I didn't do nothin', I don't want to be in the middle of this."  Patron #2 said "Do you want to take this outside?"  Patron #1 started to walk away and LA NG went up to Patron #1 to understand what had happened, but Patron #1 was very agitated and said "look at me!" very sternly and said we needed "to take care of that guy" and that "I'm 53 years old and I don't need to put up with this!" and that if we didn't take care of things, he could get himself a handgun permit and take care of things himself.  LA NG saw he was continuing to walk into the lobby and when she saw he was heading to the door, she went to get IC Librarian III KW to inform her. After Patron #1 left the building LA NG repeatedly asked Patron #2 in the future to please get staff before engaging with other patrons.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
During Guard CS's lunch break, Custodian M was in the lobby waiting for the women's restroom to clear so that he could clean.  A man and woman walked into the lobby and the woman went into the restroom.  The man stopped in the lobby and waited for her to come out.  M finished wiping the windows on the front doors and came back into the lobby to wait for the restroom to empty again. When the woman walked out M is seen rolling his cleaning supplies into the restroom alcove and the man began yelling at M as he walked towards the computers, calling M names like "Faggot", "Piece of Shit", "Bastard", "Mother Fucker" better not look at his "girl" that way.
Librarian 1 SG walked up to him and asked if everything was alright, and he continued to disparage M and call him names angrily.  SG asked the woman with him if she was ok and she said there was just a man going into the restroom to clean it.  She looked like she had tears in her eyes. The couple walked over to the computers and sat down.  
SG came to tell LIBIII KW about the situation and KW went up to the couple and asked if they were ok. At this point KW didn't know about the language and name calling, only that the man had accused M of looking at his "girl".  The man responded that No. He wasn't ok. The Janitor had violated his girl and disrespected him and he wanted something done about it.  KW asked what had happened and the man stood up to show her how M had looked at his girlfriend in an exaggerated manner.  KW said she was sorry and that she would talk to M, but asked if the man could please sit down and be aware of the people around him.  He continued to express his displeasure and told KW not to smile at him as that was disrespectful.  He indicated that KW should go over and fire M on the spot.  She informed him that she was not his employer but that she would talk to him and report his concerns.  He asked for M's supervisor contact information.
KW went to walk M out as she was concerned for his safety.  He did not know what the man was upset about.  KW went to look up Velociti and provided the man with a contact number.  When she returned to give him the contact he was calmer and thanked her.
The camera footage does not show any inappropriate behavior on behalf of M.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Librarian I (DW) was working front desk when Security (GW) informed me that the detectable odor of drugs being smoked was present in the men's room. I walked to the bathroom and the smell was stronger. Two men came out, Gwen notified me it was the skinny young man who had been doing it. I asked this man if he had been smoking drugs in the bathroom. This patron "flipped the script" and very assertively and insultingly asked why there was sharps container in the bathroom and moved very quickly to get out of the library. The odor of burnt drugs was strongly present in the bathroom and I held the door open to dissipate its concentration. Both L-1 and Security were nauseated by the smell.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.2 Disruptive use of personal devices    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.3 Food or beverage: unclean, disruptive, or damaging    3.5 Failure to clean up after eating/drinking    3.6 Using furniture improperly
Description:
Around 4:40pm LIC LII PP was alerted to a group of teens/young adults being disruptive in the Ignite space on 2nd floor - yelling loudly and using profanity. LIC PP and LII JM went to ask them to quiet down and noted a large group of teens spread out throughout the space with personal belongings and food from snack packs strewn around the tables. The teens responded politely to the request to settle down ("yes ma'am"). At 5:30pm staff on 2nd again called for assistance with the same group, some of whom had moved to the 101 area and were again being disruptive. Two of the teens in the Ignite space were "play fighting" and filming one another dancing. Guards J & L both approached the teens and asked them to quiet down. In the 101 space, Guard J asked one teen to not put his feet on the furniture and he responded "HELL NO."
At this point, LIC PP & LII JM returned to the 2nd floor and asked the entire group to leave for the day. Two of the teens continued filming themselves dancing after they were asked to leave and it took an additional 10 minutes for all to comply. On the way out the door they continued shouting and whistling loudly. After they left, LIC PP noted that the Ignite area was trashed, with food on the floor, spilled drinks on the tables, and trash scattered around the area.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: Aggressively hitting computer in a way that could cause damage
Description: At 2:17pm, youth patron on Teen Computer #3 violently hit the computer screen with his hands several times, causing the monitor to shake from force of impact. LA MKA responded immediately letting him know that was unacceptable and could damage library property and that he was done using the computer for the day, at which point he said some swear words including "b*tch", took his items and left for the day. LA MKA had been informed at the start of the hour by LA AM that this same patron had already received a warning from guard J that same day about inappropriate language/noise volume and not hitting the computer/table.

Infractions: Children in the Library    4.2 Leaving child unsupervised or ignoring disruptive behavior of child
Description:
During the Sensory Program, Session 1 from 10:15 a.m. to 11:00 a.m., patron Stephanie Mugabonake left her two young children (around ages 1.5 years old and 6 months) in the Large Meeting Room. Her six month old child started smacking the door, saying "mom, mom, mom". The child seemed distressed.
Stephanie came back less than a minute later. When Librarian I MH told her that she could not leave her child unattended, Stephanie said she just had to turn her car on. Her attitude was dismissive.
The purpose of this report is for documentation purposes. No further action was taken.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Description:
A patron walked by another patron who was seated and using a computer in the lab and hit the side of his head, causing the seated patron's ear to bleed. He continued walking toward the 1st floor desk and front doors as if to leave, then stopped at stalled, L3 LF told him to leave and he flipped her off and then exited the building.
The hit patron requested that we call the cops. L2 KW called 911 and when the cops arrived, the patron declined submitting a police report for the incident.
Patron who hit the other seated patron will be suspended for one year.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: A customer reported to Guard JD that people were arguing in the cafe area.  JD attempted to diffuse the situation without success.  L3 KK spoke to the male customer who was highly agitated and loud.  He said he had been jumped by a guy (off property) with nunchucks and was angry that the guy didn't fight him "like a man."  He made several comments about "retribution." KK offered to call paramedics.  The male customer declined and said that he wanted a nearby female customer to stop staring at him.  The male and two female customers began arguing.  KK told them to stop.  The male customer continued to breathe through his clenched teeth, clench his fists and loudly make threatening comments about "retribution" against the man who had attacked him. KK told him that he was scaring people in the area and that he would either need to calm down or leave for the day.  When customer did not calm down, KK asked him to leave for the day.  Customer eventually complied and left property.  After he left, KK spoke to the female customers and made them aware that their comments made the situation more dangerous for themselves and library staff.  They were told to allow staff to address future situations.  As KK was walking to the desk, the male customer's girlfriend and told KK that she was a domestic violence victim.  KK offered to call TPD or Emerge.  Girlfriend declined because she was afraid he would "have her jumped."  Girlfriend did take information on the Arizona 211 Transportation Hotline for when she feels ready to escape her situation.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.8 Smoking, rolling, using tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description:
Library guard A came to desk to tell LIC LI PC that an unknown patron was smoking outside, and noted that what they were smoking looked and smelled strange. LI PC went outside to let patron know that smoking on property is prohibited. At that time, LI PC noticed that the smell and appearance of what the patron was using was in line with illicit drugs. LI PC went inside and discussed with LIII AG before it was decided to trespass the patron for drugs on library property. 
LI PC with LIII AG as backup went to tell the patron. Patron became agitated and said he was going to grab his stuff, muttering as he went inside and gathered his items before leaving with his partner - muttering about having been smoking only weed. However, staff can confirm both the odor and taking method were not consistent with marijuana.
Patron will be suspended for 1 year.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.3 Food or beverage: unclean, disruptive, or damaging    3.4 Eating at computer
Description:
An unknown patron entered the library at 11:40am. The patron requested a computer guest pass and adult snack, which were given to him by L1 MG. L1 MG was then helping another patron when he asked page EP for headphones. Page EP explained that they would cot $1. He responded neutrally and went to use the computer. Page EP heard him speaking aloud saying things like "trying to charge me a dollar." The patron continued to speak aloud and seemed to be exhibiting heightened emotion. L1 MG and LA ES were monitoring the situation in case of escalation. When he began to eat his snack at the computer, Vet Sec MM asked the patron to not eat at the computers. The patron responded "I'm not." The patron continued to speak and had one outburst yelling "FUCK." L1 MG and LA ES continued to monitor the situation as he then quieted down momentarily. L1 MG notified Vet Sec MM that the patron seemed to be experiencing agitation. When he began to talk again in an agitated manner, Vet Sec MM approached the patron at 11:53am. As she did the patron got up quickly and started gathering his bags. He left the library while yelling phrases such as "leave me the fuck alone" and "why can't you just leave me alone." As he left he slammed the door open.
Since the patron left of their own accord, no further action is being taken at this time.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Red - High Impact (Please click Notifications > Email aliases > Copy Trauma Informed Care Team if your location would like to request group EAP support)
Description:
Phoebe approached LTA S MB and LTA GP at the information desk to angrily demand assistance with the charging station, saying that it was broken and not charging her phone. MB walked with Phoebe to the charging station in the front hallway. Phoebe tried to retrieve her phone from the station but put in the wrong code. MB asked her to put it in again, which successfully opened the door. MB returned to the desk, followed by Phoebe. Phoebe angrily stated that staff need to post a sign saying the station may or may not charge their device and a reminder to retrieve their items before leaving for the day. MB informed Phoebe that staff would not be posting such a sign, that patrons are responsible for their own property, and that staff are not trained to service the charging station. Phoebe leaned over the desk to gesture at staff in an aggressive manner and repeated her complaints. LTA GP informed Phoebe that she needed to stop leaning over the counter towards staff. Phoebe repeated her complaints to GP. GP also informed her about library policy regarding patron property and ended with "have a good day". Phoebe replied that she was having a good day until GP ruined it with her "enthusiasm and optimism". Phoebe returned to her computer station, then returned to the charging station.
LI KN was leaving a program and saw GP approaching Phoebe to offer further assistance with the charging station. KN gestured to GP that she would offer assistance instead, then asked Phoebe if she needed help. Phoebe angrily stated that the charging station was broken and wasn't charging her phone and that desk staff were useless and refusing to help her. KN informed her that staff are not trained to service the charging station and are limited in our ability to troubleshoot any problems. She again stated that it was broken and needed a sign. KN repeated that staff are not trained to troubleshoot problems with the charging station. Phoebe then stated "I've never wanted to slap someone so much in my life" before starting to walk down the hallway. KN walked down the hall behind her and stated that she cannot threaten library staff with violence. Phoebe turned and took one step towards KN, who immediately stopped walking. Phoebe was standing within inches of KN and repeated her statement about slapping staff. KN requested that she take a step back. Phoebe replied in an angry voice, "you were following me, you need to take a step back" while gesturing at KN with a pointed finger. Phoebe walked away, and KN retrieved L3 AG.
AG asked to speak with Phoebe in the hall, to which Phoebe stated "we'll see if you have a civil tongue in your head". In the hall AG introduced herself and stated that Phoebe is not permitted to make threats of violence against staff. Phoebe stated that she (KN) was lying and that she never did that. AG asked for her perspective on events, so Phoebe described the events while blaming staff for the charging station not charging her phone and mocking staff by imitating them. When Phoebe restated her comment of "I've never wanted to slap someone so much in my life", AG informed her that she cannot make those types of comments about staff and would need to leave. Phoebe stated that she needed to be here because her cooling was out and she was trying to arrange a repair. Phoebe then walked away from AG and returned to her computer. AG followed and asked how long she would need to make those arrangements. Phoebe replied about 30-40 minutes. AG informed her she had until 1pm and then she needed to leave the library, and that she was not to speak to staff in that manner any further.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: Regular patron, Chevayo, was in the 101 space using a computer to game.  He was repeatedly yelling loudly at the patron next to him to "shut up".  Other patrons in the 101 space were visibly disturbed by the yelling.  The patron next to him was not being loud. LA KV walked over and asked him to stop yelling.  Chevayo ignored her and put his earbud in his ear.  LIC AK was called to talk to Chevayo.  LIC asked Chevayo to leave for the day for yelling and for disrespecting library staff.  Chevayo did not move to leave.  LIC reminded him that he had been talked to about this behavior multiple times and at least once already this week.  Chevayo slammed his things around and left the building muttering under his breath and stomping down the stairs.  This behavior of yelling and disrespecting library staff has been addressed with Chevayo many times, and he was talked to just this week by L3LF about his behavior.  Plan TBA.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
Librarian JH approached a customer who was sleeping, hunched over a computer station. I had previously asked him twice to remain awake while at the computer station. JH went, a second time, to wake him and suggested that perhaps this wasn't a good day to remain at the library. The customer did not acknowledge JH's attempts to communicate with him. 
I explained that staff had approached him multiple times about the issue and offered to discuss solutions. He immediately became upset and began cursing, staking that he did not want to talk to us. I asked him to refrain from using profanity. He continued cursing, and I and asked him to leave the building. He asked if I was serious, I replied in the affirmative. He stood up knocked the chair over, left a banana peel on the floor and cursed at two other customers on his way out.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: discharged St Joseph's patient~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description: At around 10:20, guard JD told Librarian I KB that there was a man in a hospital gown sitting on a bench in front of the library. KB approached the man to let him know that he was welcome to come into the library to get out of the heat and use our courtesy phone for a ride. He indicated that St Joseph's had "thrown his ass out" and that he had nowhere to go. When asked he said that he had a multitude of medical issues and was in the hospital for 4 or 5 days. He previously lived in a boarding house but would not or could not return to that environment. He was wearing a hospital band on his wrist and a band that said "Fall Risk." KB told him that she would give him some phone numbers of shelters to call but he indicated that he wanted to research his options on the computer. KB got him onto a public PC. KB gave him the number of the Center of Opportunity and the Arizona 2-1-1 transportation number. While he was on the PC, KB called Casa de Respiro to see if they had a bed but was told he needed to get a referral from the hospital. They recommended that KB call the Gospel Rescue Mission (aka COO), which she then did and spoke with a woman who said that they normally conduct their intakes on Monday mornings but that she would email the manager on his behalf to see if there was anything that they could offer. As of this writing, KB has not heard back.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Children in the Library
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing~Children in the Library    4.3 Adult loitering in children's area
Description:
L2 KVN was assisting with Family Storytime when she noticed the patron from a volatile COL incident (see 0000023323 and 0000023334) sitting in the lobby on the benches, staring into the Large Meeting Room where storytime was taking place. KVN recognized him as the patron but was only 75% sure and therefore did not mention it to anyone or take any action. KVN did note that the patron appeared to watch/stare at her. He left shortly after she noticed him.
The patron, now identified as Jereth Orion Woodcock, is now confirmed (8/1) as the patron from the COL incidents and the patron from 7/19 after recognizing KVN and wanting to "resolve" his COL incidents on 8/1. 
This PITS serves to document his concerning behavior of watching Family Storytime on 7/19.

Infraction Categories: Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description: At around 4:40pm, L1 MED and LA RS heard shouting/screaming coming from somewhere on the El Rio Neighborhood Center campus, but could not determine from where. L1 MED saw the security guard climbing the stairs to the second level of the PCC Adult Education Center building. A few minutes later, a young woman (approximately in her late teens) was escorted into ELR by another female individual. The young woman was crying and shaking quite severely. She shared that her name was Minnie (sp?) and that she had been jumped and beaten up on the second floor of the PCC Adult Education Center building. She shared that she knew her attackers and that she had been lured to the Neighborhood Center under the pretense of celebrating her birthday which was that day, but then was attacked instead. Minnie did not want to contact and/or make a statement to law enforcement as she was fearful of subsequent retaliation. L1 MED and LA RS got Minnie settled at a table and provided her with water and a snack, as well as attended to a cut on her ear with first aid supplies upon her request and with her consent. Minnie was sick into an ELR trash can. The woman who brought her in stated that she herself had been attacked on the upper level as well in the past, and that there were no security cameras up there. She left not long after dropping Minnie off. LA RS helped Minnie call her boyfriend (Isaac, sp?) and her boyfriend's mother to coordinate a pick-up, as she did not have access to a cell phone or vehicle herself, then went to the Recreation Center to touch base with Center Manager Paul Ponce about the attack. Minnie remained at ELR until close, at which point L1 MED escorted her to the Recreation Center within the Neighborhood Center to wait for her ride. L1 MED provided Minnie with contact information for ELR and the Neighborhood Center manager, in case she changed her mind about making a statement/police report and needed to get in touch with anyone on-site.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: At ~11:50AM a patron was shouting with a CADC member at the library entrance. IC person LHN approached both people with security guard MG. At this, CADC member was yelling "she just popped off" and the patron yelled "I'm just trying to make a phone call and she won't let me." CADC member walked away to continue talking to someone about signing up. IC LHN asked the patron what had happened and while still having her voice raised, started talking about incidents unrelated to the phone call and that someone was trying to hack her and kept erasing her information and no one was helping her on the computer. LHN was on desk at 11am and did not recall any patron coming in to ask for the phone or this specific patron asking for computer help. LHN let her know that we cannot help with what was on the computer but that she could make a phone call from the free pay phone and to not ask other people outside to use their phones. The patron then said “but she said I could use hers and then started talking about no I’m at work and you can’t use my phone, I was going to recruit you but now I’m not. Is this a free phone or is it not, now I have you here threatening me.” While moving towards LHN. LHN let her know she was not threatening her and that we aren’t trying to get her to leave, we just need to know what happened so we can help her. The patron then started to yell “No one is helping me and people keep erasing my information. I don’t deserve to be outside, you’re in the f*****g way and keeping me from making a phone call.” Police officer on site MA then came up and told the patron that she did need to leave because she was being heard from inside the library and was being disruptive and using threatening language by cussing at staff. Police officer and security guard MG then escorted the patron off library premises. LHN later approached the CADC member to let her know to direct patrons inside the library for help at the front desk and to not engage with anything else. CADC member said that she did let the patron know to go inside and that she could not help with making a phone call or text message because she was working and "didn’t want to get caught up in her personal business." The CADC member was not asked to leave for the day because they did calm down and walked away after LHN initially approached both people asking what happened. The patron was asked to leave for the day because she would not stop yelling.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description: NONE

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Mason came to the Nanini Library service desk and asked if he was in the library or the sheriff's department. He said he needed an officer and no one had answered the sheriff's office door. Librarian DL told him he was in the library. She said the sheriff's department office was closed today (Saturday). Mason yelled that he needed help "right fucking now." A customer stepped in to tell him to calm down and stop yelling at library staff. Mason yelled and cursed, disrupting the entire library. Librarian DL asked him what he needed help with. She and Mason walked outside. He said his son was going to "slit his own throat" if he didn't get an officer out to his house right now. He said he lived in a house across the street. He said his wife had just died and he didn't know what to do. DL said she would call the police for him. Mason said he needed an officer "right fucking now." Just then, librarian II SW came outside and called 911. Mason laid down on the ground outside the library and began apologizing for his behavior. The sheriff's department sent three officers out to talk to Mason right away. Mason told SW not to worry because he would never come back to the library. SW told Mason he was welcome back to the library - just not today.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description: Lib 1 SG was on desk when she heard loud voices coming from the café area.  Guard CS met SC in the café where they found #1 Unknown_6993_07/15/2024   in a verbal altercation with a male who was sitting at a table with another person.  He was accusing the man of thinking "he was better than me" , using expletives, telling the man to "get up and be a man".  When SG asked him to stop using inappropriate language, and to please be aware he was in a public place, he started calling her names in Spanish that were sexual and offensive in nature.  He stated that his name was Gonzales and that name meant something on the street. He also said he was going to gather his dudes and come back to make a serious mess. This is the second incident where this patron engaged inappropriately with other patrons and made threatening remarks.  Both times he removed himself peacefully from the situation by leaving the library.  SG told him that he would be suspended.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Regular patron became agitated and began yelling profanity in the computer lab, disturbing other customers. LA TW called LIC MB, who found the woman still swearing in the direction of her computer screen while other computer users and guard were standing around her attempting to communicate. She had headphones in watching a video and was refusing to look at anyone. When she took out her headphones, MB asked her to leave for using profanity and creating a disruption. She yelled, "Leave the library? Do you know who I am?" but quickly gathered her belongings and left. TW commented that patron has a history of instability and outbursts.
