Description: 2 DVDs checked out to patron MAD were discovered to have live insects inside (not bed bugs, probably German cockroaches). Remediation steps followed.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using    1.1.10 Remaining inside the library after closing, including emergency closures~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: At 5:30 patron comes into branch and heads to the restroom.  At 5:50 Guard CS makes announcement that the library closes in 10 minutes and the restrooms need to be exited and locked up.  The patron is the only one still in the men's restroom and responds to the announcement by yelling and refusing to leave.  He is sitting in one stall, but his shirt and shoes are in the adjacent stall. After continuing to refuse to exit the restroom, Guard CS smells drug smoke coming from the restroom.  He asks the patron if he is smoking drugs to which the patron replies that he is not.  CS informs closing staff of incident and Librarian KV knocks on restroom and asks the patron to leave.  He continues to yell but admits to her that he had smoked some marijuana that may or may not have been laced with fentanyl.  The patron continues to yell for the next 10 minutes and finally comes out at 6:05 and exits the building.  After CS walked out of the front doors, the patron walked over and engaged with another patron who is deaf, trying to get him to fight.  CS told him to leave the property which he finally did.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: LIC MG responded to reports that a patron was snoring loudly in one of the restroom stalls. After multiple unsuccessful attempts to wake the patron, LII PP called 911. Fire Dept EMTs responded and were able to wake the patron and administer Narcan. Patron was taken to hospital.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description:
Librarian I DW was at the front desk, a male patron came by and said: “I don’t mean to be tattlin’ on no one, but you need to check out what’s happening in the bathroom!” After information was received DW immediately made his way to the Men’s restroom. As he approached, the smell of smoke was unmistakable and literally overpowering.
DW entered the Men’s Room and the door to the toilet stall opened.  DW saw two unknown men and the man in the stall was shirtless. He asked loudly and pointedly: “Are you smoking drugs in my library?” A second man, fully clothed, laughed in his face and quickly exited the bathroom and the building. The shirtless man then donned a t-shirt. He seemed dazed and unable to answer my questions.
Formerly shirtless man then proceeded to sit down in the library where he answered questions from staffers. DW primary task at that point was to clear out the noxious fumes in the Men’s Room.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: It took 25 minutes for him to get his belongings together and leave the library
Description: LIC L2 JM witnessed a patron at the last express computer station on the 1st floor sitting on his small red cooler and leaning forward over his legs while using a lighter to smoke a substance under the computer station. The man had a lot of clothing hung over himself. A little smoke was observed as JM approached the patron and informed him that it was illegal to smoke drugs of any kind in the library building. The patron denied smoking anything and LIC L2 JM told the patron she had seen the flame. LIC L2 JM asked Vet Sec guard J.T. to come over to assist in getting the patron to gather his belonging that were strewn around at the last computer. L3 LD came over from the children's area to assist and confirmed that there was a faint drug smell in the area by the express computers. The patron moved from sitting on the cooler to a library chair and very slowly continued putting away his things including several cell phones he was charging and their packaging into his several bags. The patron said things like that he was just trying to make money. LIC L2 JM asked the patron if it would help him to have a plastic bag to put his various items in and the patron replied "yes." L3 L.D. retried a bag from the circulation desk and all 3 library staff continued to wait for the man and to ask him to move a little quicker to get his things together and exit the building. L3 LD overheard the patron say that he didn't know how to get his things together. The patron finished getting all of his belongings and throwing away trash at 5:42pm and LIC IC JM led him outside of the library sliding glass doors. Once outside she informed him again that he would be suspended for smoking a drug substance in the libraries and he would be suspended from all branches of the library for one year. She informed him that he could come in tomorrow to get his paperwork. Vet Sec Guard JT joined them outside and the man then replied that he didn't like any type of "work" and that all he needed was "god" to take care of him. He also said some things about drugs and crackheads and that there was a drug that could keep you up for 24 hours. Most of what the patron said couldn't be understood. The patron continued walking out onto Jacome plaza and there was no further incident.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Informational: Approximately 2:22 pm, an unknown, Caucasian female was sitting at the door of the loading dock, smoking illegal substances. She was dirty, unkempt, with stringy, long hair. She was seen by custodian D, who then told L1 CM and security guard, MG about her. CM and MG opened the back door/loading dock door, where she began to quickly gather her things to leave. MG told her that she could be arrested. MG had his phone in his hand, and she said, "Don't take a picture of my vagina!" She ran off, leaving through the Yavapai Rd gate.

Description:
About 12:45p.m. a patron approached the service desk and asked LTA Sup GG for assistance with making a medical 911 call. Patron stated he was feeling pain and discomfort from a spider bite on his left leg. After a brief hold, 911 operator informed GG that emergency services would be in route. Fire department and AMR arrived around 1:10p.m. assessed and transported the patron to the hospital.
For information purposes.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress

Description:
Around 1:35, Guard CS sees a man tearing up pieces of aluminum foil in front of the main entrance to the library and reports it to L1 MNC. MNC comes out to investigate and sees the individual raising the foil to his face and heating the drugs in it with his lighter. MNC tells him that drug use is not allowed on library property and asks him to leave. The man (a white male) responds by calling MNC the n-word several times and yelling phrases like "go to f*** your mother, n*****" while walking away towards the corner of 22nd and Columbus. CS and MNC return inside.
While walking through the lobby, they see the man settle on the horseshoe bench outside the west library door to continue his drug use. CS and MNC go back outside and MNC directs him again to leave. The man continues to call MNC the n-word and shouting phrases like "you're nothing but a n*****" until he heads across the street.
He will be suspended for one year for both drug use and racist and abusive language directing towards staff.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description:
Sorry, this was created as a test to get a screen shot for instructional purposes. No incident took place.
- Betsy Langley, Sahuarita Library Manager

Around 2pm on 7/25/2024 an elderly female patron approached the front service desk and informed staff that they were experiencing possible heat related illness (heart palpitations, heavy sweating) due to the temperature in the building. The patron did not wish to leave their information with staff, and chose to leave the library instead. Staff later reported this to branch manager SH. SH informed their supervisor of the current building temperatures and the following issue and as a result the library was closed to the public at 4:00pm due to HVAC Issues. The library will reopen to the public at 10am 07/26/2024.
This report is for documentation purposes only.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating
Description: A man and his friend were sleeping in the library.  The man was lying on the ground with his foot up on a chair.  Guard RP and Lib 3 LM approached the man and asked him to please sit in a chair instead of lying on the ground.  They said he could sleep sitting up in the chair, just not lying on the ground.  He complied.  Later, when the couple left the library, the man stopped at the guard's desk and said, "Next time you do that, I'll wake up swinging and punch you, you son of a bitch".  He will be suspended for one year for threatening the security guard.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft    1.1.4 Vandalizing property
Description: Man walks up to West entrance doors before opening and proceeds to steal the Recorder's office lock box attached to the door handle.  He attempts to steal the Elections lock box on the other door but is unsuccessful.  The Recorder's team was already inside of the library thus the library keys were not in the lock box when it was taken.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
A patron approached L2 KVN at the HS and made a complaint about the patron sitting at PC #27 next to the large green suitcase. He reported the patron being repeatedly violent with the PC and desk, punching it to the point of shaking the whole table, making disruptive comments, and making the patron feel uncomfortable. 
KVN observed the patron at PC #27, Joshua Robinson, and confirmed that he was acting erratically and noticeably disturbing other patrons in the PC area.
KVN asked Guard BJ to act as backup. She approached Joshua and asked if they could step away from the PC's to talk briefly, and then he could return to his PC. Joshua refused and said KVN could talk to him at the PC. KVN informed him that there had been concerns regarding his behavior at the PC, that he had been making aggressive gestures and motions and hitting the desk, and she asked if he could please use the PC appropriately. 
Joshua denied doing any of the listed behaviors and asked KVN repeatedly to demonstrate what he had been doing at the PC. KVN stated she was not going to demonstrate, and that he simply needed to use the PC in a non-distracting manner or step away if he needed to do activities that might distract others. 
Joshua started to call KVN "a liar" because she refused to demonstrate the behavior he had been displaying at the PC. When he continued to try to argue with her and call her a liar, saying he "did not have to listen to liars," KVN interrupted and told him that if he could comply with her request he could continue using the computer, but if he continued arguing he would be asked to leave for the day.
Joshua stated "you think I should just listen to you because you're a good person, but you're not a good person, you're a bad person, so I don't have to listen to you." He continued to call KVN "a bad person" while packing up his items. KVN walked away to stop the engagement while he packed up his items.
KVN did not ask patron to leave. Patron removed himself from library.

A father was having a CPS visit with his daughter, the daughter was on computer 24 and and the father was on computer 25. Around 12:17 the father started to have a seizure and both police officer M, security guard MG librarian CM, and library staff AG ran to help. Around 12:25 security guard MG came and got me at this point we were waiting for the emergency crew to come after they have been called by officer Mike. As the father was coming to with the help of his service dog, the emergency help arrived and started to give the father the medical attention he needed. We were able to find out that the patron ran out of his seizure medication, but because the father could not remember pertinent information about his self, the emergency team took him to Banner health on N. Campbell. The emergency team was not able to take the father's dog, so the library staff held onto the dog until about !:00pm, the Librarian CO called Banner to make sure its okay to bring the dog to its owner. The hospital confirmed that it was okay so Librarian CO, Library worker AG, and security guard MG to the dog to the hospital to be with its owner.

Infraction Categories: Medical 911~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Medical 911~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description:
For documentation purposes:
Guard BJ approached Librarian I KB sometime in the early afternoon to say that a library customer (LC1) had been talking to him and another library customer (LC2) in the lobby about being afraid to go home because she was afraid that her husband might try to kill her. BJ wanted to know if he was obligated to report this information to the police. KB told him no, but gave BJ the phone number for Emerge for him to pass along to her. 
At around 3:45pm Guard BJ told LB1 KB that 911 had been called "hours" ago, but no one had arrived. Seeking clarification about whether or not the customer had spoken with someone at Emerge, KB spoke to LC1, who said that she had not, but instead had called 911 after being directed to call the police by someone at Tucson Medical Center, who LC1 had called instead of Emerge at the urging of LC2 in the lobby. LB1KB then dialed the Emerge phone number from the courtesy phone in the lobby and handed LC1 the phone. The Emerge rep was able to find a translator for LC1 (who was Chinese), enabling LC1 to better communicate her situation. While LC1 was on the phone with Emerge, a TPD officer arrived. LC1 hung up with Emerge and met with the officer in the meeting room. LC1 told BJ and KB that Emerge did not have a bed for her and that she was instructed to call other shelters. The TPD officer called a shelter, too, but did not get an answer. The officer gave LC1 a Victim Notification pamphlet with phone numbers to two other domestic violence crisis lines. LC1 indicated to BJ and KB that she was just going to go home. BJ and KB strongly urged LC1 to go to the emergency room at St. Joseph's Hospital to call the two other phone numbers, as the library would be closing soon. KB explained that these shelters were different than Emerge and hopefully they would have something available. The officer quickly explained to LC1 the process of getting a restraining officer, and KB gave her a list of cooling centers that are open on Sundays.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description: Customer 1, older white male in white hat confronted another customer 2 who was talking quietly on their phone with headphones. When customer 2 tried to ignore customer 1, the first customer got threatening and told customer #2 to "try him." After hearing reports of this interaction, I approached customer #1 to let him know the proper way to handle noise complaints is to go to staff, he said he would. I asked him to confirm his use the phrase "try me" and I explained to him that I took his threat of violence seriously and he would have to leave for the day. I again stressed the necessity of working with staff members and not taking things into one's own hands as I escorted customer #1 to the door.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Red - High Impact (Please click Notifications > Email aliases > Copy Trauma Informed Care Team if your location would like to request group EAP support)    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description:
During the 10-11 desk hour, VAL staff member CC experienced inappropriate remarks from an elder patron about her looks. 10-20 minutes after this experience, CC informed Librarian LAC about these comments. LAC remembered that another VAL page team member VO had contact with this elder patron within that hour. When CC and LAC inquired with page team member, both learned that inappropriate comments were given by the same patron. Comments include and are not limited to:
-If you come any closer, I am going to have to kiss you. 
-You're so pretty, you remind me of my girls.
-Why are you so serious? (After boundary was established)
In additional note, LAC heard an aside that he would like someone "to put on a pot of coffee for me." Later it was confirmed that the elder man wearing a grey shirt with glasses, as well as balding, was the same man making these comments to CC and VO.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.4 Sleeping    2.10 Creating tripping hazards, blocking aisles, exits, entrances    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: LibIII KW went into café area and found male patron with pillow and very stained blanket asleep and laying across the couch like it was a bed.  KW asked him to please sit upright and to please not utilize the couch as if it were a bed. He grumbled acknowledgment and KW walked away.  During the next hour KW once again went through the café and found the same man in the same position that he had been asked to rectify.  She again told him that the library was not a place to use as a personal bedroom and that he needed to put his blanket and pillow away and remain sitting or he would be asked to leave.  He was not happy and let her know that he was just trying to be comfortable to which she replied that this was not appropriate library behavior.  He begrudgingly started compiling his belongings and sitting up.  after lunch, KW once again was doing rounds through the café when she found the same man stretched out, sleeping in the corner on the floor with his blanket and pillow.  KW once again woke him up and informed him that due to his inability to comply, he needed to leave for the day.  He left but continued to complain that KW was being unreasonable and that he was 'homeless" and just wanted to sleep.  KW told him he could try again another day if he could comply with library rules.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: A customer reported to Guard JD that someone was shooting up on the west side of the building.  L3 KK and JD approached Jeffrey Balzano whose arms, neck and eyelids were twitching significantly.   KK made Mr. Balzano aware that someone said they saw him shooting up. Balzano immediately jumped up and started screaming, shouting, cursing and acting erratically.  He said that he wasn't using and swung his arms in a threatening manner.  KK and JD opted to go back into the building for their safety.  JD instructed the man to leave property as they walked away from the man.  KK called 911.  Man left property after a few minutes.  911 call was cancelled.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.1 Manipulating or bypassing library rules, such as computer use
Description: Customer PS left his computer and approached the desk to speak to LTA KW about two noise complaints: 1. A patron seated in a chair near the desk who was having what Customer PS considered to be a loud phone call and 2. A computer user who was intermittently muttering to himself and conversing with the person seated next to him. LTA KW stated that the other customers' volume was acceptable, as neither were in the quiet area. Customer PS told LTA KW that "if [she felt] that was the case, [she] needed to see an audiologist." A few minutes later Customer PS again left his computer and directly approached the patron on the phone call, saying, "nobody needs to hear you talking to your friend." The other patron ignored PS, who returned to his computer. Customer PS then came to L1 KH at the desk, inquiring about the acceptability of the noise and if there was somewhere in the library where he could "read in peace." L1 KH informed him that the library is no longer a silent space, people may speak at normal volume, and that rainy days tend to have an impact on the acoustics in Himmel. KH offered use of the meeting room as a quiet place to read, which PS declined as he needed the computer.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: Suspended customer Jeffrey Balzano returned to property and was sitting on the west side of the building.  Due to his threatening behavior the previous day, L3 KK called 911 to have him trespassed.  TPD arrived in about 5 minutes but had Mr. Balzano leave before speaking to staff.  Therefore, the customer has not been issued suspension letter.  However, TPD Officer Harrington advised Mr. Balzano that if he returned to WIL, he would be arrested for trespass.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description: Shortly before 10, a female patron was sitting on a bench in the lobby waiting for the upper floors to open. A male patron approached her and started up a conversation. The man proceeded to follow the woman throughout the library for about 40 minutes, repeatedly getting close to her, trying to touch her, and asking if he could "hold" her. She tried to get away by going to different floors, but he followed. At around 10:30, the man asked for one more hug (which the woman gave him, as she felt too intimidated to say no by this point) and left the floor. The woman came to LA TW and asked for help escaping the situation. LIC CS took her out the staff exit and walked her to her car in the garage. The man left the building and walked off across the plaza.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: At closing on 7/31, Ms. Flowers asked page EH to carry a bag to her vehicle. Lib II SW told Ms. Flowers that staff cannot carry her belongings out to her vehicle. On 8/1, IT staff were coming into the building and Ms. Flowers asked them to carry a bag into the library for her. SW told Ms. Flowers that she cannot ask people to bring things in and out for her. SW suggested that she only bring in the things she can handle herself. She asked if it was okay if someone offered to help, and SW said yes.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
At about 1:15 shouting could be heard coming from outside the front doors. As the volume increased, staff and patrons could hear profanity and slurs. L3 AG and guard AB responded to find a male patron and female patron at the bike rack. The male patron was on his bike and was leaving as the female patron yelled at him about how he wasn't supposed to be near her. The situation, as reported by the female patron, was that she had a restraining order against the man, her husband, and she had just caught him "going through" the things in the trailer attached to her bike. She asked AG if the library had a security camera and was told yes, but that she would need to file a police report. She then said she believed he may have stolen something from her and that she would probably press charges.
On reviewing the camera footage, the male patron retrieves his bike from the bike rack and then stands near the other bike without touching it. The female patron soon arrives and begins yelling at the man, who appears to just stand there. Neither of them appears to touch the other, but the female patron did get close-up to the man's face several times as though trying to intimidate or get a reaction from him.
This is for documentation purposes.

There is a COT/Regional Transportation Authority construction project along Mary Ann Cleveland Way (MAC) to install a walking/biking path from Houghton Road to Atterbury Wash Way. Much of the equipment and the crew vehicles are kept directly in front of the library along MAC. Library staff did not witness or report an incident, but by 1:40pm it was obvious from the fire engine, ambulance, and police cars that something had occurred. A TPD officer came into the library and said that one of the construction crew accidentally shot himself in the leg. He was taken to the hospital and was expected to be okay. TPD was interested in library camera footage that extends to part of the area where the incident occurred, and the Library Director granted permission to L3 MMM to let TPD view it.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.4 Sleeping~Medical 911
Description: Three staff members and our security guard attempted to wake a customer who was face down and snoring at a computer. When our attempts were unsuccessful, HR called 911. The 911 operator was concerned that the customer was snoring and not able to be woken up, and she asked if staff were prepared to do CPR. While HR was on the phone, staff continued their attempts to wake the customer. He eventually woke up before CPR had to be administered, and HR ended the 911 call. The customer decided to leave.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property~Children in the Library~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: Using and leaving a positive COVID test at a child computer station    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library~Children in the Library    4.3 Adult loitering in children's area~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description: At around 5:30pm, a mother approached L1 AK at the Children's desk and told her that there was a strange man wandering around the Children's room and that he had left something on one of the AWE stations. Upon further investigation, AK found a positive COVID test and accoutrement at the AWE desk. Camera footage shows that the man went into the children's room, opened and used the COVID test, wandered around out of AK's line of sight while the test was processing, and then left the library after checking the test. If he returns, we will speak with him about appropriate uses for the children's room and disposal of medical waste.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: Customer identifying himself as Jereth Woodcock asked to speak to the manager.  L3 KK spoke to Mr. Woodcock who said that he was in the library and someone was speaking in "high decibels."  He said staff "would not do anything about it" so he handled it himself.  He then said that he got in trouble and he wanted to get that "settled."  KK asked for his name so that she could look him up on PITS and did not find anything.  Mr. Woodcock then said L2 KVN knew about the incident and asked to speak to her.  By looking through the manager's office window, KVN identified Mr. Woodcock as a man who became violent at COL but KVN did not feel safe interacting with him.  KK made Mr. Woodcock aware that he was suspended from all libraries and that only library administration can overturn suspensions.  At Mr. Woodcock's request, KK explained why he was suspended.  Mr. Woodcock denied doing these things.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: Bug activity
Description: LTA Sup SG found a book in the outdoor bookdrop (the furthest one from the door) that had a dead bug in it and potential bug residue in the back. Patron was identified as SF in Sierra. Holds have been placed on other books on the account and book has been quarantined.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.4 Sleeping    2.10 Creating tripping hazards, blocking aisles, exits, entrances
Description: A man was sleeping on the floor, in front of the Friends shelves. Lib II SW woke him up and told him he needed to stay on the furniture. He got up and started walking toward the door. SW asked if he was okay, and he said no. SW told him to let us know if he needed medical help, and we would call 911. He declined help and left the building.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description: At 4:13 guard JQ came into the back and informed L1 JCB that a patron had reported someone with foil in the women's bathroom.  JCB entered the bathroom and found only the ADA-accessible stall in use.  There was foil on the ground, but none was burned to her observation and there was no chemical smell.  JCB grabbed MNC as additional backup and they went back in to do a welfare check.  The woman came out and asked who they were looking for.  MNC explained it was a routine background check.  The woman then stated that he needed to go do that somewhere else because this is a library and it was not okay to be checking bathrooms.  MNC told her she needed to leave for the day and directed her to the front door.  The patron then became even more incoherent, saying "don't wave your finger at me.  That's not okay.  You need help.  Someone's not treating you right if you think that's okay.  I'll call the police for you."  MNC continued to tell her to leave.  She walked off and JCB and MNC went back inside while JQ waited outside.  The woman returned less than two minutes later, and MNC and JCB returned to the front.  The woman then stated "you can't treat people like that.  You'll get thrown into the pavement if you treat people that way.  Don't leave here.  I'm calling the police.  You need to be here when they get here.  Don't leave."  At this point MNC said "You are banned from all library properties for a month for threatening staff.  She responded "you can't make me leave, this is a library.  Who do you think you are?"  JCB responded "Ma'am we are library employees and you need to leave now."  MNC and JCB again went back into the building as she walked off.  A minute later her voice was heard again and when JCB and MNC returned the woman was shouting at JQ "Your people went to war with my country but you won't win...Tell your girlfriend to shave her head because no one will follow her around looking like that."  JCB and MNC again reiterated that she had to leave and she walked toward the employee entrance side of the building.

Description: Staff called 911 for individual who was experiencing symptoms of stroke or mental health crisis.  TFD determined that the man needed medical attention.  Man resisted paramedics requiring them to get a court order to restrain him.  During the restraint process, the man got into an altercation with paramedics immediately in front of the main entry doors.  L3 KK locked the front doors until the man could be restrained.

Description:
At approximately 10:15a, VAL Team member KG informed in-charge Librarian LAC that a patron needs to call 911. On the portable phone, distressed patron (Jasmine or Jazmin) informed LAC and police that she had been shot at from a neighboring apartment complex. The following information was gathered:

Jasmine or Jazmin was wearing grey joggers and a black shirt with neon colored seams
Distressed patron was smaller than 5'5"
Shooter was described as wearing all black attire with black face mask

In-charge Librarian LAC informed Librarian RL about the incident and remarked that when she and another VAL Team member LW were on a walk-around they heard something similar to a gunshot. These instances were individually explicated to the police when they arrived onsite to two police officers. VecSec guard remained on the lookout for offsite shooter and was instructed to lock the double doors if the shooter, as described, approached VAL.

Infractions: Children in the Library    Children in the Library: Other not listed: not picked up on time
Description:
For documentation purposes: LIB KV checked with children in the library prior to closing to make sure everyone had a plan to get home or a ride.  A group of three minors said their parent knew when the library closed and that they were going to be picked up.  LIB KV asked them to please call or text to remind them that the library closes at 6:00 pm and they must be picked up by that time.  At closing the minors were still standing outside waiting for their ride.  When staff walked out around the staff exit, LIB KV asked the minors again if they had a way to get home and one responded that her mother was on the way just passing the Swap Meet.  It was about 6:10 at this point. LIB KV let the children know that it is very important to be picked up by 6:00 pm since the area is not safe and library staff would have to call the police if they are not picked up within 15 minutes of closing.  LIB SG said she would stay with Guard CS to wait for the parent.  Parent showed up around 6:18 pm for the kids and LIB SG approached the vehicle to inform the parent about the library's policy.
LIB SG approached the parent driving a pickup truck who seemed agitated. SG explained to the parent that minors are not allowed to be by themselves after closing, and if the unattended minors are not picked up within the first 15 minutes after closing, it is required policy to call the cops to report it. However, no further actions were taken in her case since the kids informed library staff that a parent was on their way. The parent's response was that she wasn't going to let her kids come to the library anymore and started yelling at the kids while they were entering the car. The parent abruptly ended the conversation accelerated the car, and recklessly drove out of the parking lot.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: Patron asked LTA Sup SG to call 911 for a medical emergency. SG called 911 around 10:05AM. Ambulance came around 10:15AM came to take the patron away. Patron left a wheelchair in the GLF breezeway and signed a waiver absolving PCPL of any loss or damages.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Sarah Brownin called to say that she had just attended storytime with her children and that the sign with the Pride flag and the message "All Are Welcome" should not be in the storytime room. She said that it's bad enough that she has to keep her children away from displays in the library, but a sign in the storytime room is not okay. L3 MMM asked, "What part of the message is not okay?" Sarah then raised her voice, got more excited and yelled that while it's true that all should be welcome in the library, everyone knows that the flag makes that message a political and divisive topic. L3 MMM attempted to speak again, but Sarah yelled, "Stop. Let me finish!" She went on to say (in her raised tone) that the sign does not make her family feel welcome and does not go along with her religious beliefs. She is concerned that she can't take her kids to the library anymore because she is not ready to have "those conversations" with them, and she said that many families are "against it." L3 MMM could hear Sarah's children were with her during the call as she went on about her family's belief system and how the library should not be taking a stance. L3 MMM heard her out until Sarah managed to finish yelling about her opinions and stopped to take a breath. L3 MMM would not agree to remove the sign but thanked her for calling. Sarah thanked her for taking the call.

G J, after conferring with ICMG, called 911 from her phone. Meanwhile, we got her a shirt and eventually she put it on. We watched her carefully, and eventually she left the building. Guard J cancelled the 911 call.

Description: L1 JD was working in the children's section when a woman looked at the child she was with and said "That looks like a nit."  The woman proceeded to pick something from the child's hair and began to inspect the child's hair in the children's room.  JD made L3 KK aware.  KK and L2 KVN approached the woman, child and the man who was with them.  As they approached the woman was parting the child's hair with her thumbnail, inspecting the scalp, and then parting a different section.  KK made the woman aware that staff had overheard her talking about nits.  The woman said that she had checked and the child did not have any.  KK asked that they discontinue checking for nits in the library and, if nits were found, to address them before their next visit.  Woman said that she would comply.  At about 5:50pm, the child's mother approached KK expressing anger that someone had accused her child of having nits.  KK explained the situation and, after a few minutes of discussion and venting, the mother calmed down saying that she would ask the child's adult sister who had been checking for nits to not do this in the library in the future.

Description: Patron came in the library last minute to do a print job for her daughter, regarding a school project. Patron notified staff (BC) of printer not printing up her print job. Staff member approached patron to exam and investigate why the printer was not working; staff member communicated with patron that library will soon be closing but is welcomed to come back to the library when staff can assist her with her print job. Patron immediately got upset and frustrated and proceeded to call attending staff member an "ugly black b****." The time was then 5:59, the computer automatically logged her off and patron then became irater at the situation, which exacerbated the existing tension between the staff member and patron. The library was then closed, patron approached the desk and ask for the staff member's name, stating that she was going to get reported. Staff member BC proceed to give the patron her name and walked off. The present security guard Robert Phillips, prior to shutting the library doors for the evening, wished the offending patron a good evening, to which the patron responded by saying, "f*** you!"

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description: A patron identified as Kevin Sahwn Burch,(21152042330963) approached the service desk requesting to speak with an in-charge librarian about an incident that happened earlier. L1 SG, responded that she was the person in charge at the moment. before the patron started to share the details of the incident, demanded SG to cover herself, when SG asked him to repeat what he said, thinking that she didn't hear right, the patron repeated twice raising his voice "cover yourself, you look offensive," using his hands to refer to the chest area. SG responded, "I'm sorry that my attire is offensive to you but I am not going to cover myself." The patron reacted surprised and demanded SG to give him the address to Main Library since he wanted to go there in person to speak with someone in charge of all libraries to file a complaint. SG gave him a brochure with the information, the patron snatched the paper out SG hands and left. For documentation purposes.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: Infestation - Requires proof of treatment
Description:
On July 18, patron Tara Lester contacted AskALibrarian with a request to removal of book titles from her account, and clarifying she wasn't asking for the fee to be removed. Patron also indicated that they are a regular computer user at the library. AskALibrarian forwarded the request to Manager VS, and Manager HR (HIM). 
Manager VS addressed the request by marking the items as "lost" in the patron's account. This removed the item titles from the patron's visible list of checked out items, but kept the cost of replacement added to the patron's account. 
Patron responded via email, writing, "Much appreciated, finally getting those damn books out of my sight every time I log in to my account!"
While checking the patron's account, VS, noticed notes in the patron's record referencing borrowing issues at HIM, and the patron P Type was set to (40) Suspended. VS updated the patron's P Type to (44) Infestion req. treatment proof, and updated the message.
Manager HR contacted VS as well, forwarding her emails from one year ago, where Manager MS from Main Library had corresponded with the patron (9/11/23) about a bed bug issue in materials she had returned to Main Library. The patron replied to MS, saying: "You are fucking crazy. All of you are. I do not have bedbugs. I think I would know if there were bugs biting me and there are not. Plus I have looked and looked for them. Found nothing. Whoever said there was a bedbug on a book I returned is a liar. I just can't figure out why. It makes no sense. I do not have the money to PAY for some kind of examination from an exterminator. So you can kindly shove your library . I don't give a fuck." 
RECOMMENDED COURSE OF ACTION:
Document any further incidents with this patron in PITS.
If patron asks about renewing borrowing privileges, Managers are encouraged to use their judgement to decide what course of action they would like to take. Circulation Services recommends two possible courses of action, based on their assessment of the patron's needs, behavior, and situation: 
---CONSERVATIVE APPROACH: explain to the patron that they will need to bring proof of treatment before we can allow them to check out books again.
---2ND CHANCE APPROACH: If you think there has been a situational or personal change that may have caused the patron to no longer have a bed bug issue, for example, a change of address that they have shown proof for, then branch managers are welcome to talk to the patron about this. it's important to note that 1) bed bugs can move with a person to a new address 2) the patron still owes money to the library that they will also have to resolve through payment or replacement, before they can use their account again. 3) reinstating this patron's privileges is risky, given their borrowing history, and may result in further loss of library materials, and a reinstatement of suspended borrowing privileges. Staff will need to carefully monitor her returns.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.4 Sleeping
Description: At ~12:40pm two patrons, presenting male and female, were found sleeping in the magazine lounging area by LTA JP, who then alerted IC LII VV. VV saw that someone was sleeping at computer 11 and woke him up first letting him know he cannot sleep in the library and the patron moved to computer 18. VV then went to wake up the other two patrons by the lounging area, but they were unresponsive. VV went to go grab Security Guard BG to help wake up the patrons, when they attempted to wake up both patrons again, the male bobbed his head but was still unresponsive to getting up, the female did not respond at all. VV then went to the front desk to let other IC staff members know the patrons were unresponsive after multiple attempts while Guard BG continued to monitor patron behavior. LHN said to call the Fire Department to check on them since they were unresponsive, VV called and was directed to call 911. Fire Department EMT team arrived at ~12:48pm, LHN and Guard BG directed EMT to lounging area and EMT attempted to wake patrons again, letting them know they needed to show them they could move and were responsive. EMT then asked again for patrons to move, female patron was asked to put on shoes and complied. Patrons were then asked if they had taken any drugs, fentanyl, alcohol, male patron responded they had been drinking. EMT were able to ensure patrons could move and were responsive and asked to leave for the day. Patrons were walked out and once towards the front of the library tried to sit at Job Help station, EMT stated to keep moving. Patrons and EMT left library property at ~1:07pm.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.2 Disruptive use of personal devices    2.8 Smoking, rolling, using tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: Youth Chance Pruyen 21152042427769 came in with two other youth (Isaiah and Mia) to use the computers.  They immediately had problems with volume and language which they were asked to correct.  On the third ask in a half hour, LA NG told them they needed to leave for the day.  LTA ML came into IC LIB III KW's office to ask for back-up with getting the youth to leave.  When KW went to the lobby she found Chance and his two friends arguing with NG about leaving and begging for another chance, interspersed with inappropriate language thrown in.  KW informed Chance and Isaiah that they needed to leave for the day or they would be suspended for a longer time.  The 2 boys finally removed themselves and Mia was able to stay because she was attempting to calm them down and make them behave.  A few minutes later the boys were back in the lobby getting a drink of water and Guard CS saw them share a vape and  inhale it right in front of him as he was telling them that they needed to stay out for the day.   They began arguing their case that it was too hot and they had to wait for another friend's sister to pick them up.  KW told them that they should have considered that when they were asked to follow library rules and they needed to leave.  After much debate, and many interspersed "bitches" and "fucks" Chance proceeded to strew his snack all over the porch.  KW went to get a broom so that he could clean up the mess and he started playing very loud rap music laden with inappropriate language and refused to turn it off.  He did attempt to sweep up his mess before KW told him that he needed to leave the property immediately and he would be suspended for 6 months.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.10 Remaining inside the library after closing, including emergency closures~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description: At 4:55, Lib II SW was locking the restrooms and there was a man in the last stall of the men's restroom. The man was still there when staff were leaving at 5:05. LA SB went into the restroom and told the man that the library was closed and he needed to leave the building. SB thought the man was cleaning up. Staff left the building and at 5:12, SW called 911. Deputies arrived at 5:24 and told SW that the man was Chris Possert. Deputies told SW that Chris had "made himself quite at home" in the stall. SW told Chris that he needs to leave when the library closes, and he would be suspended if this happened again. However, upon further review of his incidents and camera footage showing how long it took deputies to get him out of the building, SW decided to suspend him now. Camera images indicate that Chris may have been in the restroom from 2:41 until deputies removed him at 5:40.

Infraction Categories: Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description: At 12:14pm, Southwest Library received a phone call from the TUSD Southwest Resource Center that there was a shooting across the street and Anna E. Lawrence Intermediate School, Southwest Resource Center, and Harriet Johnson Primary School are on lockdown. Branch Manager MS locked the doors and informed patrons that "the branch is on lockdown, you may leave if you want to, but if you do, you cannot come back in." Branch Manager also informed LSM AR that the branch is on lockdown due to shots fired in the area and police activity. At about 12:30pm, a School Safety Officer with a key to the building, came in and searched the premises and informed us to stay on lockdown, no one in, no one out. At 2:07pm, Branch Manager MS called School Safety again, as it was the second hour on lockdown and was informed again to stay on lockdown. At 2:10, the 7 patrons inside the building decided to leave the premises, (4 adults and 3 children) as the schools were still on lockdown, but in “secure mode” allowing parents to pick up students and a School Safety Officer was posted in front of the doors of the library. At 3:00pm, Branch Manager MS called School Safety again, and was told to continue to keep the doors locked. MS contacted LSM AR who contacted Admin for permission to close for the remainder of the day.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description:
Around 3:29 pm LTA MM and LTA Sup GG were at the front desk when approached by one of our regular patrons, he began speaking indirectly to staff about him “working for the library and you (staff) should be homeless.” When LTA Sup GG looked towards him, he began yelling profanity calling LTA MM a B-word and LTA Sup GG “Dumb N-word.” Then, LTA Sup GG told him that language is not appropriate and got up to follow him towards the door. Patron then exited the building but stopped before reaching the gate. He made his back toward the building and met LTA SUP GG at the door and began to rant once more, saying to LTA Sup GG “you should go back to Ecuador, you dumb F-ing N-word.” LTA Sup GG told him to leave. Patron walked away without further incident.
Due to a similar incident in the past, patron will be suspended for a year.

LTAS GG then went and verified the odor as drug use. The patron quickly exited the building before we could question her.

A suitcase was left outside beside the building near the staff entrance. Staff member AM alerted staff in-charge SG of its presence at noon. After SG returned from lunch and the suitcase was still there, SG contact the police to inspect the item.
 
Police officer arrive and found the material was not dangerous. Told staff that they are free to call again if the material is still there in a day or so if they do not feel comfortable removing it from premises themselves.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: At 4:57pm, three teens left the library through the side door to the elevator to the parking garage. A man accosted them just outside and began shouting at them to "go to hell." He was loud enough to be heard on the 1st & 2nd floors. The teens went back inside and told desk staff. On-site Offer Merlin heard the commotion and spoke to the man outside, informing him that he was not welcome in the library for the rest of the day and could face trespass or disorderly conduct if his behavior persisted. LIC MB escorted the teens out through the staff exit on the other side of the building.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description:
Patron suspended from STU on 8.13 for PITS 0000023676 was using a PC at WIL when L2 KVN noticed him. KVN grabbed Guard JD with L1 JM as back-up and asked to speak with him up front. Patron complied and met KVN up front. KVN served him his suspension notice and explained that due to his behavior at STU he was suspended. KVN attempted to explain that he could appeal it, and patron responded "just as I find housing, you all kick me out." KVN reiterated that his behavior at STU was unacceptable and that he can appeal his suspension by following the steps on his letter. Patron responded "You guys are all n*ggers." As he was walking out the doors, he informed staff he had a "1600 SAT score" and said "Death to America." Patron refused to take his suspension letter.
KVN called STU and COL to confirm updated patron records that this patron is Sean#2. Sean#2 has been suspended for 1-year since March/April after a physical fight with another patron at COL. Now this patron has been served another 1-year suspension for behavior at STU.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.1 Harassment: Filming or photographing without permission    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: Accusations of Stalking Against Guard
Description:
Guard JD reported patron from PITS 0000023657 taking pictures of patrons entering the library. L2 KVN went to speak with her in the children's section. Patron reported being "gang stalked." KVN asked if she needed assistance from the police, and patron said she did not, she has an attorney. KVN listened to her concerns and informed her that taking pictures anywhere on property is not allowed. KVN and patron had extended conversation regarding patron's stalking situation, and patron reported having an attorney. KVN informed her the attorney can request camera footage of any incidents through a subpoena but she is not allowed to take pictures on property.
At 1:45pm Guard JD reported to KVN that the patron was arguing with him in the lobby, reporting that he had "told on her" and that he was not "forcing the lobby patrons to be quiet" so she could use the communal phone. KVN returned to speak with the patron. Patron accused JD of stalking her, to which KVN informed her that JD is doing his job and reports on all things happening inside the branch. KVN let her know that while staff are sympathetic to her situation, if she has concerns about noise volume she needs to bring it to staff at the desk, and she cannot make false accusations about the guard performing his duties or she would be asked to leave. 
KVN and patron had an extended conversation. Patron agreed "now I know he's just doing his job." 
This is second documented verbal conversation about photographing patrons.

Description: Patron on 1st floor requested that library staff call 911 for medical, complaining of pain in his ribs and slurred speech. LIC MB called 911 at 2:20pm. Fire department came within 5 minutes and EMTs escorted patron into ambulance at 2:57pm.

Infractions: Children in the Library    Children in the Library: Other not listed: Children behaving unsafely in parking lot past closing time.
Description:
As library staff were leaving for the day, L1 KN noticed that regular kids Rashad, Salem, Liam, and Leland were still present in the parking lot. These kids often walk home, so KN reminded them that they could not remain on library property after the library closes. The group of kids then went out to the bus stop. Library staff all left, and library guard AB was the last one in the parking lot. As he was leaving, he reports that Rashad and Salem's mother pulled into the parking lot, and the boys came running from the bus stop. In doing so, Salem darted out in front of AB's car, and AB had to hit his breaks to avoid him. At the same time, AB reports that Rashad and Salem's mother was driving fast and nearly collided with the rear of AB's car.
Library staff will speak to Salem about being more careful in parking lots and not running in front of cars. This is for tracking purposes.

For additional background info: Justin is a frequent COL patron and often attempts to engage staff in loud and animated conversation about various religious and historical topics until otherwise redirected.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
I (BM LG) heard shouting, from the public floor, and left the staff area to see what was happening. Two male customers were shouting at each other near the loungers between the copier and the charging tower. As I approached, customer A complained that customer B had unplugged phone, from the wall outlet, to plug in his own device. They both proceed to interrupt each other, still speaking loudly and seemed to be half addressing me and also continuing to argue with each other. I managed to stop them and warn them to lower their volume and speak one-at-a-time. Customer B confirmed that he had unplugged the other customer's device without his permission. I clarified that he should never touch personal property that was not his own, to which he responded "ok". Customer A also agreed to notify staff of any conflict with other customers, rather than engaging in disruptive behavior.
They remained sitting next to each other without further incident.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: An empty bottle of wine, a few empty small alcohol bottles, and an empty purse were found in the men's bathroom trash can. Around the same time, an adult volunteer's glasses went missing, suspected to be stolen off of a cart.

A customer was passed out in their vehicle with a bottle of alcohol in the vehicle and an empty beer bottle on their trunk.  L3 KK called 911 for a welfare check.  While waiting for police, the man woke up.  TPD arrived in about 5 minutes and did a field sobriety test.  Customer passed the test and was released.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: Youth Nathan (no last name) is known to staff in recent days for having very loud conversations with online gaming partners. Earbuds are in but his end of conversation is loud and sustained, often punctuated with loud exclamations. Staff have spoken to him  several times, most recently on Saturday 8/17. Today at 11:28 am, LTA DM noted same behavior while Nathan was at computer 15 and asked him to keep the volume of his conversation down. At 11:45 am, same behavior began again and LIB SM asked to have a brief conversation with Nathan, where she explained that persistently loud conversation at the computers disrupts other customers and is not permitted. SM explained that, though we would like him to stay at the library, he must abide by our Code of Conduct and staff requests. Further, since this was the 2nd time he was asked this today, we would ask him to leave for the day if he had to be reminded a 3rd time. SM made an effort to "catch" Nathan being quiet a couple of times after this, giving him a thumbs up when she noticed he was being particularly quiet. At 1:12 pm, SM had to remind him a 3rd time and asked him to leave for the day. She asked if he understood why this was happening and he said yes. SM reiterated we would like to see him again as long as he can better monitor and control the volume of his conversations. Nathan asked to use the phone to call for a ride and was able to reach an adult, assumed to be a parent. He left without incident. It should be noted that Nathan is always calm and receptive to staff requests in the moment, usually apologizing, no pushback. He simply has not been able to sustain a reasonable vocal volume when using the computer.

Infractions: Children in the Library    Children in the Library: Other not listed: Activating Fire Alarm
Description: L1 SG was alerted by the loud sound of a Fire Alarm in the building. L SG localized the area where the alarm went off, and walked to the children's area to deactivate the alarm. SG asked who did it and four children using the computers in the area and two other teens pointed out to an 8-year-old minor female. SG approached her and didn't deny being the person who activated the fire alarm when pulled off the cover. She was with four other children waiting to be picked up. L1 SG let them know that activating fire alarms is not an acceptable behavior and all five minors left for the day. For documentation purposes.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: damaged items, using theft as an excuse
Description: Ms. Immen came up to the desk and told Librarian I EG that her house was robbed and someone stole all of her library books (maybe 6 items). EG wasn't sure which code to use for waiving the fee, so she consulted with other staff in the back room. They explained the procedure for stolen items, which is a bit different. However, they decided to use values-based customer service here and used "incapacity" to waive the items because it seemed like something was going on with her personal situation. She had been using the library extensively, falling asleep at times, and wearing the same clothes for a few days. When we observed another item coming in damaged (soaked), Branch Manager BL decided to try to speak to her. I was worried she was maybe facing a difficult personal or living situation and was trying to get her bearings while she figured out what to do. I prepared for the conversation by gathering several flyers on community and library offerings (KW/Homeless Resource Navigator with contact info, Need Help brochure, Valley Assistance Services (Thurs drop-in at the library), and COPE (Friday drop-in at the library). When I saw her, I grabbed the wet book and asked to speak to her in a study room. I told her we noticed the book come in the book drop while she was here in the library. I explained that we usually charge for replacement costs, but I wasn't going to do that here. I wanted to check in to see if she was okay. I said I don't want to make assumptions about your situation, but I want you to know we're here to help if we can connect you to community resources. I showed her the flyers, pointing out when those volunteers are here at SAH, making note of Navigator KW's email and phone number if she couldn't wait until his next visit. I told her he's very kind and happy to talk over the phone. She just kept saying "okay" and then thanked me, but didn't offer any details about her life. She took the flyers and left. EG noticed more recent PITS incidents at COL, so I wanted to enter this information as documentation. I will reach out to folks at COL to let them know.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Green - Low Impact
Description: Vet Sec Officer B was informed by a patron who goes by the name Mouse that there was another patron at the computers listening to his music loudly. Vet Sec Officer B approached the patron at an out of order computer who was listening to videos on his phone out-loud and asked him to turn his music down. The patron responded to the guard by calling Mouse a snitch and it was reported to the guard that there had been threats made. Circulation desk staff alerted IC staff of the altercation at the computers and Vet Sec Officer B informed L2 IC JM of what had occurred. L2 IC JM, Vet Sec Guard JT, and Vet Sec Guard B headed over to the public computer and asked the patron to leave. After talking more with Mouse staff and Vet Sec guards were informed that after he had asked the patron at the computers to "quiet down" the patron called him a "faggot" and made some threats. After Mouse informed Vet Sec Guard B of the situation, the patron called Mouse a snitch and continued to make threats. The patron will be suspended for 1 year.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description: At 1:05 pm LI JCB came into the lobby and saw two people outside the west-facing door.  The woman was trying to enter the library and the man was preventing her by spreading his arms and stepping in front of her.  This went on for 3 minutes while the guard (CS) tried to intervene.  Another patron approached JCB and asked if she "needed help" or if the young woman needed help.  CB assured him that no, we had it handled.  JCB called 911 and while she was reporting to dispatch the woman walked towards Alvernon.  Dispatch said that with the people not there, it didn't warrant a call out, but that the record would be kept in case they came back.  After the call was concluded, CS informed JCB that this couple comes into the library to use the bathroom and he stands in the door of the bathroom talking to her.  He said he's trying to prevent a drug use relapse from her.  Library staff does not have enough information to corroborate or disprove his story.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: Gregory Nelson came to the library and was recognized by guard CS as he had entered the restroom. Guard informed L1 MNC of the situation and returned to the restroom to monitor. When CS heard a lighter being flicked multiple times in the restroom, he went in and told Nelson that smoking was not allowed in the library. Nelson quickly exited the restroom and the branch just as MNC came out to deliver his suspension letter.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: A commotion began around 12:30p.m. with patron A (pc1) and patron B (pc 3). Patron A began slapping his mouse on the desk to get the attention of Patron B (who is one of our regular patrons that plays online chess.) The two began to argue about the loud clicking Patron B was making while playing chess. LTAS GG approached the two and began to intervene at pc #2. GG let them know their voices were loud and disruptive and to lower their voices. Patron A stated that Patron B has continuously made noise clicking, while using the mouse. Patron A then approached staff desk and spoke with LA DS, asking “is there was any way you can make him stop?” He then went back to pc 1.  LTAS GG then went back to patron A offered a computer in the teen area. Patron A said, “there’s no point you can hear him throughout the library.” Patron A began to gather his things. GG explained that he wasn’t asking him to leave but offering a simple transition to avoid further conflict. Patron A stated that “it was ok he had other things to do anyway.” Patron A left without further incident.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description: A patron alerted our guard GH that someone was using the men's restroom inappropriately. Libs JH & DW did a bathroom check and found a gentleman bathing at the sink. JH let him know that bathing was not permitted and offered to give him information about where he could get free showers and hygiene supplies. He left without incident.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Red - High Impact (Please click Notifications > Email aliases > Copy Trauma Informed Care Team if your location would like to request group EAP support)
Description: At 3:30 a patron came to the desk and interrupted JCB at the desk to inform her that someone had threatened him in the bathroom and he had reported it to security.  At this point, Guard CS approached the desk and JCB handed off the patron she had been interacting with and asked CS what was happening.  CS responded, "It's Nick."  As shown in previous entries, Nick has a history of being threatening and offensive.  Nick exited the men's room and JCB said "I'm sorry.  I need you to leave."  Nick said "he cut me off and I called him a dick.  I'm not allowed to call someone a dick if they are?"  JCB just repeated, "I need you to leave."  Nick returned to his PC and JCB moved to follow but CS told her "I need you to stay over here" and followed Nick to his computer.  He again asked Nick to leave and Nick started shouting that JCB was a "Bitch" and that the accusing patron was a "pussy ass bitch" and pointed to him while threatening to beat him up, before grabbing his backpack and going out the west facing doors.  The patron who reported being attacked gave his story as follows "I walked to the sink and went to get soap.  He said that was his sink and I said 'Then let me get out of your way.'  Then he called me the n-word and said he'd eff me up if I didn't get out of his way."  JCB asked if he'd like to be walked to his car and the patron said yes, after he finished washing his hands.  JCB let him in the single-occupancy restroom and asked CS to walk him to his car when he was ready to leave, which CS did.  MNC reported that Nick was sitting on the horseshoe bench outside the west-facing doors.
