Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.1 Manipulating or bypassing library rules, such as computer use
Description:
During the 10 o'clock hour, a couple of female Petition Passers spoke to Branch Manager KS. The female Petition Passers told KS that there weren't any available spots for them to set-up outside the library, as both spots were taken. KS informed them that if both spots were taken they would need to wait for one of the groups to leave or to come at an earlier time in the future. The women were agreeable and left. 
Following this interaction, regular Petition Passer Greg entered the library to speak with KS, then asked to speak directly with LII SYM. Greg complained that there wasn't an available spot for him to setup. He also complained that both Petition Passing spots were taken by two of the same groups. Greg stated that both sides of a political stance should be represented. SYM let Greg know that since the two groups were indeed not the same and in fact sharing different information. 
LII SYM spoke with Greg letting home know that he could come back at a later time to set-up. Greg disagreed and stated it was in his rights to claim the spot as his. Greg then setup his table and signs directly next the other petition passing group; blocking their signage with his. 
Branch Manager KS called the OVPD nonemergency line making them aware of the situation. OVPD called back to let KS know they would not be sending an officer and nothing could be done unless threats were made. 
A petition passer entered the library and cited the BOS 32.11, asking how or why Greg's group is allowed to bypass the policy. Librarian I BT let them know that we do our best to enforce this policy and have made attempts with OVPD to no avail. BT apologized and told them to alert library staff if threats were made from Greg's group. The petition passer apologized, thanked the library and exited.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.2 Disruptive use of personal devices
Description:
LTAS SS was in the stacks when they heard a loud altercation between patrons in the study area near our Large Type section. Patron 1 was swearing loudly at one of our regular patrons, Michael. LTAS SS approached to try and de-escalate the situation, and Michael had left the area in the seconds LTAS SS was approaching. LTAS SS heard out Patron 1's side of the story, not having seen it personally- Patron 1 had approached Michael, who was on a speakerphone call and was speaking loudly as well as using expletives in his speech while in a quiet study area, to tell him to be quiet and not use that kind of language in the library. After Michael was done with his phone call, he had approached Patron 1 and was angry. Patron 1 and Michael ended up briefly arguing with each other, ending in Patron 1 telling Michael to "fuck off" among other things. The surrounding patrons all chimed in to corroborate this version of events, though one was upset about how Patron 1 acted in this situation. LTAS SS, after hearing him out, reminded Patron 1 that regardless of the circumstances, yelling at others was unacceptable behavior in the library, and to please get a staff member to address issues with other patrons in the future. He seemed very apologetic, embarrassed, and seemed to understand what LTAS SS was telling him while assuring them that it wouldn't happen again, so LTAS SS moved on to speak to Michael and get his side of events.
LTAS SS spoke with Michael, who told them his version of events. He reported that Patron 1 had told him to be quiet and to not use bad language because this was a library, and that he had approached the patron afterwards to confront him about the perceived rude behavior. He said that he understood that he was also in the wrong, and had realized his phone call was disruptive to others. He was insistent that he was not the only party in the wrong, and also that he did not want to be kicked out over this. LTAS SS reminded him to not engage with other patrons, and to please come get staff if something should arise, as well as that if he needed to call people he could always take his calls outside or down the hall, away from the quiet area. While LTAS SS was talking to Michael, multiple patrons come up to the desk to report the verbal altercation between Patron 1 and Michael and also that Michael was not being truthful, so LIII KS entered the conversation and reminded Michael that rather than approaching other patrons himself, to get staff to help handle the situation. She also reminded him that we have heard him on the phone before and that we have had heard him using curse words on phone calls before. He assured LIII KS and LTAS SS that going forward he wouldn't take calls in the library anymore, though we did remind him he had other options in regards to taking calls in the library and didn't have to stop entirely. He appeared understanding of what we had told him.
Michael has been spoken to before for his behavior of speaking on the phone loudly in quiet areas, his language when on phone calls often including expletives and disrupting nearby patrons. He was given a verbal warning today. For documentation purposes.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Lib JH was leaving for lunch and encountered 3 men congregated around the large utility box on the northwest corner of the building. One of the men was in the process of smoking an illegal substance from aluminum foil. JH told them they could not smoke drugs on library property and told them they had to leave. JH called Lib DW from the car and described the situation and the 3 men, asking him to check if any of them returned to the library, as well as check the cameras to see if the incident was caught on camera. None of the men had returned to the library. The Meraki camera did reveal that all 3 men were engaged in smoking drugs on library property. All 3 will be suspended from all PCPL branches for 1 year.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: At approximately 12:40 pm IC LD received a message from the teem desk about two teens yelling to each other and using the F word. IC LD talked to the teens and let them know them that if they are asked to lower their voice and watch their language they will have to leave for the day. at approximately 12:44, IC LD received a call from the 2nd floor desk about teen fighting outside the 2nd floor restrooms. IC LD asked L1 WW to get assistance from off-duty officer Merlin. When officer Merlin and IC LD got to the 2nd floor restrooms, a male teen was waiting outside the restroom, officer Merlin asked the male teen what the problem was. Teen mentioned that he as his girlfriend were having and argument but that no physical fighting had occurred.  1-2 minutes later 2 female teens exit the women restroom, IC LD asked the teens if they were ok. Female teens did not respond and walk out of the building. Officer Merlin asks the male to teen to wait until female teens exit the building and to not follow them once outside the library. IC Ld lets the male teen they are suspended for the day. Upon reviewing camera footage and discovering there was physical altercation between both teens, they will be suspended for 1 year.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Description:
Ingrid Returned at 1:15 pm to use the copier. L2 VV approached her to serve her letter. When asked why she was receiving a letter, VV explained that multiple staff members were reporting to VV that they did not feel safe after this morning's incident. Ingrid did not understand as through her lens she was asking a question and was the one that felt harrassed by the staff member refusing to answer. VV apologized that she was feeling harassed but seeing the other staff members did feel as though the incident was wrought with tones of racism and the constant badgering for a question they did not have an answer to she is being suspended for such. distressed she assured VV that no racism was happening and that she only wanted to know what the janitorial staff were saying for her own peace of mind and the fact that the staff member wouldn't ask the janitorial staff what was happening made her upset. VV diffused her and let her know she would handle the situation about the bathrooms from here, and informed her that VV could give her L3s CO information if she felt she was being wrongly accused. Ingrid did not want to escalate to L3 but did not accept the suspension letter either, stating she needed the restroom and couldn't process what was happening as she was "about to pee herself". VV led her to the bathroom and Ingrid left without taking the form.
 
Conversation below
VV" Ma'am, may I speak to you briefly before you leave"
IS "Make it quick I have a bus to catch and I need the bathroom" 
VV " I just wanted to have a discussion about this morning's interaction between you and a staff member" 
IS " Yes I just called the administration about it" 
IS notices suspension paper
IS "Is that for me??"
VV " Yes I had a few staff members report to me that they felt harassed and..."
IS "Harassed? by me??"
VV "Yes and, some of the language you used had some racist tones and this is a zero tol..."
IS " RACIST? I AM NOT RACIST"
VV " I am not calling you a racist, but the language you used..."
IS " I just said they should speak English in America"
VV" But their native language is Spanish and they are more than welcome to speak and have conversations in that language in their place of work, so to force them to speak English is discriminating and can make people feel unsafe simply for speaking the language they know" 
IS "That's why I wanted that man to translate for me" 
VV "My understanding is that he was not able to translate since he was not in the restroom at the time"
IS" He could have gone and asked them then told me" 
VV" Cleaning staff only need to report to us if there is something wrong, if they did not report an issue...."
IS "Well that's why I wanted to know what the cleaning crew was saying, if there was an issue with the bathroom and that man wouldn't tell me, just that if I wanted to know then I should speak Spanish"
VV"I see I will have a conversation with the staff member about that comment"
IS "good"
VV "Could you give me the name of the staff member"
IS "No"
VV " any description of what he looked like"
IS " I don't remember"
VV "Shirt color?"
IS "I don't pay attention to stuff like that "
VV " I see... I'll see what I can do and I will handle the issue with the staff member and bathroom from here. However, I still have some staff feeling harassed after today's interaction"
IS " This is ridiculous I am late for my bus" 
VV " I understand the frustration, how about I give you the information of the branch manager and you can..."
IS " NO I don't want to escalate it that high can we please just drop everything I need to go the bathroom I'm about to pee myself so I don't even know what you're saying"
VV "Go ahead and use the restroom and we can finish up after" 
IS" Thank you"
Ingrid then leaves for the bathroom and as VV is waiting for her she leaves the building without letting anyone know
 
 
L2 VV talked with the Security guard and Janitorial staff the following week about the incident as they asked about a follow-up. during this conversation, Security Guard MG confirmed that Saber approached them and stated "In America, you have to speak English" but had brushed it off since this wasn't the first time they received a comment in that nature. VV iterated the importance of letting in-charge staff know about these types of comments because as employees and humans, they deserve basic respect from patrons and others.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.4 Sleeping    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: using offensive language
Description: A female patron sleeping in a chair was woken up by L1 SG, and the patron complied sitting up and picked up belongings scattered in the non-fiction section. A male patron sitting across the female raised their voice calling SG Fucking bitch and now I'm gonna have to deal with my wife because this fucking bitch woke her up. SG asked the male patron to please stop using profanities and foul language to refer to library staff. The patron continued to use offensive language for what Guard CS was called and asked to leave. On his way out the patron kept cussing out and SG asked him to stop or he could be suspended for what he responded, I don't care, F..... it. The patron has been suspended for a week.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.4 Bullying per Pima County B.O.S. Policy D 23.1.~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description:
10:25am Patron Ingrid Saber [21152019395841] approaches librarian CjM and demands to know what our security guard and maintenance person were talking about in the bathroom while opening the facility.  Patron objected to the use of Spanish by staff and demanded they use English.  Librarian CjM informed patron that as I was not in the bathroom at that time, I had no idea what the security and cleaning staff were discussing, and I wanted to know if patron felt threatened while in the bathroom.  However, patron did not state they felt threatened, only insisted that all staff speak English at all times.  Librarian CjM informed Saber that staff were not required by any law to speak in any particular language, that the cleaning staff were discussing opening procedures, and librarian CjM showed patron Code of Conduct policy 1.1.7 regarding harassing library staff.  Saber insisted that the U.S. Constitution states that English is the official language of the country and when I asserted that the Constitution does not, she stated "Well, it's written in English so it's implied and your staff should obey it." I repeated that Pima County does not require its employees to speak English and asked Saber to drop the matter and use our facilities for the day or I "would have to ask her to leave for the day as you are harassing my staff for their speech." Saber denied harassment of anyone and went to use a public computer.
Upon reviewing security camera footage, it is clear cleaning and security staff did not interact with Saber in any way.  It is also clear from the footage that staff were in the bathroom to check on cleanliness of bathroom.
Patron continued to browse seemingly satisfied, but would contact administration later in the day to complain about how library staff handled her complaint.
Saber is older (60+) white female, tanned, short and slender, wearing glasses with graying hair.
Being the only in charge person no suspension was given until it could be discussed with other staff. with Guidance from L2 VV, Ingrid will be suspended for a year for racism since we have a zero tolerance policy.

Chance tried to argue that his suspension was already over and it took multiple reminders for him stop engaging with his friends in the teen area and exit the library. Not long after he left, MNC heard shouting outside on the patio. Chance had gotten into an altercation with another youth patron and then attempted to re-enter the building. Guard J had to again ask him to leave the property.

Description: Ingrid came into the library. I gave her the suspension letter. She told me she was not harassing anyone. I told her that I was not able to do anything about the suspension, but she can appeal.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Green - Low Impact
Description:
About 1:30pm Security Guard MG approached L1 CjM at the desk and informed me that two patrons were occasionally yelling at one another and other patrons had begun complaining about their noise.  I spoke with the pair (male is approximately 30, browned complexion, dark hair under a baseball cap; female is also late 20s/early 30s, heavy set and White though deeply tanned) and asked them to keep their voices down but they resumed their argument before I had walked more than ten paces away.  I returned, repeated my request that they keep it down and informed them that if they did not, I would ask them to leave for the day.  Again their argument resumed as soon as I stepped away from them, so with Security Guard MG and TPD officer WB, I escorted them out of the building.  The female returned to use our pay phone, and was again quite loud, but the TPD officer was standing at the door already and so asked her to get off the phone and leave.
As I was walking the female out the door she told me that her male companion had been banned from COL and MAI at some point in the recent past.  However, since neither of them were on public computers, I am unable to more accurately identify them than the description given above.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description:
Patron with known history of dementia was unable to be roused while mumbling for help "in sleep" in the library. Page EL grabbed L BL, L2 KVN, and L1 KB to report the patron being in distress. Once the patron was awake, she displayed signs of distress and confusion. She indicated she had been in pain and "trapped" and that this had happened before but "never this bad." She agreed to medical assistance.
When medical was en-route, the patron asked the cancel the call. The operator could not cancel as they were already en-route.
Patron declined any evaluation from paramedics. She was coherent by this point.

Description:
Around 11 am Vet Sec Guard KL called for a manager over walkie talkie regarding suspected drug use in Women's Restroom.  A mom had told guard about the bad chemical smell.  LI RL and LTA Supervisor WZ went to restroom area and confirmed that Women's Restroom had a strong burnt chemical smell consistent with the use of chemical drugs.  Several people exited restroom when VAL in-charge staff arrived in area.  
Women's public restroom was locked and marked Out of Order until smell subsided.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description: While on desk L1 JCB heard someone say "Get the fuck away from me!" and when she went to investigate found a couple bickering in the cafe.  Guard CS joined her and said "That's the gal from Thursday" and indicated the female patron.  JCB indicated that she would serve the suspension.  JCB came up to the woman and tried to hand her the paper while saying "I'm sorry, but you are suspended."  JCB placed the paper next to her and walked away while CS continued to monitor the situation.  The patron kicked the Friends of the Library book cart, knocked over the sign about COVID tests, and then after she left, threw a rock at the door.  As she and her male companion left she continued screaming at each other and throwing rocks both toward the building and traffic.  At that point, MNC called the police due to the danger.  The police arrived 10 minutes later and took a report from MNC.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior

Description: LTA Sup AP and Guard JD reported two adult males arguing in the computer lab because one of them was supposedly eating at a computer.  L3 KK and L1 LB and JD approached the man.  Customer1 was calling Customer2 a "pig" and the two were within about a foot from each other.  Customer2 had spilled ice over the workstation and was attempting to clean it up.  Customer1 continued to harass customer2.  KK directed customer1 to stop harassing customer2.  Customer2 volunteered to move to another computer.  As customer2 was gathering his things, customer1 again used offensive language towards customer2.  KK told him if he continued, he would need to leave.  Customer1 stopped.  KK and LB escorted customer2 to another computer.  Another customer came to say customer1 was still ranting.  KK approached customer2 who was sitting quietly.  KK asked Guard JD to remain in the lab to monitor the situation.  After about 10 minutes, customer2 left the building.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Red - High Impact (Please click Notifications > Email aliases > Copy Trauma Informed Care Team if your location would like to request group EAP support)
Description: Security camera footage showed unidentified male breaking off the lock of a vehicle in the parking lot.  Customer witnessing the act got out of his vehicle and confronted male.  Perpetrator came into the library.  Witness reported the incident to Guard JD and the victim.  While guard reported to L3 KK, perpetrator exited building with witness and victim in pursuit.  KK called 911 as she and JD observed from a distance the confrontation between the three.  During their interaction, perpetrator told victim and witness that he was going to go get "something" and come back and "kill everyone."  Male then crossed Wilmot Rd heading west on 5th Street.  KK relayed this threat to dispatcher.  Dispatcher instructed KK to go into lockdown if the individual returned to property. TPD arrived in about 10 minutes.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.2 Internet use that is harmful to minors
Description:
Male patron reported to LSub CB at the service desk that a different male patron was watching porn on a computer. L BL confirmed that minors were within viewing distance.
L2 KVN asked LA RG to be backup and they waited to see if the male patron was watching porn on PC #1, as his content was not porn-related at the time they approached. There were 2 tables each with an adult and a minor directly behind his PC.
After less than a minute, the man on PC #1 switched back to pornographic photographs of women. 
L2 KVN asked the patron to speak away from the PCs, and he complied. She explained that he is "allowed to watch and look at graphic content and photos on his computer, but not when they are within viewing distance of a minor." 
The patron replied "Oh, I see, I apologize." 
He went back to his PC without incident.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.10 Remaining inside the library after closing, including emergency closures~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
Approx. 6:02pm, Librarian I MM was returning to the library with a cart after escorting regular patron Jo Anna Flowers (and her belongings, which had been on the cart) to her vehicle. (See related incident #23729 involving Ms Flowers and library cart use.) Rather than remain with her vehicle, Ms Flowers followed L1 MM back into the building. Page AM intercepted her and politely said "Excuse me, miss, the library is now closed." Ms Flowers snapped at him, "I'm ASKING a QUESTION" in a manner that was hostile and alarming to Page AM and other staff nearby. L1 MM overheard and stepped in, answering Ms Flowers' question about places with available seating after the library closed. Ms Flowers was then reminded that the library was closed, but was still reluctant to leave, prompting LA WB to begin turning lights off. She eventually left.
If Ms Flowers is rude and hostile with staff again, she will be given a verbal warning.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: swearing at other patrons~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Green - Low Impact
Description:
Micheal W Miller came into the library, and I was the other person on desk. I was told by Mira Domsky that he approached the desk and was made to wait too long for his liking. He stressed to Mira that he was 90 years old and couldn't wait. I was told by Mira that he insulted a first patron by calling her a b*tch because he had to wait too long. I didn't hear that interaction.
A second patron told me that this was a triggering event for her to witness and, while I didn't hear the swearing, I did stay with the patron who was triggered and listened to her until she could calm down. She then proceeded to go to story time with the little boy she is in charge of as his nanny.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description: NONE

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description:
A recent regular patron walked up to the front desk around 10:20 am on 8/28/24. LA NM greeted him by saying, “Hello,” but he did not hear her and approached the desk to speak with branch manager, IR. He then gestured to NM and said, “What’s wrong with that one? She doesn’t say anything.” Having greeted him already and having heard troubling comments from him in the past, NM remained silent. He then stated to NM, “You need a vibrator.”
Patron left the desk to use the handheld phone. After several minutes on the phone, he returned to the front desk and waited in line. From his place in line, he pointed at NM and said, “I’ve got a new nickname for that one! The quiet one, because she’s so quiet.” NM clarified that she had greeted him with a hello when he first entered the building, but he had not heard her. The patron then told NM, “Well don’t sue me, I don’t have a penny to my name. I just make nicknames for people,” and returned to his chair.
Submitted for documentation purposes.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.11 Belongings: Bringing in or storing~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.6 Using furniture improperly
Description:
About a week ago, regular patron Jo Anna Flowers had reserved a study room and had left the room locked with a substantial amount of her belongings inside. As the next reservation was approaching, Librarian I MM located Ms Flowers and requested that she remove her belongings so that others could use the room. Ms Flowers indicated that she could not transport her items by herself. As a one-time courtesy, and to speed the process and allow access to the study room for other patrons, L1 MM offered her the use of a library cart and escorted her and the cart out to her vehicle.
This has now turned into Ms Flowers believing she is entitled to use library carts whenever she wishes. On 8/27 Ms Flowers was spotted grabbing an unattended cart (the page had left it briefly after finishing shelving, while gathering items for cleanup) and using it to store her belongings on. Staff were unable to address this with her at the time as the library was very busy.
Today Ms Flowers returned and was using the ADA computer. When she was finished (approx. 1:35pm), she casually mentioned, "And I'm going to need the cart" to Librarian II AD and then walked away, back to her computer, apparently expecting LII AD to follow with a cart. LII AD then became busy making several library cards and at approx. 1:50pm LA GL, who was unaware of the escalating issue but aware of L1 MM's one-time courtesy, allowed her to use a cart to transport her belongings to the car. Ms Flowers told LA GL that she would return promptly.
Approx. 2:10pm, it became apparent that this was not the case. Ms Flowers was now ensconced in the quiet area, preparing to use an armchair with the library cart filled with her belongings next to her. She showed no indication that she was removing her belongings from the cart or otherwise interested in returning the cart. LII AD approached and waited for her to sit in the armchair, then indicated the cart and said "Excuse me, but we need that back." Ms Flowers appeared perturbed and muttered, "No one ever told me that before." LII AD said "The carts are really for staff use. We can't let you have a cart unattended." At this point Ms Flowers cut LII AD off and snapped, "All you had to say was you needed it back!" She again made no move to remove any of her belongings from the cart. LII AD said "Okay, so if you can clear the cart off, I'll take it with me." Ms Flowers angrily said "You're going to have to wait. I'm slow and I have a bad back." LII AD nodded their assent and walked away. To LII AD's retreating back, Ms Flowers snapped, "I'll bring it to the front, if it means so much to you!" LII AD did not respond and continued walking. After about 5 minutes, Ms Flowers returned the empty cart to the front desk.
Documenting because Ms Flowers did not appear to listen to LII AD's explanation of the larger issue (she cannot have library carts for extended periods or without staff present) and because these issues have escalated over the last week. Staff will explain again if she requests use of a library cart again.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description: A customer approached the service desk at ABB to express concerns about a graphic novel (31152117865115) his daughter, age 13, checked out the previous day. The book, an anime-style graphic novel, was labeled as part of the adult section, where such materials are interfiled alphabetically within the adult-fiction collection. The customer (who was respectful throughout the transaction) expressed his support for information freedom, but he was concerned about the explicit content in the book. Specifically, he pointed out an indisputable sex scene in the book, presented via images and dialogue; also, the book is marked "M for Mature" on the back cover; the customer referenced ARS 34-502 during the discussion. L2 JM responded by reiterating key points from supervisor training and the Library Code of Conduct, emphasizing that parents are the primary gatekeepers for the materials their children access. L2 JM also mentioned that librarians are always available to determine the age level of any item. The customer mentioned that his daughter was disturbed by the content, and L2 JM expressed sympathy and acknowledged the impactful nature of the situation. While the customer was not advocating for the removal of the item, he suggested that adult graphic novels be separated to prevent similar issues in the future. L2 JM assured the customer he would pass along the suggestion to ABB’s L3 for a dedicated section for such materials with signage that reflects its classification. The conversation concluded, with the customer seemingly satisfied that his concerns would be communicated to the appropriate party.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: At 11:21 pm a white male with a mask and no shirt climbed over the fence and stole the plastic cart that held our hose.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description:
A book (The Darkest Place by Phillip Margolin) was returned in our bookchute this morning with a piece of tinfoil inside that was being used as a bookmark. Upon pulling out the foil, L1 MNC found drug residue on it. The book was checked out to patron CMW but staff cannot definitively say that the patron was at fault. The book was discarded for staff and patron safety.
Added for documentation in case it becomes a reoccurring issue.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.4 Bullying per Pima County B.O.S. Policy D 23.1.
Description:
At 1:41, a female patron called asking if Eckstrom-Columbus offered one-on-one computer help. After explaining that while COL offers tech help, it is a combined program along with Job help and that if she is looking for one-on-one, LTA VN offered to help her find a location that does offer the type of program she is looking for. After declining to go to several library locations offered to her, she began to vent about the neighborhood she lives in and that it was dangerous due to the repeated break in attempts. She then asked for LTA VN’s opinion on the amount of homelessness in recent years. This continued for 10 minutes as VN tried to redirect the call back to the patron’s original question regarding computer help. The patron then became irate and started to complain about the drug use in Tucson and how much better California is and that the people in Tucson are too afraid to speak up and that LTA VN too was like that. She continued to demand VN's opinion on the subject and would get more upset each time LTA VN tried to remind her that the conversation was not appropriate. VN then stated that she could get the patron someone else to speak to. The patron took great offence to this and started to rant about people in Tucson staying silent once again. Sub-librarian TS noticed the LTA VN’s struggle with the phone call and went to get L1 MNC but the patron hung up the call once L1 MNC entered the back room.
L1 MNC was not able to speak with the patron, but noted the name and phone number on the caller ID. She will be given a verbal warning regarding her behavior if she calls the branch again.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description:
A female patron approached L2 KVN at the desk to say "two people are about to fight." 
A regular teen patron approached at the same time and said "Can you please make this guy move?"
KVN followed the teens back to the 2 PCs in the back where Daryl was sitting on one of the PCs next to a backpack with the teen's belongings. Daryl reported that the PC said "Available" and no one was there so he signed in. The teens argued their belongings were right there and one was signed in and sitting there. They indicated they had tried to communicate that one of the teens simply got up, and he would not listen. 
KVN asked Daryl if he would be willing to move since he had just signed into the PC and hadn't started any work, and their items were there first, since the teen patrons wanted to sit together and there was no more room in the row. Daryl refused, repeating that no one was sitting there and it said "Available." He said the teens were "being dicks." KVN told him "that language is not appropriate inside the library."
So KVN told the teens that he was not willing the move and asked if they would be willing to move if she found two PCs next to each other for them. They both agreed.
KVN found two PCs next to each other and told them to come over.
Just as the one teen signed out of his PC and they gathered their items, Daryl signed out of his PC and moved over to the PC KVN had directed for the teens.
KVN asked if Daryl was moving instead and he said "Yeah, I just didn't see there were other PCs available." Plenty of other PCs were visibly available. 
KVN considered the situation resolved and moved to help another patron in the PC area.
She heard a commotion behind her and saw Daryl back at the PCs with the two teens, and the conversations looked tense. Daryl saw her looking and returned to his PC.
KVN asked the teens if they were okay and why he was talking to them again (as it had been resolved), and they reported he was "being an asshole" to them. 
KVN ignored the language and got LA NG and LTA Sup AP as backup (no guard available). 
She approached Daryl at his PC and told him that the situation had been resolved, but he went back to argue with the teens which was inappropriate, and she needed him to leave for the day. 
Daryl began arguing, calling the teens "dicks," stating that he had gone over to "log out of his PC." He claimed KVN must be new and demanded her name over and over (KVN wears a name badge). Daryl refused to leave the library and wanted to argue and complain further. KVN said that they had already resolved the issue, and that he could call library administration if he had further concerns, but he needed to leave. Daryl slammed down his mouse and motioned for her to meet him at the front desk, where he continued to try to argue.
KVN repeated that they had already discussed everything and he needed to leave for the day. KVN wrote down the number for library administration for Daryl. Daryl stated again "you must be new." KVN said she was not. Daryl demanded KVN write down her name, which she refused because it was visible on her badge and she had verbally told him her name repeatedly. She told him she was the assistant manager and he could relay that to them. 
NG reported that Daryl was a regular at MID and that he frequently had arguments with those specific teen patrons.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.1 Manipulating or bypassing library rules, such as computer use    3.2 Unplugging library equipment
Description:
Frequent library patron has been observed unplugging the computer on 3 occasions in the past 3 weeks, including today by IR, previously observed by LW and WZ. Additionally, the computer he was using has been discovered unplugged at the end of the day on each occasion that he has been seen using it, when staff were not aware that the recurring issue might be related to a single user.
Library user has mentioned that he is familiar with library policies and regular use of the library computers, as well as being aware of technical aspects of using the public computers.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.9 Trespassing~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Red - High Impact (Please click Notifications > Email aliases > Copy Trauma Informed Care Team if your location would like to request group EAP support)
Description:
L2 KVN went to her car for lunch at 2pm and found her car covered in an unknown, gooey substance. 
After checking the cameras, video footage at 8:03am showed a SUV matching the description of Jereth Orion Woodcock's vehicle drive around the front of the library, make a U-turn near the West side of the building, pause and watch a staff member enter the building, and then drive up to KVN's vehicle. A white male can be seen throwing something onto KVN's vehicle's driver side, and then driving to the back of her vehicle, moving the car closer, and throwing more material onto the back of KVN's vehicle.
The SUV is then seen leaving property.
Suspension being extended to 1-year from today.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.2 Strong odors~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.3 Food or beverage: unclean, disruptive, or damaging    3.6 Using furniture improperly    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description:
Approx. 9:45am, during a walkthrough of the computer lab to ready it for opening, Library Associate GL became aware of an odor of urine near computer #7. He alerted Librarian II AD. Upon further inspection, LA GL & LII AD noticed that the floor underneath the plastic mat for computer #7 was foggy and appeared wet. LII AD then put in a facilities request for biohazard cleanup (FAC11787) and closed the computer lab for the day.
Because this was discovered prior to opening, the incident itself must have occurred the previous evening. We have several regulars that use the lab, but no cameras that point towards/near the lab, so we cannot determine a likely perpetrator. For documentation purposes.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
Justin Jara came into the library parking lot and saw the Jehovah's Witnesses on our patio. He immediately began yelling comments about their religion. He then shifted to calling them "fucking n*ggers" and screaming all manner of racial slurs about Black people and how they are "ruining the country". On-site TPD officer RE, attempted to de-escalate and speak with Jara, who took off running into traffic with the officer in pursuit. He was subsequently arrested for harassment and failing to comply. The JW members left after the harassment began since they feared for their personal safety.
Due to the library's zero-tolerance policy on racism directed against library patrons, Jara will be suspended for 1 year.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description:
Prior to opening, L1 MNC and TPD Officer RE found Faraja Elias unconscious on the concrete bench near the front door with several empty beer bottles. After conducting a welfare check, RE determined that Elias had been drinking on the property and was still intoxicated. He was asked to leave for the day.
At 1:40pm, RE found Elias back on library property and again drinking a bottle of alcohol. He will now be suspended for a week.

Description: During a walk around Guard JQ came in and reported a patron using drugs by the staff door to Special Duty Officer R Engelkes and Librarian 1 MNC.  Officer Engelkes went to investigate and found the patron with a burnt foil and a straw in hand.  Patron will be suspended for a year for smoking on the property.  There is no photo as we have no cameras covering that area.

Description: Someone etched "Free Gaza" and a variety of symbols into the mirror in the men's restroom. Last month someone spray painted "Free Gaza" onto the side of the building.

Description: Officer Andre Gamulo was approached by a patron reporting misconduct in the men's room.  When he entered the  men's restroom he found a male standing up and masturbating with the stall door open.  The person in question was a vulnerable adult.  Officer AG asked him to leave for the day.  He told the officer that his family members were in the cafe, so the Officer spoke to them about the incident.  They said that they would leave and would not come back to ensure that it wouldn't happen again.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: Smoking marijuana in a public place or open space~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Guard MA was making a round outside of the library when he noticed a customer smoking marijuana on one of the concrete benches in the landscaping in front of the library. Guard MA asked customer not to smoke marijuana in front of the library because it is illegal under state law to smoke it in a public place or open space. Customer became upset and shouted expletives at Guard MA. The shouting could be heard from inside the library. L1 KH approached the front door to de-escalate, as the customer was heading back towards the front door, still shouting. Customer calmed down upon re-entering the library and asked KH if he "wasn't allowed to smoke out there." Unaware of the nature of the substance being smoked, KH informed the customer that smoking was not permitted on the purple bench, as it is too close to the library entrance. Customer acknowledged and went to retrieve his belongings. He then left without incident.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Patron Fernando was observed outside of the library yelling at no one in particular and he proceeded inside the library and headed towards the public phone on 1st floor. Patron seemed to be upset about his current situation. When Vet Sec Guard A followed him to observe the situation, he became angry and slammed down the public phone and began yelling loudly, once again at no one in particular about how people "don't respect him" and saying the word "fuck" in both English and in Spanish as he excited the library. He was also heard to say, "you guys are always teasing." The yelling and shouting profane language could be heard from the children's area on the first floor and on the 2nd floor of the library. Patron will be suspended for 1 month.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
Patron was observed by L2 JM yelling back and taunting a man in a wheelchair who was experiencing a mental health episode and who was also yelling in the 1st floor of the library. The young patron then went upstairs in the teen space. 
Upon their arrival they were greeted and replied in a polite way. Upon meeting up their friend, she began raising her voice, making threats towards someone not in the building saying “I’m gonna fuck her up” and “I’m not scared of jail.” Upon hearing this, LA KV told her that the language wasn’t appropriate and they needed to keep it down. The patron apologized. About a minute later, the same volume and cursing happens again, and LA KV makes the same statement about keeping the volume and language under control. It calms down, and LA KV makes her way to the 2nd floor desk as teen LA is at that desk. The language and volume starts up again, so LA KV makes her way back to the teen area where she hears the patron saying the N words over and over very loudly again. Staff tells the patron that what she is saying is inappropriate for the library. The teen becomes aggravated and raises her voice at LA KV saying that she uses the word all the time and LA KV can’t tell her not to. LA MA comes over to help and attempts to speak to the teen. The teen admits that they are actually 20 years old and starts making comments about how LA KV didn’t say anything about her language until they used the N word. The patron stated that she has been coming to this library for over 6 years and that no one ever comments on her language until she uses the N word specifically. She had been spoken to multiple times about all of the cursing.
Patron was told they needed to leave for the day. They came back into the library about 5 minutes later and were spoken to by in-charge L2 KW, who stated that they were suspended from the library for one month for cursing and disruptive behavior. The patron left the library with friends, and then tried to re-enter the library again but were told by guards that they could not enter.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1 Any criminal offense    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.5 Soliciting handouts, donations, contributions
Description: At 12:30pm, Guard JD was sitting at his post across from the public phone.  Man on the phone asked the caller to meet him at the library with "10 keys" telling the person he was on a library phone.  At 12:54p, guard observed a silver jeep arrive and stop in the middle of the parking lot.  Driver talked briefly to the man.  Jeep drove around to the fartherest point of the lot from the security camera (southwest corner of parking lot)  and the man gave the driver money.  The man then quickly reached into the vehicle and rapidly grabbed something on the seat immediately stuffing it into his pocket.  The jeep then drove out of the parking lot at a high rate of speed.  The group that the man was with immediately left headed towards the park near the library. Customer observing the exchanged remarked to guard that they had just witnessed a drug deal.  Guard reported incident to L3 KK.  ****Suspension letter served to individual at 10:30am on 9/5/24 by L3 KK and Guard JD.  Customer did not deny drug dealing but rather left property quickly.

Lib II SW opened the door and told the man the library was closed and he needed to leave. He said "okay." The man exited the Sheriff's door at 6:10.

L1 MNC let her know that staff will check on the situation and address them if needed. The patron continued to stand at the desk waiting for staff to speak with the other patrons. MNC reminded her that if she continued her inappropriate behavior, she would be asked to leave for the day. The patron then returned to her PC.

Description:
Suspended patron Sean (#2) entered the library at about 11:00AM. Guard BJ immediately informed LA NG, believing that he recognized the patron from past security camera footage. NG encouraged him to get a closer look during his interior rounds. Guard BJ returned to the desk to confirm his suspicion, by which point Librarian I JD had arrived at the desk.
Librarian JD and Guard BJ approached patron and asked him his name, to which he replied, "Greg" (this is noted as an alternate alias and is the name that was marked on the image of the suspended patron provided to Guard BJ). Librarian JD then informed him that he was not supposed to be in the library while referring to a copy of his suspension letter, and that it appeared he was suspended from all library branches until August of 2025. Sean (#2)/Greg then left the library without incident.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.9 Trespassing~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description:
At about 1:50PM Guard BJ informed LA NG that he believed the perpetrator from a previous incident involving an attempted vehicle theft had entered the library. Patron had been suspended following previous incident but had not yet been served his suspension letter. LA NG instructed him to keep an eye on the suspected perpetrator and to keep him informed of any suspicious activity.
 Not long after, at about 2:30PM, two regular patrons who had witnessed the previous incident with perpetrator informed desk staff that they had identified the perpetrator as being in the library once again. Perpetrator had been using the computers alongside two other teens earlier in the day, and was now wandering around the library looking around, eventually returning to the computer area. 
After verifying the previous incident in question and consulting with guard BJ, L1 BC and LA NG approached perpetrator in computer area with guard BJ in order to serve suspension letter from previous incident. Patron expressed confusion but quickly left the library. Two other teen patrons that seemed to be affiliated with the perpetrator also left the library but quickly returned. Perpetrator did not return to library property.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description: At 2:49 page BP came into the back and informed L1 JCB that the patron at PC 9 had taken the computer chair and asked JCB to confront the patron to get it back.  JCB asked the patron to return the computer chair as it was for the computer monitor.  The patron stated "I just barely got this" and JCB indicated again that it was for staff.  The patron indicated staff could use the same chairs as everyone else and JCB told her that the staff member needed the chair.  JCB gave her a typical chair and wheeled the other one back to the computer monitor station.  At that point, JCB came to the back and told MNC this patron could escalate.  2 minutes later BP came into the back clearly distressed.  BP reported that the same woman had come to her and told her she "stole the chair."  BP said she was sorry, but they couldn't give anyone special treatment.  The lady then stated, "I don't accept your apology and your excuse is BS."  Then BP excused herself from the interaction.  JCB and MNC went out and MNC told her she needed to leave for the day.  She agreed and MNC went to the desk to give her space to leave.  The woman collected her things, then approached MNC and said that she had a right to the chair.  He explained that it was for staff and when she argued that it shouldn't be MNC just said "Okay."  On her way out the woman also tried to argue with JCB and the officer, who likewise refused to engage.  The woman then stated she would not return and left the building.

Description: At 5:02 pm L1 JCB was informed that a patron wanted to speak to a manager.  The patron was standing next to the chess table about 10 feet away from the desk.  When JCB asked what she could help with he stated that he didn't want LTA VN to check him out because of a "previous altercation" that he had to bring to the attention of Main Library because it was "inappropriate."  JCB asked AO why he couldn't check him out because he was also at the desk.  AO explained that he had shut down his computer as it was after closing.  JCB instructed AO to check out the patron on VN's computer.  Kevin asked why they couldn't do that earlier and JCB explained it would have been inappropriate for AO to just use VN's station without instructions from a supervisor.   In the back room VN stated this was the man from incident 0000023664.  AO used the data in Sierra to get his name and library card number to confirm the statement.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Description: On Monday 9/9/24 @ approximately 9:30am LTA Supervisor MV informed Branch Manager SH that a large window pane had been broken on the south east side of the library. Upon further investigation SH noticed that there was a large rock lying on the ground outside next to the broken window. Only one of the window panes was broken. There was no damage to the inner pane nor to the interior of the library. Marana Police were notified and responded (Officer Wagoner, case #24090404) as well as Facilities. A work order for replacement of the exterior window pane has been submitted.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Description: Patron Joanna Flowers approached desk and in a demanding tone told LTA D.M. to put Sun Tran bus schedules out. DM informed patron that Sun Tran is not providing the library with bus schedules anymore, as detailed in an intranet post, and by the fact we did not receive any after they expired August 18th. Patron Flowers cut off DM repeatedly and in snappy language over the course of conversation. told DM that this was not true and that she has seen the print schedule, and that she needed to order some. DM replied that there may be some print schedules in existence, but that they are not provided to our library, and that she'd get patron the phone number to Sun Tran. Patron Flowers continued to tell DM she needed to order those bus schedules "right now" and to "get creative and do your job" and "you're not listening to me." DM pointed to LA W.B. and said "This is the person who obtains the flyers and handouts, and he can assure you that we are not not getting print bus schedules and that she would need to use alternative methods, and WB also informed patron that we could not have bus schedules, but patron Flowers walked away muttering. Librarian SM and LA GL were nearby and both overheard Flowers call DM a "Hypocrite." Based on the confrontation, librarian SM said if patron returned and was insulting to staff again, we would ask her to leave for the day. Patron Flowers has a recent history of issues at GLF including being very rude and condescending to staff so this is for further documentation.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.5 Indecent exposure, public indecency, lewd, other sexual offense    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: Contravening ARS 36-601 and Tucson City Code 11-54~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description:
Over the past several weeks, it has become apparent that regular patron Steve Montes has been urinating in containers inside the library and then storing them with his belongings for extended periods of time. Staff have been unable to catch him in the act, but circumstantial evidence has piled up (suspiciously yellow cups of fluid, bottles of yellow fluid having more in them throughout the day despite Mr Montes not leaving the library, urine spills on the carpet near where he usually sits, and the like). Today at opening, Librarian III AL and Librarian II AD approached Mr Montes on the breezeway and asked to have a conversation with him. LIII AL told Mr Montes that we had observed this behavior and needed to ask him to stop. Mr Montes readily admitted the behavior, but maintained that it was due to a medical condition he could not control, and that he had rights under the ADA. Further details of this conversation (including Mr Montes's medical history) were documented securely but not listed here due to medical privacy concerns.
LIII AL and LII AD then consulted with LSM VL, who indicated that there was no acceptable reason to allow someone to urinate in the library. LIII AL and LII AD then researched the legalities surrounding this concern as Mr Montes has a history of becoming litigious if asked to correct behavior. Together they discovered ARS 36-601 (subsection 5) and Tucson City Code 11-54 and printed these documents in preparation for a second conversation with Mr Montes. ARS 36-601 covers storing waste matter in an unsanitary manner (the bottles/cups of fluid) and TCC 11-54 prohibits public urination.
Approx. 11:30am, LIII AL and LII AD approached Mr Montes again. LIII AL let Mr Montes know that she had consulted her supervisor, LSM VL, and had been told that this behavior was unacceptable, and it was also illegal. She let him know that if we observed the behavior again, we would have to ask him to leave for the day. As expected, Mr Montes immediately demanded to know which laws he had contravened, and LIII AL gave him the City Code printout. He then asked if he had contravened city or state laws, and LII AD clarified that it was both. He then asked if federal law would trump state law, and again cited the ADA. LIII AL informed him that the ADA does not cover this and that he was not allowed to continue this behavior as it was a biohazard. He asked several times "Who's it going to hurt?" how it could possibly be unsafe, and LIII AL again repeated that it was a biohazard and he would be asked to leave if we observed it again. He demanded an email address to which he could send information in support of his claims under the ADA and was given the Golf Links Reference email.
Mr Montes is likely to escalate his concerns under the ADA to administration.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
Patron Madeline Immen returned to the library and began loudly telling a patron at nearby PC (who was not engaging with her) to "shut up". L1 MNC attempted to speak with the patron again about coming to staff with concerns about other patrons' behavior. She stated that she would not and that it was her right to correct others in the library. MNC said again that it was not appropriate and to please come to staff next time.
The patron exclaimed that this was not the library for her and proceeded to gather her things to leave. On her way out, she asked MNC for his name and title (which he provided) and shouted that it was her "right as an American to use her fucking voice!" 
Patron left of her own accord, but will be asked to leave for the day if she returns today.

LTAS DB and guard DT engaged the patron from a distance and told him he would need to leave or we would call 911. He left soon after and drove away in a gold minivan.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.4 Sleeping
Description:
SUB CB told LA RG that a customer was asleep in the computer lab and SUB CB couldn't rouse the man. LA RG went over to the customer, who had his head down on his arms on the desk. LA RG recognized him as Daniel E, a regular patron. LA RG managed to wake up Daniel, but he couldn't respond to questions, such as "What's your name" or "Do you need help." The security guard JD couldn't get an answer out of him either. Daniel was incoherent and had a string of drool hanging from his mouth. Staff were in the middle of closing duties, so they kept an eye on him while Daniel tried to rouse himself. He slowly woke up over the course of 15 minutes and asked nearby LIB BL for help standing up. LIB BL refused, saying if he couldn't stand up on his own, she would have to call 911. Daniel didn't want that, so he managed to stand up slowly using his walker and the computer desk. He started making his way out of the building using his walker at closing and took about 9-10 minutes to fully exit after closing time. 
Daniel was in the library most of the day, having been seen at 1pm leaving the computer lab to go to the lobby restroom. He showed signs of inebriation and his ability to walk and talk diminished as the day progressed. This is an ongoing occurrence with Daniel E, so LIB III KK is suspending him for a month.
