Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description: Patron came into the library at 2:00pm to let front desk staff know that another patron had backed into a white ford truck. They were not certain if the vehicle belonged to staff or another library user

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description:
Renee was intoxicated and vomiting in the 2nd floor women's restroom for an extended period of time. She had been drinking in the library beforehand. L2 KW and L3 LD checked in on patron, who was being assisted by Officer Davidson.
A friend known as Lucky offered to give her a ride, but Officer Davidson stated that they smelled alcohol on them and that Renee would need a different ride home. Lucky was also found to be drinking in the library earlier.
Renee and Lucky left the library.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description:
During a routine check of the library, L1 MM noticed that regular teen patron Eli was asleep in a chair in the teen area; his belongings were scattered across the floor and his open drink was on the computer desk. L1 MM woke Eli up and told him that he could not sleep in the library and asked him to clean up his belongings. He seemed disoriented and slurring his words but he did proceed to collect his items and exit the library for the day. A few minutes later, another patron came to the front desk to let L1 MM and LTASup SG know that there was liquid on the teen area computer desk and on the floor mats underneath that smelled like alcohol. L1 MM went to clean up the liquid and confirmed that it was alcohol. Eli has been spoken to in the past about bringing alcohol into the library.
Update 9/12: LII AD served Eli his suspension letter when he arrived at 10am 9/12. He attempted to deny responsibility for the spill, but when LII AD explained that he had been the only one in the teen area who could have been responsible, he acknowledged this and left peacefully. He was offered the option of LRPY rather than the suspension and did not take it, but he is permitted to contact the library today or tomorrow if he wishes to take advantage of this option.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.4 Sleeping~Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description:
At around 12pm, a concerned female patron brought a bag and wallet to the service desk, saying an unknown male patron had left them there and been gone "for awhile."
L2 KVN checked his wallet with LTASup AP and looked up his library account. Connor Stone Hopkins uses the library almost daily, so KVN and AP left his items inside the backroom to see if he would return before EOD. 
Mr. Hopkins returned roughly 1 hour later, collected his items, and continued using the library.
At around 2:34pm, a patron could be heard loudly moaning inside the library. AP went to check and discovered Mr. Hopkins slumped over in front of a PC, unable to be roused. AP grabbed L1 KB for assistance, who went over with Guard JD to ask Mr. Hopkins to leave for the day.
Mr. Hopkins could not wake up, even when physically moved by the guard.
L2 KVN called 911 for medical assistance. KB found a recycling bin next to Mr. Hopkins with 5 50ml bottles of Canadian Mist alcohol. 
When paramedics arrived, they determined Mr. Hopkins was "extremely intoxicated" and too unwell to leave by himself. They transported him to the hospital.
Mr. Hopkins is receiving a 1-month suspension for drinking in the library.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description: A young teen was observed on the camera writing a racial slur in permanent marker on a bookshelf in the back part of the adult area of the library. He had already left by the time we obtained camera footage. We prepared a suspension letter and agreed to suspend him for a week. None of the staff noticed him in the building the next few weeks. Last week we saw him in the building. Once we confirmed he was the right individual, he had gone out to the performance patio. Branch Manager BL went out to speak to him and showed him a photo asking if that was him. He said yes and admitted to writing the word on the shelf. He said another boy said he'd give him $20 if he did it. We discussed other choices he could have made in that moment, as well as the importance of making sure everyone feels welcome in the library (and not being confronted with hate speech). I told him about his suspension and that the time had already passed, but reiterated that this was a serious offence. I explained if something similar happened in the future, the suspension would probably be longer. He seemed to understand.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating
Description:
L2 KVN left the backroom because she heard loud voices, with L1 KB as backup. 
LTA YM on desk reported that she had released a print job of one single page to Copier 1 for a male patron. When the patron arrived at Copier 1, he found an older female patron printing as well. He saw his print job and asked if he could grab it, since it was his print job. The female patron refused. 
Both patrons entered into a loud verbal altercation, with the female patron repeatedly refusing to hand over his one-page document. It should be noted that his document was on letter-sized paper and all of her print jobs were on ledger-sized paper. 
When KVN and KB arrived at the front desk, the male patron was explaining that she had repeatedly refused to hand over his print job for no reason. He did have the print job at this point. A separate female patron approached the desk and said that the older female patron was being "extremely rude" and reported she had been that way "all day."
KVN had observed the female patron throwing her items around the copier and cursing while the paramedics were in the building.
KVN asked Guard JD to help her ask the older female patron to leave for the day.
The older female patron insisted she was "already leaving," and claimed she had "no way of knowing it was his print job." KVN told her she could have looked at the print job to verify it was not his and then given it to him, but the woman claimed the male patron "did not give her any time."
The female patron left for the day after arguing for a few minutes. KVN repeated that she understood, the situation was resolved, and the patron could return tomorrow. 
The patron called back at 3:48pm and asked to speak with "the person who kicked her out." KVN took the phone call, where the patron identified herself as Margie Michael and continued to try to argue her case. KVN let her know that if she had a concern, she needs to "handle the situation respectfully and ask desk staff for help" so as not to escalate the situation. Margie continued to rant for a few more minutes before hanging up abruptly.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.1 Manipulating or bypassing library rules, such as computer use    3.2 Unplugging library equipment~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Green - Low Impact
Description: Between 11:30-11:45a, In-Charge Staff LC and TM spoke with patron who frequently unplugs the computer he uses on his visits (he's been known to do so at ELP & STU which was not discussed). When LC explained to patron why he was being issued a written warning, he said "This is bullshit! I am too old for this," and then proceeded to flick the written warning on the table away from him. LC responded that he would need to adjust his language when he is speaking with a lady. He apologized and proceeded to remark "I may have unplugged the computers in the past before. If you're asking me to stop doing this, I will stop doing it, and I will not take the paper." LAC reassured him that VAL staff knows he uses computers for educational purposes and would not need to approach him again just as long as he does not continue to unplug the computers. He agreed and accepted a verbal warning for unplugging the library equipment.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.4 Sleeping    2.7 Not wearing shoes or shirt    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: Staff JH and DS approached an unknown customer to request that he not lay out on furniture to sleep. He opened his eyes momentarily, but ignored their request. The customer's speech was slurred and motor control was very slow, but he was otherwise alert. Security and BM LG also attempted to ask the patron to use the furniture appropriately- he continued to ignore staff requests, not even acknowledging us. Officers were called to escort the customer out of the building and they walked him out with no further issues.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description: For documentation purposes only: At approximately 11:45 pm, LA CC told L2 VV and LIC CM that a patron told desk staff that they were aggressively approached by a person in front of the library, handing out flyers and asking, “Do you need a job?” After a discussion by VV and CM about if there may be a violation of the code of conduct, CM, accompanied by L1 KSB, went to speak to the person in front of the library. Security guard MG was also present. CM observed 3 people out in front, one African American man (Man #1) and a Caucasian man (Man #2) and woman. CM approached the 3 people, politely asking if there was anyone handing out job flyers. The African American man (Man #1) happened to be the first one CM looked at as she spoke to all 3 people. Man #1 immediately asked, “Why did you look at me first? Because I’m a Black man looking for a job?” Man #2, who was a bit hostile, said, “Yup. Racial profiling.” Man #2 appeared to be agitated, but not in an aggressive way (Man #1 did later state that Man #2 did take medication for anxiety and paranoia).  The woman spoke up and said that she was the one giving out the flyers.  “I’m sorry, I didn’t think that I was aggressive. I admit that I am loud, but I don’t think that I was aggressive.” Man #1 continued the conversation about racial profiling. CM and KSB told them that there was a patron who told the desk staff that they were approached aggressively, so the matter needed to be investigated. There appeared to be no wrongdoing but were told that patron harassment was against the code of conduct, for them to be careful about how they engaged with patrons. CM apologized to Man #1, letting him know that there was no racial profiling intended, and that he happened to be the first one she looked at as the group was approached. Man #1 accepted the apology and was given other resource flyers. All 3 people left without incident.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal
Description: A young gentleman with dog was sitting at computer #2 when an older patron got a little to close looking at the dog, when the dog started barking. The manager CO walks over to the young gentleman at computer #2 to let him know that because his dog was disruptive (not service animal) that his dog will not be able to stay in the building or be able to come back. The gentleman left.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: At approximately 3:45 a regular couple started arguing and screaming at each other on the front porch.  She stormed through the lobby to sit outside the west-facing door.  The special duty Officer Russell went to speak to the woman who was polite but clearly frustrated and still wanted to argue with her boyfriend.  L1 JCB went to the front porch to talk with him.  He talked about the conflict while JCB listened and seemed to calm down a bit.  The officer moved to speak to him and escorted him to a part of the parking lot where they could not be seen from the front.  She remained standoffish to staff offering to help and moved to the front and asked the guard where her boyfriend went.  JQ responded that he walked away and she stood waiting for him to return.  JCB instructed JQ to unobtrusively keep an eye on her while the officer de-escalated with the boyfriend.  JCB became aware that too many people watching was escalating her, so stepped to the floor to avoid too many people.  He communicated that he'd like to go to the crisis center for help and Officer Russell called another police officer to transport him to the crisis center.  After he left, she walked off the property toward 22nd St.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: At 11:30 AM, customer Marcus was using the computer lab on 1st. He had a forest green duffle bag at the computer. He stepped outside, but did not lock the computer he was using and left his bag. Regular customer, Nathaniel can be seen in video footage sitting down at Marcus' computer station at 11:32 AM with his own belongings. He begins to use the computer, remains at that station for a couple of minutes, notices the duffle bag, then gathers his belongings and Marcus' duffle bag and leaves the building. Marcus reported the theft of his bag to guard Jen, who reported this to LIC L3 LAF. LAF encouraged Marcus to submit an online TPD report, instructed him how to do so, and notified him that she could then supply footage to police. Nathaniel will be suspended for 1 year due to theft of another individual's belongings.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.5 Indecent exposure, public indecency, lewd, other sexual offense    1.1.2 Internet use that is harmful to minors~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.2 Strong odors    2.11 Belongings: Bringing in or storing    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Red - High Impact (Please click Notifications > Email aliases > Copy Trauma Informed Care Team if your location would like to request group EAP support)    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description:
At approximately 4:45pm on 9/16 LTA Sup SG informed branch manager AL that a patron had reported regular patron Steve Montes viewing explicit/pornographic material at computer number 16. This computer faces the teen area and was in full view of minors. AL spoke to Steve and said he needed to leave immediately. He protested, saying he was just watching movies but did comply. After Steve left, the patron who initially reported the incident approached staff again to thank them and to clarify that they saw Steve watching the explicit material and quickly changing tabs when anyone else walked by. The person felt this was a traumatic event and were grateful to us for asking him to leave. 
Staff is unsure of the age of the reporting patron but due to the confirmed presence of minors in the area and given the previous issues in the branch (see PITS report 23765) AL made the decision to suspend him for the period of one year. 
The suspension letter was issued at 10:00am on 9/17/2024 prior to entry to the library by AL and Assistant Manager AD. Steve asked what the contents of the letter were. He was told he was suspended for a year from all library locations. He was also told any information to contact administration was available on the letter. He said thank you and departed promptly. He was heard to be muttering about discrimination upon departure.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Service animal barked at library patrons
Description: L1 DW was minding desk. Patron 1 is a regular at STU and often brings in a small dog as "service animal" while using computers. There has been a history of this small dog barking at other library patrons- but not frequently. While L-1 was assisting patrons, the dog barked loudly, the L1 didn't notice anything that would provoke the dog, it seemed to be barking loudly over nothing. The dog stopped barking as suddenly as it began. Typically service animals are allowed in the library as long as they are not disruptive and this patron has been warned in the past regarding this dog as there have been several incidents of this dog being upset around library patrons. Patron was asked to remove dog until it has sufficient training to remain in the library without incident.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.2 Strong odors
Description: Patron Kristin Marti Koenig requested help filling out forms on the PC. I pointed out that there must be an error in one of the fields where there are red asterisks highlighting spelling problems or issues and that she would need to fix the errors the asterisks were highlighting. Before this she interrupted me and another patron while I was helping her and was rude when I told her it would be a while and she may have better luck asking at the desk at which point she muttered how everyone at the library was rude. Patron often smells strongly of feces and today was no different. Subsequently the entire computer lab smelled.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.5 Indecent exposure, public indecency, lewd, other sexual offense
Description: At 2:20pm Guard J called LIC AK and let her know that Officer Lopez was escorting Patron Michael Dafter out of the library for watching adult porn and indecent exposure.  LIC AK found everyone outside, and Officer Lopez was writing Michael a ticket.  Michael denied the indecent exposure but admitted to watching porn.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating
Description: Kaden and Carlos had been sharing a computer for several minutes and had been warned about not using profanity.  L1 JCB walked away for roughly 30 seconds and when she returned, Kayden had Carlos in a standing headlock.  JCB told the boys they needed to leave for the day and Carlos replied "But Miss! We didn't do anything!" while still fighting to get out of the headlock.  Both boys were asked to leave for the day, but then Carlos snuck back in and was in the teen area watching another teen play Roblox, so he was suspended for 3 days.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.5 Indecent exposure, public indecency, lewd, other sexual offense~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Defecating in the library landscaping
Description: As she was coming in, LTA VN saw a woman in the bushes on the east side of the building with her pants down and defecating. When L1 MNC went to investigate, she was still in the process of relieving herself. MNC told her that this was not appropriate behavior and that she needed to leave library property. The woman left shortly afterwards. Facilities will be contacted to remove the biohazard.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description:
Approx. 11:45am, a patron alerted desk staff to the presence of a drug pipe in the men's room. Librarian II AD and Library Associate GL went to check the restroom and confirmed the presence of a glass pipe full of a burnt, greyish-white powder substance. The edges of the pipe looked sharp and lacking proper protective equipment, LII AD locked the restroom and placed it out of order until the pipe could be disposed of.
Cameras do not cover that area and no one was present in the restroom at time of inspection, so no culprit could be identified.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.1 Manipulating or bypassing library rules, such as computer use
Description:
Juma was being loud and disruptive in the computer area. L1 MNC had to interrupt helping patrons at the PCs to get him to stop. After several outbursts, MNC told him to leave the library for the day. In response, Juma tried repeatedly to shut down another teen's PC. MNC again directed him to leave with the help of Guard C. On his way out, Juma shouted a string of profanities, including calling other patrons "fucking pussies".
Juma will be suspended for one month for his disruptive behavior.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description:
Approx. 4:30pm, Librarian I VG alerted in-charge Librarian II AD that regular teen patron Eli was passed out and unresponsive in the teen area. Library Associate WB was in the teen area attempting to rouse him. LII AD and LI VG joined LA WB, whereupon LII AD attempted to get Eli's attention by saying his name several times. Eli moaned vaguely but did not change position.
LII AD informed Eli that if he could not respond coherently and get up under his own power, we would have no choice but to call 911 for a welfare check. There was more vague moaning but again no coherent response, even when both LA WB and LI VG encouraged him to rouse himself and offered to bring a chair over to him that he could use. LII AD then informed Eli that we would be calling 911 and left to do that. While walking away, LI VG and LII AD both saw an empty bottle near Eli, presumably of alcohol. This is Eli's first day back after a previous suspension for alcohol use (see PITS 23774).
Police responded at 4:45pm to conduct welfare check. They were able to wake Eli and speak with him, but when police requested his name and a contact number for a parent or guardian, he became verbally combative, insisting that he was not required to disclose any information. Two police officers escorted Eli from the premises.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: LIC LD called medical 911 for library patron, patron requested assistance on calling for medical help. EMT's arrived on scene and assisted patron, patron left with them.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Two teenagers were being loud and LTA AB overheard them use the n word repeatedly.  The slur seemed to be directed at the video game they were playing.  L3 KK and L1 KB spoke to the teens making them aware that the library has a zero tolerance for racist behavior.  KK explained that staff had heard them say the n word repeatedly.  Teen 1 rolled his eyes and said the n word wasn't racist.  KK and KB emphasized that it was and that they needed to leave for the day.  The teens complied.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: At 11:30, Security Guard GH rang the bell to the Employee Entrance to STU. L-1 DW came to the door. GH informed DW that she had seen a man smoking drugs by cooking them on a piece of foil. She brought DW around the northwest corner of the perimeter fence where they saw the man walking away angrily. Library manager LG explained that she and GH had seen the same man passed out the previous day.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: At approximately 1:54pm staff could smell marijuana in the staff and public area. When In-Charge LHN went to investigate where it may have been coming from, LTA SE walked in from the back staff area and confirmed that a patron with red hair, grey shirt and skateboard had walked from the back staff entrance to the front public entrance of the library where smell was still permeating from body. Patron was not asked to leave, at the time staff did not have access to cameras to confirm who it was and the smell had dissipated. Patron did not cause any incidents inside the library. This is being entered for documentation purposes.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description: The two teens from incident 0000023793 came to the Columbus Library and continued to display disruptive behavior including excessive swearing that was bothering nearby patrons. LTA DM recognized the patrons from the incident at Wilmot and notified L1 MNC. MNC told them that there behavior was not acceptable and that they had been asked to leave another branch for the day for the same. They were then asked to leave and not return to any PCPL branches for the day.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: Causing damage to library property    3.2 Unplugging library equipment
Description: At approximately 2:45 pm, LIC CM, who was in the staff room, heard a "crash," which was heard by other staff members. CM went to investigate and was told by LA CC that the charging station tower had fallen over. CM observed an African American male patron, who was seated at the security guard station, which is next to the charging station. The chair he was seated in was pushed back against the charging station. The patron had unplugged the charging station to use the outlet to plug in his phone. CM told the patron that he wasn't allowed to sit at the security station, and that he could not be unplugging library property. This served as a verbal warning. He was told where he could plug in his phone. L1 KSB and LTA Supervisor LNH joined CM to inspect the charging tower for damage. Some visible damage was noted. The first three slot doors are now difficult to open and have been put out of service. CM will confer with Branch manager CO to view video and determine what further action will be appropriate since there is damage to the charging station.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Entering library while suspended
Description: At 12pm female customer was approaching library with a male customer. Female was identified by guard BJ as being suspended. Librarian JD was notified and saw customer putting out her cigarette on the stone pole and then waiting in parking lot when customer saw guard.  At 12:15pm, customer was found inside library sitting at a table with male customer. BJ notified JD and both approached customer informing her that she was suspended until 3/6/2025. She threw suspension paperwork that was handed to her on the floor and said that she was not named on the paperwork and we could call 911. JD called 911 at 12:21pm. Customer left library and 911 call was cancelled at 12:47pm

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Red - High Impact (Please click Notifications > Email aliases > Copy Trauma Informed Care Team if your location would like to request group EAP support)
Description:
At around 1pm, two groups in the cafe area began arguing. L1 MNC went into the cafe and both groups continued to shout at one another and refused to de-escalate. As they would not tone down their behavior, L1 MNC asked them all to leave for the day. One of the male patrons refused to leave and began shouting racial slurs. He had to be escorted outside by TPD Officer ER via the west side exit. Guard J assisted MNC with escorting the others in the second group outside via the front door. Once outside, the male in the first group continued calling the officer and the male in the other group racial slurs and had to be ordered by Officer ER leave multiple times. He then shouted vivid death threats as he waited to cross the street and head northbound on Columbus. As the second group headed to the bus stop on the north side of the library, the male from the second group (J. Diaz-Guzman?) began to swear and shout threats back at the first man. Officer ER, Guard J, and MNC remained outside until the groups all dispersed.
Due to the nature of his threats and racist language and refusal to leave property, the male from the first group will be suspended for 1 year. The male from the second group will be suspended for 1 month.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: An argument broke out between two members of the Citation Garden Co-op. One of the members who was arguing came to the desk and demanded that the other member be made to leave. L1 MNC came into the meeting room and spoke to the group. He reminded them that meetings taking place in the room are open to everyone at the library and that they are all expected to abide by the library code of conduct. They all agreed to act civilly so that their meeting could continue.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description:
Approx. 2:15pm, a woman approached Librarian II AD at the front desk, saying she'd called earlier in the week and wished to donate several boxes of books. LII AD let her know that we could only accept 10 items at a time, but promised to have someone meet her "at the back", and pointed towards the employee entrance. LII AD asked the woman what vehicle she was driving for identification purposes and the woman could not provide either, saying only that her car was blue. LII AD asked Librarian SM to meet the woman by the employee entrance. L SM attempted to locate the woman by the employee entrance four separate times, but was unsuccessful.
Approx. 2:35pm, the woman returned, very agitated. She said that no one had been out to help her and that she'd been waiting for "at least 15 minutes!" The library was very short staffed and there were only 3 employees available and on the clock to cover 3 service points, so LII AD explained that they would attempt to have someone help her again, and asked her to return to her vehicle. Library Associate WB overheard this and volunteered to step away from the service desk to assist her. When she saw LA WB enter the back room, she demanded to be allowed to follow him. LII AD let her know that only employees were permitted in the employee area, and that she would need to meet LA WB outside. She protested, saying she'd already tried that and it hadn't worked. LII AD repeated that LA WB would be meeting her and ended the conversation, helping another patron who had been waiting.
When LA WB located her outside (in the handicapped spots near the front entrance, nowhere near the employee entrance she'd been directed to), she was still agitated and becoming increasingly hostile. She complained that "She wouldn't let me in!" (referring to LII AD). LA WB reiterated that only employees were allowed in the employee area, and also explained that the library could take a maximum of 10 donated books per day. As a compromise, he offered to take one of her boxes (approximately 15 books), but not the rest of the items. She snapped, "It's almost like you don't want these books!" LA WB indicated that he had offered all he could and asked if she still wanted his help to take one box. She said "I don't know, do you want to help me?!" At this point, LA WB chose to discontinue the interaction due to the woman's increasing hostility and aggressiveness. He reported that as he walked away, she was still clearly upset and angry.
For documentation purposes. If she returns, staff will speak with her about treating employees with respect and will provide information on the Friends Book Barn for her donation needs.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.8 Smoking, rolling, using tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes
Description: A customer entered Woods Memorial this afternoon wearing a ski mask and went directly to the bathroom.  Security Guard MG then performed a regular bathroom check, noticed a closed stall with someone inside it who did not respond to multiple, loud requests for a response by MG.  Security Guard MG then got both L1 in charge CM as well as our off-duty TPD officer WB to assist with follow-up as the customer was evidently unresponsive to MG.  When officer WB entered the bathroom and repeated MG's request for a response, the customer (male, late 20s, latinx in white hoodie) emerged from stall loudly cussing at the officer.  Officer WB saw and smelled vape smoke from the stall where customer had been, told the individual that smoking was not allowed in the library and that he would have to leave the building.  Customer became very irate at this point, claiming "You're just harassing me for using the bathroom," and briefly refused to leave the library until he had gotten the officer's name.  Customer then left still loudly complaining and asserting "I'll get a lawyer!"  Librarian CM never actually interacted with customer, just accompanied while MG & WB escorted customer out of bathroom and off of library property.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: LA RW called medical for library patron. Patron was transported to hospital.
NONE
Called 911 for medical for a patron that was not feeling well. Patron received medical attention but refused to be transported to hospital.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: A patron sitting outside on the plaza requested that LA BD call 911 for medical assistance. The patron had moved off library property but we noted that paramedics arrived to assist.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property~Children in the Library~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property~Children in the Library~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description: LIC BC was called about a patron requesting help for another individual on the plaza. The patron asked for medical help/for a cup. Patron refused the offer to call for paramedics, showed signs of intoxication and started harassing staff. When patron tried to return to the library LIC BC let him know that he could not use the library today because he was intoxicated and had harassed staff. Patron accused BC of being racist and swore and lunged in an aggressive manner. Patron's friend talked him down and he returned to the plaza. Patron will be suspended for 30 days.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: At approximately 3:22 pm, a woman approached the information desk and asked if we had seen a male that was sort of hunched over. LTA YM and Lib BL responded that she was welcome to look for him. A few minutes later Page E came to inform YM and BL that there was an altercation between two people by the printer. BL went to the area to assess the situation. At first, it appeared to be a normal conversation but quickly became loud and accusatory. The female accused the male of stealing packages from her porch. She followed him to the library. BL returned to the service desk to report the need for assistance just as YM and L2 KVN and L3 KK were responding to what had now become disruptively loud shouting that could be heard throughout the library. L3 KK spoke to the female who then went outside to call 911. L2 KVN called 911 and received no answer after two minutes and KVN ended the call and redialed. After one minute the 911 call was answered. At 4:15 pm, the police have not arrived, and the female seems to have left the property. KVN canceled the 911 call at 4:15pm.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.10 Creating tripping hazards, blocking aisles, exits, entrances    2.11 Belongings: Bringing in or storing    2.12 Belongings: Leaving unattended, may be removed without notice    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
L1 DW was at the front desk when Library Manager LG informed him that patron Anthony had left his shopping cart in the walkway to the library entrance. LG informed him that we had repeatedly asked Anthony not to park his cart there as it interfered with foot traffic of library patrons and he had repeatedly ignored our warnings not to do so.
LG asked Doug to have Anthony removed. LA GG and Security Guard GW asked Anthony to leave the premises. Anthony left peaceably.
At about 3:30 Anthony returned and was informed that he had been suspended for one day for not obeying library rules he had been reminded of repeatedly. He left without incident.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: Around 1 p.m. as LTA Sup GG was heading out for lunch and Guard GH asked for assistance in the men’s public restroom, saying there was some commotion going on. GG then entered the restroom and began speaking with patron A who stated that the patron B who was in the stall, had entered and restroom and pushed him. LTA Sup GG then spoke with patron B and asked him if everything was, ok? and he replied that “he was fine.” Patron A continued to describe what had happened, GG then asked Patron B to exit the restroom he replied, “when I’m finished.” After a few minutes patron B exited the restroom, GG explained that his behavior wasn’t tolerated in the library, Patron B replied, “what behavior?” GG then explained that patron A stated that he was pushed by him, Patron B then said, “well I didn’t and it’s his word against mine.” GG gave Patron B a verbal warning and asked him to leave for the day, he then gathered his belongings and left without further incident.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.2 Disruptive use of personal devices    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: At approximately 12:35 pm, LIC CM heard loud talking coming from the patron areas. At the time, CM was assisting a patron at the service desk. Security guard MG, had gone to see who was speaking loudly. MG asked the patron at computer 11 to lower his voice. According to MG, the patron ignored him. MG once again asked the patron to lower his voice. The patron told MG that "all these f*****g people are talking louder than me!" The patron was the only one talking. He was repeatedly asked to lower his voice. After becoming more hostile toward MG and TPD day officer R, he was asked to leave for the day. The patron refused several times, using profane language. MG asked CM to shut down computer 11. Computer 11 was shut down, and the patron was escorted off the premises by MG and Officer R without incident. The patron will be suspended for one year for disturbing behavior, using profanity, and being noncompliant.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property

Description:
Patron was observed eating in the adult computer lab. VetSec Guard MM advised him that he is not allowed to eat at the computer. Patron responded with "F*ck You!" 
Guard asked him to repeat it, he put his headphones in and ignored her.
LSM VL approached patron and told them to leave for the day. Patron stated "This is bullsh*t"
As patron walked by the front desk and stepped outside they said again "F*ck You!"

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.8 Smoking, rolling, using tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes
Description: Around 2pm VetSec MM noticed a patron smoking from an e-cigarette. She told the patron this was not appropriate behavior in the library. He indicated that he heard her. Around 10 minutes later, VetSec MM witnessed the patron putting his e-cigarette back into his pocket. She advised L1 MG what she had witnessed. L1 MG reviewed camera footage and found that he had smoked from the e-cigarette at least two times after VetSec MM had asked him to not smoke in the library. L1 MG and VetSec MM approached the patron and asked him to leave for the day. VetSec MM stated that the smoke was consistent with the odor of marijuana.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: About 2:30 a patron using computer 1 became irate, slamming computer mouse and keyboard, then throwing her chair into the desk. LTA Sup GG then approached the patron and asked if she was ok. Patron then said that staff logged her off. GG explained that staff doesn’t log people off the computer, when your time expires the computer restarts automatically. She started saying profanities at LTA Sup GG. GG then asked her to leave for the day and her behavior was not allowed in the library. After exiting the library GG followed her to the public entrance, when she turned around to curse him and the rest of the staff out saying we're all a bunch of dumb B-word, and F-word all of you. GG then told her she would be suspended from all libraries. She then left the premises.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Several youth patrons had already been asked to leave for the day for disruptive behavior in the Childrens/Teen Area. On their way out, four of our regular youth patrons (Bella Fletcher, Mia Fletcher, Isaiah Fletcher, and Mya Esters) escalated to loudly shouting profanity near the front desk and adult PCs, startling some of the adults using the PCs. They will all be suspended for one week.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description: At approximately 4:45 pm I, FC the LTA Supervisor was called to the computer lab by LA, LW, who explained that there were 3 people yelling and using profanity, I asked what happened and all they replied is that some girl threw their stuff they wouldn't explain what happened but were very upset, they continued to yell after LW had previously asked them not to use profanity while explaining what had occurred but when they would not stop, LW asked them to leave the library for the day. As they proceeded to leave they continued to yell and curse while walking out.  About 10 minutes later I, FC was called out again to the outside front of the library, my coworker ND went with me.  Security officer ML was already there, I witnessed the same 3 people yelling and cursing with another female patron and her child, I asked what was going on and all they did was yell and threaten each other, they would not stop yelling. ND asked the 3 people to leave the library grounds since they would not listen to any of us, they continued to threaten and curse until they finally went to the bus stop.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description: On Friday, September 27th around 9am, LTA AM reported to Branch Manager SH that a library page had reported seeing that the Wheeler Taft Abbett, Sr. Library's publication/newspaper ink stamp had been used to stamp several bookshelves and tables throughout the library. It was recently discovered that 2 of the stamps from the Front Desk were also missing. Staff were able to remove most of the graffiti.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct
Description: On Monday, September 23rd Librarian II JM reported to Branch Manager SH that while he was picking up trash in the staff courtyard he noticed burnt foil with burn marks. JM reported that this type of foil and the burn marks were indicative of someone possibly smoking fentanyl or another illegal substance on library property. This incident is for information purposes only.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.2 Strong odors    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal
Description: Patrons began to complain of a strong ammonia scent in the air. Librarian 1 KH tracked it to a patron sitting at the tables in the fiction section, who had a very large backpack of the type often used to carry pets. When L1 KH asked if there was a live animal in the backpack, the patron insisted it contained a robot, not an animal. However, L1 KH and Guard DT noted that there were water bowls attached to the backpack. When Guard DT saw cat eyes through the mesh, he advised the patron that he was going to inform the librarians that she had an animal that she'd lied about. When Librarian 1 MK walked by a few minutes later with the intention of speaking to her, she was packing up to go and departed the library.

Paramedics arrived at the library looking for a patron in distress. It is unclear if the patron had called or someone else had called on his behalf. They located the patron in the cafe area. After evaluation, they loaded him onto a gurney for transport to the hospital. 
Added for documentation purposes.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description: Customer sent the following to Askalibrarian:  "I wish I could shake the hand of the genius who invites classes of school children into the library so hard that I'd crush every bone like a vise grip. Are you sadistic or just plain stupid? I'm guessing whatever school these kids attend has its own library, right? How about they explore it instead? At least restrict children to the area labeled for kids."  Sender was identified as David Oriscak through the email, kennerslus@iname.com.  Customer was mailed a 6 month suspension letter and his Sierra account blocked.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
Around noon, Mia and Isaiah came into the library to question their suspension. L1 JCB spoke with them and confirmed the suspension. They both left afterwards.
At 3:40pm, Mia and Isaiah returned to the library. Guard CS attempted to remind them of their suspension but they ignored him and continued into the teen area with the guard following behind. L1 AF also restated that they were both suspended and asked them to leave but provided them with an afterschool snack. L1 MNC was called and spoke with the two teens.
Due to their disregarding directions from Guard CS and their suspensions already being confirmed to them by other staff this morning, their suspensions will now be extended to two weeks.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: Choking~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Attacked guard, choking
Description: At approximately 10:30am DW and MC heard "help me"  while at the front desk service point.  DW left the front desk to assess the situation.  She immediately stated to call 911.  MC dialed emergency response and relayed that our security guard was actively being choked and to dispatch police assistance. DW went back to monitor and assist where she safely could.  Library patron was able to get person choking the guard to stop.   Police, medics and crime scene personnel arrived to assist and process the incident. Person was arrested.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.9 Trespassing    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Red - High Impact (Please click Notifications > Email aliases > Copy Trauma Informed Care Team if your location would like to request group EAP support)
Description:
Around 12:50, a patron suspended last week entered the library and was recognized by Guard J. L1 MNC asked to speak with the patron outside accompanied by TPD Officer JC. The patron attempted to argue his suspension but accepted the letter. He then asked MNC to allow him to assist his partner (who was wearing a cast) in the use of the family restroom. MNC agreed as a one time exception and went to go unlock the restroom. 
Once he was at the restroom door, the patron escalated his behavior by tearing up his suspension letter and directing profanity and threats at the officer. Because of this, MNC stated that he could not enter the restroom and asked him to leave the library. The patron then began shouting, swearing, and threatening MNC, Officer JC, and other nearby staff and patrons. He had to be removed from the premises by the officer.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description:
Chance tried to enter the library in the company of several other children, including Isaiah Miranda and Kaysasi Esters, among others. L1 NG immediately recognized him and knew that he is still suspended. Chance recognized NG from another library and froze. NG let him know that he was suspended from all libraries and asked the group to wait in the entryway while she checked on something. NG came to get L3 AG and let her know that Chance was here, among others. AG wasn't sure if the others were suspended, and followed out to the desk to help look up recent incidents. During this time the group decided to leave on their own. They loitered outside for a short while before leaving the property. 
Because Chance left, his suspension will not be extended at this time.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Leaving animal unattended
Description:
Phil, a regular library user, came to the service desk during the 1pm - 2pm hour with L2 KVN and L1 JD on desk without his husky. He also used the restroom without his husky. L2 KVN assumed he did not bring his husky with him.
During the 3pm hour, LTA YM also noticed Phil using the restroom for over 5min without his husky. She questioned whether the husky was inside the building unattended, and noted that Phil had left his husky unattended before.
JD found the husky alone, sleeping under the PCs. When Phil left the restroom, she gave him a verbal warning that he is not allowed to leave his husky unattended and it must accompany him everywhere inside the library.
Phil was understanding.
This is to document the conversation.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
At 4:30, a male patron started loudly cursing. L1 JD went to ask if he needed help. He was attempting to use Goodreads on the Catalog PC to find a book. He was aggressive but he calmed down.
Over the next 30min, he had small outbursts of unintelligible mutters. Guard B monitored the situation.
At 5pm, JD went to let him know the library was closed and asked if she could help him check out. He started yelling "Go to hell and die" over and over. He directed it toward Guard B and JD.
L2 KVN monitored while he started walking out the building. The male patron then said "go to hell and die, bitch" to JD.
The patron took a library book without checking it out.
He then used the public phone and yelled "I'm using the phone and you can't stop me." He made a quick phone call and then left property. 
Guard B let him know he was suspended.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft    1.1.4 Vandalizing property    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Description: Upon finding a large pepper plant missing from the front planter, Video footage shows group of 3 people on the patio on Sunday morning one of which is drinking and harassing patrons who use the book chute as well as pulling the plant and tossing it into the parking lot area. Individual is suspended for one year.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft    1.1.4 Vandalizing property~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description: On Friday, September 27th LTA Supervisor MV noticed a female youth with an ink marking on her arm that had been made with the missing Wheeler Taft Abbett, Sr. Library publications/newspaper stamp. MV asked the youth where she got the stamp and the girl said from a girl named Gabby (Gabriella), and mentioned that Gabby had been stamping people and objects at the library and at her school with the stamp, as mentioned in incident 0000023815. Since that time Teen Librarian SG and Branch Manager SH identified the female youth named Gabby. At staff's request Gabby returned the stolen stamp to library staff today and because she was willing to cooperate with staff Gabby will be suspended for 15 days rather than 30 for theft and vandalism of library property. Gabby also informed library staff that she did not take the stamp but another youth stole it and gave it to her. Staff explained to Gabby that in the future she should return something that doesn't belong to her, even if she wasn't the one that stole it. Gabby's suspension will end on October 15th, 2024 at 3pm.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.2 Guns, weapons, machetes, knives
Description: At 9:15 AM LTA SE was doing book chute and found a large razor blade in the chute. The chute had multiple items from different patrons including a large amount of donations. There are no security cameras that can view who returned items to the outdoor book chute.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: Female customer entered library at opening saying she had just been released from St. Joseph's Hospital and was in medical distress.  Customer then laid down in a fetal position in front of the service desk.  L2 KVN called 911.  While ambulance was on its way, woman got up and left on her own.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
A male library user in his 20s-or-30s came up to the front desk asking for help getting online. During the interaction with Librarian TM, manager IR, who was also at the front desk heard the male library user say to TM "I have had the biggest crush on you since I used to go to storytime. You're just so beautiful." and proceeded to continue with his romantic advances. TM did not accept or respond to the verbal advances, and handed him the information that he needed and explained how he could get online with his laptop. Once the library user took the information, he started again with his verbal advances. Manager IR, who was working on something with staff at the adjacent desk, turned to the patron and said "Let me stop you right there. This is not appropriate conversation with the librarian. You need to stop talking like this to her, this is her place of work and it is inappropriate." 
The library user argued when he was redirected to stop making those comments, but walked away grumbling to the computers. He muttered under his breath a derogatory word to IR. And sat down.
Prior to this interaction, TM had walked to the back room to let in-charge staff know that this patron was in the building and that she was uncomfortable talking to him because he had made inappropriate comments towards her in the past, which made her feel ill-at-ease. Additionally, on today's visit, the man had been glaring in her direction since he had seen her at the desk, which she was posted at for the 10am-11am hour.
Once he got settled at the computer and logged in, TM went to work in the back room and IR stayed to cover the front desk. The library user who sat facing his computer turned sideways periodically to glare in the direction of the front desk, and grumbled to himself on two additional occasions when IR walked past him to help another patron.
Staff covering the desk the following hour (LSMs KZ and PAC) reported that the same man approached the front desk again, with an uneven gait and rambling conversation that was consistent with being intoxicated, as well as made staff and patrons feel ill-at-ease. 
Library user was asked to leave for the day. He complied, but returned a couple of hours later. The second time, in-charge librarian RL requested assistance from the Vet-Sec security officer to escort the man off the premises. The man lingered near the bust stop at the library south face for several hours, but did not come back inside for the rest of the day.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1 Any criminal offense
Description: Customers observed Patricia Johnson hit a truck while parking in an ADA spot.  Security camera footage showed Ms. Johnson hitting a truck, parking her vehicle, getting out and looking at the damage to her bumper and to the truck that she hit.  Ms. Johnson then hopped into her car and drove off property.  Witnesses provided L2 KVN with a license plate number and a photo of Ms. Johnson's vehicle.  Before 911 had been called, Ms. Johnson returned to property stating that she "didn't realize" she had hit the other vehicle.  The truck's owner and Ms. Johnson spoke and settled the matter.  L3 KK spoke to Ms. Johnson who told her that a woman using a cane had gotten in her way. This was not what security cameras showed.  KK mentioned to Ms. Johnson that the entire incident was recorded on security cameras and that we were happy that she had returned so that we could cancel our 911 call.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description: At 11:12am Patron Michael Dapper from incident #0000023786 was recognized by Vet Sec Guard JT and she and LIC LII JM approached the patron with his suspension paperwork. Michael was on a public computer and LIC LII JM struggled to get the patrons attention as he was very focused on his video. The Patron became upset and said that LIC LII JM had bothered him and immediately began yelling obscenities when he saw Vet Sec Guard JT standing behind her. LIC LII JM and Vet Sec Guard JT reminded Michael about his 1 year suspension and he stood up yelling and said that he already went to his court date and they dropped all charges. LIC LII JM and Vet Sec Guard JT tried to tell him again that he was suspended and needed to leave. Patron began getting up and gathering his belongings all the while yelling. LIC LII JM and Guard JT walked away from the patron further down the aisle to give him space and they stood just outside the computer stations in a more open area. Vet Sec Guard JT asked other patrons at other computers and sitting in the cafe area to not get involved and that staff will deal with this as some began standing up. Michael emerged with his belongings but proceeded to point his finger in Vet Sec Guard JT's face and aggressively call her a "cunt" and to say that he remembered her red hair. Michael called both LIC LII JM and Guard J "ugly bitches," and LIC LII JM again told the patron to leave the building and that he was suspended for 1 year as she pointed towards the front doors. As the patron walked towards the doors, he turned around several times and at one point approaching both JM and Guard JT again aggressively yelling at Vet Sec Guard JT things like "no wonder you don't have a boyfriend" and yelled towards staff that they were both "cunts" and "ugly bitches" and finally left the library. Michael's suspension will be extended.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: Be There Gift Card Fraud    3.1 Manipulating or bypassing library rules, such as computer use    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description: This individual has received at least 8 $40 gift cards through the Be There program by bringing in what appear to be legitimate Be There certificates under 9 completely different names. We do not know what her actual name is, but she used the same birthday on almost all of the certificates. She came into River last Thursday(9/26) and received a gift card under the name Willow Hill. She had her hair in a bun and I think she was wearing glasses. She collected two more gift cards at different libraries that same day. On Friday(9/27) she went to two more libraries, again with different names. Today she went to three different libraries before noon. At around 12:40pm she came back into River, this time as Harper Snyder. This time she wore no glasses and had her hair straightened and combed over her face a little, but she still looked familiar. Since I had only just finished reading the email about this individual, I asked if she had any form of ID. She said it was in the car and hurried out. She did not return.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: At about 1:30 PM, Librarian BP was sitting near the front entrance with some people she knew personally that were tabling. This was a table to help people register to vote but also has visible Harris/Walz signage. BP was wearing a mask. The patron approached the table and mentioned that it was nice that they were being civil. He then walked around the table and stepped right up to BP's face. She pointed to the mask on her arm and asked him to back up. He said, "this is a public place. If you don't like it you should go back inside. Put the mask back on, you'll look better." After haranguing her he walked to his car around the south side of the building. BP moved further away from the entrance to continue eating her lunch. The patron then pulled up in front of the library, got out of his car and took pictures of the people tabling, then specifically sought out BP taking her picture while she was trying to eat lunch. He also said that he would be back tomorrow to table since it was a public place. Patron will be suspended for one year.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.2 Disruptive use of personal devices    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
A patron arrived via skateboard and sat outside the front entrance with a large boom-box style speaker blasting music with the bass turned up. Bass could be heard both in the public area and in the staff area. L1 NG responded, approached the individual and let him know the speaker was too loud and we could hear it inside. He then said, "How do you know? You're out here." NG reiterated that the bass was too loud and we could feel it in our chests. He then offered to turn the music all the way off and did so, but turned it on again as soon as NG was inside.
At this point it was audible in the staff area but not really in the public area, so we decided to let it be, however the volume slowly increased after about 10 minutes. L3 AG then went out to address it, but found the speaker and a skateboard unattended and blocking the book drop. The patron then came outside and asked if it was too loud again. AG responded that it was, and that it was also blocking the book drop, which we don't allow. She asked him to turn it off and told him it was disruptive for the people in the library. He moved his belongings and turned the volume down but not off. AG offered him a copy of the Code of Conduct, which he refused to accept.
A few minutes later, the volume was again cranked to disruptive levels. AG went outside with NG as backup in order to tell him to leave for the day, but he was already walking away with his items. AG followed at a distance as he went around the side of the building and saw him walk out to the bus stop instead of remaining on property.
At about 3:20 he returned, and soon the volume was again briefly cranked to disruptive levels. NG and AG went outside again, to find he had again left property. Security guard AB informed them that he saw the patron leave to the west on Wetmore.

Description:
