Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Leaving animal unattended
Description:
LTA YM and L BL reported to L2 KVN at roughly 5:30pm that L1 KB had another conversation with Phil during the day because he left his husky, Blue, unattended again. KB reportedly had a conversation with him about not leaving his husky unattended.
After repeatedly leaving Blue unattended throughout the last hour, KVN went to check on Phil and Blue as he was leaving. She asked about Blue's name and asked if there was something going on with Blue that library staff could accommodate, like a temporary medical condition that made it difficult for Blue to go with him everywhere. 
Phil became defensive and repeatedly asked KVN why she was asking about Blue's conditions. KVN said that was trying to find out if something was going on, because they'd had multiple conversations with Phil and he was still leaving Blue, so if something was going on they wanted to work with him.
Phil reiterated that nothing was wrong with Blue, and he "wouldn't lie about it," but he "appreciated the concern." He said he "kept forgetting her" cause it's "easier to let her rest." 
KVN said she understood but that this would be his last verbal conversation and that there would be further consequences if it happened again because it is dangerous to leave any animal unattended.
Phil said (again) that he understood and he wasn't trying to "skirt the rules" and it "won't happen again" because this is "his favorite library."

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating
Description: At 2:57 pm on Wednesday October 2nd, Quincie Douglas library staff member BC and security guard RP called TPD to notify them of assault that was done unto another patron outside on library grounds. The patron who assaulted another library patron was an unknown older woman, white, female, with blonde hair, late 40s to early 50s, under 6 ft; the other library patron who was the victim was another unknown female, white, also late 40s to early late 50s, brown hair, under 6 ft; the victim of the assault reported that her phone was busted and no longer worked. Security guard RP tried talking to the victim, but she was visibly upset and in distress; she was seen with a bloodied nose as a result from the assault. RP spoke with TPD about the incident, afterwards. No further communication was indicated from the victim whether she decided and chose to press charges against the assailant.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description:
LTA Sup AP took a phone call from a patron at 520-358-0064, which is connected to patron Pamela Pope (the patron never identified herself on the phone).
Pamela was reporting that a "male with one-leg who uses crutches" was inside the library and had just called her demanding money. She told AP that he "has a knife and uses drugs" and told AP to look for him and call the police if he was in the library because he has "warrants out for his arrest." 
AP let the patron know that we cannot identify anyone who is in the library. The patron started becoming more upset, started cussing, and told AP "then him stabbing everyone in the library is on you then."
AP grabbed L2 KVN to take over the phone call.
L2 KVN introduced herself and asked for more details. 
KVN found out that Pamela Pope is the mother (or MIL) to this male patron she is reporting, and that she has this male patron's 14-year-old son (her grandson). She is claiming this male patron uses "meth, heroin, and fentanyl." She stated that he had harassed her at Village Inn earlier in the day, she called TPD, and he left before TPD arrived. She repeated to KVN that he has "8 warrants out for his arrest" and he "carries a steak knife in his backpack."
KVN asked if he had threatened her, and she said no. She said he had been asking her for money calling from the library's phone. She claimed he had just been released from Palo Verde Mental Hospital.
KVN apologized that Pamela was experiencing such a difficult time and validated her feelings. KVN reiterated what AP had told her, that there was no way for them to identify to her (Pamela) if this male patron was currently in the library. Pamela kept repeating that she did not want to come to the library and "bring her 14-year-old grandson to watch his father get arrested." KVN encouraged her to stay away if she was worried as there was no reason for her to come see if he was in the library. KVN suggested that Pamela call to make the report and Pamela refused and started cussing and making threats about the behavior this male patron might display in the library. 
KVN let her know that if this male patron displayed threatening behavior, showing signs of being under-the-influence, or used drugs in the library then the police would be called. 
Pamela became more agitated and started cussing again, telling KVN "he's going to fucking smoke fentanyl in your bathrooms and you don't give a fuck." 
KVN assured her it was against library policy and the proper authorities would be called at that point. 
Pamela continued to cuss and say that she didn't want him calling her. KVN encouraged Pamela again to call the police and make a report because they can do the investigation for her. 
Pamela ended the phone call by saying "Fuck you, call the police goddammit." 
The male patron Pamela described is a semi-frequent user of WIL. He has never had any negative incidents at the library. KVN spoke to the guard and other supervisors to make them aware, just in case.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description:
Patron from incident 0000023825 came into WIL. Guard J and L1 KB notified L2 KVN and had his suspension letter ready. 
L2 KVN approached the patron and asked if they could talk. He said yes. KVN showed him the suspension letter and let him know that due to his actions on Saturday 9/28, he was suspended from the library (which he had already been notified of verbally on Saturday, 9/28). KVN started to explain the appeals process when he loudly interrupted and demanded "what actions?" KVN gave him a brief overview of the behavior that led to his suspension.
He then said "That wasn't me." KVN did not attempt to argue, simply pointed out how to appeal his suspension. He repeatedly said "That wasn't me" and started yelling louder while spitting (involuntarily) on KVN. KVN let him know that she was present for the 9/28 incident and that she witnessed his behavior. 
He continued yelling "you've got the wrong person." 
KVN told him he needed to leave property while he yelled loudly.
KVN then asked him if he wanted his suspension letter so he could see the appeal instructions. He took the letter and shouted "fuck you" while he walked to the public phone. He attempted to make a phone call and threw his letter on the ground. Guard J picked it up and handed it to KVN.
He then walked to get his items. When he came back to the front he purposely stood as close as possible to KVN and stared into her face without saying anything. He repeated that it was not him so KVN offered his suspension letter again. He ripped it out of her hands.
He then walked out to the front of the library yelling "Go to hell." 
The patron attempted to re-enter a few minutes later to provide library staff with his suspension letter in which he wrote "Go to Hell" and signed his name.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms    2.10 Creating tripping hazards, blocking aisles, exits, entrances    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description: Approx. 4:30pm, Library Technical Assistant DH reported to in-charge Librarian II AD that a patron had complained that a woman had been in the ADA stall of the women's restroom "all day". LII AD went to investigate and found a woman in the ADA stall with her belongings spread everywhere. LII AD asked if everything was okay and the woman responded that she was just attempting to clean her wounds and change clothes. LII AD informed her that it was not appropriate to use the library as a place to bathe and gave her 5 minutes to leave. After 10 minutes, she had still not left, so LII AD returned and reiterated the above. She said she was almost done. LII AD went and sat on a bench outside the restrooms to monitor. After a further 5 minutes, the woman had still not left, so LII AD consulted with Librarian III AL and they returned together to the restroom, planning to offer to call for medical care if the woman could not leave on her own. They found the restroom empty, but with a large quantity of bloody paper towels overflowing the trash can. This was reported to facilities (FAC12054).

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Staff found evidence of drug use in the ADA bathroom - discarded psilocybin mushrooms.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.11 Belongings: Bringing in or storing
Description: A customer wheeled his bike inside the library. HR stopped him before he got past the lobby and let him know that bikes were not allowed inside. He requested a voter registration form and waited inside with his bike while HR retrieved it. About 10 minutes later, the customer called and wanted to know where it is written that bikes are not allowed inside libraries; he believed library staff were just making up rules. HR referred him to the Code of Conduct and let him know that this policy had been approved by the Board of Supervisors. The customer called back again a few minutes later, having read the Code of Conduct, and was combative with staff, as nowhere does the Code mention the word "bicycle." HR pointed out the section about not bringing inside items that are larger than 55 inches and he wanted to know how HR knew the size of his bicycle. He then delivered a lecture on how we need to be more friendly to people who are supporting climate change and said that HR might be smart, but she wasn't smart about bikes. HR said, "Thank you for your feedback," and hung up.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.4 Sleeping~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.1 Manipulating or bypassing library rules, such as computer use    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description:
L1 KH entered the meeting room to set up for English class. As she began to move tables, she noticed that there were feet sticking out from under a table in the northwest corner of the room. Looking behind the tables, KH discovered a woman asleep, tucked up into the northwest corner of the room. The woman had shifted our 3 rolling stacks of chairs and 4 card tables out of the corner in order to create a small, semi-concealed space to lay down in. She further concealed herself by dragging one of our 6 foot tables up to meet the card tables, covering the part of her legs and feet that stuck out from the space in the corner. KH woke the woman up, confirmed that she was ok, and asked what she was doing back in the corner. The woman stated "they told me I could be in here." KH informed her that using the meeting room as a place to sleep and concealing herself behind the furniture were not permitted, and asked the woman to leave the meeting room.
Camera footage reveals that the woman hung out in the hallway while janitorial staff was cleaning the restrooms and emptying the meeting room trash during the 1pm hour. At 1:30pm, the woman poked her head into the meeting room and retreated when janitorial staff returned to the room. At 1:45pm, the woman slipped into the room while janitorial staff had left the hallway. Janitorial staff returned within the next minute, and closed the meeting room door. The woman remained in the room for three and a half hours until discovered by KH at 5:10pm. She changed her clothes at some point during her time in the meeting room, as she was wearing a different outfit when she entered the room than she was when KH encountered her. The woman will be suspended for 1 month for concealing her presence in the room and sleeping.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling~Children in the Library    4.2 Leaving child unsupervised or ignoring disruptive behavior of child
Description: At approximately 11:30am patron was on their phone sitting at Children's PC #2 with young child. Child started to cry and parent made attempt to quiet child down with coloring pages. Child quieted down briefly but started crying again. Once child started crying again, a patron went to the front desk and said "She's being very loud and disruptive, can someone do something about this." LA BA said "Yes we can." IC LHN went over to the child and parent introducing herself and asked if there was anything wrong and why the child may have been crying. The parent responded "She's a two year old, there's nothing wrong." LHN then looked at the child and asked again, Hi, what's wrong?" the child stopped crying but did not respond. LHN asked the child if she wanted a coloring page after noticing there were two that had some coloring on it, then asking the parent if that would be ok. The parent said "yes." LHN went to the front desk, grabbed the coloring book and crayons and showed the child the coloring book. Child hid away under table, coming back out after LHN placed one coloring page and crayons on the table. LHN went to desk and was approached about a schedule change. Changes were made and LHN went to staff area to retrieve new printed schedules. When in the back LHN could hear child crying again. A few minutes later, child was crying again and parent was on their phone inattentive to child crying. When seeing LHN approach again, parent told child to "Stop fake crying." LHN said hello, I'm really sorry but if you

Infraction Categories: Medical 911~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Medical 911~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description:
At approximately 1:30PM, LA NG returned from lunch and parked in the SW corner of the parking lot to finish his lunch in his vehicle. As he was doing so, he noticed two people on the phone simultaneously, near the bushes just South of the library sign. Because this is a common place for patrons to make phone calls or smoke, he thought nothing of it.
About 7 minutes later, at 1:37PM, a firetruck and ambulance entered the library parking lot and responded to an emergency call, presumably from the two aforementioned individuals. LA NG identified one of the callers as a St. Joseph's Hospital/Carondelet Medical Center security guard in a black uniform, along with an unidentified woman. There was a presumably unconscious individual lying face down beneath one of the bushes South of the library sign. Paramedics/firemen turned him over and moved him by his arms and legs to the paved drainage channel by an open parking space nearby. 
At this point LA NG entered the building and brought the situation to the attention of LII KVN. LII KVN and LA NG exited the building and monitored the situation from the front entranceway. Paramedics appeared to be applying some kind of paste/lotion and attaching a defibrillator or similar medical device to the bare chest of the unconscious individual. While LIII KVN and LA NG were observing the emergency response, the two noticed and acknowledged that suspended patron Sean #2 entered the library.
LII KVN and LA NG approached the paramedics/firemen and asked them if it would be an appropriate time to ask a problematic patron to leave due to the potential for interference with the apparent medical intervention. The paramedics expressed confusion and directed LII KVN to contact TPD if she had any need of assistance with the patron. LII KVN reiterated that they did not need any help with asking the patron to leave, and that she simply wanted to avoid any sort of interference in the ongoing emergency response. The paramedics stated that the situation was under control and reiterated that TPD would need to be called if any sort of altercation began within the library.
LII KVN and LA NG returned to the library, where LII KVN proceeded with asking Sean #2 to leave the library (See incident #0000023849). LA NG returned to the staff area in order to punch-in from his lunch hour, and continued to monitor the emergency response from the front porch after Sean #2 had left library property. Paramedics had been joined at this point by a younger individual, who seemed connected in some way to the unconscious individual as well as the woman who had been on the phone. Paramedics placed the unconscious individual, sitting-up, onto a gurney, and continued to examine his condition while shining a flashlight in both of his eyes. LA NG did not observe the individual to have regained consciousness at any point during the emergency response, and he was loaded into the ambulance and driven immediately to the nearby St. Joseph's hospital emergency room. 
At no point in this emergency medical intervention were WIL staff notified or informed of the presence of the unconscious individual, whether by St. Joseph's Hospital security, emergency responders, or the connected individuals. The only interaction between WIL staff and the situation was LII KVN and LA NG approaching the situation.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description:
Sean #2 entered WIL library and was noticed by L2 KVN and Guard B right away.
KVN approached Sean #2 at his PC and asked if they could talk up front. He said yes.
He then asked Guard B "How's the human trafficking going?" Neither Guard B nor KVN reacted or responded. Sean #2 made a few more comments about Guard B running a human trafficking ring. 
Sean #2 then asked where the patron who was "trafficking prisoners" who usually sits in the corner went. Neither Guard B nor KVN responded.
As Sean #2 exited the PC area he called Guard B and KVN "fucking n*ggers."
As Sean #2 walked past the desk, he asked LA RG "What happened to your face? Did if fall off? You fucking bitch." 
As Sean #2 exited the building he told KVN "I want you dead, you fucking bitch." 
Sean #2s suspension will be extended to 1 year from today.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: A minor patron, Nastassia Torres, was warned for disruptive behavior during the day without any other problems. Around 3:01 p.m. L1 SG heard yelling in the teen area and addressed the situation. On her way saw Nastassia yelling at her tablet "Fuck." SG asked her to leave but Nastassia ignored directions and remained seated. SG asked again with a calm tone to please, leave since offensive language is inappropriate in the library, and the request was completely ignored. After 15 minutes of waiting for NT to comply, SG told her that if she needed to call for assistance she will be suspended for three days, but she still didn't want to comply. Off-duty officer Russell came to assist SG and the minor left with her siblings. Patron is suspended for three days.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description:
A patron was released from St. Joe's without clothes (wearing hospital gown) and no shoes (only hospital socks). He reported St. Joe's lost his phone, wallet, and all his belongings. He had difficulty walking and asked for help using the public phone to call his brother. L2 KVN assisted him but his brother did not answer in 3 calls. 
Staff attempted to obtain shoes for the patron so he could take a bus, and provided him food while he waited. 
He met another patron experiencing hardship and he offered her refuge at his house. She called an Uber for the both of them to get to his house. They left together.
This is for documentation of St. Joseph's hospital.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description:
LIC LII JM was on the 3rd floor of the library and overheard Vet Sec Guard L tell patron Thomas Wegner that the floor was closed. Before he had a chance to continue telling him about the recent 3rd floor changes (no seating, just browsing area with a few tables, and 3rd floor desk not staffed) Thomas became visibly upset and immediately began asking loudly for "Amber.". LIC LII JM immediately headed over to try and explain to the patron and both she and the guard to attempted to calm the patron down. Thomas Wegner asked LIC LII JM "is Amber here?" and "Are you Amber?" referring to the director of the library. LIC LII JM told Thomas that she was not sure if Amber was in the building right now, but that she (JM) could speak with him about the issue he was having with new 3rd floor changes. LIC LII JM tried to explain to the patron that the Main Library doesn't have enough staff to have someone at the reference desk on 3rd and so the seating had been removed but that he was welcome to browse the collection of books on 3rd. Thomas stated "you're short staffed? I think you have too much staff" and he continued to say loudly that every time he's in the library down on the 1st floor, the circulation staff behind the desk isn't doing anything and that he can never check out the magazines he wants to because the stickers need to be changed, and he called the circulation staff "useless". The patron said that he thinks that we actually need less staff at the library. He stated that staff on the 1st floor shouldn't just be standing behind the desk "doing nothing," but that instead staff should be going out doing other work on the floor. LII IC JM waited for the patron to finish speaking for a moment and then she explained to him that if he ever see's staff standing behind the desk and it doesn't appear that they are doing anything, they are simply waiting for patrons to come up and ask for assistance. She also tried to explain that staff need a break from time to time because it gets very busy at the 1st floor desk and they are constantly being called back to the desk when they try to do other things. She reiterated that they are often very busy with too little staff. The patron just kept repeating "this is ridiculous," and he began to walk towards the elevator to go downstairs. A woman with a child in a stroller came up the stairs to 3rd floor and Thomas then began speaking loudly in their direction about how staff is being ridiculous, and "can you believe, they're not even allowing patrons to look for a book." LIC LII JM approached the patron with the stroller who was trying to walk past Thomas and asked if there was anything she could help them to find and explain that this is now just a browsing area, no seats or staff at desk and Patron Thomas Wegner said "Oh, well why is SHE able to get a book?" The Patron then said that he just wanted to get a book, at which point LIC LII JM and LII PP who was also on the 3rd floor at that time told Thomas again that "you are welcome to browse!" The patron seemed to start to understand, and he went back into the 3rd floor to browse the collection. There were no further incidents reported during the day with this patron and he left the library after checking out at the 1st floor desk. 
For documentation purposes.

Infraction Categories: Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Green - Low Impact
Description: Patron asked L1 KSB if I worked at the library and she replied in the affirmative. She then asked if KSB was aware that the women's bathroom was without soap and she said yes. KSB said that the library had hand sanitizer at the front desk and the patron angrily said that hand sanitizer was not adequate. The patron asked why the library would let it run out and not put more in. KSB told her that the library had switched vendors and had not been provided soap. Patron asked why staff had not gone to the Dollar Store to buy soap for the patrons and KSB told her that staff had been advised not to. Patron said something along the lines of "that's a terrible excuse, totally ridiculous" and "I want to speak to who's in charge." KSB started to walk toward the desk as she said, "okay, let me see who's in charge right now" and the patron said, "no, who's in charge of the whole library" and KSB "okay" and told her she would find that information for her. KSB found a Woods Library business card and wrote Amber Mathewson's name and the 520-594-5600 admin reception number on it. During the entire interaction the customer displayed irritated body language (stomping around), hateful language, and disparaged the library for having money for programs but not for soap.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: L1 RL an security guard Anthony notified L2 MC that a patron was in the library with a Pitbull that was not on a leash.  L2, MC stated she would assess the situation.  When MC went to locate the patron she was in the restroom.  MC and Anthony waited for approximately 10 minutes.  MC knocked on the door and the response was a hostile "what".  MC stated she was just checking on her. The water continued to run and MC knocked again and stated that she was entering. Patron was shaving her hair and washing it, letting hair flow down the drain while the dog laid on the floor.  MC stated she could not do that in the library restroom and that she needed to stop and leave the library.  Patron stated that she was leaving, although she continued to cut and wash hair.  MC stood there waiting for her to leave.  Patron then became agitated and stated don't take pictures of me.  MC stated that there were no pictures being taken.  At this point Anthony left to obtain police back up.  The officer then stepped into the rest room and asked her to leave, told her she couldn't be using the restroom to cut her hair, or do drugs.  Patron stated she wasn't doing drugs, and the officer stated that he could see her paraphernalia sticking out of her pocket.  She then started to leave without her dog and the officer asked if that was her dog, and why it didn't have a leash.  She then started talking rudely and cussing at the officer.  The officer made sure that she left the property.

Security Guard Ben and IC Librarian spoke with teens about their behavior and they indicated they would be more respectful. The patron who reported the behavior was frustrated we did not take more action.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language

The teens quite possibly caused the man to become agitated, but staff only saw the man being so upset that he could not really communicate apart from loud profanity. Patron asked to leave for the day.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.7 Not wearing shoes or shirt~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Description: Unknown patron came in without shoes. Guard Jen spoke with patron about needing shoes and patron reacted in a threatening manner. Patron was asked to leave for the day and responded with semi-audible profanity-laden threats.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
An elderly female patron approached L BL at the desk because a man was threatening, cussing, and yelling in the PC area. BL grabbed L2 KVN and L3 KK.
KVN and KK listened to the female patron. She reported using a PC next to where a man was helping his young daughter on the PC and they were being loud. She said the man was using foul language so she asked him politely to keep his voice down. He cussed at her and said he doesn't have to keep his voice down. He made a few more rude statements and scared her with his behavior. The woman was whispering while telling KVN and KK about the interaction and had tears in her eyes. 
KVN and KK grabbed Guard J and approached the man. 
KK asked the male patron, now identified as Adam Taylor, if they could speak. He said "yeah, but I have my kid." She was already in the process of logging off and started to follow as they stepped to the front of the PC area.
KK asked if he had told a patron to "shut the fuck up" and called her a "bitch."
He said "yeah, I did. Where does it say I have to be nice to people?"
KK said "We do have a code of conduct which basically says you have to be nice to others."
KK asked Mr. Taylor about raising his voice and Mr. Taylor responded by saying he "did not yell" and demonstrated the (condescending) tone he had been using. He argued that the female patron did not have a right to talk to him in the library. Mr. Taylor was on edge during the conversation, stood inappropriately close to KK, and behaved intensely during the conversation.
KK asked him to leave for the day. He complied.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description: LTA NG contacted IC L1 WW about a patron who had been rude to her and called her a "bitch" when she was at the second floor desk while she was attempting to assist him with some reading glasses.  Soon after, Circ Desk staff (L1 MG) also notified WW on the IC phone that the patron was now at the Circ Desk, looking to speak with a manager about the incident.  WW went to the 1st floor desk and spoke with patron who accused NG of racially profiling him and insisted that NG had been incredibly rude to him while he had done nothing wrong.  When WW told him that NG had accused him of calling her a "b", and asked HIM what had happened, he went back upstairs while WW contacted L3 LF to help deal with the situation.  Guard Ben and NG reported that when patron then returned to 2nd floor desk, he began yelling at and berating NG telling her he had never called her a "b", etc... etc...  NG left the desk soon after as LF then arrived at 2nd floor desk.  LF then spoke with the patron about the incident.  WW arrived soon after to hear part of the conversation.  Patron again denied being rude and denied calling NG any names.  He also again brought up the idea that he was being racially profiled and that it was NG who had been rude to him.  Patron went back downstairs and asked L1 MG for contact information for Library Administration, which MG gave him and he then left.  LF, WW, and NG then met soon after to discuss the situation.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: bed bugs
Description: Evidence of bed bugs found in items checked out to patron SLS; remediation procedures followed. This circumstance was just under the threshold for contacting the patron, but all currently checked out items are now on hold for the Bug Reserve card.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed
Description: A thin male patron was in the library a brief time and as he exited, he stopped at the service desk to declare that was upset immigrants may vote. He said that if he saw any immigrants at the voting site, they will get shot (presumably by him). He said this quickly and left, so staff could make no response or get his name, etc. He was not a regular known to the branch. Camera access was not immediately possible, so we were delayed trying to get a picture. Only four men are in the library that morning around 9:30am and only one is thin, unknown, and seems to be wearing landscaper or outside work apparel. I am not attaching the picture however as we are not certain 100% it was him. The man in question is older (60+) and has a white stubble goatee, was wearing a solid/no logo light blue baseball camp and a bright yellow/neon no logo top and fingerless gloves.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description: The faucet was left on in the family restroom which flooded the floor. This is the second time this has happened in a month but there is no camera coverage in the area. A facilities request was submitted.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description:
At 12:45 LA BA was helping a patron print from her email. Due to the odd nature of the print job BA released the prints before charging the patron to ensure quality. Printer 1 was in use by another patron so BA sent the print job to printer 2 which looked unoccupied at the time. BA and the patron walk over to the printer to receive the print job when regular Margaret walks up to the printer. BA tries to grab the print job he sent before Margaret can print hers so there is no confusion about whose print jobs were whose. Margaret had yet to pay for the print job when she saw the paper's printing and became very upset at BA for "Taking her prints". BA explained that these papers actually belonged to another patron and that Margaret still needed to pay for her print job before they would be released. this agitated Margret as she insisted they were hers. BA then explained again how these belong to another patron. this is when Marget starts to yell at BA for being rude to her. BA shows Margaret the print jobs are not hers and walks away with the patron he was helping earlier. At this point, Margaret walks up to the police officer on duty to report BA and demands he does something. Officer M walks up to BA, VV, and MD at the desk to ask about the situation. Officer M also witnessed the interaction and confirmed that none of BA's actions could be considered rude or warrant the reaction Margaret displayed. Officer M walks back to Margaret to attempt to de-escalate her without triggering her more as she has a history of assuming staff are targeting her personally. Margaret decided to finish her work and leave. 
BA is now helping another patron at Printer #1 when Margaret walks up to the printer station. The patron BA is helping and has some of his papers on the table next to the printer with some on top of the staple remover. Margaret then tried to move the papers that belonged to the other patron when the patron said "Those are my papers" Margaret was then upset and told them to hurry as "people are allowed to sit at the desk" Margaret then walked up to the desk demanding a stapler and a staple remover. VV explained there was a staple remover at the table next to the printer. Marget then accused BA of not letting her use the staple remover and she would like another one. VV explained that due to the size of the staple remover, they tend to go missing thus why there is one tied to the table that she is more than welcome to use and that BA was only using the printer, not the table. insistent that BA is not allowing her to use the table at all and demands a staple remover. VV gives her a spare one and she walks off with both the stapler and remover.
When done with her work she returns to the desk and slams the stapler and remover in front of MD and demands BA's business card so that she can complain to his boss. BA tries to give her the Branch manager's card but she is then angry and reiterates that she wants his so she could have his name. BA explains that he does not have a business card since he is part-time, and writes down his name and gives it along with the Branch manager's card. 
She then walks off to Security Guard MG to complain about the situation again before leaving the building stating she is "never coming back to this library again"

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.12 Belongings: Leaving unattended, may be removed without notice
Description: On Thursday 10/10 @ 8:35am staff reported to Branch Manager SH that a suspicious bag was outside the front doors of the library. SH called Marana police and officers responded within 10 minutes, cleared the bag and said it could be removed. This incident is for information purposes only.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description: LTA VN informed LIC KW that she witnessed people doing drugs outside in the bushes on the East side of the building.  LIC KW and Guard CS walked around the building and found 3 people partaking of drugs and hanging out in the bushes.  KW informed them that this was not acceptable behavior on library property and they immediately left.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description: LIC KW went outside to pick up garbage from the East side bushes and found a man passed out with drug paraphernalia in his lap.  She woke him up and told him that he needed to leave the property. He complied immediately after waking up.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description: A regular patron called on the phone to complain that a stranger had placed his hands on her shoulders while she was in the library using the printer earlier. L3 AG spoke with her, apologized about the experience she'd had, and thanked her for bringing it to our attention. AG also let her know that while it was understandable that she hadn't alerted staff in the moment, that in the future it would be better if she could tell staff right away so we can address the behavior in the moment. The patron was able to give a description of the man, and said that our guard had witnessed it. After hanging up, AG checked with guard AB, who was able to confirm what had happened and that he knew what both patrons looked like, but that both had already left the building. Shortly after, AB found AG and let her know the man had returned. As he was leaving, AG asked if she could speak with him and introduced herself. On prompting, he remembered touching the other patron's shoulder to remind her not to forget her papers, and that this was after she had asked him for help using the printer. AG told him that she understood if he meant no harm, but that it would be best in the future for him not to touch anyone he doesn't know. This is for tracking purposes, in case this were to become a pattern of behavior.

Description: On October 12th Lib I VG informed LTA Sup SG via email that there were two books that had suspected bug activity in them. SG had already called and put in a facilities request to have items in the box inspected. Inspection came and confirmed bug activity in the two books put in the box. Patron was identified in Sierra as CS.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property    1.1.5 Indecent exposure, public indecency, lewd, other sexual offense    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
L3 KK and LTAs MG and YM noticed a male patron peeing on the front of the building in full view of everyone in the south parking lot area. KK approached with Guard BJ to let the patron, Anthony Potter, know about rules against peeing on the building and ask him to leave the library for the day. KK said "If you leave now, we'll just make you leave for the day. But if you stay, you will be suspended for a longer period."
Mr. Potter argued with KK and Guard BJ. The patron claimed, "peeing on the building is a reasonable accommodation because the restrooms were in use." A customer observing the situation reported that they have seen Mr. Potter urinating on the building after hour. 
He refused to comply and eventually followed the guard into the library and continued to argue to get his items. L2 KVN overheard him arguing about "his right to a disabled toilet" and saying that he "had tried calling admin and no one answered." He repeatedly stated he was not leaving until he could speak with "a supervisor." 
Guard BJ walked him back outside after he raised his voice inside the library for over 5 minutes. He followed BJ demanding a supervisor and was loud and disruptive in the library. 
KVN walked outside asking for BJ's assistance inside. The male patron told her he was "not leaving property until someone came to fix this." She just said "Okay, you can wait outside." 
The male patron came back inside because he forgot his phone and, as he was walking out the door again, told BJ and KVN he wanted to speak to "both their supervisors" and again reiterated he would not leave property.
L3 KK returned and said since he refused to comply with their request and continued to trespass into the building, TPD needed to be called. KVN called 911 at 2:30pm. 
Mr. Potter called at 2:53pm and again at 2:55pm to argue with staff. In the first, he spoke an unknown language. In the second, he claimed to be his own father and a senator. L2 KVN informed him she could not talk about the details of any patron situations with the parent of any adult patron. He then started arguing with KVN as himself and asked if he would get in trouble if he "spoke Yaqui." KVN listened to him repeat the same arguments he made to staff previously, and then hung-up when he began speaking made up Yaqui. 
911 call cancelled at 3:23 when Mr. Potter finally left property.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
Page RH informed L2 KVN at the service desk that a small dog was wandering around the PC area without a leash. When KVN went to investigate, there was a small dog wandering around patrons and sniffing the floor, not in control of it's owner. A female patron standing at copier 2 quickly called the dog over. 
The dog then started approaching KVN, so KVN said "Hi, baby" and bent down slightly. The dog immediately showed it's teeth and started growling.
KVN informed the patron that because the dog is not following the "code of conduct" expected of service dogs, the dog needed to leave.
The woman asked "what do you mean, she's a service dog."
KVN did not argue, but said "The dog was seen wandering around the PC area and just growled at me, and service dogs are required to be in the owner's control and to not show sign's of aggression in the libraries" so KVN once again asked the dog to leave.
The woman argued that KVN was not allowed to ask her to leave because it was a service dog, but KVN repeated the rules and the request.
The patron picked up her dog. KVN helped the woman finish printing and waited over 3 minutes for the woman to collect her items. The woman sat back down at the PC, pulled a drink out of her bag, and began browsing her email.
KVN walked over to the PC and said "I have asked you to leave, so I need you to start packing up."
The patron began accusing KVN of "harassment" and raised her voice claiming she "was packing up her stuff" and she just needed to "give her a minute." She repeatedly told KVN to "back off." 
KVN said "okay" and backed away to the center table for the computer monitor. 
The patron because cussing out loud and "harassment" and swore about KVN.
KVN was also monitoring the other incident happening in the middle of the PC area. L1 LB grabbed KVN because L3 KK was on the phone about the other incident. KVN asked LB to monitor the patron with the dog. 
Over 5 minutes later the patron was finally collecting her stuff and putting her dog in a bag. The patron was not complying with requests to remove her service dog and creating a disruptive environment with her raised voice and vulgar language. 
She walked to the service desk and demanded from LTA KB "the name of the crazy lady right there" and pointed at KVN. KVN told the patron "you have been asked multiple times to leave, you need to leave now." 
The woman demanded KVN's name and position so she could "call City Council," which KVN provided. KVN attempted to provide information for administration, but the patron insisted City Council would handle the situation. 
The woman left and a few minutes later returned without her dog, claiming "only [her] dog was suspended. L3 KK went to handle the situation.
The patron told L3 KK that KVN had "stood over her" and been "harassing" her. She claimed the library did not have the right to remove a service dog and that no one should approach a service dog. KK told the patron that in a public space anyone could approach a service dog, and a dog that growls and shows it's teeth is a safety concern. 
The patron took KK's name for "City Council" as well. KK only asked the patron to leave for the day for failing to comply and creating a disruptive environment.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Leaving service animal unattended
Description:
L3 KK was on desk when she noticed regular patron Phil leave the restroom without Blue, his service husky, with him. Blue has gotten into physical altercations with other dogs in the past. 
KK approached and asked why Phil didn't take Blue with him. Phil just said he "forgot." 
KK let him know there have been multiple conversations about this and Phil interrupted understandingly and said he was "packing up his stuff right now."
Phil was failing to comply after being asked to leave so as he was leaving KK notified him of his 1-week suspension.

Infractions: Children in the Library    Children in the Library: Other not listed: Minors on library property after closing
Description: While making closing announcements at 4:45, Lib II SW noticed two unattended minors. SW asked if they had a ride home and they said they did. They left the building a few minutes before closing. After closing and as staff were leaving, SW noticed the boys in the parking lot. SW asked when their ride would arrive. The 11 year old said "30 minutes." The 12 year old called their mother who said she was 3 minutes away. SW told the boys that we are supposed to call 911 for police in this case, but that she wouldn't do that today since their Mom was so close. SW told them in the future, their ride needs to be here by closing. As SW waited in her car, the boys walked away. SW did not see the boys after they walked off, and was not able to speak to the mother.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description: At 2:57 pm LTAS EB was notified that two customers were in a verbal altercation. When EB arrived patrons appeared to be ready to fight so EB asked both patrons to leave for the day. Both patrons left immediately.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: Chance was hiding in the Children's room with his group of friends.  He had his hoodie pulled over his head and face trying to be incognito.  When LIC KW approached to remind his suspension he pretended he was someone else and tried to get out of leaving.  KW told him his suspension would get longer if he didn't leave immediately.  On his way out he made a loud protest sound as he walked out the front doors.  His 6 mos suspension ending 02/09/25 is extended until 02/23/25.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description: At 4PM a teacher conducting a class visit approached the desk and asked for security. Two of her students claimed another youth offered them drugs and then pushed them when they declined. All three of the youth can be seen running down the stairs at 3:52, the accused runs out the front door and the two students ran to their teacher in the children's area. The incident occurred in the stairwell where cameras do not reach.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description:
Around 10:25, LA NM overheard a patron cursing in the general direction of another patron in the public computer area. The patron who was cursing walked by the service desk and appeared to be leaving, so staff did not intervene.
About ten minutes later, at 10:35, NM and LTA EO heard the patron again and saw that they were now cursing at another regular patron near the food table, calling her a “bitch” and other offensive terms. At this point, NM approached the patron, informed them that we do not talk to one another that way in the library, and asked them to step outside. The patron began cursing at NM but exited the branch. The patron then hovered near the front doors for a few moments. 
EO called in-charge librarian RL, and RL and LC joined NM outside. RL and LC approached the patron and informed them that they were not to return to the branch for the rest of the day. The patron remained near the premises, circling back a few times, but not re-entering. Patron also yelled "bitch" and other offensive terms at RL and LC. RL told patron that police would be called if they didn't leave the premises. Patron shouted more offensive language and eventually left premises.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.2 Strong odors
Description: CO and VV had a talk (heart 2 heart) with patron in regards to the pungent/pervasive odor that lingers around her when she is utilizing the library. The patrons insist that she washes and that her GYN doctor says that are no issues with pertaining to her. We insist that until she rectify the issue that she will not be able to use the library. She insisted that we were bullying, but we let the patron know that the message is not from the library but that other users of the library are not happy with the loud odor in the area.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description:
Chance tried to enter the library and was stopped by Guard CS. He attempted to argue with the guard about not being suspended. L1 MNC came over, confirmed the suspension, and directed him to leave.
His suspension is not extended at this time, but will be if he continues to trespass.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: Chance tried to enter the library again today and was stopped at the door by Guard CS. L1 MNC reminded him of his suspension and the consequences for trespassing. As he was leaving library property, he shouted something that included the word "faggot". Two more weeks will be added to his suspension.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others    2.7 Not wearing shoes or shirt
Description: A man without shirt or shoes ran into the library with his pants falling down. He was pursued by a second individual who claimed that the man tried to steal his bike. Guard CS was able to separate the two and directed them to leave. The second man immediately complied and left. The first man remained longer and attempted to argue with CS. CS again told him to leave because he was being disruptive and quickly approaching indecent exposure with children present. He then left before L1 MNC could address the situation.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.1 Manipulating or bypassing library rules, such as computer use
Description:
Mr. Burkhart asked to borrow the IBD Weekly, which is kept behind the service desk due to past theft. After reading for a while, he moved across the library and appeared to be browsing the DVDs. LTA MKB observed Mr. Burkhart fold up the newspaper and hold it parallel under his arm, close to his side. He then walked out the front door. As he was passing through the doorway, LTA MKB called out to him from the desk, asking him to please return the newspaper before leaving. He placed the IBD Weekly on the table near the front door and left the library.
 
For documentation purposes, as HIM staff have noticed a pattern of bypassing library rules with this patron.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.3 Food or beverage: unclean, disruptive, or damaging
Description:
For Documentation Purposes:
Patron presenting female came up to the front desk at ~11:58am, asking to have a burrito heated up, the following conversation happened:
LHN misheard: "Sure I can open it for you."
Patron: "No, I need a microwave to heat it up."
LHN: "Sorry I misheard you, we can not heat up food in a microwave."
Patron: You don't have a microwave so I can heat this up?
LHN: "Not for public use.
Patron: "Well can I have a snack pack, I'm diabetic."
LHN "Snack packs are really for kids only, I-".
Patron: "Well the other lady did it for me, you're just rude.
Patron proceeded to walk away while talking about how rude LHN was to another patron in study room a. LHN then went to go ask if it would be ok to make an exception for the patron since they're diabetic, but before LHN went to staff area, LII VV came out for Desk at 12:00pm. LHN asked VV who said, "Yeah that should be fine." Patron presenting male came up to front desk asking if someone could heat up the burrito and VV respond. "No but we can get you a snack pack." Patron walked away to go give snack pack to the patron that initially had come up to the desk.
At closing, a regular patron indicated to the guard that he could not get up from his chair and needed medical attention. EMTs were called and transported the patron to the hospital at 6:30.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description:
A man under the influence approached the desk and began to swear at and berate LTA DM unprovoked. He tried to order him to "do his job" and then "to go home" because he's "not doing his job". L1 MNC intervened and asked him to leave for the day. He continued his abusive language and orders as MNC escorted him out.
Upon review of the cameras, the man used the family restroom beforehand, but no definitive proof of drug use was detected. The man was recognized by Guard CS from previous incidents in past including restroom misuse.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: at approximately 11:30 LIC LD has handling a theft dispute with 2 patrons, patron 1 stated that patron 2 sitting in PC #18 stole his earphones. Patron 1 also mentioned that patron 2 was a "schizophrenic woman", LIC LD asked patron 1 to refrain from using that term. after verifying that patron 2 did not have patron's 1 earphones, Patron 1 wanted LIC LD to look at the camera's footage. LIC LD told patron he will need to make a police report. patron was asking questions about PACC, and partnerships with the library. after LIC LD asked patron if there was anything else she could help with, Patron answer by "you must be a 3rd world + n word", LIC LD asked patron to leave the library. Patron attempted to leave the library but kept coming back with other insulting words. LIC LD and LTAS KW asked repetitive times to exit the library. Patron eventually left the library. Patron previously suspended from another branch. Suspension updated to 1 year.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Red - High Impact (Please click Notifications > Email aliases > Copy Trauma Informed Care Team if your location would like to request group EAP support)
Description:
At around 5:45, a man entered the library and asked desk staff for a guest pass. He was very twitchy, flailing his arms, and appeared to be under the influence. (A review of the cameras shows him displaying a range of manic behavior including running in circles, bouncing against the two walls at the west doors, and slumping to the ground prior to getting up and entering.) Once at the PC, he alternated between loudly crying, waving his arms around, muttering to himself, and drooping over. Moments later, he began to hit himself in the head and make exclamations about things being "evil". L1 MNC and Guard CS intervened to check on his welfare. The man became semi-lucid but also hostile. At this point, L1 MNC asked him to leave for the day.
The man quickly got up and made motions to leave but then turned around and came within inches of MNC's face, clenching his fists and drawing back one of his arms like he was about to swing. Seeing this, Guard CS swiftly reacted and came between MNC and the man, allowing MNC to back away. 
Guard CS was able to start moving the man towards the door. The man then began shouting that he would make MNC regret this and that he would get the cartel to come and kill him. These types of threats continued until he was outside. MNC and CS closed the doors of building behind him and the man departed northbound on Columbus Blvd.
Due to the high risk of violence, 911 will be called if he returns. He is suspended for 1 year.

Description: Page BW notified staff that two teenaged boys were using offensive language and using the N word.  L1 LB with L3 KK and guard JR for backup approached the boys.  L1 LB told the boys that they had been heard using the N word and using offensive language.  She asked them to leave.  They left without incident.  When the lobby was reached L1 LB informed the teens that they would be suspended for two weeks.  This was not the first time that these teens had been asked to leave over their inappropriate language.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Causing the women's public restroom to close for one hour due to drug use~Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: Drug use in the women's restroom, causing it to be closed for one hour
Description: At approximately 2:05 pm, a female patron informed LIC CM and security guard MG of possible drug use in the women's public restroom. MG knocked on the door, announcing that he was security. CM entered the restroom, where she smelled a sweet, pungent odor. CM found an African American female in a stall. Through the crack of the door, CM could see a straw in the patron's mouth and a foil packet tucked into the strap of her dress. Both CM and MG informed the patron that she needed to come out of the restroom immediately. She stumbled out of the stall, disheveled and mumbling, "I'm just trying to use the bathroom." CM told the patron that she could see the straw and the foil pack, which the patron tried to cover up. The patron left the restroom, followed by CM and MG. She was told that she was in violation of policy 1.1.8 of the code of conduct regarding illegal drug use, and would be suspended for one year, which included all of the libraries. MG informed her that she would need to leave the property. She left the property without incident. This prompted MG to close both ladies and men's bathrooms for one hour. The restrooms were reopened at approximately 3:15 pm.

Description: Teen patron received a warning for leaving egregious snack trash on Monday, October 22nd in the 101 Space. She received a verbal warning about it yesterday when she came in. Staff were informed that they left trash again right after the warning. Upon reviewing camera footage, as staff and security guard were walking away after having issued the warning, teen flipped them off. The group of teens got after school snack and when getting up, most of the teens cleaned up after themselves. However, the teen who flipped off staff picked up a piece of trash, then threw it back on the table, and then pointed to a couple other items that she also left left behind and walked away. Teen will be suspended for two weeks.

Infraction Categories: Medical 911~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Green - Low Impact
Description: Shortly after 12pm while on desk in the 101 Space, I (L2 MED) I approached an older male teen sitting with a female friend who appeared to be experiencing medical distress and inquired about his wellbeing. I asked his name and age and offered emergency medical attention. He agreed and I called 911 to request medical care and described the situation and was told EMS were dispatched. In the meantime, L1 AW and L2 KW notified L3 LD, and on-site TPD Officer Merlin, who arrived at the scene to check on the teen. Shortly thereafter, TFD EMS arrived and checked the teen's vitals and inquired after his wellbeing, determining that he was not in immediate danger. They ultimately offered to either take him to the hospital emergency room for walk-in care, or counseled him to visit an Urgent Care facility of his choosing for further non-emergency medical attention. The teen and his friend left to take the bus to an Urgent Care in their neighborhood.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.2 Disruptive use of personal devices~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.4 Eating at computer
Description:
A female patron was on her phone in the last row of PCs having a loud and vulgar conversation that was disturbing other patrons including an older man who complained and three tweens. L1 MNC had previously spoken to the patron about keeping her volume down. When MNC went to speak with the patron again, he noticed that she was eating several snacks and had trash spread out at the PC. He started to explain about library PC use policy. The patron did not look at MNC and instead put her hand up in a "talk to the hand" gesture and said he needs to stop talking because she's leaving.
Patron was asked to leave for the day. Due to her disregard for other patrons and staff, she will be suspended if the behavior repeats. There have been other similar incidents with this patron in the past.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.5 Indecent exposure, public indecency, lewd, other sexual offense    1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Red - High Impact (Please click Notifications > Email aliases > Copy Trauma Informed Care Team if your location would like to request group EAP support)
Description:
A man entered the library and began yelling at Guard CS that he needed help. When the guard tried to clarify what help he need (medical, crisis, etc.), he became agitated and angry and shouting "I already told you I need help!" L1 MNC was called to assist and he was also unable to get a coherent answer out of the man or deescalate his behavior. However, the man did make comments that seemed to indicate he may have been trespassed from another library. As the man increasingly became hostile towards CS, MNC asked him to exit the branch. 
The man shouted that he would not leave until TPD was called and walked past MNC and CS and sat down in the cafe area. Once there, he alternated between sitting semi-calmly and agitated pacing. MNC called 911 for assistance as the man stated he was not leaving until TPD was called. Around 20 minutes later, he paced into the area next to the staff door and interior book drop with his pants dropping down, partially exposing his penis. The man was in the line of sight of the children near desk and at the chess table. MNC again said that he needed to leave and man again demanded TPD and moved back to the cafe area.
Around 12:30, he exited the building but left his suitcase behind. Branch Manager KW declined to move his belongings outside out of concern that it would escalate his behavior, but did move them nearer to the door. He returned a few minutes later, retrieved his suitcase and returned to the cafe area. At 12:45, he exited the building, moved to the front patio with his belongings, and continued to exhibit manic behavior. 
When TPD arrived at 1:15, he had already left library property. He did leave his belongings behind, including a library chromebook case which was retrieved by staff. (The chromebook was checked out to Dean Paul Zipperer but we cannot be sure that this was the individual in this incident.)
The man is suspended for 1 year and 911 will be called again if he returns.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description: For documentation purposes. Around 1:00pm, Anthony (from incident #0000023809) came to the front desk in distress and shared that some of his belongings been stolen from his person at some point within a couple hour period, likely while he was asleep either outside of the library or asleep inside the library. I offered several solutions, including calling the police to make a report and reaching out to the Homeless Resources Navigator to help with the process of replacing some of the items which were stolen. Anthony initially refused any help was inconsolable--in that moment he seemed to need to vent & be heard. Additional staff who had either seen him sleeping outside or inside tried to help pinpoint at which point him items might have been stolen. Branch Manager LG did a scan of the cameras and was unable to find any evidence of someone stealing his belongings. Anthony left the library in a state of extreme agitation which at times can feel stressful for staff. At about 1:50 Anthony returned and repeated his story of being robbed and that things were unfair, and in doing so got himself worked up. I listened and acknowledged how difficult things had been for him and tried to help bring his distressed energy down, I then offered to help him find some help. He finally agreed and asked me to dial 911 for him so he could report the theft. At 1:54 I called 911 and gave him the phone to report the events to the police. He hung up and was still agitated but left the building. Over the course of the next couple hours Anthony would leave and return, having exchanges with different staff who offered the same level of help, but he was unsatisfied. At he came back in at 3:45 and I helped him track his phone on the computer but there was no activity after 12:00pm. He returned around 4:30 and LG talked with him and again offered to help him. At around 4:40 LG called 911 for Anthony and he spoke to them again.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.1 Manipulating or bypassing library rules, such as computer use
Description:
A customer wearing a blue hoodie sweatshirt informed LTA MKB that he could not retrieve his phone from the charging locker. LTA MKB asked him to provide his phone number so that staff could call it to confirm the phone was his before opening the charging locker. Customer told MKB that he didn't know his phone number. L1 KH came to assist LTA MKB. L1 KH had the man try to retrieve the phone again. He was somewhat incoherent with slurred speech, and repeatedly tried to punch in too many numbers for his code. After a few more tries, he claimed he could not remember the code. L1 KH asked the man to describe his phone. The man described the phone as a plain black phone with "Vortex" on it. L1 KH opened the locker, and confirmed that the phone was black with a Vortex logo on the back of it. The man said, "Yes, that's my phone." He took the phone and left the library. Guard DT informed L1 KH and LTA MKB that the phone did not belong to the man in the blue sweatshirt. Guard DT found the actual owner of the phone and informed him of what had happened. The other customer was able to find the man in the blue sweatshirt and retrieve his phone.
 
Camera footage shows the man in blue walk past the true owner of the phone while the owner was placing the phone in the charging locker. The man in blue pauses briefly near the other end of the table, and then leaves the library. He returns three minutes later to begin pretending to retrieve the phone. The man in blue is suspended for 1 year due to theft.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description:
I was stepping out of a program to remind the kids outside of the room that they needed to be quiet when I saw Jackson Plaga hit his brother and I heard it loudly from even fifteen feet away. At that time I told Jackson that striking his sibling was unacceptable (particularly when a friend sitting with Jackson tried to argue it was his brother so it didn't matter) and I told Jackson that he needed to leave for the day. I walked him to the exit and told him that I would see him tomorrow. Jackson circled around the building immediately to stare through the window at his siblings and again I motioned that he had to leave.
Two of Jackson's friends went to another librarian on desk, John, and told them that Jackson was overheated outside. John did not know the details about the reason for Jackson being asked to leave for the day but didn't want Jackson to suffer from overheating so told called Jackson's mother and discussed how Jackson could come back into the A/C and get a drink to cool down as long as he wasn't hanging out in the children's area again.
Jackson did not listen to this restriction and came back into the children's area where I saw him again. I asked him why he was back in the children's room and he said another librarian let him in. I told him that maybe that was a mistake and motioned for him to come with me to talk to John again about what was going on.
John explained he hadn't know the detail about the suspension for the day but wanted Jackson to have a chance to cool off and asked if there was any way we could work together to accomplish that. I agreed with John that Jackson could stay in the library as long as he stayed in the gray chairs over by the teens.
Jackson did not go to the gray chairs but immediately went outside to the bench again. I followed and reiterated that he is welcome to be inside the A/C on the gray chairs or if he was feeling better he could stay on the bench but that he could not keep coming back in and out of the library after he had been asked to leave for the day. Jackson did not verbally respond to being told this. I said that by not talking I had to assume that he was okay to stay on the bench until he was picked up and that he was welcome back tomorrow.
I returned to my program and after a few minutes I again saw Jackson inside; I believe that his siblings also reported that Jackson had come back inside without permission. I approached Jackson and told him that for continuing to come back into the children's area after being told to leave this was going to have to escalate to being suspended from the library for two weeks. He did not answer me but he told his siblings that he did not care.
I went back to the office to write up the suspension letter and brought it to Sam's attention at the desk that I was going to deliver this suspension letter and to double-check that the escalation wasn't beyond what we have done for other patrons. Sam agreed with the suspension and we took it over to the children's area to deliver to Jackson. Jackson refused to take the letter, refused to directly acknowledge Sam or I and continued to only talk to his siblings who were by the computers who were both asking Jackson to just take the suspension and leave.
After refusing to take the two week suspension and refusing to leave, Sam told me that the refusal to listen to staff and now trespassing in the library after a suspension letter we would increase the suspension to two months and that we would need to call the police to enact the suspension. Jackson said to his siblings that he "did not care".
I returned to the desk to make the adjustments but mentioned that it would take a moment to edit the letter and that Jackson's mother was on route to pick up her children so we may not have time to have police respond to serving the suspension letter so please keep an eye out for Mrs. Plaga.
I went to edit the letter to a two month suspension and at about the same time I finished the edits, Mrs. Plaga did show up and both Sam and I explained the situation. Mrs. Plaga was a bit confused because she had heard from John that Jackson was allowed back in the building but somewhere in communication she did not hear that he had still been asked to leave the children's area and had refused to follow that restriction. Mrs. Plaga accepted the suspension letter on her son's behave and left with her children after we explained when Jackson was allowed to return and where she could direct her concerns if she felt that the suspension was unfair.
