Mother, Porter Witsel comforted child, applied ice, and left the library. There was a bump forming on Eloise's head, and Ira-Jack ran away from the commotion quickly. This is for documentation purposes only.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: 15 minutes before closing, patron passed by front desk exhibiting a cheerful and pleasant demeanor complementing staff on desk LTA Supe LHN and LA MD. When patron walked towards the restrooms MD turned towards LHN and said, "You can tell he has been drinking, when he walks by you can smell it." LHN said, "I didn't notice anything, he walked in a straight line." MD told LHN that the same patron had been in around 2:00pm when on desk earlier and the patron's eyes were not that red before. LHN nodded and went to do the walk around for closing announcements, when passing by the computers, the same patron that passed by the desk was at their computer and LHN could then smell the alcohol when up close. LHN did not speak to patron directly. Patron started to leave. MD signaled guard on duty MG to check on patron on their way out. MG caught up to patron at the door and asked if everything was alright. Patron responded in the affirmative and continued to leave without incident. Documenting for future reference in case patron drinks alcohol on property again. LHN looked at the name on the computer the patron was using to get info for PITS report.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.3 Food or beverage: unclean, disruptive, or damaging    3.5 Failure to clean up after eating/drinking
Description:
Tyliah, her brother Tysaius, and their friend Riley asked L2 KVN for guest passes at the desk. KVN made a few jokes with them because she recognized them but they did not recognize her. 
As they were walking to the children's PCs, Page S overheard Tysiaus say the N-word. Less than 10 minutes later, Page S approached L BL and informed her the 3 of them were being loud and cussing a lot at the PCs, and customers were complaining.
KVN approached and told them and told them she was only giving them one warning and that they needed to keep their volume down and not cuss in the library. Tysiaus and Tyliah argued that they "hadn't done anything" but agreed to follow the rules.
Less than 5 minutes later Page S approached KVN again and said they were being loud and cussing even more. 
KVN grabbed Guard M and told Tyliah, Tysiaus, and Riley that they need to leave for the day and they can try again tomorrow. They scattered hot cheetos all over the children's area by the PCs. All 3 turned off the PCs as they were leaving. 
As they were walking out, they yelled at an elderly woman "Get out of my fucking way."
KVN is extended their suspension to 3 days due to their behavior as they were leaving.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description:
Guard M reported to KVN at 1:50pm that an elderly gentleman with a walker had been sitting outside all day and reported being abandoned by his friend with nowhere to go.
At 2pm KVN went outside to talk to him. He was expressing concerns about symptoms from the heat and requested KVN to call 911 for him.
Gentleman expressed he wanted to be transported to hospital to confirm he was okay. 
KVN called 911, LTA RT grabbed water for him, and KVN waited with him until first responders arrived. 
Patron was transported to hospital.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description:
Several children were playing video games and laughing on computers. An older, adult male patron seated at adult computer station 17 made a comment to staff, stating that the kids were being too noisy and complaining about a whistling sound coming from the children’s area. The patron did not approach the circulation desk with this complaint, but was in earshot. His voice was loud and agitated. The patron then continued to use the computer. The patron was wearing a bright green baseball cap and a greenish-grey shirt. 
Staff did not interact further with the adult patron at this point. L1 EM walked to children’s computers and asked the children to lower their voices and overall noise level. A child volunteered information that they had a small whistle on their keychain and had been making noise with it earlier. EM instructed the child to put the whistle away completely and not to take it out while in the library. 
At 4:04 pm, two minutes after his initial comment, the adult male patron began shouting and using profanity directed at the children in the computer area. He yelled, “Fuck this shit. You punks. Your parents don’t teach you how to act in public, you little shit. Goddamnit!” while making eye contact with the children.
LTA EC addressed the patron briefly, “Sir, no.” EM moved to stand next to the children who were being shouted at to assure their safety and deter the adult patron from approaching or communicating with them further. The adult patron then gathered his belongings while continuing to shout and then left the building. In-charge staff AG and KN were summoned, but the patron was no longer in the building or on the property.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description: NONE

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description:
During opening duties on Monday staff noticed that there was a library laptop power cord on a chair in one of the study rooms.  When they investigated what it went to they found we were missing 1 of our public laptops that got locked out of our computer tower when the key was lost.  The laptop had been stored in our locked safe room with the power cord since we couldn't lock it in the tower.  Since none of the Saturday crew were in on Monday LIBIII KW waited to check in with all of them when they returned to work.  Nobody knew where it was and it was determined that a new Lib I had given the laptop to a patron to use in the study room but was not aware of the locks.  Since it was not found until Monday, we do not know if the person who borrowed it or a random person walking by the study room may have taken it or when exactly it occurred.  The laptop tower once again has a key and all remaining public laptops are securely locked away.
A police report will be filed.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description:
Guard KL reported to manager IR that a woman was using the women's restroom to bathe. IR did a restroom check and noticed a woman's t-shirt and bra on the floor in front of the sink, along with a large puddle of water under the sink. There was a single person in the restroom, a person in the stall. IR let the person know that the restroom facility was not set up for bathing and that they should not do that here. The person walked out of the restroom around 12:17pm with wet hair and wet shoes but did not return to the library.
Additional inspection of the restroom facilities after the unknown woman left revealed that the person who bathed in the restroom had opened up the hand-soap dispenser, which contains liquid soap, removed the lid and along with the use of the space as a bathing area caused excessive liquid to be spilled all around the hand washing area causing a slip hazard. The restroom was placed out of order until the mid-day cleaning could be performed.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description: An customer, name unknown, walked in to the library using slurred speech and with an unstable walk. He sat at the computer for a bit and after Guard SL had to wake the man up three times, LA MN informed Manager LG. After asking for the customer's health and whether he required medical assistance (the offer was denied), LG asked the customer to leave the building for the day and return once he felt more alert.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description: A customer reported a woman who was bathing in the bathroom and said it smelled like she was smoking. I went in and saw that a woman was washing her hair. She said she was sorry and stopped washing her hair as I came in. I told her people can't bathe in library bathrooms and she said she understood. There was a faint smell but I didn't see any signs of the woman smoking inside. It's possible she did before coming inside.

Description: The restrooms are open at 8am with the Elections, but after the library opening we found that all of the toilet paper had been taken from the Men's room.  It was reported in the facilities tracker.

Description: While covering the 101 Space desk L3 LD noticed a teenager walking from the computers towards another teen seating at a corner by the windows. both teens kept looking at the desk with a suspicious look. Teen 1 turned around and teen 2 kept looking towards the desk. soon after L3 LD could see smoke coming out of teen1. Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description: At 9:25 LTAS IC KW was approached by a Patron A who said they were threatened by Patron B near the computer lab. Patron A was very angry and promising to deal with Patron B the outside if library staff did not kick him out. Patron B denied interacting with A at all, and on camera it is hard to find the incident, so LTAS KW separated the two parties and will continue to observe. Documenting this to form pattern of behavior, as LTAS KW believes Patron B was involved in a similar incident during the previous ourspace on 10/24.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.1 Manipulating or bypassing library rules, such as computer use    3.2 Unplugging library equipment
Description: On Wednesday (10/30) around ~11:47a-12p, patron known to unplug our library computers engaged in this behavior again at computer #27. During this particular hour, Desk Staff LAC inquired on Teams if the patron had been adhering to our boundaries/rules set since the last time about unplugging the computers from incident #0000023775. Out of curiosity, LAC went to check #27 since he seemed to begin exiting the library but quickly ran back to the computer station to do something. Upon check-in, LAC noticed that the wires were unplugged and were sitting in the port, which he's been known to do this. He didn't return back to VAL. With direction from Managing Librarian IR, LAC created a new PITS report.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.2 Guns, weapons, machetes, knives~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.12 Belongings: Leaving unattended, may be removed without notice~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Description:
Staff working 1st floor info desk messaged in-charge phone that a patron who had been asking about putting his artwork on display here, had now stated that his artwork was a bomb and referenced terrorism. He had set the object on the DVD shelves. L2 KW contacted on duty Officer Merlin. The officer and KW approached the man, who the officer then handcuffed. The officer took a photo of the object that had been placed, removed the object from the shelf, and escorted the man out to his vehicle. Patron will be suspended for one year.
LIII PP saw Mr. King on the 2nd floor and alerted IC L1 WW on 2/12/25.  WW reminded Mr. King he was suspended and presented him with a copy of his suspension paperwork.  He left without protest.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: A call was received in the back room telling staff that people were fighting outside of the library. A regular group of teen/tweens that comes to the library were being overly rough in their interactions, even though they were friendly altercations they were asked to leave after repeated requests to keep their hands to themselves.  They went outside to the horseshoe bench near the West entrance where they continued to throw things at each other and take things from each other and use foul language.  LIBIII KW and Guard CS went out to talk to the group and request that they tone down their behavior or go elsewhere.  The youth continued to interact and disrupt throughout the conversation until KW told them they had 30 seconds to leave the property or they would be suspended for a week.  Within 30 seconds they scrambled across Columbus BLVD (not obeying safe crossing protocols) and moved on their way.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Page BP reported to LIC KW that youth regulars Chance and Isaiah were shouting and being disruptive near the entrance of the library.  KW went to find out what they were doing at the library on a school day at 8:55am and to ensure that they were not hindering early voting.  She found them sitting at the horseshoe bench, Chance already suspended, using expletives and talking loudly.  They told her that they are suspended from school and KW told them that they needed to go elsewhere and not disrupt people trying to vote.  Chance's suspension will be extended again for trespassing while suspended. Isaiah will be suspended for 1 week due to repetitive days of being asked to leave for disruptive behavior.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: Hate mail
Description:
On October 31, 2024 Himmel received a returned letter, no to address, no postage, with a hand-written Himmel Library return address. Inside was a single sheet of hate speech.Both envelope and message are on the same attachment.
Branch manager and Librarians-in-charge were notified.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.7.4 Bullying per Pima County B.O.S. Policy D 23.1.~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description:
At 3:30pm, a patron called the Main Library from a blocked number and spoke to LTA NG on the phone. He was condescending and rude, speaking very slowly as though NG were stupid, and when NG paused for a moment to look up the answer to his question, he asked if she spoke English. NG told him she did not like the way that he was speaking to her. The patron immediately became combative and told her she was bad at her job and that he was going to report her. NG placed the patron on hold and called L2 CS for backup.
CS took over the call. The patron recounted the whole previous conversation, including the racist comment about speaking English, and demanded to know NG's identity. When CS said that she could not give him NG's information, he demanded to speak with Amber Mathewson immediately. CS offered to give him Amber's phone number, at which point he began telling CS that he wasn't going to wait because he had donated over a quarter of a million dollars to the library and Amber would speak to him when he wanted. He went on a long rant about how he would never donate to the library again, and how he would get 25 of his friends to stop donating as well, because "they're loyal to me, not the library." He also continued to insult NG and CS. When CS attempted to interject, he told her that he had let her talk (he had not) and he expected basic courtesy. Eventually, CS interrupted the customer and said, "Sir, at this point you have been rude and condescending to me and to my staff. I can either give you the Library Director's phone number, or I can end this call." The patron asked for the number, which CS gave. The patron immediately hung up on her.
Documenting due to the overt racism and abusive tone. No action can currently be taken as we do not have this caller's name or phone number.
Patron left a very condescending message on Director Mathewson's phone as well indicating that he and his 100 friends would no longer contribute to the library - as he felt he had been treated poorly and that staff had hung up on him.  He identified himself as Dr. Davies, board certified Medical Doctor and Psychiatrist. He used the words ignorant, mentally unstable and stupid.  He did not leave a phone number.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: Interfering with election activities~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
Around 4:10, a fight broke out between Keysasi, Carlos, and Shyanna outside near the southwest corner of the building. Per Guard CS, Shyanna had instigated the fight. The three of them then began chasing each other from the building into the parking and blocking the cars of patrons who were trying to enter the driveway and park their vehicles. The parking lot was very busy at this time as many people were trying to enter the polling place for early voting before closing and there was already a line of voters extending onto the front patio.Shyanna then took the "75 Foot Limit" sign from its designated place and began to chase the other two through the lot with it and between patrons' cars. (For additional context, we have had electioneers, poll watchers, and other individuals standing right outside the boundary behind or near the signs all week using them to indicate to poll workers and voters that they were not violating election rules and could continue their activities.)Guard CS attempted to break up the fight and stop the chase as Shyanna threatened to hit the two boys with the sign. Another patron tried to intervene as well and was also sworn at and threatened by Shyanna. Guard CS was able to talk Shyanna down and she left the property.L1 MNC went outside to investigate the disturbance. After speaking with CS, he attempted to speak with Keysasi and Carlos about their inappropriate behavior. He informed them that they were suspended for 1 week for their actions and directed them to leave. They initially refused, but then moved onto the sidewalk. They then continued to test boundaries by yelling that they are not on library property, then walking back into the lot or into the driveway and back to the sidewalk. MNC told them that their suspension was now 2 weeks and again directed them to leave at which point they complied.Due to her role as instigator/aggressor in the fight, removing the "75 foot limit" sign placed by election officials to mark the polling place boundary, threatening to use it as a weapon against other youths, and posing a danger to other patrons, Shyanna will be suspended for 1 year.
Pima County Recorder's Office staff will also be filing their own report about the incident for their documentation.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description:
Saturday afternoon, around 4pm a patron reported that his electric bike was stolen due to the lock being cut. The patron had locked his bike to the ramp of the back of the library near the emergency door. The patron though that it would be a safe area to lock his bike, since he was sitting at the large window that allowed him to see the parking lot and the area where he locked his bike.
 
*Video* What the video showed was that a young man rides his bike up N. 1st towards Yavapai and places his bike in the flowerbed area near the corner spot of the green gate, the guy then jumps the green fence and lands at the corner of the bush where you can see that he uses the clippers and cut the chain, he then jumps on the bike and rides out the gate. The friend then comes to take the bike that was hidden in the area where the other guy left it.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description: Saturday November 2nd at 3:14 pm, library patron Margaret Gauna made a comment and eventually complained about a library staffer's style of dress, stating how she personally found it offensive and "not dressing professionally in a government position." Fellow QD library staffer KP and I informed the library patron how the library staffer was in fact in the appropriate style of dress but was still met with unsatisfaction with the responses she was given by staff. The patron grew increasingly agitated with the responses given by staff about the topic around dress code for government employees and asked for the direct phone number in order to speak with the director of the library. Staffer BC gave the patron the Infoline number and KP then asked her to leave for the day and not come visit the library until she has spoken with the branch manager LM. The patron begrudgingly compiled with the request, still berating staff with threats to call the library director and "have a conversation" about the incident. The patron left the building but was told by staff on desk that Ms. Gauna called the number (placing the call from her vehicle) given by staffer BC and asked for the number of the library director. Staffer BC asked another QD staffer MG to give Ms. Gauna the number of one of the library service managers PAC to speak with.

Description: During a morning walkaround Woods property, manager found graffiti on the Woods Memorial monument sign and 2 areas on the green metal fence located under the address of the building off N. 1st Avenue.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description: LIC L3 LAF was on 1st floor having addressed another issue and speaking with staff at 1st floor desk. Customer already in the building walked past the desk from area of the courtesy phone toward the front door cursing and was angry and agitated without provocation, talking in an incoherent manner. As he was exiting and speaking incoherently, LAF said, "Have a good day". The customer began yelling more obscenities and said repeatedly, "Fuck this place! Fuck this!" and yelled more incoherent statements. He then exited the building. Several minutes later, while LAF was still on the 1st floor, LA KV answered a phone call at the desk and requested LAF's assistance, saying it was Crisis. Crisis reported that a person inside the library had been calling 911 repeatedly, who connected him with Crisis, and that he was very angry and agitated, speaking incoherently. LAF determined it was the same customer, who had been calling from the courtesy phone. LAF asked if the customer had made threats of harm to himself or others. Crisis rep said not exactly, but he was extremely angry. LAF said she knew who had called. Crisis asked if the customer was still in the building and LAF replied no. Crisis advised library staff to call 911 if he returned and report what had occurred. Afterward, staff reported that the customer behaves in this way regularly and recently walked past the first floor desk and pushed the entirety of the hi-lo collection into the floor out of anger and walked out. Customer suspended for 90 days.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Election Inspector D asked to speak with L3 KK.  KK came out to the service desk and D told her that there was an inebriated woman in the Voting Center causing a disruption.  D wanted to know if KK thought the behavior merited a 911 call.  KK entered the room, observed a very inebriated woman loudly asking for a new ballot, cursing and disrupting other voters ability to vote including causing a line to form.  KK did not feel comfortable asking the person to leave being unsure of election laws and advised D to call 911.  D said that she had to call the Election Hotline before calling 911 and asked if library staff could make the 911 call.   Guard JR did so.  The mother of the disruptive woman approached the election workers with two small children.  She said she was the grandmother of the children and wanted to talk her inebriated daughter into leaving the Voting Center.  The grandmother verified that she, not her inebriated daughter, would be driving.  Election workers allowed the grandmother in.  Grandmother told the daughter that she was "going to jail" and talked her daughter into leaving and coming back "later."  Once the woman left property, 911 call was cancelled. TPD arrived about a minute after call was cancelled.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.4 Sleeping    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: LTA YM made L3 KK aware that there was a man passed out on a public computer.  KK and Guard JR approached the man who smelled of weed.  With some difficulty, KK was able to awaken the man.  She asked him if he was alright, to put his shoes on, and made him aware that he couldn't sleep on/at computers.  The man said he was okay and said he was leaving.  KK walked away from the man to allow him to gather his things.  The man was then found laying sound asleep on the foyer benches with his shoes kicked off and softly snoring.  KK and JR spoke to him asking if he needed medical assistance.  He said, "No."  KK asked that he leave for the day since he seemed to be under the influence of some substance and for failing to comply with not using the library as a place to sleep and not keeping his shoes on.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description: Around 11:58 a library patron left the library. While on the patio, the patron took cushions that are used for our Read to a Dog Program. If the patron returns, library staff will discuss this with her in case she is unaware it was library property.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: Possible hate mail
Description:
Through the mail we received an envelope that had the library's address hand written as the return address, with no "to" address showing through the plastic window, and no stamp. The handwriting was sloppy and uneven. The envelope flap was bent and taped shut, instead of neatly sealed. L3 AG commented on the envelope to other staff, that it looked as though someone was taking advantage of the USPS to send mail with no stamp, and put it with the rest of the incoming mail to be opened later.
The envelope was later set to the side, and eventually thrown away without opening, as it didn't look as if it pertained to official library business.
On 11-14-24, we learned that other libraries had received similar envelopes which contained hate mail.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Green - Low Impact
Description:
At around 10:15, a woman sitting at the computers began cursing at another patron. Guard J intervened and asked the woman to stop. She did so.
About 10 minutes later, LIC CS observed the same woman throwing small items at the other patron and cursing at him under her breath. CS went over and told the woman that she couldn't throw things at other patrons and that she would need to leave. The woman said that the other patron had stolen her blanket and her phone. The other patron denied doing so. The woman stated that she would not leave until her things were returned. CS reiterated that she couldn't throw things in the library and that she needed to leave. The woman refused multiple times, saying that "It was just a tissue, it wasn't going to hurt anybody," and telling CS to call the police. After several rounds of this, CS asked Guard J to call 911 for trespassing. The woman because shouting that CS and Guard J were "fat, lying cunt bitches" who were saying that she was refusing to leave. She stood up and left the building. As she exited the front door, she turned around and threw her full water bottle at CS. She walked off across the plaza still shouting. Guard J cancelled the 911 call.
The woman returned about half an hour later to retrieve the medical paperwork she had left at her computer. She apologized for her behavior and asked the guard to make sure the man she had shouted at was okay, then left peacefully.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating
Description:
At 11:20, a patron entered the library and asked L2 MG if she had seen his bike which had been locked to a bike rack outside of the library. He claimed it had been stolen and the lock cut. He had a heightened emotional state and was speaking loudly. L2 MG let him know that his best course of action would be to file a police report if his property was stolen. During this exchange, two other patrons were at the desk. He threatened one patron saying he "better walk away," and then told L2 MG that the other patron had burned him and indicated a wound on his face. He then asked for an adult snack pack. L2 MG retrieved the snack in an effort to deescalate the situation. As he was waiting, a fourth patron was also waiting for a snack pack and was smiling and laughing. The patron assumed he was laughing at him and said things like "yeah keep laughing." After getting the snack pack, the patron left.
After reviewing the security footage, L2 MG could not see evidence of the bike theft. LA CR also indicated she believed the patron to be Tony, who was once a regular SRO user but has not been back since his suspension last year.
For documentation purposes in the case these behaviors continue.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others    2.10 Creating tripping hazards, blocking aisles, exits, entrances
Description:
At around 12:14 pm, L1 DW and BM LG noticed an unknown male customer doubled over near the men's restroom, blocking the hallway. LG asked the man if he was feeling sick, he did not immediately respond. LG asked if he needed assistance from paramedics. He then stood up straight, shook his head and LG asked again if he was feeling okay. He nodded and I suggested he sit down for a bit if he was feeling unwell, and avoid blocking access to the restrooms. 
When I returned from lunch, Security Guard JB informed me that he had found the same individual doubled over in the lobby. JB informed L1 DW and asked if the man should be asked to leave. DW has uncertain and the man left 30 minutes later, with two other individuals.

Description: On 11/7/24 @ approximately 2:45pm Branch Manager SH noticed a male youth in the teen area laying on the floor saying "he bit me". I asked him to get up and asked what happened. He pointed at another youth and stated that the other boy had bitten him on his back. The other boy, Johnathan, denied it. Because SH had already talked to Andre about their behavior and for not complying with a staff directive, along with the dangerous behavior toward other youth, Andre will be suspended from the library for 10 days, and will be allowed to return to the library on Monday, 11/18/24 at 3pm.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal~Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: One pet made a mess on the carpet.
Description:
At 4:51pm staff observed that a patron with two dogs on leashes exited an event on the 3rd floor in the Tortolita Room and led her two dogs to the 3rd floor elevator. It can be observed on the 3rd floor cameras that the woman began pulling on her dog's leashes and began scolding one of them, the larger brown pit bull with white feet, as that dog had an accident on the 3rd floor landing outside the elevator. A long line of dog urine could be observed leading to the elevator. The woman along with her 2 dogs can be seen exiting the library at 4:53pm and coming back on to the 3rd floor at 5:01pm walking past the large urine stain without acknowledging it and back into the Tortolita Room for the event. L2 JM and LIC L2 CS met with the guard on 3rd and an off-duty police officer to access the situation. Due to the large number of people exiting the room and coming back in during that time, and due to the shift change at that time of the guards on the 3rd floor, staff did not know exactly which dog had made the mess by the elevator until after the woman and dogs had gone back inside the Tortolita Room. LIC L2 CS quickly put in a facilities request for a carpet cleaning and shortly after had to leave the area to deal with another disruption in the teen area on the 2nd floor. L2 JM continued to the 1st floor to retrieve wet floor signage to block off the area with the dog urine. The decision was made to not interrupt the event, but to wait until the event was over and to talk to the woman with the two dogs as they were leaving. L2 JM informed L3's LF and LD of the situation with the dog urine as they were leaving the 4th floor advisory board meeting and the decision was made to tell the woman that she could no longer bring her animals into the library. L2 JM and L3 LD waited until the event was over and the woman exited Tortolita with her two dogs, L2 JM approached the woman and asked her, "can we speak with you about the accident your dog had outside the elevators?" The woman immediately offered to clean it up and L3 LD told the woman that the carpet would have to be professionally cleaned. L2 JM pointed out the policy of the library that only service dogs are allowed in the library and told her that her dog had exhibited behavior not consistent with a service animal and that unfortunately the dog would not be allowed back in the library in the future. She also told the woman that she was welcome to come back in without the dogs and that we were here to help her with anything she may need. L2 JM had also printed off pet resources and handed them, along with a copy of the library policies to the woman. The woman took the paperwork and quietly left the library with no further incident.
The patron is not suspended, but she has been asked not to bring the brown pitbull dog into the library again.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
At 6:15 page DV notified me of an elderly customer (Linda) who was concerned she didn't have a ride home. L1 AB had been working with this customer previously as she had asked for information on taxi companies to pick her up. The customer told DV she and her son had walked to the library earlier in the day but she's 80 years old and she didn't want to walk back at night in the cold. Another customer overheard DV's conversation with Linda and called a cab company for her and ordered her a cab. She was very concerned for Linda's safety and wellbeing. When the cab arrived Linda said her son had her debit card and wouldn't allow her to use it for a cab. Linda wanted to talk to DV again near her son who was using the computer. Her son was listening to earbuds ignoring the conversation until he pulled one earbud out and said to DV, "you look hot in that skirt." DV said this was inappropriate and told him not to speak to her that way and he said "well you do, I can say whatever I want." DV reiterated he should not speak to her in that manner.
A few minutes later I spoke with Linda about her ride situation. She said her son was insisting they would take the bus but she said she had never taken the bus before and believed he'd actually make her walk. She also mentioned that her son wouldn't let her use her debit card to pay for a cab. She said he also had her house keys so she was afraid she wouldn't get into the house if she took a cab without him. I was alarmed by what she was telling me and I asked her to step outside with me so we could talk privately. I asked her if she felt safe at home and she reassured me she did. I asked her if she was allowed to spend her own money and she said she was. She said her son was just bossy but she felt safe and was able to spend her own money. While she was talking she told me several inconsistencies, like she couldn't remember if she had taken the bus or whether or not her son had her debit card. Before I talked to her privately I had planned on calling for PCSD assistance to see if they could take her home and perform a wellness check. However because she was so reassuring, and it was difficult for me to decipher what was going on, I decided not to. I walked back with her to where her son was and he reiterated they would be taking the bus. He told me they had taken the bus there but his mother had a poor memory and just couldn't remember. This is for documentation, the son is a regular here. He will be given a verbal warning for sexual harassment when he comes in next.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: L2 KVN noticed Sean #2 sitting in the cafe section on a couch facing here. L3 KK and Guard JR approached Sean #2.  KK made him aware that he was suspended and asked him to leave.  Sean #2 wanted to know when his suspension ended.  KK asked him to meet her in front of the building and she'd give him a copy of his suspension letter.  Sean #2 agreed but left property without waiting for the suspension letter.

Description:
When we arrived, we saw a suitcase had been left by the Sheriff's door. There was a note on it that said something like, "Do not remove my suitcase. I'll be right back." They did not come right back, so Lib II SW called the non-emergency number for the Sheriff about 12:30. Two deputies arrived. They think it belongs to a woman who has been sleeping right by the Sheriff's door. Their description of her is the same description Lib I AB provided. SW thought they were going to take it away, but the suitcase was still there after the deputies left. 
Update 4:045 pm: The woman came back and I told her she can't leave her items unattended. She said she understood.

Description: TPD Officer R.E. witnessed a hispanic male, Albert Escobedo smoking fentanyl in the form of a blue pill on library property, on the south side of the library. Ofcr R.E. let Albert know that he would have to leave the property. He notified branch manager IR of the interaction, and IR let Ofcr R.E. know that due to using drugs on property, Albert would have a suspension imposed.

This is for documentation purposes only: At approximately 2:32 pm, a male patron, Julio Cesar Del Rio, told security guard MG that he fell at computer #5. His left elbow was slightly bleeding through a scab that was already present. L1 CM also observed the patron and his elbow. The patron said that he also hit his chin. He was awake and alert. No dizziness or lightheadedness. He refused external medical assistance (911). He was given some ointment and band-aids from the first-aid kit. He said he felt fine, and that he was okay. He returned to computer 5, with no further complications or incidents. He was told that we would be available for further assistance, if needed.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description:
A female patron reported to staff at front desk that her bicycle had been stolen from the front of the library. L1 EM and L1 NG provided the patron with information on how to file a police report. Approximately 20 minutes later, a male patron who had been using a library computer earlier in the afternoon entered the library to report that he had retrieved the bicycle from another individual. He described this individual as a male who was attempting to ride away on the bicycle. The bicycle was then returned to the female patron. Staff advised the original patron to always use a sturdy lock when parking their bicycle at the library.
Update: This update is based on subsequent review of security camera footage. We determined that the bicycle was stolen and later returned by the same individual. Security footage shows an adult male patron with a striped shirt and dark hoodie sweatshirt exiting the library and turning to examine the contents of the bicycle rack. He then sat nearby and continued to look toward the bicycle rack for a short time. He then walked to the back of the bike rack, put on a striped beanie, sweatshirt hood, and black surgical mask. Next, he removed one of the bicycles and rode away to the west.
After several minutes, the same adult male returned to the front of the library with the bicycle and returned it, stating that he retrieved it from someone else.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: Writing threatening letters~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Description:
On Wednesday 11/13/2024 at approximately 12:45pm L2 emptied the suggestion box to discover two letters. The suggestion box normally gets emptied at the end of every month, but the last week of October was very hectic, so the first letter dated October 2, 2024 was not discovered until 11/13/24.
Both letters were signed by Lyra Elise Perry. 
The first letter is a complaint about alleged food theft in the Community Food Bank School Pantry cabinet inside the library building. 
The second letter is addressed to the Pima Co Library and a request to forward to the FBI. The letter is accusing staff of denying food to the patron, alleging that the jars of pickles inside the cabinet are causing her worry about her family member's life, whose nick-name is pickle. The letter also states that all, but one staff member are paid by the Ayran Nation. 
L2 DB notified LSM VL for guidance and was directed to issue a warning letter with a conversation about the items in the food pantry being for everyone and that the library is not able to meet personal dietary preferences.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.10 Creating tripping hazards, blocking aisles, exits, entrances~Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: non-food related damage     3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description: At around 3:30 pm page AC noticed a strange sticky substance on the floor of the adult section. She altered LTA JEM and Branch Manager BL. Upon checking the camera, it was discovered that a group of tween patrons had thrown a melted deodorant at one another, leaving a trail the substance all over the carpet in the adult section. BL and L1 EG decided to talk to the tweens and determined that the deodorant had exploded in the backpack of Ernesto who threw it at Bre, then Bre threw it across the area. There were three other tweens with them, but they were not directly involved in making the mess. BL and EG talked to the tweens about respecting library property, letting them know that the carpet would now need professional cleaning, and they had disrupted use of the library for other patrons. The tweens expressed concern that they would be in trouble if they had sought staff assistance for the mess. They were asked what choices they could have made, and they said they could have asked for help cleaning the mess, or not thrown the deodorant at all. Ernesto was more responsive to the conversation than Bre, who was on the phone during the discussion. Ernesto was asked what he thought might be an appropriate consequence and said that being suspended for a week or a month would be best. BL and EG told him he and Bre would have to leave for the rest of the day and were welcome back tomorrow if they made better choices. They also told the tweens that if a similar incident occurred in the future, they would face stronger suspensions.

L2s KW and MD went to assess the situation, there was also a spill nearby that our day porter was helping to mop up. The patron expressed anger that the guard Ben had asked him to not sit on the floor, and then began saying a discriminatory statement about the day porter. The courtesy phone became available, he used the phone, and left the library. Based on harassing statements to teens that was observed by guard Ben and offensive statements toward the day porter, patron will be suspended for one month.

Description:
at 1:17 Margaret flung a stapler at LA MD that had MD worried for her safety. MD had not interacted with Margaret all day but other staff that had interacted with her confirmed that Margaret was agitated all day.
L1 CM asked Margaret how much longer she would be at copier one so that he could send a fax causing her to exclaim that she was being harassed and forced to leave at 11:00 am
Margaret asked L2 vv for a stapler and then asked her again 15 minutes later. When VV looked for the stapler, she told Margaret that it was not there. Margaret was distressed that VV was claiming Margaret never returned it and angry with her for insinuating it. VV went to find another stapler when Margaret found the one she was using earlier. at 11:30 am
 
MD reported the stapler throwing to VV. VV asked for assistance from the duty officer, but Margaret had left the property. at 1:30 Margaret returns and the officer tells her that she can not behave in a way that makes staff feel unsafe. this set off Margaret where she claimed BA (From incident 0000023864) was out to get her and it was all his fault despite him not interacting with her all day. She left saying she was planning to call Administration to complain about BA

Description: On 11/14/24 @ approximately 3:20pm LTA AV reported to Branch Manager SH that two different families angrily reported at the front desk that they were leaving the library because of "a group of boys' behavior and bad language in the library". They reported that the male youth were cursing, making derogatory remarks and using racial slurs. AV asked if they were willing to wait to speak with the Branch Manager about their concerns but they refused and left. SH approached the children's area and noticed several male youth playing games on the computer. The youth said that some of the group had already left and claimed that only some of them were using this kind of language. SH told them that they would all need to call their parents to come get them, because they needed to leave for the day since it couldn't be determined which youth were responsible. The youth left without incident.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description: On 11/14/24 at approximately 3:45pm, patron Robert Littlepage calmly and politely approached the front desk and told staff "I need you to call the police, I want an officer to talk to now. It's not a matter of life and death but it is." Staff asked if it was an emergency or if he would like a welfare check. Mr. Littlepage replied "the nonemergency line is fine, I just need an officer, I haven't slept in 7 days, and I don't want to do anything I regret". Staff also reported that Mr. Littlepage claimed to be hearing voices. Staff called the Marana police nonemergency line and requested a welfare check for Mr. Littlepage. Police dispatch reported all officers were busy but would send someone as soon as possible. Mr. Littlepage left the library at 3:50pm without incident and waited outside until police arrived at 4:15pm. Shortly after, EMS arrived and also assisted. Mr. Littlepage left with them sometime after. This incident is for information purposes only.

Description: Guard JR and L3 KK approached a woman sleeping on a bench near the entrance.  KK woke the woman asking if she was okay.  Customer was groggy but said she was okay.  KK made the customer aware she could not camp on property and offered to assist her in finding support services when the branch opened at 10am if that would be helpful.  KK asked the woman to sit up.  Customer complied.  A few minutes later, KK and L1 KB were working at the service desk and heard loud shouting coming from outside the building.  Same customer had laid down on the bench again so JR asked the woman to sit up.  Woman began shouting at JR and told him it was a "free country" and she could do whatever she wanted.  Since KK was unable to stop counting money, she had JR ask her to leave property.  Woman refused.  L2 KVN called 911 and asked to have customer trespassed.  When TPD arrived, women refused to leave until TPD officer pulled out handcuffs.  Customer then left property.

Description:
On Friday 11/15/2024 at approximately 9:15am, the public area where Storytime takes place had already been rearranged and the sign that the space was reserved was clearly displayed. L2 DB observed Lyra Perry walking toward the staff area, past the sign presumably to go speak to LTA MR. L2 DB spoke up and said: "Hi Lyra, that's a staff area only right now" Lyra immediately began mumbling that she is allowed to be there and pointed to the Wi-Fi information sign on the wall and continued to walk toward the back area. LTA MR turned and walked toward Lyra, blocking her access to the staff area. Lyra began speaking very fast accusing L2 DB of being evil and that she can see DB's evil eyes. L2 DB stated that it didn't seem like it was going to be a good library day and that Lyra needed to leave for the day and try again on Monday. Lyra refused and said that she needed to get food first, which DB agreed to let her do prior to leaving. While getting food from the cabinet, Lyra continued to berate DB calling her evil and indicating that the DEA would be there to come for DB. 
 
DB followed up with LSM VL for guidance and it was determined to issue a 1 week Suspension.

Description:
Librarian JH referred Security Guard AE to me regarding an issue with a customer in the restroom. AE explained that the customer had been seen using drug paraphernalia (foil) on the North side of the building. The female customer dropped the foil and left, immediately upon seeing AE approaching. When AE re-entered the building, they noticed that the same customer was at a computer. AE reported the incident to Librarian JH. The customer immediately went to restroom, at which point JH referred AE to me.
AE and I waited for the customer to exit the restroom and informed them that due to the drug activity witnessed, they would need to leave the property. At that point, the customer began using profane language and threatening violence toward Security Guard AE. The customer gathered their belongings, all the while calling staff "bitch" and threatening staff with physical violence. 
This customer has also been seen by Guard AE at Main Library, regularly.

Guard J walked 20min later and the patron had left property. She left a food mess and potential evidence of smoking.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others
Description: On 11/15/24 at approximately 3:25pm LTA AV notified Branch Manager SH that another staff member witnessed a confrontation between two patrons. SH approached the front desk and saw a female patron complaining to staff about another patron. She reported that a male adult had pushed her child. As SH spoke with the woman, a male adult got off the computers and began to leave the library. The youth reported that this was the man who pushed him. The youth told SH that he was standing behind a friend's computer and accidentally backed into a man across the aisle who was sitting at a computer. The male adult then pushed the youth causing him to stumble forward. The youth reported that he apologized to the man, and the man told him to watch where he was going. SH informed the mother that no library staff had witnessed the incident but she was welcome to call the police. The woman called the police who arrived shortly after. After speaking with the mother, SH spoke with Marana Police Officer Grove #601, and told them what library staff had seen. Officer Grove gave SH his information and informed him of the report  case number (2411-0791). Because of this man's immediate physical and violent reaction to the youth, he will be suspended for 1 month once he returns to the library. His suspension will end on December 15th at 10am.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
At ~11:58am a patron presenting female approached the front desk where IC LHN and LI KSB were in the process of a shift change. The patron complained about the noise volume of two patrons humming loudly. KSB went to go address the issue but heard no noise and was unable to identify the patron in order to speak with them. The initial patron then came back up to the front desk at ~12:06pm asking that something be done about the issue because they have anxiety and was unable to concentrate and upset that nothing was done. KSB let the patron know they did try to address the issue but nothing was heard once they went over and that someone else would address the issue because they had to leave for lunch. LHN asked the patron to show who it was making the noise, and let them know that people are allowed to have some noise volume when in the library as long as it doesn't disturb others and that they could use a study room to help concentrate. The patron responded it's not just me who's bothered by the noise but others who were too scared to complain. The patron pointed out who it was making the noise, two patrons sitting to the side corner of the laptop bar, one presenting male and one presenting female. LHN knocked on the table in order to get the attention of the male patron who was using earbuds and quietly humming. LHN said, "Hi, sorry to bother you but there was a complaint about your noise volume and being inside a public space we ask that you be mindful of those around you and lower it just a bit." The patron said they weren't being loud and LHN let him know that someone came up saying that the humming was too distracting, and that we have study rooms if you'd like to use one of those so they could still use the library space but after three complaints, then you may be asked to leave. The patron nodded but did not move. LHN took that as understanding and went back to the desk.
At ~12:35pm the initial patron came up to the desk and said they're both being too loud and she's watching satanic videos now. LHN went with the patron back over to the laptop area and knocked on the desk again, this time trying to get the other patron's attention sitting at the laptop bar but not wanting to be blocked in the corner. LHN spoke to the male presenting patron again letting him know that his friends volume was too high and that we could move them both into a study room so they can listen and be a little louder without disturbing others. He got the attention of the other patron telling her someone snitched. LHN said this is not an issue about someone snitching this is because we have received another noise complaint and so you can both listen to your videos or music then we can move you to another area or a study room if you both continue to be loud, otherwise they will be asked to leave if staff have to come over again so please lower your volume. LHN turned to walk away and the initial female patron that came to the desk tried to intervene saying "They were being too loud and psychos watching satanic videos in the library." Security guard MG let them know that the situation was being handled. MG and LHN then spoke about the incident, MG let LHN know the patron that made the complaint was also making noise and he could hear her from the other side of the building. LHN let MG know that the complaint was from the one patron but that multiple people shook their heads agreeing the patrons spoken to were too loud. MG stayed near the area to ensure no further conflicts arose. LHN returned to the desk and the initial patron came up again about the satanic videos being played in the library and LHN told her that people can watch what they want in the library as long as there's no children around for anything inappropriate to them and that there was no noise from the area this time so they could not ask those patrons to leave. The patron then walked away upset and gathered their things from the laptop area. On the way out made a comment to MG about being an ass. Patron not suspended, for documentation.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.3 Theft
Description:
At 5:30, Guard R discovered that his plastic bag containing two books and a pair of gloves had been removed from the guard station. He found the bag across the room, missing one of the books. There was only one patron in the area, a young woman with a long ponytail and a large brown-and-white dog. Guard R asked her if she'd seen who moved his belongings, and she said no.
Checking the cameras shows that at 5:20, the young woman walked up to the guard station, took the plastic bag to another table, and went through the contents. She took the missing book and placed it in her backpack. Cameras also show her checking the guard station and looking around for the guard multiple times before this, suggesting that this was premeditated.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
Substitute L CFD requested assistance from LSG to address a situation in which Patron Richard Rmon Harrison yelled profanities like fucking bitch and move out of my way fucking loser at another female patron. L1 SG also asked for assistance from off-duty officer Wiberg who was aware of the patron's behavior upon arrival. Officer W informed Richard that due to his disruptive behavior and offensive language needed to leave for a week. The patron reacted violently to the officer's request yelling at the officer "Really? fucking pig, you are worth shit, I have connections and I will get you fired fucking motherfucker, you will regret kicking me out cock sucker" and other profanities. L SG let Richard know that observing such disruptive behavior is unacceptable and would make things easy to just comply and come back in a week. Richard turned his rage towards her calling her "You fucking bitch, I'll take care of you too, I'm going to get you fired and then I will burn this fucking library." Before leaving the patron yelled at patron S, You see fucking stupid bitch, I'm getting kicked out because of you fucking whore." The patron also threatened that he would be going to Main library.
Officer W and L SG escorted Richard out of the library informing him that due to violations of the code of conduct, he would be suspended for three months.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description:
This customer has been coming into Himmel for the past few weeks asking for guest passes, but nobody realized who he was. Today after he had used his first guest pass he came up to the desk to ask manager HR for a second pass. HR told him he could not have a second pass because customers only get four hours of computer time per day. He returned a few minutes later and said he wanted to get a library card. When HR saw his ID, she recognized his name as a dangerous suspended customer. Knowing how volatile he can be, she did not let on that she recognized him and finished issuing the card. She then informed him that he had already used his four hours of computer time and would not be allowed to sign on again using his card. He said some heated words but left the building to hang out in the park. At that point, HR went onto PITS, printed his suspension letter, and called TPD to let them know we needed assistance with trespassing a dangerous individual. The dispatcher recognized his name and promised to send someone out. HR called TPD at 2:45 but no one came. At 5:30 an officer called to check on us but by that point Mr. Woodcock was long gone.
Mr. Woodcock's suspension has been extended to one year from today as he has knowingly been coming inside the library for several weeks in defiance of his suspension. His new card is currently unblocked so that if he tries to sign on to a computer with it, he will not question staff about why he can't use it. Staff do not intend not approach Mr. Woodcock about his suspension/trespassing without police assistance.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description:
Ask A Librarian received a transphobic message regarding the library's website. The email was forwarded to the Director and Deputy Directors.
Contact information is consistent with the library card of Joanne McCutcheon.
 
Text of email reads:
I find all the information on your Website regarding Transgenders quite disturbing. This Transgender lifestyle is quickly becoming "the norm" and becoming acceptable instead of appaling....totally going against nature and God.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.10 Creating tripping hazards, blocking aisles, exits, entrances
Description:
During the last hour before closing Vet Sec Guard L heard a noise coming from the 4th floor lobby area which is closed off to the public. Guard L discovered a male patron sitting on the ground against the wall just outside of the elevators, but inside the stanchions. The man can be seen on the cameras to go up to the 4th floor on the public elevator and sit down to look at a electronic device at 3:47pm. The man appears to be hiding around the corner so that a staff member would have a hard time seeing them. When Guard L approached the patron and told him that the 4th floor was closed to the public and that the man would have to leave, the patron began slowly to move. The man told Guard L that he didn't need to stand there and watch him and Guard L told the patron that he did, in fact need to stand there until the patron had vacated the 4th floor and that it was his job. The patron became upset and used inappropriate language toward the Guard L such as the word "Fuck", pressed the elevator button to go down and when the elevator opened up on the 2nd floor, Vet Sec Guard R witnessed the patron cursing loudly as the door opened and then shut. The patron went down to 1st floor on the elevator, went directly to the men's bathroom and then left without further incident.
This report is for documentation purposes.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description:
A male patron has been making comments at the end of interactions with a specific female staff member while she is at the service desk, based on her physical appearance, such as calling her "beautiful" or saying "you're hot" and things along those lines as he's walking away. On 11/20/24, he repeatedly went to the service desk while she was working the desk, asking for multiple guest passes, asking for the zip code, etc.. 
Toward the end of the hour, the female employee was called by a different patron to the PC area to assist with printing. While she was standing there, this male patron starting "trying to convince" 2 regular teenagers that the female employee is attractive and "hot." The male teenagers were audibly disagreeing and "making faces." The male patron was saying "well I think she's beautiful. You guys just don't know what a real woman looks like."
The male teenagers then started joking, using slurs, about the female employees gender identity and sexuality because the employee was wearing something with rainbows. The male teenagers went into vulgar descriptions about the female employee having sexual relations and what she and others would do together. The male patron jumped on top of them and repeatedly told them to "shut up." The male teenagers were all laughing but eventually stopped.
When the female employee returned to the desk, the male patron came up and apologized for his "baby cousins" and as he was walking away said "I think you're hot."
The teenagers and the male patron will be suspended for 1 month.

Description: Approx. 3:55pm.  Regular 101 Space patron Yousef was playing video games with another youth.  There was a lot of boisterous banter back and forth between the two, and Yousef's chair was sent flying across the room, hitting his opponent's chair (no one was harmed and no damage was detected).  Library Associate TW immediately told Yousef it was time to leave, and although he gave some attitude back (stating snarkily "I'm just getting my stuff") and was smirking as he walked out very nonchalantly, he did comply.  Librarian in Charge KW spoke with TW about the incident and decided on a suspension; Yousef may return to libraries on Monday, December 2.

Guard points to the restroom and takes the elevator down. Patron makes his way to the 3rd floor and starts trying to open staff offices and makes his way out using the emergency-only exit. once in the stairwell, patron tries to come into the library (1st floor) with no luck. Patron eventually exits the building by the street level exit. Patron will be issued a written warning.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: LTA Sup AP was assisting a customer at the public computer when two teenage boys from previous incident (0000023892) were being disruptive while playing games on the adult computers. LTA Sup approached the teens and told them they needed to lower their volume. They said they would and LTA AP continued to help the customer. Later that same hour, a different customer came to the desk to report that the teens were getting increasing loud and when the customer asked them to quiet down, the teens called the customer a "faggot" and ignored their request. At this point, LTA Sup AP asked L2 KVN for backup, and AP told the two teens that due to their foul language they needed to leave for the rest of the day. The teens complied and left shortly after. This is for documentation as we have continuous issues with these two teens.

Description: Delivery driver MD informed STU L1 DW that he saw a syringe by our staff entrance. DW grabbed the canvas sharps kit in our branch's Emergency Equipment Bin and read the laminated instructions. He then donned the gloves for handling sharps. Mike pointed out the exact location of the syringe, fortunately the orange safety cap was on it. DW then brought the syringe to a sharps container and disposed of it.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description:
Jereth Woodcock entered Himmel Park Library again and settled in to work at a table. Staff did not approach but immediately called 911 for assistance. Two hours later, officers arrived. They served Mr. Woodcock his suspension notice and told HR that he has been entered into their system as showing that he cannot be inside any libraries for a year. The officers also informed Mr. Woodcock that if he comes inside the library during his suspension, he will go to jail.
If Mr. Woodcock enters another library before his suspension ends, staff should call 911 and provide the report number connected with this incident.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description:
at 3:20 a patron complained to CM about a patron talking too loudly. CM Grabbed VV and both staff recognized the loud patron as Margaret. VV did some rounds around the computer lab to confirm if she was talking too loud but thought her volume was at a reasonable level. Considering how Hostile Margaret can be, VV Decided it was best if she stayed at the desk for the rest of the hour in case there were more complaints from patrons about Margaret a complaint from her herself. 
at 3:25 Margaret got up and locked her computer to print and didn't return to her computer until 3:40. Margaret complained to VV that someone was hacking her computer and preventing her from working suggesting that it was staff not wanting her in the library.  VV reminded Margaret that when a computer is left alone for 10 or more minutes it will shut down for security reasons. This explanation angered Margaret claiming it was not the case since she locked the computer and nobody had access to it so that must mean someone logged in to her computer and logged it off because they didn't want her to work. VV again stated how it was how the system is set up in case someone leaves the library without logging off. still angry Margaret said, "Forget it I'm just going to talk to your manager She will fix this for me." as she moved to another computer. As she left VV was turning the computer back on so it would return to the login screen and Margaret kept muttering "You people just don't want me here, someone is trying to hack my documents, You are doing a good job at showing me you don't want me here there are lots of sites that I can go instead and I will"
 
*for documentation*

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description:
A couple came to the branch wanting to practice acoustic guitars in the study room. The resulting noise was too great for the room and the couple was asked to desist. While they cooperated with staff requests to stop, they claimed that they did the same activities at another branch (not named). 
These patrons were ultimately cooperative but I feel they may try to continue do the same at other branches. At WDS the activity was disruptive and could be heard as far back as inside staff restrooms in the back room. And the room they were using was adjacent to the customer service desk.

Description: A patron returned the non-fiction picture book "Let's Talk about Race" by Julius Lester telling staff that she discovered awful statements written in it in pen and that she did not do it and that we should know. The staff person checked in the book so we could not see the prior user, but it seems that book last circulated two years ago, so the damage was done long ago or by someone while in the library at any point in those two years. Staff have been instructed to look for other books on our shelves and at racial or political books being returned for the next weeks and months so we can see if there is anyone doing damage to books at this time. We do normally look at books very closely upon return.

Description: At 1:15PM Guard J was doing his rounds and found customer laying down in the magazine area. He asked the man to please sit up which caused the man to curse loudly multiple times and included saying “I’ll fucking kill you”. LTA Sup AP heard this and came to the reading area to observe the man continuously cursing. As LTA Sup AP went to go tell him to leave, he was urinating on the magazine racks by the table. LTA Sup AP told the man he is now suspended, and he needs to leave. At this point, L1 LB came out to observe the situation and make sure AP and J were safe. Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.6 Using furniture improperly
Description:
Regular patron JR set his belongings on the circular table in the BCN Mystery area. While sitting on a nearby chair, he had his feet up on the table. There is a sign on the table clearly stating with imagery that feet should be kept off the table.
A woman in her late-70's to 80's who was using a cane to walk was browsing nearby. She asked JR if he could remove his feet from the table so she could set her books down and sit at the other chair nearby. JR refused. The woman said this [the library] was not his living room. JR continued to refuse to remove his feet. Library Page AM heard this entire dialogue. AM approached the woman and asked if the woman needed help. The woman said she had never been treated so rudely. AM said she would get the person in charge.
Librarian I MH walked by the area after hearing about the incident. JR still had his feet on the table. When MH approached, JR stated, "Jeeze, you people can't even leave me alone in the back of the library." MH said no. She held the no feet on table sign up for JR to see and told him to remove his feet from the table. JR removed his feet and said, "You got it, Sweetheart." MH left since the patron complied with the request.
This is for documentation purposes only.
