Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
At 5:45pm LIC L2 JM was called down to the first floor where a patron who was currently suspended from Murphy-Wilmot Library (incident #0000023825) was currently using the public phone near the women's restrooms on 1st floor. The patron was observed by LIC L2 JM, Vet Sec Guard JT and Vet Sec Guard R as cursing at the phone loudly because he couldn't complete several phone calls. L2 JM and Vet Sec Guard JT retrieved the suspension paperwork from the binder at the guard station, double checked the photos and proceeded back over to the public phone area to speak with the patron. After waiting several minutes for the patron to complete his phone call, and after several attempts to get his attention, L2 JM said that the patron needed to end his phone call because they needed to speak with him about a suspension. The patron ended the phone call, pushed the chair back that he was sitting in and stood up from the chair rather aggressively, asking why we were bothering him. L2 JM handed the patron his paperwork and told him that he was suspended from the Murphy-Wilmot Library until September 28th. He grabbed the paper and began reading it saying that we had the wrong person and that we needed glasses and said that he keeps getting confused with another patron. Vet Sec Guard JT told him that we had photos from the Murphy-Wilmot Library cameras and that he looked the same as the person in those photos. The patron said that he wanted to see the photos and L2 JM told him that we did not have to show him the photos we were referring to, but that we knew it was him. She told him that he was being asked to leave since he was suspended and if he wanted to challenge the suspension, he could do that with the information on the suspension letter. The patron responded by telling library staff that they could "go to hell."
The patron then walked over to where his items were in the cafe area and sat looking at the paperwork for a few minutes. The guards and L2 JM slowly walked over and asked him again to leave. He told them once again that he keeps getting mistaken for another patron and he's sick of it. He stood up and gathered his stuff after staring directly at L2 JM and yelling loudly at her that she could "go to hell" again. He repeated that we could all go to hell, and L2 JM said that we would have to call the police if he did not leave library property. He tore up the suspension paperwork leaving it scattered on the ground and walked out of the library.
Patron's suspension will be extended to 11/27/25, one year from this latest incident due to his abusive language and behavior and the fact that he was trespassing on library property.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
While Page DC was working CM, a female patron starting talking to herself loudly at her PC. After a bit of waiting for her to quiet down, DC asked her to "please quiet down." The patron raised her voice and yelled at DC, loud enough to be heard across the library.
DC grabbed L2 KVN from the back. KVN exited the staff area as the patron was walking through the library, yelling very loudly that "this always happens" and she "always has to cause a scene." She then pointed her finger at DC and yelled "because of assholes like you."
The patron exited the library without any further conversation with library staff, continuing to yell the entire way. She then screamed loudly in the parking lot for several minutes, loud enough to be heard inside the library.
KVN is issuing a 1-month suspension.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: arguing with other customers, staff, and guards~Use and preservation of library materials and property~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Green - Low Impact
Description: LA RW reported to LIC L3 LAF that two customers were arguing on the first floor and one of them wanted the other to move. LAF went downstairs and spoke with guard Robert who had overheard the situation. LAF approached the two men, who were seated at a table next to the computer lab. She introduced herself and asked what had happened. The two men immediately began to argue and talk over each other as they both described what happened and insulted each other all at once. Person 1 claimed the other had filmed him, Person 2 said he had already been sitting at the table when the Person 1 came and sat next to him, that he had never filmed Person 1 and he simply was on his phone when the man sat next to him and began to yell at him and accuse him of filming. LAF asked them to separate. They refused and began to argue with each other again. LAF said if they could not stop arguing with one another and co-exist in the space, they'd both have to leave. They began arguing loudly again. LAF said they both needed to leave for the day because they could not stop arguing with one another. LAF took Person 2 out an alternate exit and asked guard Robert to take Person 1 out the front, to prevent an escalation of fighting outside. Person 2 left peacefully and without issue. When LAF returned from escorting Person 2 out, she found Person 1 still seated and arguing with the guard. Person 1 asked if he could charge his phone for 2 minutes before he left. LAF said yes, but he would need to leave at 11. LAF checked back in with Person 1 a few moments later at 11. He argued loudly with LAF. LAF attempted to diffuse and sat down at the table to speak with him about why he needed to leave and that if he did, he could return the next day. He continued to argue and told LAF he wouldn't leave and to call the police if she wanted him to leave. LAF said she'd prefer if he left on his own without issue, rather than escalate in this way. Patron 1 refused. LAF called TPD, who arrived around 25 minutes later and escorted the man off the property. Patron 1 will be suspended for 30 days.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
An older female patron who frequently uses the library was walking from the lobby to the magazine area in front of LTA YM at the desk. A mother and her young daughter were walking in front of the desk/self-checkouts area. The older female patron began to yell and accused the child of running, which YM confirmed the child was with her mother and not running at all. 
The mother confronted the female patron and asked her not to yell at her daughter. The patron once again accused the daughter of running and claimed she was "worried she would fall over" because of the child. 
The mother and daughter left with the daughter crying because of the interaction.
YM spoke to L2 KVN about the incident. KVN and L1 KB went to speak with the female patron in the magazine area. KVN asked if there had been an "incident a little bit ago with a child running." The patron said yes, she was "frightened" the child was going to knock her over. 
KVN told the patron if she had concerns then she needed to speak with a staff member and not address the situations herself. The patron claimed she "didn't know that." KVN let her know that if something like this happened again she might be suspended. The patron acted disinterested during the conversation.
This is to document the verbal warning as this patron has a history, especially regarding the behavior of children in the library.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior
Description:
At ~11:10am male presenting patron came up to the front desk letting staff know that the computer guess passes were not working and were from yesterday. The following conversation happened when In charge LHN went to help the patron:
IC LHN: May I see your guest pass please? The guest passes will still work even if it's from yesterday.
Patron: The pass doesn't work and don't yell at me.
IC LHN: I'm sorry sir, I'm not yelling. Can you show me what computer you were trying to sign into?
Patron: This one here. Pointing to pc 21 and then sitting down.
IC LHN: May I please see your guest pass? [patron handed over multiple guess passes. LHN took all of them and typed in the first guess pass number 99689133.] It looks like you may have grabbed more than one pass, just so you know our passes are good for 4 hours and limited to one per person.
Patron: It's not going to work and you're yelling at me and discriminating. I can't see well and this pass doesn't work.
IC LHN: I'm not yelling, I was letting you know just in case you didn't know already, that it's one per person. Can you please-
Patron: Oh it worked. Well I know it's one per person, I can't see and grabbed more than one, I have a disability and you're discriminating against me.
IC LHN: I'm not discriminating against you and I'm glad that the pass worked after I typed in the number. I hope you have a good day.
Patron: You were yelling at me and discriminating because I can't see and I grabbed more than one pass because I couldn't see.
IC LHN: That can happen sometimes. I'm glad the pass is working for you now, have a good day.
At ~3:11pm same patron came up to the front desk and told IC CJM that, "Earlier this morning someone was yelling at and discriminating against me." IC CJM asked, "Who?" The patron told him, "It was that lady at the end." LHN had been at the end roamer desk. Patron continued to speak saying, "I called and talked to a library server employee to report it and everything was written down. The woman was very nice and said she was also blind and she helped me. She told me to have a great day. I just wanted to let you know that I reported it." IC CJM said, "Ok thank you." The patron left shortly after.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.3 Food or beverage: unclean, disruptive, or damaging    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library
Description: At 100PM a regular patron of WDS, Ian G., approached the customer service desk and made mumbling requests for Narcan, mask, sanitizer and a computer pass.  Ian blocked most of our service desk while fumbling with these items, singing and swaying about, clearly extremely intoxicated.  He then wandered over to the drinking fountain, leaving his collection of baggage in the public walkway, and began to splash water over his face "to cool off," as he put it.  Ian did this for several minutes, mumbling and shambling around the drinking fountain making something of a spectacle of himself and disturbing several other patrons as they entered the building.  Two of these new arrivals immediately complained at the customer service desk about the individual at the drinking fountains, and at that point I decided this had gone on long enough and was no longer an activity associated with library use.  With VetSec MG I approach Ian and asked him to leave for the day, which he did after claiming "I was just dehydrated" and then proceeding to drink more water and splash more over his face.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Guard JQ informed L1 JCB that a patron reported a baggie with brown powder residue in the women's room.  JCB verified the presence of the baggie and consulted with Officer Reyna who told her to wrap it in a plastic glove and throw it away.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Melissa has been increasingly combative and rude to staff throughout the last two weeks. Today during the 12PM hour she once again vandalized a public computer with a pen. LTAS IC EB asked her to leave for the day, she became defensive, got real close to EBs face, and said she would not leave until she received her suspension paperwork. EB told her she could get the paperwork in the morning and asked her to leave again. Melissa then stood in the doorway yelling nonsensically into the building until LTAS KW locked the doors. After a few minutes of knocking on the doors and yelling at staff LTAS KW exited through a different door with a Guard R and let Melissa know that she was being suspended for three months and needed to leave the property.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description:
A homeless teen implicated through camera footage, was giving a warning about trespassing on library property. The teen on the video camera can be seen coming from the side but outside area of trash enclosure and making his way towards the gated garden area on the southside of the branch. The Teen is then seen jumping over the gate and settling in.
Around 2:45pm today, the manager talked to the teenager about why that jumping the fence is not acceptable and was given a warning about jumping the fence and trespassing.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: Staff members noticed a patron walking with his hand on the chest and rough coughing to the teen area around 9:30am. CL asked patron if he was okay and he mentioned that he didn't feel well and needed an ambulance. CL asked in charge BR to call 911 for the patron. Guard SL monitored the patron while the paramedics arrived to the library. The medics checked their vitals and patron walked out with them.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: At approximately 12:45, Librarian In Charge JCB heard a whistle from the computer area.  A patron whistled to inform L1 AF that he needed assistance.  AF asked if he had a question and he muttered something from his computer.  AF went about her business and the man whistled a 2nd time.  JCB went to the desk and asked if he needed anything.  He pointed to the computer.  JCB closed half the distance and asked again if he needed anything.  He stated that he needed his time extended.  JCB stated he would have to come to the desk.  The patron came up to the desk and presented his card.  As he had only been on a single hour, JCB extended for another hour.  JCB told him that he needed to speak to staff as professionals if he had something to say.  The man responded "Sorry miss, I know how to behave."  JCB replied "I look forward to seeing it."  The man did not speak to any other staff before leaving around 1:30.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: Around 3:45 a Pima County Facilities staff member made staff aware that there were foil pieces consistent with drug use on the floor in the men's restroom. Library staff is unable to determine the patron responsible. The restroom was closed for cleaning. For documentation purposes.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: Vandalism of county property
Description: Upon closing the children's section for the day, L1 KG noticed a significant amount of graffiti on the computer tabletop and the plastic base of a desktop computer. The youth vandalizing county property was determined by reviewing camera footage (name might be Ben). Youth will be suspended for two weeks.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.12 Belongings: Leaving unattended, may be removed without notice
Description: Male-presenting patron approached Librarian SM at the desk to ask if we had security in order to ask another patron who was swearing while talking on a cell phone to leave. Patron identified the cell-phone-talking patron as a male in the DVD/computer area, whom SM and LA KK had noted was on the phone earlier but had not been loud or otherwise disruptive with his conversation. Patron did not allow SM to finish what she was saying before he asked "Where did you go to school?" Other than the complaint about cell-phone-talking patron, nothing he said made any sense to the conversation or context. SM let him know that she would talk to cell-phone-talking patron herself if needed and patron responded nonsensically - but aggressively - that he did not like this course of action. He then turned to leave in frustration shouting "f#cking ret%#ds" to the air as he left. After hearing this, L3 AL (also at the desk) let him know he needed to leave for the day and not come back. Patron exited to the left toward the bathrooms and returned about 45 seconds later, popping his head in to say, "I don't appreciate your city housing." He then left again, this time headed toward the parking lot.  A plastic bag believed to belong to patron was left in adult reading area near magazines. If patron returns before close of business, he will be asked once again to leave for the day. (Cell-phone-talking patron was not spoken to since his behavior was not in any way a violation of the COC. Complaint may have been racially motivated.) LA WB also witnessed parts of the incident.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description:
L1 AW was in the East side of the 101 Makerspace when she noticed the group of youth who had been making cheerful play noise suddenly go quiet, and youth E left the room.  AW immediately approached the group and asked what just happened, as AW did not witness an incident.  Youth J was standing next to the table and said she slapped E, but didn’t mean to. 
E sat in a chair out in the main carpeted teen area, so L2 KW and AW went to check on her to see what happened and if she was okay.  She said she got hit in the face and some clay went into her mouth and was upset because she has a particular trauma about her face being touched.  She said she just needed some space.  She didn’t want us to address the incident with J, but we let her know we needed to talk to J about it.
AW and KW went to speak with J privately to see what she could tell us about the situation.  She said she was getting up from the table with her arms outstretched to wash the clay off her hands and when she turned quickly she accidentally slapped E in the face.  She said she would apologize to E for the accident.
After AW and KW finished speaking with J, they noticed that E had returned to the Makerspace and was again playing with the other youth.
Followup: E’s parent had contacted the principal of Paulo Freire Middle School and left an angry message.  The principal contacted the library on the parents’ behalf.  We told them we could not share details with them, but that the parent can contact the library.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.5 Soliciting handouts, donations, contributions
Description:
At 11:25am, the unknown male patron can be seen in the parking lot approaching other patrons and showing them items in his bag on camera.
At 11:35am, the male patron uses the public phone in front of the guard station. According to the guard standing less than 8ft away, while on the phone the patron admitted to selling stolen items to library patrons in the parking lot, and then attempted to set up a drug purchase in the WIL parking lot. It is assumed the dealer moved the purchase to St. Joe's, because the patron agreed to meet in the St. Joe's lot. 
He is then seen walking toward St. Joe's off camera.
Patron will be suspended for 1-year.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description:
Anthony Potter came into STU and immediately approached Librarian JH at the information desk and informed her that he knew he was currently suspended but that he'd contested it with Library Administration and had not yet heard back whether his appeal had been approved. JH gave Anthony the phone number to Admin. After receiving the phone number Anthony proceeded to plea his case and talk about sex and prostitution and implied that library staff were complicit in the prostitution and drug dealing. JH let Anthony know that she was unable to address the specifics of his suspension and that he would need to talk with Library Admin. He continued to want to talk about Main and Wilmot and staff and illegal behavior and JH reminded him that these were things he needed to discuss with Library Admin, not her. JH then reminded him that he was currently suspended and asked him to leave. He said he was only suspended from Pima County Public Libraries and that didn't apply to the South Tucson Library. JH let him know that South Tucson was part of the PCPL system and that his suspension was effective here, as well. He then left without further incident. 
For documentation purposes.

Description: A regular customer (A) reported to branch manager LG that someone had stolen his charger the day before, while they were in the lobby area. I reviewed the video footage and found that at approximately 12:08p another unknown customer (B) had waited for customer A to doze off and then crouched down to take the charger, immediately after walking out of the building.

Most of them attempted to speak quieter, but Rachael could still be heard yelling profanities from across the room. Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others
Description: On 12/12/24 at approximately 2:30pm staff observed Mr. Littlepage slam his computer mouse and loudly exclaim something like "someone needs to do something about these fucking kids". Staff assumed that Mr. Littlepage was speaking about the youth in the library near him who at the time were very noisy. Staff assigned to roam had already been roaming through the library and were walking toward Mr. Littlepage when he said this. Because this is not the first time that staff have requested that Mr. Littlepage only address issues or concerns with staff rather than speaking directly to or about youth, he has been suspended for 4 days and will be allowed to return to the library on 12/16/24. Branch Manager SH informed Mr. Littlepage he had been suspended for his failure to address concerns with staff only, and any future deviation from staff request would result in a much longer suspension. It was later noted that a mother of one of the youth called to address her concerns about adults cursing inside of the library around their children.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
At around 11:10 am an adult patron used the courtesy phone to call his father and ask for a ride.  The conversation diminished into an argument and the man yelled several profanities into the phone.  He was asked to keep his voice down by Guard CS.  L1s HP and JCB monitored the situation.  He slammed the phone down and stormed out, yelling "I love you guys!" to the staff as he left.  The man returned at approximately 5:05 pm and called his mother this time.  Again he began yelling into the phone.  Guard CS asked him a couple of times to keep his voice down.  He complied for about a minute each time.  After hanging up on his mother he called someone else and soon began again to scream profanity into the phone.  He was asked to leave at 5:17 pm and told staff good night on the way out.
This report is for documentation purposes

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: Anthony entered the library and spoke to Librarian KM at the 1st floor desk. He repeated several of the same arguments he spoke about in incident 0000024030, including that he had submitted his appeal several weeks ago and had not heard back, and that the library was retaliating against him due to the prostitution and drug dealing of library staff. LIC CS and L3 LAF came down to speak to Anthony regarding his suspension. CS let him know that she would touch base with Admin about his appeal, but that he still needed to head out for the day. Anthony stated multiple times that staff were war criminals for suspending him without a hearing. LAF took over and told Anthony again that she would talk to Admin about his appeal, but that he needed to leave. Anthony loudly accused CS of "having sex with me in the library" and repeatedly said that she was committing prostitution "in and outside of the library." Eventually, LAF got Anthony's phone number and got him to leave the premises. Anthony refused his suspension paperwork. He left while shouting about CS being a prostitute and staff being war criminals.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description: At 5:50pm LA GL noticed LA KK assisting a senior citizen male (between mid to late '60s) who had bloody toes. It was a previous wound from a fall that had reopened. He was seated at a table near the photocopier and was wearing thick black rubber sandals. KK provided bandages and wipes while GL provided paper towels so the man could set his foot down without staining the carpet. After the man was able to get the bleeding under control, GL directed him to a staff sink so he could wash his hands because the man wanted to find a book before the library closed. The customer then left without further trouble.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms    2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal
Description: Delivery staff MD and page ZS made branch manager LG aware that a customer had a large dog in the building off-leash. I went to speak with the customer and explained that only service animals were allowed on property and a leash was required at all times, for safety reasons. The customer at the time was also using the water fountain to wash their hair, and I asker them to stop, noting that the entire floor was catching water droplets.The customer was asked to remove the dog from the building and, due to the misuse of the water fountain, not to return for the remainder of the day. The security guard S and LAs DS and MN, who were on desk that hour were made aware of the incident.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description:
LIB III KS went to the copier to look for a print job. A woman in a red beret was standing at the copier and her bag and some papers on the desk next to the copier. She began picking up the library office supplies there and roughly shoving and slamming them down out of her way including almost ripping the electrical stapler cord out of the wall. 
After she almost pulled the electrical stapler out of the wall, LIB III KS said "Hi! I noticed you don't have enough room. There is an empty desk behind you without supplies on it that you could use." (Next to the other copier, which was not being used at the time.) The woman said, "I'm fine here." KS replied "oh, well we would like the supplies to be accessible to everyone and the table behind you is free." She grabbed all the supplies and piled them up, again trying to pull the stapler hard to pull out the cord, KS said "Please don't pull the stapler. It is plugged in, and you could break it. In the future, please use an available desk rather than the supply desk if you need more room." She said something along the lines of she would just move the supplies to the other desk instead of using it herself. KS said, "Okay. please put the supplies back when you are done. Thank you for your understanding." The woman smirked as KS walked away, and she said "Bitch". 
KS went to the desk and got her card and LIB II SY to witness the conversation. She went up to the patron and told her "I'm Kaitlyn, the manager. Here is my card. I heard what you said when I walked away and if you refer to me or my staff that way, you will be asked to leave the library." She smiled really big and said, "Thanks for letting me know!". 
The patron later went to the desk and asked what the manager did with her copy, saying that the manager took it. (She had thrown her own copy way when KS walked up to speak with her the second time, and staff desk found it in the recycle bin next to the copier for her.) Later she told staff that she likes that desk better so she can put a chair there and referred to KS as a "HOA" as she was leaving. She spent about 30 minutes at the copier.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Use and preservation of library materials and property~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.4 Vandalizing property    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: Abusive, offensive language written in graffiti~Use and preservation of library materials and property    Use and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: Offensive graffiti~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Green - Low Impact
Description: On the afternoon of Friday, 12/13/24, LTA JEM discovered offensive graffiti ("FUKK YU") written in marker on the side of the pickup lockers facing the library entrance. It is not known when the graffiti was written, or who wrote it, but the day before there were some rowdy middle school students hanging around, and on Wednesday, 12/11/24, there was a minor confrontation near that area between a family and a group of rowdy, angry middle school-age students.  After discussing with L1 CJL, LTA JEM attempted to clean off the graffiti with a mild cleanser, which proved ineffectual.  L1 CJL and LTA JEM decided to stopped short of trying to clean it with anything stronger for fear of damaging the paint or the structure.  A facilites request was submitted to have the graffiti cleaned.

911 was contact for a welfare check on a person in distress near the library parking lot. The individual was in obvious pain and unable to stand on their own. when the EMTs arrived, the person refused assistance and remained sitting on the sidewalk.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Leaving meeting room soiled, delaying access for next users~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.3 Food or beverage: unclean, disruptive, or damaging    3.5 Failure to clean up after eating/drinking
Description:
Beginning at 4:30pm on 12/13, TPD had used the large meeting room for a staff party. Branch Manager AL had approved this meeting to last after hours, with the agreement that TPD would otherwise abide by the rest of the meeting room rules, specifically leaving the meeting room as they had found it upon their arrival. TPD were the last group to use the meeting room on 12/13.
Approx. 10am on 12/14, Librarian I VG alerted in-charge Librarian II AD to an issue in the meeting room. The community group scheduled to use the meeting room were being let in by Page RH, who noticed that a large amount of food from TPD's party had been left out overnight and was still covering several tables in the meeting room. Additionally, the door connecting the police substation to the large meeting room had been left open, creating a security issue for TPD (this door is normally accessible only via TPD badge access; library staff do not have access to this door).
LII AD, along with Library Associates WB and GL, entered the meeting room, intending to put the leftovers in the small adjacent kitchen so as to allow the community group (still waiting for access) to use the room unimpeded. Upon arrival, AD, WB, and GL determined that there was so much food that it would not fit in the large meeting room. Additionally, they also discovered that several trays of meat products had been left out overnight without refrigeration, and there were still small self-contained propane heaters resting below the trays (that appeared to have burned out), both of which constituted potential safety hazards for the public. After attempts to reach out to police through the open internal door were unsuccessful, AD, WB and GL agreed that the food should be left where it was and documented. The community group was let into the meeting room and instructed not to touch the food either.
As of 2:15pm, the metal trays and heaters were gone and the interior door was closed, but there were still several cakes/pies and a couple of large open bags of chips in the meeting room. The community group reported that someone had come in during their meeting to clean up, resulting in further disruption to the group's meeting.
LII AD reported this to Branch Manager AL. As this is a serious violation of the meeting room agreement, AL intends to follow up with our TPD contact and reiterate the meeting room rules and policies. Please see attached pictures, taken approx. 10:15am.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct: Other not listed: booby trapping a child's item
Description: Patron reported to front desk that their child found a hello kitty chap stick in front of the library that had a razor blade in it. For documentation purposes.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description:
Patron Joseph Cione came to the service desk while L2 KVN and LTA YM were working. He explained to KVN how he had accidently damaged a book and showed KVN the replacement book he had purchased second hand. Through the conversation, he emphasized his New Jersey accent and explained that the "culture is different in New Jersey" as he repeatedly swore while describing the damaged book and the stain on the replacement book.
Mr. Cione suggested that other staff members "give him issues with replacements" and that "if [L1 KB] were here she would accept it" before KVN had a chance to speak. 
As KVN was looking at the water damaged book, Mr. Cione said "yeah, that's fucked up." He then repeated something about certain things being "more acceptable in New Jersey."
KVN told him that his replacement was fine. As she was processing his replacement, a friend of Mr. Cione's walked up and Mr. Cione commented to her "they're going to accept my replacement. I'm not getting detention. But if she was running it [pointing to KVN] I would purposely do bad things to get detention."
As KVN was grabbing his DVD hold, Mr. Cione made another comment about New Jersey personality traits and commented to KVN that he is "good-looking too."
No verbal warning was given at the time of interaction. This is for documentation of egregious use of profane language and inappropriate comments to and about staff.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.2 Strong odors
Description: Two different patrons approached LA BM at the desk with complaints about a strong, pervasive odor that originated with the patron at computer #5. The odor was so strong that the patrons had to discontinue working at the computers. LA BM informed L1 KH, who also noted a strong odor in the area of computer #5. KH printed some shower resource materials and asked to speak with the patron privately. She let the patron know that we had received some complaints about a strong odor from the patron's belongings, and that they were very welcome to come back to the library when they had taken care of the issue. The patron declined the resources and said he would leave.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
This afternoon four JR High children were asked to leave the premises due to their disruptive behavior. 
Starting at 3 pm shortly after arriving at the library, a group of four boys, all wearing black jeans and black hoodies, all with distinctive broccoli haircuts, were constantly engaging in disruptive behavior and interrupting other library patrons by entering study rooms uninvited and interrupting and harassing them, speaking very loudly in the stacks, and generally being a disruption wherever they went inside the library.
After being told on 4 separate occasions between 3 pm and 3:35 pm, once outside study room E, then in the far corner near adult graphic novels, then outside study room C, and also in the gaming room, the group was told by both myself and L1 EG to calm down or they would be asked to leave the premises.
The group then went outside to the main patio area. Once there they took a soda from a junior high-aged patron, threw it on the ground, and threw some ice at that patron. The young girl came inside the library to notify myself and EG what happened. The staff did not witness this behavior. Myself and EG confronted the four boys and told them they had to leave the premises for the day. 
They were told that if they disrupt the library again, whether tomorrow (12/17/24) or later in the week, they will be barred from returning for several days. This was not the first time staff has had to tell this group of students to calm down and behave in the building. They have proven to be chronic disruptors and agitators to their peers over the past few months. This is the latest escalation in their disruptive behavior. Previous disruptions included the same group mirroring their device to the TVs in a study room and playing random noise samples at full volume, completely disrupting the entire library. This happened on both 12/11 & 12/12.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms
Description: L1 BR became aware of a customer in the men's restroom stall that appeared to have disrobed from the waist down. Their pants were visibly lying on the tiled floor. Security Guard SL was informed and upon conducting a security check, he identified the customer, as he'd already had a conversation with them about the amount of time spent in the restroom and repeated flushing while using the facilities.L2 LG waited for the customer to leave the restroom and try to address the behavior, however the customer refused to acknowledge or participate in the conversation, did not provide a name and simply left the building.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking
Description: At approximately 4:28pm, group of five male teens entered the library and headed towards restroom together. The five male teen patrons left the restroom and went to service desk. The five patrons asked for snack packs leftover from CACFP. LI B.V. handed patrons their snacks, and then they exited the library. Female teen patron entered the library and asked for wipes, informing staff that the male patrons threw apple sauce from snack packs at her, dirtying her shoes. Upon reviewing branch cameras, two of the male patrons are seen outside the front of the library throwing apple sauce at the female teen patron. One of the male teen patrons is seen throwing the whole snack pack at the female teen patron.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others
Description:
While I was roaming, a tween girl, who was later identified as Noelle, punched/smacked a tween boy named Joseph right in front of me. I got boths attention when she hit him  Noelle then said that she was punched first, but Joseph and he protested he never touched her. I was going to have them step out for the day since they were rough housing when another teen, Adrian, began filming the situation with his front camera. I got Adrian's attention to stop the recording and meet me at the front desk to explain the recording rules inside the library when Noelle ran off. I got Joseph to join Adrian at the front desk to wait me there when I noticed Noelle across the way grabbing her things and heading towards the door. I tried getting her attention by calling to her directly , Something like "Excuse me!" Another girl joined her as the both sped walked to the entrance. I think her name was Arianna. By the time got the door and shouted for the girls, they were around the right side of the building and ran out of view.
I talked to Adrian first about not filming in the library especially other people and made it clear that people privacy is protected here.
Then I talked to Joseph who said that he didn't know her, that that's how they were playing like they do in school. Then said they were friends and gave me their names. He said that he was bad mouthing her and that's was led her to hit him. 
For physical violence Noelle will suspended for 1 week and will end December 25th, 2024.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Red - High Impact (Please click Notifications > Email aliases > Copy Trauma Informed Care Team if your location would like to request group EAP support)
Description:
As staff were leaving the building at 6 pm, there was a man and a woman waiting for us. They had parked perpendicular to three staff vehicles blocking us in so we couldn’t leave. They began lecturing us on how out of line we were to park in two EV charging spots. I explained what we were faced with at 2pm when we returned from lunch – early release day, the parking lot full due to a popular program and parent pick-up, and general library use. They argued more, saying we should have come back out at some point to move our cars later in the day. I explained we were working and didn't have time due to several other issues that we were dealing with. I told them that library staff and customer parking is prioritized anyway.
Entitled and rude, they argued more, as though they had ownership of these chargers. They threatened to call the police on us if we parked there again. I explained that we were given permission from Library Administration to park wherever we needed to. I suggested they contact Facilities Management with additional questions or concerns. Finally, the man went to his other car while the woman moved their EV car into the delivery area so we could pull out. I took this moment to briefly debrief with the other two staff, but the woman started yelling at us again, so we left.
They are suspended for one year.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Blocking cars in parking lot
Description:
A man was double parked behind three cars charging his vehicle. He had pulled alongside the other cars and drawn the charging cable out to his car. L1 EG explained that he could not block the parking lot, and there was an open charging space further down. He reported he “wasn’t blocking parking” (he was toward the back of the lot in the area where staff typically parks) and that the charging station with the open spot needed a power reset and wasn’t working. EG told him he was welcome to call the county to report the malfunction, but he could not block in cars. He said he didn’t have enough charge to move and needed 30 minutes. EG reiterated that the lot is prioritized for patron and staff use, and he responded “I would be a patron if I could leave my car here!” EG again told him that he could not block in cars that were already parked, as we could not know when someone would need to leave. He finally relented and said “FINE. I won’t block cars.” After a few minutes he left. 
This is for documentation purposes. Negative interactions between staff and people attempting to use the EV chargers have become more frequent, and progressively more adversarial.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.8 Smoking, rolling, using tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes
Description: Guard DT witnessed a customer vaping while sitting at one of our computers and asked him to leave.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.4 Sleeping
Description: This man was sleeping at a computer for about an hour. He was not logged in. Lib II SW woke him up and told him this space needed to be available for people using the computer. He said he understood, and was trying to stay awake. He was still not logged in, and another customer suggested that he move to a comfortable chair in the back. Documenting this because it is at least the second time he has slept at a computer for a long period of time.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking
Description:
Denise has been harassing staff over the phone, by email, infoline and ask a librarian service for the past month. 
 
November 7th Denise emails Virtual Library that she will return the stolen item to "Blue Box Letter" outside the library and hopes to appeal suspension
Staff search outdoor and indoor bins with no evidence of Denise on property returning the stolen item. Due to failure to return the item suspension still stands.  
 
November 21st Denise contacts Infoline about returning her items but is afraid woods staff is going to call the police on her 
staff response
"Dear Denise,
 
Thank you for reaching out.
 
We understand your concerns regarding the return of the stolen items to the Woods Memorial Library while you are currently suspended for 3 months. To address this, we recommend that you stop by the Woods Memorial Library and ask to speak with a manager. They will be able to discuss the situation with you and help facilitate the return of the items.
 
The branch’s regular hours are as follows:

Monday: 10:00 AM - 7:00 PM
Tuesday: 10:00 AM - 7:00 PM
Wednesday: 10:00 AM - 7:00 PM
Thursday: 10:00 AM - 7:00 PM
Friday: 10:00 AM - 5:00 PM
Saturday: 10:00 AM - 5:00 PM
Sunday: Closed

 
If you have any further questions or need assistance, please don’t hesitate to reach out, our phone number is (520) 594-5445."
 
December 5th Denise emails Virtual Library about refusing to return to the library because she is not treated with respect because she was banned. Denise reiterates her fear of being arrested by police for her small offense and that she has books to return in addition to the stolen item.
staff response
“Dear Denise,
 
Thank you for reaching out.
 
We understand your concerns regarding the return of your late items to the Woods Memorial Library while you are currently suspended. Please feel free to drop off your items at any Pima County Public Library book drop location. To address the issue of the stolen item, we recommend that you stop by the Woods Memorial Library and ask to speak with an In-Charge Librarian. They will be able to discuss the situation with you and help facilitate the return of the item.
 
The branch’s regular hours are as follows:

Monday: 10:00 AM - 7:00 PM
Tuesday: 10:00 AM - 7:00 PM
Wednesday: 10:00 AM - 7:00 PM
Thursday: 10:00 AM - 7:00 PM
Friday: 10:00 AM - 5:00 PM
Saturday: 10:00 AM - 5:00 PM
Sunday: Closed

 
If you have any further questions or need assistance, please don’t hesitate to reach out, our phone number is (520) 594-5445.”
December 17th  Denise emails Virtual Library again stating she will return the items and stated how she is still suspended and that it is disrespectful to her that she remains suspended. Denise reiterates her fear of being arrested
 L3 CO will be contacting her by phone despite Denise stating she prefers to be contacted by email with current evidence showing that she is not reading the emails we send her.
 
If Denise continues to harass the Library, her suspension will be extended to a year due to harassment and failure to comply with library staff directions. 
If Denise does return the item she stole; she will need to continue her current suspension because of the length of time it took to return the bear and the constant harassment of staff throughout the system

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description:
Three youth were asked to leave after their last warning for language, roughhousing, and disrupting others on the computers in the Teen Space.  Unknown_7339_12/20/2024 dropped his snack pack on the floor on 1st floor, and Guard B said “you dropped your snack” and youth replied “Hell no I didn’t.”  
They proceeded to the plaza throwing the snacks at each other and leaving a huge trail of litter.  They threw a 2 liter soda at the building near the book lockers.  They harassed an adult patron who was entering the library as the youth were leaving, upsetting the adult patron enough to say to Guard “F&*#%ing kids have no respect.”

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.9 Trespassing
Description: Denise entered the library at around 4:00 today and returned the item that was stolen back in November. Due to the amount of time it took to return the item and the constant harassment of staff the suspension is being upheld and she was told she could return in February. Denise argued that it had already been 3 months but L2 VV reminded her the incident happened in early November. Denise left upset stating when she can return to libraries she will never visit the Woods Library branch again due to staff disrespecting her.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description:
LSM PAC was helping female patron fax. Female patron made a call to clarify some numbers. Male patron at a computer nearby turned around and glared at the female patron and LSM. LSM let male patron know it'd be just a minute and that she'd address it. He continued to stare for several moments. Once the female patron finished the call, LSM let her know about the complaint. When she had to make a second call, she made it in the hallway by the restrooms.
As male patron was leaving, LSM asked to speak with him to apologize for the disturbance and to let him know that she had addressed the situation. She asked him to let staff handle the situation next time because the way he was staring at female patron and LSM was intimidating. He responded with, "good." I said, "no, that's the kind of behavior that will get you suspended." He said, "suspend me then." As he was walking out, he stopped by the front desk and said, "in my day the librarian would have said, shush." I let him know it was different times. He continue out the door, saying "suspend me then."

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.4 Bullying per Pima County B.O.S. Policy D 23.1.
Description: A patron called the library at 4:20 PM to share a disturbing video he saw on YouTube. the video contained all the First Amendment audits that occurred at PCPL over the past 2 years. the patron wanted to let staff know that there was a person going around the libraries conducting these and wanted to warn staff in case they had not been visited yet, that there potentially could be someone coming to harass staff. L2 VV took the call over and thanked the patron for sharing the information. patron stated that he wanted to call other libraries to warn them. VV assured him that was not necessary and that she would share information with admin who will distribute information to PCPL staff accordingly.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description:
L SD informed L1 SO that the fire department had just left. They told her that a construction worker dealing with equipment by the roadside had become concerned about an "indigent person"/ unhoused man on library property. The worker called 911, who then dispatched the paramedics. They spoke with the man, who refused help and then laid down in front of the door. As the front door was never blocked, we believe that they meant the patio door into the meeting room. The paramedics then came inside to inform SD that if the man became a problem, we could have him trespassed. 
L1 SO walked around the outside of the building and found the man lying down in the shade outside the fence by the children's patio, on the east side of the building. When asked if he was all right, the man said yes, and if he wanted to come inside, he said no. As he was simply lying down, and not causing any problems, L1 SO decided that staff would check on him periodically but otherwise leave him alone. 
We are making this report because emergency services were called.
Update-at 4:30 PM, L1 KS & LTA Sup AK checked on the young man, who was still laying behind the library. L1 KS woke the man and informed him the library will close in 30 minutes in case he needed to come in for water or to use the restroom. The man shook his head no. L1 KS asked if he wanted help or an ambulance. The man shook his head no. L1 KS asked the man if he wanted water. The man nodded yes. L1 KS retrieved the water bottle L1 SO left for him earlier and filled it with water. L1 KS left the water bottle for the man and again reminded him the library would be closing in about half an hour.  
It was also noted, possible human feces on the ground a few feet from the man.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: A patron was singing loudly from one of the public computers, Guard SL walked over to the patron and asked him to please not sing aloud. As Guard SL walked away, the patron said something aloud in Spanish. I (L, JH) walked over and reminded the patron that he had just been asked by the guard to please keep his voice down as it was disruptive to others in the computer area. The patron had his headphones on and appeared to not hear me, so I repeated myself, at that point he pointed to his computer and said it was the computer and not him. I let him know that he may not have been aware that he was singing out loud but that we and others did hear him. He nodded dismissively that he understood. As I walked away he called me a bitch. I walked back and let him know that since he was unable to comply with our request and continued to be disruptive that he had to leave for the day but was welcome to come back on Monday when we reopened. He refused to leave and wanted to finish listening to whatever it was he had on his computer. I firmly told him he needed to gather his things and leave. He proceeded to claim that I had disrespected him and that he knew me from the Main Library earlier this year where I had similarly disrespected him. I reminded him that he had been the one to call me a bitch when I politely asked him to be respectful of other people and not sing aloud. He continued to argue about who he was and his job, my job, and it became a bit jumbled and incoherent. I asked him again to gather his things and to leave for the day. After another minute or two he finally gathered his things and left. As I returned to the desk, LA MN said that when he initially spoke aloud in Spanish after Guard SL had talked to him, he was saying insulting things about the guard. He will be suspended for 2 weeks, per L2 LG.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language    1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
From October - December, Sean #2 has trespassed at WIL 3-4 times. Each time, he has been asked to leave, been given a copy of his 10/18 suspension letter, and has left respectfully without incident. No PITS reports were made for those days. 
Today, Sean #2 entered WIL at 1:06pm. He was immediately recognized by Guard J and LTA YM at the desk. Guard J reminded him that he is suspended and that he needs to leave. Sean said he wanted to speak to the person in charge about why he was suspended. 
LTA YM reported to L2 KVN that Sean was already making comments about staff member nationalities, saying that staff members must be involved in porn, and was using a lot of profanity. 
KVN came out with his suspension letter printed and LA RG as backup. KVN read the violations on the suspension from MAI and explained when he can return. 
Sean #2 argued that there is no name or DOB printed on the suspension letter, and therefore they cannot identify it belongs to him.
KVN told him that they had a system to keep track of incidents and that this this was his suspension letter.
Sean argued again that it wasn't, asked to see the system, and said something about the library violating his rights by keeping data on him.
He then said "you have a lot of nationalities here. How many nationalities do you have here?" Pointing to KVN, RG, YM, and L BL at the service desk assisting with the incident or helping patrons. 
KVN told him that she could not give him access to the system and that the suspension letter was him. She explained how can appeal and asked him to leave the building.
Sean argued that he would not because the suspension letter was not his. He wanted the phone number to call to argue his case. KVN showed him the instructions to appeal his suspension at the bottom of the letter and Sean interrupted asking KVN "how old are you even?" KVN told him "that is personal information that I don't answer." Sean said "what are you? 26? This is fucking ridiculous." He then went back to pointing out the "different nationalities."
KVN told him that if he continued using profane language and speaking in that manner, his suspension would be extended. She asked if he wanted to stay to get the number to call administration and he said yes. So KVN asked him again to calm down while she found that information for him. 
Sean did not follow instructions and went back to discussing his privacy and staff nationalities. 
KVN gave him the admin phone number and asked him again to leave the building. Sean refused. KVN said that he was trespassing and that if he refused to leave she would have to call the police. He told her to call them. KVN said okay and let him know his suspension had been extended.
KVN called 911 at 1:09pm. They specifically asked if there was any property damage. 
KVN then stood at the service desk to ensure the situation did not escalate. She ignored Sean as he tried to argue and made no further verbal response to him. KVN and other staff operated as normal while Sean stood at the service desk, stared at staff members, and occasionally tried to argue, swear, or insult staff. 
At 1:19pm, Sean said "you guys can keep this" (referring to the suspension letter) "because this isn't me, but I'm going to leave."
KVN did not respond. Guard J verified Sean left property. KVN cancelled the 911 call. 
Sean is now suspended until 12/21/2025.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description: An elderly lady came in and asked for a rolling cart. She explained that she brought boxes of books to donate and she needed help to bring those in. The front desk staff asked how many boxes she had in her car, and the lady answered, "Ten". The staff explained that we could only accept a bag or two of books at a time. The lady became upset.  She said, "You have to take these boxes in, and I promise, I will not bring anymore donations and I won't use the library anymore" and that if we don't take the boxes she would have to write about it "in a newspaper". LA DG recognized the lady as patron of GVY and offered to talk to the Assistant manager. I came out and introduced myself. The lady told me that she had called the library before and was told on the phone that the library accepted donations.  I confirmed that yes, we did accept donations but we had a limit due to the lack of space, and unfortunately, we could not accommodate to take 10 boxes in. The lady became indignant and said loudly, "As a taxpayer and the patron of the library, I have the right to use the library and you have to accept my donation". I offered to step outside and to have a look at her boxes, and the lady agreed. Once outside, the lady and I were met by the lady's husband. The lady immediately addressed her husband with the following, "They changed their policy, honey - they do not want donations anymore, they discriminate old people, this is not how you supposed to treat your taxpayers". I tried to explain that it was not what I had said, but the husband interrupted me, "Oh just forget it, we are leaving", after which both of them turned around and walked away towards their car while loudly expressing their discontent.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
For documentation:
AT ~1:15pm Patron went up to L LPV at the front desk, asking for staff to make copies for her. Patron put a page and coins in front of LPV. LPV informed the patron that computer monitor & LTA SE could assist and show her how to make copies. LPV asked the patron to bring her belongings, paper, and coins with her. SE met the patron at the copier, where the patron tried to give SE the paper and coins and walked away. SE said, "Hold on, we can make the copies together." and did not take the page or coins. The patron replied, "I don't want to do the copies together, or want to learn how to make the copies. It's your job to help patrons by making the copies." SE replied that, "I am happy to go through the copy process step-by-step with you."
SE then instructed the patron to insert the coins in the coin slot, then put the paper in the automatic document feeder at the top of the machine, which the patron did. When the patron pushed the copy button, the copier did not work. SE pressed the touch screen on the copier to set the paper type to letter size. After SE was troubleshooting to figure out why the copy machine wasn't working, the patron expressed her frustration that SE would not complete the copy job for her. She said that "It's your job as a library worker to help patrons copy and you're not doing your job." After choosing the paper size, the copy machine still did not copy. SE realized that the paper was not fully inserted into the automatic document feeder and pushed the paper in fully. SE asked the patron to push the blue button.
Before the patron pushed the blue button, she reiterated that, "You should have been the one doing the copying, as library staff and you're not doing your job well." (because the copies did not come out initially). SE responded, "I am happy to help you make copies, but I would like you to speak to me respectfully." The patron pressed the copy button and the copies came out. The patron asked, "How am I speaking disrespectfully? I'm just asking you to do your job and copy the pages for me, it's not my fault that you don't know what you're doing. You don't deserve my respect." At this point L LPV went to grab IC LHN from the back and let them know they should listen to the conversation at the desk, a patron was yelling at SE. SE handed the patron her copies and asked if she needed any additional assistance. The patron continued to ask how she was speaking disrespectfully and SE replied that they can give her a copy of the code of conduct. 
As SE gave the patron the code of conduct IC LHN stepped in. LHN said "Hello-" patron interrupted and said, "Other people print for me because I'm always printing for DES, and upset because I'm not disrespectful, I asked to print, I didn't ask SE to print it for me but to do their job." LHN let the patron know that "We only do printing for free when it's for specific things like DES." The patron said, "I know, I just needed two pages, and they wouldn't help me." LHN let the patron know that. "It is our job to help guide people on how to use the machine, but we do not just do it for them, and to be mindful of how they speak to our staff members because they cannot get help if they are disrespectful to them." Patron said they were not being disrespectful. LHN said, "You were raising your voice, and you can't do that to our staff." Patron then said, "What when, on another day?" LHN said, "No we are speaking about what happened today right now, not anything else. You have your print outs, just be mindful." Officer on duty interjected as patron said, "I was not disrespectful, I'd never be disrespectful to my elders." Officer JO attempted to speak to the patron but they did not respond he asked "Hello, can you hear me?" and then waived their hand to get the patrons attention letting them know, "Hey you got your print jobs, this seems like it was just a big misunderstanding. It's Christmas, right?" Patron responded, "I don't know." Officer JO said, "Well you got what you needed, let's just go." SE then said to patron as they were being walked out, "I did not mean to make you feel unwelcomed." Patron said, "I'm not from here, I feel unwelcomed everywhere." LHN said, "You’re allowed to come here but you have to follow the rules" Patron said, "Can you please give this to CeCe?" handing LHN one of the pages that the patron had printed out. LHN said, “Yes, I can.” Officer JO and Security Guard MG escorted patron half way to the entrance and patron left the library.
 -
This would be the second incident with this patron raising their voice in the library to staff. In an incident not yet documented last week by LHN telling the patron "You may not have known this, but you cannot play music out loud in the library." The patron said, "I just need to print something and then I'll be out of here." LHN let them know, "That's fine, we can help you with printing, but you still can't play your music, please turn it off." LHN waited for the patron to comply and they did not so LHN paused the music using their pinky. Patron turned music back on, stood up and yelled the lyrics "BITCH NIGGA" LHN said "I'm going to need you to leave if you don't turn off your music." The patron said, "I will as soon as I get these printed out." Handing LHN a guest pass. LHN said "Turn off your music and I can help you with printing." Patron turned off music and LHN let the patron know "You'll need to pay for your documents, it's .10¢ per page." Patron responded that "It's for DES, so it's free." LHN took the guess pass and printed the documents at the front desk. Patron took the documents and said, "No one has given me trouble like this for printing before." and walked out with their print jobs, turning their music back on.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7 Harassing or stalking    1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Green - Low Impact
Description:
At 12:45pm a call came into the 2nd floor reference desk phone from a Gary Sereno. L2 JM answered the phone saying "Pima County Public Library" and told them her name asking how she could help. The caller said Hi and repeated the staff person's name, "You can quit your job you piece of shit bitch." The patron hung up immediately after this and L2 JM notified staff, the In Charge person and the off-duty officer on the 2nd floor about the call. 
Attempting to retrieve the number, L2 JM accidently called the number and hung up. The name that came up on the phone was Gary Sereno and the number associated was 92487731407 
Later in the afternoon the patron called back saying saying he received a call earlier. He gave L1 MG the same message, that she should quit, that we all sucked, and that we should all quit our jobs. Then he called her a bitch and hung up.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling~Use and preservation of library materials and property    3.7 Activities not associated with a public library~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description: Oscar booked a study room for 4-6 pm.  JCB gave a 5-minute warning at 5:55 pm and found him shaving his head into the trash can.  He took the trash bag with him as he left.  JCB informed him that shaving his head was against the Code of Conduct.  When Oscar expressed incredulity she told him it fell under "activities not associated with a public library."  As he exited he said something unintelligible and then laughed.  He appeared very erratic and his sentences were non sequiturs.  Once he got to the printer he shouted "No matter what happens I still love you guys."  As staff exited out the back entrance he was there to meet them.  Guard CS was already waiting for staff to exit at the back door.  Oscar counted each person and pointed his shaver at each in turn.  He then said something intelligible and laughed, then walked off.  At no point did Oscar seem coherent.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.2 Strong odors    2.3 Inappropriate use of water fountains or restrooms~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description: At ~10:50a, staff member EO called in-charge Librarian LAC that there are fumes permeating from the bathroom area. Upon investigation, the area smelled like burnt rubber, reminiscent fentanyl. VecSec guard Anthony had doors opened to let fumes out and when LAC went into the women's bathroom, she asked "Ma'am, we are smelling some drug fumes. Are you engaging in any of these activities?" Lady responded that she was just using the restroom. VecSec and LAC closed off the bathroom with another in-charge staff member FC. Bathrooms will remain closed until further notice. Facilities request has been given due to prior experience of LAC and assistant Librarian MC from heading home with sickness. Will wait for access from footage to confirm woman and male couple.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress    Yellow - Moderate Impact
Description: Patron Marcus came in on Saturday, 12/14, asking if he was still suspended.  L1 JCB could not find any suspension under his name or alternate spelling and informed him of that information.  He then used the computer.  On Thursday 12/26 he returned and the Monday-Friday guard identified the man from Incident 0000023610 and notified LIII KW and LI JCB of his identity.  After searching PITS, JCB found his suspension letter.    JCB asked Officer Utter for assistance in delivering the suspension letter.  JCB asked to talk to the man outside and he refused, stating he wanted witnesses.  She told him he was suspended and attempted to hand him the letter.  He demanded to know why he was suspended and JCB gave the details of the incident the man stated that JCB herself had said there was no suspension.  JCB stated that when he asked there were no staff from the original incident.  The man accused JCB of making false accusations and demanded to see his accuser.  He also stated that LIII KW "Has a bug up her butt against me."  JCB handed him the photo from the PITS record.  The man admitted it was a photo of himself and said it was inadmissible as evidence because there was no sound.  The man demanded a written witness statement so he could sue for false allegations.  Officer Utter explained that there were no criminal charges.  The man demanded Officer Utter's name and badge #, which he gave.  The man was escorted out by the officer and promised that the NAACP would sue him.  Patron declined to take his suspension letter.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description:
Documentation: LA TA was approached by a patron who appeared distressed. TA asked if he needed any library services, but the patron started crying and seemed to have delayed responses. LTAS LM offered to call 911 and verified that he wasn't being followed. He was asked if he wanted to make the call in Study Room A and agreed. 
LA TA informed the staff in charge, L1 MH and L1 BR, about the situation and noted that the patron had been on the call for over ten minutes. MH then communicated the situation to L3 CR via phone. BR called 911 from a back phone at 4:42 PM to verify that a call had been made from their location; 911 confirmed that no other call had been received from that area. BR relayed this information to LM, who suggested re-calling 911 to ensure an officer handled the situation.
During the second call, LM informed BR that the patron had left the room and that the Crisis Response Center (CRC) was on its way to pick up the patron. BR mentioned to 911 to cancel the request. LM offered for in-charge staff members to stay with him after closing hours, but the patron declined the offer.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct    1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior    2.1 Disruptive behavior    2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling    2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: L1 RS asked patrons George and Rachael to speak in quieter tones starting around 2PM. They would periodically shout at each other but were able to quiet down. After a few warnings, they continued to shout at each other continuously at the time of the incident. L1 Rachael asked for them to leave the library for the day, however they did not comply with staff instruction. When they continued their behavior L1 RS said she would call security if they did not exit. George then said if the security guard touched him, he would "swing at them" and began swinging his arms in a threatening manner. They then exited without further incident.

Infractions: Medical 911    Called 911 for medical
Description: Guard B and LTAS IC EB could not wake up an unresponsive male at PC 16. When paramedics arrived, patron woke up and left on his own accord.
