Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property3.1 Manipulating or bypassing library rules, such as computer use3.6 Using furniture improperly
Description:
Female presenting patron entered the library around 10:50 am and went into the study room without asking staff for permission to use the room. At 11:00 am, another customer, who had a study room reservation, arrived and checked in with staff. LTA MS opened the door to the study room to notify the first patron that there was a reservation for the room. MS saw a backpack and other belongings on the table, but did not see the patron. MS went into the back workroom to ask L1 KH to check the women's restroom for the patron. Meanwhile, LA BM noticed that the patron was actually still in the study room. She was wedged into the far back corner of the room, sitting underneath the table, with a chair pulled over to the corner to conceal her. LA BM asked the patron to come out from under the table and exit the room. L1 KH came out at this point, and observed the patron under the table. The patron slowly emerged and left the room. Since the patron complied with the request and has been very suspicious about staff watching her in the past, L1 KH decided not to discuss appropriate study room use with her at this time.
A little while later, the patron asked LTA MS for a computer pass. When he handed her the pass, she said that she "didn't like that pass" and wanted a different one. LTA MS handed her a second pass, and asked for the first one back. She told him that she would rip it up herself. MS noted that she seemed to be unhappy that he had touched the pass and that he would not let her reach across the desk to take a pass for herself.
Documenting as this patron has been exhibiting increasingly odd behavior over the past few months.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description:
An hour after staff found this customer hiding under a table in the study room, she continued to exhibit strange behaviors and paranoia about being identified. She requested to use the study room and when HR asked for her name, she refused to give it. She then walked past our security guard DT, who had his clipboard with his notes on his lap, and she stood next to him, looking down at his clipboard, trying to read what it said. HR told her she could not read his clipboard. A few minutes later the guard went outside to do his rounds, and she also went outside a few minutes later. DT stated that she appeared to follow him to his car. Shen then wandered back into the library to ask if the wifi worked outside the building.
Documenting her behavior as I am concerned by her interest in DT's clipboard and whereabouts.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating
Description: Security Guard R was performing his routine patrol by the 1st floor computer lab, noticed that patron on computer #27 was eating on top of the keyboard. Security guard R. reminded patron to not eat (2nd time). Security guard went to the circulation desk to let staff know about patron eating in the computer. Patron gathers his belongings and walks towards the security guard to confront him. Patron uses offensive language towards guard and inviting him to "Go outside and take care of it". by the time LIC LD and officer Utter made it to the first floor, patron was no longer inside the library. Patron will be suspended for 1 year.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.3 Theft
Description:
Patron called at 4:15 asking if a purple wallet had been found. She reported using the library for less than 10min roughly 30min before. L2 KVN looked around self-checks with Page DC and did not find anything.
Patron called again at around 4:20 to see if anything had been turned in. Nothing had been turned in and nothing was in Lost and Found. Patron reported having an AirTag in her wallet stating it was at WIL.
At roughly 4:30, patron came into the library looking for her wallet. She reported to Page DC and desk staff LTA YM that the AirTag was showing the wallet's location at WIL. Patron checked the library in the areas she used and in the back of the library. KVN looked around the library again.
Patron was unsure how to use the "Find My" function with the AirTag, other than to see the location of her wallet on the map.
KVN attempted to have the AirTag make a sound, but patron's phone was not close enough to AirTag. KVN explained that the AirTag did not update it's location right away. The AirTag location refreshed to show the wallet location farther down Wilmot Rd. KVN asked if the patron had checked her vehicle and under her seat, and she insisted she had. Patron decided to drive closer to the last AirTag location down Wilmot Rd. KVN showed her how to make her AirTag play a sound when she was within an acceptable range.
It is possible the AirTag is in the patron's vehicle and refreshing it's location slowly. It is also possible the wallet was taken if left inside the library unattended. This serves to document the event and interaction.
Update 1/3-1/4/25 - Patron found airtag in trashcan along Wilmot Rd. Patron has reported her wallet was stolen.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior2.1 Disruptive behavior2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description: Page DC observed a customer spit on her computer screen. DC said that it clearly appeared intentional. L3 KK, L1 KB and Guard JR approached the customer. KK made customer aware that staff observed her spitting on the screen. Customer at first denied but then said it was because she had a cold. KK asked customer to leave for the day. Customer said that she would but sat down and began using the computer again. After a couple of minutes, customer was advised by JR that the computer would shut down in 60 seconds. KK shut down the computer. Customer left the building without further incident.

Infractions: Medical 911Called 911 for medical
Description:
For documentation since patron was hurt on library property.

At approximately 1:26pm female patron came up to the desk saying husband fell and needed to call 911. BA went to grab IC LHN. LHN directed the patron to the phone at the front to call 911, patron said they can not hear well so LHN called for them at ~1:28pm. Police arrived at 1:30pm. The patron didn't want the officer to help her husband up because she wanted an EMT to come look at an evaluate him. Another patron approached and said they had medical experience and asked the woman if they'd be ok with helping the officer move him so his knees weren't in any more pain from falling. LHN grabbed a chair for the patron to be moved into until EMT could come, the officer and patron were able to help him get into the chair and EMT arrived shortly after to evaluate. The wife asked LHN to place the books in their car so they were out of the way. After seeing the EMT and Officers had the situation under control, LHN let the officers and EMT know to let staff know if they need anything else and to let LHN know when they're done to retrieve the chair. Officers and EMT left shortly after.

Infractions: Medical 911Called 911 for medical
Description:
For documentation since patron needed medical attention in library.

Patron sitting at children computer #1 around 2:35pm passed out and abruptly fell to the ground. IC LHN approached the patron who was unresponsive at first. Security Guard MG came over and stayed with patron while LHN went to go grab Officer on duty MA. MA came and rolled the patron over, asked questions to see if they were responsive and patron did respond after second attempt. VV was notified of the situation and bought out a water bottle and snicker snack bar for patron. MG and MA were able to get patron back into the chair and officer gave patron water bottle, asked if patron had donated, they said yes. Officer radioed EMT and they arrived ~2:41pm. Patron was evaluated and asked to lay down to continue evaluation. EMT asked if they wanted to go to hospital, patron said no and EMT let patron know hospital was recommended due to vitals. Patron was taken to hospital by EMT at 2:57pm. Car is most likely being left in parking lot overnight.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal
Description:
A dog could be heard throughout the library barking for over 30sec. L BL on the service desk grabbed L2 KVN.
L2 KVN approached the patron with Guard J. When KVN walked up to them, the dog started jumping on KVN's legs.
KVN asked if the dog had been barking and the patron said yes, the dog was upset by another dog nearby.
KVN explained to the patron that all dogs are expected to behave like service dogs in the library. She told the patron the dog would have to leave for the day.
Patron was compliant and left within 5min.
Patron then attempted to tie the dog to a bench outside so she could return to library. Guard J told her no.
Patron put the dog in her vehicle and left him unattended while she returned to use the library. No further discussion was made with patron because it was 10min to close. Temperatures are not in danger zones for dog.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.4 Vandalizing property1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior2.1 Disruptive behavior2.8 Smoking, rolling, using tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes~Use and preservation of library materials and property3.3 Food or beverage: unclean, disruptive, or damaging
Description:
A group of teens spent most of the afternoon in the library. They left a considerable mess and vandalism in the area they were seated, so security camera footage was reviewed by LIC PP. Around 1:50pm, Teen #1 enters the 101 Space and hits a vape, blowing smoke while walking to the table. Teen #1 is then seen using a marker to draw on the walls, table, and chairs. The other teens observe this happening. Teen #2 is also seen repeatedly hitting a vape. Around 2:15pm, Guard J approaches to tell Teen #3 to remove their feet from the table. As she turns away, Teen #4 makes a threatening gesture in her direction (throwing his body like he wants to fight). When the group leaves, they leave all of their food trash behind. As they exit, L1 AW stops them and asks if it is their trash; Teen #5 acknowledges that it is and returns to pick up the trash.
At 11:25am the following day 1/7/24 the group of teens came back, teen #1 was spoken to by L3 LF and denied writing graffiti on the walls, table and chair. She then said that it was only removable marker, and L3 LF told her that she was suspended for 2 weeks. Another teen (Teen #6) was sitting at the computers with teen #1 and started cursing at L3 LF and saying "fuck this place." The two teens left the library without further incident. They will both be suspended for 2 weeks.
Update 1: Teen #6 returned to the library around 12pm on 1/8/25 and when informed again that she was suspended for two weeks, ignored and brushed past staff, grabbed her bag from the computer area which she had left there and said "stop rushing me nigger," as she left. Her suspension is extended for one month until 2/8/25.
Update 2 Teen #1 returned to the library on 1/8/25 (first time) and was reminded of her suspension and asked to leave, which she did. Teen #6 also returned (second time) to the library on 1/8/25 and was asked to leave by Guard J and LIC WW. When asked to clean her snack trash she refused and said she "doesn't care" then cursed on her way out. Her suspension will be again extended one more week.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.4 Vandalizing property
Description:
On January 7, 2025, at approximately 2:45 PM, Patron RD reported to Librarian 1 (L1) GF an incident involving a potential hit and run at the MID Electric Vehicle Charging Station parking lot.
Patron RD stated that an elderly Caucasian female, approximately 5 feet tall and wearing gloves, struck their white Chevy Equinox with their vehicle. When Patron RD confronted the individual regarding the incident, Patron RD claims that the woman purposefully struck the vehicle again.
Patron RD requested the other party's insurance information and driver?s license. The individual responded by telling Patron RD to "wait," then entered her vehicle, identified as an orange/red Kia EV6 Electric Vehicle, and left the scene without providing any information.
Patron RD approached the front desk and requested the identity of the other patron involved and access to any available camera footage. L1 GF informed Patron RD that the library does not have the capability to identify patrons in this manner and advised them to file a Tucson Police Department (TPD) report. Patron RD was also advised to include the Arizona license plate of the other vehicle, for which they had a photograph.
Upon review of the available camera footage, it was determined that no usable footage was captured to clearly document the incident. It remains unclear whether the damage was caused by the other party?s vehicle door or during the act of parking or exiting the space.
Patron RD was advised to file a report with TPD, providing all pertinent details, including the description of the other individual, the vehicle make and model, and the Arizona license plate that they captured on their phone.
Documenting this incident here.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others
Description:
Minor patrons Mario and Liam were engaging in rough horseplay in the children's area, including crawling around on the floor, jostling library furniture, and screaming and yelling, all of which they were warned about the previous day. This is part of a pattern of escalating behavior problems that staff have noticed and have been trying to work with them to remedy. At about 3:15 both were asked to leave the library for the day due to this behavior.
At about 3:45 Liam returned to the library and went into the restrooms. When he left he waved and laughed at staff, so staff were aware this was intentional behavior on his part. LTA Sup MB went outside and found both boys hanging out on library property. MB had a conversation with them to explain that being asked to leave for the day means they cannot be on property, cannot return and use the restrooms, and about broader behavior and consequences.
Because Liam intentionally returned to the library when he had been asked to leave, he will be asked to leave for the day the next time he returns to the library.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description: At 10:15 AM LTA NG called LIC L3 LAF from the 101 space desk to report that an adult had just threatened a teen. NG reported that the adult walked to the edge of the 101 space area, called a teen over, and threatened to beat up the teen and hurt them. The dispute was over a girl. The adult then walked over to the other side of the 2nd floor to another seating area, where they had friends sitting. Guard Ben heard the adult telling his friends that he had tried to coerce the teen to go outside to fight and bragging that he had threatened him over a girl. LAF spoke with the teen who had been threatened, who would not disclose what was said to him. After getting the reports from NG and Ben, LAF and guard Jen waited outside of the restroom, where the patron who had threatened the teen had gone after talking with his friends. LAF asked if she could speak with him when he exited and he said, "about what?". She said he had threatened someone and would need to leave. The patron returned to the seating area on the other side of 2nd where his friends were, packed up his belongings, and left the building a few minutes later. Patron suspended for 6 months.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior2.1 Disruptive behavior2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
Yesterday afternoon there was an incident where we had to ask a child to leave the premises after he had a pattern of being disruptive and culminated with the use of a vulgar racist epithet towards another junior high student.

The boy namedCadenwas with a group of three junior high students being disruptive inside the library, and after a few instances where staff asked them to calm down, the group left the library and went outside to the performance patio area.

Once there the small group of 4 boys was told a few times to stop causing disruptions with other students who were also using that area. Maybe 5-10 minutes after the warnings a female junior high school student came inside to the front desk and told us thatCadenhad called her a fu**ing ni**er.

I went outside to the patio area to confront the group about who said those words, they all confirmed that Caden was indeed the person who said it, but that he had left the premises and was getting a beverage at the nearby business. Caden?s peers told us what happened and we sternly told them this was unacceptable behavior.

When Caden returned from the store EG and I told him that he needed to leave for the day and that if he said those things again he would not be welcomed back at the library. Caden and the rest of his group seemed to understand the severity of the moment. Caden left the library grounds once asked to leave.

The young student who was the target of these words (name not known) was upset but appreciated our disciplinary efforts.

We are documenting this in the event this incident gets escalated.

He was overheard loudly joking about having sex with a 9 year old and was given a verbal warning by LA MA. As he was leaving he also said to the group of teens with him "No, I won't give you coke." Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior2.2 Strong odors
Description:
Over time, we have had an escalating number of complaints about Ole Olson's personal odor, and staff have noticed increasing incidents of both fecal and urinary incontinence, which has necessitated us to lock a restroom for cleaning. The number of complaints has reached the point of this being a pattern and not just an occasional accident.
At about 1:30 L3 AG approached Ole and introduced herself as the manager, then gently explained that we had received a number of complaints about an odor coming from him, and that this is something in our Code of Conduct, because it inhibits the use and enjoyment of the library by others. AG went on to explain that he would need to leave, but that he was welcome to return when the odor had been addressed. Ole accepted a copy of the Code of Conduct and packed up his belongings to go.

Infractions: Medical 911Called 911 for medical
Description:
L2 KW witnessed patron fall to the floor in the Santa Rita meeting room on 2nd floor. Called 911. EMTs came and determined patron's vitals were good and that he was feeling better. Patron said he must have been dehydrated and was feeling much better after drinking water and eating a snack.
Third party incident form was filled out and submitted to Risk Management.

Infractions: Medical 911Called 911 for medical
Description: 20 year old customer was found sprawled on the southeast corner of the property next to the Large Meeting Room exit door. L1 LB and Guard JR were unable to wake up the customer but saw that he was breathing. LB made L2 KVN and L3 KK aware. KK called 911 asking for medical assistance. KVN continued to try to wake the customer and was finally successful. After waiting 30 minutes for medical assistance, the man sat up but was still groggy. He asked if we had blankets but we had handed them all out the day before. We told him that Main Library had blankets. He opted to try to take a bus to Main Library. KK call 911 back to cancel the call. They mentioned that they had dispatched TPD rather than paramedics. KK expressed concern since the man clearly needed medical assistance. Dispatcher said that TPD is dispatched rather than paramedics for overdose situations. TPD called KK a few minutes later. KK made officer aware that she was concerned that the man may not survive the freezing temperatures tonight due to his state of mind and lack of warm clothing. Officer said he would try to locate the man.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal
Description:
At 5:58pm, patron from PITS0000024083 was using a PC and stood up to go to the printer. She looked at KVN (who was shutting down nearby catalog computers) and appeared to hesitate. She then dropped her dogs leash and walked to the printer.
Her dog, now without his owner, walked to KVN. KVN picked up the leash because the dog has demonstrated he is friendly (to people) and took him back to his owner. KVN asked if she had accidently dropped the dog's leash. The patron seemed confused/overwhelmed (perhaps with completing all her tasks before close) and said yes. KVN reminded her that her dog needs to be with her at all times. The patron was polite and understanding.
This is to document a history of behavior and conversations with this patron and her dog.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior2.4 Sleeping
Description:
On 1/14, Page S informed L2 KVN of a patron sleeping at PC #33. The patron was completely slumped over the desk. KVN woke him up by asking if he was okay. He was difficult to rouse but said yes.
On 1/14 at 2:33 Page M informed L2 KVN at the desk that the same patron was sleeping again at PC #33. The patron was completely slumped over the desk with the PC signed out. At 3:00pm Page M returned to inform KVN that the patron was again passed out at the desk. KVN asked Guard J to escort the patron outside for the day.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language

Infraction Categories: Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic StressYellow - Moderate Impact
Description: At about 2 p.m. today, apotential altercation occurred outside the library, 75 feet from the entrance, leading to conflicting statements from the parties involved. A minor, 13, approached the library sidewalk and claimed that an adult man had pushed him. The boy was visibly upset when recounting the incident, asserting that the adult's actions were unprovoked. In contrast, the adult man, denied the accusation. He stated that the boy had been verbally aggressive toward him, using profanities. According to the adult, no physical interaction took place, and the situation had been blown out of proportion. There was no surveillance footage or other immediate evidence available to clarify what happened. Officer Brooks, responding to the situation, mentioned that the investigation was still ongoing, as he noted that further interviews with potential witnesses were being conducted. After talking to the police, the boy and his mother decided to leave the library, while the adult remained inside, awaiting further inquiries. The police are now working to speak with additional witnesses to determine the truth of the claims.

Description: LTA YM made customer who had exceeded their study room time by an hour aware that another customer had the room reserved at 1:00pm and asked them to leave the room. The customer waiting for the room waited quietly about 15 feet away from the room. The customer in the study room began to verbally berate the waiting customer who was quietly waiting making comments about his age and insinuating that he was watching her children. At 1:10pm, L1 LB approached the irate customer and said, "This man has a 1:00pm reservation and I think you've gone over your time." The woman said "Does he have to stand there and watch?" LB said that he had a right to stand off to the side. The customer continued to take her time vacating the room. As L3 KK walked up, the customer made more derogatory comments to the man who was waiting. KK introduced herself as the manager and made irate customer aware that she was violating our code of conduct and needed to stop berating the waiting customer and to comply with staff instructions to leave the room. Customer then started berating KK. KK said that if she did not stop, she could lose library privileges. Customer said that KK could not do that and said that she wanted KK's info when she left. At 1:15pm, the woman left the room, she began arguing with KK including saying that she was a veteran and should not be told to leave. KK told her that the conversation was no longer productive and she was going to end the discussion. Woman asked who she could complain to. KK said she appreciated her service as a veteran and provided the woman with Admin's number. Woman declined KK's request for her name asking why she would need it. KK said that we document this type of behavior. Woman said, "Good, now you have more work to do" and left.

Description: L1 NG was doing a patrol of the library and noticed an adult patron in the teen area alongside her child, who is a regular teen known to staff. She politely informed the adult that we do not allow adults in the teen area. The adult said she was there with her child. L1 NG offered to help them all relocate to a different area of the building outside the teen area, or she (L1 NG) could ask the other teens in the area if they were alright with the adult staying. The adult loudly began to question the teens in the area, and L1 NG stopped her and said she (L1 NG) would need to handle that step. The adult slammed her hand on the table and angrily stated that she was going to leave instead. She collected her other child in the children's area, then approached the front desk to retrieve her keys that were given as collateral to staff to borrow a puzzle. While LTA AD was retrieving the keys the patron was ranting and swearing about the situation and L1 NG in particular, then told LTA AD to "tell [L1 NG] that she's a fucking bitch" before leaving the library with her children. Patron will be suspended for 1 month. Staff will serve the suspension notice whenever she returns.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior2.1 Disruptive behavior2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic StressGreen - Low Impact
Description: A patron approached our Vet Sec. security desk on the 1st floor to complain about the Wi-Fi not working on his cell phone. The Vet Sec Guard told the patron to go to the circulation desk to speak with staff. LA MA attempted to help a patron and he was very argumentative with her as she tried to help him. He began pointing his finger at her aggressively and reprimanding us for not knowing it was down. or having issues. After trying for a few minutes to help the patron, she told him that she would get a manager to come down and talk to him about it. The patron asked if the manager was a man or a woman. The patron went back to the guard station to complain and reprimand Vet Sec guard R also asked guard R if the manager was a woman or a man. LA MA had alerted LIC LII JM of the upset patron who was acting aggressively and asked for assistance. The patron kept trying to argue with the Vet Sec guard R about the Wi-Fi issues saying that it's his fault the library Wi-Fi wasn't connecting because we "own the whole thing." LII JM then arrived at the guard station to speak with the patron, introduced herself as the person in charge and asked if she could help him try to connect his phone to Wi-Fi. The patron asked why LII JM would know about his issue and looked back at LA MA at the circulation desk several times over the next few minutes with an intimidating stare. The patron asked several times if LII JM was a manager there and she replied that she was and that she was here to help him with his issue if he would tell her more about it. The patron said that we as the library should know when the Wi-Fi is having issues and that we control the whole thing and so it's our fault that it isn't working. LII JM tried to explain that sometimes the Wi-Fi will just take a few minutes to log in and asked him if he would like to sit down on a bench so that she could try logging into the Wi-Fi on her personal device and see if she could help figure out the issue for him. The patron spoke very quietly the whole time and was mumbling his words so that staff had to keep asking him to repeat what he said because they couldn't hear him. For over 5 minutes JM tried to talk to the man on the bench and he kept arguing and blaming JM for the slow Wi-Fi issue. He claimed that it didn't make any sense because he never had an issue connecting at the Valencia branch. Jessica explained some reasons why we may have a hard time connecting in this building from time to time. JM explained that we do not know that the Wi-Fi is down until someone tells us about it because we do not usually need to use the public Wi-Fi. She told him that she could report it to I.T. and that they would look into it and try to fix it if there is a wide-spread issue. It became obvious that the man only wanted to argue with staff and accuse them of things beyond our control. He was then asked to take his things with him and leave the library for the day. LII JM explained to the man that he would not be allowed to be combative with staff when they were trying to help him and that he would need to leave our library for the day, but that if he left now, he could come back tomorrow if he wished. The patron said that he wasn't going to come back to this library and that he would go to Valencia because their Wi-Fi never had any issues. LII JM said that he could certainly do that, but that he needed to leave now or else he would be facing suspension. The patron said that he would take his phone and his drink but that he wanted the guard to carry out his bag for him. JM replied that she would be happy to help him outside with his bag, but he said that he wanted the guard specifically to do it. JM asked the guard if he would please carry the patron's bag outside for him so that the patron could leave and the guard complied, setting his bag outside the doors and trying to get the patron to follow him out. After arguing for another minute or so, he left the library but then he picked up his bag and came right back inside. He said that he was not going to leave now and that he needed to use the phone. JM asked whether he could use his own phone to make a phone call and he said that he was using his phone to listen to music and so no, he could not. He walked past the guard and LII JM and went to the public phone, disregarding staff. After a few more minutes he came back over and said that when he was at the phone, his cell phone connected to the network. He said that he didn't intend on leaving and stood in front of the children's area. JM said that if he wouldn't leave, he would be considered trespassing and that they would be forced to call police. He told them that they could go ahead and call, he then told JM and guard R "fuck you." JM dialed 911 on the in-charge phone and explained to the dispatcher that there was a patron who had been asked to leave and that he was trespassing on library property. When the patron saw that JM was indeed speaking with the dispatcher, he finally left and walked outside and across the plaza along Stone and towards Pennington. JM explained to the dispatcher that the patron had finally left and that she no longer needed them to come to the library. The patron will be suspended from library property for 2 weeks.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating
Description: On 1/21/25 at approximately 3:35pm it was reported to Branch Manager SH that an adult was waiting to speak with SH about their child being grabbed by an adult male outside of the library near the parking lot around 3pm today. SH spoke with the parent and the youth who had been involved. The youth reported that an older adult male (gray hair, scruffy beard, dirty looking) who had been on his cellphone near the parking lot approached him and his friend and reportedly grabbed him by his left arm and mumbled something about kids not showing respect. The youth said that they told the adult "you can't touch kids", and the adult male said "what are you going to do, snitch on me?" There were no other witnesses present and the youth reported that the male adult immediately left the area afterward. SH encouraged the youth in the future to inform staff immediately after an incident happens rather than waiting over half an hour to report the incident. The parent also told their child that they should immediately notify staff of any weird or unusual behavior to prevent this from happening to someone else. SH was unable to determine the identity of the adult male and the description the youth gave did not match with library patrons who had visited the library during this time, and the youth said they had never seen this person before.

Description: When L2 KVN was setting up for storytime on 1/22/25, she noticed significant stains on east facing large meeting room door. Upon further investigation, in the cameras, a regular male patron has been camping in the corner on days the library is closed and urinating on the door. Camera footage from 1/12/25 at 5:50 pm has been documented as confirmation of these events. L3 KK approached patron on 1/22/25 with backup guard J with L1 JA. KK said that he was observed on the cameras urinating on the door. KK mentioned that the patron may be able to use the restroom at St. Joe's emergency room when the library is closed. Then KK let the patron know that he was suspended for 1 week. Patron packed up and left.

Description: LTA DM reported to Librarian KV that a customer brought in a large cart full of personal belongings and was in the restroom. Lib KV confirmed the items were obstructing the hallway in the front entrance next to the restroom. While Lib KV waited in the hallway to talk to the patron, another person exiting the restroom motioned that someone was smoking inside the restroom. Lib KV walked inside to check and told the customer she cannot smoke and she responded that she lit toilet paper to cover up the smells in the restroom. When she walked out she was informed that she could not bring carts full of belongings inside the library. The off-duty officer BW also asked about her lighting something in the restroom and she reiterated that she lit toilet paper and that she was not doing drugs. The off-duty officer BW and guard CS did not identify the smell as drugs. She was asked to leave for the day.

Description:
Around 11:30, a woman begins setting up a tripod with a camera outside the front entrance to the library. LTA AV notices her pointing the camera into the library. When she realizes that she was being watched by AV, she quickly swivels the camera towards the ground. AV then alerts L1 MNC to the situation.
When L1 MNC went out to speak with her, she was already packing her equipment. He explained the library code of conduct and rules about not filming library patrons in order to protect their privacy while using the library. After indicating that she had filmed a patron walking out of the branch, she questioned if this was a new policy and MNC replied that this had been the library's policy for a few years. She indicated that she understood and then left the property.
Added for documentation purposes.

However, today he was talking out loud to himself and using inappropriate language. LIB III KW approached him to ask that he not use that language as he was around youth in the youth room. He immediately reacted by asking "What are you doing in my house?" and other non reality based statements while flailing his arms and fidgeting wildly. KW backed up and asked him to leave, while he continued to rant and flail, he did begin walking towards the front doors. Guard CS who is also familiar with this individual walked up to him and inquired what was up while walking him out of the building. The other patron started to engage with him, but KW and CS asked her to move on and allow us to take care of the situation. After we had him outside and walking towards the property line, he started to follow the patron who he had called "Bitch" so CS followed him and directed him the rest of the way off of the property.

Description:
Driver DV went to get in his truck at 11:12 on the ORO loading dock. There was a woman standing close by the front of his truck, he asked if she needed help. She said something along the lines of she didn't want to keep him, but she and her husband were having a debate and maybe he could settle it. DV said "where's your husband" and he came out from behind the wall. The woman said she thought DV was safe because of his govt job, but her husband said he was one of them. DV asked "one of what, a county worker?" They said "no - because of your brown skin. You have to be ready because ICE is coming" and maybe it would be safer if he went to Mexico. DV said he was born and raised in Tucson and told them, "I have to go. Have a good day."
This is for documentation purposes only. Neither were on camera. Both were 60s-70s with grey hair, woman had turquoise earrings and black North Face vest, and man had a grey sweater vest with copper framed eyeglasses. They were near a car with Massachusetts plates.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating1.1.7 Harassing or stalking1.1.7.1 Harassment: Filming or photographing without permission1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description:
At approximately 2:02 pm, L3 LD handles a closed stacks item to a group of teenage students and directs them to an empty table next to Emily. Emily states that she is autistic to the group of students and begins asking them where they are from, the group responds ?from Arizona, California, New Mexico, India? Emily states she is also from Arizona, then proceeds to ask where their parents are from. Emily interrupts them to tell them in a loud and condescending voice that they are not allowed to take photographs of closed stacks materials, now L3 LD approaches the situation and explains to Emily that they are allowed to take photographs of the material. Guard J asks the group if they would like to move to another table, they agreed to move. Emily asks for LD?s full name and asks what her title is. Emily asks L3 LD where she is from, LD answers that she does not need to provide with any personal information. Emily asks again the same question and asks if LD is American, and that she is doing an American Audit, LD again answers that she does not need to provide with that information. Emily also states that if LD was American LD will be saying it. Emily demands to know who LD?s supervisor is, LD provides with the name and number. Emily calls LD?s supervisor and hangs up. Emily then begins filming the group of teenage students and accuses them of taking photographs of the material. L3 LD approaches Emily and lets her know she cannot film patrons. Emily states she will be calling the police; LD locates the off-duty officer and asks him to assist. LD asks Emily to leave the library.

Upon further investigation, it was brought to L3 LD attention that Emely had prior similar interactions with staff and patrons.
On Tuesday January 28th, LTA MG was shelving books at approximately 11:40 am, LTA MG heard Emily Holcomb instructing a group of teens that the books on the 3rd floor are not for check out. Emily asked the teens where they were from and if they were American Citizens. LTA MG intervened in the conversation to explain that only reference materials are not for check out, but anything else can be checked out. Emily Holcomb did not like LTA MG?s intervention and demanded to know what the library is doing to recover lost books. LTA MG advised patron to a different floor to speak with a supervisor.


On Wednesday January 29th at approximately 1pm, Emily Holcomb approaches LTA Supervisor EB and asks if she speaks Spanish. EB answers that she does, then Emily asks EB if she can speak to her in Spanish, EB says a work in Spanish ?Si?, Emily immediately accuses EB of not knowing Spanish and proceeds to ask her where she is from in a demanding way. EB responds, Emily does not like EB?s answers and keeps asking exactly where she is from. EB responds again, Emily leaves the conversation abruptly

Her complaints have escalated into threats such as "ONCE INDIVIDUALS GIVE ME NAMES EVERYONE WILL BE HANDLE WITH BEAT UP BRICK TOWRDS FACE OR BOTTLE/GLASS". L3 LM and L1 BC spoke with Ms. Oliver today and she said she didn't agree with anything we said. She got up and walked away. LM told her that if she writes more letters complaining about staff to Askalibrarian, she will be suspended for one year for threatening us.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Children in the Library~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior2.1 Disruptive behavior2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others~Children in the Library4.2 Leaving child unsupervised or ignoring disruptive behavior of child~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic StressYellow - Moderate Impact
Description:
Regular patrons of mother, young son, and their therapist were using study room A for the child's therapy session. The child displayed behavior including loud yelling and screaming, throwing chairs, slamming on the glass walls with his hands, laying on his back to kick the glass walls with both feet with all his strength, slapping and hitting his mother, and saying the word "fuck" repeatedly. The shouting and pounding on the glass could be heard in the public space as well as the staff space, causing a disruption to the other patrons in the library. Staff were also concerned for the safety of the three involved patrons, and for the library furniture and equipment.
L1 NG entered the study room to speak to the adults about the child's behavior. NG let them know that it looked like this wasn't a good day for him to be in the library and that his behaviors violate our code of conduct. NG also explained that the library tries to be a safe and inclusive space and that we want them in the library, but these particular behaviors were not acceptable. The mother responded defensively, telling NG first that they could not ask the child to alter his behavior because that would "make him worse," and then accusing the library of discriminating against disabilities.
NG asked L3 AG for backup, and AG entered the room. The mother immediately said that they would go and began trying to get the child ready to go, who was still hitting and slapping her, slapping the therapist's equipment, and swearing. Because they were leaving, AG went to write down the number for Library Admin to offer to the mother, while NG began searching for resources for the mother and therapist. AG offered the mother Admin's number, which she refused but promised she would call anyway.
After mother and child left, NG returned to the study room to speak with the therapist, who had stayed behind. The therapist was not aware of any alternative space to conduct therapy sessions and asked NG where she was supposed to go instead. NG offered to take her phone number in case she was able to locate other resources. The therapist provided the phone number of her broader organization/employer.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior

Description: On Friday, 1/31/25 at approximately 8:30am it was reported to Branch Manager SH that an elderly man had yelled at one of the delivery drivers telling them to get out of the way. SH spoke with the delivery driver and they reported that during their delivery they were yelled at by an elderly man about blocking other county vehicles from using the delivery drive. There apparently was another county vehicle with a trailer that was waiting for the delivery driver to move and this person took it upon themselves to inform the delivery driver that they needed to move their vehicle. SH later determined that the person who was yelling at the driver was Mr. Littlepage. SH had a conversation with Mr. Littlepage about preventing staff from doing their jobs and the severity of harassing county staff while conducting their duties. SH informed Mr. Littlepage that he would be suspended if there is continued behavior like this. Mr. Littlepage apologized and said he would not "speak to county staff and would mind his own business next time".

Instead he shared his plans to "walk into traffic" and immediately left the property. The Crisis Line was contacted and they contacted 911 to send officers to search for the customer. Officers arrived minute later to get a description of the events before leaving to find him. For documentation purposes.

Description: At approximately 3:10pm, 5 TPD officers arrived at the library and headed straight to the teen area. Officers walked straight to Seth Burton and Christian Vasquez, asked them to remove their backpacks, after searching them and their belongings, officers found kitchen knives and BB guns in their possessions. Both Seth and Christian were seen outside City High intimidating school students and staff by brandishing their knives, City High had to go into soft lockdown. Both Seth and Christian left City High premises before police arrived and headed to the library.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description:
During the 12pm-1pm hour on 2/1, LTASup AM took a phone call from an "upset" patron who reported that someone vandalized her car with a "sticker" and an "unknown substance." She wanted access to camera footage, claiming the incident took place between 10am and 11am. AM documented the call and told her the Assistant Manager would give her a call back. AM reported the patron speaking with a "raised voice" and being "difficult to understand."
When L2 KVN returned from lunch, she watched security camera footage.
Patron Nicole Hill was not parked in the library parking lot, but instead against the curb on Emergency Rd (leading to the St. Joseph's ER). Nicole claimed that her car "conked out" which is why she had to park there. She can be seen at 4:14pm on 1/31 driving through the library parking lot and reversing to the spot on Emergency Rd where she remained parked over night until 12:10pm on 2/1.
Ms. Hill could be seen leaving her vehicle to enter the library at around 10:28am on 2/1. She returned to her vehicle briefly at 10:42am. She then went back into the library and did not go back to her vehicle until 12:10pm, when she left for the day.
At 11:43am, a car can be seen pulling up next to the drivers side of Ms. Hill's vehicle and stopping briefly. That is the only footage KVN saw that might have led to the vandalism.
Nicole Hill called back at 2pm on 2/1, and reported being "upset" that no one had called her back. KVN had spent the 2pm - 3pm hour on desk + reviewing camera footage.
KVN asked for clarification on what happened. Ms. Hill stated someone had "walked past" her car and put a sticker saying "Repent and Get Busy" along with hot sauce on the drivers side of her car. She said this must have happened between 10am - 11:30am. She was calmer while on the phone with KVN and spoke at a normal volume.
KVN explained that she had reviewed the camera footage and did not see anyone walk past Ms. Hill's vehicle. Ms. Hill said she talked to the security guard and the security guard told her there are cameras all around the building and if it was a library patron the police can access that footage. KVN explained that because the drivers side of her car was facing away from the cameras, any footage would likely not provide adequate evidence to help with identifying anyone. KVN told her that she was still able to follow the processes to obtaining the records through law enforcement if she wanted to see the footage, but that no camera angle from the library would capture the drivers side of her vehicle.
Ms. Hill inquired where the "best place to park is" so that "these incidents will be covered on camera." KVN explained that the security cameras are intended to protect the library building and parking lot, and therefore the best place to park for camera protection would be in the parking lot. Ms. Hill argued that she would not have been able to park in the library parking lot over night because "[the library] would have towed her car" which is why she was parking on Emergency Rd. KVN explained that she was not accusing Ms. Hill of any wrongdoing, just answering her question.
Ms. Hill thanked KVN for the information. This incident reported is for documentation purposes only.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Leaving dog tied outside
Description:
A female patron approached the desk asking for a water bowl for a dog left tied outside. L2 KVN walked outside with her to discover a regular patron's dog tied to a bench outside.
KVN approached the dog and, since she knew he was friendly and saw his owner in her truck in the parking lot, started untying the dog from the bench with Guard DC as backup.
The dog's owner immediately approached and said "that's my dog." KVN said "yes, and we have told you before you cannot leave your dog tied outside and unattended."
The owner argued that she "cannot get him out of her truck" after she parks (an explanation she used previously) so she has to tie him up. KVN told her that is not acceptable and she either needs to find another place to park or another way to travel and transport her dog, because she cannot leave him unattended or tied outside. The patron argued it was "only for 5 minutes," and KVN responded that it was enough time for other patrons to become concerned and report to KVN at the desk asking for water for her dog.
The patron continued to try to argue so KVN explained that if she leaves her dog unattended, an aggressive dog could come by and attack her dog and she would not be present to protect him.
KVN told her this was her final warning. KVN explained that if her dog is found tied up or unattended again, library staff are required to call PACC. KVN told her that she needs to follow library policy and keep her dog with her at all times or she may be suspended from the library.
Patron indicated she understood at the end of the conversation.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description:
As a female patron from a community group was reporting the room count at the service desk with LTASup AM, LTA YM, and L2 KVN, another regular female patron walked out of the women's restroom, pointed at her, and started yelling.
She yelled "I do not have a domestic violence charge, lady."
The female patron was confused and gave KVN, AM, and YM a concerned look. KVN held up a hand to indicate to the patron at the desk that it was okay.
The regular female patron continued yelling at her and other patrons as she walked past out the front door "so you can take that information and shove it up your ass. You are all cunts."
She was still yelling incoherently outside.
KVN apologized to the female patron at the desk and explained the yelling was not directed at her.
This female patron has a history of yelling randomly and using profane language. While her behavior is suspected to be related to mental health concerns, she is now suspended for 1 week due to her directing her profane language at the patron at the desk and the patrons in the lobby.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.3 Theft~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Description:
On Monday 2/3/25 at approximately 4:00pm it was reported to Branch Manager SH that a young teenaged female had reported that she had a personal book stolen from where she was sitting at in the public area by the adult magazines. SH Spoke with the female youth who identified herself as Grace. Grace reported that there were several male youth around the area and had been looking "oddly" at her. Grace said that she had left the area temporarily and when she came back her book was gone. SH told her that library staff would look for the book and hopefully someone grabbed it mistakenly. Grace did not leave contact information but left soon after. Library staff looked for the book but were not able to find it. Around 5:40pm it was reported to SH that the book had been found by a library page on a table in the children's area, which was on the opposite side of the library. The book will be returned to Grace upon her next library visit.
This incident is for documentation purposes only.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description:
On Monday 2/3/25 at approximately 4pm Branch Manager SH was notified that Officer Alvarez from the Marana Police Department was at the front desk. SH spoke with the officer and Officer Alvarez informed SH that they had found a backpack belonging to Mr. Littlepage at the Walmart by the library and were trying to return his backpack to him. Officer Alvarez asked SH if Mr. Littlepage was in the building and SH told her she was welcome to look for him. Officer Alvarez said that since Mr. Littlepage is often around the library they would continue to look for him outside to return his belongings to him.
This incident is for documentation purposes only.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description:
At the beginning of February 2025, Page SM received a call and quietly answered on the corner next to the mysteries section. The patron approached her and told her to "shut up" and to "get out" in an intimidating manner. SM stood in shock and didn't respond; she simply hung up the phone. The patron then returned to the alcove where she usually sits.
On later dates, as SM passed the alcove, the patron muttered curse words under her breath while looking at her screen.
This patron is a regular, and this is being documented in case of future incidents.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic StressRed - High Impact (Please click Notifications > Email aliases > Copy Trauma Informed Care Team if your location would like to request group EAP support)
Description:
On February 4, 2025, At a staff organized health fair, regular customer WH approached L1 HT and engaged in talk about the event. He then asked L1 HT go with him on a trip to Los Angles to go camping and line dancing. HT declined that offer.



On 2/12 L3 MS spoke to customer WH about making inappropriate advances to a library staff member.


L3 MS recounted to him their understanding that on 2/4 during a library program, WH approached L1 HT and asked her ?...to go camping and line dancing...? with him. L3 MS expressed that this was inappropriate behavior for the library setting that we would not tolerate, and L3 MS asked him to strictly avoid future interactions with L1 HT. He reacted with anger at first and said, ?Fine, I?ll just never talk with her,? L3 MS agreed that this was what was being asked of him. WH started to escalate and angrily said, ?Why is she making such a big deal out of this?? At which point L3 MS expressed that it wasn?t the staff member in question ?making a big deal,? but rather this was L# MS concerned for everyone's safety and that I was following library rules and procedures. He considered this and dropped his fight and agreed to the terms. He has since returned to the library three times, and to my knowledge he has held up his end of the agreement to not interact with this particular staff member. 
On 2/18 LA BF was exiting the library at 5PM and that as she opened the staff door, the noise got the attention of WH, who was standing in the breezeway at the time, and he stepped out to look around the corner and then turned back. LA BF stopped and returned to warn the others and L1 HT about this sighting. WH was gone when LA BF left escorted.
2.28.25 around 12:05 pm L1 AM was walking into library from rear staff parking lot and noticed WH above on the second level parking scanning the staff parking lot. When he noticed L1 AM he paused, kept scanning and then turned and left, AM then heard a car being turned on.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others
Description: On 5/20/25 at approximately 5:30pm Librarian II, JM, notified Branch Manager, SH, that a youth had reported being kicked by Mr. Littlepage earlier in the afternoon. The youth also reported that Mr. Littlepage had just taken away his basketball and took it up to the front desk after hearing someone bouncing the ball in the library. JM and SH spoke with the youth and it was reported that that Mr. Littlepage and the youth were sitting at computers across from each other and Mr. Littlepage kicked under the desk hitting the youth in the shin. The youth reported they then went to Homework Help and afterward came back to the computers in the public area. At this point the youth's sibling began bouncing a basketball in the library and Mr. Littlepage got up from his seat at the computer and walked over to the youth and took the ball away, telling them "they could pick up their ball at the front desk". Mr. Littlepage then gave the ball to desk staff and walked back to his computer. JM and SH later spoke with Mr. Littlepage and Mr. Littlepage did agree that he had heard a ball bouncing and walked over and picked it up off the floor and carried it to the front desk, and did tell a youth they could "get their ball from the front desk on their way out". Mr. Littlepage vehemently denied ever coming into physical contact with the youth and said he knew it was inappropriate to ever engage in such behavior. He stated that he had no recollection of ever interacting with the youth until he walked over and took the ball from him. SH has instructed Mr. Littlepage in the past that he should never take matters into his own hands, and should always only bring the issue to library staff's attention and allow them to handle whatever issue is occurring. Because Mr. Littlepage continues to ignore this direction and did admit to trying to resolve this situation on his own he will be suspended for one month. Mr. Littlepage will be issued his suspension letter upon his next visit to the library.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description: A woman named Marcella came into QUI and asked to speak to the head librarian. She was holding some of the red cards that have information on them about 4th and 5th amendment rights, translated into several languages. She told L3 LM that she is "enraged" by the cards and that it is illegal for a public library to have them out for distribution. She said it is a violation of immigration law and that she was going to report it to INS (her words). LM explained that most PCPL public libraries carry these cards in their citizenship corners, along with other information for immigrants. She went to the citizenship corner and took a lot of pictures of all the information there. She asked for phone numbers of people in admin which LM provided. She said she would be calling admin to complain.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating1.2 Guns, weapons, machetes, knives
Description:
Around 4:10pm on 2/5, L1 JC alerted L2 MG that Lucio disclosed that he had brought his BB gun into the library. L2 MG spoke to Lucio, who denied it. Based on previous incident (0000023207) L2 MG told Lucio to leave for the day. On 2/6 L2 MG reviewed the camera footage. She was able to confirm that Lucio did bring the BB gun into the library. At 4:06pm he can be seen pointing it at another juvenile patron. Since this is his second such offense, in accordance with LRPY guidelines for infraction 1.1.7, he will be suspended for two months.
After discussing this incident in theRestorative Practices Drop-In Session on 2/6 with LSM LF, LSM VL, and L2 KW, the suspension will be extended to one year with option to appeal.

Description: Around 4:40 patron Ithzel requested to use the desk phone. As staff allows for quick calls, L2 MG permitted this. When Ithzel was on the phone, she began to use profane language such as "why is the f****** baby crying." L2 MG let Ithzel know that offensive words were not permitted in the library. Ithzel indicated she understood. She then asked for money from the person on the phone, once again using profane language and saying things like "if you don't give me my f****** stuff," "I just need a little money." L2 MG discerned this was not an appropriate use of library equipment and told Ithzel she had to end her call. Ithzel ended it saying "I need to go before I sp*z out on someone here." After hanging up, Ithzel asked L2 MG if she could use the phone again. L2 MG denied the request and issued a verbal warning that due to the profane language used and the inappropriate nature of the call she could not make another call.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description:
LTA Supervisor AM came to get Librarian I KB to say that a customer in the computer area told AM to get KB because a fight may soon break out in the computer area. AM, KB, and VetSec guard JR went into the computer area but everyone appeared calm and quiet. After a minute or two, customer Phil and customer Jesse A Hill, who were seated across the area from each other, started to exchange words. KB told them both to be quiet and stop interacting with each other. KB said that if they have a problem with another customer to come up to the desk to report it. Phil responded that that is what he did. (Phil had complained to AM and L3 KK earlier in the day about Jesse; KB was not aware of this previous interaction.)
Things quieted down for a while but Jesse (who said he was "high as a kite" during an earlier interaction at the customer service desk) became agitated and got up and started in on Phil again. Phil yelled at Jesse to leave him and his dog alone while Phil walked out of the building. KB allowed Phil and his dog to leave, intercepting Jesse to allow Phil to get out of the building without Jesse following him. Jesse tried to get on various public PCs before giving up, walking around for a little while, and leaving about 5 minutes or so after Phil left.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description: Marcella Edwards called again today (from incident0000024147). She said we are in violation of the constitution by having the red cards available, that we are coaching illegal immigrants to evade, obstruct and thwart immigration law, that we are committing a felony by providing the cards. She said she had reported it to ICE and that I (L3 LM) could be arrested for breaking the law for putting out "disgusting garbage" for customers. She said she is a naturalized citizen and that her father didn't rape women or commit human trafficking to get here. LM again gave her the number for administration and told her she could call admin with her complaint.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior2.9 Bringing in an animal other than service animal, or disruptive service animal2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: L3 KK heard a dog barking loudly and aggressively from her office. The dog was standing next to a woman using the phone and Guard JR reported the dog had been barking at another customer's dog. L1 KB told the woman to keep her dog under control. About 2 minutes later, the woman's dog began barking aggressively again. KK told the woman her dog was being disruptive and the dog needed to leave property. Due to previous incidents, KK told the woman the dog could not be left unattended on the property. At 4pm, KK and JR saw that the dog was in the woman's vehicle in the sun with the windows slightly cracked open. The dog was panting and in distress. KK found the woman on a computer and told her the door was in distress. The woman quickly packed up her items. As she was leaving, KK advised the woman that if the dog was left unattended on property again, she would be suspended from library use.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating
Description:
On Thursday, February 6, around 3:15pm, L1 EG saw two tweens, Tarzan (or Hubert) and Michael enter a study room. They have a history of behavioral issues, being disruptive and bothering other patrons. EG asked them to stop banging on the windows. There were three other people in the room: Jordan (a black female), and two unidentified tweens. EG knew that Jordan had experienced bullying from Tarzan and Michael?s friend group in the past. While EG was speaking with Tarzan and Michael, Jordan looked at EG and seemed uncomfortable. EG asked if Jordan wanted the boys removed from the room, and she said they were not invited in. EG tried to get the boys to leave, and Jordan left the room. Meanwhile, the girl who had initially booked the room (Rosemary) disappeared while EG was speaking to the boys.
At around 3:40pm, EG spoke to an upset parent, Rosemary?s father, who said she had been slapped and asked to see video footage. EG explained the camera policies and told him we have been seeing increased negative behaviors from this group, though no one had reported an assault. The father asked if he could file a police report and EG told him he was welcome to do so. After he left, EG tried to learn more from the kids in the building and she was stopped by Michael?s mother, who was concerned that her son was being accused of assault. EG told she didn?t know exactly who was involved, but there had been behavioral issues with Michael?s group and Michael had been reproached for this behavior in the past. Michael then left with his mother.
EG spoke with the remaining three children, including Tarzan/Hubert, attempting LRPY-style conversations. Due to Tarzan?s recent behavior, his involvement in this incident and his continued proximity to negative interactions, he would be suspended for a month. He did not argue and seemed to accept that this was an adequate consequence to his behavior.
Lib III, BL, looked at the camera footage but couldn?t see detailed movements in the room. Nothing stood out in terms of assault, but she could see Tarzan and Michael hugging at one point. Michael came in the next day and EG and BL spoke with him privately. He admitted that either he or Tarzan accidentally hit Rosemary as they were hugging. We had a LRPY conversation, explaining that the consequences of the action, as well as the bigger issues of them engaging in other negative behavior in the library, entering the room uninvited and not doing the normal things you?d do when you accidentally hit someone (apologize, ask if they?re okay, ask how you can help, etc). We agreed that Tarzan and Michael would be suspended for two weeks. Michael was very polite and seemed to understand our reasoning.
