Description: LTA Supervisor AM said that Jesse Hill was vaping in the lab and starting a fight with another customer. L3 KK, L1 JA, and Guard JR approached and Jesse was engaged in a loud and threatening verbal fight with another customer and had a vape in his hand. KK told both customers to stop arguing. The other customer complied. KK told Jesse to leave the building. He asked why and KK told him he needed to leave because he was vaping drugs in the computer lab. Jesse refused to leave and began to stare down KK in a menacing manner. KK instructed JA to call 911. KK moved away from the area and tried to keep the other customers in the area safe. There was a Saint Michael's School class visit happening next to the altercation. JR stayed in the area. Jesse left after arguing for a few minutes with JR. 911 call was cancelled.Due to safety concerns, customer was not told he is suspended for a year.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct
Description: A regular customer approached the desk and said "aren't you not allowed to have a Black History Month display?" SB and JNB clarified this didn't apply to PCPL locations as they aren't federal buildings. The customer said loudly "Ok, I just hate Trump, I wish someone would blow up the Super Bowl." SL was walking past as she said this and told her it wasn't appropriate. This is just for documentation.

Infractions: null2.1 Disruptive behavior2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~null1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating
Description: Two youth entered the Teen space in the later part of the 2-3pm hour appearing high and making repeated statements such as "f*ck that n*gga" and similar language. LA MKA also overheard a youth sitting at a Teen computer close to the staff desk state that he was "waiting on my homeboy to bring me some weed", at which point LA MKA informed IC. IC AW and L3 LD asked the three teens to leave for the day, two of the teens complied with the request. The teen that made the "waiting" remark went back to his computer, L3 LD informed the teen that he needed to leave, teen was not responding to LD's request. LD requested assistance from security guard R to escort teen out of the library. Teen angrily threw his backpack to the floor and started calling LD a "bitch". LD informed the teen that he will not be suspended for 1 month for his behavior. Teen exited the library insulting LD and shouting as he made his way out.

Infractions: Children in the Library4.2 Leaving child unsupervised or ignoring disruptive behavior of child
Description:
L1 RK pointed out to L3 AG a child who had been in a library program the previous day; RK thought the child might be about 5. AG also thought the child looked young, and didn't appear to have an adult present. AG approached the child and asked if she was here with an adult. Child said she was not, so AG asked how old she was. Child said she was 7. AG asked if she was here with anyone at all, and she said she had two other family members with her. AG asked how old they were, child said they were 9 and 11. AG explained the Unattended child policy to the three of them and asked them to please call an adult caregiver to come be with them or pick them up, and that she would be happy to explain the policy to their adult. The children refused and said that all their adults were busy or too far away. AG explained that unfortunately the youngest couldn't be here and reiterated that they should call someone. The three children left with a copy of the Unattended Minors policy.
About 5 minutes later a patron reported that there were 3 young kids sitting outside and that they had asked her something. AG went outside to find the three kids sitting on a front bench. AG asked if they had someone coming to pick them up. They said an aunt was coming but that she was coming by bus and it would be a while. AG said that they could remain on the property while they waited (it was a pleasant 75 degrees out), but explained how important it was for them to be picked up before the library closed at 5. AG explained that she knew this wasn't fun but that it was for the safety of the youngest, and again offered to speak with their adult when they arrived.
Several staff members and the VetSec guard did visual checks on them regularly over the next hour or so. By about 4:20pm the children appeared to have been picked up, but staff did not see it happen.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic StressGreen - Low Impact
Description:
Around 3:35 L1 JC and LTAS GG heard yelling in the teen room. L1 JC entered the teen room to find Calvin visibly distressed, L1 JC suggested that Calvin take a few deep breaths and a drink of water. After doing so Calvin disclosed to L1 JC that another juvenile patron, Vicente had been verbally harassing him. L1 JC suggested that he take a break from the room and return. Upon returning to the teen room Calvin slammed the door fairly hard. L1 JC reentered the teen room and asked Calvin to leave for the day, Calvin complied.L1 JC and LTAS GG reviewed the security camera footage, after a verbal exchange between the two, Calvin pulled Vicente from the chair and the two began to grapple. Calvin then throws his backpack at a computer chair and then throws another chair to the floor. Since Calvin had already left for the day, we did not get a chance to speak with him regarding his actions. Next time he comes into the library he will be suspended for three weeks.
L1 JC then pulled Vicente into the hallway to ask about what happened from his point of view. Vicente, stated that he "couldn't remember" what had happened. L1 JC asked him to leave for the day. After conferring with L2 MG it was determined that Vicente will be suspended for a week for verbally harassing Calvin.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior2.1 Disruptive behavior2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: A woman came up to the desk with a guest pass, and said the printer wouldn't work when she put her debit card in it. L3 LM looked up the print job, and saw that it was for 82 pages. She told the woman that she could print with a debit card if she broke up the print job into two sections, to make the transaction $5 or less, or LM could release it from the desk if she paid for the prints in cash. The woman got very agitated, said she didn't have cash and couldn't break up the document into sections. She said loudly, 'So you're telling me I can't do this?" multiple times. LM said that she would print it if the woman brought in $8.20. The woman started speaking loudly, saying "You're making me go to Circle K to get cash?" multiple times. She continued arguing loudly with LM until the guard came to the desk and LM said she wouldn't be able to help her until she brought the money in. The woman said, "F* you" and left. She will be suspended for one month for not complying with staff and cursing at a staff member.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
The men's restroom was placed out of order at 3pm due to excessive water on the floor. The source and condition of the water was undetermined. LTA AB placed an out-of-order sign on the door and a cone in front of the door.
At 4:45pm, a regular male patron opened the men's restroom, looked at the floor, and entered the restroom and locked it. Guard M saw him disregard the out-of-order sign and the cone so she knocked on the door and asked him to exit.
He exited the men's restroom and argued there was no water on the floor so he could use the restroom. She told him it did not matter, the restroom was out-of-order and he needed to use the family restrooms in the front.
The patron asked Guard M "Are you Mexican?" Guard M reported being surprised and answering "yes," to which the patron respond "You're all failures." He then walked away.
L2 KVN provided the patron with a copy of the Code of Conduct and explained that because he failed to follow staff directions to not use the men's restroom, and (most important) because he made derogatory comments about the guard, he is being suspended for 1 month. The patron argued but eventually complied and left the building.
Update 2/13/25: At the end of the day on 2/8/25, Guard M reported the patron attempted to stay on property and sit on the benches in front of the building. Guard M informed him he needed to leave the property entirely. He attempted to argue with her so she walked away. He gathered his belongings and as he was leaving the property, he flipped her off.
Upon further review of this incident, this patron's suspension has been extended to a 3-month suspension.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.4 Vandalizing property
Description: On Monday 2/10/25 @ approximately 9:30 am LTA AV informed Branch Manager SH that a large exterior window pane had been broken on the east side of the library. Only one of the window panes was broken. There was no damage to the inner pane nor to the interior of the library. Marana police were notified and responded(Officer Kesterson, case 2502-0507) as well as Facilities. A work order for replacement of the exterior window pane has been submitted.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior2.2 Strong odors2.11 Belongings: Bringing in or storing~Use and preservation of library materials and propertyUse and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: wrote curse words on concrete bench outside the library
Description:
Three homeless men came into the library and sat near the patio. They had all their belongings around them. There was a very strong smell surrounding them which the guard described as "skunk weed". It was so strong that the guard and staff felt sick to their stomachs. One man went out on the patio and lay down to sleep. The other two sat near the patio door with their belongings. L3 LM, L1 BC and guard DK went outside and asked the man lying down to gather his belongings and leave due to the very strong smell. They noticed the smell was still permeating the area around the other two men, so L3 asked them to leave as well, showing them the code of conduct. The men slowly got up to leave, and asked what level of odor they could have before being asked to leave the library. LM again showed them the code of conduct with the "strong odors" part highlighted. The men said they would call the governor, congress and Trump to complain. LM gave them the number for admin to call.
Follow up: Staff noticed curse words written on the concrete block bench outside QUI (on library property). On reviewing footage, she saw the men writing on the concrete block. They will be suspended for one month.

Infraction Categories: Medical 911~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Medical 911~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic StressYellow - Moderate Impact
Description: A patron came in with her husband to work on the computer, she decided to leave and walk home. She came back into the library about 15 min later limping and panting asking for help because she had just been bitten by a dog. The patron showed Branch Manager MS her bleeding wound on the back of her left leg right above the back of the knee. MS ask her if she wanted her to call 911 and the patron said yes. The husband to the patron was getting angry and aggressive and said that he wanted the sheriff to come, because there were a lot of dogs in the area of their house and the library. 911 instructed MS to apply pressure to the patron's wound and MS gave the patron a trauma pad from the first aid kit to cover her wound and apply pressure. MS had the patron sit in a chair until paramedics arrived. Paramedics arrived at 2:45 to tend to the patron who was bitten and two Sheriff's deputies arrived at 2:50pm to talk to the patron and her husband to deal with the dog situation. They left at 3:00pm.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment1.2 Guns, weapons, machetes, knives~Disruptive Personal Behavior2.1 Disruptive behavior2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic StressYellow - Moderate Impact
Description: A patron (patron #2) sitting on the 2nd floor tables and began ?working on his music? with headphones on and rapping out loud. This started to irritate a regular library patron named Anthony at the next table who was reading. Patron #2 kept rapping and using language that was not appropriate for the library such as ?f*ck,? ?B*tch? and ?n*gga? Loud enough to disturb other patrons around him. This went on for about 10 -15 more minutes until patron Anthony tried to get the attention of Patron #2 and asked if he would ?keep it down? because he was ?trying to read.? Anthony told Patron #2 that he could check out a study room and Patron #2 began making threats toward Patron Anthony, telling him to mind his own ?fucking business? and that he would come over and kick Patron Anthony?s ass. Anthony asked Patron #2 again if he could keep it down and he disregarded the request, put on his sunglasses and began rapping louder. At this point, the argument became loud enough that it could be heard from the information desk and LIC LII JM who was engaged in a conversation with a patron at the information desk came over to see what the fighting was about. LII JM approached the desk where Patron #2 was sitting and asked what the issue was and why he was cursing. Patron #2 did not respond and kept rapping and cursing. LII JM went to find a Vet Sec Guard to assist her in case she had to ask patron #2 to leave. JM and Vet Sec Guard B approached Patron #2 and asked if he could please keep it down and stop cursing in the library and told him that fighting was not allowed in the library. Patron #2 said that he was a grown-ass adult and he could do what he wanted. Vet Sec Guard B told Patron #2 that there were children on that floor and that it wasn?t appropriate for him to be cursing loud enough for them to hear. Patron #2 said ?fuck this shit? and stated that Patron Anthony wouldn?t leave him alone and that he had come into the main library several times before and his rapping and cursing had never been a issue before. LII JM told Patron #2 that it was time for him to leave for the day and the Patron gathered his things and kept cursing as LII JM and Vet Sec Guard B said that they would give the patron some room to get his stuff together and exited the stacks area to wait for him. JM went to the Information desk to update staff in the IC phone that a patron was being asked to leave. Patron Anthony then became upset and went to the desk to report to staff that when the other patron was leaving he had flashed a knife that he had sheathed and hanging on his pants and threatened Patron Anthony. Patron Anthony told staff that he felt scared to go outside after closure because he thought the patron may hurt him. Patron Anthony is houseless and Vet Sec Guard B told him what he would need to do to file a report, but since the patron had left on his own, staff had not had to call police. After staff ensured that Patron #2 had exited the building and walked across the plaza they went to speak to Patron Anthony and get further information from him about the threat which staff did not see, but can be seen on the camera footage. Patron will be suspended for 90 days for threatening a patron and disregarding staff requests about his behavior.

The man got agitated, argued loudly and said, "F* you" to LM and DK. Customers at the branch looked on and later told us they felt afraid. Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description:
Tween patron Rashad asked to use the phone at the info desk. L1 KN overheard part of the conversation, including him telling his brother to come to the library because "these kids are saying they're going to beat me up" and he needed his help, possibly implying that he intended to fight on library property. After he ended the call L1 KN attempted to have a conversation with him and he refused, saying it was "his personal business". L1 KN informed Rashad that if he refused to discuss it he would need to leave the library, which he did. Shortly after, Rashad returned with his mother, Alaa, who confronted L1 KN for "throwing Rashad out of the library". L1 KN informed Alaa that Rashad was asked to leave because he refused to discuss a safety concern involving the library. Alaa spoke with Rashad privately, who then changed his mind and spoke with L1 KN. Rashad stated that tween patrons Francisco and Leiland had stated that they were going to take him outside and beat him up. Alaa said Rashad has been hurt by "these kids" before, which L1 KN clarified did not occur on library property. L1 KN explained that Rashad's phone conversation implied that he was going to start a fight on library property, which was why L1 KN insisted on discussing the issue. Both Alaa and Rashad were informed that they need to come to library staff with safety concerns related to things that happen on library property (and that staff have no ability to affect things that do not happen on library property).
L1 KN conferred with other staff, who agreed that both Francisco and Leiland have been warned about this type of threatening language/behavior before. Because of this it was decided to suspend both tweens for 1 week. L1 KN informed them of their suspension and gave them their suspension letters, which they threw away before exiting the library.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Made Nazi salute at adult computers

While LI JCB was talking to Juma she noticed Faustin holding his hand in the Nazi salute and continuing to play his game. JCB asked him to leave and he looked at her and said "what am I doing, Miss?" JCB told him that she would discuss it in the lobby. Faustin refused and JCB walked into the lobby. The guard (CS) came and stood behind Faustin until he joined JCB in the library. She informed him that he was out for the rest of the day and that tomorrow (2/14) the staff would tell him how long his suspension was.

Description: L1 KB observed a woman berating and insulting individuals sharing religious info in the designated exterior info sharing space. Among other things, she accused them of being pedophiles. L3 KK and Guard JR approached the woman in the computer lab. The woman repeatedly ignored KK as KK asked to speak to her. When KK and JR did not walk away, the woman said she was "busy" and told KK and JR to "go away." KK again said that she needed to speak to the her. The woman shouted that library staff were "promoting pedophiles" and said that the group outside was responsible for her "disability" and the library "had them out there all the time." Her shouting disrupted everyone in the lab area. The woman then announced she was leaving and left.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior2.1 Disruptive behavior2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: L1 HP was working on a book display near the adult computers when she hear one of the teens, Martine, sitting in the are call another "little bitch." Recognizing that this teen was one of our regulars, who had already been involved in disruptive behavior at the information desk that day, L1 HP told Martine it was time to leave for the day. He told L1 HMP that he was just kidding, but L1 HMP said that he still needed to leave. Martine then started looking at his phone and ignoring the request. L1 HP repeated that he needed to leave, to which Martine told her to "be patient," and "give me a minute, Jesus Christ." He then told L1 HMP to "keep your cool," and "I don't like your attitude." At this point, L1 HP told Martine that if he didn't leave now, that he would be suspended. He made a face and laughed, so L1 HMP walked away to find the IC librarian, L1 JB. When L1 HP and L1 JB returned to the area, Martine was leaving. Based on the disruptive behavior and failing to comply with staff requests, Martine will be suspended for 3 days starting 2/15/25.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: A young woman with a baby and an older woman were using the study room. The baby was crying loudly for a long time. Lib II SW opened the door and asked if everything was okay. They said the baby wanted her binky which they left at home. They asked if SW was asking them to leave because they had been "kicked out of libraries before." SW told them the baby seemed very upset and it might be better if they left. Things quieted down for a while. Then the baby started crying and one of the woman said, "shut the hell up." SW opened the door again. By then the women looked calm and the baby was smiling. Their time was up in the study room. SW told them they could use it for another 20 minutes, and then they should leave. They left without further incident.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and propertyUse and preservation of library materials and property: Other not listed: Removing item from library bulletin board
Description: LTA EC observed a patron rip down a paper posted to the bulletin board in the children's area. LTA EC informed LTA sup MB and L1 KN of the incident. L1 KN checked the board and noted that a branch newsletter (which was an out-of-date January edition) had been removed. L1 KN approached the patron, introduced herself, and mentioned that a staff member had observed her removing something from the bulletin board. The patron said they had "felt someone watching them" and wondered if someone was going to talk to her, then retrieved the newsletter from a nearby trash can. The patron asked where she could find the current newsletter, so L1 KN brought her to the front desk where the February newsletters were on display. L1 KN asked her to not remove items from library bulletin boards in the future, and to ask staff if she saw anything incorrect or wanted a copy of something that was posted. The patron was defensive, asking for the date and pointedly commented that the newsletter was two weeks out of date. L1 KN informed her she had forgotten to change it, then asked if the patron had any questions. The patron remarked that she might, before leaving the front desk area. No suspension or warning issued, noting for the record.

Description: At 5:12pm staff were alerted to the alarm on the emergency exit door in the adult area going off. LTA AD observed a patron finishing exiting the door as she was moving to the area. Staff were able to finally disable the alarm around 5:50pm. Cisco Meraki shows the patron exiting the marked emergency exit door, circling the building to enter their vehicle, then eventually leaving with the rest of his party around 5:45pm. He had booked a study room under the name Edward. If the patron returns, staff will have a conversation with him about not exiting through marked emergency exit doors.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior2.2 Strong odors2.10 Creating tripping hazards, blocking aisles, exits, entrances2.11 Belongings: Bringing in or storing
Description:
Just before six pm, the security guard, DK, informed Librarian, MG, that a few weeks earlier a woman had attempted to bring an excessive number of bags into the library and was denied entrance as a result by the branch manager, LM. That woman was here again and trying again to bring the same inordinate number of belongings into the library. In addition, the bags smelled of urine. When the code of conduct was explained to her, the woman argued extensively. She demanded to speak to someone higher than the manager so Librarian, MG, provided her with the phone number for administration. MG also asked Library associate, CS, for support. CS spoke with the woman and reiterated the stance of the library and the reasons for the Code of Conduct. The woman was allowed to use the restroom and given food, water, and empathy, however, entrance with the baggage was denied. The woman left after a lengthy amount of time, somewhat appeased.
This is written for documentation purposes.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior2.1 Disruptive behavior2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: intimidation ~Use and preservation of library materials and property3.1 Manipulating or bypassing library rules, such as computer use~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic StressRed - High Impact (Please click Notifications > Email aliases > Copy Trauma Informed Care Team if your location would like to request group EAP support)
Description:
Around 6:30 p.m. LA CC was at the service desk when regular patron Kevin B approached the desk to check out DVDs. Upon scanning the patron?s library card LA CC notified the patron of two billed DVDs on his account. LA CC then explained library policy but would allow the patron to check out items today and could resolve the fines on the next visit. He let LA CC know that she had told him when he checked them out to bring this to our attention since one of the cases was already a bit damaged and the other was in perfect condition. LA CC asked which one it was, and she was more than happy to take that one off his account, but there was still one that was chewed up/damaged and that he could do a replacement or pay the fine but that today she?ll go ahead and check out for him, and he can take care of it next time. The patron?s demeanor changed and became argumentative with a raised voice disrupting other patrons, as well as staff. He began asking ?What do you want me to do? What are you going to do? The DVD was already damaged? LA CC replied with library policy. The patron repeated himself 3 times as he was unable to comprehend that he would be allowed to check items out and resolve the fines on next visit by either replacing or paying the fee. About 6:40 LTA KG noticed the patron being in an aggressive manner with LA CC, who returned to staff area to retrieve the billed items, to show the damage to the patron. LTA KG followed her and asked LA CC if she needed assistance to help deescalate the situation. LTA KG was already aware of the items billed to the patron?s account and previously discussed with staff that this would be for educational purposes to prevent further damage to library materials. When LTA KG and LA CC returned to the patron to show him the damaged cases, he became dismissive and condescending to LTA KG stating ?I?m not talking to you, I?m talking to her, since she already knows the issue.? (in a loud and disruptive tone.) LA CC further reiterated the process of billed items. He once again was raising his voice and LTA KG then informed the patron that these billed items would be waived for this one time. He replied, ?okay so you?re giving me a credit?? LTA KG then explained that it?s not a credit that the fees would be waived from his account. At this point the patron seemed irate and confused and repeated himself yet again to which staff replied, ?this is not a credit?. LTA KG then offered him the option of replacing or paying for the damaged items. He then demanded to speak to the supervisor in charge of damage items. LTA KG explained that the LTA Sup was not in, but she could contact him tomorrow. He further demanded that KG call LTA Sup FC ?NOW?. LTA KG explained that she would not do that being that she is off today. Patron then demanded to speak to another person stating that ?we were not making sense.? LTA KG located LTA Sup WZ
When LTA Sup WZ and LTA KG returned to the service desk, our on-duty officer was there. Patron?s behavior changed dramatically, in a softer mellow tone he said, ?Hi sir, I am a Veteran, and I am not understanding what these girls are telling me and for my safety I asked the officer to come inside.? Library staff did not ask assistance from officer/guard. LTA Sup WZ reiterated library policy on billed items. Patron Kevin B then stated that LTA KG had told him she was going to give him a veteran credit and LTA Sup WZ repeated the policy and let him know that there is no such thing and then waived the fines as LTA KG printed the receipt. The patron further explained ?that this was his first offense and was unaware of the damaged DVD cases, and he had just returned another DVD that was damaged into the outside book-chute.? LTA Sup WZ said that outside book chute gets processed in the morning and would address the damage then.
For documentation purposes.

This time, Library Staff Member (L1 BR) approached her to inform her that the library was going to close. L1 said, "Sorry for interrupting, but we'll close the restrooms in 10 minutes, and the library closes today at 6. Thank you." On 2/20/25 he was now told that he will have a 1 month suspension for using the bathroom again, today 2/20/25 around 10:15am as his personal bathroom leaving hair cut all over the floor, in both hand sink and in a bathroom stall.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description:
LTA Supervisor AM was summoned to the quiet reading area by a customer who demanded help with connecting to the library's Wi-Fi. Woman was talking loudly and insisting that AM could push a button behind the customer assistance desk to connect her laptop to Wi-Fi. AM said that was incorrect. Woman proceeded to pepper AM with questions about relatives, friends, etc., and her "predictions" that they were going to die. AM deflected the customer's inquiries; AM then asked L1 KB to assist with the situation. The woman told KB that she was trying to charge her phone but that the outlets weren't working. She then tried several outlets, with the same result. KB suggested that the issue may be with her cord or her phone rather than the library's outlets. She insisted that her charger has worked for years. KB suggested that she try the charging station, but the customer responded she doesn't put her "phone in a capsule." After going back and forth, with the woman asking to borrow an iPhone charger and KB telling her to use the charging station, the woman finally agreed to put her phone in the charging station, where it began charging her phone.
Throughout the exchange, the woman was talking loudly, using profanities for emphasis. KB asked the woman to lower her voice and to stop swearing. The customer said she was going outside to smoke pot at the tables in the yard. KB said she was not allowed to smoke anything on library property. She insisted that she "does it all the time, Sweetie" by the helicopters. KB said that as long as the woman smoked off library property, it wasn't the library's concern.
The woman came and left several times, often instigating quarrels with other customers on the way in and out. She disappeared before KB had a chance to ask her to leave for the day.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.4 Vandalizing property
Description: Someone spray painted "dick" and "penis" with accompanying artwork on two walls near the staff gate.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior2.4 Sleeping2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: BM LG noticed that Anthony was slumped over a table in deep sleep. I approached him and it took a few tries to wake him. I asked if he was feeling alright and explained that he was at risk of falling off his chair. He mumbled that he was fine. A bit later he was back in the same position. After waking him a second time, I suggested that if he was having trouble staying awake he might move to a chair with arm rests to avoid injuring himself. Instead he gathered his belongings and left the building.Ten minutes later another customer reported that a man was out to the garden area laid out on the bench and looked like he might be having a health crisis. Guard SL and I walked out to find Anthony sleeping on the bench. I again asked if he needed medical and he said no. We asked him to leave the property and return when he was feeling better. He was asleep again when we went to check minutes later and we repeated the same questions. Again, Anthony did not want assistance and he got up and left the property.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior2.10 Creating tripping hazards, blocking aisles, exits, entrances2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: Security Guard SL approached me to inform that a man was laying on the floor, blocking of the periodical shelving. Guard SL had already approached once to ask that he utilize the chairs provided in the lobby, but was ignored. SL and I approach him a second time to repeat the request. The customer became frustrated and raised his voice, asserting that he was not sleeping. I explained that it was a hazard to himself and others to lay on the floor, regardless.The customer continued to complain loudly, using the profanity and was asked to leave the property for the day.

Description: A male patron named "Timothy" was walking through the library a number of times, pacing. He then proceeds to yell at the teens at the teen computers to shut up and be quiet in an aggressive manner, he then berates them with curse words. LA DW was on desk and informed the patron that he was in-violation of the code of conduct and was asked to leave for the day. He then yelled out to the library that he is never coming to this library again and left of his own accord. Documenting this incident here.

Infraction Categories: Disruptive Personal Behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior2.1 Disruptive behavior2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior2.14 Any other behavior that seriously disrupts library operations or the use of the library by others: Writing many threatening emails to AskaLibrarian; trespassing~Use and preservation of library materials and property
Description:
Constance LaQuista Oliver (from incident 0000024133) wrote another email to AskaLibrarian with the following content:
"I CONSTANCE LAQUISTA OLIVER ASK THE SUPERVISOR OR CITY AUTHORITY TO SPEAK WITH WHITE RACE FEMALE ABOUT PHONE PRIVILEDGE BECUASE OF STOLEN CELL PHONE AND IDENTITY WHITE RACE FEMALE DONT UNDERSTAND WE PATIENTS AND VCITIMS ARMY CAN USE THE PHONE WHEN NEED TO THE WHITE RACE FEMALE NEEDS TO BE FIRED BECAUSE I THINK SHE IS STALKING ME NO ONE IN MY HOUSEHOLD OR MYSELF IS GAY OR HAVE PLANS OPEN UP DIRECT DEPOSIT CHECKING ACCOUNT FOR MILLIONAIRES INSTEAD EMAIL MY ATTORNEY AND GET A LAWSUIT WHITE RCAE FEMALE TO ME FOLLOWS ME AROUND THE LIBRARY"
Constance is referring to L3 LM because when Constance asked to use the desk phone, LM told her she would let her use it as an exception since her phone was stolen, but it would have to be a short call. Constance talked on the phone for while, and then called another number, so LM asked her to comply with her request and not use the phone.
Because Constance was told not to write these types of emails to askalibrarian (she has written many emails, some of them threatening QUI staff in the past), she will be suspended for one month.
Update: Constance came into QUI. L3LM and guard DK approached her with the suspension letter. She refused to take it and said, "Call the police". They attempted to give it to her a second time, explaining the one month suspension. When she wouldn't take it a second time, LM called the police. Constance stayed for about an hour longer, then got up and left. LM canceled the 911 call. Since Constance trespassed, and wouldn't comply with staff requests, she is now suspended for one year.

Infractions: No Infractions Set
Description: Mr. William Schmader came into the library at 10:27 ask LA EZ for help printing from his Ipad. EZ was helping him sending his photos to the printer via the TBS email while standing to his right, not touching his device. As he was swiping left, he stopped on a photo of a penis for a few seconds, then swiped back. This is not the first time that this has occurred with Mr. Schmader, due to that, this report is for documentation purposes.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior2.1 Disruptive behavior2.1.2 Disruptive use of personal devices
Description: Chapo was with another boy, Alonzo, disrupting staff at the desk, asking non-library questions, talking about superpowers, like not having traceable DNA, and seemed to be insinuating they'd get away with certain types of criminal behavior. LIB III BL engaged for a while and then tried to wrap up the conversation by asking if they had a library-related question. If not, please move along with your day. They proceeded to go into a full Study Room, resulting in overcapacity of the room, and adding to loud noise that staff had already addressed several times. Lib I EG went into the room, asking Chapo and Alonzo to exit. BL could see Chapo on his phone and suddenly the TV released loud noises. Casting inappropriate things to the screens has been an ongoing battle and since they had already been disruptive BL asked the entire room to leave for the day. Staff later discussed in more depth and decided Chapo was an instigator here and in other incidents. Kids look up to him and often copy his negative behaviors. We decided to suspend him for a week with a LRPY option to complete a worksheet around behavior choices and bring it back to sit down with a librarian. At around 2:15pm on 2/26, L1 EG saw L1 CT speaking with Chapo about his behavior yesterday. EG grabbed the suspension letter and LRPY worksheet from the ref desk and headed over to let Chapo know that he was suspended from all libraries for one week. Chapo asked why and argued that he hadn?t done anything wrong. EG told him the suspension letter outlined his infractions. She said that his presence in the library was continually upsetting other patrons, and this behavior had been noted (and increasing) for months. EG also told him that if he wanted to shorten his suspension, he was free to fill out the LRPY worksheet and come back to have a conversation. He continued to argue, and EG said ?one of the primary issues with your behavior in the library is not complying with staff directions. You have been suspended, and I am telling you to leave the property.? As he left, EG said ?you can take your letter and the worksheet? and Chapo responded ?I ain?t taking shit? and walked outside.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using
Description: At 4:55 pm Mgr KW was informed that someone had reported the smell of Fentanyl being smoked in the women's restroom. Upon investigation KW found a very strong Fentanyl odor and nobody in the restroom. Security cameras show only 1 person in the restroom during the timeframe where the drug use could have happened. Restroom was locked for last hour of operation. Patron will be suspended for 1 year.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment
Description:
Page A was busy shelving a cart when she glanced up at a patron. The patron saw her, immediately became hostile, and demanded that she stop staring at him using aggressive language. Page A quickly went in the back and told L1s PC and MNC. They both came out and MNC spoke with the patron (who was now seated in a chair behind the library stacks, out of view of other patrons and staff) about incident. The patron was very defensive and made comments about being "disrespected" by Page A. MNC asked the patron to treat library staff with respect and to bring any concerns to the desk instead to with the staff member directly. The patron thanked MNC and PC making sure to verbally note the names on their name tags.
A few minutes later, the patron came to the desk asking to speak with PC or MNC, interrupting another patron interaction in the process. When both staff members came out, he already had his phone up and was recording. He restated how he felt harassed in the library every time he came and said that if it continues he will contact his attorney. He then walked away.
Staff told branch manager SH about the incident and SH went out to speak with the patron. SH asked to speak with the patron near the teen area, out of view of other patrons. The patron explained his view of the interactions with Page A, MNC, and PC and again stated that he felt harassed and discriminated against by library staff. He took out his phone and told SH that he was recording the interaction for his attorney. SH stated that recording staff is fine, but that he refrain from recording other patrons. The patron continued to say that he had been repeatedly harassed by library staff in previous years and that he was being harassed again right now and being called out in front of all of the other patrons as MNC and PC had earlier. SH explained that was not his intention, but that he just wanted to speak with him about his interaction Page A and the subsequent interactions with MNC and PC. He also offered the patron a copy of the Code of Conduct which the patron declined. The patron then returned to hallway to wait for AARP.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.8 Illegal drugs or alcohol: possessing, selling, or using~Disruptive Personal Behavior2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: A patron using the computer was making loud, disruptive statements. LTA Sup MB asked them to lower their voice to be respectful of the other computer users around him and the patron apologized. LTA sup MB noted that the patron's unsteady movements and slurred speech indicated he might be intoxicated. Patron continued to make loud statements such as "I'm an American!", "Halloween!" and other non-sensical statements. While LTA sup MB was helping another patron at the printer, LI KN watched the patron glance toward LTA sup MB, then remove a liquor bottle from inside his sweatshirt pocket. LI KN immediately asked the patron to leave for the day. The patron asked to stay, but LI KN said today was not a good day for him to be in the library and that we'll try again tomorrow. The patron was very unsteady on his feet and had slurred speech as he collected his belongings and filled his water bottle. At one point he stated "Be gone, Satan", possibly directed at LI KN. He stopped out on the front patio and made some incomprehensible statements towards a group tabling out front, so LI KN reminded him he needed to continue off of library property. The patron stopped a second time to talk to another patron further along the walkway, so LI KN and LTA sup MB went to remind him again to continue off of property. He asked why they were being so mean, and they informed him that he was too intoxicated to be at the library today. He apologized for calling LI KN Satan, then finally continued off library property.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: At 2:15 pm Librarian I's SG and JCB were on desk when someone shouted "Security! Someone get security! Help!" As the security guard was on lunch, JCB ran to see what was happening. There was no one in the lobby, on the front porch, or outside the west-facing door. With no security guard, JCB had no way to find out what happened, though she thought she recognized the voice. When she returned to the desk, she saw Keysasi Ester outside and went to talk to Keysasi, Mia Fletcher, Myyah Ester, Tyliah, and Shyanna Waugh. JCB asked who screamed and none of them would confess. JCB issued a group day-long ban and went back inside. Three minutes later Mia Fletcher called the library and asked to speak to JCB. She explained that "some crackhead" attacked them and tried to take Tyliah's cap. JCB reviewed camera footage and could only ascertain that whatever took place, it happened in the women's restroom. As there were several individuals in the restroom, it is impossible to verify further details without the guard being present. As details are impossible to confirm or deny, no suspensions will be issued or extended at this time. This is for documentation purposes.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.4 Vandalizing property
Description: At approximately 3:56 pm, security guard MG discovered graffiti in the men's bathroom. On video, 2 male teens (one black hair, one blond hair) were observed entering, then leaving the bathroom after an extended amount of time, when the graffiti was discovered. LIC CM and branch manager CO located the teens in the library, and asked them about the graffiti. They both admitted to doing it, then the dark-haired teen said that he did it by himself. They were polite, cooperative and cleaned up the graffiti when they were given cleaning supplies. The dark-haired teen was given a one month suspension.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior2.1 Disruptive behavior2.2 Strong odors2.10 Creating tripping hazards, blocking aisles, exits, entrances2.11 Belongings: Bringing in or storing2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description: The woman from incident0000024186 came into the library again last night, and wanted to bring in around 10 bags which smelled of mold and urine. LTA KP told her that she couldn't bring the bags into the library because of their size and odor. The woman blocked the outside entrance with her belongings, left them outside unattended and asked to the use the restroom. KP and guard DK asked her to move the bags because they were blocking the entrance. They let her use the restroom out of compassion, but when she asked to use a study room, they said she couldn't bring the bags in because there were so many and they smelled bad. The woman got agitated, wouldn't listen and asked for the manager's phone number, schedule for when she worked at QUI, her address and also a number to call admin. KP gave her admin's number, but said they couldn't give out personal information for the manager. Because this is the 3rd instance of the woman not complying with staff request about her behavior, she will be suspended for one week.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating
Description:
At 3:40 PM LTA Sup MB hears a loud thud from the teen area. At this same time, Guard A was in the teen area and witnessed Conner initiate fighting with Blake. Guard A told Conner to leave, and he complied and left immediately after being asked. MB goes to teen area and asks about what happened. Blake says "I thought he was just playing around, but then he hit me out of nowhere". MB explained to Blake that Conner will be out for the day and asked Blake if he felt safe. Blake confirmed and then asked for ice. MB alerted L1 KN and L3 AG about incident in the staff area, and then went to the teen area to give ice wrapped in paper towel to Blake afterward.
Upon reviewing security footage, Conner initiates fighting by pushing other patron Drake while he was sitting. Then, Conner approaches Blake and pushes him to the ground. After Blake gets up he begins to raise his arms at Conner, but Conner continued to keep pushing Blake. Drake gets up and splits the two apart from each other. After that moment, Guard A then steps in to tell Conner to leave.
Conner was not talked to about his suspension and was only asked to leave by Guard A. A one-month suspension letter will be given to him next time he is in due to unprompted violence.
Update: Conner was served his suspension 2/28 at 4:40 PM. He took his letter and left the library for the day.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating
Description: At approximately 5pm, L1 KG and Guard B heard two girls calling each other "bitch" repeatedly. Guard B told the girls not to swear in the library. The two girls left the library separately, but met up out on the plaza and began physically fighting while their friends cheered them on. Our off-duty officer walked outside and the girls separated. The two groups of friends walked off in opposite directions along Stone Ave.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.7 Harassing or stalking~Disruptive Personal Behavior2.8 Smoking, rolling, using tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior~Use and preservation of library materials and property3.3 Food or beverage: unclean, disruptive, or damaging3.5 Failure to clean up after eating/drinking
Description:
A large of teens entered the 101 Space near the end of the day on Friday. L2 KW asked them to clear a path around the emergency exit where they were gathering. A few became argumentative. LA MA gave one a warning about rough-housing in the library. L2 KW saw a "vape cloud" through the window from where she had been sitting in the makerspace, but was unable to determine which teen it came from. With the library closing in 8 minutes, KW let them know that they all needed to just leave for the day with the vaping having been the last straw. The kids denied they had been, were argumentative again, and then left a large mess of snack trash behind. KW asked them to pick up the snack trash and not one helped to clean it up, even after multiple asks to do so, they all walked past it and left it behind. Regular teen Freddie returned to the 101 Space to find his vape, he said, and was non-compliant and disrespectful toward L3 LD and L2 KW when told the library was closed and he needed to leave.
Upon reviewing camera footage, several kids were seen throwing snack trash around at other kids in the space, harassing other kids using the computers, as well as vaping multiple times.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior2.1 Disruptive behavior
Description: Per Special Duty TPD officer DG: At approximately 12:10 pm, Caucasian patron Christopher Stein was at public computer #1, where he was getting angry at the computer, using profanity. African American patron, Oscar, asked Christopher not to use that language. Christopher told Oscar to mind his own business and called him a racial slur. DG heard the commotion and went to talk to them. At this time, African American patron, Patrick Yarns, who was at another computer, said to Christopher, ?What did you say to him? I should just smack you in the mouth.? Then Patrick kicked Christopher. This all happened in front of DG, who was trying to de-escalate the incident. DG handcuffed Patrick and escorted him outside. Security guard MG escorted Christopher outside. Apparently, Oscar did not respond to the verbal altercation and was not involved in the physical altercation, so he was not implicated. LA CC alerted LIC CM, who was at lunch, about the incident. CM went outside, where TPD officer DG was speaking with Patrick. DG then went to speak with Christopher. Another TPD unit arrived to speak with Patrick. That was Officer ZJ. After both parties agreed not to press charges, they were both released by TPD. They both left the premises without further incident. They will both receive 3 month suspensions.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description: LPI CH told L3 CR that a patron in the alcove had come over a couple of weeks ago during job help to tell her to be quiet. She explained that it is a program and they speak at normal volume. The patron was welcome to move to a quiet area in the library. Today the patron again asked her to be quiet. CH again told the patron that she has a program and the patron can move to another area. The patron then told her she was rude and walked away. Again, she did not move seats. Due to repeated negative interactions with staff, patron will be suspended for one week.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.3 Theft
Description: Around 4pm a patron reported that they could not find their car keys. After searching the library, they checked their car; it was open, riffled through, and their Kindle missing. At this point, the patron called the police. L3 KS reviewed library footage and the patron had their keys on a purple lanyard when they came into the library at 2:09pm. On camera again at 2:23pm, they did not have keys (they did not leave the library until after 4pm). Library footage did not show anyone walking out with the keys visible. Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating
Description:
Patron Tim John Knight came to the service desk to make a library card. He brought his wife's photo ID and requested staff make her a library card as well. His wife was not physically present. LTA AB explained (after verifying with L2 KVN) that staff are unable to make library cards for people who are not physically present, even with a photo ID.
AB explained to Mr. Knight that they could go on the library website and follow the instructions to apply for a library card through the website if his wife was not able to physically come to the library. AB told Mr. Knight that he would be getting a full-service card with a 50-item limit, and hopefully that will help until they are able to obtain his wife's card through the website. AB also explained that his wife is welcome to come to the library at a separate time with her photo ID to make her card.
At the end of the interaction, Mr. Knight made it clear to AB and LTA RT that he was displeased they had not made a library card for his wife. He told them "maybe I should call Elon on you guys," as he was leaving.
This is for documentation purposes as it is clear Mr. Knight intended the comment to be a threat (based on tone and body language), perhaps not realizing PCPL is not a federal agency.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.4 Vandalizing property
Description: VetSec night patrol found that a dumpster padlock had been broken off and the dumpster gates were left open. There are no security cameras covering this area of the parking lot.

Infraction Categories: Use and preservation of library materials and property
Infractions: Use and preservation of library materials and property3.1 Manipulating or bypassing library rules, such as computer use3.2 Unplugging library equipment
Description: At ~11:33am man with beard had trouble with PC 1 and went up to front desk for help. Bearded patron told LTA SRE that when trying to sign in it wouldn't work and that patron in an orange hat and orange shirt went to sign up for a computer at computer sign up station which then assigned to him not allowing patron in beard to use computer. When SRE went over, they saw that the man in orange was unplugging computer and affected computer 1 and 2. SRE let patron know not to unplug computer and that they would help them, patron told SRE that they had been having trouble for 10 minutes, SRE let patron know that they would help at the front desk but patron proceeded to unplug computer. SRE told IC LHN what happened and LHN went to staff area for LIII CO to get video in order to see what happened with computers before going to ask the patron to leave for the day for unplugging library equipment. LHN then went to speak to patron who was at the front desk and explained to them that they would be asked to leave because patrons are not allowed to unplug library equipment. Patron explained they though it was okay because someone else did it to him the other day. LHN said that the other patron should not have done that and if staff had known who it was they would have been asked to leave too. Patron asked to speak to library admin, LHN said they'd ask the branch manager if they'd make an exception. Patron explained it was an honest mistake and LIII CO made exception to allow patron to stay instead of leaving for the day.

HMP and AW went into the caf, and HMP began to address the patron, but he interrupted, saying "I'm done." He picked up his belongings and left through the west doors, brushing past another patron who was entering and saying something unintelligible.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language
Description:
A white male patron wearing a sheriff's uniform with "Special Operations Unit" on it came to the desk and asked L2 KVN and LTA RT where the Lucky Day copy of CJ Box's latest book was located, because he had seen WIL had it on the online catalog.
KVN checked the backroom, display, and shelf and determined with a 2/27 check-in date the book was likely missing. She informed the patron.
As the patron was leaving, he passed the desk and told KVN and RT that he usually visits libraries "on the other side of town" but he "drove over here where all the white people are" because that book is a "white person book." His finished by saying "Mexicans don't read that type of book." He then left the library.
KVN was unable to ask him, in the moment, what he was trying to say.
Since his comments were unnecessary and potentially harmful to anyone in earshot, this PITS is for documentation.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.7 Harassing or stalking1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior2.1 Disruptive behavior2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: A regular patron with a toddler entered the library, approached a child and then asked for the minor's older teenage sibling. They had a brief exchange of words, then quickly escalated to shouting and accused the teen patron of using insulting language outside of the library amongst their family. The teen patron began yelling back and threatening to call their father. The adult patron walks out of the library yelling at teen and the teen was yelling at the adult as they walked out of the library. Staff also checked in with the teens, and confirmed it was related to an incident that occurred outside of the library. Teens were also encouraged to get library staff in the event this occurs again. Staff will issue verbal warning of being in violation of our code of conduct to adult patron when they return.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language~Disruptive Personal Behavior2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
At 4:15 L1 EG was alerted by staff that some teens were being loud, using profanity, and had been warned 4 times about their behavior. EG noted that when she walked to the adult reading area there were two boys, Michael and another child who?s name is unknown but is a library regular, who were seated far apart ?reading? books. As she headed back towards the children?s section, she heard a teen scream ?N*****? loud enough to be heard by the whole library. He did not seem to be saying it at anyone, but instead just screaming it in order to cause a scene and get staff attention. EG walked back to the area and told the boys they had to leave. They both protested and said they hadn?t done anything wrong, and EG told them to leave the premises immediately.
EG is fairly certain that it was Michael?s voice screaming the racial slur. Due to his increasingly aberrant behavior (He has been suspended three times in the last two months), Michael will be suspended for a month. He has rejected LRPY intervention for his previous two suspensions.
Michael?s friend, although often seen alongside other kids displaying behavioral issues, has not himself shown any violent or difficult behavior. When on his own, he is quiet and respectful. He will be allowed to return to the library tomorrow, but staff will engage in a LRPY conversation to prevent suspension in the future.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating1.1.7 Harassing or stalking1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language1.1.7.4 Bullying per Pima County B.O.S. Policy D 23.1.~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Description: A large group of about 16 teens entered the library and were looking for an individual who they were going to fight. They went upstairs into the teen area, entering, with others circling the space looking, and then went downstairs into the children's area. L2 CS stopped them from entering into the children's area as they were too old and clearly looking for someone in a threatening way. L2 KW was called on the in-charge phone, received multiple Teams messages from various staff about this group needing to be kept an eye on. KW went downstairs and saw the large group outside of the children's space just waiting around, and then trying to peer into the children's room after the person they were looking for. CS informed KW that the two teens hiding out in the children's room were really scared for their safety and didn't feel safe to leave the library, thinking they would be fought by the group. At this point, KW said that the large group needed to leave the library for their stalking and intimidating behavior with the intention to hurt another person. They became argumentative and were cursing on the way out, with some reluctant to leave, but they all finally did. The group remained outside of the library entrance and were pounding on the glass windows and trying to peak over the frosted part into the children's room. CS called the police as the girl who had been hiding out was going to leave the library, CS relayed the information to the police. The guy who was with the girl called his relative for a ride. Library mgmt stayed after closing to ensure safety of these two teens. Police came and spoke with the girl and guy, they said another set of officers were talking to the group of teens downtown, but then they got called away for another incident that was happening downtown. The girl and guy were picked up safely from the back of the library. Large group will be suspended from the library for one year.

Description:
While LTASup AP and L2 KVN were on desk, a female patron left the library yelling "fuck you" very loudly. She continued to yell "fuck you" to her male companion in the parking lot, and screamed at him while walking up Wilmot Rd. This disruption caused complaints from 3 patrons.
This same behavior happened 1.5 weeks ago.
Due to these disruptions, the patron will be suspended for 2 weeks.

Description: A few suspended tweens started coming into the library at about 4:40pm. 10 minutes later they gathered in the 1st floor lobby area. These tweens/teens that were suspended were not yet aware that they were suspended and had not yet received their suspension paperwork. LIC LII JM met with Vet Sec Guard B down on the 1st floor desk because they both had recognized about 5of the tweens in the large group of about 10 kids that were suspended from the previous afternoon. Vet Sec Guard J was called down to meet them and help identify the teens who were suspended. JM and Guard J approached the group of teens with the suspension letter. JM informed the group that the teens who were present the previous afternoon and involved in the harassment of a teenaged girl were suspended from the library and needed to leave. JM and Guard J talked directly to the two teens that they could definitely identify from the suspended group, told them they were suspended and asked them to leave showing them the suspension letter. The teens denied being a part of this incident. JM told the teens that they had photos and video of them because there are cameras that caught their activity the evening before. An adult male patron who did not know the teens walked up behind their group and involved himself in the conversation by telling the teens that they should sue the library. This adult patron was asked by Vet Sec Guard J if he knew this group of kids, he said that he did not and she asked him to please ?move on? and allow them to talk to the group of boys. The man still stood with the tweens and did not move on as asked by library staff. Several of the boys asked to see the photos from the library cameras and were told that they would not be allowed to view the photos. They were again asked to leave. The teens who were not involved in the previous incident kept speaking up to argue with library staff. JM told them that the whole group would have to leave the library now. The boys then started saying that they were being falsely identified and JM told them that if they did not leave, they would be trespassing and that she would have to call the police. The tweens continued to argue and JM began to make the phone call to 911. A few of the boys rushed over to the guard station, grabbing the active PITS report binder and ran out the door onto the Plaza with it. The rest of the group followed. Guards J and B both went after the teens, stopping by the planters. JM informed the police that the group had just stolen their security binder and run out the door with it. The dispatcher could hear the loud tweens in the background arguing with the Vet Sec Guards and told JM that officers would respond as soon as they could. JM was not given an ETA. JM was joined by LIII LD and LII CS. A separate group of older teens came into the library. Most wearing red and black clothing. Minutes later JM was informed that another group of teens wearing all black were rushing down the stairs to fight someone. All of these teens went outside the library onto Jacome plaza and a fight broke out among these groups. An older female teen attempted to get the guard binder from the tween boys and this older teen began brandishing knives and was seen to have brass knuckles. A group of older teen girls wearing red and black rushed out to the plaza and stood behind the older female teen wearing a bow in her hair. The library went into lockout, locked the large sliding glass doors and began to guide patrons wanting to leave out of the emergency exit. When it appeared to be calm again and all of the teens were gone from the plaza, we opened back up normally.

Description: Despite Guard JR's instructions to exit the restroom, a customer was refusing to leave a foyer restroom for approximately one hour. When he finally exited, he left behind a large empty alcohol container and stumbled over to a computer. L3 KK, LTA Supervisor AM, and JR approached the man. KK made the customer aware that there was evidence in the restroom that he had been drinking alcohol. KK asked him to leave. The customer said he would leave but after several minutes did not. KK and JR again approached the customer and asked him to leave. He did not comply. KK shut down the computer remotely. The customer began singing loudly and shout some obscene language, walked through the lab, and exited the building

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic Stress
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating~Disruptive Personal Behavior2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling~Incident Impact Level - Staff Traumatic StressRed - High Impact (Please click Notifications > Email aliases > Copy Trauma Informed Care Team if your location would like to request group EAP support)
Description: At around 12:30 pm SL TS entered the back room to inform L1 HMP that there was a couple arguing and causing a disturbance in the library. HMP followed TS out onto the floor, where HMP encountered a man who was saying "Everything is ok, we're going." HMP saw a woman standing in the back of the library, yelling at the man to stay away from her. The man began to approach her, and HMP followed. A patron using one of the computers informed HMP as she was walking past that the man had grabbed the woman. As HMP approached the couple, the man was standing very close to the woman, stopping her from moving. HMP advised the man to step away and that he needed to leave the library, to which he replied "this is between us, this is my wife." L1 SG and G CS were also monitoring the situation. The woman attempted to run away and the man followed her to the front of the library, where Guard CS repeated that the man had to leave. L3 KW came out of the back room and told the man to leave and that the police would be called. The man then grabbed the woman again, trying to pull her out of the library, at which point CS physically restrained the man. KW went to call the police. The man struggled to hold onto the woman, pulling her jacket off. CS pulled the man away, who was pushing and grabbing at CS. The woman ran away to another part of the library and the man left, through the west doors, shouting threats, either towards the woman or CS, or both. CS monitored the man exiting the library and HMP went back in to the library to check on the woman, who was hiding in the book stacks. The woman stated that she was afraid to leave and did not want to speak with police. Another patron told the woman that she could help her get in contact with domestic abuse support and could take her immediately to a safe place. The woman left with this patron. The man will be suspended for one year.

Description: Patron unresponsive in compute lab. EMTs were able to wake him up after a few minutes, patron decided to leave on his own.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior2.1 Disruptive behavior2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description:
A patron sitting at the end of computer row 6 began shouting and yelling profanities. The on-duty officer, Matias, approached the patron and asked them to quiet down. As LHN was walking over, the patron shouted, "Are you serious?" Officer and LHN, informed the patron that he could not yell in the library and would need to leave for the day if it continued.
LHN mentioned that there had been a previous complaint about the patron making inappropriate gestures, to which the patron responded, "I've never seen you before, you?re lying." LHN replied, ?We have multiple staff members and the message had been passed along to me which is why I know.?
Security guard MG heard the patron yelling, walked over and let the patron know, "Sir, you're being asked to leave because you are shouting and cursing, there are children in the library hearing this." The patron then pointed at LHN and said, "You work for Lucifer." As the patron gathered his belongings, he left his phone behind. Both the officer and LHN alerted the patron that he forgot his phone, to which the patron replied, "Well, I guess there is good in you."
The officer and security guard escorted the patron out of the library to ensure he left without further disruption.

L1 MNC was on desk and spoke with Mr. Littlepage about his outburst, reminding him that he had just returned from a suspension involving similar actions. Littlepage replied that he was already leaving and he understood that he should not address other patrons, especially youth, directly.

Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment1.1.7.3 Harassment: Profane, offensive, abusive language1.1.9 Trespassing~Disruptive Personal Behavior2.1 Disruptive behavior2.1.1 Disruptive: Shouting or yelling
Description: Around 12:20 a group of patrons with many bags and items enter the library. the woman of the group lays down all her bags on the floor near the restroom and her boyfriend accuses another member of the group of stopping "staring at her ass". the boyfriend and the friend exit the building and they start to escalate into a fight. Guard MG stops them before they can get physical and tells the group they will have to leave for the day those who were about to fight understand and get ready to leave without incident. This angers the woman and she begins to yell that they have already been kicked out of another library (assumably for domestic violence) the woman then gets agitated with Milo which alerts the officer on Duty and L1 KSB. The officer tells the woman that they were asked to leave and that they need to grab their things and go. the woman then yells at the officer that she has bags to pick up and that she can't just leave that second. the officer tells her to pick up her items and then to leave to which the woman claims that, that is impossible for her to do because of how many bags she has. at this point, LA CC grabs L2 VV to take over for L1 KSB. She continues to scream at the officer who continues to tell her that because she is refusing to compile she is now trespassing and to please pick up her items and leave or she will be arrested. the boyfriend and friend hear this and grab her things for her. they leave but the woman is still yelling at the officer. L2 VV Guard MG and the officer all escort her out of the building and off the property with her continuing to yell. the group is now suspended with the woman will receive a 2-month suspension for failing to comply with staff and and officer direction and for her disruptive behavior.

Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.6 Disorderly conduct, fighting, violence, threatening, intimidating1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment1.1.9 Trespassing
Description:
When L2 MG came to desk at 12:00, LTASup GG informed her that a patron in the Adult Lab had been spoken to by staff and VetSec several times after other patron complaints due to noisiness. A few minutes later, L2 MG then heard the patron from across the library. L2 MG and VetSec MM approached the patron. L2 MG offered a study room, but the patron was not interested. L2 MG let the patron know that the Adult Lab was a quiet area and if we had to speak to him again he would be asked to leave for the day.
At 12:50, L2 MG once again could hear the patron. L2 MG and VetSec MM approached the patron and L2 MG let him know that he would need to leave for the day. He refused saying ?I?ll leave when I?m done with this.? L2 MG replied ?You need to leave now, you?re being asked to leave for the day.? This went on once more, and L2 MG said ?I asked you to leave for the day. Since you are not complying it is considered trespassing. I am at liberty to call the police, but I would rather not, so please leave for the day.? The patron refused. L2 MG went to call 911. While on the call, the patron left and L2 MG cancelled the call. As the patron was leaving, he said something unintelligible to another patron in the lab, that seemed to be inflammatory due to the second patron's response. He also stated "I should smack you" to VetSec MM as he was exiting.
VetSec MM escorted the patron outside. When he got outside he said he had left a phone inside. VetSec MM told him he was unable to reenter the library. VetSec MM called police from her cellphone due to his refusal to leave the library area. At this point, the patron attempted to push past VetSec MM. VetSec MM told the patron ?do not touch me.? The patron then attempted to climb over the wall into the patio.
LA CR noticed VetSec MM was still engaged with the patron and went outside. She offered to look for the phone. LA CR checked where the patron was sitting, but did not find a phone. She reported this to VetSec MM and the patron then stated that the phone was in the charging station. There were no phones or other devices in the charging station. The patron then asked a juvenile patron to get the phone for him. The patron whispered something unintelligible to the juvenile patron, and the juvenile patron went inside and returned holding a phone. The patron then left the area.
Upon viewing the camera footage, the juvenile patron can be seen taking a cell phone from the laptop charging area, and a second item which he puts into a second juvenile patron's pocket before leaving.
Due to not complying with staff requests, and the verbal harassment of other patrons and library staff, the patron will be suspended for one month.

Guard J woke the man up and informed him that he could not sleep in the library. He was also told to put his shoe back on. The man seemed very groggy when he awoke, and L1 LB offered to call 911. He declined. He gathered his belongs, went to the bathroom and soon exited the library after using the bathroom. This is for documentation purposes only.

Guard MM asked the patron to put the knife away. Person basically ignored Guard MM and continued chatting with their friend on the video chat. She asked the person again and they complied. She also noted that the patron was drinking a beer. She informed the patron they could not do that either. Patron left by the back gate. Patron will be suspended for three months.
