Description: Patron 1 came in to branch around 2:35pm and parked a bike in front of the periodicals in lobby. When Guard JQ came back from lunch around 3pm he began looking for whose bike it was to ask them not to leave it in the lobby. He went in the men's room to ask and patron 2 said it was his bike. Patron 2 came out and retrieved the bike. A few minutes later patron 1 came up to the desk saying his bike had been stolen.
Patron reported someone passed out in the 1st floor mens room, LIC PP called 911 and was told services were already en route. Medics responded and left with patron.

A regular patron, Charles Q., fainted while standing at the check out desk. He crumbled to the ground and hit his head on a metal cabinet behind him and skinned his right knee a bit. He came to quickly and we attended to his knee with basic first aid items. He said he was fine and has low blood pressure and he can get dizzy sometimes. He just probably stood up and walked too fast. He refused any care beyond a kleenex and a bandaid. He did stay to help staff fill out the 3rd Party Incident form and it has been sent to Risk Management, per procedures.

Library Associate(DS) asked a patron what the lady outside asked her. The patron said she asked her about if she knew anyone that was selling e-cigs. Infraction Categories: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct~Disruptive Personal Behavior
Infractions: Dangerous, Threatening, or Illegal Conduct1.1.5 Indecent exposure, public indecency, lewd, other sexual offense1.1.7.2 Harassment: Conduct, stares, or gestures causing fear of safety, distress, alarm, harassment~Disruptive Personal Behavior2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
Approx. 3pm, Librarian SM reported to Librarian II AD and Librarian III AL that during the 2-3pm hour, a patron, Daniel L. Hart, had approached the desk for assistance with his phones and tablet. During the course of their interaction, Mr Hart made several comments about SM's appearance and body. He also stared directly at SM's chest for a prolonged period of time. Librarian SM told Mr Hart directly that she was here to do a job and that her body had nothing to do with the job she was there to perform, and asked him to refrain from commenting on her body or appearance. Mr Hart did not stop the behavior, instead staring again at SM's chest and saying, "I know you're mad at me because I keep staring right there" and gestured at her chest. She reiterated that he needed to stop his behavior and that it was not appropriate. Mr Hart left to use a computer.
During the library-related portion of the interaction, Mr Hart became increasingly snippy that library staff could not help him set up his personal device. Librarian SM clarified what the library can and cannot do for tech help. Mr Hart was unsatisfied with this response and made several agitated comments about the fact that we could not help him.
If Mr Hart becomes abusive to staff or makes comments about staff's appearance again, he will be suspended.

Infractions: Disruptive Personal Behavior2.1.3 Behaving in a way that could hurt oneself or others2.13 Failing to comply with staff request about behavior
Description:
A regular youth patron was dribbling a basketball in the library. L1 MNC asked him to stop and he initially refused and became argumentative. After being prompted again, he stopped and threw the ball hard at his friend. The ball glanced off the other youth patron and landed on a nearby chair. MNC tried to speak with him about appropriate library behavior but he was not being receptive or respectful. MNC then suspended him for one week.
Once outside, the patron continued to escalate his behavior by being disruptive, bouncing the ball on and by the windows of the teen area, and knocking and pressing his face on the glass. L1 MNC and LIII SH went out to speak with him again about his behavior but he was still argumentative and unreceptive to staff attempts at restorative youth practices. The patron's name is unknown as he did not want to provide it to MNC or SH. He has been told that he is suspended from the library until he returns with a parent so that staff can have a conversation about our expectations for youth behavior at the library.

Description: L3 KK, L1 KB, and Guard JR approached a customer who had set up a tent on the west side of the building. Customer was told that camping wasn't allowed on property and offered resources. Customer took down her tent and was provided information on the Homeless Navigator program and local shelters.
